Reviews.Title: “do check the beds!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for a conference last week and was very pleased with everything during our stay. Great location and we loved the view of the CN Tower we had from our room--truly spectacular. On the flight home, however, my partner and I discovered that we had been sharing our bed with bedbugs! Now, the management is likely to say in response that there's no way of knowing what the bites from or when they occurred but unfortunately I have some past experience with these critters and know what I'm talking about. We just hope we didn't bring them home with in our suitcases! I would strongly recommend that anyone staying at this hotel first check out their beds as per the instructions given in previous posts about bedbugs at this hotel on this site.

Reviews.Title: “It's the Sheraton. It's fine.”
Reviews.Author: bakedjake
Reviews.Content: As the title says, it's the Sheraton. I've stayed at this hotel a ton. It's in a good location in the city, two blocks from subways going in either direction, a 15 minute walk to the Air Canada Centre or Hockey Hall of Fame, close to the entertainment district, etc. Inside, it's your typical big city Sheraton. The hotel bar is way in the back, but quiet for getting work done. The rooms are fine. The valet is awful. Truly awful. Probably the worst valet I've ever seen. Just be prepared for it, and call to get your car 20-30 minutes early. Don't tip. I'm a liberal tipper generally but refuse to tip for a valet that takes a half hour to get my car. Note that if you're cheap and book on sites like Priceline or Hotwire you don't get SPG benefits at this hotel. This seems to be SPG policy but enforcement varies by location. This hotel is strict about it. You get one or two double beds, and you have to pay if you'd like anything bigger. Still, you should give them your number for incidentals. I still got my SPG Gold bonus points even though I was not awarded any points for the base price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent March break!”
Reviews.Author: family-traveler256
Reviews.Content: We came to the hotel to attend a professional conference but brought our kids. Because it was Canadian spring break, the hotel had put on a number of activities for families, which was fabulous -- our kids LOVED the swimming lessons, the pool was a big hit, and the club facilities were perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravellers2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night on business, geat rooms, views, locations, awesome checkin, they just make it very easy to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Spent New Years there”
Reviews.Author: Julia W
Reviews.Content: For a busy night, they were very clean and helpful! didn't have any problems

Reviews.Title: “Very good and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Thomas C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my girlfriend for a little staycation. We both thought it was a really great hotel, and it is close to all your downtown Toronto entertainment needs. We booked it through Hotwire, without a guaranteed bedding choice and was given a one double bed room at first. When I went up to the room, it was WAY too small (kind of like a college dorm room). I actually had no idea there were such rooms available. However, it had a nice view of the CN Tower..Still, thinking it was too small, I went back down to the lobby to see if I could get a bigger room, and they ended up giving me a room with a king bed. No complaints here. Too bad this room didn't have the same view. The bed was comfortable and overall the room was perfect. Friendly and professional staff as well. I would definitely stay here again, and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for the business person”
Reviews.Author: RMORTON
Reviews.Content: This is a good hote, with excellent facilities for the person wanting to be downtown within easy reach of all the main businesses and the Conference Centre. Excellent rooms with all modern conveniences and good internet service. The service was excellent. A limousine service to Lester Pearson airport is available at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “A very good business/conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim H
Reviews.Content: Professional and friendly staff. Good quality bed and bedding. Quiet room. I was very impressed with the quality of the food. I still hate having to pay for internet access. With what they're charging for a room these days the internet cost should be included in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend experience only”
Reviews.Author: dinthesun
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 6 or 8 times - for a weekend only - over the last several years. Check-in can be slow but it is volume only. The desk staff is courteous and efficient. The rooms are good for the most part. They could use some more lighting as they never seem fully lit. The bathroom is clean but sparse. The bed is comfy but the pillows aren't firm enough for my taste. We always park under Nathan Phillips Square and leave the car for the entire weekend. We have never had an issue, the cost is reasonable, the parkade is open 24 hours. You can walk or take a taxi just about everywhere that you might want to go. We never fail to get a view of Nathan Phillips Square, Old City Hall and the city skyline, which we always enjoy, coming from a much smaller city. There is much cheaper food to be had outside of the hotel, but having said that, we did have dinner at the hotel once and it was good (but rather pricey). There is a Tim Horton's just outside of the hotel, and a coffee shop that sells Starbucks in the Lobby (again, somewhat pricey). The Eaton's Centre is a short walk and the Bay can be reached by the underground concourse. They have a great variety of prepared food for sale in their Marketplace. Our conference facilities were very good, they handle large volumes of people very well. The facility is well-signed so my room was easy to find. Finally, there is always staff available should you have any questions, concerns or problems. I have used room service and have no complaints. The front desk has been very accommodating as well. All-in-all, a great place to base yourself for a weekend in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy,quiet,dated”
Reviews.Author: gb_super
Reviews.Content: Huge lobby and huge line up to check in waiting around 25 minutes to be booked in. Room on the 8th floor, rooms are an averge size, clean with comfy beds and linens although I think they need to be updated as they are starting to look very late 90s early 00's now. House keeping of the rooms was to a good standard although they seem unable to clean the corridors, there was a tray outside another room that had been used for room service (Complete with left over fries etc) that was there for 2 days and not moved!!! Hotel is in a good location for downtown Toronto, although parking can be found alot cheaper a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating and better restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Lydia50Kamloops
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was dark and outdated and not enough outlets. Also had to pay for internet - so annoying. Food in Bistro Restaurant was expensive and atmosphere was similar to the Greyhound Bus Depot. An Earl Grey tea, served with a dirty spoon by a waitress with chipped nail polish, was $5.00. The coffee shop located in the lobby was open only until 3 pm each day. Went to fabulous restaurants on Bay street; the Gabardine and Mercatto. Food was delicious in both restaurants. Bannock Restaurant down Queen street is about a 6 out of 10 (poor service and food plain). The hotel participates in a green program; if your room does not require housekeeping you receive a $5.00 coupon to use in the hotel. The hotel also provides free bottled water in room. The Marriott Hotel down the street offers better value and service.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sukhdeep L
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel a few times, and I do like staying here for the location. Its a few minutes from Eaton Centre and close to the entertainment district. The stay in June was primarily for the IIFA awards that were held at the Rogers Centre that month.

Reviews.Title: “Grand lobby, great location, dated rooms, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: SkylarC
Reviews.Content: Like: Location: perfect for Bay St business or museums, shopping and tourist activities. Great place if you have business, you can bring your spouse and kids and they can do their thing. Underground access was handy since it was cold and raining. Lobby: great for large groups, tidy Staff: friendly and professional Dislike: Parking: Expensive and far. Not sure how much the valet is but we opted to park across the street. got there at 8pm left at 8am, $26 Rooms: dark, cheap attempt at being updated Internet charge: hotels really need to stop this cash grab. just add to the built in cost. Almost everyone wants it and paying $15 just leaves a bad taste. we pay about $30/mth at home for hi speed wireless. Hotels who charge make about $450/mth per occupied room. "Club Lounge" - apparently they have a nice Club Lounge but I didnt make it there. I'm still not sure what the deals was. I asked about it and a staff member asked if I was a Club member, if I had SPG or SET and a few other acronyms that I didnt understand. I believe she said I could pay to go there. I get enough of the fake elite status jargon from Air Canada so I passed and went down the street to a nice restaurant. If you have amenities open them up to your guests, simple. Its what brings them back.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, nothing special, but a good location downtown.”
Reviews.Author: SDBLima
Reviews.Content: An older hotel in a good downtown location. Rooms are fairly quiet. Their is a good steakhouse immediately adjacent to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High-end price - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: 50andlovingit53
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two days (march 5 - 7)...and even though it is a downtown hotel - the room certainly did not warrant the price tag. next time I'll shop around a bit more. room was average, service was average, and the ambiance and food were average. NOTHING stood out about this hotel other than its connection to the Eaton Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - pity about the Traders bar”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: Our company had a mass booking during the recent PDAC trade show. Great hotel, very centrally located, easy to get into the fantastic PATH system underneath the downtown. Good rooms, fast and efficient personal service. The food however is best described as average, the menu is small and the food a tendency to be overcooked unless you are ordering steak, and a bit slow to table. My party who had stayed here for many PDAC shows (it was my first) were very disappointed the downstairs Traders Bar had closed, as they considered it an excellent meeting place. The Irish bar upstairs insisted in closing just after midnight, although the bar was swarming with delegates looking for a drink. Does seem a bit silly to close a bar and put restricted hours on another during a very popular show/convention. Thus like many delegates we went out on the town instead. However, a good central place to stay, very comfortable rooms, good internet essential for business people, and happily the hotel is surrounded by superior eating and drinking places.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton at its Best”
Reviews.Author: phil1985
Reviews.Content: Nothing too stellar to note about this property, but nothing that hurts it really either. It's somewhere right down the middle, if you're looking for a reasonably priced property with some minor oversights, but primarily a great hotel in a great location, look no further. The hotel is situated not far from Yonge Street, with plenty of nightlife/restaurants/shopping to choose from. The front desk seemed attentive, though I had no trials to say that they were above the rest. All in all a nice property in a great location for not much money.

Reviews.Title: “Not great.”
Reviews.Author: Joemammadotca
Reviews.Content: Not what you would expect from a Sheraton. Â Â  Very slow front desk and not enough staff. Room was very old with terible ventilation. (one was actually coverd with tape).

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and elegant”
Reviews.Author: schnugchi
Reviews.Content: The room was tastefully decorated and clean. Bedding and pillows were plush. Checking in and out was easy and painless. Like many large hotels, free wifi is only available in the lobby. Location is in the core dowtown district right with lots of shopping and dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tod A
Reviews.Content: During my three day stay in Toronto for business this past week I was booked in by my client at the Sheraton Centre Hotel. This property is in excellent condition very clean, wel priced and the location is perfect. After a very cost effective comfortable ride (the Airporter approx 39.95 round trip) from Pearson International airport I arrived at the front entrance of the Sheraton Centre. Not only do they have concierge service but they also have individuals personally greeting you. My King room was perfect with a beautiful cityscape view and from waht I could tell the view would be fantastic from all sides of the hotel. The Centre of Performing Arts is right across the street where Opera or Ballet is offered among other entertainment. In addition City Hall and its promenade which offers a skating rink in the winter is right there as well. Not only that but you are right downtown with all the major shopping and tour type locations within walking distance. This was my first time staying at the Sheraton Centre and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: K-TownKeliza
Reviews.Content: Disappointed that valet was full however when you are greeted by such a helpful professional check in agent like Marilyn you forget about all of your worries. Marilyn understood that I was a diva and traveling alone on business so she put me close to the elevator on club level offered me late check out Because she already knew my conference ran late. Rooms were Sheraton perfect and clean! Staff so helpful and friendly! Ease of check in and out awesome...my only complaint was my other colleagues carrying on until 2am. I can never say enough good things about this property! Well worth it! (anytime you don't have to go outside to hit the mall is a good thing) Only bad part was that I had to leave and get back to work life.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average quality and service.”
Reviews.Author: Rick1057
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre is a huge downtown convention-oriented hotel with the best location in Toronto, directly across from the city hall and Nathan Phillips Square. For the cost, you would expect better service and more premium accomodation. The registration desk is terribly understaffed at peak times for check-in/check-out. The accomodations are at a level you would expect from a Holiday Inn at half the price. The catered food for meeting breakfasts and lunches was mediocre and luke warm. They have a very good selection of meeting rooms and ballrooms for most types of functions, and the lobby is well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel if you get it at a good price...not worth their regular rate”
Reviews.Author: V_in_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location, enough elevators, access to underground shopping, nice waterfall garden in the lobby, nice breakfast buffet, free wi fi in the lobby Cons: Parking Entrance always busy, not enough front desk clerks result in line ups for check in, awful gym, no free wi fi in rooms Overall...get it for the location, but don't pay their regular rate

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: maltyone
Reviews.Content: Pretty much in the heart of downtown. Mixed reviews play on what you, as a traveler, feel is important. I'm at the hotel now...so here is my spin Pro's Lounge - amazing view of the City, each time I look forward to the expansive views and appies The indoor outdoor pool is pretty neat, especially when it snows (though some have mentioned it can be on the colder side as a result, point taken..) Negs We'll... the hotel is apparently upgrading the change rooms and fitness centre, which I thought we're pretty decent last year, sooo you have to go to the 4th floor to change and take the lift or stairs down to the pool on the 3rd, which is not really wonderful, showering in a converted guest room with the previous person's towels on the washroom floor isn't really appealing, though using the elevator dripping wet wasn't ideal either... The positives outweigh the negs others raise. The property is often booked up which at the end of the day confirms value for money, rather than perfection

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, but paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: businesstrav1
Reviews.Content: First trip to Toronto and this hotel is a great location downtown. It connects to the PATH so you can walk all over downtown underground and shop. Room was nice and bedding was wonderfully comfortable. But hearing my neighbors' loud music at 3:30, followed by extracurricular activity (after I called the desk and they sent someone up to tell them to turn off the music) was not appreciated. Not sure if their room walls are all that thin.

Reviews.Title: “OK but Nothing to Write Home About”
Reviews.Author: CharlaineL
Reviews.Content: I don't usually stay at Sheraton's but the conference I was attending was there. It's ok but I guess I'm used to going to the same chain and benefiting from perks. I don't like to pay 15$ for Internet access - why are hotels still charging for that? Also, to be honest, I like chocolate with my turndown service. I'm spoiled, what can I say. In the plus side, I was really happy to be able to walk from where the Billy Bishop island shuttle dropped me off, near the train station. It only took me about 10 minutes. It's great that it's on the PATH, so lots of great shopping, food courts and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown base for weekend visit to Toronto”
Reviews.Author: 284Ont
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre with a good CAA/AA rate for the Family Day weekend. The upgrade to the club level was worth the $50 - the lounge on the 43rd floor gave great views, free internet and nicer room made our stay even better. However we found the continental breakfast provided was a little sparse, but for no charge it was better than the zoo like atmosphere and expensive buffet at the main restaurant. The view north to city hall is always my favourite. Walking distance to the Four Seasons Centre (Opera Hall) was marvellous and much better than facing the long drive home late at night. The kids loved the indoor/outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: JDMitch
Reviews.Content: As a frequent attendee at conferences held in this great downtown venue, I have stayed at the Sheraton Centre many times and it never disappoints. Excellent, organized service even at peak convention check-in times. Surface level parking with spots big enough for my full sized SUV handy to the lobby. Amazing location connected to the pedestrian tunnels that link everything in downtown TO. Close to shopping at the Eaton's Centre, the spectacular productions in the theatre district and a terrific selection of resaturants, whether you are after fine dining, foodie locales or any kind of chain from upscale to ordinary - you are within walking distance. Comfy, comfy beds. Great bar off the main lobby where you can meet friends for drinks before going out for the evening. Internet access and comfy work space in lobby and rooms. Scenic pool courtyard with indoor/outdoor pool. Go for a city view high above City Hall. Got an excellent pre-paid rate ($109 - better than the discount sites) right on the hotel's website. Have also stayed here with folks who needed an accessible room, and in terms of accessibility of washroom and shower, the room was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yazzy13
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Sheraton Centre, and I have stayed there many times over the past few years. It's a great hotel with all the amenities you need. The place is sprawling, but gives you access to many services. Like a lot of hotels, some of the extra charges are steep. But there is a cafe in the lobby for breakfast and plenty of food sources nearby. To save on parking, it is very easy to park in the City Hall lot across Queen St. The hotel is in a prime location with easy access to much of what downtown Toronto has to offer, either on foot, by taxi or car, or by transit. A small point - the hotel has some rooms with two double beds. If you are a couple and want more space, be sure to ask. Otherwise, our room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “It's our Toronto home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Fabulash
Reviews.Content: We have decided that the Sheraton Centre Hotel in downtown Toronto is really our best choice anytime we come into town for special functions, visit friends, go to the theatre etc. It's easy to get to when driving in from the Gardiner Expressway or Lakeshore Drive. You don't have to drive through the entire city. Underground parking is conveniently located across the street at City Hall. You do not have to go outside, there is an entrance to the Sheraton Centre from Level 1 parking. Parking isn't cheap, about $33.00/day with tax but you are paying for the convenience. In the winter or in bad weather, no need to go outside, The Sheraton Centre is connected to hundreds of shops and restaurants through the Toronto underground "Path system" which goes for miles and miles. The rooms are always clean and comfortable. They always accommodate our request for a "quiet location, upper floor".

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Jade97
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to transport, shopping. It has its tour desk which can help you book every tour and show available in town. Plenty of restaurants to choose from within a 3-4 block radius. It felt a bit quiet at night to be walking around, especially along the back street of the hotel. The room was small, but comfortable. Toilet wasn't as cleanly maintained as it should be and the room generally really needed an upgrade. Service was very impersonal but is not unexpected of a typical Sheraton. If you are simply looking for a convenient place to stay for a few days, this place is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: scott9Caledon
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel on many occasions when visiting Toronto. We find the location excellent, especially with access to the 'Path' of underground tunnels to many of Toronto's finest attractions. This visit was no different. It started with an early check-in (9am) when I enquired if we could choose a room before we spent the day at the Auto Show. Not expecting a favourable reply, we were surprised to be checked-in, upgraded and given a late check-out time the next day...excellent service! Some renos are happening, including the Traders bar/restaurant in the main lobby. Rooms are same as always, comfortable, well appointed and a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs upgrades”
Reviews.Author: dpharm
Reviews.Content: My family regularly stays at this centrally located hotel. We love the energy of the lobby and the convenient access to the path leading to most downtown attractions without venturing out in the cold. However, the rooms and lobby are very much showing their age. The rooms are very well used and in desperate need of a refresh. There were long line ups to check in, however the staff were very pleasant and accommodating on arrival. We enjoy staying at this hotel for the location and energy, however in the future other options will be explored as the rooms, still charging a premium, are not up to the standards of other similar or lesser priced rivals.

Reviews.Title: “Well located!”
Reviews.Author: Jojobiz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of downtown Toronto. It is connected to the Eaton Centre. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Also, the staff is very helpful. I have stayed at that location several times over the years, and I always been pleased! The only critic I might have is that the Internet connection is not included in the price of the room. However, free Internet access and computers are provided in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the economy rooms or club rooms... but nothing in between”
Reviews.Author: ALO_YYZ
Reviews.Content: I'm a Toronto native, and this hotel has a lot of pros... but you also gotta be careful which room you book: Pros: Location is unbeatable, connected to all the skyscrapers via underground mall tunnels. Finishes are average... say 3.5 star (not 4, but not 3 either) Do not book Junior suite rooms, unless its a true suite where the bedroom is a separate room. If you are not careful they will give u a junior suite which is more like a bachelor with a small 2 seater couch coffee table right beside your bed.... Stick to economy rooms or club floor.... I like this hotel for rates below $140/night... not a big fan when rates climb above $170/night..for economy rooms. If prices are high, I'd pick the Hilton, or pay double and park myself in Le Germain for $300 a night....

Reviews.Title: “Change to Room Service Hours”
Reviews.Author: vacationaholic2
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review off by saying that I have stayed at this property many times over the past several year for business. I have always been happy with the: location, speed and courtesy of check-in, room cleanliness, room view, and room service. However, I my last stay I had a little different experience. I had also sent an e-mail to Tony Dunn, Marsha Ray, and left a comment card at the front desk regarding my recent stay (Saturday Feb. 11-12). I have not heard back from anyone nor do I know if they are planning on addressing the issue I mention below. My e-mails to them went like this: "I am a platinum guest and have stayed at your property many times for business over the past several years. On Saturday I arrived at your property at 3:00pm after a business meeting. I was looking for something to eat before another evening dinner business meeting as I knew I would not be eating until late. I was surprised that the coffee shop had closed at 3:00pm and I had just missed them. I then thought that I would order something from room service from your â€œAll Dayâ€� menu, however, when I called to place my order I was informed that the kitchen was closed and would reopen at 5:00pm. I mentioned that the menu stated â€œAll Dayâ€� dining options with times and the person on the other end of the phone stated that it was a new schedule implemented by management. I would kindly suggest that you change your in-room menus to reflect your new kitchen hours. In addition, it would be nice to have an option for a meal/snack on site other than the higher end restaurant. Thank you for your attention to this matter."

Reviews.Title: “4 night city break”
Reviews.Author: linzicol
Reviews.Content: good central position by city hall , direct access to PATH and close to Eaton shopping mall. Our room overlooked the skating rink, was a good size with two double beds, hotel very busy on Saturday night and experienced some late night noise from other rooms. hotel security quick to react and dealt with situation successfully. following morning on contacting reception we were advised that people concerned were checking out that day but offered a move and free breakfast vouchers.hotel service was faultless both in reception and restaurant. we used the concierge desk most days for advice on restaurants and travel information including trips to Niagara and Toronto zoo, Assita the concierge was friendly and very helpful, he made our stay all the more enjoyable. We could not fault the hotel and had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Sheraton Centre”
Reviews.Author: VacationMom_8
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I rented a room for a girls weekend in the city. We loved our room. Loved the location, so convenient! Staff were so very helpful and friendly. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot go wrong with it”
Reviews.Author: mtl-wasa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in the heart of downtown Toronto, 5 minutes away from the famous Eaton Center. The rooms are nice and comfortable and the lobby is pleasant. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Poor attitude”
Reviews.Author: fox4ster25
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the boat show weekend. Had booked a room last fall at the boat show rate. Unable to do club class as told non available. On day of arrival tried again but told non available. A few friends of our arrive in the afternoon and were able to be upgraded to club class. That evening I spoke to the front desk and was told club class not available. Asked if we could purchase a pass or be allowed to join our friends for breakfast the next day in the club lounge. Front desk said no to the upgrade and if we wanted to join them for breakfast it wold cost us 60 dollars. He was very curt and just didn't want to discuss it any further. I know it was a busy weekend for the staff but I have never experienced this before at the Sheridan. Many years ago I was told by the front desk I should become a member of their awards program because of the number of nights I have spent at the Sheridan. I did, but must say was very disappointed during this weekend with the attitude. Will be in Toronto again in the not to distant future and will try another close by hotel. Complacency in the hospitality business will result in lost business. A smile and and effort to help the guest will go a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: zoemorn
Reviews.Content: Try to get a city hall view, as this was fantastic during our stay. We could see much of the city and had fun watching the skaters on the public ice rink down below. The staff were helpful and friendly, with the concierge giving us some good restaurant recommendations. The location is great, we used starwood points and cash and got a fabulous deal. The room was comfy, though the heater seemed to have a hard time keeping up with the coolness of winter, we were never that uncomfortable, but i could envision some desiring it to be warmer. But the views were spectacular of the city, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs some management that can take control of this place before it is to late.”
Reviews.Author: jimVictoria_BC
Reviews.Content: I stay a lot of hotels and this one takes the cake corrupt valets poor check in, one queen bed and I'm a gold member with Starwood. Never told me the restaurant was closed under repair never told me the the gym was closed. A total screw around from the minute I checked in the best part about is I'm still here. The Internet system is just the worst and the charge an arm and leg even to their so called best customers I will never stay here again and I will make it my mission tell as many people as I can about my shtiy experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly hotel for its size”
Reviews.Author: Enid24
Reviews.Content: Sheraton centre is a large hotel in the middle of Toronto close to financial district and shopping and subway. Walking distance to the CN Tower and the Air Canada ice hockey centre - make this a mandatory inclusion for entertainment on and off the ice (last minute tickets if you go to the venue or there are scalpers with tickets outside). The rooms are ok and the hallways are a bit tired (I was on floor 7) but I had a large room with a great view of some older buildings and a public ice skating rink which was lovely to look out on. Lobby staff very friendly and helpful with directions and taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton a good home base for Toronto Activities”
Reviews.Author: newmarket5
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the Sheraton for our family and we were pleased with the decor, size of the room and the location to all of the downtown attractions. Plus the price was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Always the best”
Reviews.Author: Hugh L
Reviews.Content: I stay here on a weekly basis. With a Starwoods card and 25 stays per year, I get a free upgrade and access to the club lounge with appetizers at 5 (that serve as dinner) and breakfast in the morning. The hotel is always very clean, lively, but quiet at night. The indoor/outdoor pool is being renovated now as is the main floor restaurant. The staff are great and the location can't be beat. Go to "Fred's Not Here" on King Street, downstairs for an excellent and cheap bar menu: blackened salmon, $7, wine $5/ glass. Hugh

Reviews.Title: “Great winter stay in Torono”
Reviews.Author: TammiFlannery
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton centre hotel in Toronto always runs a great package rate for the Toronto International Boat Show. The hotel is lovely and connected to the Totonto underground PATH, so you don't have to go out in the cold for restaurants and shopping. Free shuttle to the show is excellent as well. They also have a nice option to refuse housekeeping for a night and get a $5 coupon for a hotel restaraunt. Great 'green' idea..... Our one complaint is that they now charge $15/day for wireless anywhere in the hotel. That's per device! It would be nice if they would provide free wireless someplace like a lounge or lobby if not in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Down town”
Reviews.Author: Desmond D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located in the heart of down town Toronto.The restaurants and shopping mall are all in walking distance.The ice skating rink is next to the hotel and a fantastic outing for all ages. The room was very spacious and the beds and linen were excellent.We had a great overnite stay. Parking at the hotel was expensive but public parking next to the hotel is available at a cheaper rate. Got a nice deal through a promotion that was currently on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rooms could use updating”
Reviews.Author: ronlord
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days here to attend the Toronto Boat show. The location is the best for city sight-seeing and shopping. You can leave the hotel through the lower level and never go outside to shop. The indoor/outdoor pool at this hotel is really cool, you can swim from the indoor pool and go outdoors even in the middle of the winter. We noticed a lot of renovation going on, the changing rooms on the pool floor were closed as well as the Traders restaurant. They need to re-do the rooms and halls next, the carpets were very worn and stained in spots. Overall not a bad stay if you can get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Looks like the movie set of "Stayin' Alive"”
Reviews.Author: dupedtourist
Reviews.Content: There must be a mandatory trade school that hotel interior designers attend with classes titled â€œHistory of Plaid Carpetâ€�, â€œIntroduction to Enormous Pointless Sculptureâ€� and â€œAmerican Paintings So Ugly No One Will Steal Them 101.â€� Iâ€™m guessing their first job after graduating from this institution of bad taste is to design a Sheraton and the Sheraton Centre in Toronto was probably a studentâ€™s senior thesis. Compared to other franchises in the chain, Sheratons remain the weak Starwood link and I try to avoid them. These aged, forgotten, big city fortresses with endless halls strewn with leftover room service trays, beige metal room doors and noisy ice machines are depressing. To be fair, the Hilton and Marriots, etc., in this class are no better looking or any more cheerful, and some chains, like the wildly gaudy Intercontinental, are sad in their own cheap Vegas blingy way. Itâ€™s not that this hotel is dirty or ragged but it shows its age by not even pretending to be a part of the new millennium, or even the 90s for that matter. The over-the-top decorative chrome elements, a sea of patterned carpet and a fake babbling brook courtyard dominate the huge lobby making it look like an enormous singles fern bar from the past. Throw in the Janis Joplin sound track that was playing and the bad haircuts and dated couture of the mostly Canadian guests and you have a Boogie nights nightmare minus the scintillating porn. Despite its aesthetic shortcomings, this large tower has a convenient location that is walking distance from Chinatown, the university and hospitals. Itâ€™s a short cab ride to the financial district, Yorkville or the waterfront. Service at check in and check out was friendly and prompt and I was given my Platinum upgrade, bonus points and free breakfast card without asking. Note to management: please adopt the policy of sliding the bill under the door the night before checkout like the Westin and W do. Iâ€™d hate to see what a standard room looks like as mine was small, with not much room around the king bed and a cheap bathroom with a basic bathtub/shower curtain combination, plastic picnic drinking glasses and very scratchy towels. At least it was quiet, which was important seeing that several hundred prepubescent cheerleaders had checked in that morning for a local cheering competition. Temperature control was an issue, as I couldnâ€™t get it below 73 degrees F even at the coldest settings with the fan on high. Major hotel pet peeve: locating those big heater/air conditioning boxes directly under the window where the closed curtains cover the upward flow is plain dumb. The hotel is located directly over the maze of underground food courts and gift shops that make up something called â€œThe Path.â€� A hectic 20 minute walk dodging lunch hour drones led me to various rabbit holes of cheap jewelers and fast food joints with names like Mister Tandoori, so I turned around and hightailed it back the relative comfort of the 1980s. As a mid-priced ($190 CA), mid-town, hotel tower, you get a middle-of-the-road experience which is exactly what they are aiming for. Without the triple points promotion that Starwood was running, I would have gone running- to a smaller, more charming place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: newschool_ski_bum
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying at the Sheraton Centre in Toronto. This is a perfect business hotel, with a great central location in downtown Toronto. The service was great, they even did some printing for me very late at night, and fufilled a room change without any delay or problems. I would have given the hotel a 5, however the blinds in my room were terrible. Pretty much all the light went right through them. Also my room was a little dirty, which I think is unacceptable when playing such a high price for a room. Otherwise, great spot. Up there with the Westin Harbour Castle and the Four Seasons for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay :)”
Reviews.Author: JapamaWoman
Reviews.Content: We received a very warm welcome when we arrived at the hotel and they very kindly let us into our room right away even though we were there considerably earlier than the regular check-in time. Everyone that we met was helpful and friendly and seemed to take a genuine interest in their guests. The room itself was well appointed, spacious, spotlessly clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. We had a spectacular view of Nathan Phillips Square, although we were on the 10th floor we were able to watch the comings and goings in the square and watch the skaters on the rink - ideal if you are a people watcher like me! The location was excellent, the Eaton Centre, Yonge Street and the Entertainment District were all minutes away. As the hotel is linked to the PATH you don't even need to go outside if the weather is a bit inhospitable. The Airport Express coach has a stop just outside the hotel and most of the city siteseeing buses have a stop in the vicinity. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay again when I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bab
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto during the holidays. Hotel was fully booked but it did not show as hotel is spacious. Hotel well located next to city hall. Shopping is easily accessible and you don't even have to go outside. Metro station near and there is a tramway stop in front of hotel. Room was clean, bed was very, very confortable. Overall, a great place to stay for a visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for NYE celebrations”
Reviews.Author: Lovefood53
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel to enjoy a weekend getaway to celebrate NYE in downtwon Toronto. It is excellent for viewing the NYE countdown without having to stand in the crowd or cold! Lots of shopping that could be accessed by the underground pathway to the Eaton's Cente, The Bay store etc. There are also many great restaurants in and around the immediate area without having to take a cab. Try Quinns steakhouse for great steaks. Lots of happening parties in the Hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “"In the Heart of TO"”
Reviews.Author: beenaroundeworld
Reviews.Content: Super location, very central.....nice staff, restaurant in the hotel too is great.... Super beds:):)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mandyy403
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Centre for one night on January 13th and enjoyed my stay. I showed up without a reservation, but the front desk agents were great in finding me a last minute room. I booked for two nights, friday and saturday but only ended up staying the saturday night. I've stayed in many Sheraton hotels, i'm a SPG member and i also receive a corporate rate through work. I was hoping that they could have made a small exception and not charged me for not using the second night, but I did check out at 4pm, so its understandable The regular rate for this hotel is quite high for what you get in the rooms. I've definitely stayed in nicer rooms at a Sheraton for less money, but remember, you are in downtown Toronto and you're paying for the location My room was average, nothing special to it. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean (two things that are important to me) The bistro and the food was okay, a little overpriced, but most sheraton restaurants are All in all a good stay and a perfect location for those that want to be in downtown Toronto and close to everything

Reviews.Title: “Nice home away from home”
Reviews.Author: roystoys
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a good location for nearby attractions..Eaton center, Air Canada Center, Hockey Hall of Fame,Union Station to name a few. We had a great room,view of the city,comfortable beds and nice bath/shower.Would highly recommend this hotel if a person needed to be downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: chutaiko
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a weekend here and I was surprised at how fantastic of a location it was, how nice the room was and how reasonable the rate was. In the summertime you're right next to Queen St shops and in the wintertime there's a whole underground to explore. The only drawback was the amount of loud guests wandering the halls. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It is not worth the money paid for the room.”
Reviews.Author: Tursuyah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed many times at this hotel because of the location and our points and unfortunately each time we stayed here we found something dirty in the room and loud guests no matter which floor we stay at....the management has upgraded our room after we complained however this is the last time we are staying here. We found a dirty towel in the bathroom and bread crumbs in the bed and that was it we were totally disgusted!!! I would not recommend a family to stay at this hotel...if I was single without a baby and I was drunk to the point that I could pass out anywhere after a night out clubbing yes this is the hotel but for a family definitely not!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful common areas, mediocre rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddict1218
Reviews.Content: For how much money they are asking, you would think the rooms would be a little bigger or a little nicer. But maybe that's just Toronto for you. The location really can't be beat though.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Bruce S
Reviews.Content: This property is close to it all in Toronto. Its located across the road from Nathan Phillips Square and the old city hall. Subways are close by to get you elsewhere if needed. The Hotel is older but well kept, and the rooms are spacious with excellent Sheraton beds. Internet service in the room is sub-par for streaming, as is in most hotels, but Ok for the basics. Get a room higher up unless you enjoy sleeping to the noise of the busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, great bedroom”
Reviews.Author: Faldereee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night after touring the East Coast of Canada. Cannot find fault from check in, to valet parking. The hotel is in a great location, 10 minute walk to the harbourside, to Chinatown and Galleries. Shops and restaurants are on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Tired- Indifferent service- excellent location for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: rammenon
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood member and chose this for hotel for a quick overnight stay for a business meeting downtown. Expansive lobby but thats about it. The suite is a larger room with a threadbare sofa and a larger TV. The hotel is tired, 80's kitsch furnishings, stained carpets, dingy rooms and small bathrooms. Coming in on a late flight and expect a quick sandwich from room service? You could wait for an hour. Starwood usually stands for something better. Tried to order room service before a morning meeting- was on hold for 11 minutes. Could not check out fast enough! Overall- location makes it easy in the winter to walk to any downtown location for a meeting. That's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: sandy b
Reviews.Content: We booked a King size room for 19 days over the holidays. To our delight and surprise we ended up on the club floor which included a continental breakfast and appetizers in the evening. If that wasn't enough we found a beautiful Xmas tree in our suite! How fantastic! We loved our room attendant who was a breath of fresh air and a ray of susnshine each day she came to clean up. Our waiter during breakfast even knew our names and brought my husband a piece of chocolate cake at breakfast for his birthday. We chatted with Chef and he said he would prepare a special breakfast for us instead of the buffet since we were there so long. All staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. Spending New Year's Eve in front of Toronto City Hall looking our our window at the festivites when the fireworks went off right in front of our eyes was a spectacular memory! This was one of the most amazing Christmases that we have spent. The Sheraton was the way to go and we will do this again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Jalenkos
Reviews.Content: We booked somewhat last minute as the Sheraton had some great rates this past weekend. Having been to Toronto and the Sheraton before I knew the valet parking is expensive ($45 per night). There are other options, such as parking under city hall (entrance off of Queen right at the Sheraton Centre). This ran us about $14 a day in comparison and it is accessible to the Sheraton without even having to go outside! Check-in was quick and we were upgraded to one of their Jacuzzi Salon Suites. These rooms are large and have a good sized Jacuzzi tub with a nice skyline view. The rooms are starting to show a bit of wear and tear as well. We were told that the Club lounge was closed, which is unfortunate as it is one of the main reasons for booking the Sheraton. I would have expected to be offered a free appetizer or something at the restaurant as is done at many other Sheraton's when the Club lounge is closed, but that was not the case. We found a nearby restaurant in its place and had a good time there. The biggest complaint I had was the temperature in the room. Upon entering we cranked the temperature down to 18.5 because it was swealtering in the room. It never got anywhere close to that temp, my guess was that the room started off at 26 or so and might have gotten down to 23 or 24. One of the nicest things with the Sheraton though is connection to the PATH, which allows you to get to the Eaton Centre without having to go outside. This was nice since we walked to the mall without having to take a jacket. The pool is also really nice at the Sheraton, it is an indoor/outdoor heated pool. The only downside to it right now is the Fitness centre is undergoing rennovations so the pool area had some pretty serious fumes (paint or varnish or something). Overall for the price we paid we were content, but might be more likely to stay at the King Edward next time we come to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “close to shopping and watching fireworks”
Reviews.Author: sunburn88
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I travel to Toronto the last week of November every year for the Calvacade of Lights Show and Christmas shopping. We have a specific room we book so that we have the option of staying in and watching the fireworks and bands playing. This year it was mild enough that we ventured outside to City Hall. The Good: -Location is one of the best for Eaton Centre shopping, we easily walked underground back and forth to drop off our bags and leave coats in room. -beds are still the most comfortable, better than the Intercontinental on Front Street. -great blackout curtains for sleeping in -Starbucks coffee (reg and decaf)and coffee maker in room, little starbuck in lobby also with muffins etc. -2 comfortable chairs, -windows open slightly, air and heat work well. -lots of pillows, great closet, iron ironing board -bellman service great (he laughed at all of our bags) -underground path to Eatons centre has area of inexpensive food -lovely lobby , nicely decorated -nice pub/bar where you can have dinner. -room service expensive but tasty -lovely pool area -have stayed in a premium club room which has access to the top floor, drinks snacks etc, and one of the best views in Toronto The bad: -only one robe -needs a good cleaning in the corners....notice this every year. -valet parking expensive $45.00/night -problem with bill. overcharged and had reserved months before visiting -usually a line-up at the front desk We will continue this trek every year for as long as we are able. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good, but missed the mark on the small details if you are a frequent traveler”
Reviews.Author: J-LA33
Reviews.Content: I choose to redeem a night at this hotel for New Yearâ€™s Eve, and hear is some feedback on my stay: Positive feedback: - I was pleased with check in as a received priority as a Platinum member; I normally donâ€™t bother with this, however, there was at least 40+ people waiting to check in, my stay was off to a great start as did not have to wait - Asked to change my welcome gift from 2 beers to 2 glasses of wine (I hate beer), and was given a bottle. Again, very pleased, as this was not expected - Upgraded to a king suite on the 25th floor, instead of the club floor standard king room which I had booked. Ideas for next time: - When I was waiting in the priority line, the hotel duty manager asked me twice if I was a Gold/Platinum member, in such a way that was a little disappointing. It was almost as if he did not believe I was. I was dressed casually as this was a personal stay vs. business. As a younger professional, this happens often, so I would not negatively review the hotel over it, just something to keep in mind. - Turn down service was not available due to the hotel being full that night, which is understandable. An idea would be to have this service for Gold/Platinum members regardless of hotel capacity - Front desk wanted to charge me 5.00 for a wine opener, which was annoying since they had sent me the bottle of wine in the first place; I called though and had the charge removed. - Upon booking, I had specifically had asked for a room on a higher floor facing Nathan Phillips square so that I could watch the fireworks, which was not available upon check in. I was given a suite on the 25th floor, instead of a club standard room which I had booked originally, however, it is my understanding that I would have received that anyway due to my member status. So that was disappointing. - Breakfast was a little picked over due to the amount of people staying, and it would have been nice to have some protein (eggs). Overall, it was an good stay, and I would recommend the hotel. It was more about the small details that were overlooked that were disappointing for a person who is a frequent traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: businessgirl_11
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I've stayed here a few times, and each time, I'm pleasantly satisfied. The rooms are quiet, the beds are comfortable, the decor is pleasing, and the staff are very professional. It's also very conveniently located, with a subway station entrance just around the corner, and parking available both at the hotel, and directly across the street for a cheaper price. The only negative thing I have to say about this hotel, is the location of it's front desk. If you haven't been here before, it takes a little while to find it. It's tucked away in the far back corner, behind all the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but double check charges to your credit card.”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Sun_lovers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for one night to attend a show and do some shopping. It is in a good location for shopping and convenient to public transportation. We made the mistake of pulling in to the hotel at about 3:20 pm and the valet parking area was incredibly busy. We were shocked to learn that the cost of valet parking was $45 which is the highest price I've seen in any hotel including those in downtown Ottawa and Montreal. At the end of our visit when we collected our car the radio channel was changed and the volume was blasting. I do not think this is acceptable. The line up to check in was extremely long. It took over 20 minutes to get to the front of the line. The front desk staff member was efficient and friendly. We chose to upgrade to a club room although the price quoted was more than the stated price on the internet. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable but the room was small. The evening snacks and breakfast in the club lounge were about what we would have expected and in line with those at other hotels. Every other room had a paper in the morning but for some reason we did not receive one. The view from our 42nd floor room was pretty incredible. We had a late snack in the hotel bistro after the show of beer and nachos. There were very few people in the bar. The food was fine but the service was not great. Our waiter just seemed to disappear after we got our menus and it took a long time (over 15 minutes) for him to return and we had another long wait for a beer. Next time we would sit at the bar instead of the booth because I think he forgot about us. I was frustrated to find an extra charge on our credit card when I checked it after our stay. This happens from time to time at these hotels and it really irritates me. I would never consider touching the overpriced snacks. We bought water at a nearby store and brought our own bottle of wine to enjoy. The charges were reversed with a minimum of bother but these things should be checked more carefully. We never even opened the minibar. There are better hotels in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: pinkgelato_
Reviews.Content: Front desk was extremely friendly. View is amazing! Later that night, the room beside ours was extremely noisy, and I called the front desk to make a noise complaint. Without any hassles, they offered another room, and called back the next morning to ensure that we had a good night's sleep. The location is prime, it's close to many attractions and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Expecting more..”
Reviews.Author: thoughtsofa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights on a conference trip. The hotel was also the conference venue. The location and staff at this hotel were the two main positives. The room was a bit dated/shabby and could have done with a good clean or complete refurbishment (particularly the bathroom). The beds were very comfortable and the view fantastic. While getting ready one morning, the electricity in the whole room went off for some time. On mentioning it later in reception I was offered a complimentary breakfast, which was a very nice touch. One thing which annoyed me was since leaving the hotel I have received about 15 emails in 5 months as a 'Starwood Preferred Guest'. This was initiated at check-in when I was given a SPG card (without asking for it) and without the staff member asking if it they had my permission to send emails to me. Still, overall, the hotel was fine and comfortable for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel conviniently located”
Reviews.Author: wck112
Reviews.Content: nice and clean hotel, great view from our room, the front desk was so friendly, location was perfect. definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel and I was very impressed! My husband and I stayed for one night only and wished that we would have booked for a longer period. We were travelling with our two children, aged 10 and 11 and we found the staff went over and above to accommodate all of our needs. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to do anything in the downtown area. The location was perfect. We could see the skaters at Nathan Phillip Square and enjoyed the Christmas lights from the 29th floor. Very easy access to the Eaton Centre without going outside in the rain was an added bonus. The rooms were very comfortable with the beds offering me one of the most comfortable sleeps that I've had in a long time. If you can check in early, you will avoid the line that forms around 3 pm. Valet parking was well worth the extra cost. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but very big...”
Reviews.Author: AConferenceAttendee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto in September for a social media conference - She's Connected. I have stayed at the Sheraton before and have always had a pleasant stay. I have to admit, I was not disappointed this time either but I have to say, the rooms were looking a bit more tired this time around. However, the beds are just as comfortable as ever! The best thing about the Sheraton is that is very close to The Eaton Centre - one of the best shopping centres in Canada. It is convenient for families & business guests. The biggest plus is that I was able to get a rate that included parking. At $45 a day for valet parking, this expense can add up quickly if you are in town for a long weekend. I was hoping to get an upgrade to a club room in order to get access to the club dining room (which sits at the top of the hotel and provides spectacular views). My sister-in-law often stayed at the Sheraton so I was able to sample the delicious breakfast buffet in the Club Lounge. I was disappointed to see that the this lounge was primarily closed of over the holiday season. I still feel that people do continue to work during the season or at least for for New Years and family visits. It is a shame that this 'perk' is not available then. One big criticism that I have of the Sheraton is the amount of personnel that they had at check-in & check-out time. There was a considerable line up so if you want to check out from the comfort of your room, I would suggest you try that instead of waiting (that is what I did but the person I drove down with had not so there was a bit of waiting involved). I would suggest that you try to get a view facing City Hall. Any other view will just get you a view of other buildings and is not as interesting. Overall the stay was good but it is a very large property so if you have issues with waiting for elevators or don't like a busy lobby, this may not be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Heater too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Debby585
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel, but the heater is too noisy. I tried three guest rooms and all had a noisy heater. The swimming pool is great, but it should be totally covered during winter. They need to construct a mobile roof! Extra services as Internet, breakfast and phone calls are too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory.”
Reviews.Author: mararedhead
Reviews.Content: We arrived just before 4 pm on a Friday afternoon. Upon arrival we were greeted with a 20 minute line-up to check in. When we finally reached the desk, the process itself was pretty quick. After reading reviews here, I asked for a room in the Queen Tower and this request was granted. The room itself was pretty small...one queen bed, desk, small bathroom and closet. There was no fridge in the room. We wanted to open a bottle of wine and called down to guest services. (Actually, it took us a couple attempts at trying to figure out the phone. For some odd reason, the phone is permanently set to speaker?) We were told by guest services to call back after 5 pm as this service wouldn't be available until then. We called down just after 5 pm and finally received the corkscrew about an hour later. The view was lovely, overlooking Nathan Phillips Square. It was nice to watch ice skaters and see the bustle of the city at night from our window. The bed was just okay. I am a firm believer of fitted bottom sheets and this hotel doesn't seem to use them so upon awakening, I found myself laying on bare mattress which isn't exactly a pleasant experience. I will say that the shower had excellent water pressure and that the bathroom was very clean and contained all the necessities. The room menu seemed a bit overpriced...I think a bowl of berries for breakfast cost $9??? We opted to take an early morning stroll and headed over to Tim Hortons! All in all, if you want something affordable and clean in the heart of the city with a great view, this does the job. But if you're looking for something a bit more special and memorable, I'd recommend looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at Its Best”
Reviews.Author: babsyluv
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at this hotel for Caribana celebrations like we doi every year. The Service was awesome the staff were extremely accommodating. I have severe allergies and they made sure that all common areas even the vip lounge did not have certain fruits. The rooms were feather free someone checked in regular to make sure I was comfortable. On a previous business trip for our AGM and conference even the food services Manager made sure my food was allergen free my breakfast was delivered to my room because I could not eat in the common area. Overall A wonderful caring place to be. I highly recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure it is also very family oriented and close to everything in downtown Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by it's cover”
Reviews.Author: SydCityBoy
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at The Sheraton Centre, I was greeted with a giant, drab, concrete box. Other guests who I was not travelling with and I got off the airport shuttle, got out bags and were a bit lost. After a couple of moments, we worked out that the entry is via the undercover parking area. So weaving our bags through the hodgepodge of parked cars, we found the entrance. Wow, the foyer was almost breath-taking. It is complete with cosy chairs, coffee shop, bar... not to mention huge waterfall and landscaped gardens. Quite amazing given the discomforting disorientation we just had. Check in was relatively smooth, although I would suggest it would be a whole lot faster if all of the clerks weren't desperately signing up guests to their rewards program. It was a rabble of features being repeated over and over along the line. The room was very nice and relatively large. I had booked a king, but was given two queens. Upon questioning, I was told the only room with a king that was available was an 'Accessible Room', which I declined as I thought it would be selfish to take up a room which someone might actually need, for the sake of a wider bed. My room overlooked City Hall and the heritage park across the road. Nice, but not very exciting. Bathroom was big and well appointed, except for the bath-tub. Small and uncomfortable - no long soaking here. Get in, get out. The location was second to none. A short walk East, and you hit the Eaton Centre, Yonge+Dundas Square and Yonge Street. A short walk West, and you're in the beginnings of the Queen West revival, with hot boutiques and cool cafÃ©s and bars. To the South, you'll hit King Street, where you could mistake it for NYC on some street corners. Room service was over-priced for the quality. At the Traders Bar, I ordered a snack of chicken tenders, which were nothing more than breaded chicken from the freezer chucked in the deep fryer - which is acceptable - but not at $9, plus tax. I do recommend Shopsy's deli though. It's a little tricky to find, down the walkway and around the corner from the foyer, but well worth it. The food is great, reasonably priced, and the staff are great to have a chat with. All in all, it was a good stay, and I would return. Hot Tip: When walking around the streets, find a newspaper box called 'The Grid' and take a copy. It's a free weekly street-press, with all the latest places to go and hot events on that week.

Reviews.Title: “good location for anyone spending time in the city”
Reviews.Author: trianne81
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Hotwire for this hotel and it worked out really well. The hotel is centrally located and we were able to walk everywhere in the city. We parked the car in an underground lot right next to the hotel and paid only $40 for three nights (much better deal than valet parking at the hotel). The rooms were clean, and since we elected to not have maid service while we were in the hotel, we got $5 vouchers to use in the hotel coffee shop. There are a lot of restaurants and coffee shops near the hotel as well. Overall a clean, comfortable hotel with a friendly staff that is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not enough for a 4-star - no fridge, bo shower gel, no staff”
Reviews.Author: Fieldwolf
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel is very well situated - most of the attractions are literally 20 minutes walk. The rooms are a bit weary but quite nice, so if you need something just as a sleeping base in the center of Toronto - that'll do fine What we did not like: - Looks like they have staff shortage - all the time lines to the services, bellmen always missing etc. - No fridge in the room - pretty uncool for a 4-star, especially when you travel with a baby - No shower gel in the room - that was really unexpected from a hotel of that class.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: redwoodyonge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice this year - once in April for seven nights and in July for a week. Our visit in April did not live up to our initial expectations. We were given a twin room in the Richmond tower despite booking a king room. The hotel was full of conference guests and our request could not be accommodated. On arrival in the room we found a large spill in the bathroom. This was cleaned after we complained. A few nights later we were kept awake by noisy guests. The next evening when we returned to our room around 10.30 pm there appeared to be a lot of young guests on our floor running from room to room, shrieking and dropping ice all over the floor. We immediately complained to the front desk and were moved to a king room in the Queen tower. The queen tower is much nicer than the Richmond tower. When we returned home we received an automated email asking about our stay. I sent a polite reply, outlining the difficulties we had. We were told we would have our room upgraded in July. This duly happened and we had access to the complimentary breakfast on the top floor. The views from this room are great but there are not enough seats to accommodate all guests at peak times, tables that become free are not cleared of dirty plates promptly etc. One morning I was pushed out of the way by a member of staff who wanted to replenish a container I was standing at. There was no "excuse me" or apology. Our room on this occasion was clean. I find that the Sheraton lacks the finesse of other hotels of a similar standard. It is so large and clearly has a large conference market that independent travelers can appear to just "make up the numbers". The location is ideal but make sure you stay in the Queen tower. Skip the "free" breakfast and go next door to Tim Horton's where you are much more likely to get a chair and a clean table at which to sit!

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend treat”
Reviews.Author: cheshiremackat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a nice weekend away from the house. I had a room on the 4th floor, overlooking the pool deck. The room was spacious and clean, but nothing really special. The only nice touch was the noon checkout. Overall, the room was very satisfactory. The only challenge was parking - I think the hotel prefers you to use the valet - but we parked across the street at City Hall.

Reviews.Title: “An OK choice (great location though)”
Reviews.Author: darrennelson
Reviews.Content: I stay here quite often while in town. I would say the Sheraton has a great location, but that is about it. The hotel is very large, and always busy. I believe the rooms are all the same (standard Sheraton room). I would agree with some of the comments about noise; I find the walls very thin and usually this does not bother me. My biggest complaint this trip was probably cleanlinest .. I found multiple hairs in the bathroom and tub when I checked in. The hotel is close to shopping and restaurants, as well as the train (by the Bay). The hotel also does have a few restaurants on site (all just average). The hotel does have a club lounge for platinum members or guests willing to pay the extra. As a SPG platinum member, I prefer the King Edward over this hotel in every way. I generally stay at the Sheraton only when the rate is cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Hamiltontraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked a night's stay through Priceline and got a very good price. After reading a number of reviews I was worried we would would get a small, inferior room. I did try to call the hotel directly a day ahead to request a king bedded room but was told that priceline rooms were assigned at check-in and requests could not be taken in advance. Check in: We arrive at about 2 pm, were the only ones at the checking in counter. Vernon, the gentleman at check-in was warm and seemed sincerely glad we were there. He left a very good first impression on us. I asked for a king-bedded room, he said he would make sure we had a nice room and he did! We were in room 3223, overlooking city hall. The floor was marked as "preferred", we were thrilled! We were there the Monday night before Christmas and the hotel did not appear to be very full so that probably helped. Room: We were on the 32nd floor with an amazing view. The windows went wall to wall. The city lights at night were a sight to see from that vantage point. The bed was indeed comfortable and the bedding impressive. Nice comfy pillows. The furnature was upscale, very nice. The heat worked well, we were comfortable. There was a big comfy chair with an outoman in front of the window. The TV was a flatscreen which we didn't watch much. The bathroom was typical. The water pressure good. If you were there for more than a day or two, you might find the vanity space meager. The towels were fluffy. No fridge but an ice machine on every floor. We did bring a little cooler with us. We felt very fortunate to get assigned this room. A Globe and Mail was outside our door in the morning. Nice touch! I did look at some of the other rooms on other floors when the doors were open and they were getting cleaned. There were some rooms that were considerably smaller, only a queen bed in a much smaller space. The amenities looked the same, the bedding nice but smaller. I'm guessing if the hotel was in high season, this is what we would have gotten for the price we paid. The hallways on the lower floors I looked at did not seem to have been renovated and were slighly more dated. Our room was almost across from the elevator but we didn't notice any extra noise. We asked for late check-in and were given until 3 pm. Again we felt that the staff was looking for ways to make our stay nice. Parking: We parked across the road from the hotel entrance in the municipal parking on Queen Street. It is underground parking so we missed it the first time round as we were looking for a "parking lot" .... It has an underground path (just a few steps) to the hotel lobby, no need to go outside. Pricing was this: from 7 am to 6 pm $14, from 6 pm to 7 am $6. We parked from Monday at 2 pm to Tuesday at 3 pm and paid $34. Cheaper than at the hotel but more than we are used to paying. It is something to factor in when pricing out your stay. This is Toronto though and everything is expensive! The "PATH": The PATH is the underground walkway that runs through the downtown core. It was amazing. We walked to the theatre district, about 15 or 20 minutes almost totally inside. The Sheraton is right on the PATH, so we walked underground until we got to Roy Thompson Hall on King Street and then above ground the short distance to the theatres. We went to Second City but the Princess of Wales and Alex were right there. We walked the PATH to Union Station from the hotel (2o minutes) and then a few blocks to the Speghetti Factory for dinner. The staff at the hotel have PATH maps and were very helpful in mapping out routes. Overall: The hotel more than met our expectations. We do hope to return for another quick getaway in the future. The pool area was being renovated while we were there. It looked like it would be nice when completed. The hotel does definately feel more like a business hotel, even the outside looked more like an office building. There are many eating options nearby at all price points, many without even stepping outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: meganbeth4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times. At check in we were given an upgrade to a suite. The pullout sofa in the room was terrible and needed to be replaced. The pool - which is amazing- was closed and that was a disappointment however the hotel did give us a $20 credit on our bill. The hotel is located close to everything and you can walk to the eaton center, skating rink, hockey hall of fame, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Sassyshoes
Reviews.Content: Booked one night at the Sheraton Centre through Priceline for $70 USD. Some recent reviews were not very good so I was a bit nervous. Arrived in the city for an overnight Christmas shopping trip with a girlfriend at 10:30am and was told "no problem" to check in at that time. Tammy at the front desk was very accommodating and gave us a room on the 26th floor. She seemed excited for us to be away for the weekend and gave us complimentary passes to the Club Lounge that offered free breakfast and hors o'dourves and a beautiful view of the city. Our room was beautiful, updated and clean with 2 comfy double beds and a flat screen TV. We found the hotel to be very quiet and the staff very friendly. The best features (besides our front desk experience) are the views and the location. We could see City Hall lit up at night and the skaters at Nathan Phillip Square and it was an easy walk to all shopping. You are able to walk underground to the Eaton's Centre so no coats were needed. Used valet parking for $45. and it was definately worth the $$. I would highly recommend the Sheraton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “It is the normal Sheraton experience”
Reviews.Author: Sam A
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the beds were great to sleep in, the hallways were a little dated but not bad. We were on the 15th floor and had a great view of the Christmas lights and the skating in the park. We chose the Sheraton due to the location for shopping and we went to the Ballet so both were very easy walking. Traders was loud and not really anything too great and the breakfast at bistro two was over priced for the quality. We woke on our last day to find a tv show being filmed in the lobby which I found very tacky.

Reviews.Title: “Heading down a slippery slope!”
Reviews.Author: FLSMARK
Reviews.Content: This is my third or fourth stay at the Sheraton and I must admit that each stay is getting worse. Obviously you need to set reasonable expectations for a large convention hotel, but basic functions of their operation have fallen apart. During my 17 night stay for a project, more than half the time, my room had not been cleaned by the time I had returned between 5pm-6pm. Upon mentioning it, I was told I must have forgotten to take the door tag off my door. When I replied that I know to leave it off (given I spend half my life in hotels), I was pretty much ignored like I was lying. We dined at the lobby bar multiple times and the staff all voluntarily mentioned the upcoming renovation. They all openly expressed their displeasure given the bar seemed somewhat updated and as a result were going to lose tips for four months. Furthermore, I had club level access with my SPG Platinum status. The access was really irrelevant as any "Joe, Dick and Tom" could come in for breakfast in the mornings. Of the 17 day stay, only twice did they ask what room I was in. The other mornings you could just walk in. The word had gotten out to the entire hotel of the free access because it was a mad house every morning. There were no filters and in fact one morning a homeless person sat at the seats next to me swallowing muffins whole, and none of the staff blinked an eye. One morning the temporary gym was empty and I started a workout on an elliptical. Ten minutes later a staff member appears and instructed me,"please get off the machine immeaditly." When I walked over and asked what the issue is, she said that I hadn't signed in for the machine for a 30 minute slot and was "forbidden" from using the machine until I did so. I signed up and contined my workout only to see her leave and not return. Only one other guest came into the gym during this encounter. When staff publicly complains about their employer, ignores guests comments, rooms are not cleaned iorang specific order and a lack of security is present, it could be the impact of the current management team. My previous stays, the last of which was two years ago were much better. It is clear that a bitter and unempowered staff is a direct result of a union dispute/slowdown OR the lack of motivation and ability to control the staff by the management team of this hotel. My message to management; fix the problem with the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Uninspiring Hotel Well Matched to an Uninspiring City”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker63
