Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night as I had to be in Toronto for a dinner and played russian roulette on Priceline.com- got a room here for $79. One doesn't expect much from the Sheraton brand, and this hotel was applicably bland, well-suited to the bland brand that is the city of Toronto. The lobby has been recently done in that modern everywhere contemporary style of aspiring wannabe cities. Having read horrible reviews on Tripadvisor, I asked for a newly renovated room at check-in, and received one (despite the fact that the room was on the preferred floor- high marks to the check-in guy, who was quite friendly in a sincere way - a departure from the typical snittyness of Torontonians). The room indeed was newly renovated, and furnished/appointed in a manner consistent with what Starwood is doing with the Sheraton brand. Would not stay here for a business trip or leisure stay, but for one quick night at $79, it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: live66
Reviews.Content: Recent reviews made me anxious about my up-coming mini vacation. I was pleasantly surprised with the facility...beds are fabulous, rooms are large. The staff were OK...didn't really go out of their way, but OK. The location is close to everything...so don't feel obligated to eat their, as there are plenty of choices nearby. I am always disappointed that To. is so much more expensive than Chicago, however, I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton as usual”
Reviews.Author: db4649t200rs
Reviews.Content: As Starwood Preferred Guest, I used ot stay in Sheraton Hotels and this one is like any other good one, so no bad surprise. Large and Clean rooms, Sheraton Sweeper beds are perfect. Service, Food, Price in lines with other Sheraton Hotels. Good location. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Only very bad surprise to me, but it will not happen to other is that i take the Club Room which are more expensive, located on the top floors, with a panoramic lounge at the top floor... Unfortunately, workings were undertaken and the top floor lounge was moved to the second floor, and no compensation offered for this so basically, you loose a great value in the price you pay. But now, be sure that it really worth it as workings should be over.

Reviews.Title: “Only good things to say”
Reviews.Author: JamesPharm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Centre this past weekend and it was just lovely. The reception staff were friendly and we were able to get the room early. The room was clean and well maintained. We had a view of nathan phillips square which was nice to observe the skating. We were across the hall from the elevators but the noise level was fine. I hear the south tower is outdated, but the north tower was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay; Nothing really stood out as fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugcheri
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend as we were attending a work Xmas party downtown and didn't want to drive home. Parking: Organized chaos. A long wait for the valet parking, which cost $45 I thought that a little pricey. There are street lots and covered parking close by that would have been more economical. Busy place! I have no idea how the valet staff coordinate the mess, but kudos! They were friendly and professional. Upon departing, our car was ready within fifteen minutes after calling for it. Check In: A long line. It moved rather quickly, but we were still in line for about 15 minutes. To be fair it was check in time (3-4pm on a Saturday). Were were given our key cards in about 3 minutes. Room: Clean and great view of the skating surface at Nathan Phillips Square. Bed was comfy and linens were decent. Furniture was a little roughed up. Bathroom was small but clean and suited our needs. A pesky charge for Internet....either $12 or $14. (Totally unnecessary, IMHO) Room service menu was expensive, we chose to get coffee and eat elsewhere. Movies and music were expensive as well. Little things like this really turn me off hotels. Hotel: Location is great. Right on the PATH system. We went to Eaton Centre without our coats. Decor of the lobby, elevators and hallways dated. The rooms are neutral but need updating. Overall experience: I didn't have anything negative happen but I didn't feel particularly wowed. The hotel was so busy I didn't feel that personal touch that I do when staying at other hotels. Aside from the valet and front desk interaction, I didn't encounter any other hotel employees. I suppose some people like that, but to me I left feeling a bit flat. I guess I had high expectations of this hotel given its reputation. Would I stay there again? If I got a room from a discount travel site I would be happy with it. Paying regular rate? Not so much; it's overpriced for what you get, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough, well worth the money, but breakfasts poor”
Reviews.Author: Faience44
Reviews.Content: I got a room here for $169 Canadian a night, which is good value for central Toronto. The hotel is enormous and doesn't have much atmosphere. The room was large and quiet and clean, which is all I want in a hotel. The breakfasts though are poor value at $30 a pop, especially when the food is indifferent. The service was friendly throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the parking recommendations.”
Reviews.Author: boowaaccaa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights for a conference that was being held at the hotel. The location was great - underground walking path and close to shopping and restaurants. I got a basic room that was priced at over $250 so I did have some expectations. I found the room to be very small (one queen bed) and that was in need of some renovations. The wallpaper was peeling off the wall and there were several shoe scuffs on the wall. Also the toilet seat was very chipped and then just painted over. I just expected more at this price point. The bed, however, was very comfortable. The shower pressure was fine but then the tub didn't drain properly no matter how much I played with the plug. Again, likely it would not bother me as much at other places but at this price it did. There was free internet in the lobby and nice computers to use there. One major point that soured our stay was that we were told when we checked in that the parking would be $45 at the hotel but we were better off parking across the road at the city lot as it was half price. So we parked across the street. Well, due to the time of the day (approximately 4pm) and the time my husband checked the car out (8am) as he was only staying for the one night, we were charged for 2 days - $48! If we had of parked at the hotel it would have been $45 for valet for the same time period. We would have never parked across the road if the front desk clerk had not of advised us to do so. So in the end we had to lug our luggage across the busy road then get billed more for it all at the recommendation of the hotel staff. There were other people travelling in our party that were told the hotel was sold out and the clerk that answered the phone said they would book them at their other property (Westin Harbour Castle) which was, as per that staff member only .5 of a km away. Well this wasnâ€™t true either (as per Google maps it was a little over 2km away) and my colleagues ended up paying $15 cab ride there and back There are so many options in this area that have a better price point so I would likely not stay here again. It was, however, very convenient for my conference.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill?”
Reviews.Author: Suzuki267
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here quite a number of times. Location is great with everything in downtown AND Queen West nearby, as well as the underground PATH. However, my last two stays the rooms have not impressed, the last in particular in late November. There were stains on the extremely old carpet, and to top it off I stepped in a piece of used gum (how could that be missed? It was in the middle of the floor directly after entering, I didn't see it because it was dark but presumably cleaning staff have the lights on). Shower curtain needed changing, there was some long hair on the tub fixture - these are basics, whether you are a one star or 5 star. To top it off, when booked I was not told the pool area was under renovation and the fitness centre was a few aerobic machines in a makeshift boardroom. Good that they are renovating, but not good that this was not disclosed. A bit disappointing considering how easy it would be to get these things right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - In the Heart of Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaTraveller67
Reviews.Content: Once you arrive you are quite literally in the middle of everything and you never have to step outside. Go down the escalator and walk for 5 minutes and you are in the Eaton Center. The higher the floor the more amazing the city views ! Fitness center was being renovated and the temporary set up is horrible however I have an amazing service story here..I walked down to the lobby intending to ask a concierge about another gym i could go to, even if I had to pay...a manager walked by, saw the perplexed look on my face ( there was no concierge available, they were all occupied with other guests ) she asked if she could help..I explained about the gym situation, how busy it was and how i wanted to work out even if I had to pay....she said there is nothing close by but give me a minute...she dissappeared behind the desk, came out 5 minutes later and said I have made arrangements with another hotel u can walk to, to use their gym.....I was floored, this is truly service recovery as it should be...this young lady went above and beyond and it truly made me feel valued plus i got to work out, the manager on duty repeated the scenario he following night. Sheraton leaders, guess what, you are doing an amazing job - your team are representing you and your hotel very well ! I am looking forward to going back in another week !!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: donnamarie168
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel is one of my favourate places to stay when visiting Toronto. The staff are warm and friendly and tend to your every need. The rooms are very clean and spacious with complementry tea and coffee makers. The beds are to die for with masive down comforters. We prefer the king size bed . The furnature is modern with flat screen TV and computer hook ups. In the lobbie are fabulous chairs to relax in and look at a beautiful waterfall and garden incased in glass a wonderful resturant also in the lobbie with marvelous food an esculator takes you to a shopping course some little shops and The Bay . There is a VIP lounge sorry can't remember the floor which overlooks the city all around where we had cocktails then breakfast next morning buffet style absloutely wonderful ! I really like the location as your right in the heart of everything shopping ,theatres, resturants,Roy Thompson Hall, ROM to name a few. I almost forgot the indoor outdoor swimming pool ,sauna, and fitness centre too!! I highly reccommend the Sheraton Centre

Reviews.Title: “Staff were the highlight”
Reviews.Author: GVWStonegate
Reviews.Content: Just spent five nights at the Sheraton Centre Toronto. Located in the center of it all, the Sheraton Centre has always been a favorite of mine. This will be the fourth time we have stayed there. On this occassion, we paid the extra and experienced the "Club Level " service. While the hotel itself is generally an awesome, albeit expensive place to stay, the club level service was not at all worth the extra bucks. We can honestly say that I have enjoyed far better amenities at other hotels three star and higher. With the club level service, we got to stay on the higher floors ranging from the 26th to 42nd with pretty damn good city line views; got a continental breakfast (not unlike what one would get at a two or three start hotel. The only difference here was the meal was served in the club lounge on the 43rd floor with almost panoramic view of the city. There were also beverages served throughout the day and snacks from five to seven every evening. Linens were comfy and were said to be a sweet sleeper experience. I guess, I should mention the two free bottles of water in the room and what were supposedly upgraded bathing products. Aside from the few food offerrings and the free water, a traditional room would have been just fine with as much comfort as what was afforded at the club level. There could have been a bit more attention to details in the room; wine glasses were never replaced, towels were neatly placed, but were not attractive or soft; rugs were not vacuumed daily; windows were dirty. What was truly awesome were the staff at every level. Even though we were four hours in waiting for our room to become ready, the staff were more than accomodating. Everyone was friendly and seemed to go out of their way to make our stay enjoyable (was it because I was at the club level?). Housekeeping, valets, desk clerks, guest services.... all were cherry and welcoming. At no time did anyone hesitate when we had a request. It was honored efficiently and with a smile. It was the staff that made our stay delightful. The hotel is now showing it's age. Eventhough the Sheraton reports at having spent millions in upgrades to its hotels, this one was not one of those lucky to have had a face lift. With a bit of work, paint and new wall paper, this could remain as one of the classic Toronto hotels. For it's location alone, we would highly recommend it. Access to above ground shopping and more so to the underground malls and eateries make this a most enjoyable and spot to be situated. Take the risk and stay here, experiece the location, the staff, and the enjoyment this hotel can bring. No need to experience the club level. A traditional room would be as delightful. You wouldn't be missing much.

Reviews.Title: “One of my most favourite hotels in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Duststorm
Reviews.Content: Talk about first impressions count, right from the visual impact of the main reception area, I could tell this would be an excellent hotel. And I wasn't wrong, the facilities in the room were excellent with a great bathroom, very comfy beds, and a FANTASTIC sunset view of the city from my room which made for some super photos (overlooking Nathan Phillips Square) together with the fabulous rooftop swimming pool and hot tub. In addition, the location of the hotel is close to almost everything in the city centre, with the water front, Air Canada Centre, Union Station and the Eaton Centre just short walks away. Even though this hotel can be pricey if you don't shop around, it is definitely worth a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MarcieEOwenSound
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at. The rooms are lovely and it's central to everything. You can walk down Queen Street for great shops and restaurants, and you're also close to the Eaton Centre. The hotel can be pricey, but I found a great deal on it through Expedia. The rooms are clean and have a nice decor. The bed is very comfortable as well. Unfortunately, I didn't find the front desk to be very helpful or friendly. The check in process was pretty slow as well. One tip if you want to save money on parking is that you park across from the hotel in the underground parking. It's about $9 to park there, instead of the $40 fee at the hotel. The parking lot is directly across the Sheraton Hotel on Queen Street. My other advice is do some research about different restaurants in the area because there so many to choose from. Unfortunately, I didn't find the concierge very helpful when asking for a good thai restaurant. The breakfast place that I would recommend is EggSpectation on Yonge. They have good service and good food there. Definetly find some time to stroll down Queen Street, it is a neat place to walk down, with nice stores for sure.

Reviews.Title: “WOW. AMAZING VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: Beth c
Reviews.Content: Even though i am a local i loved the views this place had to offer and the amazing service!!!What an outstanding hotel in the toronto area!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: DogAgility
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at this hotel for a business trip. There's nothing wrong with it, but nothing exciting about it either. Check-in line was pretty slow - and the check-in person failed to make it clear to me that I was in the Richmond Tower, completely separate from the other part of the hotel, separate elevators and not easy to find. So it took me awhile to find my room, info desk was not helpful at all. I felt like a second class citizen. Room was okay. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Hair, hair, everywhere”
Reviews.Author: CanadaGalOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: I have never seen a room so neglected, in a major chain in the downtown core of a big city. There was hair on the bathroom counter, on the floor and on the shower walls. The rooms are very outdated and worn -- stains on the peeling wallpaper in the bathroom, a horrid smell of stale smoke or BO...?! The tub drained very, very slowly. Sheets and towels seemed to be clean, but were stained...UGH. A colleague had to change rooms twice because of an allergic reaction. Pretty sure that smoking rooms have been converted to non, without adequate attention to cleaning/replacement of carpet, furniture, etc. Would be terrible for someone with allergies or asthma. Will not go back until the room are completely and totally refurbished. Check-in staff were fine, but the woman working the info desk was nasty. Stayed at a nearby Hilton a couple of years ago -- was much, much better!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: socjoc12
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with free internet in the lobby area. Best feature is it's location as its downtown and close to everything in the area.

Reviews.Title: “most luxurious hotel in toronto”
Reviews.Author: jraja1
Reviews.Content: Good quality room with stunning views,would like to go again, swimming facilities pretty cool outdoors, one of the best locations in downtown Toronto, lots of restaurants in the area, free wifi, overall lovely, shahrukh khan stayed here too!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a little pricey, book in advance”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeforeKids
Reviews.Content: Good location, right off the Osgoode stop and walking distance to the Eaton Center and on Queen St west. It is pricey, but then so are most of the hotels in Toronto. Please book in advance as the hotel tends to sell out. Valet parking is very expensive, so take public transportation. They have a seperate line for elite members which comes in VERY useful as there are a lot of people in line to check in. Air conditioning is very poor but windows can be opened which makes up for it slightly. Beds were so-so, they need to be replaced soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - old fashioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrunoHerd
Reviews.Content: Excellent location; Public parking close by (not too expensive). This sheraton is in need for a renovation (especially in the rooms). Service can also be improved (front end staff not as good as you usually find in starwood hotels). No internet wireless in the 21st century? Are you serious? I am a starwood fan but this one can be improved (or its category has to be downgraded to 3) Not impressed...

Reviews.Title: “SheratonHotel, Toronto”
Reviews.Author: AlisonNewcastleUK
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in centre of Toronto. Excellent room, As I was travelling on m yown and first time in Toronto. I felt very safe whilst staying there, food good

Reviews.Title: “Start of a great trip”
Reviews.Author: WarwickshireMonty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated for getting about in Toronto. We stayed here for three nights. The stop for the airpot shuttle is right outside the hote, so you don't have to drag your cases very far!. The rooms were large, comfortable and clean and the staff were all very helpful. There is free wifi too. The main shops, bars and nightlife are a 10 minute walk away, enough time to walk off that dessert you wish you hadn't had. If we visit Toronto agai, we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times. It is an ok hotel overall. If you're here for business, this is a good hotel to stay. Nothing really special about this hotel but it's nothing bad either. The main downside is that they don't have wireless internet in the room--come on !! In this day and age without wireless internet in a hotel room in a big city like Toronto ? If you are here for fun, stay at the Hazelton!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: nonquonpaddler3
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton Centre in Toronto for a weekend getaway. This was the second time staying at this local, but the first without kids. Check-in was easy and accurate, the room had a spectacular view towards the lake (Lake Ontario), and it was clean and comfortable. The beds are very comfortable. Check-out was simple and fast. The only improvement would be free in-room WIFI - you can use computers in the lobby (it appeared that you could use them for a little while, and then you would have to pay), or you could use the WIFI in your room - and the rates seemed steep. The location is very good - close to shopping, theatre, the opera and ballet, the symphony, and great dining. Our stay was great as a couple going for dinner and theatre. We came home very relaxed, and look forward to doing it again over the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the centre of it all!!!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiboundToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a shopping weekend, so we wanted to be close to the Eaton Centre and the Bay and the many stores along Yonge Street. This was a great location for everything we needed. The hotel room itself was very clean and comfy, especially the beds. We had a room away from the elevator with a view over looking Nathan Phillips Square. We were able to watch them decorate the huge tree in the Square for Christmas. The hotel has free wifi in the lobby, but not the rooms. They do have a bunch of free computers in the lobby that are free too, you just have to log in with your room number & name. The elevators were super quick...we never waited longer than 15 seconds for a lift.....they were that fast! I usually like a fridge in my room, but we were not in there very often and there was an ice machine right on our floor anyway, so that wasn't a big deal! There is a Tim Horton's right up the street, which was a good choice for breakfast. I used the parking across the street at city hall....it was much cheaper than the hotel's $45/day. I paid $38 for the entire weekend, which was from Friday at noon until Sunday at noon. You don't need your car while in Toronto - you can walk around with no problems. Once you park in the underground, just follow the signs to the hotel....you never have to step foot outside! The hotel staff was very polite and helped out with any question that I had. We had drinks and snacks in the Traders restaurant while we watched the hockey game on their large TVs. The service was good and the price wasn't too bad considering it was a hotel. There are many other restaurants near by - which we used throughout the weekend, but we were a little tired after all the shopping on the last day! Good choice while in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Very well located!”
Reviews.Author: rodriarano
Reviews.Content: Connected to the underground city and being place in the very financial district, this Sheraton hotel has a very good location in downtown Toronto! Service is of course very good, but consider that is a gigantic hotel (like 1500 rooms) and it's more like a business hotel. Therefore you don't have someone following you all the time, which I found much better! The room (standard) was super spacious with a big toilet. Probably the best bed I've ever tried. If you are lucky (or you pay more) you will a have great view. There is a gym and a waterpool + whirlpool free to access. Something I found super ridiculous is that Sheraton (as many other high category hotels) charge you to have an Internet connection. Even if I were rich I'd fin this ridiculous. Nowadays a wi-fi access in your room is not an option! You can always connect for free in the hall, but of course is not the same ambiance as in you cloudy bed! Whatever. Very recommended if you find a good rate!

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Clean, the fitness center needs you...”
Reviews.Author: Anthony015
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed here in quite some time, and forgot what a nice property it is. Very impressive lobby. As a runner, I always travel with my running shoes and make it a point to hit the fitness center. This fitness center left much to be desired and was disappointing enough to prevent my return. First, I had to connect my iPod to 5 treadmills before I found one with a functional cable, #meh. Worse though, I don't think the treadmill bases had been wiped, cleaned, or sanitized in months, if ever! I understand that each guest is expected to wipe down the equipment after use but upon seeing the condition of the bases, I limited my wiping to the console and sensors. D-I-R-T-Y! Surprising though since the rest of the hotel was quite pristine.

Reviews.Title: “Average - terrible wireless”
Reviews.Author: onobed
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and as such connectivity is key. Unfortunately the wireless was so slow I couldn't get any work done. However, the rooms were nice and the staff friendly. That equates to average for me. One note to my US friends: Sheraton's in Canada tend to be nicer than those in the States.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate at best.”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: First, the positive: The location is excellent, the staff is pleasant, and the lobby is beautiful. its clear that quite a bit of money was spent (recently) to either refresh or maintain the looby and they did an excellent job. It really is nice enough to sit down with an iPad and read a book or get some work done in a pleasant environment. Onto the negatives: I travel quite a bit for work and personal trips. On work trips I stay at Holiday Inn Express, exclusively. On personal I tend to stay at Kimpton properties, but i stay at at least one Sheraton a year. The last Sheraton property I stayed at was in Baltimore the rooms were stunning and it was a great experience. My stay at the Toronto Sheraton was a mix of business and pleasure. The rooms at the Toronto Sheraton Centre left quite a bit to be desired. Sheraton beds are always excellent but it appeared as if the update to the furniture had bypassed the bathroom. The fixtures were usable but beyond dated, the layout was poor, and even on a low flooer there was NO water pressure. We had a view of the under construction pool. I can't fault them for this, everything needs refreshing and this is a logical time to do the pool. In addition to the bathroom, the desk was unacceptable as well. There were no available outlets anywhere in the room, with the exception of ONE on the desk. In this day in age, most if not all travelers will need at least two (computer and phone) open outlets to charge each evening. I don't expect a hotel to meet my expectations in this regard (four - a computer, two phones, and an iPad) but I expect them to meet the minimum. Speaking of meeting the minimum, lets talk internet. I do not expect free wireless internet in all rooms. I DO expect free wireless internet in the lobby for SPG Members (AT MINIMUM). Additionally, I DO expect free wired internet in all rooms. I can't recall the last time I traveled in North America and had to pay for internet service in the hotel. At a business oriented property (as Sheratons tend to be), this is unacceptable. I don't need to be able to get on Hulu or netflix (which would be nice, I would pay for that) but I need to be able to get on email (on my system, not a shared computer), gratis. Other problems abound. Twice on our first night we were woken by what sounded to be a jack hammer (1:30 and 3 am). Cigarette smoke frequently permeated our hall and on one day, the hall floor was covered in either mud or dog feces. I dare not get close enough to find out. The courtesy phone I used to report it was never answered. The room itself was clean enough, the curtains were stained and the bed skirt was FILTHY (looked like grease) but the towels, bathroom, and sheets were clean. Overall, this is not a Sheraton experience. The first impression of the lobby and staff was excellent, but the room didn't hold up to those expectations. It was a $100 room for $200.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and centrally located. Ideal for business travel.”
Reviews.Author: GypsyKingBrussels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September for one night, as the Hilton accross the street, where I was staying the night before, was fully booked. Very efficient hotel featuring a nice lobby with shops, coffee shops and resto's. Nice swimming pool. My room spacious, clean and with everything in working order. Nice plus: I had a room with a stunning view, overlooking Phillips Square, Toronto City Hall and Osgoode Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte D
Reviews.Content: Came here from out of town for a wedding. The staff at the hotel were very polite and friendly--they even upgraded us for free! The rooms were spacious and very clean. The beds were comfortable. My only complaint is that a breakfast (room service) cost almost $50.00!! Even for a hotel, it seemed excessive. Other than that, no complaints. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harrison1457
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October 2011. Me and my husband stayed for 4 nights. The hotel was in the perfect location, very near to the CN Tower, Air Canada Centre, the harbour and all the shops. There was also plenty of restaurants and bars nearby, and i would definately recommend the Keg steakouse which is just around the corner. The reception area was large and quite busy with alot of business people, i would say that the hotel was mainly for business people rather than tourists but we did not feel uncomfortable at any point. The room was lovely and very spacious, we had a great view of the CN Tower which was lovely, we were on the 24th floor. There was a huge tv in the room which was great for my husband to watch all the ice hockey updates on! The bed was amazingly comfortable, which we needed from all the walking we had done during our time spent there. The only issue i had withthe rrom was the bathroom, it was outdated and did not have much space to put your toiletries etc. Also the bath blocked up whilst we were there but the room service was very good and as soon as i reported the problem they cam and sorted it out. The breakfast we had at the hotel was lovely, very filling and tasty, i would recommend trying one of these! Overall the hotel was great for what we wanted, a good base for exploring the city. I would stay at this hotel again if we went back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel, but still a great option”
Reviews.Author: GettinErDun
Reviews.Content: First off, I know I only rated this as 3/5. However, there as reasons for this and I will explain. I checked the website, the list price was $260/night. I booked through Hotwire, and got a room for $99/night. Yes, I would say that is a huge discrepancy. For $99/night this hotel is outstanding. For $260/night, not so much. So I can give this 5/5 for value at $99, but much less for full price .... The valet parking was great, fast friendly .. both coming and going and I tipped nicely as I was so pleased. ($45/night FYI) The lobby at this place is outstanding ... huge well appointed, very classy. Check in was fine, I was hoping to get upgraded or switched to a King for being such a nice person, but apparently they were all booked up (which I don't believe .. had I been a travelling Rock star, Im pretty sure they could have accomodated me haha). Anyway, the room was fine, a basic room on the 14th, with 2 double beds is what we ended up with. So me and my lovely wife wach got our own bed we joked. The room was clean, the decor was fine. Strangely low ceiling in there ... maybe 7' if that. Again, nothing special. The bathroom was somewhat lack lustre, one marble sink but small. The bed was soft, the sheets crisp and white. The TV/cable was OK, the view of the rooftops was .... well ..... I could see the CN tower if that even matters. The video check out actually worked well as a bonus. Ill try to post a photo later ..... There are better options for a $260/night room in Toronto. I stayed at the Residence Inn (See review) for $240 which included parking and breakfast, and that is THE place to stay in my opinion for that kind of money. Overall for location, it can't be beat. If you get a Hotwire deal, then yes, stay here or if you want to be right down near the Eaton Centre. I had chosen here as we were going to a show at Massey Hall. On a side note we did get desert in Traders in the lobby, and that place was nice enough, and surprisingly the drinks weren't overpriced. I think the menu in there will leave a little to be desired, but the drink menu is fabulous. Would I go back ... for $99 yes anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: healey100
Reviews.Content: Great central location - close to shopping, AGO, lots of excellent restaurants nearby - block from the subway. Good rooms, but a bit tired. A busy hotel with lots of conventions. Restaurants, parking, internet over-the-top pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: myghtymouse
Reviews.Content: I got an excellent rate on my room, the hotel was clean, comfortable and guest services were very accomodating. The hotel location was ideal, right in the middle of shopping at the Eaton Centre and on Queen St W. there was an underground path that took you right to the Bay and Eaton Centre so we didn't even have to go outside as the weather was cold that day. The hotel parking was expensive so we just used the city parking right across the stree under city hall, it was only $12 for overnight and there was an underground entrance to the Sheraton Centre from that parking lot, so it was perfect. Only glitch our reservation confirmation had said that the pool was closed for renovation Nov/Dec by the time we found out that they actually hadn't closed it down yet it was too late to go swimming...other than that our stay was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: AusKMac
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my recent stay at the Sheraton Centre. I got a great deal on a last minute site, so was very pleased with value for money. The hotel is quite tired, and does need some modernising, but with that would come an increase in price for a night's stay. Beds were really comfy and the rooms were a good size - I would recommend staying there if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Ask about construction and beware of breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: SeeTee-27
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a good hotel, with all the amenities one would expect of a quality chain in a downtown location. The location is excellent -- easy to walk from the hotel almost anywhere in the downtown core or access public transit. We booked through Hotwire at a good price but (or perhaps "so") were put in a room that looked out over a major construction site across the street. Activity started up early Saturday morning and continued most of the day. This meant we couldn't keep the window open and the thermostat wouldn't allow us to go below 18.5 deg. C (warmer than we like for sleeping). Otherwise, the room was fine. Beds are exceptionally comfortable and nicely made up in good quality sheets and duvet. Bathroom was a bit dowdy but clean and convenient. Avoid the "Bistro on Two" for breakfast unless you have money to burn. The CafÃ© CrÃªpe a couple of blocks along Queen towards Yonge serves delicious breakfast items and very good coffee all day long, at a very reasonable price. Lots of other places to choose from as well. Parking is available across the street under Nathan Phillips Square at $6/day on the weekend but you'll be talked into valet parking unless you make a point of avoiding it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Big room, good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AJWong8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre for a 5 day trip to Toronto, the hotel is in a good central location, walking distance to the Eaton Centre, and other shopping & entertainment areas, connected to the PATH (underground walkway all around Toronto with shops and lots of food courts). We took a tour to Niagara Falls and the tour bus picked us up from the hotel (took about 1.5hrs to get to the falls). The room was very large, big comfy bed (could fit at least 3 people), very clean - Starbucks coffee maker in room, with take away Starbucks cups, topped up every day! Free wifi in the lobby for all hotel guests, this area can get quite busy as everyone is trying to connect: don't expect super fast wifi! We stayed on the 21st floor and had great views of the city. Great seafood restaurant across the road called Fishermans Wharf, but quite pricey! Would stay here again, checkin was busy, but they have express checkout which was great and we could store our luggage until our taxi arrived for our night flight. Very busy hotel but we did stay there during the Toronto marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: forkrisf
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights 11/4-11/6 the Sheraton Centre is listed as a 4 star hotel and itâ€™s just not up to par. Itâ€™s probably a 3 star at best, with some issues. Good: Location easy walking distance to lots of shopping, restaurants and fun. Bad: Hotel lobby staff is not friendly, not helpful and over all just not up to Starwood performance that I would expect. From valet to check in to calling down to the front desk it was an over all disappointment. Upon arrival it was a crazy mad house valet were not outside taking keys opening car doors or unloading luggage. At check in you are greeted by a note at the desk saying that if anyone calls to complain about you being too noisy they will give you one warning call and upon the second complaint charge your room 200$. I called down with a question to the front desk and wasnâ€™t greeted by my name as Iâ€™ve experienced in every other Starwood property Iâ€™ve stayed at. I know that sounds snotty, but I expect a certain amount of butt kissing for the price I pay to stay at a hotel, it doesnâ€™t COST them more to be warm and welcoming but it really makes a difference. We were given a room on the 4th floor and it really appears that they purchased an older hotel and built upon it. There is an odd transition between the elevator and room 456 you walk down ramps so it feels like you are on maybe the 3rd floor not the 4th. Iâ€™ve posted some pictures of the hallway and vending area missing light fixtures and missing ceiling tiles. In our room there were no bottles of water waiting for meâ€¦. Again I know this sounds snotty but at every other Sheraton theyâ€™ve been there and I expected them and missed them being absent. It appeared the room didnâ€™t have any heating system there were two space heaters plugged in for my use Iâ€™ve posted those pictures too. The first door to the bathroom leads into a room with a large vanity/sink. Inside that room was the closet for this room with the safe. Additionally there was another door that housed the shower/tub and toilet and it was small and cramped. You could have sat on the toilet and washed your hair in the tub. Iâ€™ve included a picture of this too. The shower head was very low making me believe it was an insert on top of the original bathtub. The set up of the vanity and shower/tub toilet reminded me of they way Travel Lodges/Motel 6â€™s are set up where the vanity is part of the hotel room? The rooms have very thin walls as others have said, I couldnâ€™t believe the amount of conversation I could hear from the people next to us and also in the hall way and from the note at check in this Sheraton will profit 200$ from you based off their poor building abilities! WiFi or Wired internet is 15$ for 24hrs and there is no free WiFi the lobby. Valet is 45$ a day and they should be ashamed for charging that much with such a terrible staff to greet and send off their customers. If you get a good price and you expect a 3 star hotel this is an good place to stay. But don't expect too much!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Scouture
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent guest at the Sheraton Centre Toronto and it has become my favourite hotel in the city. Guest services has always gone out of the way to ensure my stay is great. I have been upgraded to the Club floor and been given complimentary breakfast vouchers. The location is perfect and the hotel is always pristine.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time”
Reviews.Author: NickyandMichael
Reviews.Content: Booked with hotwire and got an amazing price. Stayed for 1 night, on the 19th floor. No issues or concerns. Room was spacious and clean. Service was very professional. The only bad thing is no free internet in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, but incredibly noisy”
Reviews.Author: Hourray
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton from the 21st of October through the 23rd. Overall, I would probably stay there again. PROS - Incredible location: 15 min walk to train station, AC Center & 5-10 min walk to Eaton Center - Clean rooms and friendly staff; checking in was super quick CONS - GOD it was noisy! We were on the 21st floor and I could hear the sirens more loudly than I hear it staying on the 4th floor of a Manhattan hotel. Moroever, whenever you'd flush the toilet, it would take about 30 secs to 1 min for the noise to stop. Finally, whenever the AC would start, it would sound as though a train was coming in the station (not as loud but still....). Since I'm a light sleeper' needless to say that I didn't get much rest! Hope it helps!

Reviews.Title: “Not a boutique hotel, just OK”
Reviews.Author: cnnHalifaxNs
Reviews.Content: I think I may be spoiled by staying in too many artsy boutique hotels, so take what I say with a grain of salt. Overall - not super impressed with the hotel. Front desk staff were kind, but they are overworked - always a lineup no matter what time of day I stopped by (10 AM, afternoon, 1AM). Room was pleasant - nothing special. Room temperature was too warm - couldn't cool it down to sleep, and awoke early in the AM from noise of other people's door closing. Gym adequate - a little crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: monty2k05
Reviews.Content: 3 nights booked and did not want to leave, fantastic in every sense. Location, food, staff, rooms, all amazing would recommend to anyone - oh and the price is not that bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: KerrySudbury
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre is conveniently located in the heart of downtown Toronto. You can easily walk to the Eaton's Centre, the theatre district, both sporting venues and many restaurants. The indoor/outdoor pool is also great, especially at night during the colder months when you can swim outside and enjoy the city lights! There are some downsides however! Accessing the front entrance by vehicle can be a nightmare - especially on a Friday afternoon. Checking in can also take an eternity depending on when you arrive. The rooms are average at best. The bar and restaurants are mediocre. If you want a great location, this is the place. If you want a more upscale hotel with newer decor and great amenities look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “lounging not as good as previous visits”
Reviews.Author: heeto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times before and we are SPG Gold members The Good: Great location,good sized clean,functional rooms as you would expect from Sheraton.Overall staff was good esp club lounge staff.Pretty good and reliable concierge and bellhops.Easy to get cabs. The Bad (and there were more than before) First room allocated was behind elevator shaft which was ridiculously noisy since this is a very busy and TALL hotel.We paid extra and switched to club room which we've had couple times previously.This room is slightly nicer i.e. better furnished but not much different for most people.The tub took forever to drain.The thermostat did not work as the room was constantly 75-79F even though the setting was 65F!!! In room check out did not function.Lobby ALWAYS busy as there are constant line ups for check in/out and luggage storage.Long wait in Gold/Platinum line as well.Hotel needs more front desk staff. Lastly and most annoying-club lounge has gone downhill and is THE WORST lounge we've encountered in years.Its still very pretty and has amazing views but what has happened to their nightly food offerings???There used to be huge selection of nibblies (e.g. sushi,cheese,scallops,olives) now there's a slim selection of outdated vegetables and a couple of meagre dips.Same every single night.Really?We are expected to pay $10-15 per drink and chew on raw celery? Cmon guys lets not allow your best attribute go to waste.The lounge was dead all three nights we visited.The staff bored and with no customers no tips.Its better to have a full lounge =more people drinking pricey drinks=more revenue .Breakfast selection a bit better if you like boiled eggs. Will we return? Probably not.Even though we are loyal to the SPG brand name its time to try Toronto's newer options.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: tarynpeter
Reviews.Content: Stains on the carpet, worn and no wifi in the room! Was probably a great property at one point. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Centre Remains The Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: DetMI
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sheraton Centre many times in my lifetime, going way back to when it first opened, around 1974, when it was called Four Seasons Sheraton. Love this place. Recently stayed for three nights in mid-October, my second stay there for this year! The comfort, location, and amenities remain outstanding! It remains as my favorite hotel in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “good stay despite the cool temp.”
Reviews.Author: nanatee
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the hotel for a work conference. I had never stayed at such a large hotel before, so this was an experience. First, the good things... the staff was very helpful and friendly- no complaints there. the room was spacious, the bed very comfie and the washroom clean. The fact that the hotel is centrally located was very convenient as my colleagues and I attended the Princess of Wales theatre on Thursday night and you can walk there in 15 minutes. I was also close to the train station for my trip home. I ate at the Traders restaurant off the lobby and had delicious fish and chips. It was rather noisy and not cheap but I didn't mind. The coffee shop has some good treats and food for a light breakfast or snack. Not the friendliest folks there but adequate. The big problem with the place was the lack of heat in the room. I spent the first night uncomfortably cold and promptly called down for some help with the heating. No one came after a long wait so I went to lunch. When I returned, I called again and within half and hour, a man came with a space heater. This was an improvement though it took quite a while for the heat to fill the room. I decided to complain at checkout and was immediately given a $100 credit on my bill. I was satisfied with how they handled the issue. Would i stay there again? probably yes, for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Overrated”
Reviews.Author: JennyBrenock
Reviews.Content: While in a great location from a tourism perspective the parking aspect is a MISERY. There is absolute CHAOS at the entrance, which is significantly understaffed. Unless you have an SPG membership the check-in takes an unacceptable amount of time. The room I was in had a great view but was itself ordinary and dated. It was clean. Food was nicely presented ...charges would be consistent with "fine dining" but this was "family fare". I would not choose this hotel for future trips to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy maid and no hot water = bad experience”
Reviews.Author: kerr1974
Reviews.Content: Well we went for the weekend and got a great deal on hotwire for less than 100 dollars a night. We arrived around 9pm and check in took forever.. It was pretty busy but they only had 2 ppl working. The room was pretty standard but clean. So after going out in toronto for the night we woke up to the maid at 8am knocking on everyones door yelling "housekeeping". Well way too early to be doing that crap but whats even worse is she did it every half hour! anyways, the only other thing is that we had no hot water in the mornings to shower.. At best it was luke warm. Thank god we didnt pay much for this hotel.. I probably ask for a refund!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hope1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located, impressive upon entrance, clean and beautifully styled. If you find a deal on Priceline, this hotel is a great bargain, but Priceline aside, it measures up as an ecellent place to stay in downtown Toronto. The rooms a large and I've never had an issue with check-in or check-out. Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay with a Few Bumps”
Reviews.Author: PsychRN12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto for a conference I was attending in Toronto. Normally I do not stay at the conference location since it is usually very expensive, however it would have costed me more to rent a car and pay for parking each day. It was $195/night with the conference rate - even more without. The hotel itself is located in the heart of Toronto with easy access to Union Station and many features and attractions. It is more of an upscale hotel with lots of business people, but since there were multiple conferences going on I didn't feel too out of place. Upon check-in I found out that they had reserved me two double beds instead of one king bed which is what I booked. I still don't understand why they would book 1 person into a two bed room, but this same scenario had happened before at another Sheraton I stayed at. They were unable to accomodate the king bed for the first night, but did compensate me very well with free buffet breakfasts every morning of my stay (which was 5 days). The rooms are quite nice, with some stunning views of Toronto (I had a beautiful view of the CN tower and its light show). The room has a safe in it for storing valuables which was convenient. The bed was unbelievable comfortable, though they could stand to offer a few different pillow types since the ones they had were very soft. You had the option to decline maid service in exchange for either a 5 dollar food voucher or 500 SPG points each day (I earned 1500 points during my time here). Internet does cost extra from your room, but there is free wireless in the lobby as well as 8 computers you can use. The hotel has a pool, fitness room, and hot tub. The pool is partially indoor/outdoor which is unique though a bit cool at times. There is usually a sauna but due to renovations this was closed. The food wasn't too bad, though overpriced. Room service has an automatic 15% added on plus $5 to deliver, so beware. Overall, my stay was great and the hotel did an excellent job compensating me for the problems that occurred. Though it was a bit pricey it does have a great location with lots of services. It is more business focused, so I don't think it would be the best family location. I would recommed this hotel if you aren't budget-conscious and willing to spend extra money for the location and services.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central location & great pool”
Reviews.Author: MDB-Bham
Reviews.Content: Large well-appointed chain hotel in great central location. Fabulous views from the rooms which are large with comfortable beds. Hotel pool is a highlight, half within the hotel and half outside in the fresh air. Good base for seeing the city. Walk south to the ferry across to the Islands where you can hire bikes for a great ride around the park, water's edge and residential district - with fabulous views back to the city. Or take the tram east along Queen St East as far as the "The Beach" for sunbathing and swimming in the lake at the right time of year! Shell out on a meal in the revolving restaurant up the CN Tower as a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “First and last stay.”
Reviews.Author: MartyPuch
Reviews.Content: Two nights for a conference. Room was musty and deodorized. Carpet was rolled in many spots. Hair in bathroom. Took fast shower and ended up with water up to high ankles due to clogged drain which was fixed on request. Poor sleep both nights due to ambient and external noise. Room corridors not picked up regularly. Conference facilities are good albeit some servers had knarly attitudes. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Central to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Nif27
Reviews.Content: Travelling alone is not always easy so I look for places with decent rates near public transportation or walking distance to a lot of places to see and eat at. This place met all of my requirements. The staff was friendly and helpful and I felt safe travelling alone and walking around the city at night. Used the hotel as a place to stay so couldnt say anything about the amenities except for the help desk being a great service to those staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Hotel Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: roadtrippintotheUSA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from toronto, another great mini trip for hubby and I. We won the Sheraton for $92 from Hotwire. Absoloutly great deal considering the price through their website was 289 a night for 1 king. Now I dont know if you get a better room with that or not. Upon check in they did not have a king bed reserved for us, why idk any other hotwire hotel i have ever booked we got a king bed for 2 people. Anyway the man benhind the desk offered us an upgrade for 20 bucks to a king bed. Really? people get up graded all the time for free, I say. Hubby says oh dont worry aboput it and offfers topay it, at the station beside us the man was giving another lady a free upgrade for the 2 nights she was staying, so i looked at our check in guy and smiled he finally says "well i just heard my colleague give out a free king bed so i guess i will too": Thanks buddy i say cause I heard that too. He also threw in free breakfast buffet in the morning. I have read alot of reviews of how the food is not really good, so we dicided to go out for breakfast elswhere and enjoy it. (breakfast is my fav meal of the day). The room nothing special we were on the 5th floor looking at the pool. The bed is sooooooo comfy OMG. really soft and lots of pilllows.In the morning when we tried to shower the shower wa broke. My hubby pulled the piece out to turn on the water and and it all broke in his hand. So i called front desk within 5 min a guy was there with the piece and we had wter Yeah!!! There is no security there at all. you can enter tht building several different ways, and anyone can just not a great feeling to me I guess, I like when you enter youi past gueat services so that way they have an idea of whois in teh hotel. There was a lot of confrences going on I think Hubbya nd I were the only 2 people not attending a confrence LOL. Anyway Nice hotel, would stay again, only if won on hotwire I wouldnt pay their price for it. Good location but really anything is only a street car ride away or a nice lovey walk with your partner and what you see on the way will probably make it worth the walk. Oh yeah, there was also cleaners on our floor, ALWAYs but why they couldnt pick up the dam salt shaker is beyond me. We arrived Monday at 12noon and it was there and we left Tuesday at 4pm and it was still there. WHY? it sat infront of the one room for all that time I bet 30 cleaners walked by it and never picked it up. I finally grabbed the pen that sat in the middle of the hallway for the whole time so THANKS!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “DRUNK TRYING TO SMASH DOOR DOWN”
Reviews.Author: traveller2371
Reviews.Content: as the title says friday night man swearing and cursing at 2am in the morning shouting at the top of his voice and try to kick the door through of his room .his partner eventually let him in and all we could hear was the screaming and shouting.by 3.30 am police took them out of the hotel while staff cleared the blood and mess up .saturday night again 2 am seemed to be party night in the hallway but a fellow traveller gave a few choice words and things then got a bit quieter.. i have got to say the hotel itself is very nice ,clean rooms and very comfortable.good location but i think avoid weekends i have seen other reviews relating to this hotel with similar issues at the weekend

Reviews.Title: “Shopping trip to Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Jackie K
Reviews.Content: Great location and good sized rooms for a city centre hotel. After experiencing noise for other guests ( our room was located next to the vending machine) we were moved to 32nd floor and given complimentary breakfast for the rest of our stay. Perfect location for Eaton Centre shops, walking distance to all other attractions, plus the airport express coach and Niagara transfer buses all stop directly outside the hotel. The hotel will also store some of your luggage if you are to return to them after a trip to Niagara. Breakfast in the Bistro on 2 is a little pricey, but the bar has a good selection of drinks and a nice atmosphere Added bonus was free internet access for all guests, based in the lobby of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Food”
Reviews.Author: TranspaciFlyer
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton, when compared to other hotel options in the immediate vicinity, distinguishes itself for its mediocrity, blandness and unpalatable, over priced dining options. This hotel is geared to conferences and meetings because it has the facilities. It is not a good choice for a "tourist" or an over nighting business traveler. Breakfast cost $37 for one person and for that, one had the option of an omlette and the usual greasy potatos, selection of processed over cooked pork products and extremely poor quality "baked" goods. Sure, breakfast buffets are basic, but for the price, there was nothing special.The bacon was cold and dried out, the ham was sitting in greasy water, the "pastries" were obviously industrial variety as opposed to actually being prepared by a real baker. The crowning glory were the sausages that tasted "off". I had to spit it out. I should have walked out after the 8 minute wait for a waitress to make her way over to the table in a room at 30% capacity. The lady making the vegetable omlette put a teaspoon worth of vegetables in the eggs. I counted 2 slivers of red pepper, and 2 tiny pieces of yellow pepper with lots of onions. The food areas were dirty and the utensils used to serve were sticky and dirty. Would it have killed one of the staff to change the utensils every so often, or is the hotel trying to see how many people can contract a food related illness? What was the unsmiling hostess thinking when she sat us next to a serving station in a nearly empty room? We had the delight of a busboy banging cutlery and dishes while having a loud conversation with his co-worker. Don't bother stopping for a beer in the main floor bar as the price is significantly higher than many of the surrounding options. I pity anyone attending a conference at this hotel as the meals are unpalatable, greasy, overly salted, and unimaginative. The only consistency in food is that it is over priced and bad at any time of the day. The sad aspect of my experience was that at one time, the Sheraton had both a great brekfast and lunch otion that was imaginative, distinguished by quality and competitively priced. Two tips; avoid the high priced valet parking and park your car in the underground municpal garage next door and better yet, consider the multiple Hilton brand, Mariott and Delta options close by. The aforementioned hotels offer similar or better rates and a superior ambience combined with reasonable dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jhundt1
Reviews.Content: The perfect location of this hotel is what takes it from three to four stars. This hotel is perfectly located across the street from the Eaton Centre, and within easy walking distance of the entertainment district, Chinatown, and Dundas Square. This hotel seems to have more of a focus on maintaining a beautiful lobby than updating its rooms. The room decor tends to be a bit dated, and just have a stale feel to them. The pool and outdoor garden are another bright spot to this hotel. While the indoor / outdoor concept is pointless, the beautiful tree cover make you forget you are in the middle of one of the world's largest cities.

Reviews.Title: “Very good city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmilRio
Reviews.Content: Large but well kept hotel in the centre of Toronto. North American-style large rooms with free internet. Great views from the executive lounge on the top floor. Large gym and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coventrylass
Reviews.Content: A less than impressive exterior hides a very impressive interior with direct access to the underground shopping centre. Rooms were very clean & comfortable. Food appeared to be rather expensive in the hotel restaurant but due to the excellent location of the hotel there were plenty of reasonably priced cafes & restaurants close by. Overall a very impressive hotel & a very comfortable stay

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: P1623
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Rooms are always clean. Staff are very nice. Connected to PATH in Toronto. Very handy. Restaurants have quality food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel to stay at, Everything was Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Satella
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel thru Priceline at a special rate. Upon Check in the clerk was super nice and very helpful. He gave us the North Tower and since we were members of the Starwood Club gave me access to the VIP Lounge room. We got the 2 Double bed suite. The rooms in this tower are upgraded. Great Views, everything clean and crisp! Club Lounge was an absolute delight!! Make sure if your staying at this hotel that you can get access here. The view in the day and night is SPECTACULAR!!! The complimentary salad bar was a delight with all you can eat foodies which were very tasteful. Lounge offered free WIFI internet which was good. I am very impressed. The Pool to the gym was fantastic. Would definetly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Kanguro10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Saturday 10 Sept to Monday 12 Sept (two nights). We arrived at the hotel at 8pm, after driving from Niagara Falls for two hours. We actually had an original three days booking at this hotel but we decided to drive to Niagara Falls from Toronto airport and stay over there for one night. It was a fantastic experience. Check-in was pretty easy and efficient. At the time of booking this hotel, we requested High floor with views and we got that. We stayed in room 1639 (level 16). It was a beautiful welcoming room with great views of Town Hall (photo). You will find all the basic amenities in the room. Valet parking is quite expensive ($35 first night and $45 afterwards). You might want to consider parking at the car park opposite the hotel (on queen Street), which has reasonable rates!. Internet is $15 per device. As we wanted to explore the restaurants in Toronto, we didnâ€™t dine in at the restaurant of this property. If you are gym junky, you will be more than happy as the gym has good work-out equipments. It is located next to the swimming pool. The hotel is like 15 minutes walk from CN Tower and one block from Eaton Centre (shopping Mall). There is a Starbucks on the ground floor, next to the Business Center. We certainly would consider this hotel in the future. The location is unbeatable and amenities are top of range. A taxi ride to the airport is $65.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynx21
Reviews.Content: We arrived direct from our flight from the UK and despite there being 3 large groups checking in we were sent to a separate desk and speedily processed and off to our room which was in the smaller (older?) tower block, much to my wife's delight as she hates heights. This is the first hotel I have stayed in where they actually honour the concept of 'no room service' and even reward one for asking for no service. Everyone else pays lip service to this concept of saving the world but doesn't actually do it. The hotel is very well located and access in bad weather to Toronto's underground malls (27 Kms of them!) was directly from the hotel. Food was expensive in the hotel but that was no surprise and we soon found a small inexpensive alternative just one block down the street. The really annoying thing was the idiot who set off the fire alarm early in the morning, I can only hope he/she was charged by the authorities and also ejected from the hotel immediately he/she was found. The towels were definitely fluffy and sufficed for the 4 nights we stayed here. Well worth what I paid for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Keeping up with the times...”
Reviews.Author: pltanct
Reviews.Content: The hotel remains a little dated, even though I understand they've recently renovated. Toiletries left much to be desired, and were comparable to no star motels.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Allen W
Reviews.Content: Big hotel but very classy, clean.and personable. Service was first rate, location was superb. It's across the street from City Hall, on the trolley and subway lines, three blocks from Eton Center, six blocks from the convention center, seven from the Rogers Center and seven and a half from the CN Tower. Great shops right below the hotel in the Toronto Underground. Rooms were spacious and updated. The breakfast buffet was very good, but like all breakfast buffets, over priced. My favorite hangout was Traders, the bar/restaurant on the main floor. Great atmosphere with locals mixing with the tourists. Food was excellent and the bartenders very attentive. The place was packed every night. Made a long trip tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: AoifeW
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night recently and we would highly recommend this hotel. The location is fantastic, right in the middle of everything downtown. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was nicely decorated, spacious and clean. The view from the room was lovely. There was no WiFi in the hotel room which was disappointing however you could get WiFi in the lobby which was a huge area with plenty of places to lounge. The hotel bar was really nice also - it didn't have that boring hotel bar feel to it. We returned to Toronto again following this visit but unfortunately the room rates were really expensive due to the Toronto Film Festival so we stayed elsewhere. But we would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Christine L
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 4 nights at the hotel for a conference and was woke up 2 nights because of fire alarm in the middle of the night . First night at 2 in the morning and the other night around midnight and both were not actual fire but jokes from partying individuals. Both nights were lost for me taking about 2 hours to get back to sleep after going down 24 floors. For a business place sure is quite a place to party . In addition there is open access to everyone on the street all around the hotel and no security. No complimentary breakfast or reduction on the bill for the inconvenient. Hot tub and pool area is all wet and does not look clean. It's the last time I'm going there.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again if ever in toronto again”
Reviews.Author: firsttimer23
Reviews.Content: We(my girlfriend and I) stayed here the past thanksgiving weekend from saturday until monday, and have nothing but good things to say. First of all we booked this stay through selloffvacations and it only cost $292 taxes in(CAD) for the two nights and after reading reviews from here didn't expect a very nice place. Upon check-in the guy behind the desk (not mentioning names) was nothing but polite and nice to us. Right away asked us if king bed and higher floor were our prefrence yet our selloffvacations package said double bed standard room. Then when we had said yes to that he said I will upgrade you to club level free of charge if you sign up for the starwood perferred guest plan which was also free of charge and was given a membership card. The room we got was on the 35th floor with a view of the CN tower(amazing view of the city) which on the door noticed the room would normally cost $529.00 per night. We had also told the from desk on check in that our flight didn't leave until 10:55pm on check out day and immediatly he gave us what he called V.I.P checkout time which was 4pm also free of charge. Also we had asked for a map of toronto and he gave us a map and also marked on it showing us the best places to visit and the areas of town to stay out of. Because we declined housekeeping for the two nights we were there by putting this piece of paper on our doorknob we received a $5 voucher for any of the restaurants in the hotel or 500 starwood points each on checkout. We went to canadas wonderland on sunday and saturday night being tourists didn't know how to get there so we went to the information desk and were treated very nicely and they told us the cheapest fastest way to get there showed us on our map how to and also gave us written directions with distances and times on it. The pool was very warm and a nice touch to the hotel with the indoor/outdoor aspect. The only downfall we found was that we ate at Bistro on Two for breakfast on sunday and it was fairly expensive for a plate of 2 pancakes and a plate of eggs bacon and sausage $55. Which also when being seated we were'nt notified they didn't take debit that is until we went to pay for it 'sorry we don't take debit cards only cash or credit' and were told there was a atm on the basement level if we wanted to go get money. In the end I just charged it to the room to save the hassel. The morning of check out they had already done up our reciept and had it placed under our door which I found rather convient as we could check out from our in room TV but we chose the traditional front desk check out route and when we said we didn't have our flight until 10:55 that evening the took our luggage and put it in storage for us for no additional charge and told us that we could use the change rooms by the pool if we needed to change before we departed also offering to call us transportation to the airport. Overall the hotel staff made it the most enjoyable stay I've ever had at any hotel and will definitely be staying here again. And recommend this hotel to everyone. Thank you for the wonderful stay sheraton center Toronto Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite hitting the mark”
Reviews.Author: taj_2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this convenient downtown hotel and had no bad experiences. Nice lobby, good service, generally clean and maintained appearance. This Sheraton wants to be a downtown business hotel and hits many of the right marks, but not all. Why do the guest rooms have plastic wrapped, throwaway plastic cups in the bathroom instead of glass? This is what I'd expect to see at a cheap motel. Also, the bathroom towels were thin and well worn and the bathtub/shower faucets and fixtures were worn and loose. It's time for some upgrading!

Reviews.Title: “Dingy and Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: cantravel00
Reviews.Content: My room was completely disgusting. It had gross stains on the wall in the bathroom and bedroom and a kind of grey smudge over the light switch in the bathroom. The supposedly white bathroom towels had a revolting grey tinge. Worst of all, the hallway and room stank like stale cigarette smoke in spite of being a non-smoking hotel. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No way”
Reviews.Author: e k
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at Sheraton centre in Toronto last week. The hotel is at the best point of Toronto close to the city attractions. We had a reduced price (185 $) because of the conference was held at the hotel. They forgot to mention us when we was making the reservation, that breakfast was not included at the price and so, they wanted 50$ more for each day. They charged us 180 $ (!!!!) for a 6 days period for internet access, because we used two different laptops. The normal rate was 90$ and they declared the double price was mentioned at the sign form, which is true, but nobody can read everything, or even imagine such a terrible policy. They also tried to charge as for parking, even if we never drove a car in Toronto. A Sheraton hotel must absolutely be not like this. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ue1
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location, the best pool in T.O. We stayed here on TIFF weekend. Kids went to American Idol with the MRS. And I went to a Jays game with the youngest, pricelined room for $120. The hotal was great; clean, efficient checkin, parking etc. no surprises, no complaints. The pool in this hotel is likely the best in the City with the swim in swim out, good size. The staff were courteous. The hotel was surprisingly quiet given the weekend; Good noise cancellation?

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: moomzer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay for a conference. View from 40th floor great, room super clean, everything in order. Very comfortable beds/pillows, slept like a baby! Left a note for housekeeper because toilet seemed a little sluggish, was fixed within the hour by plumber. Club lounge with breakfast and hors-d'oeuvres included. Upgrade included free internet in room. Concierge very helpful. Hotel was completely booked but I did not ever feel jammed-in anywhere. Check-in and check-out smooth and efficient. Error on the charge was fixed with no fuss at all. I arrived by train, short cab ride from Union Station. Walking distance to CN tower, Eaton Centre and lots of restaurants. Food at Traders very good and very reasonably priced for the area. Pool great, jets in hot tub need a liitle adjusting. Would I go back? Without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Gorlestonpete
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days whilst visiting Canada, we come from England. Good City Centre location close to Shopping Centres and other sights. Nice well kept rooms but one day room not cleaned - given free breakfast to compensate. Frendly staff apart from one barman. Two in house places to eat with good food and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: K-TownKeliza
Reviews.Content: Simply the best hotel in downtown Toronto, from the moment you pull into the hotel and valet takes your car away peace and excitement abound, check-in is easy, Traders lounge is fantastic! I have stayed in this hotel many times and will continue to make it my one stop hotel in Toronto! My favourite parts are as follows, Club Level, Club Lounge, Traders Lounge, Pool, walking path to Eaton Centre (leave your jacket in your hotel room you don't need to go outside!!!) and Quinn's steakhouse in the Path. We will be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: moondrop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Downtown during Nuit Blanche 2011. Found a cheap (Starpicks rate) rate on-line directly through the hotel rather than through Hotwire, Expedia etc. Paid $119 before tax but could only get a room with two double beds. Checked in on Saturday at 10:30 am and we were upgraded to a King bed on a high floor without extra charges. Our room (#2617) faced Nathan Philips Square â€“ we were warned about potential noise as there would be an all-night live concert. Took an afternoon nap and realized that we would be hearing the elevators running all night. Went to the front desk to request a room change and discovered a HUGE line of people waiting to check-in. There was a lovely lady near the check-in line who asked if she could help us â€“ we explained our situation and within five minutes, she gave us another room (#2646) facing the CN tower and in the extreme opposite direction of the elevators. No time for the indoor/outdoor pool, hot tub or exercise room this time. We were given a late check-out of 1:00 pm but I see from another review that we could have checked out at 2:00 pm. We were extremely happy with the price, the service, the comfy bed and the quiet room. We will definitely be back to Sheraton Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay - apart from fire alarm!”
Reviews.Author: Fishstain
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre is a lovely hotel and perfectly positioned. Just about every where is walkable - the CN Tower, Rogers and Air Canada centre. Pool is also very nice. We were on the 33rd floor which had great views - but was a long way to go down when the fire alarm was accidentally set off!! Still all in all a brilliant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: LadyWhy
Reviews.Content: Everything that you would expect from a Sheraton located right in the core of downtown Toronto. Amazing location (2 minute walk from Eaton Centre), great view from our window (old city hall and Nathan Philips square), comfortable beds and so on. The only thing that kinda marred this experience was some pesky little bugs that were mainly gathered at the window sill. they were harmless, and the hotel did put a note in a room saying that in the fall these bugs increase in numbers and that we shouldn't open the windows etc. The was the only thing that kinda bothered us a bit, other than that, we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Newman65
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for business travellers. If you want a worry free business travel experience, I would recommend you upgrade your room to include the 43th floor lounge benefits. The hotel room is comfortable, the table and chair are great for writing reports and staff is always there to help if you have any questions. The hotel also has a nice gym if you want work work out after long day of work. The location of the hotel is excellent and you can walk pretty much anywhere. The only down side is that the hotel is expensive, especially if you want access to the lounge. It is not for people who are traveling on a small budget.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Busy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoisDee
Reviews.Content: The staff here were helpful but always rushed off their feet.
