We were checked i by Steve who could not offer us a room immediately as it was early in the day and the hotel was ful the previous night. We had been travelling overnight and were really tired. To compensate he offered to call us when a room was free and gave us a complimentary breakfast in the meantime. I think this was excellent service. We found some of the bell hops rude and disinterested

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: user651
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, right in the heart of the city, and the staff are fantastic! Every front desk person I spoke with was caring and funny and went out of their way to make my stay enjoyable. And the staff in the lobby bar were a treat as well. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsKGamblin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights earlier this month and had a great time. Check in was quick and as we had 2 rooms booked they made sure we were all on the same floor. When we got to our room, we noticed the safe was not working so we called down to reception to have it fixed. A nice man from security was with us wihin 10 mnutes and when he saw it was actually broken the first thing he said was did we want a new room. As we had already unpacked, we declined and he said he would have it fixed as soon as he can and it was. When we got back to our room, we had a voice mail apologising and offering us free breakfast, This was completely unnessesary as the safe was fixed but it showed great customer service. I went down to pick up the vouchers and as we had another room booked, they also got free breakfast! The room was nice and the bed was so comfortable. My only complaint about the room would be the bathroom was a little tired. I used the FREE computers in the lobby and never had any trouble getting one (less than 5 min wait). We had drinks in traders and found the staff friendly and drinks were good quiality. The location is excellent and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Centre Toronto - No Pool for Me Again”
Reviews.Author: bdl29
Reviews.Content: We went to Toronto last year for the Santa Claus Parade, we rented a hotel room here, it was clean and quiet but nothing elaborate, It is in a really great location just down the street from the Eaton Centre. The pool was neat, however I could not stand being there for it was cold - Half the Pool is outside and in November the air is really cold. The water was actually warmer when you were outside, but the air made it so cold we couldn't stay in very long. I'm sure in warmer seasons the pool is quite nice and probably neat.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown business hotel”
Reviews.Author: OnetwentyOTR
Reviews.Content: Rooms have been updated since the last time I stayed here a few years ago. They are nicely appointed and clean. Front desk staff was very friendly and efficient, and even offered the unexpected bonus of earning reward pointed even through I had booked a deeply discounted room through a consolidator. The gym is large and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist Oriented - Not ideal for Business.”
Reviews.Author: BaconBreath
Reviews.Content: The area itself is probably good in terms of location, but traffic is incredibly busy, and as such it is tough to get around. The service was also not ideal in that they were clear to let you know they did not have time for you. Also, and more surprising, I asked the concierge where to go for breakfast, and she indicated they did NOT have a restaurant. I was shocked by this, but even moreso when I saw a restaurant later on up the escalater....that served breakfast! I went back to that concierge, and she only smiled and went "oops". Not something one would expect at a Sheraton. It was also difficult to set up meetings, and their valet area was too busy for clients to deal with, so really not idea for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value:convenient, clean, comfortable.....and a great outdoor pool!”
Reviews.Author: comonaut2
Reviews.Content: Large hotel, but very good service. Rooms are clean and comfortable,(not luxurious) often with an interesting view. Can walk to many attractions, shopping and food. Great evening venues for all sorts of music very close by--from the opera house to jazz pubs, and more! One of the best outdoor pool/ lounging area around--lovely warm water. And in the winter you can use the underground path if the weather is bad. All around good value!

Reviews.Title: “Central, but a little run down.”
Reviews.Author: mashaman
Reviews.Content: Great location, but certainly nothing special. Bed was fine, but the room had seen better days. Fine if you get a good price, but noing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel. Great location. Very comfortable. If you're able to score a deal on Priceline or Hotwire, you will be very pleased w”
Reviews.Author: jjhrad
Reviews.Content: Outstanding mini-suite just below the top floor lounge where evening appetizers and breakfast are served. Service was very good. Only complaint was exhorbitant charge for parking. Otherwise we had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Book With Confidence--Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: CupcakeToo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 6 day stay at the Sheraton Centre. When a hotel is fully booked with a large convention, which is what brought us to Toronto, things can be crazy, and small details and guest requests can go unheeded. I have to say that this hotel Exceeded our high expectations for comfort, location, services, and excellent staff and management! It was also our 5th anniversary, and the staff did so much to make this a memorable, wonderful stay for us, above and beyong our convention needs! There were many convention events, from breakfasts, to suite events and parties, and the food and beverages were great each time. Further, the event staff and waitstaff really went the extra mile to accomodate a diverse group with many needs; every request was met with a "can do" attitude that we appreciated! The rooms are comfortable, the beds and bedding cozy and soft, and the extra amenities in the rooms added to our positive experience.Even though the hotel was at capacity, we were never disturbed by any noise, and we slept very well. Our room was on the 5th floor, and we enjoyed the view. We also went to many upper suites for meetings and parties and the views were great. We enjoyed the Club Level for a gorgeous view of the city, and wonderful drinks and appetizers. Sunsets, and the lights of the City at night were both breathtaking from the Club Level! The location of the hotel is perfect whether you want to shop, eat,attend an event, or just relax. The City has a great web of transportation that is located steps from the hotel, whether it is walking (we felt safe walking day and night on the streets of Toronto), the subway, Path or bus and trolley system. You really don't need a car, in most cases. There is a great business center in the lobby that's free to guests; a comfortable area with new computers and printers that guest may use to print boarding passes,etc. There is WiFi available, but if you don't need your laptop for anything pressing, this is really convenient and appreciated. The caring, helpful ,and welcoming staff make this hotel even better! Our next stay in Toronto will definitely be at this property; what a wonderful combination of excellence: customer service, hotel services, a beautiful property to enjoy, in a prime location!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Staff & Services... Will Be Back :-)”
Reviews.Author: ChelsAVB
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed for 5 nights at this hotel in Toronto. The Airport Express Shuttle bus dropped us to the door which was very handy. The hotel was huge and very clean and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 20th floor looking at the new city hall and the hotel, for its size, was quiet and the room was lovely and spaceous. Very handy the way the hotel sits on top of the PATH underground shopping center so you are always close to shops and things to do. Also has a hop on hop off stop right outside the door. The breakfast buffet was an all you can eat, and while the price is on the high end for a breakfast you are set up for the day and the food was delicious. Loved every minute of our stay and will most definitely will be back again ( soon hopefully )

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: marmin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first 3 nights of our Canada trip. Overall a good choice and we'd use it again. First the possible negatives - Very large and busy hotel and our room had a lousy view - cheaper room so to be expected? Rooms not particularly luxurious but perfectly comfortable and clean. On the positive side, the hotel is in a great location and we were able to walk to most of our desired locations. It's also connected to the extensive underground walkway which is very useful for shopping and would also be great if the weather turned. Check-in staff were very friendly as were the other staff we encountered. Very good and accessible internet facility in the lobby (approx 10 fixed pc's with free access) and a convenient and good value cafe in lobby also. Our room was very large with 2 comfortable beds and had all the required facilities - iron, hairdryer, good tv etc. Overall, whilst this may not be a memorable hotel it offered good value for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “Canada birthday trip September 2011”
Reviews.Author: joowlz_2000
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Sheaton Centre Toronto from September 8th to 15th this year as a gift for my 50th birthday. We already had high expectations of this hotel from reading reviews on Trip Advisor and from personal recommendation from friends, but we were overwhelmed when we got there. From the minute we stepped through the doors we were treated like VIPs. When the booking was made we were on a very tight budget and could only afford to book room only. We arrived at the check in area and were told that as it was a special birthday we had been upgraded to club class!!! I have a SPG card so we received points on that too!! The from we were allocated was on the 35th floor and the views were spectacular to say the least. We could see the harbour area and Centre Island (through the buildings) and the CN Tower as well as an impressive array of skyscrapers that lit up the night sky like twinkling stars. The room had two beautifully comfortable beds in it (I had the best weeks sleep in a long time!) and everything you would expect from a 4* hotel. Considering we were right in the centre of this wonderful city you couldn't hear a thing through the double glazing. This hotel is situated right at the heart of everything. Just a 5 minute walk and tou were T the Eaton Centre a HUGE shopping and eating experience. Be sure to visit the Urban Eatery food court.........but go there hungry, there is so much to choose from. Situated within the hotel there is Traders, a friendly bar for all ages, Link which is a coffee and snacks bar, and Quinns which is an Irish bar where the welcome is warm and the food beautiful. Up on the 43rd floor we found the club lounge. This lounge afforded some excellent views of the city from two sides through floor to ceiling windows. The food here was buffet style and it was always well stocked and beautiful. The staff in the lounge were extremely pleasant and very helpful. They always had a lovely smile and a hearty good morning/afternoon/evening for you. Nothing was too much trouble for them. All of the staff at the Sheraton Centre Toronot deserve a pat on the back. Their customer service is second to none. I would most definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a special place to stay, and will 100% stay there again on my next visit. Thank you Sheraton Centre for making my 50th birthday celebration so special and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: rondonel
Reviews.Content: Although we arrived at midnight tired and unfamiliar with Toronto at the Sheraton Centre hotel, the receptionist attended to us cheerfully and efficiently. Our first view of our room on the 6th floor was very welcoming, peaceful, large and with a wonderful view of the City Square and Old town Hall, hotel fountain etc. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful and toiletries, towels etc. were replenished as required. Rosemary Allan

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Relaxed”
Reviews.Author: Esthersnippe
Reviews.Content: A friend got a deal here from Hotwire, and we had an amazing time! We got in, dropped our stuff off, and took off down Queen Street West. When we got back after a night of live music on the town, we ordered our breakfast for the morning, and had a very comfortable night sleep. The breakfast was stupidly expensive, but at 7am with a hangover, it was pretty spot on. We went for both a swim, soak and sit in the sauna, and felt more relaxed then I have in ages. There was loads of shops/coffee shops/views from the hotel, and the location was absolutely prime. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “OK but dated”
Reviews.Author: LincolnTravellingman
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here as a stopover on way home to UK from BC. A very large hotel with corresponding facilities and a central location which allowed us to explore Toronto quite easily. The traffic was really busy all around the building all of the time. A typical major city downtown hotel really. Note that the GPS we used to find the hotel failed at the last critical moment as it "lost" the satellites owing to the high rise buildings all around this area. Nothing really to complain of about the hotel but also nothing special to praise. Rooms and hotel have outdated decor and the air conditioning struggled to keep the room cool during a hot spell of weather. The corridors were stiffling hot and stuffy. We had prepaid our room but the cost reappeared on our final bill so check yours carefully. When pointed out it was instantly changed by the people on the desk who did apologise and were very friendly and helpful but it should not have happened.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel that lived up to expectations for my first 4* stay!”
Reviews.Author: childgenius7
Reviews.Content: I'll qualify my statements by saying that this was my first stay at a 4 star hotel. Whether this makes me more or less critical is unknown to me but all I can say is that I loved every minute of being in this hotel. The staff were all super friendly and helpful, you were always greeted with a smile and the hotel and room was beautiful. Location can't be beat and the view from my room with the LARGE window was exactly what I was looking for when I asked for a high floor upon check-in. Would definitely stay here again if I can get another deal.

Reviews.Title: “very large, busy hotel which is central and has pool and fitness centre”
Reviews.Author: truman08
Reviews.Content: length of stay 3 nights. mid august. we stayed here on the advice of a friend who had just stayed here the week before. her description was, 'central and fine'. we arrived at check-in around 1030 pm and had to queue up for around 15 minutes with a number of other guests. i had spent a long time trawling websites trying to book us in on a reasonable rate, our booking stated twin room but we asked if it was possible to have a double. we were told,'you booked a twin'. i tried to explain that this was the only option available on any website and that i did understand this, i just wondered if it would be possible. when we got to our room, it was a queen. i'm not sure why she did not tell us she had helped us at the desk! it was a clean room, although had quite a strong musty kind of smell(the whole floor seemed to) but we got used to it. we had some jetlag and the room/bed were very comfortable and enabled us to combat this. it has a very transient feel as it is so large. we never had to wait long to use the free to guests pcs in the lobby. when we checked out we were allowed to have internet access beyond noon, which was really helpful. the pool area was nice to sit out and read, although we did not swim, the fitness area was clean and we used this a couple of times. because it is so huge, i guess security is a little tricky but a couple of times in the lobby we were approached by non guests basically asking for money. one guy was actually quite pushy, he had a little booklet which said he was deaf. we were taken by surprise and had no idea what he was indicating initially, he then made some rude gestures and went over to some other people. i would probably recommend this hotel, but it's more of a base to stay in toronto rather than part of the experience. we have stayed in other sheratons and it is similar to them, there are no surprises (except funny smell in room). if you're not wanting the personal touches like a hello, good morning, have a great evening, can i help you with that? then this may be the right place for you. i imagine for business purposes it ticks the boxes. we found it had a touch of the impersonal about it, partly because of the size.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy stay at an overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: purdy37
Reviews.Content: I had a three night stay at The Sheraton in Toronto. They placed me in a room that had a joining door to another suite. At 11pm, as I was nodding off - the family staying in the suite next door came home. It was a family = mom, dad, and two young kids. The parents tried really hard to settle the young ones down, I heard everything. I heard the children jumping on the beds, just being kids. I heard the mom trying to keep her voice down and then finally losing it with a loud "Go to sleep". I was not upset with the family next door, they were trying to be considerate .. I was MAD at the Sheraton for placing this family in such a situation - there were empty rooms in the hotel, why place a business person in a room with an interleading door to a family with young kids?

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Consultbishop
Reviews.Content: Service was very good, very busy hotel, great location. Downside the rooms are quite tired looking and could certainly use a remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Slipping behind the times”
Reviews.Author: praasands
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while on business in Toronto. The staff I had contact with were all pretty friendly and eager to help. Superlative is the size of the place. Most of the other stuff I just found to be just plain average and a disappointment for the price. I stayed in the smaller Richmond Tower. Room size and bed were fine but the carpets, bathroom and hallway were beginning to get rather shabby. The internet connection is only via a cable (no WiFi) and costs an exorbitant $15 a day. There is free WiFi in the lobby but a good hotel these days should be able to provide WiFi free in the rooms - it's standard in so many other places. Next trip I think I'll be trying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to enjoy the city”
Reviews.Author: suzpru
Reviews.Content: This the 2nd year we have stayed here during our visit for the Toronto Film Festival. The location is ideal-- puts you in walking distance to great restaurants , sights, and if you're coming for TIFF, most film venues. It's a big hotel but staff is so friendly that it doesn't have that vast impersonal feel that large properties often do. Rooms are a nice size. We have had a great view each year too.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: KrazyCanadian
Reviews.Content: This hotel rests in the heart of Toronto, making it easy to get around on foot or using the public transit system. Staff are friendly and helpful. We stayed a week and the few issues that came up were professionally, quickly and appropriately addressed. Even the security associates (Garry and Jordan in particular) were friendly and punctual.

Reviews.Title: “Standard business hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelrabbit2003
Reviews.Content: Really, pretty standard. We've stayed here twice, and the hotel is huge, a bit impersonal. Things we've liked-the club floor does have a tremendous view. Secondly, in frigid March the pool (half indoor, half outdoor) was open, and superheated, so we could swim while the snow was falling. That was actually very cool (once you get past the heavy chlorine). Also, the hotel is connected to the underground, so if it is too cold for you, you can stay inside!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: neil.macleod5
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and after 3 nights in Niagara Falls returned for a further two nights. Both occasions provided excellent service with staff making every effort to make our stay very special indeed. The service, room and facilities were first class and on our return we were made to feel like long lost friends by Tammy on the reception desk. This experience has converted us into Sheraton fans ensuring that our next stay away will be with this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for Toronto Downtown !”
Reviews.Author: jehanmpatel
Reviews.Content: The rooms were neat and clean, the lobby was lively. Great location for the price and many attractions around the hotel. I spent 2 days here and I would rate it overall 4 stars. Just a note that customer service could be more attentive !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to sights”
Reviews.Author: Blizzardave
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre Hotel is truly a hub of activity. The rooms are, without exception, excellent and clean. The conference centre is composed of, literally, dozens of rooms of various sizes. In fact, I'm pretty sure the Grand Ballroom is the biggest meeting room in a hotel anywhere in Canada. One sort of nifty thing is that the hotel is attached directly to 'The Path', the underground city that's filled with shops and eateries and runs under a good part of the downtown core. The rooms aren't cheap but, then, you don't choose the Sheraton name because you're on a tight budget. There's a huge, underground municipal lot across the street, under city hall. Parking is reasonably-priced at this large lot. The only real drawback to this particular hotel, I suppose, is that you have to walk at least a couple of blocks to find a restaurant. Most other downtown hotels have restaurants within steps of the door. There are a couple of restaurants in the hotel but, to be honest, they're nothing special, especially given the prices. If you're adventurous, though, just head out in any direction and, within a few blocks, you'll find something to please most any palate. If you're looking for an upscale stay close to major attractions, the Sheraton is tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby, good service, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: prolificliving
Reviews.Content: We are here for TIFF 2011 and we have stayed at several other places in Toronto for the last 2 TIFFs (TIFF: Toronto International Film Festival). I really like this hotel's lobby. It is one of the best lobbies for people watching, using free WiFi, meeting and greeting friends, and just spending time during the trip. The rooms are good, and I like that they have a Green Choice - you can choose to skip housekeeping (get your towels still) and then opt in for extra points and amenities. Great to save water and also to earn extra points. So far, like it a lot! The location is EXCELLENT - it is at the center of everything.

Reviews.Title: “consistently good”
Reviews.Author: TorontoVicki1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed as part of package to Lion King. We've stayed before, and although many folks seem to like the Delta Chelsea, I much prefer the Sheraton. Beds nicer, decor more updated, and outdoor/indoor pool a big hit with the kids. I left my jacket there and was able to pick it up 2 days later. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great city centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClaireR
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a great hotel in the centre of Toronto. It's a mssive property but has excellent facilities and friendly, helpful staff. The room we stayed in at the Richmond Tower was very nicely decorated and quite large in size too. The Eaton Centre is only a couple of minutes walk away and there are good public transport links too. You can walk to the harbour in no time at all, so its convenient for a day trip out to the islands or if taking a harbour cruise. The same is true for heading to the CN Tower. The Airport Express stops right outside the hotel and tickets can be bought from the tourist information desk in the lobby. My only negative would be that there was an air vent in the bedroom which we seemed to have no control over and when it came on the noise was very loud and it created quite a draft on the second bed. Closing the vent only seemed to create a whistling sound so we were better off leaving it alone. Apart from that we had a lovely stay and I'd definetly recommend the hotel or return again myself in the future

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: Paldrevl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel due to a convention. large rooms with a good view of Toronto. hotel pool is also good. breakfast is good but quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased with our 2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: syh75287
Reviews.Content: We flew in to Buffalo to see Niagara Falls (Canadian side) in late August but drove to Toronto first to stay the weekend. No big events in the city. We got a great deal on priceline ($77/nt). There is a public parking garage across the street, and it cost us 26 CAD for 2 days (cheaper than the hotel). Did not drive until we left Toronto. We walked everywhere easily: CN Tower, chinatown, kensington market...The underground parking connects thru to the hotel (look for the hotel name in orange or red paint at the top of the wall by the glass doors. Then take the escalators up to the huge lobby area. There's free Wifi and tons of chairs and seating areas. I especially liked the chairs facing the glass with the pretty nature scene (tiny waterfall?) We checked-in early evening, and there was no wait. We got a room w/ 2 double beds in the Richmond Tower. The room was nice, and we had a nice view of the city. You can open the window (slight opening). The bathroom was nice as well, the only negative being the weak toilet flush. Recommend the restaurant: Mengrai Thai. I think it was ranked #1 on yelp. The pad thai was delicious. We also ordered from the prix fixe menu. We got there 8pm, and they were able to seat us without a reservation. Maybe due to the other towers I've been to (Paris, Seattle, Sydney), I'm no longer interested in them, but CN Tower was not that great. Didn't help that the outdoor observation level was closed due to the winds. The glass floor is neat but crowded. All in all, the hotel is in a great location. There's shops in there, a large sports bar (did not go). My friend, who used the fitness center, said it was very nice. The equipment was pretty new. She also said the pool area was nice, too (one of those indoor & outdoor pools).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: illian420
Reviews.Content: We had a one night trip to Niagara during our Sheraton stay which gave us the chance to experience two different rooms here. Both were very clean and had a great view. Both rooms had a view of the Old and New City Halls. There is also a nice waterfall to see when passing the lobby. The beds are very comfortable, but I personally disliked the overly squishy pillows. Even doubling the pillows wasn't enough firmness for my preference. I didn't sleep well because of this. The mattress was comfortable though. So if you like a more firm pillow bring your own. The breakfast on the second level is expensive, but the food was delicious. I really liked Traders which is right by the entrance of the hotel. If you want to enjoy wi-fi it's the most relaxing place especially in the corner with the double sofa and a large table with a drink and snacks or meal to enjoy. Traders was kind of quiet the few times I went in. I really think it's silly you have to be downstairs in the open lobby to get free wi-fi. There is a charge for wi-fi in-room, but if you're connected to it in your room and didn't buy wi-fi, you can view a website for free which will give you some basic information for attractions, restaurants, etc in the area. Otherwise the wifi in the lobby works great. Everyone seemed huddled in a little area in the lobby for the wifi, but you can get it in the restaurants in the hotel and in the often vacant sitting area on the second level. The hotel's in a nice location across the street from the City Halls and a short walk to the Eaton Centre and Dundas Square. I would definitely stay here again, but with my own pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,”
Reviews.Author: RayUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: Very good location, central downtown so very close to everything. Very busy but service still good Don't expect to have quiet coffee in lounge.

Reviews.Title: “It feels like home.”
Reviews.Author: Paulette748
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at the Sheraton every quarter. We enjoy the Club level room, and club lounge very much. The service is great and the servers now expect us. They always come over to say hello and ask how we are. We feel very welcomed. Also, the pool is lovely. It is an indoor/outdoor rooftop pool with large hot tub nearby. The hotel is close to The Keg and an Italian eatery. The Traders restaurant downstairs serves good food and has a comfortable atmosphere. The nicest part is that the hotel exits on The Path. You can enjoy shopping underground and make your way to the Eaton Centre easily. We are loyal customers and recommend trying the Sheraton!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, right in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: Rencat22
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel, fab location opposite City hall and in walking distance of shops and CN tower and Rogers Stadium, theatres and restaurants and cafes. Very clean room, nicely furnished, comfortable, very polite staff too. Definitely no bed bugs!! An allround winner for a short stay when you have a lot to see and do. We recommend taking a ferry to the Toronto islands too. Well done Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Best. Possible. Location.”
Reviews.Author: CareerEnder
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is so perfect for many reasons. Overall, not the crazy nicest hotel but holds the Sheraton name nicely. I was a big fan of the "Link" program where everyone has WIFI and access to the internet and printers with ease. The hotel resto/bar is average at best. You're just steps away from better/expensive/cheap/casual/greasy/amazing eats. Outstanding pool deck if you're there in the summer. OK workout facility. On the downside, it was SO busy there. Took a while to check in and if you needed anything from front desk after that (my key de-magnitised) you had to wait. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely book again”
Reviews.Author: c33jay77
Reviews.Content: We had to wait a while to check into the hotel but was amazed the hotel was so big. There was loads of facilities in the hotel. It is a shame WiFi was only available in the hotel lobby, not ideal if you have only got an iPod or phone to use. The room was spacious and airy. We had 2 double beds, I am not sure that they realised that we were a couple. 2 females travelling together obviously need 2 beds even though we booked a double room. Rather annoyed at the hotels assumption. The only issue that we had was on the first morning we wanted to go to the Bistro on Two for breakfast as it was a reasonable price, roughly $12 for a full cooked breakfast. We got down there and there was a notice to say that it was closed, some sort of function. I feel that there should have been a note in the room to tell us this. We had to go to the Bar in reception where breakfast was being served. We ended up paying $17 for a continental breakfast consisting of a few pastries, some cereal and a couple other bits. Or we could have had a cooked breakfast for $22, I feel quite ripped off about this especially as we had to wait 15 minutes for juice and coffee. I wrote 2 comment cards saying exactly this and no one has mentioned this to me. On check out I didn't even get a bill for the breakfast and I find that I have been charged for them. I feel this is very bad customer service. If one restaurant was closed then the same food should have been on offer in other places not double the price. Apart from the breakfast issue, I would go back to the hotel as the facilities and where is was situated was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Car trashed in hotel directed parking lot and tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: Steve F
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday night to be told that valet parking was not available and told to park across street at City Hall. Within 3 hours of being parked the car (along with several other Sheraton guests' cars) was broken into and the interior trashed. At least we got lucky, one of the other guys had blood over his car and the guy that broke in was HepC positive! The TO cops were faultless in dealing with our angst (they indicated that City Hall parking lot is notorious for break ins - so why does the Sheraton direct guest there?). Sheraton staff were far less concerned about TOs image than the cops. All we got from them was a "Oh".! Other note. Valet parking is $35 on Friday and Saturday only (dont believe what they tell you at check-in, their forms are pretty clear on the distinction) Sunday onwards is $45. We could only get into valet parking on Sunday!. Finally, we got put in the Richmond Tower. This is inconvenient if you want to use the pool etc since you have to schlep across public areas (dripping) to get back to your room and when we stayed seem to be full with college-aged kids who had only just discovered alcohol. The room hadnt been totally cleaned of "party string" even by the time we checked out (3 days later). Don't take the breakfast included option. Its overpriced and the Starlight Grill is just outside the hotel and does excellent bfast cheaper. Overall: I have stayed at the Sheraton Center TO for the past 5 years without complaint, but felt during the last visit that the hotel and service are tired - they both could do with a refresh (or kick in the pants). Although I am a supposedly Starwoods Preferred Guest (i.e. The frequent flyer of hotels), I wont stay at this hotel again. Its time to give the other TO hotels a chance. The Sheraton blows in my (biased) opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: DamaskDuke
Reviews.Content: This hotel wa in a great location smack bang in the middle of the key areas. We were pleasantly surprised by a room upgrade, a free movie and free breakfast and free evening Hors d'oeuvres thrown in by the excellent concierge Tammy on the front desk. Great top floor bar with a terrific view of the city and CN tower and good downstairs bar and decent sized well-equipped swimming. and great looking gym if that's your thing. All for excellent value for money in the hight of summer. Highly reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but zero customer service”
Reviews.Author: NewfieTraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked my daughter in to this hotel for a conference she was attending. She doesn't have a credit card, so the hotel placed a hold on $200 to cover any incidentals. The money was actually DEDUCTED, not just held, and after almost a month -- and many telephone calls -- the money has still not been refunded. Impossible to speak to anyone, and they NEVER return phone calls. I stay in hotels regularly, but not usually this chain, but it was convenient for the conference; however after this experience I doubt whether i would book with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Convient location”
Reviews.Author: Pat A
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times for business - good location, clean, staff mostly friendly. Additional charge for internet service which is almost unheard off at other big chains. Pricing of rooms is okay as long as there is nothing else big happening in town if there is they increase the price almost double.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: herb02072
Reviews.Content: we spent 5 days there aug 22-aug 27th. location was great and within walking distance of major attractions. subway one block away. hotel staff very courteous and helpful. room was clean a nd comfortable. definetly the place to stay in downtown toronto.

Reviews.Title: “great views, service ok but could do better”
Reviews.Author: single-dad-glos
Reviews.Content: Room on 24th floor great views of the city and location very good. my son liked the hotel more than me. no internet in the room unless you pay $17 a day, despite booking based on free wi-fi, but only in the lobby 24 floors below us! breakfast good value on the buffet and some staff very good would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central/Very Accomodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: swicks77
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre has a great location. The main point I wanted to convey in this review is that we had a great experience with all the staff that we encountered at the hotel. From the front desk to the two security guards who helped us find a room to have a good time with our wedding reception guests late into the evening. Special thanks to Dino Sepe and Matthew Smith. A great experience overall and would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Toronto and in search of a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, crummy restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: Tan P
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent for doing anything downtown Toronto. Everything is within walking distance. The hotel itself was beautiful, rooms were clean, staff were polite and helpful. The only negative aspect of the hotel was the Bistro on 2. It is very over priced, and the food is terrible. My husband and I ordered Eggs Benedict ($19) Coffee ($5), and received a plate of expensive disappointment. They place the dish in a broiler to re-heat the hollandiase sauce, which overheated, broke, and burnt the sauce. Essentially we were served poached eggs with a burnt scrambled egg puree on top. It was disgusting. If you stay here, I strongly recommend using BlogTO.com to find restaurants outside of the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently location for a hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: tokyoskater
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ the Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel for four nights. The staff were nice and very professional. I stayed on the 25th floor in the Queen Tower facing the CN Tower. I was able to request for a fridge @ no extra cost due to my AAA membership. They had and decent gym with an outdoor pool that was always seemed buys even @ 10 PM at night. If you want free internet, The Sheraton Centre has computers in the lobby (about 8). Just be ready to wait if its busy. I do think that the Sheraton could lower their daily rates for in-room wi-fi. Their coin laundry is located on the 2nd floor @ the end of the hallway with two washers and two dryers ($3.00 CAN for each). I am glad they had that, but it should have its own room, please!! If you are coming by car, park across the street @ Nathan Phillips Square for $20 CAN per night. The parking lot connect directly to the hotel through the PATH underground passageway. This same passageway connects you also to Eaton Centre and Union Station. The hotel was such and convenient location for our trip to Toronto. Not far from the streetcar, bus and subway lines. And the Eaton Centre was also close by. The CN tower is also walkable from there. I loved my stay and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Center of Downtown Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: tomchinappi
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Sheraton Center in downtown Toronto on Friday August 19 and checked out Monday August 22. What can I say? Everything was perfect! We were a short walk away from everything in the downtown core. We walked on Bay Street in the financial district, Yonge Street and the Eaton Center for shopping, were entertained at Dundas Square (Toronto's version of a mini-me Times Square). Visited the Hockey Hall of Fame.....the original Stanley Cup was overwhelming. The hotel service was outstanding. The room was impeccable,the lobby bustling, the free internet in the lobby worked wonderfully. The Traders Bar & Restaurant was great. i worked out at the fitness center (fullly equipped) and watched people swim in the indoor/outdoor pool. I can't think of anything negative to say! A few tips about staying at this hotel: We had breakfast at Tim Hortons' every morning. You walk through the lobby and you are practically at the front door of the Timmy's . $6.00 gets you coffee and cream cheese bagels for three! You can park in the underground public parking across the street on Queen st. Parking for the whole weekend cost us $50.00 as opposed to taking the valet parking that would have cost $45.00 per night. Also you can go directly to the underground parking directly from the Hotel Concourse level. There is an underground city (P.A.T.H.) where if it is raining, you can go to the Eaton Center and countless other landmarks. When booking, call and see their promotion specials. They are really good at finding you the special of the week. I have stayed at this hotel 3 times before and it just keeps on getting better and better. Any future trip to Toronto for me will include the Sheraton Center on 123 Queen St West!

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed.”
Reviews.Author: vulpecula
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location, which is great. Our room was clean, and the beds were nice. Otherwise, I don't have too many positive things to say. This hotel is not very ideal for people with a car. The valet service is outrageously priced (use the public lot across the street, under City Hall). There isn't a good place to pull up your car and hop out and check in - it's all in a tight, chaotic space filled with taxis and the valets. I can understand because the hotel is downtown and space is limited, however, the entrance area is not pleasant. I cannot believe that in this day and age, and at this cost, that the hotel does not offer free internet in the rooms - even inexpensive chain motels offer this. There was an internet menu card in the room with three levels of availability, starting at about $8/day. And while it isn't standard elsewhere, it would have been nice had there been room left in the minibar fridge for us to put our own drinks, since we were there for a week and certainly wasn't going to touch the $5 cans of pop that were in there. There are 43 floors in the hotel. If you have an issue with heights, be sure to request a lower room when booking. Because there are many floors, there are two banks of elevators - one for the first 25 or so floors, and the second for the upper floors. The banks of elevators were not well marked and we saw many people get very confused and irritated. The elevators were, however, quite fast and the trip to the top never took long. We were also surprised at how noisy the hotel was. It was very busy while we were there, and we could hear other people from in our room. There were a couple of loud parties going on in nearby rooms, some of which were visited by security. On our check-out day, our hotel bill was mixed up and incorrect and so we could not use the express check-out option because we had to go to the front desk and have our bill fixed. In the end, I believe the Sheraton to be just average. A great location, nice fancy lobby and comfortable beds - but that's all it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Lively hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Ourcomments2010
Reviews.Content: Good location on Queen Street & York. So close to the Eaton Centre Mall, The Bay Store, and restaurants on Yonge Street. All within walk distance. We walked to the Harbourfront, downtown airport (Porter Airlines), Cdn National Exhibition. Breakfast buffet is a bit pricey @ $27 before tax and gratuity. Other than that, its nice hotel in a great location. We used Hotwire and got the room for $89/ night

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location!”
Reviews.Author: peachrayz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto last Friday night with my boyfriend. We wanted a 4-star hotel, with a great location and a low price. The Sheraton offered all that. It's located right across the street from city hall (where there are always weekend festivals and music), a block from the Eaton Centre and on the same street as a lot of great shopping (Queen Street). It's also relatively close to the entertainment district (under a $10 cab ride, or walkable). The hotel itself offers free computer and wifi access in the lobby. The rooms are average - I would honestly expect a little more out of a 4-star hotel room. They're clean and spacious - just nothing memorable. As an added tip, there is a public underground parking ramp right across the street in front of city hall. It is much cheaper than the valet the hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But Poor Maid Service and Management”
Reviews.Author: LvsQlts
Reviews.Content: Cons: We had to repeatedly ask for soap, towels, and even toilet paper. At these prices, we expected better service than some road side motel would have provided. Actually, during our travels, we stayed at hotels that were half the price, were immaculately clean, and included complimentary full breakfasts and free, in-room wi-fi. Sheraton could learn a lot from such places. When my husband complained, the maid brought fresh towels, but then mixed them up with the dirty ones--for our family of four sharing the room. We again had to complain. Then that night, the management intentionally booked a large group of under-aged and rowdy teens, who were having a drinking party, in the room next to ours. They were banging into the walls late at night and it sounded like they were breaking the furniture. The management tried to ignore our request that they do something about the noise, until my husband threatened to report them to the police for allowing underage drinking. They then took care of the problem. They did credit our bill for one night of our stay. Needless to say, we will never stay in this hotel again. The concierge talked us into expensive tickets for a bus that made various stops in the city during the day. We later discovered that it is much less expensive and more convenient to simply buy a city Day Pass, which allows you to ride all public transportation--buses, trains, and subways--and hop on and off as needed. I realize that concierge is given commissions for selling things, but as guests of the hotel, they should present options. We felt that as visitors and guests, that they took advantage of us. Do NOT park in the hotel parking lot. It is outrageously expensive compared to the public parking nearby. Once again, guests are gouged. There is no free wi-fi in rooms. Even the cheapest hotels now offer free in room wi-fi. But not the Sheraton. If you want to surf, you will have to go down to the lobby and wait to use one of four computers. Pros: This hotel was centrally located to area attractions and near the subway, which allowed access to attractions further away. Our room had a fantastic view of the CN Tower, which had a nightly light show on the hour. The lobby area and various gardens and waterfalls were beautiful and relaxing. It was near Eaton Center Mall, which had a couple of nice restaurants. There are nearby banks where you can exchange currency for less than at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really good and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Niall
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights and it was a great start to a Canadian holiday. Across the road from the City Hall and Nathan Phillips Sq. Super room with kingsize bed, which was really comfortable. Plenty of pillows, towels and toiletries. Lifts super and fast, plenty of them too. Checkin was really late and the front desk were nothing but accommodating and really pleasant to two tired travellers. Location 3 min walk to all the shops you want in the Eaton Centre and plenty of restaurants close by in any direction you want to go. Restaurants and shops on ground floor also. All the sights you want to see are within 15 mins walk in any direction from the hotel. Would stay here again no worries.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home to us!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here at least eight times over the past four years. The location is wonderful, and the hotel is spacious and clean. Try to get upgraded to a Club Room if possible. You can then take advantage of the light breakfast buffet and evening hors d'oeuvres, which, during our last stay, were different and quite delicious! We have found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. We are already looking forward to our next stay. The only fault I can think of is the fact that the bathrooms do not have fans in them. The mirrors steam up rather quickly, and this can be annoying at times. But, other than that, I would recommend this Hotel for all the other amenities it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and will be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: kaylixoxo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 1942, this room was spotless. Our housekeeper was wonderful, and did a fantastic job. I couldn't beleive how IMMACULATELY clean this room was. I wish I had got her name, so I could write a letter to the appropriate person. I checked for bed bugs, the room was clean with no sign of them. I've been trained to look for them and I was very impressed. Our sink was slow draining we noticed, but we went out for the evening and it was quickly fixed for when we came back. The asian lady at the front was wonderful also, she was very helpful and friendly ! Bell boy was great, brought our stuff up to the room and unloaded it very carefully. Great stay, 9.5 / 10 overall. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: PaulandNadene
Reviews.Content: I'll never stay at this hotel again. As a question of physcal safety and security, do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PCTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a 2 day business trip. Great location - close to everything. very comfortable beds and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “business hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: redcar2606
Reviews.Content: This is the biggest hotel I have ever been in. It is in a great location, close to a big shopping mall, and the internal courtyard is lovely. The pool and fitness centre are nice, and there was no fee for hotel guests. Costs of breakfast, room service and internet are outrageous, but there are cafes and restaurants just outside the hotel. The rooms are decorated in various shades of brown (arghh). Ask for north facing rooms, they have a much nicer view. This is a convenient business hotel, but not something for a romantic weekend. There are nicer boutique hotels close by, and they are cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference facilities but price gouging to the extreme”
Reviews.Author: AlizaFromOttawa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June, 2010, while attending a conference. First the positives: very good conference facilities, lots of rooms including the largest ballroom I've ever seen. Also loved the big lobby, with plenty of seating, the beautiful garden, and the convenient location. Now the negatives: this hotel nickel and dimes you to death. The internet fee is outrageous-- $15/day means two days equals what I paid at the time for fast high speed at home for a month! Then they charge you for the gym (thankfully, it turned out that my own gym had a branch nearby) and the restaurants and cafes were equally overpriced ($7 coffees). Not surprisingly, their box lunches (I organized a meeting) were also outrageously expensive ($25 for a sandwich and apple). Luckily, there were cheaper options nearby-- although they didn't provide me with a fridge in my room without another charge. The only place they didn't gouge was the cost of printing in the business centre (and those staff were pleasant, too). I've stayed at many equivalent hotels, in cities literally around the world, and have never seen such gouging. Lastly, the lineups at the reception were LONG-- you have to plan for a minimum 30 minute wait to check in, check out, etc. Huge facility and only three or four people to serve guests. PS the room was a bit small, but pretty standard big-chain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Cath073
Reviews.Content: I stayed here again for an annual meeting (3rd year in a row). The location can't be beat - close to lots of shopping, dining and easy to access using public transit. The hotel staff was extremely friendly, from the check-in staff to caretaking. The room was great - a nice comfy bed with a terrific view onto Osgoode Hall and Nathan Phillips Square. We were on the 16th floor, so there was no street noise. The only drawback was that our washroom door was difficult to close as the new (my guess is a low-flow) toilet jutted out too far and so the door would always scrape against the toilet. Other than this, everything was fine!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dms1878
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on hotwire, which sometimes means you get a bad room but not here - nice room, nice view. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION SUPER PRICE”
Reviews.Author: jptreacy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 5 different toronto hotels in the past 2 years and this was a Great deal via Hotwire @ $85 USD per night ($112/pn with taxes). Upon arrival there was a long line which moved quickly. Jonathon Wang checked me in and could not have been nicer! As an SPG member (free to join... so do it!) I was upgraded to a Club Room #3911, very comfortable bed and access to the Club Lounge which served a nice continental breakfast daily as well as evening appetizers! WITH AN AMAZING VIEW OF TORONTO from the 43rd Floor! Location is spectacular! You can walk to Eaton Center without going outside, via "The Path" underground tunnel/mall. 10 minute walk to University of Toronto! 15 minute walk to the waterfront! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a traditionnal one”
Reviews.Author: Emmmi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week end in august 2011. We had a nice stay since the hotel was clean, beautiful and very elegant. The bedroom & bed were very clean and comfortable and the view from the bedroom was wonderful ! However, we found it quite disappointing that there was no free wi-fi nor cable internet in the bedrooms. Wi-fi was available (but not working well) downstairs, they also provide computers for you to use in the lobby. We were also charged 2,50$ for ONE local call... Not that it makes that much of a difference in our budget, just that for the price you pay to stay there, they should provide a free landline and free wi-fi!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated/Overpriced/Bad Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: kmac2400
Reviews.Content: Poor signage for parking started experience. Fortunately, it resulted in me parking in underground lot for City Hall across the street from the hotel saving more than $20/day in parking fees. Parking garage has access tunnel directly into the hotel. Check in line was slow and very long. Staff cool and seemed bored. Room standard hotel fare - nothing special - actually smaller than I expected for a North American hotel. Tub/shower would not drain properly and numerous attempts to get the hotel to correct it failed. Finally took drain apart ourselves and found it clogged with ~ 10 inches of hair - makes you wonder how housekeeping cleaned the tub when it would not drain properly for 3 of 4 days of our stay? If the tub is not getting cleaned, what else is not getting cleaned? Each day was something new when we returned to our room - no towels, partial towels, same dirty towels, no soap, etc. - resulting in numerous calls for routine supplies. Final night, hotel moved a bachelor party into the room next door, loud music, banging on wall, etc. After complaining in person at the front desk, the hotel finally made them quiet down. Great location for visiting the city but I would never stay here again - I would consider the Hilton which is a block away before I would come back to the Sheraton. Overall, I have stayed at cheaper hotels and had a much better experience. Not your typical Sheraton experience - very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm, not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: v m
Reviews.Content: This is not a place for couples, I believe. It seems to be a place targeted for business travellers. You didn't get much for what you were paying for, and you needed to pay to get more than what an average hotel would normally include in the price (internet, for example, was 15$ per day....). That and we didn't have a mini bar in our room regardless of the fact that we upgraded. Finally we paid 250 per night, to get nothing more than what you'd get out of a three star hotel, in fact, we got less. The room was nice, but it seemed to be targeted to someone travelling because the desk was quite large and there was a large dresser. It was just an average place to be..... Oh and the breakfast buffet was 27 dollars per person and it didn't look incredibly special.... again, a place for business travellers and not couples... unless you want to purposely spend more money for no good reason......

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jlm1178
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 2424 and my parents stayed in room 2935. Our room was very outdated with stains on the carpet and the room smelled terrible. My parents room was also outdated but at least it did not smell. I brought the smell in our room to the front desk's attention, but was informed that the room had just been cleaned and there was nothing they could do. The smell was so bad I actually had a purchase air freshener during our stay. (Not a highlight of our trip :0) The wallpaper was peeling on the walls and the paint was chipping. The hallway was extremely hot! My parents and my family had requested that our rooms be positioned next to each other or at least on the same floor. We were told this would not be a problem. However, upon check in, we were told they only had clean rooms available on two different floors that required the use of separate elevators. This made things difficult for our children. The pool was nice and our kids did enjoy swimming. The buffet breakfast was okay but nothing to brag about and the price was a bit steep for the quality of the food. The location was great but I think you could stay someplace much better for the price. Overall, I was very disappointed with the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose”
Reviews.Author: SurreyHoliday1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Centre from 7th August until 9th August for business in the local area. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful especially when I had to book another night at very short notice, after already having checked out. I stayed on the 34th floor and had an amazing view of the CN Tower. The room was large enough and clean. The bed was amazing, the pillows were so comfortable and the bed was not rock hard, like you get sometimes in city hotels. The room however was basic but enough for a short stay. Hairdryer and coffee facilities in room along with a safe. There is a swimming pool which appeared to be busy but I did not use. Breakfast is not included so I would suggest walking around the corner to either Starbucks or Tim Hortons which is the Canadian equivalent. Tim Hortons very reasonable, huge selection of coffee's, muffins and bagels for breakfast/lunch. There are some very nice restaurants nearby and some cheep and cheerful ones. My colleague and I booked a meal in the CN Tower restaurant, unfortunately I was very ill before hand and spent most of the evening in the toilets ( which are lovely and clean) I did get to see the food and my colleague who managed to eat a 3 course meal stated the food was amazing!! T he staff were very friendly and were concerned about me and did not charge for my food which although I ordered I could not eat. I know some restaurants would have still charged!! The view was amazing and I would definitely recommend. I had booked on line before hand which I would recommend via the CN Tower website, it saved you having to queue and you have your own lift to the restaurant, a little VIP service!! On a day off we took the Greyhound bus to Niagara Falls which is approx 2 hours away, well worth it!! The bus station is only a very short walk from the hotel and cost approx $30 return. The journey is boring, it is all motorway. The Niagara bus stop where you are dropped off is about a 20 minute walk from Niagara Falls but there are a few taxis hanging about. The walk is very nice, it is not sign posted so we asked someone who was waiting for the bus for directions to the falls, it is very straight forward. The Maide of the Mist cost $16. My stay was fairly short but I do not think I would stay at the Sheraton Centre again, I think I was just not impressed with Toronto. I was amazed at the amount of homeless people who was asking for money outside the coffee shops and sleeping even outside the Sheraton Centre!! The location however was great, very close to CN Tower and the City airport for internal flights. To sum up in one sentence, my stay was reasonable but I would not hurry back to the Sheraton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “ROOM WITH A BALCONY”
Reviews.Author: GEORGEDORLY
Reviews.Content: Great location. For something special try room on the fourth floor with a private balcony Great for an apperitif or a late night digestif.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly Serviced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thevacationlovers
Reviews.Content: We had bought 2 Travelzoo Local Deal vouchers, one for each of two couples, for Breakfast for Two at the Bistro on Two at the Sheraton Centre Toronto. We called the restaurant weeks in advance to secure the reservation including giving the Travelzoo Voucher Codes (proof of purchase) and when we got to the restaurant on August 20, there was no evidence of our booking. When it came time to settle the bill (the meals had been prepaid), the waiter wasn't satisfied that only one of us had brought the vouchers, and before we knew it, the Manager stood beside our table essentially making a big scene and asking us to prove our online purchase. The manager paraded me through the kitchen, and I had to produce her 'proof' at her office computer. She then said good-bye to me and expected me to find my own way out of the hallway and kitchen maze. Meanwhile, our friends along with my husband, still at the table, were humiliated and embarrassed and we were all left wondering about the shoddy, poorly managed scenario. Travelzoo Local Deal users BEWARE of what you are getting into at this hotel restaurant. Additionally I would like to comment that the restaurant was dirty and dingy. For the price, you could do much better at most downtown restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “so much nicer than we thought it would be, will be back”
Reviews.Author: SNOWYOntarioCanada
Reviews.Content: receptionist at check in was very pleasant,hotel room so clean and comfortable I think it must have recently been through some renovations.The quality of the bedding was immaculate.Nice lounge very enjoyable,we were very relaxed and ready for our flight the next morning We would not hesitate to stay at the airport Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Toronto hotel”
Reviews.Author: darrennelson
Reviews.Content: I stay here quite often on business as it is a preferred hotel for my company. I definitely prefer to stay at the King Edward whenever possible over this Starwood hotel. The Sheraton is a very big hotel, and service is quite average. All the rooms are pretty much the same (standard, generic hotel room) that are getting a little worn and dated. As a platinum SPG member, I have never received any upgrades (mainly because the hotel always seems quite busy ...). The lobby has a nice computer area, coffee shop and pub. I have regularly had breakfast at the bistro on level 2. Good buffet; though I do not know if I would pay the regular rate for the buffet given I am not a big breakfast person. The club lounge is an average Starwood lounge; great when it is free but would not recommend paying for the use. Overall, it is an OK hotel in a very good location (lots to do, good restaurants close, subway close) though I personnally prefer other hotels in the area unless we are having meetings at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: PsychMike71
Reviews.Content: Family of four loved this place. Everyone was very nice and helpful. Location was good, within walking distance of major attractions and good restaurants. Booked online and got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnieL79
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, great pool and good food, Central location

Reviews.Title: “great deal, great service”
Reviews.Author: mjhoc
Reviews.Content: Hey I don't know why people had issues with using hotwire here. I got a great deal, $108 a night for a king size bed room. I also had enough points to upgrade to a club level floor (which i highly recommend) The club lounge services a great breakfast and evening snacks! I had great service at the front desk with a girl named Tammy. The location is great, the eaton's centre is a short walk away underground. There is also a food court that has a lot of cheap meals. This is my favourite hotel in downtown TO and I have stayed at a lot. The only complaint I have is my room had a squeaky mattress but this is only a minor annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: 1BigDaddy1
Reviews.Content: Great pool and large fitness center. Kids activities in the huge lobby. Location is perfect, easy to get anywhere. There is a subway station 1 block away, or can use the underground PATH which is directly below the hotel. The PATH is 17 miles of underground corridors with food and shopping, which is great to duck into if it begins to rain! The Eaton Center is 2 blocks away. Cannot go wrong with this hotel in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TeignmouthRed
Reviews.Content: Having visited the Sheraton a couple of years ago on a family holiday and recieved superb service, I was keen to see if standards had been maintained. No need to worry onthat count - the Sheraton is still clean, well-run and good value. The staff are excellent - in particular, I'd pay tribute to Mark from the Security team who was incredibly helpful and went out of his way to assist us. My family and I travelled between Montreal, Ottawa, Kingston and Toronto and stayed in 6 different hotels and the Sheraton was our favourite. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: rmvacation
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel and it was the perfect choice for many reasons. The hotel was very nice, well decorated, clean, the staff courteous and helpful and valet service was great. The proximity to the theatres, quirky shops on Queen Street and the Eaton's Center were a delight. A short 15 minute stroll finds you at the St Laurence Market and another 10 minutes you can enjoy the Distillery District. The area provides an eclectic mix of eateries from the fantastic Crepe restaurant to some very nice Indian restaurants. Hard to go wrong on this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, but "green" means red”
Reviews.Author: HotRod_88
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location. It's located within a a mile and a half of all the major inner city sites and it's even connected underground via the PATH to Eaton Center. There all all kinds of restaurants nearby that you do not have to rely on those within the hotel. There's a huge pool, large exercise room, and coffee shop/wifi station on the premises. The staff was very friendly and respectful. Unfortunately, there were three major issues we encountered. (1) This hotel tries to be a "green" along with the rest of the city. At most hotels that I've visited, going "green" means that you still get maid service, but you reuse your towels. Here, opting for "green" means that the maids DO NOT ENTER your room, even to make the bed, tidy the room, or empty the garbage. It's a problem if you get take-out food and eat in your room or you stay longer than a day or two. We even tried to leave our overflowing garbage can outside our room, but the maid did not empty it. Think twice before going green. It's seems more of an economic move to save on maid service than an environment concern. Next, there is NO CONCIERGE who can assist you with travel plans or make recommendations. There is a "tour and trip information" desk. But they are paid by outside vendors to promote specific vendors. When we tried to select a tour to Niagara Falls, they push the most expensive tour, over $150 per person, that included a meal we didn't need. When we asked about other options, including some in the tour books, they refused to comment. (BTW - we booked a great tour in a mini-bus for $60.) If you have questions, you're better off asking the bellmen. This would not be a problem if you are there for business, had unlimited funds, or don't care to sightsee. The final issue is that being a SPG Gold member means nothing here. No acknowledgment, no upgrades, no nothing. Not a big deal unless you're used to being treated very well at other Starwood properties.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay still a charm”
Reviews.Author: nickannetteandem
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for five nights in July 2011 at this well located Sheraton and loved it once again. As many have noted, this is a large hotel but we never felt like a number. Considering it was hosting a very large convention of Bridge Players (never have I heard so many people so engrossed in discussions around trump, clubs etc as these people were...neat to see how passionate people do get about a game). As a platinum SPG member we were given an upgraded suite and provided access to the club lounge. As this trip was the celebration of a significant birthday for myself the suite was a nice touch. Special mention has to be made to Lily at the front desk...she was wonderful (even wished me a happy birthday on check in). She also arranged to have a bottle of sparkling wine brought up with two flutes for a celebratory toast. This was an unexpected surprise that I found touching. The temperature in Toronto hovered in the upper 40's centigrade with the humidex for most of our stay but the hotel air conditioning did not fail us and the room was cool after being out in the heat. The room was kept clean and the cleaning staff were friendly and seemed to get the room done prior to noon each day. The club lounge was being renovated and we went to the temporary second floor space (I cannot wait for the new space upstairs to open) and while the space was small, the service and positive attitudes from the lounge staff made the time spent there a true pleasure. The selection of food was very good in the morning (yogurt, fruit, selection of cold and hot cereals, breads, pastries, coffee, tea and juice) and good in the evening (more snack type foods but well prepared). There is a great pool area and a fantastic fitness centre (you have to rely on my wife's words on that as I did not partake in the dubious pleasure of exercising while on holiday). The hotel is a two block walk to the Bay and the shopping centre (you can take the PATH system from the hotel and go to the Bay underground if the weather is uncooperative); the shops are pretty standard mall fare but the stores are a cool respite from a hot day. You can also find streetcars on Queen Street in front of the hotel (Queen Street West has a lot of shops, restaurants, boutiques etc) as well as having access to the subway one block west of the hotel. Check to see if the theatre next door has something running as we saw the Broadway play "Next to Normal" and it was superb (plus the short walk home was ideal). We would highly recommend a stay at the Sheraton Centre and look forward to our next trip to the friendly folks at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs room 1544”
Reviews.Author: merciere
Reviews.Content: Hi, My and my girlfriend came for a trip of three days to visit the city. We took a reservation trought Hotwire. Bad Idea, first, internet is supposed to be free in the deal with hotwire but no it was at 16$ per days. The Sheraton also have a parking yes, at 45$ per days.... But the worse thing is realy bed bugs.. The bed was infested, i've been bite during those days, and I know because i'm allergic... BAD IDEA... Never be in a Sheraton anymore...

Reviews.Title: “100% - excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: members2
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to Kensington Market, China Town, CN tower, sports, entertainment district, shopping (you can walk everywhere). Park in city underground lot across street -$20.00 for 24 hours. Staff were very helpful, room was clean, beds were comfortable, pool is beautiful -everything you need is in your room including a coffeemaker with Starbucks Coffee! Free use of 7 or eight computers and wi-fi in hotel lobby, there is a charge for use of internet in your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, the staff are great, the room has some issues”
Reviews.Author: Sean962
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a couple on a short holiday/city break for two nights, midweek. At check in there was a big queue, but it moved pleasantly quickly, no problems, staff were courteous and efficient. The lobby facilities are nice, varied, the internet kiosk service works well, lots of restaurant choices (one exception, more later) and nice view of the waterfall garden. Location in the middle of downtown Toronto is as good as it can be. The room was generally clean, but despite being a non-smoking property there was a cigarette burn in the arm of the chair and there was a lingering hint of smoke in the air, and also some stains in the carpeting. Bathroom was clean, everything worked, strong water pressure and plenty of hot water. TV a big LCD, remote in good order. Curtains closed easily and blacked out the room very well in midafternoon. Things that bugged us: was that the 2nd floor restaurant that usually offers breakfast was closed for renovation. Breakfast was offered at the lobby bar as an alternative, but only until 1030 instead of 1100 like at the restaurant - nobody warned us about this and there were no notes or messages, so we couldn't follow through on one breakfast plan, which was inconvenient. Also, the bed was very prone to wiggling and jiggling when anybody moved in it, meaning both people were moving whenever any one does. That was annoying and did lead to interrupted sleep. If you're alone, no big deal, but Ã  deux, it was a big detriment to enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: dsimon_11
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the three o'clock check-in time and was pleasantly surprised to find a very short line for such a large property. The check-in was quick and hassle free, though i did not receive the high floor I requested -- I was on floor eleven, which was disappointing, considering the hotel has forty-three floors. My room was very clean, and though it was a bit worn, the beds had very new linens and were very comfortable. There was no Wi-Fi in the room, and the Internet required a $31.58 charge for two days. My room also did not have the advertised safe, so I had to take alternative measures to secure my valuables. I got a very good deal on this hotel through Hotwire -- about $90 a night before taxes -- but i suspect booking through a third party may have been part of the reason I was treated as something of a second class guest. I travel to Toronto quite frequently. but being given a worn room, on a low floor, and without the advertised safe will make me quite hesitant to book directly with this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday with my son”
Reviews.Author: DaveSmith75
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at short notice for an unplanned break with my Son to Toronto through Canadian Affair. I've stayed in most of the major chains through work in the UK but never stayed in a Sheraton Hotel before but having read the reviews, I thought we'd give it a go. SERVICE: The staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. Nothing was a problem for them. On arrival in the room, I couldn't access the Safe and within minutes of speaking to reception, Security staff were there to reset it for me. I couldn't fault the service from any of the staff we spoke to. 10/10 ROOM: 2 nice big (very comfortable) double beds, standard bathroom and a coffee machine which was a nice touch. FOOD: I cannot comment on the hotel restaurants as we were out and about most of the time and wanted to sample the local cafes and restaurants. SWIMMING POOL: We did use the swimming pool a few times and it was very clean and although often busy, never overcrowded. Staff were very helpful down there as well. LOCATION: The hotel is opposite the New City Hall and 2 minutes walk to the Eaton Centre and all of the shops on Yonge Street as well as the Subway. It is also linked to the underground PATH network and it is possible to get to the area around the CN Tower / Union Station without going up to street level which is a godsend when it's either scorching hot or teeming down with rain. There are lots of little shops and food outlets etc within the basement of the Hotel and a handy 7/11 shop near the entrance on Queen Street. It is also very close to all of the office blocks in the area. I would recommend this hotel to anybody going to Toronto for Business or Pleasure. This is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. GETTING THERE: I pre booked the 'Airport Express' bus service for us thus saving a few quid and would thoroughly recommend it (under 12s travel free). It drops off and picks up at the Hotel and the drivers are very helpful. There was also WiFi on the bus which was an added bonus. I would advise giving yourself a good hour before airport check in as there was a lot of the traffic on the highway on our return journey

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay at Sheraton Centre”
Reviews.Author: AverageTraveller24
Reviews.Content: The staff at this huge hotel really made our stay enjoyable and relaxing. The downtown location is super. City Hall is across the street and serious shopping a block away. The check-in line-up was long but moved fast and our room was ready for us. We asked for and got a quiet room on the second floor facing Queen Street (Room 268). Our room backed onto the multi-storey Atrium and even had a patio. We used the escalator which was great and very convenient. Our requests for anything room related were promptly handled. It's valet parking only at $35 a day but really convenient otherwise use the city's underground parking garage at $28 per business day but cheaper on weekends. Use the Queen St. entrance next to the hotel then cross the street to the hotel. My wife and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Violent Neighbours Ruin Stay”
Reviews.Author: PilotsDaughter
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Sheraton to attend the North American Bridge Championships that was held at the hotel.
