On Friday night, the 29th, at 3 in the morning an altercation broke out between two rival groups using fowl language and eventually death threats right outside our door in the hallway. To report what was to be a noise complaint, I was on hold for Guest Services for over 10 minutes while the argument outside escalated and my children and I got increasingly fearful. One group eventually stormed off before security arrived (or I got through) with a promise to kill the other party (he didn't want to shoot the other person(s) in the hotel; he demanded the other guy(s) go outside so he could do it there). The departing group said it wasn't over. When I finally got through, the staff member asked what the problem was then 'if' he should send security; as if the outbreak had not been reported. I refused the offer to move my family (afraid for our safety and what we had heard, and if the others thought we could have seen something). I accepted the offer that security remain on the floor for the rest of the night. I stayed up because I was frightened and through the rest of the night, people came and went from the rooms in question, including at least one person from the rival side (so where was the promised on floor security?). Upon reporting the incident the next day to the front desk, I was placated and summarily dismissed because they didn't want incoming guests to overhear the events of the night before. Our violent neighbours benefitted from being at the Sheraton because if they had met the other rival party outside, on the street or at another venue, I'm certain there could have been a more violent outcome. Because of their benefit from the stay, they may return: We Will Not.

Reviews.Title: “correction please”
Reviews.Author: wearytraveller08
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel innumerable times , it is clean , convenient to work and I suppose play, its always crowded . I had an issue during my last stay , and when I filled out their survey they answered promptly and made a suitable adjustment , better than I expected

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have asked for!!”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: We booked a theatre package through Mirvish that included the hotel, dinner and theatre tickets. This hotel was exceptional. It was immaculate. The staff was very helpful and accomodating. Our room was beautifully appointed and the bed was very comfortable. In addition the location makes it easy to walk to theatres and shopping. A great place to stay if you want to explore on foot. With the help of the concierge we selected the Kit Kat Restaurant for dinner. Another wonderful experience. The staff was very attentive and friendly and the food was exceptional. The appetizer portion of mussels could have been for dinner and the chef prepared entrees were innovative and delicious. This is a Toronto star!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Hotel - One of the Best Sheratons Ever!”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum level Starwood Preferred Guest, I have stayed at dozens and dozens of Starwood properties, plus other luxury hotels and resorts. I was absolutely delighted with this hotel. From the early check in at 10:00 a.m., the friendly front desk, no lines anywhere (expect once at the free computers in the lobby), this 1,400 room, 43 story hotel is superb. My compliments to Starwood and the hotel's General Manager. The lobby, though busy, provides lots of space to sit and relax. There is a cafe, a bar, and a Starbucks. There is a very large table that was designed for people to use their laptops with Wi-Fi in the lobby. The bellmen were also especially helpful in providing directions and getting me a taxi. The location is right in the center of Toronto. Lots of restaurants, a 7-11, and shopping nearby, plus old and new City Hall. The 43rd floor Club Lounge is huge. Breakfast served as early as 6:30 a.m., and it was bountiful, plus free coffee maker for my cappucino or espresso was a nice touch. Views were excellent. The price was reasonable. Never waited for an elevator which all moved swiftly and smoothly. Everything was clean. The rooms were also typical Starwood, and seemed to have been recently renovated. Plush carpeting, great Sweet Sleeper beds, hot showers, large bedrooms, large flat screen TVs. This is a great place to stay, and I will again when next in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: nikita56
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto to see Donny and Marie (yep, they brought their Las Vegas show to Toronto for a couple of weeks) at the Four Seasons Centre for Performing Arts. I needed a hotel near the Performing Arts Centre and this was great! Within minutes walking to good shopping and restaurants, as well as the concert. The heat was excessive but manageable. Felt safe when out and about. The hotel itself was clean, modern and friendly, from the check-in lady to the housekeeper and the maintainence man. I flew in on Porter Air as I planned to be in the downtown area. Nice flight, roomy seating and the ferry was prompt and well organized. Hope this is helpful to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a Starbuck's in reception, good base for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: nectarine
Reviews.Content: Hotel was large with moving stairs to shops below and above to bistro and conference rooms. We stayed on the tenth floor, room was lovely but furniture a little old, it was clean, it had two double beds and bathroom had a shower. The entrance to the hotel is quite plush where doormen wait to help you, it was a very warm day and you could get yourself an ice cold water with a hint or orange to cool you down free of charge. We only stayed a couple of nights but it was a lovely hotel to come back to, my husband told me the alcoholic drinks where quite dear. I had a coffee from Starbuck's in the reception whilst looking out at the small garden with a little waterfall. Good base for downtown Toronto, you have to go to the CN tower, the view from the 360 revolving restaurant is great, book a table before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tinselcat
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable stay here for four nights. The hotel facilities are excellent and the room was large, clean and well-serviced throughout. There is free wifi in the lobby area as well as some computers to use. A limo-taxi from the airport cost $60. The hotel is very convenient for tourist and entertainment attractions, shopping and the subway and railway. As such, it is busy and there were lots of guests and traffic nearby as you should expect. On the 17th floor, we were not bothered by this at all. The only thing I would say is that our final night coincided with a large number of guests arriving for a festival over the weekend in Toronto. Some of these guests were noisy at night. This is clearly a popular choice of hotel ao if you are looking for peace and quiet, maybe this isn't the place for you. Check the events calendar for the local area! Quinns Steakhouse restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “a good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaeri
Reviews.Content: This is a huge hotel and pitches to the convention market. Having said that the rooms are clean, spacious and really tastefully decorated. Located downtown in Toronto you can't go wrong if you want a nice, central base. We ate dinner and breakfast at the restaurant. Dinner was so-so, breakfast was good. All the staff we encountered during our 2 night stay were very helpful and friendly. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Toronto Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: kevinbernardi
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here in the past, but the property has undergone a major renovation in all areas and it's now quite wonderful. Really accommodating front desk staff, complimentary computers in lobby, Starbucks in-room coffee maker. Excellent location for enjoying all of the tourist sights; walked to most sites. Airport Express bus from airport stops at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Canuck1973
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times and am always impressed how quiet the halls are even though it is a huge hotel. We were down with friends for a stagette during cabana long weekend...and even though the hotel was packed...the security made sure that guests that were not staying at the hotel did not come in during the later hours. I couldn't believe how quiet the halls were. Clean rooms and friendly service as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value"”
Reviews.Author: KWG1625
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a dinner/theatre package put together by Mirvish Theatre group and the hotel is a step above the larger chains. The giant covered canopy/entrance is great coverage for all types of weather conditions and the valet parking is efficient and computerized. Even though we were part of a discount package the clerk bumped us up to the club level which included access to the lounge. Not the best selection of food for breakfast but great views of the city and very relaxed. The outdoor pool area is great, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: PCBailey
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Sheraton Centre for one night while in town to see Craig Ferguson in Massey Hall. The location was good for our visit. Massey Hall was a quick ten minute walk away. I signed up for the Starwood Preferred Guest program and was able to by-pass the long check in line, even though I had booked this hotel through a third party for a discounted rate. We parked in the Green P (public) parking across the street. It cost me $21 (plus hst) to park there for one night. They gave us a king room on the 22nd floor (room 2237). We had a view of Nathan Philip Square. The room was clean and spacious. The elevators ran exceptionally well and we never had to wait long. This was different to our experience at the Hyatt Regency on King the month before. We enjoyed eating at Shopsyâ€™s Deli in the hotel. We also spent some time in Quinnâ€™s Irish Bar. We had outstanding food and service at both. We enjoyed the pool and outside patio. It had a relaxing atmosphere and was well maintained. We would definitely go back to this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Superb Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Angelina2008_9
Reviews.Content: Having recently had the pleasure of making a return visit to the Sheraton Centre, I felt the urge to share with readers how amazing this hotel really is. Staff couldnâ€™t be more helpful and the location couldnâ€™t be better! All amenities are on the doorstep, in the heart of the entertainment centre, with smart shops nearby, theatre and a restaurants choice, second to none. No matter what the weather, one is spoilt for choice, with a â€˜Pathâ€™ underground connecting to the Eaton Centre and subway. Bedrooms are spotlessly clean and, for the most part, soundproof, with amazing views. Restaurants in the Hotel are better than most with the â€˜Bistro for Twoâ€™ a favourite place for breakfast. Service is superb and the varied menu caters to everyone. This restaurant overlooks acres of waterfall gardens, which are spectacularly beautiful and relaxing. For dinner in the Hotel, guests have a choice of Traders Bar and Grill or Quinnâ€™s Steakhouse, which get rave reviews from many guests. When making a reservation, it may be worth considering a Club level room, which includes many extras, such as complimentary high speed internet access, continental breakfast served in the Club Lounge, Hors dâ€™oeuvres in the evening, with a spectacular view of the beautiful city of Toronto. Complimentary local calls, fitness centre access and refreshments at certain times throughout the day are also provided. Another convenience at the Sheraton Centre is the Airport Shuttle Bus service, which is frequent and reliable. Needless to say, no hotel would remain competitive if it was not for good staff and the Sheraton Centre management and staff are the best, in my opinion. Even while waiting in the lobby for airport transportation, we were offered chilled water on a warm afternoon; a thoughtful gesture that meant a lot! As a well travelled individual, (sometimes referred to as a â€œglobetrotterâ€� by my family!), in my view, the standard at this particular Sheraton far surpasses most other hotels; Management and Staff, at all levels, are professional and caring, even adjusting their own schedules to accommodate guest needs. Another plus for this Hotel is their environmental practices, where incentives are offered to guests to participate in green housekeeping. Check this out, you will be impressed! In closing, may I suggest if you are trying to impress someone special, whatever the occasion, donâ€™t procrastinate, we all deserve pampering now and then and nowhere better than the Sheraton Centre in beautiful Toronto. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: sonia-ottawa
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean. The pool was also very nice but could be cleaner. We enjoyed our 3 nights stay there with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: AnjaHelene
Reviews.Content: this hotel is big!! very big but with a very central location. in middle of it all and you can walk i think everywhere. room was very nice and clean and staff was helpfull with any questions. hotels located in the hotel was very expensive and not that much to choose from, menuwise. but there is a food court in the basement. bus from airport stops just by the hotel. we did not know that when we arrived, but it was very easy when we where going home. if you are 2 people traveling, make sure one of you buys the busticket. its cheaper:0)

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: thewisetraveler
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Sheraton Centre is it's location. Right across the street from City Hall, near Eaton Centre, and public transportation, the location can't be beat. The rooms, however, are in need of a little upgrade and refurbishing, to be considered four star. First off, I'd recommend you park your automobile across the street in the municipal underground parking garage. There is an entrance right off Queen Street West, between University and Bay. The price was significantly cheaper than the hotel's valet or parking garage and it has a pedestrian connection from the underground garage to the shopping area below the Sheraton lobby- very convenient. For as crowded as the hotel was, the check-in process was rather easy. The only hitch was our rooms were not ready. We arrived about an hour before the official check-in time, so this was nothing to get discouraged about. We just had to wait in line again a few hours later (of course the line was longer now) to actually get the room keys. We stayed on the 31st floor and upon entering my non-smoking room, I found the air quality to be very stagnant and smoky. The previous guest in my room was definitely smoking cigarettes in the room and bathroom. I half wanted to request a different room, but didn't want to have the replacement room located on a different floor than my family. (I also didn't want to have to wait in line in the lobby again.) Luckily the smoke smell dissipated after the first day and life went on. There was nothing else particularly wrong with the rooms- they were just a bit dated and in need of a refresh- especially the bathroom. It is an old building, and it definitely shows in certain areas. This is why I'd dispute the Sheraton's four star rating. Three stars- probably. But not four in my opinion. Probably the worst experience during our stay was breakfast in the hotel's "Bistro on Two" restaurant. Not only was it way over-priced, as expected, but the quality was no better than a free continental breakfast at a Holiday Inn Express. And the waiter, he was just plain rude. (Luckily, there's a Starbucks in the lobby with grab and go pastries.) Would I stay here again- possibly...but mainly because the location was very convenient and I used a discount website to get a significantly reduced rate. Just remember to park across the street and avoid the Bistro on Two.

Reviews.Title: “OK - big!!!”
Reviews.Author: PeterthePilot080
Reviews.Content: A huge hotel, with not enough staff causing lines and subsequent frustrations. No free internet in the rooms, however a wifi hot spot in the lobby plus six or so free internet monitors - which caused lines until the middle of the night. Ideal for a city centre requirement, but not appropriate if travel needs require daily egress from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: chloeisacat
Reviews.Content: Location - great, it is within walking distance to the Eaton Centre. Service - fantastic & friendly View - very nice downtown view, we had a north facing room. We had the SPG card (free to join) and were upgraded to the club level rooms which included free hor dourves, coffee, tea etc. and free breakfast too. Nice hotel to stay in for a night or 2, nothing extremely fancy or jaw dropping but definitely not disappointing at all. Nice rooms, and the SPG benefits were a bonus. I'd stay here again and would recommend to other travelers if it is within their budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - why charge for WiFi”
Reviews.Author: SkiNut101
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, room was pleasant...but I still can't understand why big business hotels charge $10-15/day for wifi, when the more economical brands can include wifi for free. Now that my rant is out of the way...the lobby was comfortable and I especially enjoyed the flavored water station near registration. I didn't care for the main lounge/restaurant (service was very slow), but the breakfast/lunch restaurant was wonderful. There was easy access to the underground tunnel network and public transportation. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the pool”
Reviews.Author: PhilHelmuth
Reviews.Content: I love the pool at this place. The hotel is great too, but ordering fruity drinks by the pool (which is half indoors and half outdoors) and sunning, while looking up at the tall buildings, is kind of trippy. I usually try and stay here in the fall as the water is heated and lets you push the season a little longer than normal.

Reviews.Title: “My third visit here”
Reviews.Author: Sixty00
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so big that it resembles a small city with lots of opportunities for people watching in the lobby. It links to Toronto's amazing underground shopping Path and is very centrally situated for everything including the huge Eaton Centre and all Toronto's attractions. The rooms are pretty standard - no fridge and valuables are better stored in a safe box at reception - but the beds are amazingly comfortable! There are a number of restaurants all of which are pretty expensive especially the Bistro that serves breakfast so it's probably better to try one of the fast food places. Web access is free though you might have to wait as there are often big conferences taking place with hundreds of delegates. That said, comfort, convenience and friendly staff probably outweigh any bad points and I felt very safe there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsses
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early July 2011 , I booked last minute on hotwire and got a room for 79$ for what this hotel turned out to be it was a steal, this was our only on scheduled stop on our honeymoon and turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip. This hotel os huge with something like 1377 room. The pool is on the third floor and is very neat half inside and Hal outdoors . It is in the downtown area so it is very busy bit conveniently is walking distance to eaton center for anyone who likes shopping. The only real complaint I have is parking is expensive and inconvient . We parked at a lot not to the hotel for 20 a night which is cheaper than the hotel however once you park you can't leave and come again unless you pay another 20. All in all a wonderful hotel great service and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - especially for business and/or conferences”
Reviews.Author: kmccolli
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a business conference. The room was large and comfortable, though I thought the hallways were quite dingy and dark. The lobby, waterfall garden, and access to "the Path" underground city were pluses. The BEST thing about this hotel is the club room on the top floor. If you are a priority rewards member you have access to the club room for a wonderful breakfast. The views are spectacular!! If you have a higher level of priority rewards membership, you can also go in the afternoons for hors d'oeuvres. A minor critique: I wish they had WiFi service in the rooms! I had to go to the Apple store (which was fortunately within walking distance) to get an ethernet adaptor for my laptop in order to access internet in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: BrownTan
Reviews.Content: This is proably the best located hotel in downtown Toronto, immediately next to Eaton Centre, Yonge St. shopping, and near many restaurants and bars in business/shopping district. Hotel is nice with all expected amenities. Was also priced well for what you get, especially in downtown Toronto. I recently attended for a conference, and the conference facilities and food were excellent. Have also stayed here previously for leisure, using the unique indoor/outdoor pool. This hotel may also attract many late night partiers on weekendsmaking noise coming back in after 2am.

Reviews.Title: “Better Service this time around.”
Reviews.Author: caledonia
Reviews.Content: Our most recent stay at the Sheraton Centre was December 2010. We noticed immediately at check in that the service had changed. We were pleasantly surprised (after serveral visits here) that we had been upgraded to a Club Floor at no charge. We also noticed service with a smile throughout the entire hotel. Although rooms are starting to look a little neglected the good service and great location is worth the stay. One small note the indoor/outdoor pool is really cold to swim in during the winter months. They say the pool is 80 degrees but with the open wall to the outdoors and the wind from the cool winter night, it was really hard to enjoy swimming in this pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful staff.... we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: millie2007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, the staff is helpful and polite, the attention to detail is present. The rooms are well laid out and sized. The beds are comfortable. The hotel has many non-smoking rooms, a fitness center and Starbucks on site. Nice restaurants and Valet parking complete the experience. The hotel is a little difficult to access by car. Valet parking is highly recommended. Otherwise public transit is close by and easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and a great location”
Reviews.Author: RoxxyGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in July using Starwood points (Gold level) and while I though the hotel was clean and ideally situated, it was utterly generic. BUT that can be ok depending on how much you pay. The Starwood Preferred Guest rooms are on the 34th floor. Our room was large, updated and the beds comfy. The hotel was obscenely packed throughout the stay- tour groups, weddings, conferences, people, people and oh my god, more people. The check in line was LONG LONG LONG but I breezed through the SPG line and was able to check in immediately and get a 4 pm check out on the day I was leaving. HUGE bonus. The floor we were on was virtually empty except for one night when we had a very loud party stay next to us. We complained about noise and smoke the next day (non smoking hotel and smoke coming in out room) and they quickly fixed the problem and offered me more points. Um, yes please. We were there during the infernal fires from hell (heat index was 105) and it seemed that everyone and their mother was at the pool. So happy we had a pool option that it didnâ€™t matter. Location- walk to St Lawrence Market (so great!), Kensington Market, Brewery district, shops on Queen and so much more. Subway two blocks away and oh so easy to use. There are so many Starbucks in this city that one would think it owned the town. Overall- service was stellar and that goes a long way with me. Hotel wasnâ€™t 5 star and you could be anywhere in the world but hey, if you get it cheap or use point, it canâ€™t be beat. Viva Starwood! I am a believer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thecatinthehat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in July and loved it. The location was perfect for everything we wanted to do. Service was excellent -- friendly and efficient. Room was great with a wonderful view of the city and the beds were so comfortable, which we find is rare in hotels. There was a heat wave during our stay so we took full advantage of the wonderful outdoor pool and pool bar. Our only disappointment was with the parking. We often ask to leave our car in valet parking on the day of our checkout until we're ready to head home. The Sheraton would allow us to do that, but would start charging us from the time of our check in (e.g. we checked in at 11 am so they would start charging us as of 11 am on the day of our check out). We've never encountered that before. Overall, a wonderful stay and we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ...a real treat!”
Reviews.Author: mwasc
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 week trip to Canada. This was our favourite hotel. Clean, helpful, luxurious and my kids loved the pool and so did mum and dad. We had a lovely view and it was such a treat to wake up to.The beds were really great too, a fab sleep!This hotel has a great feel and we felt welcomed and relaxed. Thanks for the bottled water when we arrived on a very hot day...a brilliant first impression for 4 very hot Scottish folk! My daughter fell and hurt herself outside the hotel and the member of staff in Traders who gave her some ice to reduce the swelling couldn't have been kinder. Thank you for our great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star - little beat up”
Reviews.Author: mom2two2
Reviews.Content: First of all I will say that we booked this property off hotwire for a great price. I think though, that we were given a room that below par because of it. Our room was a little beaten up, carpet looked stained, chipped paint on backs of doors, shower did not drain well and just did not seem very fresh overall. It was "ok" but compared with other properties that we had booked through hotwire (the most recent also being a Sheraton in another city) it was not very good. Even the elevator smelled of wet dog. The cleaning was not very thorough, old glasses were left in the room, pillows not replaced on bed and we tidy up after ourselves. I did mention our experience on check out to the girl at the desk and she appologised and offered 3000 SPG points on our card but in all honesty, I do not think I would stay here again. It was "ok" but not the best experience and certainly not a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated, clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: VicsmomCalgary
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review for months as I would definitely stay there again. The hotel is next to Toronto City hall and near several historic and beautiful buildings. But the main attraction of this hotel is its proximity to everything you will want to see/visit in the downtown area. If you are going to any other attractions outside the core of downtown, the subway is a two minute walk from the hotel and the buses/trolleys are even nearer. There are plenty of restaurants (Really nice ones) within walking distance. The rooms are large and clean. The "Path" - an underground shopping area and access to the subway is right beneath the hotel, with lots of inexpensive places to eat. Finally, there is an inside/outside pool that is wonderful (and hot tub). We once stayed there frigid January weather and we swam outside under the stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Ali0404
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early February 2011 for a few nights. Excellent location...with easy access to the Eaton Centre and Yonge Street. It was absolutely freezing, unseasonably cold in Toronto! The hotel is a conference hotel, so is likely to get very busy during the day. Rooms were very comfortable. The gym and swimming pool were ok, but not very well staffed. Swimming pool, has an outside section which was fun to swim in, in sub zero temperatures! Would recommend an evening at the Sultans Tent restaurant on Front Street...and the CN Tower is always worth a visit, and you can clearly see the Sheraton from the viewing decks! We didn't eat at the hotel, as there is so much choice out and about in Toronto. Another recommendation would be to visit Second City, the comedy venue, absolutely fantastic. Would stay at the Sheraton again, clean, convenient and reasonable prices...and the beds are very comfortable:)

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: IrishGalway_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for 2 nights with my family. WE had 3 rooms at club level. THe breakfast was excellent and kept us going until late afternoon. Loved the hors d'o in the evenings. I thought the pool was the best yet for a city centre hotel. Found the tour desk so helpful and We did a lovely city tour. THe hotel is located on the PATH system with access to food courts and shops. OVerall I Wld highly recommend the Sheraton centre hotel and on my next visit will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and World Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rickr7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Centre in Downtown Toronto on a very Rainy Weekend in May. The location of the Hotel is fabulous and easy access walking to all parts of Central Toronto. The CN Tower, Rogers Center (Blue Jays), Hockey hall of Fame and has access to the underground. The Hotel has a huge indoor/ outdoor pool which is heated both ways. Great Resturants and Shops. Internet access in the lobby. The rroms are all updated and very onfortable and the staff is more than willing to help. you can grab a bus right at Pearson airport for about $16 Canadian and it will drop you off right in front of the hotel. The bus runs every half hours. All downtown resturants are within walking distance to the hotel. I highly recomend this hotel for business or pleasure. Thank You Sheraton for a fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absoulute gem!”
Reviews.Author: suzej21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I LOVED this hotel! It's right in the heart of the city and the Eaton centre is right on the doorstep! We loved that this hotel is on the PATH which was brilliant for afternoons when we couldn't face the 30+' heat... I also had to visit a doctor while we were there and the surgery was located INSIDE the hotel centre - amazing! The outdoor pool was great and always had sun loungers and towels available... my husband also used the gym (which he thought could be better air-conditioned, but that is just an aside). We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely return if we are ever in Toronto again. We would also recommend it to anyone we know visiting Toronto! Suzanne Northern Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: f00fak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto on July 21st for one night. Location was excellent. The service from check-in to check-out was superb. Lily (salamat po!) at the front desk was EXTREMELY helpful and called me about five minutes after check-in to make sure I was happy with my room. The physical appearance of the hotel is very modern; had the fluffiest king size bed, nice flat screen TV, etc. Morning buffet had design-your-own omelette, Belgian waffles, all kinds of nice breads and cheeses (including brie), tons of desserts and a special chef's suggestion too. All of this considering the price I paid (on Hotwire) was an incredible deal. Would definitely stay here again, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “excellent and we will definately be back”
Reviews.Author: linzi2201
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 days and had a fabulous time. The hotel is in a great location, with lots of sight seeing attractions round about it. All staff were extremely helpful, from the guest services right down to the plumber! and the security staff were great when we had problems with the safe. We were on the 33rd floor and had a great view of the city and out onto the lake, and we loved the pool; pool side staff were excellent also. We will definatelt be returning for a stay next year

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: 52607Smiling
Reviews.Content: You can't find a nicer place for the price. We went to a Blue Jays game at the Rogers Stadium. They told us it was a fifteen minute walk which isn't too bad but I suggest good walking shoes because it seemed longer! I suggest upgrading to include the 43rd floor cafe which includes breakfast and excellent appetizers.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised to get it for such a cheap rate!”
Reviews.Author: stevefranco2219
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels in Toronto. Mostly because I've stayed here many times and nothing ever seems to go wrong. Except I wound up getting a price online this time for less than 1/2 of what I've paid in the past! Anyway, I like the new vibe in the lobby with the cool music playing in the background. Very nightclub feel / vegas feel to it. Room was nice, bed was awesome, staff is always pleasant. Only beef I would have is that my room didn't seem to get cleaned all that well. I could feel crumbs on the carpet walking around that never seemed to get vacuumed? Anyway, you can't go to wrong at the Sheraton Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: djsil377
Reviews.Content: I have visited the Sheraton once a year for the past 6 years - what a great place!! In January 2011, I took my daughter and grandaughter because my husband was not able to go. We walked in as strangers - but we left as real friends of the hotel - thanks to the excellent service from the Lobby Ambassador Mr. Oliver Dobberstein. I had opportunity to take another grandaughter there end of June (2011) and once again, the same gentleman - Mr. Dobberstein, greeted me BY NAME!!!! Whenever he saw my grandaughter or myself in the lobby - he spoke to us using our name - and was more than willing to accomodate us with whatever we were in need of. He made these last 2 stays at the Sheraton make me look forward to my next one in January 2012 (if not before) We loved the pool - swim inside and outside all year round - we really enjoyed being able to walk to the BAY and the Eaton centre without even having to take a coat (or boots in the winter). You walk out the back door and there is a TIM HORTONS right there, and the Nathan Phillips square skating rink in the winter. We usually go to the theatre while we are there - everything is very close - we even walked home from the theatre when we were there a few weeks ago. What a great convenient place to be at in Toronto. I highly recommend the Sheraton Centre Toronto!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: rwgrncrd
Reviews.Content: Awesome central location. The executive level is a must - great breakfast, evening cocktails and appetizzers. Absolutely worth the extra and will end up saving you money. Great rooms and the staff were very accomodating especially the front desk clerk, Brian. He made sure we had everything perfect and had great advice on the best places to eat locally. We will stay here every time we visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: chestnut6547
Reviews.Content: A truly stunning hotel offering evrything you need, the rooms are immaculate with beautiful views of downtown Toronto. Set in the centre everything is within walking distance. The food at the hotel was absolutely superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good - then not so good!”
Reviews.Author: HoHumAnotherTrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two visits in July. We book through a specialist Canadian travel website in the UK and got an exceptionally good deal, but in writing the review I'll bear in mind the star rating of the hotel and ignore what we actually paid. The first stay was excellent. Right from checkin (with the excellent Tammy, who another reviewer also applauds) to a comfortable stay.in a good comfortable and fairly large twin-bedded room. It's a little odd that there is no fridge, but if that's our main grumble that can't be too bad. The second stay started off OK but as we were heading out to dinner we found that the safe in our room wouldn't work. We rang reception and were assured that someone would be up right away to sort it out. Well, it took an hour with 3 more phone calls, each promising that someone would be right up, before someone eventually came. They confirmed our diagnosis that the safe was broken and told us that we'd be able to store our laptops, camera, kindles and documents at reception. So we took them all down, queued for ages, and were then told that the boxes there were too small to hold these. The receptionist was not very helpful or sympathetic. We were eventually offered another room (Richmond Tower) and were promised a couple of breakfast vouchers. So we had to re-pack our bags and move... and eventually had a VERY late dinner. The vouchers didn't arrive, of course. (I asked for them a few days later, and was given them though this was grudging and I had the clear impression that the receptionist didn't believe that I had been promised them). The problem should not have arisen if the room had been properly checked, and it was dealt with quite poorly. The aircon in our substitute room was feeble, but we couldn't be bothered complaining again to the unhelpful staff. Even though we're SPGs. One four star and one two-star visit averages out at a 3-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Third world hotel, stay away”
Reviews.Author: RamiG1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sheraton Center Toronto several times in the last 15 years, always at a club level room. As time went by I noticed decline of quality of service while increase of prices. The last visit was just terrible. My impression is that not only the management is poor and indifferent but intentionally fraudulent and criminal. We stayed there 7/14/2011-7/17/2011. (1) The room (at the 42 floor) had a broken bed frame, moved to a room on the 40th floor only to discover in the following day that the toilet was not flushing, had to wait 45 minutes for a plumber to fix it. (2) The voice mail box of the previous guest was not deleted, we found it entertaining to listen to a message left by a lawyer about a recent judgement. Clearly privacy of guests is not a priority at this hotel. (3) The club level rooms include continental breakfast and refreshments from 5PM to 7:30PM in a lounge on the top floor on the 43rd floor. To our surprise when arrived there on Friday at 5:10PM found out that it was closed, due to a private party, without any indication where the club level people are supposed to go. I complained to the duty manager, who had the audacity to tell me that the lounge is "closed for renovations" and the refreshment moved to the second floor. She had no answer why I was not informed about this. It seems to me that this hotel's policy is to sell the space and services twice. Later I found out that the refreshments moved to a dusty narrow room that is part of the hallway on the second floor. (4) It is incredible that the hotel offers no WIFI in the rooms, just Ethernet cables in the rooms for $15 a day per computer. There is free WIFI in the lobby that is crowded, unpleasant and super slow. (5) The AC in our room could not keep it cool in hot summer days. (6) The bathroom was small had no ventilation, not even an exhaust fan. Was hot an humid. (7) A day after checking out, the hotel sent me an "updated bill" including charges for about $30 for the mini bar that we did not use. (8) Today Monday 7/18/2011, I called the hotel 3 times between 10AM and 11:30AM the accounts and billing department, in attempt to dispute the charges, I did not manage to talk a human, was sent to voice mail box. I left two messages explaining the problem more than three hours ago, still received no response.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: Ontario101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre the night of July 16. We booked the room through an on-line travel site and we were extremely disappointed. The room was extremely small with one double bed, small bathroom with toilet against a small vanity. When I complained about the room at the front desk, I was told "that's what I get for booking through an online site" and that the "hotel was full, and that was all that was available". The check in lines were also very long, and people were not happy with the slow service. Other than the $45 per night valet parking, there is no other parking on the hotel site. Safe your money, and stay somewhere else! I know I will.

Reviews.Title: “Great family experience”
Reviews.Author: RBD1017
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Toronto Sheraton last week. We were on a road trip from Boston to Minneapolis. It was my husband and I, and our two children (5 and 1). We had checked in after a long drive from our previous stop in Montreal. Tammy checked us in. She was incredible. She was so sweet with our children. We were thoroughly impressed with her service. The hotel was very nice. There was a lot of hustle and bustle, which we like. The hotel is in a great location. We walked to the CN Tower and went to lunch in Chinatown. There were plenty of dining choices in the area. There is the mall that is right there and many shops and restaurants on Yonge street which is very close to the hotel. We used the pool one after noon, which was really nice and had a pool bar. The valet parking was very expensive, but we parked ourselves and it was only $32 for the two days we were there. We definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again! Thanks Tammy for starting our visit off right!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for all the action!”
Reviews.Author: Fabulash
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre, downtown Toronto from June 24 - 26. The purpose of our visit was to attend a Toronto Jazz Festival concert nearby at Metro Square to see The Average White Band and headliner band with 2 original members of Booker T & the MG's, the legendary guitarist Steve Cropper with dynamic guest singer Eddie Floyd. The hotel was sold out. Not only was it the Jazz Festival but also Bollywood Film Festival Awards weekend - first time ever held in North America. There was so much going on and it was lots of fun to be in the middle of everything. The Sheraton is a huge conference hotel but they always treat all their guests as special. Upon arrival while waiting in line to check-in, they had fresh water stations with glass containers of water filled with oranges & lemons for the thirsty travellers. We had a wonderful and very comfortable room on the 22nd floor overlooking Toronto City Hall & the downtown area. It was a perfect weekend get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Arasica
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton while attending a conference during the week of July 10. I travel frequently for business, have been to Toronto many times before, and am a Starwood Preferred Guest (SPG) member. This has been by far my worse experience at a Sheraton Hotel. My room, 1441, did not have a safe or a refrigerator and the carpet leading to the room at the hall was extremely dirty. Upon calling the front desk to request a safe and refrigerator I was told that the refrigerator is delivered upon request and that I should have a safe in my room. It was clear that the person who answered my call did not quite believe me that there was no safe in my room and sent an engineer to â€œshow me where the safe was located.â€� Needless to say the engineer could not find the safe nor could he install one for my documents and valuables. I called the front desk again and was offered another room the following day since they had no availability on the day I arrived. The next day I asked to change rooms before leaving the hotel for the day and I was asked to return around 3P since there room was not available. I explained that I could not return to move to a different room but that I could move upon my return at the end of the day. The next day, I was told the same thing â€“ no room available sorry, just stop by later. Another big disappointment was the Internet connection. First, there is no wireless available in the rooms and you need to use the Ethernet cable at the desk and pay a fee of $15 a day for EACH COMPUTER you get connected. I had a business and personal laptop and I was charged twice for Internet. When I called to complain I was told that the Internet connection price is for each computer you connect to their Internet, even though you cannot use them at the same time and is using the same connection, you pay twice since the system register your computer IP address. This hotel should not be rated more than a 3 star hotel for the condition and service they offer. There are much better options for lower prices around Toronto and I would definitely not recommend this hotel at this price and level of service to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: maple101
Reviews.Content: I believe that one sees the real worth of a hotel when there is a crisis and this time, I did have a crisis. Within a few hours of my checking in, I stepped out to take a short walk and I tripped on an uneven part of the pavement and sprained my ankle badly. When I called the front desk for some ice, they suggested that the security staff could help me better. So Mark Ducusin aand Adrian Ming came to my room. They were just wonderful. They checked my ankle, tested it and thought that I had not broken it. My husband was most worried and they spoke to him on the phone and reassured him completely that I was being taken care of. They got me ice packs, showed me how to put it, suggested the best treatment that is used for sports injuries (cold and hot alternately) and made me feel completely confident that I would be able to manage this. Earlier, these two young men had come and fixed my safe that was not working, apologized profusely (though it was not their fault) and offered me compensatory breakfast and so on! This is quite unlike the treatment I have got in other hotels, even as a Starwood Preferred guest. Later, at night, I needed to take Advil, but could not go myself. Tim Parsons was on duty that evening, and he was just as great. He bought the Advil for me (I paid of course), and a couple of ice packs. He also had a stretchy bandage which he gave me and refused to take money for it. these guys are a treasure and enhance the image of your hotel vis -a-vis even the competitors. In fact, the service was just great. Every single person helped me and with a smile. From the room service people, to the woman who cleans my room, to the ones who spoke to me on the phone. And the front desk as well. All in all, though I spent all my time in my room and never saw your beautiful city, only hobbling to my iHEA sessions and back, under difficult circumstances, your hotel shone, and I was happy. thank you and please do something for your wonderful security guys!

Reviews.Title: “Quality chain hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: BadPacker09
Reviews.Content: Very long and tedious wait to check in, but relatively quick once we actually got to the front of the queue. Room was fairly standard for a chain hotel and very clean. Slightly annoying that free wifi is not available in the rooms - something that seems to be standard in most other hotels (it is however available in the lobby). Great location for seeing Toronto - walking distance to the CN tower, plenty of shops/restaurants and subway very close by.

Reviews.Title: “It was clean, but customer service was not so great!”
Reviews.Author: avb823
Reviews.Content: At check in, the front desk staff will ask for your credit card for 'incidentals.' Upon my arrival home, I found out that they debited my account by $200 without my knowledge. The front desk staff did not tell me this was the policy, nor did they tell me I would incur this charge. So, be forewarned that your stay will not only cost for the room, but the Sheraton Centre Toronto takes some extra cash for several days, as I have been on the phone with them for 2 days trying to get it released back into my account. Not an easy process & the staff I've talked to say that I should have known about this charge (even though I was never informed). I get that this is their policy, but when I call back to complain or question why I was never informed, I did not get a warm or friendly customer service experience. It was the opposite - I will definitely choose another establishment in the future to avoid this type of poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: warwiac
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute through hotwire got a great deal. Pool is salt water and 1/3 in and 2/3 outside and had a pool bar. It was really nice (it was busy however). The rooms are nice and clean (but to be fair they are well used) and the a/c struggled with the 30' C + heat. We did the valet parking (45) because it's hard to get off the street without doing that. However after further review there is a municipal parking lot directly across from the hotel that has an understreet walkway to the hotel. So the valet parking could be avoided if you know that in advance. Which ended up costing almost as much as the room in the end. But all in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and excellent Hotel but extremely busy”
Reviews.Author: Alexander013
Reviews.Content: Great for families and business but be ready to wait. This hotel is usually so busy that there is always a line-up everywhere. The pool is great during summer and it is connected via the mall during bad weather seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: clafond
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for one night. It is walking distance to the Eaton Centre, the CN tower and the Prince of Wales Theatre. We requested a fridge and a kettle and service was quick and at no extra cost. Our children enjoyed the pool, though the water was slightly cold at the time. We parked across the street in the underground parking lot of Nathan Philipp Square, which turned out to be a lot cheaper. We also got a reasonable price deal through Ticket King since we had tickets to see the Lion King. We were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great view from the hotel room”
Reviews.Author: ThomasHerrmann1976
Reviews.Content: Defenitely the best hotel during our US East Coast tour (I know Toronto is in Canada). The hotel is located directly in the city with short walks to the most interesting places. The rooms have a lot of space and the view from our room over Toronto (33rd floor) was astonishing. Also the rooms were clean and tidy. The only negative issue I need to mention is the valet parking of CAD40,- per night. For someone who already pays the price for the rooms there should be a (much) cheaper rate for the valet parking

Reviews.Title: “Excelllllllent Service....Wow!”
Reviews.Author: KathrynMulrooney
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Sheraton with a couple of my friends to celebrate my birthday. What a great stay....hospitality galore! I asked the front desk staff to pick a good room for our stay and....it was great. We enjoyed sitting on our balcony shooting the breeze while listening to the waterfall. On top of this, within 5 minutes of arriving in my room the Hotel sent up a lovely wine and cheese tray. What a wonderful surprise. The excellent service continued with Mark from security thanking us for our stay and generously giving us vouchers for a complimentary breakfast! Wow! This is the best birthday I've had in years and the Sheraton played a major part...thank you soooo much!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: menad38
Reviews.Content: Won on priceline and stayed for 4 nights. Despite an 'incident' which they informed guests by leaving a msg on every room's phone in the morning, everything else went smoothly. Pro - Free wifi in the lobby area with lots of seats including nice rocking chairs, chess table and some computers - newspapers every morning by your door - good size rooms - quick elevators as 2 sections of 4 each for lower levels & others for higher level - easy check-in and check-out including assisting us with airport taxi - central location to everything including shopping (eaton centre), food (tim hortons, food trucks out front), buses and subway Con - concierge/information table was always so busy so long waits - no fridge/mini bar which would have been good - only drinks vending machine...no food vending machines which meant a late night snack without venturing out of the hotel was out of the question...altho maybe the food truck across the rd might have still been open - the air heating/cooling system doesn't work very well when the curtains are drawn as the curtains go over it & cover it up which meant we had to leave the large gap open every night

Reviews.Title: “surprising bad service”
Reviews.Author: reliablereviews2011
Reviews.Content: Although we booked and paid for this room a month in advance through a Starwood representative all of the staff we spoke to upon check-in and check-out made numerous mistakes regarding this booking. In response to these obvious errors (for example invoicing us on what was already been pre-paid and charging us for two nights of an upgrade to Club room when we only stayed one) all three staff members we spoke to were consistently inefficient and rude. Clearly defensive, they all acted as if they were doing us a favor by correcting mistakes that should not have been made in the first place. I have stayed in hotels in Canada, the United States and Europe and was genuinely surprised by this unprofessional and unfriendly attitude. Fixing these and other errors took up large amounts of our time, both because of the inefficiency and attitude of the staff and because of having to stand in consistently huge, slow moving line-ups at various times of the day and evening (not enough staff). Standing in these lines gave me a bird-eye view of several other frustrated travelers attempting to deal with the attitude and inefficiency of the staff (it seemed to be a fairly common occurrence). We came here primarily because of the pool and because we expected decent customer service. While the size of the pool is great for a hotel, it was often full of floating black dirt and one time the hot tube area was strewn with plastic cups some drunken young folk had left behind (when I mentioned this to the pool staff he implied that he would do something about this but approx.15 minutes later the cups were still there. I could go on but I won't . . .just waiting to see if the management will address these concerns which I very clearly stated to them, or not. This may make a difference in whether I ever with stay in any Sheraton again and I will let you know. I sincerely hope you have a better experience than me if you stay here. If you know of a hotel with reliable standards of customer service in Toronto please let me know!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel :-)”
Reviews.Author: scottishlassie77
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel a week before we went on advice from our travel agent. And I would say after reading previous reviews I was a wee bit apprehensive about what to expect. I can honestly say we had an excellent time. On advice on check in we asked for an upper room and I would say majority of the check in staff were excellent. We were told if we didn't mind waiting we could have our twin room on the 32nd floor - great we thought. Going back after an hour to check on progress we were greeted by a very unhelpful lady who couldn't even be bothered to look up our information on the computer!!!! Waiting yet another hour we again approached with much trepidation to be greeted by a very helpful gentleman who couldn't have done enough for us - not only checking on progress of original room and finding it still not ready but going on to find another room on an upgraded floor. Room was lovely although near lifts we didn't find it a problem at all. We found the hotel staff on the whole very accomodating especially when my friend became ill after eating in one of the hotel restaurants on our second day - Adrian and Jerome (I think) from security were excellent getting water and offering to call a doctor. The only disappointing thing was I don't think anything was done about the restaurant. We hadn't actually been anywhere else to eat that day apart from breakfast at 10am that morning!!! Thankfully it didn't spoil our holiday but did put my friend out of action for a few days. So apart from a unhelpful check in girl after a very long flight and my friend becoming ill we had a fantastic time made all the more better by the great hotel and fabulous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a perfect downtown location”
Reviews.Author: BJDorani
Reviews.Content: I am still staying in the Sheraton Centre, this is a first hand live review. I checked in with my family of 4 on 3rd July. I requested adjoining rooms and got them with a smile from a friendly and welcoming reception desk lady. She even enrolled me into the Sheraton worldwide rewards programme. The rooms on the 9th floor have pleasant cityscape views. On wednesdays the huge square in front of the new City Hall has a market which is a pleasant stroll. The old City Hall is also a great looking building seen from the hotel window. Free wife is available in the huge hotel lobby but only if you have your own laptop PC. We had a great meal at the Traders restaurant in the Sheraton, again friendly smiling staff, wide selection of local and European beers. Location is perfect, close to subway, Eaton Center, restaurants, and also within walking distance to Chinatown, Kensington Markets, University. A small fridge or mini bar in the room would have been nice, however Sheraton provide Ice dispensers on each floor. Guests are invited th hrlp conservation by declining linen and towel change and given a 5 dollar voucher as a reward, we did this only once because the housekeeping staff do not replenish the coffee and milk either, perhaps Sheraton should review this for futire guests. Staff were generally polite and helpful and we are having a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 'modern' hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teacherbear
Reviews.Content: The thing which makes this hotel is the staff. They are professional and friendly. The location is great. You have to remember it is a modern business hotel, no a lot of character. Club lounge on the 43 floor has super views and a good breakfast. Again it has a business and modern look. The evening reception has great food but wine and beer prices are high. Brian C the front desk clerk was outstanding and certainly made one feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awesome Service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GwenKitchener
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute mini get-away for the kids and ourselves....just to get away from the daily routine. We booked our hotel through hotwire.ca and ended up paying $100(including taxes) for 1 night. Our room was on the 19th floor over looking Nathan Phillip Square. It had two double beds. The room itself was very clean, except for the bedskirts of the bed. They were a liitle dirty. The bathroom was very clean. I forgot a corkscrew for my wine bottle. I called room service and a very nice gentleman came up within minutes, opened my bottle for me and wouldn't even take a tip I offered for his trouble!!!!!! The pool was very nice....the kids enjoyed the indoor/outdoor aspect of the pool, however, the pool could have been cleaner. There were a few things floating around the pool and the deck was dirty. Didn't want to take my pool sandals off in the deck area(indoor part). We have stayed at this hotel before, in November of last year, and would definately stay here again. I couldn't find a single fault with my stay then. Everything was clean...pool and bedskirts ;) The hotel overall is still one of my favorites and the cutomer service is impecciable. The staff are very friendly and helpful. This is definately a hotel to stay in if you are visiting Downtown Toronto and want to be within walking distance of everything and want a nice, clean place to stay for 2 people or for a family. Keep up the amazing work Sheraton!!!!!! I will come back again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No more chances”
Reviews.Author: Sfael
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is very conveniently located near my office, so I have given it repeat chances despite similar poor experiences in the past. I have stayed here quite often, book early and always request a non-smoking room away from the elevators. Bottom line is conventions take priority. During my latest visit, when I checked in (after waiting in a line 50 people deep and being spoken too rudely by the person ushering the guests), I was placed in a room directly beside the elevators where there was a constant thumping noise as the elevators went up and down the shaft. I immediately went back down and asked to be moved to a different room, and was told they were at "negative capacity" (whatever that means) and at this time of night there would be nobody available to clean the room so I couldn't move. Fair enough. I went back down first thing in the morning (after a sleepless night) and was again told there was no rooms available. I returned again that evening and was told that i couldn't expect to be helped at this time of night (even though the person I spoke to in the morning said they marked my file with the request for a room move). They treated me like it was ridiculous for me to even be asking. At midnight, I asked if they could transfer me to their sister hotel (the Westin), at which point they handed me the phone and told me to call them. I could no longer take the noise or the service, and checked out immediately. I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - join starwood points program!”
Reviews.Author: JToo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times over the past decade, but this was the first time we used starwood preferred customer program. This meant a free breakfast buffet and hospitality buffet at 5-8 pm which saved our family of 4 quite a bit! Beds were comfortable, pool and hot tub were awesome, and location is perfect for access to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Scent sensitive? Stay away! Otherwise wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gracer45
Reviews.Content: Gym facilities, excellent! Room service, excellent! Location, guest services, cleanliness and privacy, all excellent! My only concern was that the entire lobby area smelled heavily perfumed. As a scent sensitive person, this riddled me with headaches for our two-night stay. If you suffer from scent sensitivity, I would choose another hotel - the scent was strong no matter what time we were going through the lobby. For the exercisers out there, the fitness area is well stocked and maintained with high quality fitness equipment and lots of towels available in the gym. Check out was very convenient and quick; you could review your invoice and check-out on the TV, which we took advantage of to spend less time in the fragrant lobby. Free internet service (including free printing up to 5 pages - great for boarding passes, etc.) but there was usually a line-up for the desktop computers, so bringing a netbook or laptop would be more convenient. The information staff were excellent in helping us figure out the best way to get to the City Center Airport - via free shuttle! Signing up for the free SPG rewards had us upgraded (although we reserved using Hotwire) from 1 double on the 24th floor to 1 queen on the 32nd floor - FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: RussellS1978
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was ideal, because it was directly located on the PATH underground system. The most glowing part of my stay by far was the customer service of the hotel staff. From the Brian at the Front Desk to the Yayae (I hope I spelled that right) and the Bellmen staff to the cleaning crew. Everyone went out of their way to accommodate me and my family. This was our first family trip with our 1 year old child, and they went out of their way to make our first vacation "with child" as easy as possible. Even though I booked through Hotwire.com, which usually lowers you as a priority in most hotels, they treated us like true VIPs. I travel alot for business and because of Reward Points I usually stay at Hilton hotels, but the Sheraton Centre Toronto has made me rethink my future travel plans.This is the best customer service I have had at any facility. My congratulations to not only the staff but to the management who must set the bar so high.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, service, location = great”
Reviews.Author: Kingstonbeach
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel for the price, we paid the same price for half the hotel in LA and have since paid twice the price for 10% of the hotel in Rome (OK that's normal really). Great check in staff, great management (the manager jumped into the check in queue to help out), great restaurant, great location, great tour desk (thanks Anna). One thing though, would be great to have hotel wide wifi but if you are on holidays wifi isn't a necessity is it?

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC FANTASTIC LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: woodviewuk
Reviews.Content: We went to Toronto to celebrate my husbands 60th Birthday ,the Sheratan was a great base in a great location,The staff were professional and pleasant .The rooms were clean well equiped and the beds were lovely and comfortable .I would always recommend anyone to use the Sheratan good value and excellent service ,Thank you

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jraja123
Reviews.Content: Good quality room, friendly and helpful staff, amazing views (esp on the spg floor), ac wasnâ€™t working in the room though, one of the best locations in downtown Toronto, free wifi, overall amazing! Excellent lounge & business centre

Reviews.Title: “customer service”
Reviews.Author: instalher
Reviews.Content: upon forgetting to bring my access key with me for the day, when i returned to my room i soon realized that i couldn't get into my room. i went downstaris and notified the front end girl who told me to go up to my room and wait until security arrive. well it took no more than 10 min for the security associate to arrive and let me into my room. his professionalism was top notch and came off as a person who was truly looking out for his guests best interest.. i will highly recommend to all my fellow associates that when in Toronto to give the Sheraton a call.. Thank you very much Mr. Jordan Brown.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: DRAEMON
Reviews.Content: I stayed four hotels in Toronto. This hotel was the best location and was very convenient hotel as a tourist ! They had very helpful and friendly staff, nice swimming pool / gym & sauna. .The room had a nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but very central”
Reviews.Author: nsjetsetters
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on business. Attended a conference on site. The conference facilities are getting pretty dated looking and the hotel is very difficult to find all the conference rooms in. The lobby area is nice with lots of free WI-fi areas, and a computer area that you could never get at due to so many young people using it. The restaurants were all horrendously expensive. I mean come on, nearly $30 for a breakfast buffet! And it was nothing special, either. The second morning I discovered the Tim Horton's just outside the side entrance. The room was just OK. A bit dated. The beds were comfy and clean, no bed bugs ( I checked!) The computer was wired in the room, I brought my own and the hotel charges some ridiculous amount like $15 per day, but my internet was included in the business rate. The rate I paid was about $250 per night. The rack rate on the back of the door was , get this, $550 per night!! So not worth it! This hotel is close to shopping and all the downtown amenities. Due to being on business I had obligatory dinners to attend and did not see much of the hotels restaurants, but I imagine they were really pricey. The food served at the conference was just OK, nothing really great but that was probably due to the conference planners and cost factors. This hotel is really expensive but I don't know if there is another less expensive place in this area. I had a problem with my key a few times and got locked out, but they were pretty prompt to get another one up to me. One thing sort of was weird, you can sign up for their "green" program and get extra points if you don't get clean towels etc. every day. I hung the sign out on my door and got a clean fresh bed and new towels every day! Probably a problem with support staff that do not speak English very well. Overall, this place was OK but not the lap of luxury. Because I was there over a weekend, there were a lot of families there. Unfortunately there were several families on my floor who thought it was OK to leave pre-teen kids alone for the whole evening. They ran, screamed and slammed doors until nearly midnight when I called the desk. Security was prompt, swift and there was blessed silence after they got there! When I pay this much to stay somewhere I'm sorry but I do NOT want to hear your bratty kids screaming and yelling and slamming. So, for people who think it's OK to allow this kind of behaviour, it's not! Especially when other guests may have to get up very early the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Staff and Location! We will be returning!”
Reviews.Author: JayU_89
Reviews.Content: The Hotel couldn't be any much better than it was...I mean we had a truly remarkable stay. Me and a friend wanted to visit Toronto for 10days and it was between Westin, Sheraton and Best Western. We decided not to stay at the Westin as it was closer to the Harbourfront. So: Sheraton or Best Western? The difference between these two hotels for us was a mere Â£23, and we were very glad we paid that extra Â£23 for Sheraton. Why? The moment we stepped into the Lobby area with our baggage, there were staff ready to help you. The check-in procedure could not have been any easier than it was - we just gave our last name, presented a credit card and off we were. The room itself, was BETTER than what we expected...much different to the pictures (jn a good way)...our room was clean, tidy, spacious and had a great view of the City Hall/Nathan Phillips Square across the Sheraton (apart from the construction works). We were looked after thoroughly from day 1 to day 10, and the staff were absolutely brilliant - always on hand to help. Should anyone go upon reading this review or any other review, look out for: Aabad, Ronnie, Lily - these guys truly made our stay a wonderful one!! They were our key contacts at the hotel, for any advice on what to do, where to go, how to get about etc. When we left, we could only say goodbye to Lily as Aabad was off I presume and Ronnie was off to Cuba for his anniversary. The only downfall to the Sheraton will probably be have to be the (i) Internet and (ii) parking. Firstly, the free internet is only available in the lobby but I gave this hotel 5 stars because we received complimentary internet access for a few days due to some confusion as our holiday provider stated we had internet access in our rooms - we didnt know about the internet issue until we had to use the internet to book some tickets online and didnt even expect to receive complimentary internet acess...however, the staff looked after us very well! And secondly, as we hired a car for about 4/10 days, we chose not to park at the hotel as we thought it was quite expensive so instead we parked in a public parking lot across the hotel, for a cheaper amount. All in all, a brilliant and faultless stay at the Sheraton. We are already in discussions for a return trip next year, with a few more people...so we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SPSCaterham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a city break before going up to Niagara Falls. It is a large hotel which is well located. Rooms are tastefully decorated and comfortable. Reception staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: glrbob
Reviews.Content: An old building that has been rehabbed. A lot of street noise and the heating/cooling system was also noisy and impossible to regulate. Very expensive for what you get. I ordered an omlet for breakfast from room service and it cost $38! Ouch

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, reasonably priced, not great internet access”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMan3333
Reviews.Content: I enjoy staying at Sheratons around the world, but that also means I have fairly high expectations of them. This was a good hotel, but with disappointing internet access, which brought down my rating. The rooms are clean and nice, with flatscreen television, updated bathrooms and plenty of space. The lobby is beautiful, and the bar is large and friendly. There's also a Starbucks in the lobby, and an entrance to a mall directly from the hotel lobby. The location is very central, essentially at the heart of downtown at Queen and Bay Streets. Unfortunately, the internet access is very spotty. The rooms only have wired internet (free for standard access, $9/day for higher bandwidth). The wire is also very short, and only accessible from the desk. This means laptop or tablet usage in bed is impossible. The free version isn't terribly fast. The lobby wifi is very spotty. It's theoretically free (if you're a hotel guest), but didn't work from a meeting room I was in. Despite being a hotel guest, it wouldn't let me access. Very frustrating! Overall, I would recommend this hotel, but they could use some work on the internet access...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but why not free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: TripnFall
Reviews.Content: From initial check-in (with early arrival) to check-out and storage of luggage, the service was friendly and impeccable. The room was quiet and very clean. All big city hotel amenities plus the hotel connects to the underground city. You can travel all over downtown Toronto without surfacing which is very appealing in winter or rainy weather. Not my first stay here and won't be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Still wonderful with a couple hiccups....”
Reviews.Author: Maliesmom
Reviews.Content: Here's a tip for the front desk staff (though not needed by those checking me in)...sometime people have driven for hours when they are in front of you. I have a tendency to prefer a particular area of the hotel so that I can easily tend to my canine daughter's needs. At check in I learned these room were not available due to some drilling that was going on and would be immensely disturbing. The staff tried to be as helpful as possible and to offer something to take the sting out of the hassle, which I greatly appreciated. (Yes, I guess I can be bribed!). Although I'm sure it would have been immediately tended to, I did not report a less than clean bathroom issue. I only wanted to eat and go to bed. The next day we were able to switch rooms, so I was happy. A courtesy pre-arrival email had made it known that the pool would be unavailable certain days...but I was not prepared to see the beautiful garden that I enjoy sitting in being in its own renovation mode, and the waterfalls that I so enjoy were non-functioning. A major disappointment to me, but my canine daughter showed me how one could still enjoy the garden and have fun even without that feature. I have written the hotel manager to strongly urge that as the hotel is non-smoking that they go all the way and enforce the garden as a no-smoking zone as well. I find it very disturbing to go out to enjoy it and have to deal with people attending meetings or on breaks lighting up, blowing their smoke about, and leaving their butts on the ground or in the garden beds. Since my last review there have been some other changes: The wicker chairs/sofas at the window overlooking the waterfall have been replaced with single chairs of a more classic nature. For the moment the windows were frosted so people wouldn't have to observe the garden coming back to life with fresh plantings etc. If you order food from Shopsy's (NOT related, but in the hotel) DO check to make sure your condiments are in the bag. The Bay Dept store no longer has a post office and the greeting card dept is now within the grocery...though there is a post box. There is a post office in the back of the Shoppers Drug store in Eaton Centre. The hotel room service or Traders in the lobby does a fantastic cobb salad with a delicous champagne viniagrette. Be sure to request this. I did the first night and I think someone was confused and sent the balsamic...which was good as well. The Club Lounge offers a beautiful view of the city that can't be beat...and the breakfast buffet and evening snacks are outstanding. The staff remain friendly, personable and attentive... The beds are very comfortable...though desk lighting could be improved. Very much appreciate the hotels conservation/recycling efforts...every room has a bin, and if you decline housekeeping you have the option of a $5 food credit or starpoints credited to your account.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: SophiaNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 2x in the last 2 years, both times to attend weddings. The staff were helpful and friendly, The room was very comfortable. Pool area is great. There's a Starbucks in the Lobby area. We liked the walkway that took us to the Bay and Eaton's Centre without going outside. We didn't eat in the hotel as there were lots of restaurants nearby. We flew into Toronto Island Airport with Air Canada so we only had a short distance from the airport to our hotel. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sstreet
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel at a perfect location. We walked the underground "PATH" to the theatre and enjoyed the shops along the way. Great view and very attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lovestodine77
Reviews.Content: Everytime I come into Toronto overnight for a concert, a shopping trip or just a weekend away I always try and book this hotel as the location in great!. The hotel itsef is very nice, clean, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and the best party is that the beds are so comfy!!., I always have a wonderful nights sleep. The hotel is all within walking distance to many great restaurants, shopping and the Air Canada Centre, which is very convenient as you can park at the hotel and then walk everywhere so you don't have to pay for parking everywhere you go.
