There is also a PATH that is an underground walkway with shops that connects you to the Eaton Centre which is good during the winter months when it might be a little cold to walk outside. This is definitely a great hotel for any tourists visiting the Toronto area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: srix9
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location and the lobby and room were spacious and clean. We were on the 6th floor and our room did not have a fridge, which seemed a bit odd and disappointing. The biggest problem with this hotel, or at least the area that we were in, is that the walls seem to be paper thin, especially those which have a door that joins to the next room. We stayed for two nights and both nights we had to call the front desk since we could very clearly hear the guests in the room next door (they were talking loudly but in most other hotels I think their volume would have been fine). When we called the front desk on the second night they sent someone up who knocked on the door, but the guests didn't answer the door and continued to be loud and the hotel employee simply left, so we had to knock on their door and ask that they try to be a bit quieter (they were apologetic as they didn't expect their volume to be heard in another room). It wasn't a huge deal since we were in town to visit some friends and see the city, but if I was in town for business and needed to get a good sleep I probably wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “nice position and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: marieanddon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night. Easy to find and withing walking distance from metro station. Reception area big spacious and comfortable, staff at reception efficient. room air conditioning not working and got moved without problems. Rooms spacious with 2 beds TV and fridge. Bathroom area clean. Would stay again as central for sight seeing. Should offer free wifi!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, short stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelFamily2012
Reviews.Content: Had to overnight in Toronto for work meetings. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful all around. Room was just as photos on website suggest with a clean and comfortable bed. On the 22nd floor I had a great view of city hall and the city. Quite lovely. My flight was late so I arrived at 11pm but was still able to get some food in the pub (Traders), where there was a very good group playing live music. I had meetings the next day in one of the conference rooms... the yogurt and fruit for the continental breakfast was very good. Lunch, too, was delicious with lots and lots of healthy options available. I travel a lot and it is so hard to get good food on the road so I really appreciated access to lots of fresh fruits and vegetables. Kudos to the Sheraton for that! WifI is available for guests only in the central lobby but you have to pay for it in the rooms. Plus, once you check out at noon, your wifi is not longer valid. For the price, this was a good hotel and delivered what it had promised.

Reviews.Title: “Old and dirty hotel. Book elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: AlexandruDolghiu
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at this hotel because my work involves to stay 2 nights every year in June. My Sheraton experience left me another bad impression (same in Bahamas). Old towels, water clogged into the bathtub and sink, dust around the electric switches and floor trims and the carpet. An overall old look and feel with noisy A/C unit and dusty A/C pipes. Overall a bad experience. A max. 3 star would suffice for this run down hotel. I recommended my company for next year to look elsewhere. Luckily the stay was paid by my company.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly poor!”
Reviews.Author: Ails12
Reviews.Content: Rudest check-in staff I have EVER encountered. Enough to put me off every visiting a Sheraton again and even visiting Toronto again for that matter (nice first impression!!). The noise I could deal with (it was a weekend after all), even the shabby hallways and the paper coffee cups (nice one, Sheraton - you have recycling bins in rooms yet you use paper cups?????!!!!???) but rudeness? NO!!

Reviews.Title: “My worst experience”
Reviews.Author: MDS201111
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 days during the international congress. This stay is my nightmare. Most staff are rude, inconsiderate and have no service mind. For example, the guy at egg station in breakfast buffet told me that he was too busy to take any order, the reception at a breakfast restuaruant told me that you came too early (despite it was 10 minutes after the opening hours), the lady at fitness center have me waited for 10 minutes for opening the door to let me in, the bell boy told me to get my lugguage from storage room myself, the conciege told me to look at the map myself because it is 5 minutes after her working hours. All my friends in the same group experience the same situation. some are even worse. It may be the discrimation, prejudice or just a very bad service. I strongly believe that it is the hotel culture!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Taylorv2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights for a conference. Upon my late arrival, the front desk clerk was super nice and helpful. The room was very clean and smelled fesh. I even had a view of the CN Tower which was pretty cool at night. Room service was served in less than 30 minutes, and it was tasty. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the centre of downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: kevindebcarey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Sheraton Centre Hotel, Toronto. This was our first trip to Toronto for myself, husband and daughter aged 14. We hired a car at the airport, used a satnav and arrived into the hotel approx 40 mins later - although on the way back it took us only 25 mins! We messed up a couple of times out of Toronto airport. On arrival at the hotel there was a friendly welcome from the reception staff and the check-in was quick and we were told everything we needed to know about the hotel - times of breakfast, opening hours of the pool etc. We did not use the pool but it was lovely and my husband used the gym in the morning which was also good. Our room was on the 32nd floor and overlooked Nathan Philips Square. The room included two double beds, flat screen tv, tea/coffee machine, small table and arm chair. The room was very comfortable and we all slept well. The air conditioning was a must for the week we were there. One of the days reached 32 and the coolest day was 19. I had read reports from others who were bothered by noise and bedbugs! We suffered none of these and found the hotel clean, comfortable and the staff friendly. The cleaning staff were lovely and very friendly. I would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again should we ever come to Toronto. I would also recommend hiring a car. We toured Straford and St Jacobs which is amish country. Very interesting to see amish people going about their normal everyday business. We also visited Niagara Falls and, if you get the chance, visit Niagara by the Lake which is about a 15 minute drive away. The town is very pretty and has a number of olde worldy shops and lots of eating places. We found Canada to be quite expensive for food, clothes, trips etc. As we have a 14 year old we took her to Canada's Wonderland which we all loved although it cost us Â£130 for entry for the 3 of us. If you buy your tickets online before you go you will save $20 Canadian dollars each. We were slightly disappointed by the CNN Tower but feel if you're going to Toronto you must visit. Once again restaurant expensive, although we did not have a meal there. Views good but the Tower felt quite claustrophobic once you got up to the top with lots of visitors. The lobby of the hotel is lovely. Once again, very clean. There is a Starbucks in the lobby which catered for breakfasts and quick food. There are also a number of other eating places leading off the lobby to the underground shops. There is 30 minutes free internet access in the lobby which my daughter used daily. We did not use the spa, restaurant or order room service so I cannot comment. We had a lovely holiday and would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but noise issues at the Richmond Tower”
Reviews.Author: abass47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. Hotel is well located. The rooms were basic but clean. Not sure that it was a four star room, (as per hotwire), but then I wasn't paying a four star price either. The only caveat is that my first room was in the Richmond Tower facing the street. It was fine during the day but at night there was a strange noise that sounded like someone was vacuuming outside. It was loud enough that I needed earplugs to sleep. Apparently, it's a chronic issue because no one acted surprised when I complained. They changed my room the next day and the new room was fine. My friends who had a room on the non street facing side didn't have any issues. So I'd definitely stay at the hotel again. Just avoid a room on the street side of the Richmond tower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricey...”
Reviews.Author: lethomas9
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the Sheraton while in town for a conference being held on-site at the hotel. I have a decent king-bed room on the 29th floor with a nice view of downtown. The room itself is smaller than I expected, but very comfortable. I appreciate that there is Starbucks coffee in the room and that it is very clean. The location is awesome, right downtown and the hotel has good access to restaurants and shopping. However, the best rate that I could get for this room during the conference was $239, which this room is absolutely not worth. For that price, I would expect to have access to free wireless (there is no wireless in the rooms and the cable access charge is enormous). This hotel is nice, with a great location, but the rooms are certainly not worth that exorbitant charge. I would be quite happy staying at this hotel for a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: meleetyme
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is great although the building and many of the surrounding buildings have that 1950s industrial cold look to it. Upon arrival we were greted by a valet but no one ever came to take our bags. Irritated. We checked in to one of our rooms but were told that the adjacent connecting room that we desired was still being cleaned but would be ready within an hour. That was okay with us as we were not in a rush. We went to put our bags down and found the room to be okay. Nothing spectacular but clean. Please note that this hotel does not seem to have queen beds just full and kings which was a bit odd. Anyway, we returned several hours later, tired only to find that the room that we were waiting on had not been cleaned. It was about 10 p.m . at this time. We were offered to be moved to new rooms in the other tower of the hotel. (The hotel is housed in two towers). Only thing is the associate never offered to have someone move our bags for us. When we finally asked about it we were told that they could request the bell hop for us. (This made it clear that they were not compng this service for us). Thus we were disappointed by the baggage handling. We had breakfast at their hotel restaurant which was pretty good. The waiter, Mr. Sawh was a delight. I would stay here again but it is not an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stays for business - want to come back for pure fun.”
Reviews.Author: Cago_Steve
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre Hotel is far and away my preferred place to stay when in Toronto. I have stayed at four other Toronto hotels but none of those has come close to beating the excellent experience I consistently receive at the Sheraton Centre. Let me tell you why I like it so much. First of all, the facilities are top notch. Everything â€“ lobby, restaurants, rooms, workout area - are modern and fresh looking. Each room that I have stayed in has been nicely appointed, quiet, and very clean. The beds are very comfortable and I have always gotten a great nightâ€™s sleep. Location, location, location â€“Itâ€™s the best in Toronto. Itâ€™s right in the core of the city. Everytime that Iâ€™ve stayed somewhere else, I always end up needing to spend most of my time near the Sheraton. The views have been interesting. On one side, an â€œup closeâ€� view of the Canada Life Weather Beacon â€“ by its lights it is possible to determine whether it is going to rain or snow, be clear or cloudy or if the temperature is rising or falling. On the other side, I found the view of the lighted CN tower to be very relaxing to sit and enjoy the view while calling home after a busy day in the office. The staff has always been very friendly and helpful. Whether Iâ€™m asking for directions, food recommendation, a good running route, each person seems to sincerely want to do their part to make your stay as convenient and comfortable as possible. I have been impressed with the food. The onsite Traders and Bistro on Two restaurants provide many delicious and convenient food and drink choices to satisfy the tastes of the people in your group. I have been most impressed by the room service that I have ordered a couple of times. I really like the Cobb Salad with Chicken and topped with chunks ofBlue Cheese. The chunks of Blue Cheese melded with the chicken to create a wonderful flavor. Iâ€™ve never had a Cobb salad served quite like that and it was truly one of the best salads I have ever had. I tried to duplicate it at home but it didnâ€™t have quite the same result. The workout and pool areas are top notch. The workout area is quite large and has many options for strength and aerobic training. The full 25 meter, indoor/outdoor pool is the biggest and best I have ever seen in a hotel. It would be impressive at a top notch resort. The pool is especially interesting during winter as a moveable wall lowered to the waterline so that half is indoors and half is outdoors. It is really cool that one can swim uninterrupted laps as you go between indoors and out through cutouts in the wall in each of the lane. My kids really want to come with me next winter to check this out. I look forward to the staying at the Sheraton Centre the each time I return on business to Toronto. I like the Sheraton Centre and Toronto so much that am also planning a visit with either my entire family or just my wife to show them the sights and sounds of Toronto as well as to let them check out the many cool features of this hotel. My children really want to check of the pool while if only my wife comes, she thinks the ultimate would be to relax in the SPA Suite after a day of sightseeing. I think sheâ€™s right â€“ it would be the ultimate end of any travel day â€“ business or pleasure - to retreat to the private sanctuary of the SPA suite at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great but pick a different hotel in the same area.”
Reviews.Author: NoneSelected
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for five nights for a conference. Our room was very small, noisy and uncomfortable. We asked to be moved after the first night (two days before our conference started) and were advised that the front desk would let us know what was available. No one bothered to get back to us. When I complained about this I was advised that the hotel was very busy with the conference. Given that our room had been booked months in advance and we asked for the change two days before the start of the conference, I find this to be a weak excuse. To my mind, they were no longer interested in providing customer service to conference participants since they had already secured the conference's business. Other issues: High fees for internet access, which one expects to be an included feature at higher end hotels. In addition, you can expect to be charged for all calls made from your room, including local and 1-800 numbers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - nice location”
Reviews.Author: PlaneTraveler
Reviews.Content: Very well-kept hotel, beautifully appointed rooms, bath could have used more vanity storage or shelves. There was no place to leave anything. Restaurants offer typical dependable high-priced fare. Very convenient to subway (1 block). Biggest problem is the only wifi is in the hotel lobby which is inconvenient. Seems like for a $15 dollar per day Internet fee in the hotel rooms (wired only), one could expect to have wireless service in the rooms also. Hundreds of guests are camped out in the lobby all hours of the day and night to use wifi. Room service trays and carts seem to remain in corridors forever.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay, but....”
Reviews.Author: rdr49
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from Hotwire where it was advertised as a 4-star in downtown Toronto at $85 per night. When we accepted and paid, the total charge was $104.18. I think that is reasonable for downtown Toronto, especially at a location that very central. We arrived on foot from the railway station (a 760 metre distance) just before midnight. Downtown Toronto was active at that time of night along our route up York Street, and especially so in the Sheraton Centreâ€™s vehicle arrival area and their large lobby. We were directed by the bell staff to Reception where we were checked in very efficiently . We were given a room with a king bed on the 10th floor overlooking the City Hall. The view was quite appealing even with the current re-construction going on in Nathan Phillips Square. The room was very nicely furnished and very comfortable. My wife who is fussy about those things found the bed very comfortable. The next morning, we were checked out reasonably fast. There were 4 tour buses parked just outside the hotel on Queen Street so while there was a potential for delay they did have 6 clerks on duty. My wife and I are not demanding guests but weâ€™re not push-overs either. So when I say that every one of our contacts with hotel staff was very pleasant, I think most people could agree. We were wary from a previous review here about weekend budget guests (like ourselves) who could be noisy and thoughtless of others. The only downside to our stay that Iâ€™d like to mention was that twice during the night we were awakened by noisy guests talking outside in the hallway near our door. Then, at 02:30 we were awakened by a fire alarm that had been activated on the 3rd floor. I was completely alert after that, and with the subsequent announcements, it was at least 30 minutes before we settled down again. Can you criticise a good hotel for the actions of bad guests? It doesnâ€™t seem fair, but our primary objective was a good nightâ€™s sleep and it was not met. Still, my guess is that during the week with business travellers, this place would be a really great location. On the weekend, you take your chances with the possibility of a rowdy element. It is not just at the Sheraton â€“ weâ€™ve had the experience of great locations and not-so-great guests about 4 times in the past year!

Reviews.Title: “WiFi and security issues”
Reviews.Author: ezier
Reviews.Content: Since there is no wi fi in the hotel rooms you have to go down to the lobby to get a wi fi connection. During the day the wi fi table is packed with other angry customers since this is the ONLY hotel that I have stayed at in the last five years without wi fi in your own room. On the last night I went to the lobby at 11pm. There were a half dozen other users at the table and after a while there was a poke in my neck by a panhandler sticking a "charity cup" at me. So security and wi fi issues make this a never do again place

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mainegirl759
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing about this hotel is the wireless internet. You can't get it in your room, but can get it in the lobby. But once you check out, you can no longer access the wireless. I always check out early, and that left me with no wireless acess in the lobby for the rest of the morning. Otherwise, this is a really good conference hotel - extremely quiet even though I was with a group of 1,500. Restaurants are pretty good - hotel staff is great!

Reviews.Title: “First class customer service”
Reviews.Author: DBM24
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times. I will say, our last stay was less than perfect. The management of the Sheraton made a personal effort to make sure we felt that all our issues were dealt with. As a result with this most recent stay, they pulled out all the stops for us, and we very much appreciated that. I won't go into details, but I will say, this level of service is much more indicative of a five star hotel. As you can see from my reviews, I don't give many 5 stars, but the service of thes management and staff certainly requires a 5 star from me. We will come back...many times.

Reviews.Title: “LOST ITEM ISSUE”
Reviews.Author: jezebel45
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Toronto Sheraton Centre for 1 night in February on my birthday. It was a great stay. We were upgraded to a club level room with a great view of Nathan Phillips Square. The room was clean and tastefully decorated. We have absolutely no complaints with the quality of the room and the guest services provided. But, a few days later, I realized I left my necklace in the hotel room. We stayed the Friday night and by the time I noticed my necklace was missing, it was now the following Tuesday. I called the hotel immediately and was told my necklace had been found. What a relief! I was told I could come pick it up any time and the necklace was in safekeeping. Unfortunately I could not pick up the necklace immediately as I was away on business for three weeks. I came in as soon as I could to pick up my necklace which was April 1st. After speaking with a few security/lost and found personnel, my necklace could not be located. I was informed that since I called the hotel about a missing necklace, which was found by housekeeping, the hotel was responsible for holding that necklace for as long as needed. Had I not called the hotel within 30 days of my stay, the hotel was well within their rights to no longer keep the necklace in the safe. Good thing I called. Or so I thought. When I went to pick up my necklace, after keeping me waiting for 45 minutes in the hotel lobby, the person who was searching for my necklace brought out a stack of papers to show me she could not find my room number, name or any information stating I called about the necklace. After glancing through the papers myself, for about 30 seconds, I noticed my room number, my name and necklace for pick up, highlighted. She informed me of the 30 day policy ( which did not apply since I called with regards to the necklace). I was told the person who turned in the necklace, the housekeeper, would be able to claim it after the 30 days expired. I was then told the hotel would keep in touch with me while determining the status of my necklace. After not hearing from the hotel for a number of days, I called and was told the hotel could not locate my necklace and could not get a hold of the housekeeper who may or may not have claimed the necklace. After 10 days of me visiting the hotel to pick up my necklace and being proactive in calling the hotel, trying to get some answers, I was still told the necklace was missing and could not be found amongst any employees. The hotel told me they would spend the rest of the week ensuring that the necklace had in fact been lost by the hotel and I could expect an answer by the end of the week to see where we could go from there. Two days later, I received a call from a third employee I had never spoken to saying the employee handling my case was on vacation and would get a hold of me the following week. This employee then informed me, they could not find any record of ever finding a necklace in my room. I immediately became worried that my necklace suddenly was of no importance, even though I clearly was shown papers that said my necklace was found and would be picked up. I decided to take this situation in my own hands and visited the hotel two days later. I spoke with a security employee and informed him of my problem. Within 20 minutes, the employee was able to find a record of the hotel finding a necklace in my room, but he could not find the previous paper I had seen 2 weeks earlier when I first visited the hotel to pick up my necklace. He informed me that paper was floating around the hotel. This employee was incredibly helpful, courteous and did more in 20 minutes than anyone had in two weeks. I asked if I could copy the paper or take a picture of it. He said that was against hotel policy but said he would make a copy of the paper and keep it within his own personal records that only he had access to. So, now onto the following week (Monday). Knowing that the person handling my case was coming back from vacation, I called the person I spoke to, to call me as soon as possible, and she did within an hour. When she called, she apologized for the inconvenience and the frustration the hotel has caused me. Having all my information in front of me, I asked her what information she had available to her. I was told she had none. The employee was eager to come to a resolution, asking how much my necklace was worth and said she would go over all the information they could find and would get back to me by Thursday as we both knew the long weekend was coming up. Eager to come to a resolution, I informed the hotel employee I would look for a certificate of appraisal for the necklace. Now, the necklace I lost was a birthday gift to me from my mother, who received that necklace from her mother. So I really had no idea whether or not there would be any certificate of appraisal. After explaining the situation to my mother and after receiving a very heated lecture, she did inform me she had it appraised years ago and would give me the certificate which included the suggested replacement value on it. Today, being Thursday and nearly three weeks since I first visited the hotel to pick up my necklace, I called the hotel trying to get a hold of the employee dealing with my case to inform her I had a certificate of appraisal. I immediately got her voice mail that said she would be away until the following week. (Again, I'm told I would have a resolution, but mysteriously, an employee working on my case, is away. Now this is a different employee that has disappeared, literally the day before I was told I should have a conclusion to my case.) At this point, it is clear the hotel has lost my necklace and did not follow their own security policies. I have been dealing with the security department this entire time and I am shocked that any records relating to my case, can't seem to be found by employees unless I personally explain how they can be found IN PERSON. I finally got a hold of the last person I had spoken to regarding my issue, and got her fax number to send in the certificate of appraisal. When I asked her what the next step would be once I sent her the certificate, she informed me it was no longer 'in their hands' and was quick to get me off the phone. I was told the insurance company was now handling the case and the hotel was no longer tied to the issue. I was never made to feel comfortable that this case would be dealt with nor was anyone apologetic in ANY WAY for the loss of my family heirloom. I was told the certificate was going to be sent to the insurance company and I would hear from someone within a week. Ten days and 0 phone calls later, I called the last person who I had spoken to, and asked if she would be able to find out the status of the claim. Hours later, I received a call from the insurance company, not the hotel, asking for some information regarding the necklace. She also asked me to send her another copy of my certificate of appraisal. How is it that all the information regarding my necklace seems to float around, but never to the person who's actually handling my case? I now have to go out of my way to provide more details and send information that the hotel should have been giving to the appropriate person. What strikes me as odd, is the Sheraton was so willing to be rid of my case, to let the insurance company handle it and take no responsibility. I never once had anyone who was consistent with follow ups or even seemed to have a caring nature when speaking with me regarding my lost family heirloom. It seems the people who complain regarding a noisy stay, get offered free use of amenities, a few extra nights and a points system, yet all I'm offered, are a very stressful 8 weeks of trying to get to the bottom of the reasons behind how a hotel could lose such a valuable, personal item, that was supposed to continue to be in my family for another 60 years. How is it after 8 weeks I am still making phone calls, still posting on trip advisor, only to have to keep telling my story to numerous people in hope of a resolution? Once again, I want to be clear. Yes, I left my necklace in the hotel room. My fault. But I feel I took the appropriate steps to find my necklace within three days of my stay. Since then, the hotel has found the necklace and THEN lost it. I feel like I can't express enough I took whatever steps necessary to retrieve my necklace. So beware, the Sheraton is a nice hotel, but be careful when you leave your room. Ensure you leave with everything you bring!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Josied2
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Sheraton with our two small kids got Easter weekend. The staff were awesome and very helPful. They upgraded our standard room to one with a bit more space for pur two busy kids on the pool level (third floor) which had a little balcony for them to sit put on, which they loved- much better than a sealed up room on a high floor. Easter weekend activities were a hoot, the kids adored it. We had a minor incident when our son accidentally boarded the wrong elevator And the staff and security personnel were there instantly to help us and were fantastic! So professional. For our next family weekend in the city we won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Charges & Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravels6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Center with a few friends back in February 2011. Worse hotel experience ever! The security staff screamed in my face, attempting to intimidate a young female, and continued to wrongly accuse my room with noise complaints and unexpected charges of $226. If we were such a noisey group I would have preferred we were just asked to leave as I only paid $80 for the room on hotwire. The rooms beside and across the hallway from mine were having parties and managed to soil the hallway carpet with pop bottles, alcohol bottles, and vomitt which were still visible the following day. It was not even worth my time to speak to the lady at the front desk about the poor treatment received by security and the rediculous charges, as she was simply rude and unhelpful saying that there was no manager available to deal with my issue until the following Monday (which was 4 days away). Overall, a complete lack of respect and customer service from staff and management alike. My advice to you is if you are a group of 4 or more, do not stay here as they give will charge you an extra $226 if you make any noise past 10pm (this includes walking back to your room after an evening out). On a more positive note, this hotel has average rooms and a great downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_native
Reviews.Content: Had a very enjoyable stay at the Sheraton. Me and my brother booked a club room in order to assure a high floor. We ended up on the 34th floor with very nice views looking north. Next time I'll be sure to specify a downtown looking view. Luckily the club lounge on the 43rd floor had great views on all angles. The food served there was quite good, I especially liked the pineapple chicken. It was nice being able to have a few drinks and relax looking down at the streets below. The room itself was comfortable and very clean however I was a bit disappointed in the decor. I was expecting much nicer for a club floor room. The room itself was quite nice and the beds very comfortable. All though the bathroom was fine it was a bit dated. The minibar was well stocked but of course had ridiculous prices for anything in it. No need really to get anything out of it considering theres a 7/11 just down the road from the hotel. Did not try the hotel restaurant but the breakfast at the club lounge was quite nice. Just enough to get us going for the day. The swimming pool seemed very nice and I was disappointed I did not get to try it since I had forgotten my bathing suit. Overall an excellent downtown hotel which I will for sure go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kazzyvege
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late April, 2011. The hotel is in a great spot there are things to do all around it and within a short walk. We had a slight problem checking in as they had given us twin beds when we asked for king and they didn't have another room available to give us except for a disabled room. Beware when you book as they said the majority of their rooms are twin. We finally ended up with the disabled room which was close to the lifts and a little noisy (there are rooms right next to the lifts so make sure you don't get these!). The hotel is quite large and there is a pool and fitness centre available. The hotel also provides laundry facilities which was great for us as we had been travelling for a few weeks by then and needed to wash. I went to reception to get money changed as it is coin operated and they gave me one dollar coins which can't be used in the machines so wasn't very happy that I had to go all the way back down to the lobby to get that sorted - I though the staff should have known this! Other than that the rooms are big and the bed is comfy there are views either side of the hotel so wherever you are you should have a view from your room. There is a small coffee shop in the lobby which does good coffee and the hotel provides computers and free access if you are staying there. All in all a good hotel maybe the staff were not the best we had met they didn't seem to want to help out much but maybe we had been spoilt by other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “You have to "upgrade" to a king or two doubles?”
Reviews.Author: boblawbla
Reviews.Content: After booking on Hotwire, the front desk informed me upon arrival that our room was only a "double" sized bed. I had to pay an extra $50.00 plus taxes to upgrade to what should have been a standard size room. The room with the double sized bed, looked like something from "Mr. Bean" in Europe...

Reviews.Title: “Young weekend party crowd”
Reviews.Author: gotanywine
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter and I were looking forward to our stay. Our enthusiasm was quickly dampened by the party going on in the hallway outside our room. We bagan calling the desk at 11pm. We were told that security would be up. After this, the party moved into the adjoining room. We continued to call the front desk. They were polite and apologetic however the noise continued. At 12:45, my husband made cell phone recording of the noise. He brought the recording to the front desk and was told nothing could be done. He insisted security be sent up, and thankfully things then quieted down. We had prepaid for our room through Priceline and therefore could not be reimbursed. The hotel did provide us with complimentary parking and breakfast. This is a tired hotel in need of renovation, full of young partyers. A definite thumbs down! Booking online left us with no recourse. Not worth the savings!

Reviews.Title: “Solid, but pricey hotel”
Reviews.Author: halifaxns
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Sheraton Centre while attending a conference on-site there. Check-in was a breeze, and although checking in 4 hrs early, I was able to get a room on one of the top club floors with a great view out over downtown Toronto facing Lake Ontario and the CN Tower. Being on the club floor gave me access to snacks and free in room internet. I loved that the coffee in the hotel was Starbucks for all of the conference meetings. The room was a good size, the bed was very comfortable and the room was kept perfectly clean. All in all, it was a great place to stay. The hotel was pretty full with a major conference so the best rate I could get was 199. At this price point, there are much better values in the general neighbourhood. For my stay, the convenience of staying at the conference site was worth the bit extra.

Reviews.Title: “Despite check in blunder, a great stay overall!”
Reviews.Author: cal_dude7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Centre the last weekend of April. Overall it was a great property, however we had one less night to enjoy it... Upon check in we were greeted at check in by being advised they were over booked and they would have to put us up in an alternate property for the night. This turned out being the Holiday Inn on Carleton St, which I wouldn't say is a comparable hotel by any means, however they did give us the night for free as well as round trip taxi for when our room would be read the remaining 2 nights of our stay. In the end all worked out great as they upgraded us to the concierge level for the inconvenience (this included free breakfast and evening appetizers at the concierge lounge). The rooms themselves were great! The bed was amazing, and the room was furnished with a modern look and flat screen TV. Considering it is a Toronto hotel,which are generally small in room size, this hotel offered decent space in the rooms. The bathroom was also nice with good shower and space. The facilities at the hotel itself are huge. With on site restaurant that looked nice (we only had drinks there however, so I can't comment on how the food was), gym, pool, business centre, this hotel had all you would need to enjoy your stay. There is even a spa on site as well. Location was excellent. You are within a couple blocks of Eaton Centre/Younge St, and about 15-20 minute walk to Front St (CN Tower, Skydome, Air Canada Centre). Overall minus the check in issues at the beginning of our stay I have no complaints. The staff was great, the rooms were in great condition, and you can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Palour Suite Needs Major Cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Steveℜen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre one night over March Break. The hotel upgraded us to a room with a parlour suite attached as a good will gesture after a problem on a previous stay. Our main room was great. Clean and well kept. The parlour suite was filthy. I have attached some pictures. Housekeeping needs improvement. You can't beat the location of this hotel, but it is in need of some renovations. Starting to look dated and in desperate need of a good cleaning. Pool was also dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Bubba05_11
Reviews.Content: The staff went above and beyond to make our stay amazing. From check in to check out, every experience we had with the staff members was fantastic. We made two contacts in particular, Gary and Jordan in Security, who took our stay over the top. They were really helpful in providing recommendations and tidbits of the on goings in the hotel and around the city. Their help led to some amazing experiences for us....thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service needs training!”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: i usually stay at the Delta Chelsea, However i was in Toronto for 5 nights and i saw Expedia had a decent rate so i thought i would treat myself thinking this place was a little more upmarket. When i arrived absolutely exhausted having flown in from Australia door to door, i had requested a "High Floor" room, Upon check in the the woman who served me wasn't very friendly and issued me an 8th floor room!!! When i queried as to why i was getting such a low floor she said "Oh we're sold out you'll have to try again tomorrow for a higher floor" I just feel if you're staying a decent amount of nights ie 3 or more nights you'd think they'd make the effort to accomodate you on to a high floor since you're giving them a decent amount of business. After getting to my room it was small with a double bed and i noticed you could hear a little street noise and the bed is SO uncomfortable!!!!! It's really hard and appears to have just a cheap mattress.... After 5 nights i feel sleep deprived!!! The bathroom was kind of worn and i agree with a previous reviewer who said the tolietries smell a little lower scale. Shower over bath I didnt use the gym or the pool so i cant comment on those. On my last night a friend asked me could she stay the night as she and i were travelling to the airport together the next morning, I said sure and rang "Guest Services" and asked could we get a rollaway/cot bed set up? The woman said in quite a rude manner "it wont fit in there but we'll see what we can do" so i gave them an hour, hadn't heard back so i went down to the front desk on our way out to see "The Lion King" at Princess of Wales Theatre (Highly recommended by the way) They said "Sure no problem" but when we returned hours later the same above mentioned rude woman had left a voicemail for me (Complete with attitude) to tell me they weren't giving us one as the room is too small. For the record the room was small however i still think one would of fit in there and if not then fair enough but it's just the bad attitude that irked me!!!!! In summary if you're looking for a no frills hotel room it would be perfect but as a luxury hotel it definitely doesnt meet those requirements, Next time i'd stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all areas”
Reviews.Author: nickannetteandem
Reviews.Content: We should have posted this review right after we stayed last July but life got in the way. The Sheraton Toronto Centre provided us (myself, wife and 11 year old) the stay of the year. Even though we were staying on Starwood points, we were upgraded to Club level (even though I am platinum I assumed this would not occur as we were not paying for the week long stay). The check-in was brilliant; we have to note Marilyn B. as really making us feel like we were valued guests. An extra bed was arranged for our daughter and was delivered within minutes of our arrival. Everything was as promised. The room was large, comfortable and immaculately kept. The Club lounge was an oasis of calm...great choice of breakfast items and a broad selection at supper. Coffee, tea, hot chocolate and cold beverages were always available. The lounge staff were pleasant and efficient. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the centre of things”
Reviews.Author: CorkToAnywhere
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with family ( 2 adults , 3 children ).Leisure facilities are very good with lovely pool ( half in , half out) ; however , the lack of staff at the gym , poolside area really let the facilities down. A lot of 'dirt' at bottom of pool and to top it all off someone broke a glass in the pool and it was closed for a time period ; very upset children !! Overall , the hotel facilities are very goog with underground access to subway , massive shopping areas etc. My complaints would probably centre around pricing and would be true for any city centre Toronto hotel. First problem would be breakfast pricing of about 30 CAD per adult and 15CAD for child before tax ; absolutely crazy pricing considering how little kids under 12 eat ( at least my kids anyway). I would recommend that people walk out from door and walk 300 yards or so left to Sunset Grill for breakfast. Great value . Second issue is with people taking your drinks oders from the table. They charge 20% gratuity on all drinks which are already over 10CAD if you include taxes. Absolute rip off ! Last gripe is on room service. My kids wanted room service and we decided to give them a treat ; I might add I was not in the room when food was delivered. They ordered steak , childs nuggets , child pizza. Pizza was 'tiny' and nuggets were spiced ; sirloin steak was burnt to a crisp and was not edible. To add to this , by the time they added in room service , gratuity , tax the whole thing was nearly 80 CAD for rubbish ! Apart from these issues this is a great centre location for visiting Toronto if you can get a good rate . However , dont use the hotel for breakfast , room service or drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Mehrishi
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent experience as per the services & location of the hotel. It is located in the heart of city. Rooms are huge & spacious & Really luxurious ones. Star Hote and really a good option for honeymooners. The connectivity is really good with the local transport system as you get all the facilities right at the door steps. You also have all the major tour operators pickup facility at this hotel. Good shopping area & night life around this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual”
Reviews.Author: FlexitarianCouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for one night on the Easter weekend. We booked with hotwire and got a great deal. We stay at the Sheraton 2 - 3 times a year and we have enjoyed all but 1 stay over the past 10 years. This time was great, we got an early check in at 1pm on Friday and stayed until check out at noon on Saturday. The check in line was extremely long and we had to wait over 20 minutes. We stayed in the Queen tower and had a view of the CN Tower and looked down on the pool. We used the pool on Friday and then on Sat morning we tried again, but the place was very crowded with families with kids. So we opted for the sauna instead and then headed back to the room. Overall, the stay was great and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great for Us - Noisy”
Reviews.Author: OntarioRUNr
Reviews.Content: We booked the Easter Promo, $100. per night, and stayed Thursday, Friday and Sat. nights (excellent price for Downtown Toronto). We were given a room on the 17th floor, close to the ice machine and elevator which could be heard from inside the room but still quite adequate. The room was clean and comfortable, although the double beds are a bit small and not as comfy as some have said. The Hotel location is ideal, we parked at the lot across the street (as others have said, it is much cheaper than the hotel Valet parking). For the price we were quite content. However, that changed as bed-time approached. We were traveling with our daughter who has been quite sick but is now recovering. This weekend was a little trip for her, to relax, see a show, and buy a couple of new outfits (she lost some weight while sick). Unfortunately a group of young men were put into the room next door, there seemed to be quite a few of them (couldn't have all been guests at the hotel). They were rowdy and noisy while pre-drinking before they went out around 11:30PM. So, we figured that was the end of it. It wasn't. They were back again around 3 am, even rowdier, throwing ice cubes at the walls and it seemed they were looking for a fight. There was an altercation outside our door around 3:30 am and they were gone again......I believe one of them made a cell phone call and the quote was "we re coming for you and your family, expletive, expletive". At this point I called the desk for Security. I'm not sure if Security arrived but I heard the group leave to the elevator shortly after this. Somewhere around 4 am some of them came back and seemed to go to bed, then around 4:30-5 am one of the rowdier ones returned and seemed to be still looking for a fight. After about 30 minutes they settled him down and that was it for the night. During this time I phoned the desk again and requested a room change if we were going to have the same neighbors for the next 2 nights. They were very apologetic and told us they would move us to a higher floor (club level) with complementary club lounge privileges. We were pleased with this and 1st thing in the morning we accepted the offer and were moved to a room on the 40th floor. The room was pretty much the same (quite decent) and we took advantage of the complementary club lounge privileges in the mornings by enjoying the Continental +++ buffet style breakfast. It was very good. The room seemed a little on the warm side and seemed to really stay steamed up after the 3 of us showered (maybe the exhaust fan wasn't working?) but no big deal. The first night we spent in this room was fine. The 2nd night was different. A group of young people (19-20 year old - my guess) were having a party. Started at about 10 PM and went on until I went down to the desk (12:30-1 am). Again there seemed to be a lot of people who were likely not Hotel guests and people were making calls outside our door giving more people directions on how to get there. Again the desk people were very apologetic and Security shut it down quickly around 12:30 PM- 1 am. They all left and we didn't hear anything else until their arrival back around 3:30 am......... not much really just one or 2 token expletives. As I said, the staff was very apologetic and said they would assign some star points to my account that I could use for a free night stay in the future. I checked earlier and the points were not there but there was a disclaimer that said it could take 7-10 days for points to show up. Maybe it was just luck of the draw, but only 1 nights sleep out 3 left us pretty disappointed. We did appreciate the efforts made by Hotel staff but because this was a weekend for our daughter we really wanted for everything to be better. Probably won't stay here again. I know that this kind of thing happens, not sure what the solution is ???

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, however...”
Reviews.Author: citygirl0827
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked on hotwire a 1 king room. Compared to the prices from the Sheraton website, we got a total steal! We stayed only for one night, but we didnt want to pay the ridiculous prices for hotel parking, so we parked across the street. Its literally a 30 second walk from the parking lot to the hotel. Weekend rates are amazing! We only paid $13 for parking compared to $45+tip. When we walked in, it was very clean and service was fast. Room was very nice, however the bathroom was small, and the counter space was very minimal.There wasnt really enough room for my make up bag, and his toiletry bag (toothbrush, razor, deodorant, ect). The bed was very comfortable, however the pillows were very soft and the minute you put your head on the pillow, you sink. My boyfriend and I had to put two pillows to get the right firmness. We had some drinks with us, so we called down to the front desk to ask if we could have a fridge (at an extra $20 fee), however they didnt have any more left, which is odd because most hotels come with a fridge! Anyways, we had to fill up the sink with ice to keep our drinks cold. Also, room service prices are just absolutely ridiculous! $18 for a continental breakfast? $30 for bacon and eggs? Give me a break. If you go down to the restaurants, their prices are about $5-$10 cheaper, depending on what you get. Around 7pm we went to the hotel restaurant, however what I noticed was a lot of "hoodlums" (baggy pants, over sized clothes) hanging around the main lobby. It looked like they were doing a drug deal, but Im not too sure. I dont know if they were hotel guests, but they would hang around near the doors and it made me feel very uncomfortable because they would just stop and stare at me as I walked by them and they would hiss at me. I didnt feel very safe in the hotel in that aspect and I needed to have my boyfriend with me if I wanted to go down to the lobby for whatever reason. My boyfriend suggested to me that because it is very centrally located downtown, they are just probably hanging out since everything else is closed. After dinner when we went back to our room, our floor (and especially our hallway) REAKED like weed!!! At that point in time I was kind of disgusted. I did call front desk about it and they said that they would handle the situation accordingly. After going out for the night, we arrived back at around 3am and noticed that our hallway didnt smell like weed anymore, which I was very pleased about. Our sleep was amazing (despite the pillow situation) and we were graciously given a late check out at 1pm. Overall, our stay was fine. We made the most out of our stay and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “An average attempt to modernize an old hotel”
Reviews.Author: GuybrushJo
Reviews.Content: I'd picked this hotel as I'm an SPG member and went via marketing image and SPG price guarantee. Location is great and convenient to get around to. However this place had undergone an attempted refurbishment. Parts of the Lobby were modern whilst other area were just like a shopping center. This hotel connects to shopping centers and food court. Room: Bed was nice however decor was a very standard. Toilets were also old. The biggest complaint has got to be the hallway towards the room. As you walk from the elevator it is quite depressing. Ask to be on Level 26 and above. I had three rooms booked. L7, L25 and L26. L7 and L25 isn't great at all. Price: I booked and spoke to an SPG rep. Price guarantee was definitely not guaranteed. Upon booking (not prepaid mind you) I contacted SPG on the discrepancies of $100+ vs Expedia and maintain my booking. They said log via the website and all will be sorted, which I did then it was responded with rejection. Expedia will get you better price. I should have cancelled at no cost and go with Expedia. Not recommended for the price, I moved onto other hotels after 2 nights. Checkout the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Someone Tell These Folks What A 4* Hotel Is Plz!”
Reviews.Author: Sheikyerbooty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 4th time in 2 years. Two nights on a weekend. Was given a standard room on the 24th floor. Booked through Hotwire, and paid $100.oo taxes incl. a night. Upon check-in we were offered club level rooms for $60.00 more a night but declined. Nothing wrong with the hotel or common spaces, but the room we were given was not up to 4* standards, it was more in the 2.5 to 3* range in my opinion. The furniture was worn, every bureau or nightstand was touched up with brown paint to hide scratches, there was only one phone in the room, and it was on the work desk, so you if you called for a wake up call, you had to get out of bed to answer the phone. The room did come with an alarm clock, but it was not functioning properly, and the volume button was broken, so you only had one level of volume.....LOUD.No mini bar, very few amenties in the bathroom, all in all a real bare bones older room. I have stayed at some 2.5 - 3.5* properties in the city, that had much nicer rooms with many more amenties. The room was clean, and the beds were comfy, though I did request a firmer pillow the 2nd night, and was told they did not have any firm pillows, but they could send up more of the ones we didn;t like if we wanted (love the logic of that one). This might have been a "Hotwire/Priceline" room, as some hotels seem to reserve the rooms no one wants (this one was close to the elevator and ice machine), or rooms that have yet to be updated to third party customers. I know the manager of this hotel responds to these reviews sometimes, I'd like to know exactly what your policy is for customers who have, as your check-in clerk described it...a pre paid reservation, because in this case I certainly did not get what I would describe as a 4* room. I will most certainly return to this hotel for business in the future, hopefully things will have gotten better room wise.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - will stay at another hotel next time.”
Reviews.Author: georgian08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel overnight while on a business trip. The rooms were supposedly recently renovated. While the furniture was updated, the bathroom marble counter top was stained and looked dirty. The cleaning crew left about a half gallon of water in the bottom of the tub. Three weeks prior to staying at this hotel, I had reserved a room with a king bed. When I checked in, I was told that a king bed was not a guarantee, just a request and they put me in a room with 2 double beds - just across from the ice and vending machines. So much for a peaceful night's sleep in advance of my business meetings. I needed to take a taxi to dinner - no one was available in the main motor area to secure one for me. Breakfast menu was overpriced relative to other nearby, similar hotels. Bed was comfortable. I have stayed at many Sheraton (Starwood) properties previously. This one was disappointing. I won't stay here again, especially since there are other similar hotels nearby for about the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Choice”
Reviews.Author: ejas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Centre for business and found the location very convenient, the staff friendly and helpful and the fitness centre very good. The rooms were okay - nothing special but clean and comfortable. Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcayer
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very comfortable beds and fantastic service. The staff is professional and attentive. The lounge on the 43rd floor was enjoyable and very clean. The service there is great too! The view is amazing! Although we had breakfast included and evening hors d'oeuvres in the lounge, we were never hassled for our ticket or room number before entering. It's a classy hotel and always has a busy lobby. The valet service was great! Check-in/check-out was quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Noisy restaurant above 10th floor; this hotel is popular with drunken hockey fans”
Reviews.Author: sfchris
Reviews.Content: I asked for a quiet room, and they put me on the 10th floor of one of the towers away from the ice machine and elevators. I had to spend several hours each day working from my room but this was made difficult by constant thumping and crashing above my ceiling. Construction noise from the street below is also currently a distraction. At first, I thought the noise above my room was the maids cleaning, but it went on all day, every day. Finally I took the elevator one floor up to find that the entire eleventh floor is a restaurant! Sure enough, I heard that thumping from above even in the hallway of the 10th floor . In my opinion, this hotel has no choice but to forget about using that 10th floor for guests. Otherwise they are are really doing their guests a disservice. They are quite a busy hotel, so if you arrive late you will probably be stuck on that floor. Note that this will probably not impact your sleep quality as the noise seems to start around 10 am or later. Another comment about this hotel is that there are quite a few partiers using it when the Leafs are playing hockey, staying up until 3am. Finally, they offer automated checkout, but do not deliver your folio to your room, like other Sheratons do, and the lines are long. I am now waiting in a voicemail queue to have my folio emailed to me. That's kind of silly.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty from the beginning to the end!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vandenheja
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! We stayed Saturday night to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and to attend a concert at the Air Canada Centre. From the minute, we booked to the morning we left, the staff couldn't do enough. The signature beds with their wonderful duvet would be a dream if I could only have this at home. The Hotel is so close to everything -we walked to shopping, excellent restaurants (Canyon Creek on Front Street) and the Air Canada Centre was an easy walk. We had a night cap and dessert at the Sheraton restaurant and were impressed with the quick service and presentation of the food. We arrived Saturday morning early and left Sunday at 10am â€“we parked across the road at City hall and paid $16 for parking for our entire stay. Easy access. We are travellers who travel regularly all over the world and we would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family. Congratulations to all Sheridan staff-job well done and you do deliver happiness to your customers. .

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel, great staff, what a joy!!”
Reviews.Author: JSP2011
Reviews.Content: Right from when we entered the hotel I was treated well. Brian at the registration desk upgraded us to the 40th floor with free Lounge access and free Internet for no additional charge - super service. The food and service at the Lounge was superb - very impressive. They have an automatic expresso machine there that I must have used 1/2 dozen times over 3 days. Their evening hor d'oeuvres were delicious and their morning buffets were great - I think I gained a few pounds while there. My daughter loved their indoor/outdoor pool - it was a little busy but was expected since it was March Break. Can't say enough good things about our stay there. Thank you Brian and the rest of the staff at the Sheraton. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great down town hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liam30london
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my girlfriend. For my 30th the hotel is lovely looking inside very big and airy. The staff are very nice and only to happy to help. The rooms are big bright and airy lovely beds if a little small. Very clean. Bathrooms were clean and towls where changed daily. There's plenty of lifts so you never wait long. My only problem as with all hotels is that there bar down stairs is very very over priced and the bar staff are hit and miss when it comes to politeness. As for location. You don't get much better you 2 mins from the eaton center shopping center. 5 mins from the Gary hound bus garage for buses to niagra falls. Oh and you have to try shoppys down stirs from the hotel they do great Breackfast.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lanatasha
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed one night in the Sheraton, we got a great deal on Hotwire DOT com The rooms are so clean, the staff AMAZING! The beds were so comfortable! Like sleeping on a cloud! Bring a bathing suit because they have a MASSIVE pool! You are close to EVERYTHING downtown Toronto, 2 minute walk from the Eaton Center!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ihgelap
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 days and very happy with our stay and the service. Rooms were quite, clean, with a nice view of the new town hall and CN tower (we changed room after the 3rd night). Excellent location in the middle of Toronto, easy and convenient access to anywhere in the city center. Service was great, I came down twice daily to get some hot water (for baby formula) at the restaurant and coffee shop, and the folks were very helpful. The free Wifi at the lobby was great, plenty of seating spaces, and very reliable. We ended up extending the stay via Priceline, because the thing that we need to do in Toronto couldn't finish in time. We were a little late, so the original room was assigned to another guess, which turned out to be a good thing, as we were upgraded to higher floor and even got access to the club lounge :) When we're moving room, my infant daughter was just started her afternoon nap, and the front desk let us stay for late check out. We also got a call from the room service, when we accidentally left a pair of jeans at the previous room. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: JayTea
Reviews.Content: I live in Toronto and rarely stay at our hotels but my furnace broke on one of the coldest nights of the year so I headed for the Sheraton. I was upgraded to The Club level which was great - a beautiful suite and one of the largest guest lounges I have ever seen. Everyone from the front desk to the bartender in the lounge were friendly and helpful. Good stuff, Sheraton City Centre for showing off Toronto so well!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: NBPSmall
Reviews.Content: My 8-year old daughter and I stayed 6 nights at the Toronto Sheraton Hotel the week before school started 2010. This location was a great starting point for tours around Toronto and shopping. Located near several subway stations, you can get anywhere from here. Great salt-chlorinated pool too, wonderful for people who have asthma. We also enjoyed the view of the CN Tower and the light show everynight.

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: nasimn
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. Despite early advice that one of us had allergies to feathers, the room had feather pillows and duvet. thank god did check and not rely on the hotel, otherwise I would be hospital bound. Asked for teabags as I am not a coffee person, teabags never arrived for 2 days. this is the new Marriot Service in Downtown Toronto Pretty upset. they tried to make it up with cheeze platter and wine. Visit to the hospital would have been disastrous. Parking cost $45 per day. Ripoff. Please double check your requests especially if you have health issues as these places do not take them seriously unless they end up in court.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 1trpRCD
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on the PATH, the convenience of the underground walkway was fantastic. We were able to walk just about everywhere we wanted and not need a coat. Would reccommend this hotel if you are looking for a getaway for shopping and seeing downtown Toronto. Pool was fantastic it was neat to swim outside in the winter surrounded by snow! My kids loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: First of all it's a sheraton and hence it's expected to be of high quality. And to be honest, it has really come up to our expectations. It's located right at the heart of Toronto, next to the malls, the opera and a tiny Italian restaurant at the corner which is run by a Greek chap. Rooms, specially if you can secure one at the higher floors, have a great view of the city and they are really spacious. It's only 5 minutes cab ride from the Toronto tower and as said before it's pretty much close to everything. Next time in Toronto, will be a sheraton time again!

Reviews.Title: “March Break”
Reviews.Author: KarenSmith43
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing stay. I got a great $100.00 deal. There was a little line at the front desk and the manager Abbygail pulled me from the back of the line as she saw I was traveling with 2 small children. She gave me a flyer with all sorts of things for my 5 and 7 year old to do in the loby. She also suprised me with free tickets to see disney on ice for me and my 2 kids. She asked if I needed the room with 2 double beds, which I really didn't and she upgraded me to a suite with a seperate living room whcih was really nice to have. This was my first trip alone without my husband. The food and pool was amazing!!!!! When we went to see the ice show we ended up running into Abbygail. She was sitting next to us with her small daughter. She watched my son while I took my daughter to the bathroom in the middle of the show. She also walked back to the hotel with us to show us the way! Thank you so much Abbygail!

Reviews.Title: “Great, central place to be. Accessible room ok but needs refreshing.”
Reviews.Author: Ta10p
Reviews.Content: Our late arrival may have complicated matters as there were a few conventions in the hotel that particular week-end. We had booked an accessible room but (I assume) as my bride was able to walk a little, desk staff tried very hard to have us accept a regular room. After the 3rd time I said we needed a room where she did not have to climb over the edge of the bathtub and still they wanted us to go see the room to make sure! I said: "No. Just give us an acceessible room please" after which they did! The 14th floor corner room was very comfortable and offered a great view! Very near the elevator is a bonus. Older design philosophy showed; the safe was exactly where one would hang their clothes in a designed for handicapped closet. Roll in shower was very well designed but the plumbing was old and leaked. Nowhere to put your soap, shampoo, etc in the shower area itself but a little wheeled cart is there so you can have everything near. The mirror over the large round sink is too far and not tilted down so very hard to use. A low mounted mirror on an extendable arm would go a long way here! Hotel staff is great, very helpful information desk attendee as well. Love the indoor/outdoor pool and the 3rd floor spa.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkJacky
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Sheraton, and everything was great. The room was spotless and all the staff were welcoming, kind and friendly. A minor problem with the safe in our room was dealt with immediately and courteously. The location is very good - walking distance of the CN Tower and there is an underground walkway to the Eaton Shopping Centre and the subway. This hotel places a premium on customer service, and we were very comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Main_Critic
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby and good underground connections to major shopping. Standard room and furniture. Excellent staff at check-in. Hotel is older, but has extensive renovations to lobby and rooms. Bathrooms and halls could stand a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Moose_the_explorer
Reviews.Content: We booked off Hotwire and got a great deal for the one night. We had a bit of trouble actually finding a place to park while we checked in but it wasn't a huge problem. We parked across the street as it is much cheaper than parking at the hotel itself, plus there is an indoor walkway that takes 2 minutes to reach the carpark across the road so you don't even need to go outside. Our room was nice, but unfortunately they had no king beds left so my husband and I had a room with two double beds. We checked out the menu for breakfast but it was incredibly expensive, as was the room service menu. We didn't get a chance to use the pool but it looked really nice. Overall it was a great stay in a really nice hotel in a prime location, but any extras will definitely cost a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: youthquake
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton branch has really outdone itself in terms of service. I got married in Toronto two years ago, and although the wedding was held elsewhere, all of my family and friends stayed here. Everyone found the staff very helpful, and we were so well looked after, especially by Tammy. Back again for another stay two years later, Tammy remembered us, and spoilt us rotten once again. Literally, the best service i've ever encountered in a hotel... Location great, comfy rooms, I cannot recommend this hotel enough..

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Clock”
Reviews.Author: baddog11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay until the last day. We had an early flight and asked for a wake-up call. Never got one. Thankfully, I woke up in time to make the flight. This the second time time this has happened at a Sheraton property. Although I [or was] am a Sheraton preferred guest, I will never stay at a Sheraton property again. Dr. Tom Barker

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Rob3847214
Reviews.Content: Everyone at Sheraton Centre was very helpful. I especially want to thank George Salim and Dimtrius Galanos for their good service to ACJS Community College section in our reception Well done guys!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Lainey2745
Reviews.Content: Received theatre tickets for Christmas - so went to the city on Valentines Weekend. Stayed at the Sheraton Centre and had a wonderful time. Saw Billy Elliot which was hugely disappointing but the Hotel made up for that. Excellent service - everyone is happy and obviously likes their job - from the front desk to the chambermaids - big smiles and all round pleasant. Wonderful indoor/outdoor pool. The food was great - breakfast was included and it was elegant - healthy, fresh. Had drinks at the main lobby bar and everyone was so friendly. Parked across the street at city parking, which is attached to the hotel and saved 50% on parking. Thanks Sheraton Centre

Reviews.Title: “Never again, a hotel full of glitches, or is it just bad management?”
Reviews.Author: geocz
Reviews.Content: There is certainly nothing wrong with the physical aspects of the hotel. My issue is with the hotel management. We booked the hotel through expedia. When we arrived we were told the king room we had booked was not available - even the reception desk manager came over and explained to me that booking through expedia did not guarantee the king room - reluctantly we had to take another room. (I contacted expedia later and they advised me our room was in fact guaranteed. Expedia then contacted the Sheraton and told me they were advised that the hotel had a computer glitch and they did not show a king room had been booked - a different story than I was told by the hotel management!). Eventually we got to our room. About 30 minutes later someone opens the door to our room - they had booked into the hotel and were given the same room as us (this not only happened to us but to others as well). We did get a subsequent call from reception apologising for the glitch and offering some financial compensation. On check out they had errors on our hotel bill - they charged us for services that had been prepaid. The bill was corrected, they apologised for the glitch and I settled up. Later when I checked my credit card bill there were other charges on my account from the hotel. I called the hotel and they told me there were room service charges against our room - I told them we did not have room service and that I had settled my account in full when we checked out. On further checking they advised there was a glitch and the room service charges were charged to my credit card in error and they would be reversed. I have never stayed at a hotel with so many glitches. My thought is perhaps there was a glitch when they hired the current hotel management?

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Downtown”
Reviews.Author: righttimes
Reviews.Content: Very good location for Business meetings room and conference area,heart of downtown toronto, very high level of service, neat rooms,very good and clean area, value for money. Lots of indoor activates for romantic couple to enjoy with.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the Sheraton made this stay an awful experience.”
Reviews.Author: steff56822
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for a well run hotel, with a courteous staff. Firstly, we had 2 rooms reserved. One was ready at 7:30pm- the other was not ready until after 10:30pm at night!!! Secondly, the staff at the Sheraton Toronto was rude and out of line; they do not care about their customers, or quite frankly, their reputation. I spoke to two managers about an incident that transpired during our stay and rather than do anything to satisfy me, the customer, they did not even want to look into the incident- telling me to deal with someone else at the office who was of course not there that day. I plan to take this incident up with head office,but I would urge others not to stay at the Sheraton Centre Toronto if you are looking for a good experience in customer service. If you do have a problem, expect to be ignored and passed off to other individuals.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever!”
Reviews.Author: MattywrightDurham
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel ight in the middle of town. Just off the longest street in the world with loads of shops and a massaive shopping centre across the road! Underground city can take you any where with out seeing the light of day or any bad weather. Little shops and plenty of places to eat on the cheap down there. Trams in the town are great and so is the subway system. Room in the hotel was massive great view out of the window of town hall. As ive stopped here before i tell you the view form the other side of all the city and the cn tower are great too. The dinning experence in the hotel is great, breakfast buffet with any thing you can think of and the steak house was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: DavidLF
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days early February 2010. An annual trip (usually with my son but solo this year due to his Uni commitments) to watch the Leafs, other hockey, Rock & Raptors, but my first stay at the Sheraton. Got a great deal via British Airways which cut the price a lot and made it a good value stay. The location is perfect - skate at Nathan Phillips Square just opposite, few minutes walk to Queen subway and directly part of the PATH system - so if you don't want to go out you can stay underground all the way to the ACC! It's a big place and very busy but never felt crowded. Lots of amenities altho eating and drinking is expensive even for Toronto standards. Staff were great - checked me in early on the Thursday I arrived. No queue and I'm an SPG member so very helpful. 1 small problem while I was there with the safe not locking. Their response was to make me believe they felt like this issue could ruin my whole holiday and so do whatever to get it fixed making me feel like their No.1 priority for that moment. It was a great experience at having a (small) problem resolved v quickly. Perfect customer service and some, so well done Dino Sepe! The bars and restaurants in the complex are good standards (if a little expensive), sauna and pool area was good too. Rooms are spacious and clean, beds comfortable, TV etc. just right so overall a great place to stay which I'd highly recommend. If the price is right I'll definitely stay here next year - when I'm in T.O. twice! Although a regular visitor, as on my own this year I visited Casa Loma, Distillery District, St Lawrence Market & The Zoo which were all brilliant! Feel free to ask any questions & I'll help if I can.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: michiganistan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing-excellent service! We waited to check in for about 3 minutes (which was not a big deal at all to us) but the concierge apologized and kept throwing in complimentary things, and waiving fees for us. We used hotwire, and the price we ended up paying was ridiculously underpriced and made us almost feel bad for the hotel, it was an amazing deal! Our room looked like a suite, and the view was pretty nice from the 36th floor. All in all this hotel was extravagant, I would strongly reccomend if you're in the area and need a nice place to stay, this is it-two restaurants and a shopping mall in it, too, ladies :-) Toronto is such a fun city, you really don't need much cash as the subway system is like two dollars each way, and the city is bustling with diversity. We stopped in nearby Cabbagetown to snap a few photos since many movies were set here because of the Victorian rowhouses and unique style. All in all, it was an excellent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I expected - great!”
Reviews.Author: AverageTravelGal
