Reviews.Content: Spent a Saturday night at the Sheraton in February. Parking prices listed on the hotel website were very high ($35) so we drove till we found a lot. Found a great spot on York Blvd. between Richmond and Queen. $25 for underground monitored parking RIGHT across the street from the hotel. It took us about 3 minutes to get to the lobby! I would not use the valet parking. It was so packed - even Lewis Hamilton would have had a hard time getting out of that lot without a scratch on his bumper!!! There was quite a lineup to check in at 4:00 pm. We waited about 10 minutes in line, but every available staff was working the desks, and someone came around with bottled water for the line. Check in clerk needed the names of every party staying in the hotel and ran it thorugh their system. We were told that our room key cards would be deactiviated at midnight (is this just on weekends or because we were young??) and that we would have to check in after midnight if we were not already in our rooms. We did end up coming back at about 3 am but it took just a second for them to reactivate our card. The room was very nice. Comfy beds and clean. Bathroom was very nice and tidy. A call to front desk for a housecoat was quickly delivered. Beautiful view from our room of the top of the CN tower and of the outdoor heated pool! There was a bit of a gap under the room door, and I could hear people leaving in the morning. Not very loud, but I have stayed in more sound rooms. The prices for food were insane. The room service menu was nuts - so I would assume that the restraunts in the lobby were too! Overall beautiful hotel that was big and full of people! Would stay again if I found another great rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location for city explorer”
Reviews.Author: lanc_red
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for 2 nights. Having checked the reviews on here & managing to get a cheap deal through otel.com I chose this hotel. My only pre-concern was the parking charges. $45 a night for valet seemed real expensive so sought a different option. I found that there is a parking lot opposite the hotel on Queen Street West that charges roughly $20 for 24 hour period. On arrival we parked in the mentioned garage. There is an entrance for the Sheraton Centre on the first level so you dont even have to go overground. On entrance to hotel I was impressed by the decor & cleanliness throughout. The checkin clerk was helpful & because I had recently signed up as a SPG member he offered us a choice of room. We opted for a single Queen. The room was spacious enough for 2 people & the amazing view from the 31st floor looking at the financial district. The room had a decent sized LCD with a decent channel selection. There were a few sports channels so I was happy enough. The bathroom was clean. The room also had a safe & iron/ironing board. The internet was charged at $14.95 per day, but we didnt purchase. The hotel is in walking distance of Yonge Street & Dundas Square. CN Tower, Rogers Centre & Air Canada center are walkable, but it can take around 30 mins. Stop off at a Tim Hortons along the way for a caramel mocha! Checkout was easy & no additional charges were applied. The parking cost for around 40 hours was $46. Half the price of would it would have cost at the Sheraton Valet parking. They probably use this same parking lot. Overall id stay at this hotel again should I be able to get the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “great winter break”
Reviews.Author: pbettyrrn
Reviews.Content: immaculate rooms with great view of city hall and the skating rink below.They are trying to be green in all aspects but a chilly lobby and hallways were noticeable as heat seemed to be turned down. Great breakfast buffet on the second floor with custom omelletes and lots of fresh fruit and goodies. Nice and large fitness room and pool. A big convention type hotel but right at the heart of the downtown theater and shopping area. Next ot the beautiful Bay Store that has all the latest in fashion. A good winter escape for us !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: aero_world
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is right at the heart of the action in Toronto, connected directly to the underground PATH system which is important during the cold winters. My room was clean, bright, and had a nice view of city hall right across the street. The service was okay - nothing to write home about and it certainly wasn't bad. For convenience and a good solid comfortable place to stay, this place can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “No Wifi??”
Reviews.Author: nagronam
Reviews.Content: That's right. No wifi--at least in my room. They had ethernet but I have a Mac Book Air and the adapter didn't work. So, I walked through the PATH system (great!) to the Eaton Centre and bought a $40 router from the The Source. I connected it and I had a great personal network going--well, I imagine another 50 or so guests suddenly had WiFi as well --then--to my shock and horror a "Datavalet" page comes up and announces a nearly $20 fee for internet service for 24 hours. Stuff it!! I tethered my iPhone 4 and used it for my internet provision. Good hotels and bad hotels alike all provide free wireless to guests--but not this place. It soured the entire stay and it got me thinking: I like to fall asleep to the sound of running hot water in the bathroom-and awaken to it 9 hours later when I'm feeling ripped-off--I'd never treat myself to something like that at home; it'd cost a small fortune but this hotel likely has the cash garnered from guests without smartphones and tethering ability. Sheraton!!! It's 2011! Get Real! The rooms are nice the beds are great, the corridors in the tower are....dated. The general appearance and ambience is most alluring--but I can't stop thinking about the wifi.....hmmm?

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: excobra_driver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend (Thurs - Sun). Staff were very pleasant. Close by but not in your way. Cleaning staff wanted to accommodate our routine when cleaning room. Room was spacious and in very good condition. We did not dine in any of the onsite restaurants, but they appeared fine. Heated pool extends to outdoors for indoor or outdoor conditions. Whirlpool was large, but the jets were not strong. The poolside shower did not have shampoo, but it was quickly refilled after being mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. A good hotel if you do not mind a convention type atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: jjkathome
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on various occasions over the years. I completed a recent stay and cannot find any significant faults with the hotel. The rooms are of decent size (stayed in a regular club level room), the club lounge is quite large and has an impressive view. I have never been able to take advantage of the food offerings due to my schedule, so cannot really comment on the food. The hotel is connected to the PATH system and is convenient to most major businesses downtown, as well as shopping. However, everytime I have stayed, is usually very busy. The hotel has a very convention hotel atmosphere, which I do not particularly like, and the lobby is usually packed with people. There is a link cafe in the lobby as well. No real complaints, except that it is a little too large and a little too busy for my tastes. They do have a SPG Gold - Plat line which is actually utilized, so those with status can check in and out a little quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to stay during cold days”
Reviews.Author: gianao
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great for shopping during winter since most of the shopping (Eaton Center) is also connected by underground tunnels with tons of shopping / cafes / fastfood / souvenier stands. Typical Sheraton Hotel - staff was helpful, room service was prompt and good but pricey and all amenities were good. Internet in the room has a charge but if you use it from the Lobby, its free. Awesome location!

Reviews.Title: “less than a normal sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Steevthetraveller
Reviews.Content: as sheraton have always the basics , i don't know about this one or it might be the country itself my only complain was the cleaness of the rooms , specially the toilet the other thing , they charge for a call of 17 min to vancouver which they claim to be a long distance call , they charge 23 $ !!!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like 2nd-class citizen”
Reviews.Author: ohlradio
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of travel and have never had such a poor check-in experience. Most hotels have express lines for its high-end loyalty members, I get it, understand it and have no problem with it. When I approached the check-in counter there were 2 spots open for gold/platinum customers and one for regular. One of the express spots opened up, and I was the only person waiting. But the clerk had to take care of some computer work first, and said she'd be right with me, fine. But while I waited, someone came into the express lane. So she took him instead and said "someone will be right with you". Then when the person on the regular lane was done with their customer, that person said "Someone will be with you in a moment" and she left! Now there was nobody handling non-gold/platinum customers. Three more express-lane customers came along, so I was continually passed over. Two more non-gold/platinum customers joined the line and we just looked at each other in disbelief. Finally, after there were no more express-lane customers I got my chance to check-in. If my reservation was not pre-paid, I would have walked! They didn't know it was pre-paid as I stood there in line. I understand giving your high-end loyalty customers preferential treatment, but to SNUB others is something I have never seen. I was amazed there was nobody handling the non-gold/platinum customers. Once I finally got my room, it was obvious I was put into the older part of the hotel. The carpet in the room is stained, the area where the ice/pop machine is was cordoned off with plastic and a sign. The hotel's high-speed internet access is $15/day, which is common for hotels of this type in large urban centers. I have no problem with this. But the hotel's website says there is a higher bandwidth option for an additional fee. When I connected there was no mention of this higher bandwidth option. It is a very nice hotel. Lots of restaurants, great location, etc. but I think there needs to be some major work done in the area of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great ! Especially Location”
Reviews.Author: davidplustanya
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great hotel. Friendly staff, great amenities and in good condition. Pool was especially neat because they leave the outdoor section open during the winter. Gym equipment in the fitness center was all very modern and updated. Favorite thing about this hotel was the location. I'm a pretty fast walker, and comfortable walking longer than most people, but we didn't have to take a taxi anywhere once. The PATH network connected to the hotel came in handy. I'd recommend Shopsy's which can be accessed via the hotel (you'll see signs) their smoked meat was great! Only knocks on the hotel I could say was that the rooms were a little on the small side, but maybe I'm just used to having bigger rooms. Also the fact that they chage very high amounts for internet. Then again, if you really had to search something up you could always bring your laptop to the lobby (free wi-fi) or use the business center computers free for 45 mins. 5/5 !

Reviews.Title: “Nice centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctlshaw
Reviews.Content: My second time staying at this hotel, though I hadn't been here for several years. Standing right across from Toronto City Hall, the location of this Sheraton is excellent. Very close to shopping restaurants, TTC and maybe a 10 minute walk to the Porter Airlines shuttle pickup at the Fairmount Royal York. The quality of the hotel is above average. I really like the look of the lobby, which for me seems modern, business and grandiose but others might not feel the same way. There is a Link@Sheraton computer setup in the lobby which was always extremely busy but the setup was nice. There are two towers, Richmond and Queen. I stayed in the Queen towers. Being an SPG member I was put on a higher SPG floor overlooking the city hall plaza. The room itself was standard but nice. I don't know what it is about Starwood bathrooms but the toilet water pressure always seems low. The bed itself was fine for sleeping. Unforunately, I was awaken by a middle of the night fire alarm which went of for about 45 minutes. This was also alluded to in a review just before mine. It was highly annoying but it only happened once out of the my four night stay. Internet is not free but I was comped for my stay. The speed was good. I intereacted with the staff at the front desk and the bell and they were all accomodating espcially when I went a day after refusing a late checkout to change my mind. Overall, it's a nice hotel. I would stay again for business as it is a company preferred hotel, but I'm not sure I would do it on my own dime.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location...but alarms ruined sleep.”
Reviews.Author: tales84
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here Dec 18-19th...we were supposed to stay 17th-18th but because of missed flights they kindly swapped one of our nights for us. The room was decent...quite small but clean and cosy and a very comfortable bed (we spent the whole first day sleeping from jet lag anyway). It is in a decent location- a short walk to restaurants and shops and tranport. The restaurant upstairs was lovely to eat at for breakfast and we had a nice pub meal at the irish pub there. The only issue we had was fire alarms going off. There had been a msg on our phone to warn us of these but we hadnt checked the message. The alarms went off at some crazy time at the morning (like 3am) and we kept getting alarms and announcements for nearly 45 minutes! And of course the sound of fire trucks. We were then awoken later in the morning (from memort some time between 8 and 10) and the same thing happened! This was very disappointing and think some compensation should have been made. Other than this, I would definately recommend this hotel. The staff here are lovely too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice urban getaway”
Reviews.Author: Aerocraft67
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms, mom, dad, baby, and grandma, December 26â€“28. We reserved one night with Hotwire and had an unnecessarily difficult time extending the stay one additional night. I understand that the hotel does not hold sway over the Hotwire reservation but there was no reason for the hotel to give us such a hard time about adding an additional night, given that there was availability. Calling ahead shunted us back to Hotwire's system, which of course was unresponsive. Upon arrival, the front desk said it had no access to the rates available on the hotel's own web site, so it we suffered the ridiculous indignity of reserving the next night ourselves on one of the complementary computers in the lobby, then returning to the front desk to combine our reservations, as instructed, saving $50 per room per night over what the front desk was able to provide. After doing that and being assured that two reservations were combined and seamless, sure enough the keys expired the next day, just when a mad rush of new guests were coming in from massive travel delays, causing another completely unnecessary problem for us. The concierge reacted to my disgust and fixed the problem promptly so I appreciate that. Beyond all that the rooms were nice with nice views, although one was a bit small. The staff were courteous and helpful. The location is quite central, yet not in a "dead after 5:00" district you might find with other business hotelsâ€”other interesting neighborhoods and attractions are either walking distance or short and readily available cab rides away. Walking includes connectivity to the network of underground tunnels/malls, although our trip to the nearby Eaton Centre mall was disappointing. The indoor/outdoor pool is quite an attraction, especially in sub-freezing weather, but the staff was oddly militant about exiting the pool outside. Not entirely unreasonable, as it's icy, but getting out of the heated pool to test the freezing weather (briefly, of course), seemed like the most logical way to enjoy the outdoor feature, and there were otherwise no signs to the contrary (and there were no smoking signs, for instance). I wasn't bothered after an initial warning, so no worries, just weirdly contradictory. The breakfast buffet featured a generous spread but was very expensive, even by major hotel standards. Good, but not a good value. Several other restaurants owned or closely associated with the hotel were closed for the holiday season, which limited our options. We were referred to The Keg, a steakhouse down the street, which aptly served as a cocktail destination on the first night and dinner the next. No free internet in the rooms, which seems rather outdated. Plenty of people taking advantage of free WiFi in the lobby, though, including on a few hotel-provided computers. So some significant hassles but otherwise a nice hotel with courteous staff. Would stay again but probably would not seek it out especially. Would just as soon stay at the Fairmont Royal York down the street, or just try another 4-star hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great up until NYE problems...”
Reviews.Author: Mike_NCL
Reviews.Content: In all, this is a great hotel to stay in, centrally located, clean rooms and friendly staff. However, and here's the bit that's left the sour taste. As we were staying on New Years Eve, we expected a little noise from Nathan Phillips Square (we got a great room to watch the fireworks and event from) which quickly finished at about 12:30am, and maybe some other noise from revellers getting back in late - we don't have a problem with that, it's New Years Eve after all. What we didn't expect was there to be a party on the 43rd floor, the hotel to shut the lifts down to prevent anyone going to places where they shouldn't and revellers from upstairs using the 42nd floor fire exit to get up and down to the 43rd. Whilst shouting, squeeling and smashing glass. Did I mention this was right outside our room? Did I also mention that the hotel sent a letter to every resident the previous morning warning that there would be party patrols monitoring noise levels to check no one was having a party in their rooms? It took a call to security to sort it out, and even then the party didn't finish til 2:30 - which was meant to finish at 2am. We voiced our concerns on checkout that morning (New Years Day) to the Lobby Manager who was checking us out and who studiously took notes and asked if there was anything he could do to ensure we stayed at the Sheraton the next time we visited Toronto. I suggested that our breakfast that morning could be free (which he agreed to) and that next time at least give people the choice of room if an event is going to disturb residents. So, the reason I'm writing this today? I checked my credit card and we've been charged for breakfast that was apparently free (the balance would otherwise have been zero) and now I think I'd recommend the Hilton round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “friendly service and great view”
Reviews.Author: bikerpair2010
Reviews.Content: This being the 2nd time staying at this hotel, again the staff were awesome at check in. very courtasy as well when booking in... make sure you are a SPG guest and if not before going... sign up and you will be rewarded with a much superior room with an awesome view like we had. 29th floor overlooking the city hall. there was a false fire alarm at 4am and not sure if the hotel had everything under control until the fire department arrived. my only complaint is that the person on the intercom had difficulties with his english and I dont think that he was well trained to work the intercom because a lot of his messages were all broke up and missing parts as I think he would say something then push the button. ( i will be contacting the corporate management as this could be serious had a real fire exist) The information on what the problem was, was not relayed and so no one new if the alarm had been pulled by a prangster or if the hotel had inner issues with their system. this incident was isolated so I will be returning to this hotel in the future. The pool, exercise room is superior to others out there and the pool goes underneath a doorway to swim outdoors even in the winter. Quite cool to say the least. Bedding and ammenities are superior as well The business centre is free as well the parking is very expensive even off site.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel was a Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AcornOwl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for two nights on a spontaneous visit to Toronto just before New Years. Everyone from the Valet, to Check-In Clerk, to House-Keeping Staff, was helpful and cheerful. Our room was immaculate and quiet. We were near the top of the building and enjoyed the view of the other buildings, including the CNN Tower. The bed was comfortable and the shower was hot- we couldn't ask for more! The Conciergge Desk was especially helpful in getting us tickets to the Museums and making dinner reservations. Since the hotel was well situated, we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel but personable service”
Reviews.Author: Steph_260
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 2 days just before Christmas. I managed to get a cheaper rate thanks to one of the popular third party websites, and was quite pleased to have got the Sheraton Centre in Toronto. It is a large hotel - we were on the 30th floor, but I do believe there were many floors above us. Our room was smallish - one queen bed, a small tub-chair, desk and TV. The TV was a decent sized flat screen - and the picture quality was good too if you care about those things! There was a large stain on the floor by the chair - not great for a 4 star hotel, but I guess some wear and tear is to be expected in such a large hotel. The view from our room was wonderful - the CN Tower, financial district and even a small part of the lake could be seen. The bathroom was functional and very clean. The bed was comfortable, and the room temperature could be controlled with ease. The tea/coffee making facilities were decent too, with Starbucks coffee being the brand of choice. I used the gym,and must say this was not bad at all. All the equipment was very new and of good spec - although I didn't use the half indoor half outdoor pool! (It WAS minus 8 degrees outside! Although plenty of brave souls took a dip so I expect the water temperature was just fine). All the staff we came across were friendly and helpful, although the cleaning ladies were very noisey in thr morning! (Knocked on our door at 8am for room service, despite the 'do not disturb' sign being left on the door knob. They then came back about an hour later and did the same thing, before having what seemed to be a 2 hour chat outside in the corridor!). The parking is valet only - at a whopping $45 a day! I would suggest that unless you are made of money, use the municipal parking lots instead. $45 is outragious! Also, it costs $15 to use the Wifi in the rooms - go downstairs to the lobby and it's free for 40 minutes. Overall, a pleasant stay at this hotel. I imagine in the summer it is a lot more busy, and more noisey. However, our stay was lovely, and I would use this hotel again if I could get a good deal on it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whisus
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is a nice hotel, great for the orice we booked for. Staff are friendly and helpful. Checking in and out was fast and efficient. Very good location, everywhere you might want to go in downtown Toronto is within walking diatance. Might want to look at changing the hallway carpets, looking a bit shabby and stained. Pool is nice, can swim outdoors in the wintertime!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: BigLasagna
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on a great rate. This hotel is central to everything and you can't beat the attention to detail. The staff were very helpful. I asked for suggestions on places to visit at night and not only did the staff find places of interest, they called ahead to let the places know I was coming and we were treated like royalty. If you are staying in Toronto, and I do at least once a month, work through your hotel to get reservations at restos etc. as hotels like this are well connected.

Reviews.Title: “nice location , unpersonal service, crowdy”
Reviews.Author: Filipe2010
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton, is very well located, but is so business that we easily forgot that we are in a 5* hotel. Pros: I like the Gim, and the pool, de bed confort, the view in upper floor. I 've been in 38) Starbuck coffe in room. :-) Cons:Very noisy , room to room, the cleaning team needs some formation in cleaning. Crowd and not personal service at all. Breakfast is a mass in rush hour. Elevators very slow in rush hours.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: K2511
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a name your price hotel on priceline. I was a little disappointed to get the Sheraton as in the past I have not been overly impressed. I was visiting Toronto for my sister's birthday and when I checked in, I casually mentioned this to Pennepa at the desk. Later that evening my sister and I stopped by the desk to ask for a wine opener and Pennepa greeted my sister by name and wished her a happy birthday. We then went back to the room to find champagne, cheese, crackers and fruit and a birthday card for my sister. We were both very impressed and pleased. The hotel was clean and the rest of the staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel..”
Reviews.Author: daniel1583
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally comfortable and very good service, I recommend upgrading to club rooms for more services, the pool is a great area when the sun is out...recommend staying there

Reviews.Title: “Would highly reccomend staying in this exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy1940
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a week's holiday in Toronto as we often do.We chose this hotel after researching the many positive reviews and found it to meet all our expectations.It was very clean, staff and service extremely friendly and obliging,great sleep in a most comfortable bed in a large nicely furnished , quiet room.We found the view from the 24th floor was spectacular and the location very handy to everything.I would also like to comment on the friendliness of the staff in all the eating and drinking areas as well as the convenience of free use of internet.We will certainly stay there again and highly reccomend others to stay here as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sam_kr08
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre, is a great location. Suggest parking at the City hall parking, as you come down York - turn right on Queen West - do not turn into the Sheraton but continue just half a block and take the underground on the right side. Level one connects directly to the Concourse level of the Sheraton, along with underground shopping and Eaton Centre. The concierge do a great job, suggestions for local restaurants etc. Also, if need to get around - do not drive - take a taxi as parking in challenging in the downtown area. Restaurant: suggest a new one - Woodlot - serves both vegetarian and meat dishes, delicious and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Slipping a tad”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED with reservations: This is my 2nd review (the first 2 years ago). This is the 2nd largest hotel in Toronto and located at the crossroads of all 'things' in the city. So location wise, a good choice. Unfortunately, it's still big and impersonal with a variety of groups surfing in and out of the property. You'll find business men, holiday seekers and conference goers. This hotel is often your selection on Hotwire and Priceline. Our first room we discovered had water pooling on the carpet. The hotel quickly dispatched keys to a new room and had maintenance and housekeeping on the spot within 10 minutes. Good. They offered free breakfast for the inconvenience without any prompting. A nice touch. On the morning of the 2nd night, loud drilling on the floor above made doing working the room impossible, a call to manager quickly brought a response - an upgrade to a Suite as well as a $100 voucher for anything in the hotel. This again was quite nice and speaks to Sheraton's desire for guest satisfaction. The heavy traffic is taking it's toll on this older property. The biggest negative is the bedding, older mattresses, springs and ill fitting sheets made for lessor sleep quality. Overall, I would easily stay here again. Guest services were top notch but I'm scared to see the place in 2 years!

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Tetley69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the nights of November 19-21, 2010. Was able to secure a room thru bidding on Priceline. Otherwise I feel the hotel is a little too high priced and would never pay full rate. That's not a knock against this hotel but I truly do not think the majority of hotels should cost $200+ per night. I also find it puzzling how lower priced hotels offer freebies such as free local phone calls and free Internet but the hotels that charge more for their rooms tend to charge a substantial fee for services that should be complimentary IMO. The free wireless in the lobby wasn't all that reliable but they do provide free computers to use for a time limit of 45 mins max. So that was nice. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I guess my one complain about the rooms would be the walls seemed quite thin and you could hear the room next to you quite easily. However, I loved the fact the curtains kept the lights out and this was one of the better hotels where you could sleep in during the morning without feeling blinded by the morning light seeping thru your windows. You could hear traffic below (and we were on the 8th floor). The place is massive. Elevators were quick. Check-in/out was simple. Parked across the street in the City Hall Underground parking and paid $24 total for the Fri-Sun parking. Had we used the valet service, it would have cost us $45 per night ($90 total) PLUS tip. Definitely not worth it. Hotel is conveniently located. It's connected to the PATH which is amazing how you can literally walk underground throughout the city. We walked to the Eaton Centre which was packed. The lobby was beautiful. Many restaurants are close by. We ate at the Keg one night...a short walking distance down the road. Would stay here again if I won it again on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on you Sheraton - shabby, dirty and overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: GrumpyTraveller55
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel 3 to 4 times a year (not by choice). Every time I stay I phone in advance to ask for an allergy free room as I am allergic to feathers. Every time without exception I have had to wait from 3 to 6 - yes SIX HOURS for my room! There is no such thing as an allergy free room that I have seen. Simply removing the pillows and leaving a down filled duvet does not work. The rooms are dirty. On a stay in October where I had requested an early check in, I sat in the lobby until 6pm. Upon arrival in my room, I found a filthy bathtub, pubic hairs and .... lets say some unknown greasy film on the toilet seat, as well as a splattered mirror, filthy floor and of course feathers. On my stay in November I got my early check in the room was surprisingly clean, but of course there were feather pillows and duvet on the bed. But it gets worse. As a corporate guest, myself and my colleagues use a corporate credit card. I arrived early and had to use my personal credit card to secure the room. At checkout, the bill was paid with the corporate card. Six days after leaving, my personal credit card was charged. I have phoned on three occasions to find out that "it will take 14 days" to repair this!!! This after being promised on the second phone call that it had been fixed and being promised an email stating that my card had been credited - which I did not receive. Every stay is more unpleasant than the last. The rooms smell sour and the wall paper is peeling. The desk staff are somewhat snotty and also somewhat incompetent. Everything seems to be a big issue for them. I have stayed at hotels that are considerably less expensive and had very nice, clean rooms and much friendlier staff. Really, the Sheraton should be ashamed!

Reviews.Title: “Umkay”
Reviews.Author: Josh12300
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great place to stay but it was kinda one of those places that if you were there once there wasn't really anything else to see so there was no point in going back. But while I was there it was a great hotel, but could have a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - not much more to write home about”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel616
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, the location was great. Centered in the heart of the entertainment district and easily accessible from the highway, we were within walking distance of everywhere we intended to be over the weekend. Having driven in, I was very happy to have researched parking ahead of time and knew to avoid their valet parking at $45 per night. The circle drive was also quite chaotic at all times observed and I was pleased to not have to rely on their retrieval of our car upon departure. Directly across the street, very conveniently located, is an enclosed city parking lot (City Hall, I believe) where we parked Friday night through Sunday morning for $24 total. Aside from location, the other positive note to our experience was a very courteous and professional gentleman (Sean) who checked us in. Unfortunately, despite his assistance, we were unable to get a room anywhere near that of my 84-year old mother, who had checked in earlier that afternoon, despite the fact that our adjoining or "nearby" rooms request had been guaranteed when I made the reservation several weeks prior. I was offered an explanation of their cleaning/room availability procedures, but that did nothing to explain why my "guaranteed" request was not honored and my elderly mother was now in a different tower than my family. Our room was drab and dreary, clearly in need of some major renovation, but the hair all over the bathroom floor and in the tub upon our arrival took the cake for the most repulsive part of the in-room experience. Our rate of $129 as part of a block of rooms secured by our hosts for a family wedding seemed very reasonable when making the reservation after having found the rates to be much higher via the Sheraton website and discount hotel room finders. However, based on the quality of the room and the sheer number of hotels in that part of the city, I'm sure that there was a better/cleaner/friendlier option for us. Needing Internet use in the room for work purposes added another $14.95/day to our tab - plus taxes - because the advertised free wireless in the lobby was sporadic and unreliable. Lastly, with the exception of front desk and housekeeping, the staff was very unfriendly, acting like people who clearly don't like their work. Bell staff were blatantly rude. There was no official concierge at this property, but a desk in the lobby marked something like "tours/travel" was manned by 2 gentleman who were unable to direct us to an address (restaurant) listed as .7 km from the hotel and seemed put out by any request for assistance. All in all, I'd certainly check out other nearby hotel options, due to the great location, but I'd do my best to avoid this one on return trips to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location - EX concierge assistance - beds/rooms average”
Reviews.Author: HolsteinsRUs
Reviews.Content: We attended the Canadian Royal Winter Fair and toured the area for 5 days. The hotel lobby seems modern...but our room was quite "tired", the beds not the quality we've experienced at other Sheratons. The heat/cooling couldn't stabilize in room 776...Either hot or cold during the night...so it was sleepless for 4 nights. But.... the positives... hotel information desk was EXCELLENT. They booked shows, arranged a rental car to be delivered to hotel, recommended restaurants, were very familiar with attractions. They truly made up for the "average" room. The location is optimum...you are an easy walk from the theaters and entertainment district and also from shopping. Under the Sheraton, you can access an underground network to various shopping areas. There you can also exchange currency if necessary. The shuttle bus ride from the airport cost $17/person. We rented a car for 24 hours to tour Niagra Falls...overlapping to get us to the airport the next morning. Parking at the hotel costs $40/night. We parked across the street in a parking ramp for $25. We dropped the rental off at the airport for an additional $20. Eating - you won't be disappointed. There are numerous ( I mean lots) of eateries ranging from casual to fine dining within a short walk from the Sheraton. Taxi's were always waiting outside the door if you needed one.

Reviews.Title: “We will not stay there again.....”
Reviews.Author: kristinrn3
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed - especially when we called to have our room temperature fixed (it was 82 degrees in our room). The front desk stated that they would send someone up to fix it and the worker showed up with a fan. Was that supposed to help?!? Also, the attendent at the tourism desk was unfriendly and unwilling to put forth much of an effort.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Suprise”
Reviews.Author: Jen598
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for while attending a Rock of Ages show. Booked on Hotwire and got a great rate of $109CAN! Was a little leary after reading the other reviews but figured we couldn't beat the price and we were really only going to be sleeping there. The front desk staff were the most professional I have ever experienced (I believe his name was Goran). We were upgraded to a king bed room (from the 2 doubles we booked on Hotwire) on the 21st floor with a nice view of the city. The room was spacious and very modern. Loved the Starbucks coffee in the room and the nice toiletries. And the Keg is right around the corner! The Theatre was only a couple of blocks too. Great location for theatre/downtown!! Overall, a great stay! We have already booked The Sheraton again for our next trip to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Chuckelberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last night in Toronto before we flew back to England. Over the course of 3 weeks, we had stayed in many hotels in Toronto and this was the best one by far! We asked for a CN Tower view and to be on a high floor and we received both! We couldn't believe the beautiful view. Great hotel and we would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Oh so characterless - and who thought paper cups were a good idea?”
Reviews.Author: bcr1001
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant enough, very corporate hotel. It's a decent place to hold a conference, but oh so characterless. (I recognised the "artwork" on the walls from other Sheraton rooms in other cities. Beats me why they can't be bothered to get a few hundred different prints, rather than repeating the same dreary one over and over and over again). Room was clean, front desk service was good. I stayed on a high floor (35) and had a great view over Toronto. In-room internet was wired only and worked OK with some intermittent service. Swimming pool and fitness centre was great! What I just don't get, though, is why the value-engineers and bean counters think it's a great idea to skimp on the basic amenities. Why can't they provide decent toiletries? Why can't they provide anything better than a manky Starbucks paper cup to drink coffee out of? Why are there no glasses in the bathroom, just horrible cheap plastic things in cellophane shrink wrap? It degrades the whole experience, from arriving with the hopeful feeling you might be staying somewhere vaguely luxurious, to the depressing realisation you are staying in something more like a youth hostel where they make the beds nicely. Given the price of the room, it is just so unnecessarily mean to try and save a few cents here and there on cleaning the cups.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to attend a conference.”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun1946
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Although I was extremely busy attending conference sessions, I could get an inexpensive lunch by accessing the underground resturants. The banquet food was top shelf. The room more then comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but no heat”
Reviews.Author: GordonChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located one block from the Eaton Center and the Queen Street subway station. The King Street entertainment area, with Roy Thomson Hall and the twin legit theatres, are within walking distance also. In contrast to an earlier reviewer, I really enjoyed being across the street from City Hall with its hourly chimes. In mid-October the trees were turning which made the view even more striking. It would have been a wonderful experience, except for two rather important concerns: the hotel management had not yet turned on the heat though the temps outside had turned cold; and though we had been promised an upgraded room on the floor where the club lounge was located (documented by an email from many weeks previous), we were informed this was not available. I feel the hotel's management needs some improvement. They should not be making promises they cannot or will not keep, and they should review their penny-wise-but-pound-foolish miserly policy on providing heat. I doubt we will be staying here next time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent comfortable stay at the Sheraton Centre Toronto”
Reviews.Author: travbuddy_28
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton. I was traveling for a work conference. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious. The check in and check out was extremely efficient, and all of the staff were friendly and helpful. There are decent quick food options in the hotel as well as in the mall/shopping area attached to the hotel, but other options for food are just a short walk away. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Toronto and looking for a convenient place to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel; okay for tourists”
Reviews.Author: librarian5
Reviews.Content: This is a conference hotel so we felt a little out of place as tourists during the off-season, but the hotel had lots of great amenities like a top-notch pool and exercise room and numerous restaurants and shopping in the lobby or accessible through an enclosed walkway. The rooms were spotless and in good working order. The staff was very friendly with the exception of one surly waitress in one of the hotel restaurants. The hotel is walking distance to Union Station, CN Tower and shopping on Yonge St.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced with teeny tiny beds and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous_Traveler01
Reviews.Content: Staff members are friendly and helpful and the rooms are quiet, but.... I was there for a meeting and there were fire alarms two mornings in a row - FALSE alarms. One was at 3:30 AM and the other was just before 8 AM. They went off for a long time, too. A double bed in a 4-star hotel. Really? Bedrooms and bathrooms are tiny. Grimy bathrooms in the ballroom/meeting room areas. You can get a refrigerator, but you have to pay a delivery fee and a significant daily fee that I can't publish here, or the site won't publish my review. Parking rates are OBSCENE. Nowhere else in the entire world (literally) have I seen such expensive parking rates. I'd tell you the amount, but again, the site won't publish my review if I do. The hotel restaurants are crazy expensive - go out to eat, or go down to the food court where prices are better. The area isn't that nice, either. I didn't feel that safe when I went out. I took the bus from the airport (much less expensive than the taxis) and it drove through the financial district. That area seemed much nicer, although the hotel rates are probably even worse there. This place might be worth it if the room rates were 1/3 of what they are. As it stands, I would never return.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not in the best place for me”
Reviews.Author: ronilight
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. I got upgraded twice, I think, since I ended up with a very large suite. It was probably 800 square feet with a living room, dinning room, bedroom, and two full bathrooms. The hotel staff was VERY nice and welcoming every time I interacted with them. The suite was very clean, new, and comfortable. The lobby was always active and they had an whole computer area that was really cool. I did eat breakfast at the restaurant on the second level and had a great omlette. The coffee shop on in the lobby had very limited food choices, but they did brew starbucks coffee. My only issue was that I was going to Yorkville a lot and I either had to walk about 15 minutes or take a cab. And cabs are VERY expensive in Toronto. This would have been a perfect hotel if I could just have moved it a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected!”
Reviews.Author: HR_Wizard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shertaon Centre in Toronto for the first time. Being locals - I always considered the Sheraton to be one of Toronto's top hotels, that is until I stayed there. I have to say the downstairs lobby area is beautiful- everything you would expect and more, but once you leave there, it seems to go downhill. The rooms are not very big at all, and the drapes that match the wallpaper is like nothing I have ever seen before. The narrow hallway leading to the door made us both feel closed in. There were MANY long black hairs in the bathroom and shower -and we are both blond....ewww.... My sheets came off the bed and I saw what appeard to be a "stain" on the side of the matress. Overall- I was not impressed. the 7:40am wake up call- aka the 25 min fire alarm was the cake topper too. I should have driven 45 minutes north and gone home. The view is very nice from the rooms -I have to say that. There were a number of parties going on, but it was quiet in the room, I'll give them that too. This hotel is in serious need of some renos. I feel bad that I sent a colleague visiting from Brazil earlier this year to that hotel- I truly had no idea. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of an EVIL Bell!”
Reviews.Author: Limao
Reviews.Content: The hotel settings are OK and the staff was pleasant. However, the heated pool that is part indoor and part outdoor is not ideal. In cold days, the water is not hot enough even if you are in the indoor part of the pool. For a 4 star hotel, the rooms and bathrooms would benefit of some renovation. The hotel location is great, it's walking distance to most attractions and two blocks away from the cool Younge Street. The only really annoying thing about this hotel is the fact that is across the old City Hall. This old building has an evil bell that will jingle every hour, including in the middle of the night. If you have trouble sleeping, this is not a place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: cagia224
Reviews.Content: I am way behind in reviewing this (I typically don't write many reviews) but I feel compelled to write about this hotel. We went to Toronto for my boyfriend's birthday and they made it so special! I called and asked for room service to be available when we got there (chocolate covered strawberries). I had a favorite wine that I was bringing with - so they offered to put everything in the room (wine bucket, ice, glasses, cork screw) and even wrote a card out for my boyfriend. When I called, I explained the reason for our visit - and when I got to the hotel - they upgraded us to an even better view. The room was A-MAZING, the view was outstanding, and the hotel is centrally located to everything we wanted. It is a great location. If you don't want to pay the valet price, there is parking LITERALLY across the street in the underground garage. The price is still a little high, but it's city living - most cities are comparable. Overall, I would like to publicly thank Amanda in room service who made our stay so special with the help she provided...and I only wish I got the name of the reservation agent I spoke with. From start to finish, this was a wonderful experience. I would recommend staying here to anyone. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced small rooms”
Reviews.Author: AnonFromBoston
Reviews.Content: Staff members were very welcoming but the rooms are tiny. I had a double bed. I was surprised that a 4 star hotel even *had* double beds (the bathroom was also quite small). The view wasn't great, either. I paid $129/night through Hotwire, significantly less than my group's rate, and I still felt it was overpriced. The hotel restaurants are RIDICULOUSLY overpriced ($7 for a bagel and cream cheese...$6 for orange juice...$8 for yogurt with fresh fruit.). Local and 800 calls have a $2 access charge just for the privilege of using the phone. Pre-paid calling cards also have a $2 access charge. Long distance calls cost the operator-assisted rate plus 110% surcharge. In-room internet costs $14.95 for 1 day, $27.95 for 2 days and $40.95 for 3 days. Parking is around $45/night. And again... the room was tiny. If I hadn't paid Hotwire prices, I would be really upset right now.

Reviews.Title: “The location couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: incidents
Reviews.Content: Spending four days in Toronto, it was important to pick a hotel that was the center of everything we planned to do. The Sheraton Centre is in a great location in downtown south, which meant almost anything we did was in a short walking distance. Even just walking out the front doors you will be almost directly submerged in a bunch of festivals and events in the heart of downtown. We also went to a bunch of games at the Rogers Centre which was so close we would just run downhill from the hotel to the stadium. Lobby was HUGE, full of tons of hotel guests especially business clients. It appears to span a couple of floors even. Hotel staff were friendly and it was nice of them to honor my request of getting a king sized bed instead of a two queens. Also, at the end of our trip our flight was later than the check-out time, so they held our bags for a few hours even after we checked out. However, the rooms were average at best. Considering what we paid and how the hotel rates itself, it is clear the price is based off of the great location. The room was very basic, lacking even a mini-fridge (which when staying four days would have been nice to have for beverages, etc.). There was a small smoke stain on the ceiling. Nothing was below average, that's for sure - but I would not call it a "four star room". This didn't hugely matter as spent almost no time in the hotel room, but I can see how for some guests this would be an issue. So for guests that want rooms to impress, I am not sure if this is the hotel for them. But, if you are in Toronto and want a hotel with a downtown location for close proximity to a bunch of attractions like the CN tower, Rogers Centre, Yonge street, bars, great nightlife, etc. this is hands down your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Definite signs of bed bugs and drug-fueled parties down the hall”
Reviews.Author: JorgeJefferson
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before with some satisfaction, but this time, from check in to dealing with signs of bed bug infestation, things were not smooth, clean or friendly. We inspected our first room for bed bugs given that there's a widespread infestation. Sure enough, found the tell-tale black fecal marks and clumps of clear yellow stuff (eggs?) around the cloth zipper of a leather chair. They sent security (?) to photo and made us wait in the hallway, starving and with our bags out in the hall, while while my 4 year old started to melt down. Finally, a new room. Which was filthy. Seriously. Dorito bits in the bed, dark carpet stains. And it had the dust ruffle stapled on (suspicious, since it made it hard to see box spring). I waited several hours to find out what they'd do about any of it, finally called and was put through to the manager, a Mr. Ng, who was very officious and kept asking me what, exactly, I wanted. Well, I said, first of all maybe a llttle concern about first being put in a room w/ bedbugs. Second, a cleaning of the new room. But mostly not to be condescended to, you know? That last order seemed a tall one for Mr. Ng, who is a condescending type and who told me that bed bugs only live on mattresses and never on chairs. Ha! Like I don't have access to Google. In the end, they did clean the new room and (of course) later called to report, "Good news! No bed bugs in the other room!" (yeah, sure.) Not much improvement in service and on our last night, our neighbors began a drug-fueled frenzy of screaming and glass breaking at 10 pm. We began calling the front desk for security or help around 11 or 12, and had to call repeatedly. Very little was done until they were finally arrested at 5 am. Hotel security was probably busy with bedbugs. They did at least call to apologize for that the next morning and offer a late check out. No thanks. You can keep your meth heads and bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Service was exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: PGWbird
Reviews.Content: Hats off to Sheraton! This was our first stay at this hotel and we will be booking again. There were problems with our reservation, caused by a third party booking company but the staff at the Sheraton front desk were pros - honoring the booking even though there was no obligation! That is real class. Thanks to Jeanette at reception for making our day! The facility is really nice. Our room was intimate but luxurious and very well maintained. Mattress was a little creaky but compensated for by the awesome skyline view out our window. The location is what sells this place for me though. It's on Queen street right in the heart of Toronto's theatre, shopping and entertainment district. You want it? It's all at your doorstep. The price is steep at $300 or more per night but the view from the club lounge first thing in the morning is worth the price. And we all deserve a little luxury now and then.

Reviews.Title: “excellent beds, too many homeless outside around the doors”
Reviews.Author: awlewis184
Reviews.Content: well to start I was not impressed with the girl at the front desk,the room was booked in my name in May and we were told we couldn't get it for the six nights of our CEP convention but later learned people got their rooms for the whole six nights two or three days before the convention started.Now back to the girl at the front desk,as we were paying with a credit card it was a massive confusion as she wanted to charge half the room to me and half to my colleague.The rooms had the best beds I have ever had in a hotel and we had a excellent view of city hall.As for out front there was too many homeless aloud to bother hotel guests.As for the price of the rooms I thought maybe that internet should have been included.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: benner15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in March. Got a great deal on expedia that combined flight and hotel. We arrived about 12 hours earlier than our check-in time, but they were able to get us a room right then and there! It was a very busy weekend in Toronto (leafs vs habs, hockey and martial arts tournaments, etc.) so we were so pleased they were able to get us a room immediately. I had read reviews saying "avoid the elevator shaft", but the elevator was no problem. You'd have to be the lightest sleeper on Earth for that to be a nuisance. The bed was fantastic. And the room had a flat-screen tv. We stayed on the 26th floor, and I strongly recommend staying on higher floor. We had a great view, day and night. The location is excellent, so close to most of the things we were there for. Lastly, the day we left, our flight was hours after checkout. We didn't want to haul around our bags all day, so we were able to leave them at the hotel in a holding area. Im not sure if that's a common courtesy, but I loved it, nonetheless. Overall, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but disappointed by the cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller_120
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my boyfriend over the Thanksgiving long weekend. We booked the stay through hotwire and paid half of the average nightly rate. If we had paid the full rate, I would have definitely complained to the hotel staff about its shortcomings. -We loved the location (right on the subway line and was close to many of Torontoâ€™s landmarks, shops and restaurants.) -We loved that the hotel had extra amenities such as a whirlpool, swimming pool and free wireless in the lobby. -We were disappointed about the cleanliness. During our stay, we arrived back to our room at 5pm after a day of sightseeing and housekeeping had not finished cleaning our room. The housekeeper seemed startled and moved on to the bathroom in her haste to finish our room. Only after she had left did we realize she had not emptied the garbage or tied up the room. -The hotel was a busy one with many tour groups and business travellers. When we were able to talk to someone they seemed helpful and pleasant. But it was frustrating waiting for the opportunity to talk to a staff member. We did call the front desk/concierge a couple of times (for a wake-up call, to find out about taking a cab to the airport) and the phone just rang and rang. Finally, someone answered and then transferred our call to another extension which ended up being voicemail! -We would probably stay there again purely based on the location but not expect too much from a service perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Needs update. Club level is nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Grinadam
Reviews.Content: I went up to Toronto for a fun weekend in the city. It was Nuit Blanche which meant an all night party right outside the hotel. The rooms are old and need updating. I was originally on the 8th floor of the hotel facing city hall in a corner room which was rather spacious, but still nothing special. I booked the hotel on points so I wasn't as concerned about cost. As a gold member I was upgraded for free to the club level room on the 39th floor. This was great because of the all night party at city hall, but the room was actually smaller. Also the free breakfast buffet was down right gross. Glad I didn't pay for the upgrade. The location is absolutely stellar though.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel made me feel like I was at home.”
Reviews.Author: scooter35
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip and chose to stay at the Sheraton Centre Toronto. Very nice hotel. Staff was amazing. The food and beverage was very good. I would recommend the hotel to anyone traveling to Toronto. Truly made me feel like it was my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: gabbykai
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and beautiful! Staff was very friendly. Beds were VERY comfy and the view from our room was picture perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “No bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: Miami305Florida
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel to stay at during a conference and then reading recent reviews criticizing the place for its unsanitary conditions and bedbugs, along with all of the media hype, I was concerned I might have a similar encounter. I just want to say that that was not the case; I did not have the same experience during my stay, this past week. My room was very clean and there were absolutely NO SIGNS of bedbugs! Believe me, I thoroughly checked the mattress for the tell-tale signs, including stains, but there were none. Again, the room was very clean, with almost everything in it very new. The floor I was on, 34, had just been completely renovated. I was disappointed to be facing to the north, because, while there was a view, the south view overlooks the lake and the CN tower, and is much better. So ask for a south facing room on a high floor at check-in. Also, it's worth-it to pay the extra $$$ to have access to the lounge/restaurant on the 43rd floor. It's a very nice space with great views, and the food, drink and service are both excellent. Finally, I wouldn't say the location of the hotel is excellent. If I go back to Toronto I'll stay in Yorkville, which is a lot more pedestrian-friendly, and with a much better concentration of nice shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Dated accommodation and noisy”
Reviews.Author: SAGlobetrotters
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old and hasn't been renovated. Shower/bath didn't drain properly so standing in a pool of water when having a shower. Poor sleep as could hear people in the corridor, the lift and people in the room next door. Crib provided had no sheets (which seems to be the rule with Sheratons), so we had to make do with what we had brought with us. Although we had rung days earlier to book a crib, the lady at reception told us when we arrived that she would check if they had any left! She continued to repeat this despite us telling her we had rung to book one. Booked this on Hotwire so acceptable for the price we paid but wouldn't want to pay normal rates for this hotel. Was in a good location. Park in the adjacent garage - a lot cheaper than at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Cazzkins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and two grown-up daughters (aged 19 & 23) in September. We'd come to Canada primarily to see the Niagara Falls and had travelled on from Washington, USA. After checking in, we had trouble with one of our room key cards which necessitated 2 visits back down to Reception. The guy on reception the second time could not have been more helpful or apologetic and even gave us vouchers for breakfast to make up for the inconvenience! We were in one of the towers and the rooms were comfortable and clean but nothing special (especially after our h-u-g-e adjoining rooms in Washington!) We ate in the hotel twice, once in the Irish Bar on the ground floor and were welcomed (not!) by the lady at the desk who appeared to want to be anywhere but there that day! Fortunately her disinterest was made up for by the very nice waitress who gave us an excellent service and was very friendly and we were also able to watch the Arsenal football game on the tv screen there!. We also had breakfast one morning in the upstairs restaurant (free vouchers from before!) and although the service was good and the staff pleasant, we didn't feel we were quite up to the high standard of their usual clientele! We were fascinated with the underground adjoining pathway which linked this hotel with many others and shops etc. but guess it helps in the extreme winter cold! The hotel is well-positioned for sightseeing around Toronto, although we didn't venture much further than the CN Tower, harbour and Eaton Centre. Unfortunately, we ran out of time to use the swiming pool, which I understand was well worth seeing/using. Overall, I'd have liked the hotel to be somewhat more impressive as it was a little pricey however it was a good, comfortable hotel but with not much character or atmosphere, probably due to its huge size and what appeared to be mainly business guests.

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of upgrades and overpriced for the service”
Reviews.Author: Z00tie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beaten, however this is about as positive as it gets. These days, when you are paying $350 for a room (corporate rate based on my company booking 100 rooms was down to $220) you expect a lot more. This hotel has an old decor and desperately needs upgrading. The biggest issue was we arrived when it was starting to get cold in early October 2010 and was nonchalantly told that they don't turn the heating on until mid October but we could have a portable heater and a few blankets - not really what you expect from the Sheraton. The friendliness of the personnel each time I spoke with the guest services regarding our freezing room was a bit surly. The fan also wasn't working in our bathroom and despite them saying that the rooms were non smoking , our room smelled of stale smoke and with the room not being heated it wasn't pleasant. If you are going to spend $350 a night I would look for a better option.

Reviews.Title: “In the centre of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: pettifog
Reviews.Content: We got a lucky price with priceline and was very happy. the hotel is near shopping, the subway, streetcars or you can walk where you like. We got a great view of Nathan Phillips Square too. Some people commented that the hotel is a bit tired, but if you don't look too closely (why bother!) it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but over priced hotel option”
Reviews.Author: ViajeroIndiana
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Sheraton Centre Toronto. Each time my wife and I have come for a conference, but this time we brought the kid along. I really like this hotel, and would give it a higher rating if it were a better value. The conference rate was about $230 including taxes, and this was a significant discount from the going rate. The breakfast buffet is good, but at $25 per adult and $12.50 per child, it's a real rip off. Go out to breakfast instead. Fell like a bear in the evening? Well, you'll pay $11 for a pint in the bar, or you could have a can of cheep beer in the mini bar for $9.50. Again, ditch the hotel and find a better place to spend your money. Parking is $45 per day, but you can park across the street (literally) for $20 on weekdays and $12 on weekends. The rooms are fine, but small. Insist on a room high up and facing south, and you will have a splendid view of Toronto and the lake. We were on the 38th floor. Pretty great view, really. The bathrooms are adequate, but small, and really not reflective of the hotel price. Bathroom amenities are what you would expect from a Sheraton . . . nothing to get excited about. The hotel's location is great. A short walk to CN Tower, St. Lawerence Market, Hockey Hall of Fame, and many other places.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: edmbaby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love to travel... even though we live in Toronto we love being able to stay for 1 or 2 nights in various downtown Toronto hotels as a treat or if we just feel like it. We have stayed in the Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel a few times and we love it. You cannot be closer to all downtown Toronto sights and action... everything is very central and within walking distance. As a Starwood Member, we often get emails for promos and we take advantage whenever we can. Our last stay (for my husband's birthday) was on Club Level and I booked for $140 (normal rate is mid-$200 / per night). So, great deal for us! Club Level rooms are spacious, clean and on the higher floors (Queen tower). Rate includes a superb buffet breakfast in the executive / club-level lounge overlooking the entire city - floor to ceiling glass windows! The only negative I can say is that service is slow if you call down to guest services for anything extra you need (i.e., extra pillows). But this may be due to scale of hotel and the hundreds of guests they have coming in and out. For overnight Parking - great deal can be found if you use the Parking lot opposite the Richmond St. entrance (the parking shared with Four Seasons Centre). Literally a 3 minute walk from Hotel's main entrance. So, book Sheraton, you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: thequeeeen
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through a Priceline deal and when asked if the allocated room was on the highest floor possible, we got upgraded to a King Parlour Guest Room, which was awesome in every sense of the word. Spacious and tastefully decorated, we loved the room to bits. The bathroom was clean, roomy and well-equipped too. A short and pleasant walk downtown, to the subway and to the waterfront, location-wise the hotel was good too. What would have made the stay absolutely perfect was free wi-fi in the room and bottled water in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay in central location”
Reviews.Author: tvfoley
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Toronto in early October to attend a conference. It was being held at the hotel so chose to stay on site. Overall it was a decent stay. There wasn't anything overly negative that would prompt me to say "don't stay here". However, for the price I was expecting something better. Being a business traveller, having no wi fi in the room was ridiculous. I haven't stayed at a single hotel in the last couple of years that didn't have it and for free. It was very expensive. They offer the lobby with access to wi fi and computers but it wad so busy for the 3 days I was there, you couldn't get anywhere near them. I would agree with other reviewers that noise is a problem. I was on the eight floor and street noise wasn't a problem but the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything your neighbors are up to. Long story, short... I'd probably try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, spotlessly clean, great facilities, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Tumax
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the spaciousness of our room, with the in-room facilities and with the cleanliness of both the room and the entire hotel. Staff were welcoming and gracious and very approachable and helpful. Nice choice of places to dine/have coffee, great location for all the touristy bits, plus shopping, theatre, cinema, buses, etc. The perfect addition for me personally would have been a mini fridge in the room, but was more than happy to have coffee machine, hairdryer, iron, etc. Would DEFinitely stay here again and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “nuit blanche madness”
Reviews.Author: rosey1963Toronto
Reviews.Content: stayed at The Sheraton Centre the night of Nuit Blanche and this was the perfect location for the downtown zone events. The hotel is comfortable and the staff seemed to be relatively unfazed by the mass of people milling about everywhere. Good quick room service, comfy bed, very clean. i would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE DURING NUIT BLANCHE”
Reviews.Author: AKK
Reviews.Content: I checked in on October 1 for four nights for a conference. As a Gold Starwoods Member, I should have been given the "best available room" Instead, I was given a room facing the nearby park. They forgot to mention that the next night was "Nuit Blanche". There is a live concert from sunset to sunrise 100 yards away from my room. Pounding noise, headache, no sleep. I asked to change to a room on the other side of the hotel, but of course, no rooms available. I asked them to put a bed in the lobby because it was quieter in the lobby than it was in my room. They did offer me ear plugs. Thanks. VERY BAD THAT THEY DID NOT WARN US. I would have stayed elsewhere or at least requested a room on the other side of the building. Do not stay here for Nuit Blanche. I would love for the hotel staff to respond. But they give the baloney that sorry, there are no other rooms available, there is nothing that we can do. This was such a horrible experience that I cannot even comment about anything else about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - awful guests”
Reviews.Author: jenlucky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Toronto overnight for our honeymoon. We only stayed in this hotel because we booked it through hotwire. Lovely hotel. We had a great room with a nice view. Our only complaint was the guests who were in rooms close to ours... We heard a group of young people leave their rooms around 11:00 PM, and I said to my husband, "this is going to be a problem when they get back...." because I assumed they were going to the bar. Sure enough, we heard them LOUDLY come back around 2:00 am and proceeded to hear them until 4:00 am as they travelled to and from their friends rooms. It was awful. Every time we went to call the front desk, the people would be gone from the halls, and we weren't 100% sure which room they were in. Finally we called the front desk and complained and they sent someone upstairs to watch the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, very big”
Reviews.Author: tzanoni
Reviews.Content: A very large hotel, probably the biggest in town. Very well located and very good for conventions. I went in a convention for brazilian judges last september and was a large party, almost 200 people. The hotel handled such a large group very well. The elevators were amazing in efficiency. I had no problem with outside noise and I had a beautiful view of CN Tower and other buildings around. The hotel is not far from Scotiabank Theatre Movies, with has IMAX room. Restaurants inside the building were good, with prices around the same as outside.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: magscot
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre Toronto is in a great location, you can walk almost anywhere in the central city. We stayed in a Club Room and had access to the Club Lounge. A good buffet breakfast was provided in the morning and a great selection of hors d'oevre in the evening with free soft drinks, tea and coffee. The club room was on a high floor with great views of the city and Lake Ontario. The staff a check in could not do enough to meet our needs and we were warmly welcomed and given our room in the morning which was great. We also got an extended check out free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: Chattyboo
Reviews.Content: Good location, comfy beds. Rooms standard hotel decor. Had problems with severe noise outside hotel and eventually got room changed. My overall impression of the hotel has suffered because of this and that's the reason I would not recommend this hotel to family and friends. Probably better choices out there?

Reviews.Title: “nice location, soundproofing issues”
Reviews.Author: johndavies68
Reviews.Content: stayed at the sheraton for a week 13th-20th september 2010.hotel is located on queen street west.all staff we dealt with were superb.from the front desk all the way to the room service and maids.the room we were given was on the 19th floor level overlooking roy thomas hall and queen st west.nice standard room nothing special but did the job.now for the negative point about this room.(room1941)the windows are not double glazed so you can hear the street noise and clock tower which strikes every hour non stop.if a light sleeper you will need ear plugs.door locks also bang however quite you try and shut them.did not encounter dreaded fire alarm like other reviewers.we found the pool to be very big for a city center hotel if a little cold.the one thing this hotel did excell at was making a fuss about my 6 year old daughter.given 4 tins of coloring pencils and coloring book at check in and given another huge coloring book and pack of 24 crayons when she left the pool area after swimming.if staying in toronto again i would stay at this hotel but only with a room with double glazing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: sarahSurrey_Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week from the 9th September. No wait at check in, the queue formed quite quickly while checking in and a manager immediately put on more staff. Helpful and efficient at check in. Had booked two rooms, both clean with lovely views out over the city. Housekeeping were great throughout our stay. Restaurants in hotel weren't really much more expensive than anywhere else, but the portions were huge. Service very good. All staff in the hotel were helpful and friendly. Would recommend this hotel, but would say only stay for a long weekend in Toronto as we ran out of things to do. Would tell everyone to go to Niagara Falls on a day trip and if you have teenagers a trip to Canadas Wonderland is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: 1RoadTripper
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel, had no trouble in finding the parking area, or the front desk. Brian checked us in and made us feel right at home. We had an early dinner at Traders, the food was very good. Later we went to the Club Lounge for evening hors dâ€™oeuvres, terrific spread, well worth it. Buffet breakfast at Bistro on 2 was also very good. The bed was very comfortable. The room clean and cozy, which included Starbucks coffee, coffee maker, iron and board, hair dryer, microwave, mini fridge, Shine bath products and flat screen tv, which included local channels, plus more options. Can't wait to go back again, what a totally awesome experience. Thank you so much Brian and Michael.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: sgarci1
Reviews.Content: This weekend was the start of the TIFF or Toronto International Film Festival so rooms were pricey probably because of this. I booked the hotel using Priceline.com because I didn't care where I was staying as long as it was a good price. We were just visiting family and mostly wanted to be in walking distance of everything so the location was great. The lobby is nice especially since there is free WiFi if you are a guest in the hotel. There are also tons of computers for free use which is nice if you didn't bring your computer. It would be nice if there was WiFi in the room but no need since you can just go to the lobby and hang out at various seating locations with desks or tables for you to work at. I even used my IPAD in the restaurant that was next to the lobby while waiting for some food that we wanted to bring to our room. As far as the room, my husband has Starwood status so we had stayed on the 33rd floor with a nice view of the CN Tower and downtown. We had a king size bed and asked for a roll-a-way bed for my relative. It worked out nicely. When it was time to check out and head to the airport, it was great that we were able to print our boarding passes at a kiosk in the lobby. FYI..when you get to the airport and flying back to the US, don't forget to just ask the airlines desk for a declaration form. It's required before you head to customs.

Reviews.Title: “Good value comfortable hotel with great city views”
Reviews.Author: newengland
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 32 floor so the views were stunning. The rooms were very comfortable and the beds were so so comfortable it was difficult to get up in the morning! Check in was swift and polite and easy. Didnt use any of the other hotel facilities - the internet area was continually busy so no chance of using it unless we wanted to waste our time hanging around. Slight critisism in that the tourist information in the rooms was non existent and the tourist desk was not that approachable. We agree with other posters that the room could have been cleaner - lots of thick dust on the paintwork and hairs in the bath. Location was excellent - everything in walking distance once we had got our bearings.

Reviews.Title: “A Few Concerns”
Reviews.Author: americanjim
