Reviews.Content: I spent one night @ Sheraton Centre while my condo was being repainted to escape the fumes and construction mess. This is the big convention / tour group / "event" downtown hotel in Toronto - it's a great location for business types and for tourists - everything major in TO is close and easy to access. The public areas of the hotel have been nicely updated and are extremely pleasant. Their pool and workout facility is superior in every way. It's connected to the PATH underground directly so weather is not a factor moving around downtown. I enjoyed the stay, but had the following concerns: 1) no wireless in the room / $16.85 per day for hotel ethernet. this is unacceptable in today's world. 2) they say "queen beds" when you check in, but they are doubles, not queens. 3) soundproofing on hallway doors and connecting doors to room next door was non-existant. i head hallway conversations every time someone passed my door. the family of 4 staying in the room next to mine - i heard them clearly thru the connecting door my entire stay. 4) they need to step up the cleanliness. my room had dust around the baseboards and scraps of paper on the floor. in the hallways there were old coffee stirs and bottle caps that had not been picked up. 5) even on the 16th floor, you can hear the clanging of the 24-hour streetcar outside as they pass every 5 minutes. 6) the check-in desk is not marked and somewhat "hidden" off in a corner of the lobby, i wandered around twice before i found it. Most of the guests were either at the hotel for a convention or in a tour group, or else Starwood road warriors in town for business. This is not an intimate setting - it's the big, bustling, main hotel in a major city. Location is fantastic and services are fine. Just be aware that it's not a boutique atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “BUYER BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: TravelCoordinating
Reviews.Content: My first mistake was reserving the room through Hotwire. I have many friends who have had success with this service. This was my first time, and my last. When we arrived, there was no direction as to where to park or what to do. After circling the block once, we arrived again, and there was finally a bellman outside to ask what we were supposed to do (as we were expecting to valet). The bellman told us he was not recommending that we valet, but to park across the street in underground city parking lot. I guess that was supposed to be a good thing? I have never been anywhere that an employee was not recommending that you use their service. Then, there was no direction as to where to check-in, as it is tucked away off the main lobby. After wondering around, we finally found it. I was told that we were to have a double room. I asked for an upgrade, particularly since I am a rewards program member. My guess is that the rooms that the hotel offers on Hotwire so cheaply are the small double-size beds. I was told I could pay an additional fee for a Jr. King suite room. I willingly and happily agreed. Then I was told none were available. Why would you offer it if it isn't available? I asked if any King rooms were available (non-suite), and I was told that none were available. However, as I was standing there, the employee next to the one waiting on me offered two different people upgrades to King rooms - both of whom arrived after me. When we finally arrived in the room, there was an odd smell. We believe that it might have come from the air conditioner. Also, the bathtub faucet dripped. Thankfully, you couldn't hear outside the bathroom, though. The best thing that I can say for this hotel is that it was a bed to sleep after a weary day of sightseeing. But, did I mention the fact that the beds had the noisiest sheets? It was sleeping in a paper bag. You can also hear what is happening in the hallways as there is little insulation. The first morning, we had a fire alarm. Yes, I know that this is not the fault of the hotel. However, we did not have any instructions as to whether we were to evacuate or not. Just "stand by for instructions." Once most on the guests on our floor decided to evacuate, you couldn't hear any instructions in the stairwell. Oh, yeah, there are many homeless people who hang out in front of the doors, too. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but could use an update”
Reviews.Author: CanuckAndie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Centre Hotel from Aug. 21 to 23rd. We booked our room through Priceline and felt we got a good deal for this time of year ($95/nt). We were given a room on the 5th floor of the Queen's Tower (#530). It had one double bed, with barely enough room to fit a desk and arm chair in along with it. We could have paid extra to upgrade to something bigger but decided not to. The room was nice, though a bit dated. The carpet, especially, was showing its age. The bathroom had a somewhat awkward layout, with the toilet under the counter. It made it difficult to use the counter space properly, but we did get a good laugh at my husband being able to "check out his technique" every time he used the washroom, since the placement of the toilet allowed him a good view in the mirror! There was a musty, stale smell in the room during our stay that was especially noticeable in the closet. We had a nice view of the indoor/outdoor pool and the tip of the CN Tower from our room. It was nice to sit at the window at night and see it lit up. We didn't use the pool ourselves but it was pretty popular with other guests during our stay. There is free wifi in the lobby, which worked great. They have a few computers for guests to use in the lobby but I'd recommend bringing your own laptop or mobile device since their computers were always in use. The PATH system was a great feature and we made use of it to go back and forth from the Eaton Centre since it rained on the Sunday that we were there. Early on the Sunday morning (5:30 am), I woke up smelling cigarette smoke coming into our room through the air vent. It was very strong and I couldn't get back to sleep. I called Guest Services, not really expecting anyone to be there that time of day, but figuring I'd give it a shot. I was pleasantly surprised when someone answered! The person I spoke with was very friendly and said they'd send security up to check on things. I have no idea if security actually came or if they found anything, it's very likely that whoever was smoking just finished up, but the smell did go away about 15 minutes after I called and we never smelled it again for the rest of our stay. I should mention that all of the staff we encountered were really friendly and helpful. The best part about this hotel for us was its location. It was within walking distance to everything. It is also just a block from Osgoode subway station, and the streetcar runs right in front of it. A tip if you are driving here: there is a Green P city parking lot right under Nathan Phillips Square that is MUCH cheaper than the hotel's daily rate and is just across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great Travelzoo price”
Reviews.Author: luckytimer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, last weekend of August to attend a City and Colour Concert (Dallas Green) with our teenage son, our friends and their son the same age. We got a great Travelzoo deal for a mere $129 per night which included a full hot buffet breakfast for 2 people in Bistro on Two. The value of that breakfast alone was $54 ($27 pp) so that made the room only $75. We were on the 6th floor (no view) but were placed in the Richmond Tower which is renovated. The hotel was an easy summer's eve walk to the Elephant & Castle Pub for dinner. From there we walked to Union Station, rode the street car to the CNE grounds and were off to Molson Amphitheatre for the concert. Great location. Great fun. Did not have time unfortunately to use the pool. Great lounge/rocking chairs in the amazing lobby. Very classy. Beds were truly amazing. They are double beds (I'll never know why hotels don't use Queen beds as standard fare) but they were comfy even to share when you are used to a much bigger bed. We parked across the street, or use the underground entrance on the same side of the street as the Sheraton for a mere $18.00. This is the City Hall underground parking lot. It was empty on a Saturday to Sunday. Overall, would stay here again on this deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - extremely accomodating & pleasant employees!”
Reviews.Author: cjw62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Toronto! It is easy access to everything! It has restaurants, shops,internet,complimentary breakfast & apps for dinner (the 43rd floor) & a fabulous pool! Jimmy Lee is a great manager & keeps this area always inviting! They also an exercise room available. The lodging rooms are very nice. I would definetely stay here again! Only downside is the cost of parking!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mthebaut
Reviews.Content: My family arrived at the hotel September 3rd 2010 for a three night stay. We booked 2 King Spa rooms and paid for Club Level amenities for both. One of the two rooms was ready at our 4:00 PM arrival. The first room was on the 34th floor. Walking into the (supposedly refurbished) room, we found a large stain in the carpet in the sitting area. This room did not have a safe or beverage center. Our second room was on the 36fh floor and did have a safe and beverage center. Both rooms have small, dated bathrooms. The shower/tub combos were weak on pressure, but had plenty of hot water. The ice machine on the 36th floor was inoperative. I called room service to bring some ice and glasses to the room, for which they charged $10.00. Other than this, room service did a good job with punctual deliveries. The Club Level is on the 43rd floor. They had a continental breakfast buffet and snacks at night. Beverages other than juices and coffee must be purchased (very disappointing!) The bar did not have a sufficient selection of alcohol to make my preferred drink. My last evening in the hotel I brought my cocktail to the lounge and was allowed entry and shortly thereafter was told they must take away the drinks we brought. Staff was treating me like a child but finally conceded and allowed me to finish the cocktail I brought. Normally the Club Level had 2 stations open to toast breads. On Labor Day, a very busy day, they decided to only have one station open. They also ran out of paper cups, making it difficult to take coffee to my wife. For some reason, on several visits to the Club Level, my adult kids were told they were not allowed in the facility without an additional charge. In these instances we told the staff to contact the front desk to work out the difficulty. Nevertheless, it was a hassle. Of all our disappointments, our biggest complaint regards inadequate cooling in our rooms. The AC units can be set to 65 degrees, but would only achieve a low temp of 71 degrees. This made for very poor sleep, in spite of the hotel supplying a fan. Complaints about this to the front desk accomplished nothing. I definitely would not recommend this hotel and will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Will Be Going Back !!!”
Reviews.Author: Summer-Sun-x-
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend arrived at this hotel on 28th August, we upgraded to a club room with access into the club lounge which has fantastic views of the city from the 43rd floor. From check in to check out i could not find fault with any of the staff or the cleanliness of the hotel. The pool area is brilliant complete with indoor and outdoor bathing areas, also equipped with a Jacuzzi and pool bar. Pool towels are included. The location was fantastic, easy access to the famous sites, although if you didn't feel like walking, Toronto has various local transports to offer, including busses, trains and the subway etc... We used a taxi to get to and from Pearson International Airport which cost around $58, you could also use a local airport shuttle bus which cost's around $22pp or if youâ€™re willing to take 2 trains you can get there for around $10pp. The room was fantastic, although we didn't have a CN Tower view from the 38th floor it didn't disappoint us, we were facing the new city hall which at night time lights up and looks amazing. We booked the CN Tower on arrival, we purchased a total tour ticket which cost $38pp and included: - entrance to the observation deck, entrance to the glass floor on 141st floor, entrance to the Skylon pod on 181st floor, entrance on to a motion ride and a 3-D film. The only extra would be a meal at the 360 restaurant, which is quite pricey! We managed to get a trip to Niagara Falls whilst we were there, which I would completely recommend, we had a 10 hour tour which cost $169 it did seem a lot but was well worth it, we had lunch overlooking the falls, maid's of the mist boat ride, a shopping break at Niagara On The Lake and to finish the day off a wine tasting at Niagara College. A great way to experience Niagara but if I had more time I would want to stay for 2 nights to be able to see everything and even cross the board to the United States. We only spent 4nights in Toronto and can't wait to return to the city and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: chekmanirov
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at this hotel, and will luckily be checking out tomorrow morning. Yesterday evening, upon entering my room, I noticed a bug on my bed. I simply removed it from my bed and went to sleep, unaware that it was in fact a bed bug. Today, I have already found three (3) bugs. Two were sitting on my bed, and one on my lampshade. After reading other similar reviews of this hotel, I'm really quite afraid. This bed bug infestation seems to be common throughout all the rooms of this hotel. It seems that bed bugs will follow you home, and will cost thousands to remove. I am in Toronto studying engineering at the University of Toronto and am staying at this hotel because I arrived before the move in day to take care of errands and to orient myself with the city. I'm not the type of person that complains about small things (cheap rooms, bad service, ugly furniture - haha), but when it comes to blood sucking insect infestations, I cannot help but be upset. Other aspects of my stay: The Bistro on Two offers a good breakfast, and the hotel is located in the heart of downtown. Check in is relatively quick, as the hotel has many desks to check customers in with. It is a renovated hotel and looks pretty good on the inside. I definitely will not sleep tonight (but I probably wasn't going to anyway- first day of my university life coming up!) If you've read this review and are looking for a good night's sleep, you won't find it at this hotel (anymore).

Reviews.Title: “Front desk and valet staff second to none!”
Reviews.Author: calOntario
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for an end of summer family getaway. The hotel is well located and close to several desirable family attractions. Check in was easy, efficient and the staff were very friendly! The gentlemen who assisted us with the valet parking were INCREDIBLE! When we needed to access our vehicle (several times), they went out of their way to assist us! The hotel itself was beautiful and connected to several shopping destinations that pleased our teenage children. My only complaint was the cleanliness of the room. The first glass my son grabbed for a drink was caked in a thick, creamy residue that was hard to miss. We had just arrived to our room, so housekeeping was still in the hallways. The first maid I found down the hall was quick to say it was not her room or fault, and was eager for me to call the front desk to complain (she even found the maid who was responsible and brought her to our room). I told both of them we were not upset and it was not a big deal..just wanted a clean glass. But what did disgust me, were the hairs stuck to the "clean" hand towel, and that were on our bathroom floor (found following the dirty glass incident)- these hairs did not originate from the top of one's head!! As an aside....we would highly recommend "Rock of Ages"...brilliant play that features 80's hits and is interactive (even our teens thoroughly enjoyed it.).

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton is a good value in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: dcalianno
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Toronto where we stayed at the Sheraton Centre. The hotel was very busy. Check in went well. The rooms were very nice except for the old heater grill in the bathroom. The bed was not as comfortable as what I expected with their advertising on their beds. The daytime concierge people were very helpful. The night time (after 6PM) concierge, not so much. The Bistro on 2 was very over priced and the service not good at all. The bar in the lobby was okay for munchies and drinks. The coffee bar in the lobby was the best for a quick breakfast and the ladies were very friendly and upbeat. The hotel is in an excellent location and was a good value for the price. Free internet in the lobby which was a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - will be staying there again”
Reviews.Author: Summer5
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Sheraton in downtown Toronto. We had a very enjoyable stay. The rooms was clean with a excellent view of the CN Tower. This hotel is centre to downtown Toronto. Two blocks from the entertainment district. The lobby is huge and with lots of people. We parked across the street at City Hall for a cheaper rate. The underground parking is connected via the underground concourse full of shops. We didn't eat at the restaurants so can't review them. As usual the hotel bar was $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, room was clean, hallways were quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Varush
Reviews.Content: Bad experience at check in. There were cars parked everywhere under the entrance overhang which made it tough to get in. Then was hit with the $45 per night cost to valet park. Didn't know about the self park across the street. While desk person was extremely pleasant she did not tell us anything about the hotel. I only found out about the pool by reading these reviews. I also didn't know about the underground tunnel and shops down there. I only knew about the ones on the lobby level. Good location though and I'm a light sleeper but had no problems with the chimes in the clock tower.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Cleared4takeoff
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 had the opportunity to visit this hotel for two nights, while in town to watch some Blue Jays baseball. Everything was flawless. Check-in was quick, friendly and efficient. Staff was extremely professional, and all of our needs were attended to. Rooms were modern, spotless and extremely quiet. The location of the hotel was phenomenal. It was walking distance to virtually everything we needed. Definitely my new favourite place to stay in Toronto. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Best room: 4th flr balcony overlooking the pool”
Reviews.Author: altdelto
Reviews.Content: The highlight is Sheraton's 25 foot rooftop pool on the 3rd floor. This is a tropical oasis. Try to get a room overlooking with balcony - great view! The pool manager Jimmy takes care of you like you're at a 5 star and will get to know you by name. Great atmosphere with the workout room, coconut bar and relaxing lounge chairs around a huge pool that is pristinely kept.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world.”
Reviews.Author: Holiday-Lady25
Reviews.Content: Just fab the hotel was great. It was so big and the lobby just blew me away. The only thing that let it down abit was that it only had 1 place to eat at night. The walkway underground to the shops was a great way to get to the shops and easy but you could get lost as it is so big. A fab hotel with no faults.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: cazhappydays
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I had an amazing time at this hotel. From the moment of our arrival the staff made us feel very welcome. Our room was more than we could have wished for. Comfortable beds and fab pillows allowed a good nightâ€™s sleep. Even with the city outside the window it was incredibly quiet it is easy to walk to the harbour and the CNN tower from the room. If you need any information the staff are more than happy to help. I would defiantly recommend and would stay here again on my return to the city of Toronto. To keep cost down you can park across the road for half the price at a public car park, we removed our luggage then went to park. Again staff helpful with this and it was not a problem Many thanks for making our stay so very special.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: RH_Travellors
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton Hotel downtown and had a disappointing stay. The hotel seems to have reduced their staff levels perhaps to control their costs and so basic things at the hotel seemed to be a challenge. They had great difficulty having our room ready on check-in and despite having assurances that the room would be ready within the hour, they didn't get us to our room until after 7pm despite showing up at the hotel after 4:30pm (purposely after their posted 4pm check-in time which apparently isn't a promise that you can actually check-in at that time). Kind of difficult when you have a family with you that are tired from the journey. While we got alot of attention from managment after the problems and they did provide some compensation for our troubles, this was very different than any of our previous stays at this hotel. I think it must be a staffing issue as we found that housekeeping was slow all weekend to clean up the rooms. Perhaps it was our fault for not wanting our room cleaned at 9am on a Saturday morning when housekeeping went by the first time but usually you don't need to specifically ask to have your room made up. We also noticed the lack of service when we did use the club lounge for breakfast, we found the replenishment of food and the clean-up to be slow. Overall a disappointment that I am really not used to at a Sheraton. I hope they get better as we are going to hesitate the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: mustangjimmy
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the Sheraton and found friendly staff, great atmosphere and an amazing indoor/outdoor pool. The gym was top knotch too! I would highly recommend this hotel and everyone who works there...the kids especially had a blast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Your average city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctron1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what you would expect from a four star city centre hotel in North America. The check in was efficient, the location is good, the room was adequate, the bed in comfortable and the staff are friendly. There are a couple of downsides. The parking is very expensive, it is $45. Other hotels in the area are $30, so factor this into your price. The second problem in the showers, the shower head is very low. The third problem is the clock tower outside! 6, 7, 8, 9 oâ€™clock bonged out waking me up each time. I came home feeling tired and un-rested. I know there is not much the hotel can do about that but it means I will not return If you are a heavy sleeper and get a good deal this is just your standard hotel in a downtown area. Nothing wowed me, but nothing made me mad either!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: gypsytravels
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Centre on my vacation in Toronto for two nights. I had previously spent two nights at the Fairmont Royal York but prefered the Sheraton. The Sheraton, has an outdoor pool and a much larger fitness facility. The rooms are bright and spacious and very clean. While there I took advantage of the spa services which were quite good. I would recommend. One downside is the steep price for parking at $50/night, but that seems to be the going rate in downtown toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great view!”
Reviews.Author: 80four
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre is an OK hotel - i've stayed in better. If i return to Toronto, i would probably choose the Fairmont. We made the mistake of travelling on 31st October - I don't think i had any sleep that night! The hotel was over-run by college kids who made alot of noise all night! There is also a clock tower outside! The thing that has put me off staying here again is the fire alarm. It went off every other day. It was quite frustrating - especially at 6 o'clock in the morning! The hotel is a big hotel - it has shops inside and conference centres. The staff are polite. The location is ok. I would highly recommend the Niagara falls and wine tasting tour through the hotel. The guide was brilliant and the trip was great especially the stop off at a small town. Definitely eat at the CN tower - amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, super location.”
Reviews.Author: LydNewHope_PA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this centrally located hotel in Toronto. I can't say enough good things about it. Starting with checkin by Natalia to security by Mark to complete information about the area by Max. Everything was superb. We were lucky to get the club level amendities which included a great continental breakfast buffett daily as well as appetizers/snacks with softdrinks in the late afternoon. The view from the 43rd club level floor was breathtaking. It almost equaled the view from the 360 CN tower restaurant. I had checked out hop-on hop-off tours of Toronto previous to our departure and found info on the web about Greyhound tours. I'm so glad that I did not book them, since the Sheraton had a help desk for any type of tours. The hop-on hop-off with the green bus that Sheraton's travel desk featured was less expensive and could be used for 2 separate days. The interior of the hotel lobby was beautiful and spacious. Never had to wait for an elavator. In the hotel you had access to the underground shopping areas and public transportation. So, if the weather is bad (we had great weather), you don't even have to go outside. Again, we could not have picked a better hotel for our 5-day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel with underground walkway to the mall!!”
Reviews.Author: ethan88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel once with family. It has good restaurants, indoor outdoor pool, and a underground walkway to mall. We booked a double bed room, but when we got there those rooms were sold out. So the 4 of us has to sleep in a king room with a nice flat screen TV. I did not like the bathrooms, they seemed old and small. I like how the room was on a high floor and had a great view. I would recommened this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, just o.k. room”
Reviews.Author: Amalthea7c
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a conference at the Sheraton Centre in Toronto, otherwise we would not have stayed here. The front desk staff were good, if a bit slow and housekeeping was around when we needed them to do the room up but they aren't the tidiest of housekeepers. As in other reviews the carpet was stained and dirty, the bedskirt had black marks on it and the top sheet was torn and not long enough for the bed. And speaking of the bed, it really was not very comfortable and while they look nice, the pillows too are uncomfortable. There was only one easy chair with ottoman, one desk chair and a small table so with two people in the room only one person gets to sit comfortably while the other has to make do with the ottoman or desk chair. The charge for internet access was exorbitant and $2.00 for a local or 800 number call, ridiculous! We did not eat at the hotel because of the high prices (my husband gets a per diem, not an expense account). Fortunately, we did not have a car to park so we didn't have that overpriced item to deal with. The lobby is nice but the hallways to the rooms are very dark and dingy looking. The location of the hotel is very good for seeing Toronto and the Airport Shuttle bus does stop right at the hotel. The elevators worked well along with the air conditioning but that's not enough to make us stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel/ great service!”
Reviews.Author: krisfi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from July 31 to aug 7/ 2010. My favorite thing was the bed, it was like sleeping in a cloud. It was also nice to have in the room one of those coffee machines that brews individual cups of coffee or tea. The hotel itself is connected to a vast network of underground shopping tunnels, this can be very fun and exciting but starting out from the hotel on a different escalator from the day before can make a completely different experience, you can get lost and tired if you are not careful. Good to get a map of the PATH system. I happened to mention to someone at the front desk that I had a late flight leaving the next day and without any prompting whatsoever I was offered a 4 pm checkout. I'm not sure what the rules are for this sort of thing but it sure helped me out a lot and it was very nice of him. The only drawback for this place-I wish the pool was open later. Seems there are so many distractions in the area that it is difficult to get back in time to enjoy it. Nice to relax in at the end of a long day of sight seeing. Surprised to find out how affordable and easy it is to take the go train from union station to Niagara Falls. Gotta be the best deal in town at 14$ each way!. As a female travelling alone I loved this hotel. It is good to stay in a place where you feel safe and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The swimmingpool is the most magnificent well kept pool in the city of Toronto a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: bigdarksteve
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the fabulous Sheraton hotel with my 5 pound Chihuahuah ARTIE. The swimming pool is a treasure in downtown Toronto,well managed and a great bar to add. It truly is a gem..The room was outstanding...so comfortable...spotless The 43rd floor is the most spectacular view and lets not forget the best food anyone could imagine...Thanks chef for treating your guests like royalty.And the 5:00pm cocktail hour is one fabulous well prepared feast. I knew I was going to have a great time as I was greeted by your hostess with a truly perfect smile. A happy employee!!! nice to see..The bartender was smiling as he served us drink after drink. What a nice guy....I spent the most gloious week at the Sheraton and Lee the manager of the pool and gym was one great manager. He made taht trip perfect with that fabulous pool. It was true paradise staying at the Sheraton. My 3 friends have already booked there vacation for next year at the Sheraton.I booked mine today...Thanks Sheraton had a great vacation and your hotel.You guys made me feel like a millionaire........Steven Z and my dog little Artie

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money unless you like to stay in dirty hotel rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Jmon_10
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have stayed at the Sheraton in at least 20 years. The carpets were terribly stained and the rooms smelled musty. The dust ruffles on the beds were filthy dirty. The sheets on one of the beds had food on them and we had to call housekeeping twice to have them changed. If we had not been here for business we would have left and found a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service”
Reviews.Author: UbiqueHatter
Reviews.Content: For a large downtown hotel that caters mainly for the lucrative conference punter, I was most impressed by the level of service shown to my family during our recent stay in Toronto (so much so that I have signed up with Trip Advisor just to write this review). While the room was fine and with a great view of the CN Tower, the choice of bars and food was good (although the price of a beer was a bit steep) and there is a bloke who blow-dries his chihuahua in the swimming pool changing room (much to my sons' amusement), the most notable element of our visit was the courtesy and level of attention afforded by the Front Desk staff. Throughout our visit they bent over backwards to help us, especially when one of my children was hurt in an accident. They were so very helpful. If you are in Toronto on business or pleasure, I thoroughly recommend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location - would definately stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: FJR999
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 10 day family trip to Toronto. I booked the flights and hotel via Candian affair. We were very pleased with the location of this hotel. The entrance hall is very impressive. The staff were friendly and attentive. Initially my daughters were located a room 16 floors below my wife and I. I requested another room for them and this was sorted without any fuss. We were allocated room 3338. Overall we were happy with the room - especially the views of the CN Tower/city. It was clean and tidy and was in a good state of repair. We were upgraded to a king size bed which was massive in comparison to UK beds. I personally found the pillows too soft. The bathroom was clean and towels changed every days. My only negative about the room was the fact it was located next to the vending machine/ice machine area. This reduced the width of the room slightly and when the machines were used their was some noise. We did not feel this was bad enough to request a room change. I did find the rooms aircon a little loud and thought were had a poltergeist when it would suddenly come on in the middle of the night. - however it was very pleasant to return to a cold room after a days sightseeing. Due to the tripadvisor reviews we did not eat at the hotel. Their are many great places to eat in the vicinity. We enjoyed Tim Hortons and Sunset grill for breakfasts and visited Little India for a great curry, Chippies for excellent fish and chips and had a belly busting meal at Baton Rouge. The hotel was always busy and had a nice atmosphere. I found it to be the perfect location for visiting the sights of Toronto. On more than one occasion we used the tour desk services to book trips etc. Overall i was pleased with the infomation they provided. Apart from a nightmare trip to the Niagara falls ( due to an incompetant tour rep who left someone at the food stop half way !) the hotel staff were spot on with recommendations. My family were all happy with the services provided and would not hestitate to stay at the Sheraton centre agian.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; excellent service”
Reviews.Author: CCO_10
Reviews.Content: Great location - minutes walk from the Eaton's Centre, Yonge St. shopping, restaurants and attractions. Dynamic lobby with lots of activity yet floors are quiet. No noise from any adjoining rooms whatsoever. We were early checking in and had no problem - room available right away. Lots of selection for eating - from takeouts in the Concourse level, Tim Horton's is next door ! Eaton's Centre, the Bay and Antrium on the Bay within minutes. Also minutes from the Osgood subway. Pool is an added bonus after returning from a day out shopping or walking.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is nice but the staff not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: vanessin
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of the hotel the lobby is nice but the rooms are average, they are clean, the beds are comfy but it is nothing too special about them. The rate we got was not the cheapest (over 240dlls) and for that price I would expect a smile form the staff but the only smile we got was from the waitress at breakfast time other than that everybody looked so unhappy, I actually asked one of the cooks at the buffet if I could have some waffles (the waffle maker and the batter was there) but she told me to have pancakes instead, because she would have to make them when I said I wanted waffles she was no happy at all, got my waffles though. I would not recommend this hotel to my friends there is better hotels in downtown toronto with kind of the same rates and location.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice - value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lancs7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is above a shopping centre which means there is lots of hustle and bustle and a variety of places to eat.However once we got up to the guest room level you were totally unaware of any noise below us. The room was clean and comfortable with good views over the city. The swimming pool at this hotel was amazing situated on the third floor with a lovely patio and plenty of sun beds towels etc.Half the pool was indoors half outside. It was lovely and relaxing amid the city. This hotel is really made so much better because of the staff who were out standing. Nothing was too much trouble and they were keen to make sure we all enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: JessNY76
Reviews.Content: hotel is in perfect location, right across the street from the Eaton Center....accessible from underground, no internet in the room i was lucky to catch a wireless connection while in a friends room but they give u 30 mins free downstairs....food Traders restaurant is good...bout $10-15 cab to major clubs and sites (guvernment/sky bar, Thompson hotel (nice rooftop), CN tower, Lakeshore....)...walkable to the major shopping area "little times sq" h&m, forever 21, best buy....overall really nice hotel, nice bathroom, nice beds, comfy, nice tv, fridge was a plus! will def be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but be aware expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: Travelerfromphilly
Reviews.Content: Parking is very expensive in the hotel $45 per night!!! There is a couple of other parking lots around that charge around $20 from 7 am to 7am. The way they charge is $14 from 7am to 6pm and $6 from 6pm to 7am the next day. So if you are going to stay past the 7am the next day you'll end up paying $36. we found a reasonable parking lot @ Victoria and Richmond where we ended up paying $26 from 2:30 pm to up to 7pm the next day. The food in the hotel is very expensive as well and we got a couple of stuff from Link the bakery and it was stale. The good thing is if you decline room cleaning they give you a $5 voucher (for being green) that you can use in the hotel for food or drink. The room was nice but the hotel was busy. Make sure you visit Casa Loma. Go early because they close @ 5

Reviews.Title: “Would have been a great stay without the mystery charge on my card.”
Reviews.Author: procuitto
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I'd have to say I was very impressed with the Sheraton Hotel in Toronto. The room itself was clean and the staff were courteous and helpful. The only off putting aspects were the oily, finger smudged room windows, extremely thin walls, and as one reviewer put it- the "train station" feel of the lobby. My friend and I took a one night leisure trip to Toronto, and stayed on the club floor (37th) with two double beds, 24 hour internet, and breakfast included for $159 BT (We called the morning of, for a room). When we entered the room, on the table there were a large selection of items for sale at the mini bar and I remembered saying to myself it'd be my luck if they charged us for something we never purchased! We had paid for the room upfront, and hadn't touched a single thing in the room up till the time of check out. I don't understand where they had the gull to make unnecessary charges without notifying the customer 4 days after the trip. While I have contacted them to resolve the issue, in the meantime this ordeal has extremely soured my impression of this hotel and its ethical billing practices. In closing, make SURE you read the fine print and ask to make sure what's free in your room and what isn't as they don't readily make this information available to you. Confirm all charges upon check in AND check out as well as your credit card statement.

Reviews.Title: “No 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2madmike
Reviews.Content: While our USA-Canada Trip we got the opportunity to have a night at the Sheraton in Toronto. Next to other Hotels like the Marriot or Westin or Hilton, the Sheraton does not deserve the 4*. Our room was not clean at all. The heating in the bathroom was broken. and sharp edges rised from it. One light was also broken. And last but not least, there was a dirty bathtowel. At least the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CTA76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I won this hotel via Priceline for 2 consecutive weeknights for about 50% off the listed rack rates. We were beyond satisified with this hotel. As others have mentioned, the hotel's parking rates are rather steep, but the underground parking lot across the street is only $20/day. The hotel staff is very helpful in telling you how to get over there (as opposed to say a hotel that denies the existence of a cheaper parking option). Our room itself was excellent. You can tell it was redone, but it was great. Very spacious and an excellent bed. The location of the hotel is perfect. It's very close to a few tourist attractions. We walked to Dundas Square, St. Lawrence Market, and Rogers Centre. Oh, and while checking in, I mentioned it was our anniversary and the hotel offered to send up a cheese platter. That was very nice of them.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, bad room location”
Reviews.Author: Chyla1980
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel valet met us and exchanged our car keys for a tag. We checked into the room (with a voucher rate that we handed in at that time). We made our way up to the room and were pleased with the condition of the room. The windows are pretty dirty to look out but a decent view. We were out of the hotel until nightfall and when we got back we realized that it sounded like someone was vaccuuming constantly. Eventually we realized that it was the elevators... They made a rolling like noise and never stopped all night long... Quite annoying as it kept us up much of the night. Room service was prompt however very over priced for size and quality of desserts. Our check out was invoiced and slid under the door however it was incorrect due to the fact that the voucher was not added on to our room rate. The situation was rectified quickly when I brought it to their attention. Upon checkout we pulled out the little tag for calling for our car to realize that we were supposed to hand it in to the front desk. They never told us to and front desk had never asked us for it. We assumed we would be charged the parking costs on the credit card but never were. As this did work in our favor probably not the best procedure for the hotel itself. Overall the hotel was nice however the service didnt quite match the atmosphere. It wasnt bad.. but it definitely wasnt wow worthy either.

Reviews.Title: “Very uncomfortable bed. Partly because...”
Reviews.Author: AwayAtWeekends
Reviews.Content: Very uncomfortable bed. Partly because the whole bed shook when one of us turned over, partly because it was much too soft, and partly because the under sheet was too small and kept springing loose from the matress. After the first night we requested bigger sheets and a bed board. The member of staff we spoke to was very apologetic and offered us free breakfasts to compensate. However the promised larger sheets and board never materialised. The room was a good size but very dated and uninspiring. Check-in was quick and staff were helpful with directions and local information. Pool was a plus. The breakfasts included a good range of choices with excellent omelettes cooked to order but other cooked food was just so,so.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing about the hotel is the pool....”
Reviews.Author: tcrad12
Reviews.Content: We arrived in our room to find it had not been cleaned properly. There was a huge what looked like coffee stain on the bedskirt. Which made me wonder about how clean the rest of the room really was. Parking for the hotel is $45 per night! and they left my vehicle outside the entire time! Quinns Steakhouse is in the hotel but not affiliated with the hotel and thank goodness as it was the worst dining experience I have ever had in my life!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: Aileen H
Reviews.Content: Excellent base for touring around Toronto. Close to underground stations and bus and tram stops. Hotel was very clean as was room although it was a little small. I would recommend this hotel without reservation and would return again if I was visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view.”
Reviews.Author: Stephlewis
Reviews.Content: Just got home from 9 nights at the Sheraton. I experienced the fire alarm going off too. Lots of announcements and constant ringing alarms for about one hour. No sleep that night!! The other 8 nights I slept really well though. Beds are very comfortable. Whilst the hotel is a perfect location as it is very central (hence the name Sheraton Centre) it is too busy there and you don't get to know anyone. There seemed to be a lot of conferences and events on in the hotel so people bustling about all day, every day. The maid tried to get into my room every morning at around 8am and as it was too early would ask me what time she could come back. I'm on holiday - I want to leave when I feel like it. Some mornings I would get a bottle of water, others not. I read another review that said she got free popcorn and juice in the evenings - where was this I wonder? My parents stayed in the Hilton Garden Inn and had free cookies and coffee every evening. The pool was ok. Bit dissapointed in the fact that it was only one pool. A lot of people apparently understood that there were two pools but in fact when it says indoor / outdoor pool it is in fact half in and half out!!! I had a fabulous view of the CN tower - I asked for a room high up and with this view and they were happy to accomodate. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff there but there were always long queues for whoever you needed to speak too. Finding the shops from the hotel underground was a maze - I could never get back to the same shops twice!! Maybe that's just me though - I'm hopeless with a map. Still, I enjoyed the time there and walked miles every day. Loved the island - if you go, you must rent a bike to see the whole of the island. And don't forget a trip to Niagara Falls for the day if you haven't already been.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: george00
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sheraton Centre Toronto several times a year. I recently stayed for three nights in the Queen tower. The Good: Great location which is easily accessible to the subway and has a streetcar stop right in front of the hotel. Nice indoor/outdoor pool Good service Rooms are of a decent size and everything was in good working condition. Mostly clean (see below) The bad: While most of the room was clean, when looking at the wall behind the mattress there was quite a bit of dust on the top of the mattress and on the floor under the bedskirt It's nice to have free internet in the lobby, however, sometimes I would like to lounge in the privacy of my own room and check my email, look up something on the 'net, etc. It would be nice if internet was at least offered for free in room for members of the starwood preferred guest program. Our room was located right next to the elevator so in the mornings I couldn't sleep past 7 am due to the sound of the elevator going up and down. What happened to a free upgrade to a "preferred" room for SPG gold members? The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling and could use an update. Lastly, the darn fire alarms at 2 am. I have woken to fire alarms on three different occasions, this time at 2 am. It is then difficult to get back to sleep. I realize that this is a large hotel with a lot of guests, but it seems that the frequent alarms are a little excessive.

Reviews.Title: “If you value sleep; stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Brian186338
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Sheraton Hotels before, but after this never again. From the moment they tried to down-grade our (pre-paid) room at check in, to the moment they tried to extract 40 dollars for "other" services, which we not only had not received but they could not even tell us what they were supposed to be, at check out, they were terrible. The staff really made you feel it was quite a lot of trouble for them to do anything to make your stay pleasant. They found it impossible to service the room properly and even make the bed. Worst of all the sound-proofing is non-existant, we had little sleep due to the terrible noise each night. We will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, centrally located for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: MTBDance
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for business trip. Centrally located to all major financial institutions in downtown Toronto and within walking distance to a wide variety of restaurants, shops and a few strip malls. Room was as expected for a hotel catering to business travelers. Only issue I had was that I was assigned a room with 2 queens beds but one of the beds was not made. I called the Front Desk and Housekeeping was there to turn the room over very quickly. I had dinner at the Irish pub/steakhouse in the lobby. Food was very good, wait staff was was very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT experience at Sheraton - make sure to ask for Queen Tower with a view of the CN Tower”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug373
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got 50% off ($93 per night) our room price at the Sheraton in downtown Toronto. We're big fans of Tripadvisor, so we checked out the reviews before staying there. We were thoroughly impressed. Most of the rave reviews seemed to come from people who stayed in the Queen Street (newer) tower. We also heard that the CN Tower is visible from the upper levels of this tower, so we specifically requested this when we arrived. We arrived at ~2pm, so I'm not sure if this increased our chances of better room choice, but I suspect that it probably helped. Before arriving at the hotel, we called the toll free number and joined (for free) Sheraton's Starwood preferred member club. This club membership seemed worthwhile since the 33rd floor (and probably above to level 43) were specifically reserved for members of this club. We were treated to a King-sized bed upgrade for free ($20 value) since they didn't have a queen available at the time. We rented a car to attend a wedding that was slightly out of town, but otherwise, we could have easily used mass transit the whole time from this central location. It's very close to many conveniences including shopping at the Eaton Centre, Tim Horton's, and mass transit. It was also only a 15 minute walk to the Air Canada Centre where we checked out a concert. Our only complaint (which was easily resolved) was that parking was $45 per day for the valet. You can park underneath the City Hall across the street on Queen for $20 per day. We would definitely recommend this hotel using the criteria listed above.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelgal018
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on hotwire. Beautiful lobby. Nice comfortable room. GREAT location... across the street from hop on/off bus stop which we did, block from Eaton Centre, and walkable to CN Tower. Parking expensive $45/day. Great service

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Sheraton Centre Toronto for the bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: jhastie
Reviews.Content: I am so angry I could scream right now. I stayed at the Sheraton Centre in Toronto for 3 nights in early June 2010 (Sheraton Tower). This is the only hotel or public place I have stayed in months. Now, I'm being forced to spend upwards of $1000 to get rid of bed bugs that I brought home with me as a "souvenir." Any chance you want to "chip in" for this expense, Sheraton Centre Toronto???

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeafsFan97
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good hotel. The room is really clean and nice. The location is amazing its right across city hall. The pool is awesome its half outside and half inside. The lobby is really nice they give out free food sometimes its really nice. The staff is also really freindly and nice. This hotel was really good i recommend this hotel to travelers and family.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a hotel with YOUR best interest in mind!”
Reviews.Author: myvoicecarries
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sheraton Centre Toronto through Hotwire.com for $89 (CDN). It was a fantastic deal for such a well-established brand of hotel. I've stayed at Sheraton's in the past and have consistently enjoyed wonderful service...but this particular time was above and beyond any hotel experience I've ever had. Upon arrival I asked if there were any payable upgrades (I do this everytime I book through a third party site and I highly recommend it). Not only was the girl happy to look, she gave me plenty of options as well. We decided to take a junior suite for an additional $30 dollars (one king bed, one pull out couch, and a balcony located on the 3rd floor). My friend and I spent the day shopping and when we came back to our room around 8pm we noticed the room next to us had a 'please be quiet' sign on the door and thought that was weird. We went into our room and were just watching television and talking when we heard a knock on the door. We thought it was our friends who were meeting up with us (we were going to see deadmau5 that night - it was AWESOME btw). When I opened the door, no one was there. I looked around and heard a door open, it was the person next to us. She said 'you need to be quiet, I'm trying to sleep.' and she tried to close the door, I stopped her and said 'all we're doing is talking, that woke you up?' and she said 'yes, you're being loud. I need to sleep.' I kept stopping her from shutting the door because I was trying to tell her my friends and I wouldn't be leaving for another 2 hours so if we're loud talking at normal volume this is going to be an issue. She didn't care though and just insisted that she needed her sleep and shut the door in my face. I called the front desk and explained the situation saying that I didn't want to be kicked out on account of waking this woman up again. He was totally understanding and within 10 minutes he had us move to a room just a few doors down. They didn't have any staff available to run the new key cards down to me so I happily went up to the front desk to get them myself. I spoke with the gentlemen who had helped me and asked if there was anyone beside us in the new room, which i quickly said after 'not that it matters' I didn't want to give the impression that we were going to be purposely loud and disruptive to other guests. He said 'no, no one is next to you and to be honest that woman was quite rude to tell you to be quiet.' I was pleasently surprised to see that the hotel would be on our side at all! Turns out the Sheraton has a no noise policy that begins at 11pm (not 10pm like most hotels I've stayed in) and it being only 9pm at this point, the hotel sided with us. My friends and I were so incredibly touched with the service and support in this hotel. Not to mention the comfortable and clean rooms and fantastic location (literally steps away from the eaton's center). I look forward to staying there again this summer and hope anyone who reads this review will make the same choice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: brooklyborn
Reviews.Content: It's not very often that we stay in hotels in the GTA, however, over the Canada Day Weekend we were not able to stay with friends and the Sheraton provided us with our home away from home. In fact, in many ways it was better than our home! There was a very friendly gentleman to greet us and assist with our luggage, a lovely young lady at the desk who checked us in, and very kind and understanding cleaning staff to help us! We stayed here, with our 4 month old son specifically because of the pool. We were NOT disappointed! It was gorgeous. We spent several hours at the pool over the three days that we stayed, and never met a negative moment. There were plenty of towels, friendly staff and a very lovely pool side bar! Our room was clean, the bed pleasant to sleep on and I have to say I appreciated the "GREEN" initiative that Sheraton follows. I loved having my own blue box in the room and would only suggest inviting guests to follow Toronto's compost opportunities. Yes, Toronto is a busy city, and yes, this hotel is RIGHT downtown, so was I shocked to be able to hear the concerts going on across the street? No, but when I did call down to the guest services to inquire if they knew how late it would be going on, they not only knew, they also offered to move our room! (we declined as our son was sleeping soundly concert and all!) A fire alarm did go off in the wee small hours of the morning but I found that their announcements were both professional and reassuring. Parking is expensive here, but we also didn't have to worry about finding a spot, struggling with our gear or having to organize ourselves to get our stuff back to the car at check out! Between the Bell staff and the valet staff all we had to do was get in and buckle up! My favourite aspects about our stay were these: Being down town, very close to many restaurants, transportation, shopping and movie theatres. Being surrounded by very professional and friendly staff who were always ready to help me with my stroller or with any questions I had. The Link- the access to the computers. The POOL! truly an Oasis on such hot and sultry days! Thank you Sheraton for making our stay in your hotel so enjoyable! I can only hope that our friends are not able to put us up again soon so we have an excuse to see you again!

Reviews.Title: “Everything great....”
Reviews.Author: crazywudsl
Reviews.Content: Check-in for SPG platinum guest was efficient and as one would want getting standard platinum amenity, access to club lounge, and higher level club floor room. Parking in public lots was inexpensive and across the street. Walk to many popular locations and activities.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but very brown and very expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: jalu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Canadian tour in July 2010 and while we found the hotel to be comfortable and well staffed there we did find some downsides. Our room was on the fifth floor of the Richmond tower and could have used a bit of an update. While the decor was almost entirely brown (albeit different shades of brown) the beds were really comfortable and the aircon excellent during the Toronto heatwave. Outside of the room the hotel lobby was plush and well decorated but the lifts were a constant bugbear, either not working or working slowly 'due to the heat'. We often ended up using the service lift and I once got lost taking the stairs out of sheer desperation. Parking at the hotel itself was ludicrously expensive at more than $40 a night - the hotel is connected to the huge City Hall parking lot which charged less but still more than we would have liked. Internet access in the room was expensive however the lobby had a few machines which allowed you to get online for free. All in all the hotel was pretty comfortable but our room could have used a bit of a lick of paint.

Reviews.Title: “Best Toronto locaton; best hotel pool; A-1”
Reviews.Author: barb1960
Reviews.Content: Went for a business conference and brough my two sons with me(ages 17 and 20). We all enjoyed ourselves. The location couldn't be any better. Nathan Philips Square, the Eaton Centre, and walking distance to so much. The jewel in the crown is the heated outdoor swimming pool. Large enough to do laps. Must be 25 metres long. Superb!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK Room, Outrageous parking fee.”
Reviews.Author: WADEKIND
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on this hotel by using an educated guess on one of those sites where you don't know what your getting until you pay. Very busy hotel right downtown close to city hall. Easy access to public transportation. Expensive restaurants even for a pastry or a sandwich. Our room had dirt in all of the corners. We stayed 3 nights and even though our reservation was for 4 we had to ask for a 4th towel. Good for business travelers. I would not stay here for the full rate they were asking. Parking was $45.00/day which is the highest I saw while looking for hotels in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: dmarsh_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at several hotels in Toronto and we seem to always come back to this one. The best overall for luxury, service, convenienince and value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Fantastic Location, BUT they Need to Address the Fire Alarm Issue!”
Reviews.Author: KAM_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the night of July 2, 2010. We were greeted very professionally and were happy with the location, the view, and the room. The hotel is right in the middle of the action on Queen Street and extremely close to all the downtown activities. The room decor was nice, the beds comfortable and the cleanliness was fairly good. The pool and hot tub were very nice, and not too crowded, which surprised us given the huge number of people staying at the hotel and the hot weather! We enjoyed that very much. There's no mini-bar in the room, which surprised me. Room service was incredibly expensive. There's very few places in the area where you can pick up fruit or a pastry for breakfast, so you're a little bit stuck in that way. We went down to the Starbucks in the lobby which had absolutely awful stale muffins. Now, the biggest complaint we had was that we were awakened at 3 or 4 am by a fire alarm. Now normally I would say that's life, and just accept that people sometimes pull an alarm just for fun. However, I had read reviews that this is a VERY common occurrence at this hotel. I think they need to look at WHY this is occurring on a regular basis at this hotel and look for ways to address them. I would suggest limiting the number of proms/teen age events to have a more mature crowd. Also perhaps warning people ahead of time so they can make an educated decision about whether to stay there or not. (Yeah I know that will never happen.) If you are a person who has trouble falling back asleep after the worry of a fire alarm, stay somewhere else. You won't get a good night's sleep. In addition, how about an apology the next day? In the morning, I would have liked to close the blinds, but they scrimped on the curtains and I believe that it is not possible to close the heavy fabric, only the light, useless ones (hopefully management will correct me if I am wrong). So we were awakened at 6 am by the incredibly bright light. Basically, we got three hours of sleep...no fun at all!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: HerefordSniper
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best locations in the city. we only had to walk 20 minutes to get to anywhere ! ( the cn tower, basball ground, lakefront etc. ) The check in staff were extremely helpful and accomodating and we were given a room on the 10th floor overlooking the city centre. The room was fabulous and one of the biggest I have ever stayed in. The staff overall were very friendly and I thoroughly recommend a stay here. If I had one concern,( well two ) it was the state of the changing rooms for the pool. All the lockers bar one or two, were padlocked and being used privately, and the spa tub wasn't working correctly and was looking a bit tired; also the price of the drinks in the bar were very expensive. That said, everywhere in Toronto is expensive !!

Reviews.Title: “great location ,hospitable staff,very good amenities.”
Reviews.Author: walkaboutWhickham_
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Toronto at the height of the G20 summit. Despite the unfortunate circumstances and the sad turn of events I still managed to have an enjoyable time in Toronto, mainly due to the helpful staff who were always more than willing to give good advice to me. When!! I make a return visit to toronto this hotel will be my first choice.!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: SKtravels_10
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the level of service I received during my stay at this property. My accommodations were well appointed and my overall feeling was that the hotel was good value for the rate I paid.

Reviews.Title: “so many screw ups ..”
Reviews.Author: manny358
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent business traveler and thought I would try Sheraton. So far, I'm not impressed. On my first night when I arrived at midnight, they gave me keys that didn't work and after getting another set, they still didn't work. Eventually, Security let me in but forget to bring keys up. I called a couple of times and finally had to complain to the Manager to get keys. On my next night, they had checked me out even though I was staying for 5 nights. Threw all my stuff in a bag (and shoved it in a suitcase) and moved it to Lost & Found. Yes, I understand, mistakes can happen but what really was reallyt disappointing was the attitude of the Front Desk Manager, who promptly told me it was "not his fault" this happened. So much for shouldering responsibility as a a team and taking Accountability! I'd like to get a response from the Manager at this Hotel and will find him out to discuss all the screw ups .. if they are not reading this.. so far very negative.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre "4-star" Sheraton Centre”
Reviews.Author: elsal
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Priceline, I stayed 4 nights for under US$90/night at this "4 star" rated hotel. It is the typical, giant, fairly impersonal chain hotel that gets an international clientele, conventioneers, and many business travelers. The rooms are small, but the staff was present for any request. Their air conditioning system did not seem to be performing too well... the room temperature seemed to always stay between 77 to 80 degrees... even at maximum fan & cooling. My biggest concern was with room noise. The windows are older and not well insulated from blocking exterior noise... i.e. sirens, clock towers, & activities taking place across the street at City Hall. Additionally, the interior noise was pretty loud from activity in the hallway & other rooms. The World Cup was going on & the Portugal fans in the room next door exploded every time their country scored a goal one morning(pre-8am)... that damn team scored 7 goals that morning!!! The Sheraton's location is terrific. If you're flying into Toronto City Island Airport, this is a great hotel for you. There is a free bus that takes you from the terminal to Union Station. From there, it is a few city blocks to the lobby of the Sheraton. Before booking with Priceline, I saw similar rooms offered at this hotel for around $150/night. My advice, if you need to stay in downtown Toronto, before booking through a hotel website or your favorite travel booking site, try to get a bargain through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired... A large...”
Reviews.Author: Thenightgoose
Reviews.Content: A bit tired... A large business/conference type of a place, so not much character. Modernisation needed in some areas. Pricey food. Opt for the upgrade which includes breakfast and hors dervs each day. The view is fantastic and the food is pleasant. Gym and pool are good but changing facilities are down the hall: bit crazy and you may want to take a robe especially if you've been swimming! Not centrally located but great views of tower and city. Would stay again, especially if they re-furbed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: mkrober
Reviews.Content: Great location in Downtown. Walking distance to Chinatown, SoHo, CN Tower/ Skydome, and Waterfront. Rooms were nice and well kept. Valet parking is pretty expensive, but there is self parking across street under city hall, which is cheaper (still >$20). Found a very good deal using Priceline. I would certainly stay there again if visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Great Views If You Ask For Them”
Reviews.Author: RoyalSilk
Reviews.Content: Ask if you can for a high floor and a cityside (as opposed to lakeside) view when you check in. The lakeside view sounds better but actually is obscured by equally tall buildings whereas from the 41st floor. I found the staff were very accommodating, the attentiveness excellent and the view cityside from this level is stunning (when the cloud is above you!). Service was very good and their response to a 2.15am fire alarm immpecable - well communicated and an abject apology the following morning for a false alarm on the voicemail. The hotel is very well located for all downtown facilities. Parking is $45 a day so you will obviously avoid that. By British standards its decor is unsophisticated and needs an makeover.

Reviews.Title: “An enormous hotel housing guests in two...”
Reviews.Author: pace_ripley
Reviews.Content: An enormous hotel housing guests in two towers situated impeccably close to shopping, government and cultural sites. Rooms are clean and fairly modern. WiFi/Intetnet access is CA$17/day but for a hotel - very fast. Gripes: like another reviewer said, second-day and beyond room cleaning is not what I would expect. Some bath cleaning and supplies replenishment (coffee, soap) but no new towels and clumsy rehanging of said towels. Shower is mediocre at best. Old showrhead needs to go. For CA$275 (incl.tax) for a plain room - you start expecting things. Sheraton barely delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel with expected facilities of a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kadavar
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights in this large, busy hotel as part of a package holiday. Our room on the 32nd Floor was clean, in good condition and pleasantly decorated. The bed was comfortable and everything worked. TV, hairdryer, ironing board and toiletries were all supplied. The location is good and central for many attractions. The staff we encountered were pleasant and efficient. This is a huge hotel with all the expected facilities of a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton was A Warm Welcome in a Big City”
Reviews.Author: willypost123
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for the FCM (Federation of Canadian Municipalities) conference which was being held at the Sheraton Centre. My wife and I were very pleased with the accomodations, the cleanliness of our room the friendly and polite staff. We were also pleased with the location. Shopping, restaurants, transportation and sight seeing were all withing walking distance of the hotel. On our second day there we were greeted by the West Coast Manager Scott Mac Millan who was working at the Sheraton while the conference was on. Mr. MacMillna was most accomodating in making our stay and the stay of many of our colleagues as comfortable and pleasing as possible. We were treated with the greatest hospitality by Mr, MacMillan and he made sure that we knew that if there was anything he could do to make our stay more to our liking we were to contact him and he would do whatever was possible to please us. He is a definate assest to the Sheraton and his friendly and professional attitude was definately a factor in making the Sheraton Hotel a pleasant experience for us. .

Reviews.Title: “Good location for seeing Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Robjan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre Hotel Toronto for six nights. While we were there the fire alarm went off twice on different nights 4am & 1.30am. We were on the 12th floor and didnâ€™t have to evacuate the premises. Information was given over a speaker system within the room which gave updates on the situation before the fire service announced it was a false alarm. It seems the fire alarm was set off twice on the 42nd floor deliberately and on the 2nd occasion the culprit was caught on CCTV. In our opinion the situation was handled in a satisfactory manor. Our room was clean and tidy and had no complaints. We had a view of the City Hall opposite. We never experienced any delays waiting for lifts which sometimes can happen in hotels with so many floors. The hotel is ideally situated for getting around Toronto with bus and trams passing and two subway stations close by. TTC day tickets were good value if you are planning to make several trips in one day. We didnâ€™t eat in the hotel but preferred to dine in restaurants close by The Keg and Milestones were two of our favourites. Bar prices in the hotel bar were slightly more expensive but they did put peanuts out. We were lucky with the weather with temperatures reaching 31c and were able to use the outside pool area, but on the weekend it did become very busy and the sun beds were all taken. If we were to visit Toronto again we would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly727
Reviews.Content: Like the traveler below, I stayed at the Sheraton Centre for an international communicators conference and agree on his assessment of how they handled the potential fire emergency. I had my concerns, based on the inconsistent reviews, but was pleasantly surprised by the friendly staff and their level of service, down to the housekeeper. I had access to the club level and by the third morning, the receptionist greeted me by name. She even offered me use of her "faster" computer so I could check in for my flight. My room was of average size, but was modern and clean. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was small, but adequate. My only complaint was the fan, that ran continuously. The location is great, with easy access to the subway, streetcar and shopping. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and feeling taken advantage of!”
Reviews.Author: magic039
Reviews.Content: Will not stay in the downtown hotels again. This time was just too much for us to stomach...We shop for our hotels and research location and this time was not aware of the EXTRAS that we incurred when we arrived. $45.00 a day for no choice valet parking was the worst charge of all and I am still blown away by this and $16.95 a day for internet service, also another totally ridiculous charge. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone because I would be too embarrassed to tell them of the crazy costs involved over and above the room charge. It is definitely NOT THAT SPECIAL.

Reviews.Title: “CLEANLINESS AT A BARE MINIMUM...”
Reviews.Author: Katherine523
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton a few times in the past and was TERRIBLY DISAPPOINTED by what I saw during this stay. We were given a room in the Richmond Tower - 2 Double Beds. At a bare minimum (ignoring decor, amenities, etc.) in any hotel room in any city, you expect general overall cleanliness - that is definitely NOT what we got. The bed sheets were filthy - massive red (ketchup spattered) looking stain on the bed cover once we ripped off the duvet and on the other bed, black looking grease marks. Both bed skirts were caked with black looking grease stains over weeks/months accumulation of travellers shoes??? AND the tongs for the ice bucket were caked with someone's old food. The last thing you want to be reminded of when you walk into a hotel room is that there were past inhabitants there. We were happy to see that the room came with a mini fridge (even though not requested) but were shocked to find a yellowey looking old yogurt spill dwelling in there??? We called Guest Services and they had someone replace the sheets immediately but really the only two great things I can say about the stay - the LOCATION and the HAND CREAM (Mandarin & Mint) ...really, that's it. DISAPPOINTING. NEVER staying there again. Dirty sheets - inexcusable. You shouldn't have to ask for those things. oh and parking? 45 dollars a night, I suggest the GREEN P across the street - $30 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: saskatoon10987654321
Reviews.Content: The entire staff right from the bellman to the pool attendant made my stay at the Sheraton Centre one of my top 3 - and I travel a great deal. Goran at the front desk and guest services manger Scott are two of the most professional and friendly staff I have encounterd at any hotel. Their attention to detail and the ability to remember my name amongst thousands of guests was greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nice room!”
Reviews.Author: CIVOG
Reviews.Content: We've arrived at 21:00 and check-in was very efficient. We were given a room at Starwood preferred guest level, as my husband has a Gold Starwood card. Room was very spacious, nice and clean. Had an LCD TV and a view to CN Tower. Location is great! You can't go wrong if you stay here, if you are in Toronto! in the night we arrived we ordered some food from room service. It was promptly delivered, it was nice, but a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Brief stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: jonstanford
Reviews.Content: As part of a winter trip we had 2 night stopover in Toronto. We arrived from Ottawa on the train and we arrived about 6pm. Tip: There are many unscrupulous "taxi" drivers hovering around the station - we were definately ripped off for the short journey. There was confusion at check in - we were a part of 6 in 3 rooms, they later left messages to say that one of the party hadnt checked in! Room was good & spacious and we were given access to club level - great for breakfast & evening snacks, although beer expensive! Location very good, access to the path system, plenty of shops/eateries close by. Pool was nice, had indoor/outdoor section and hottub - but strangely the changing rooms were down the corridor and our room keys didn't work in the door. Be careful not to step outside from the changing room as you cant get back in - not so good in the freezing winter weather ! We were out much of the next day and then left early on our way to Niagara so we really didn't spend that much time in the hotel but it provided a comfortable stay. Having breakfast on club level was a great extra.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, luxurious hotel to stay with all one needs but a fridge.”
Reviews.Author: Murphy050
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel before & it is pure luxury & has an escalator down to the 25 klm shopping and business centre underground which is amazing. It is in the centre of town near lots of places of interest and the only thing I could say about it is that it is expensive but one gets what we pay for really. The rooms are huge and the bathrooms excellent with everything needed being provided such as shampoo soap conditioner & face cream daily. All of the staff were very friendly and willing to assist with any needs that are wanted. I love it and want to return for a 3rd stay hopefully. The hotel does have specials such as pay for 5 and get a 6th night free which is a great deal I had advantage of on my stay. The hotel also has coffee making facilities in each room & a great T.V.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but rooms in need of a facelift”
Reviews.Author: JohnelnWeldon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - very close to the main shopping and business areas. The hotel is very well equipped - with all facilities you would expect. The room is a bit dated and could do with a facelift. but overall I woul recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No luxury, but good service”
Reviews.Author: MCMember
