Reviews.Content: Sheratons can vary greatly from Lisbon to Amsterdam Airport to ... Toronto. This one is very conveniently located and quite good to host conferences. The rooms are a bit tired and not as spacious as you would expect in North America, and corridors are a bit gloomy. There were a few glitches at check-in, but the staff dealt with these promptly and offered compensation without the need to complain. Unrelated to this, but still good service, I was also offered complimentary (not too) late check-out. The hotel has decent bars and grills, although there is plenty of choice a few blocks away. Limited choice of room service, but good and efficient. LAN access in the room and wireless in the lobby, so if you want to work anywhere else than on the bed, just bring a cable. The best thing I found is a fantastic fitness room, open after hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ANGIE1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights on the 17th floor view was the CN Tower that was good,the rooms were clean enough although did expect king size beds but we got standard doubles,staff came daily to change towels etc...The hotel was quiet enough I think I had my family with me and they all snored so couldn,t hear anything anyway lol.......... Bar was to expensive tho.The food was ok we used the food hall for breakfast cheap compared to the streets. The rooms and lobbies a touch dated but the location out weighed the glamour that we could have got in other hotels but I actually liked it am no snob and it done our stay its a huge hotel with thousands staying every year of course its going to be well used but not scruffy Just Go and make the most of your time there without worrying you,ll be ok in this hotel you could get much much worse. ENJOY xx AJ (scotland)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, predictable SPG service quality.”
Reviews.Author: Payam81
Reviews.Content: The number one reason you should choose this hotel is because of the location! It's in the downtown, without being too close to the core and right across from the city hall with underground access to subway and a maze of shops. Hotel itself is a bit old, but renovated so the rooms don't feel dated. In fact I found the rooms to be nicely decorated, just like most other Sheraton hotels. Stayed here several times and always been satisfied. They are one of the easier ones to get through Priceline for dirt cheap prices. At the beginning of the recent economic recession, I once managed to get a night for $35 + Tax on Priceline! Those days are long gone though and the hotel is very popular and goes for a lot more, even on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great on somethings, lacking in others”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler83
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, the gym/pool facilities are great. The hallways/rooms are pretty dated, but nothing wrong with that. Stay away form the food at all costs, I got sick on several meals, and was always let down by even the most basic of dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the Money, Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: mkouzmine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my father while in town for a concert. We got a great rate and paid nearly nothing for decent accommodations in downtown Toronto. Thank goodness because I would hate to shell out real money for a hotel like this. Our bathroom was not very clean and we found several strands of hair on the floor and on the vanity. The room was basic, simple and no frills. Parking was very expensive, but it is downtown so that's to be expected. We did not eat in the hotel so we can't remark on the restaurant, but it was nice to have a Starbucks downstairs. I think this hotel is more suited to business travelers than for tourists, but it is still more of a value hotel than a luxury one, no matter who the client is.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive price ... poor value”
Reviews.Author: garent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton on the weekend. My complaints are mostly of the room. This very expensive hotel does not match the quality of it. Of course the lobby was beautiful but when you go to the room it's less than worth it's money. I have stayed at hotels that are a quarter the price that are much nicer. In addition, the room service was very poor. We came back to our room on more than one occasion and dirty dishes were still there and used cups after the room was supposedly cleaned. I also put towels on the floor and I believe they were just picked up off the floor on one of the days to be used again. In addition to the cleanliness the hotel was very expensive. The restaurant prices were out of this world. They charged $70 for 3 phone calls. I do understand that Toronto is expensive but there comes a point that begin to think you are being taken. I attended this hotel with an extremely large group and with that amount of money coming in you would think they would cater to their guests to have them return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: Gordouu
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay in Toronto (live in north of Toronto) after a company event and stayed at the Sheraton Hotel Toronto for a night. I had the King bed room, the room was nice and spacious on the higher floor with a view of the CN Tower. Used the fitness facilities the next morning, it has a huge pool and new fitness equipment. The staffs were friendly and helpful especially Jimmy at the fitness center who was always trying to help. The breakfast buffet has a huge selection of food and the quality was great.

Reviews.Title: “great position, clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: HUmbleChow
Reviews.Content: I havd been stayed in the hotel for 6 days in April for a conference and a holiday afterward. The reception gave me a prompt arrangement and very early check-in., there was great, I could take a shower and rest after a 15 hrs flight. The standard room was spacious and clean. It's located in the heart of the downtown, many spots are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: briggott
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for a meeting at the convention center. It's a healthy walk to the center but easy to do in comfortable shoes. Connected to the underground shopping and walkways. Only 2 blocks from the Eaton Centre Mall and Hudson Bay. A few restaurants within close walking distance. Food and beverage at the hotel is pricey. Glass of wine is a minimum of $11 CA and they love to tax in Canada. Free internet in the lobby area and Club level of the hotel. I was caught off guard when shopping and was asked if I wanted a plastic bag for my clothing purchase and then found I was charged 5 cents for the bag on my receipt. Overall good experience at the hotel. Club services on the 43rd floor were nice with a great view out the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Friendly Staff....and....A Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: BFamilyClintonTwp_MI
Reviews.Content: What could have been an "okay" visit turned out great due to advice from another review on this site and the staff at this hotel. Parking at this hotel is expensive - $45 per day! Ouch! Another review suggested parking at the parking garage across the street for $25. We did this and it worked out perfect. Probably didn't have to walk more than 200 extra feet from where the valet would have delivered the car. Also, the room we were originally given had a distinct 'musty' odor. I wasn't happy with it, but figured I would tolerate it. My husband went to the desk and the staff apologized profusely, upgraded us AND offered to transfer our luggage to the new room. Problem handled very nicely. The concierge gave us ideas of activities, restaurants and shopping. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Got what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: backman_brian
Reviews.Content: I live in Toronto but wanted to get away for the weekend so put in a bid on Priceline.com I only paid $89.00 so for a hotel in downtown this was a real steal. Got my money's worth but would not be happy if I had to pay full price for this place. I can back up what other reviewers have said and this hotel definantly give priceline customers the short end of the stick when it comes to the room inventory. Though the room was small (double bed only) it was clean and an amazing view (29th floor) Pros: Starbucks coffee in room, New and updated furniture, excellent pool, Clean, central location. Cons: Take the TTC because parking is $45.00, Expect to get the smaller rooms if booking on priceline (still good value in my opinion), Very busy, lots of foot traffic, no free internet (I have a turbostick so didn't really care) On a side note, I worked on a Reality TV show that shot at this hotel 5 years ago and the staff were very accommodating to us. Everyone from the doorman to the chef was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable Staff”
Reviews.Author: TOTraveller6295
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Toronto, we stayed at the Sheraton Centre, in downtown TO. Although all aspects of the stay were comfortable and great, the housekeeping staff were outstanding. It gave a really lift to my day to have the housekeeper assigned to our floor pass along a few chocolates each day of our stay. The chocolate was delicious, but the gesture and the smile that accompanied it were memorable. Will return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: MtnBrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre for two nights in April 2010. As we stayed over the weekend, we were able to get a great rate (only $149/night). At that price, this hotel was great value. We had a room on the 31st floor with a view toward city hall. Unfortunately that meant we were woken on an hourly basis each time the tower bells tolled the hours away. Our room had a king size bed that was comfortable. The room was a reasonable size for a large city. The ventilation worked properly and it was even possible to open the window. The room was mostly clean - except for a heavy layer of dust extending an inch from all the walls. That was a bit gross. The one way I would have improved the room would be to add a small fridge. There was complimentary internet access in the lobby. Six computers were available. The hotel also accommodated our late check out. The location was very convenient - about one block to the Eaton Centre and the subway station. This hotel would be a good choice for business or leisure travelers. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated -- Literally”
Reviews.Author: TampaFloridian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights for a conference. We paid over $300/night and expected a 4-star stay. This hotel is deserving of only 2 stars. We had requested a king bed and it was not available (they were rude about it). We got 2 double beds, no pillow-top. There was a card in the room that said you could choose not to get your room made up at ALL (under the guise of the hotel being green) - really? 5 days with no maid service in a 4-star? The bathroom was dark (lighting is from the 70's) and crowded (small counter space with insufficient space for 2, and storage of dop kits and hair dryers necessary in the closet). Cups provided in the bathroom are those plastic ones wrapped in plastic. The second night we were awakened at 2am by a loudspeaker in our room and a loud buzzing noise saying that there was a fire in the second basement and that we should 'stand by' for evacuation instructions. This went on for about 45 minutes (destroying my night's sleep) with the voice announcing in our room 3 or more times. I tried to go back to sleep but kept contemplating what I would try to rescue from the room if we really had to leave. Several times I had to talk to someone at the front desk or the operator and they were extremely abrupt and rude. If you're going to a convention, stay at the Fairmont or the Intercontinental. There is nothing except the location of this hotel (downtown but still far away from the convention centre) to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: geo54
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location Within walking distance to many attractions and the subway. We were upgraded and stayed on the 41st floor (Club Level). Very nice rooms. Comfy beds, flat screen tv. I did think that it was odd that there was no fan in the bathroom. Made the room very muggy and steamy after showering. The information desk was very informative by giving directions, maps, suggestions and tickets. I loved the fact that you could walk indoors all the way to Eaton Centre and subway. Pool was great with the indoor outdoor option. However, the hot tub which we were looking forward to was not that hot and the jets did not work. I hope they get that fixed soon! I did get a good deal on their website with the pay your birth year rate. Good times had in TO!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it. There's much better in the area.”
Reviews.Author: AlliBum
Reviews.Content: I have stayed all over Toronto and traveled the globe for my job. I'm accustomed to staying in Marriott properties but due to the nature of my travel, I was sent to a Sheraton this time. The hotel claims to be renovated but certainly not the floor I'm staying on. The carpet is stained, worn, old and bumpy. The bathroom has an extremely low ceiling and shower head... at almost 6-feet tall I have to bend to wash my hair. The rest of the bathroom is OK - the toilet seat seems to be stained in some sort of unremovable substance that has caught my eye a few times too. Room service is sporadic and unreliable... I was out of my room from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. wiithout a visit and as soon as I had to return to work on my computer, they called to ask to get in. The beds in my room are not up to the Sheraton standard -- the dream bed? More like a horrible nightmare. The sheets they use pulled off the corners almost immediately and the bed skirts on both beds are dirty. For $250/night I'd expect a lot more of the Sheraton and know I can find it elsewhere. They have lost all future business.

Reviews.Title: “Letdown...not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: ardac
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights with friends. We had upgraded to Club Level , thinking it would be a nice treat. The Club Lounge was great..awesome views, comfy seating, good continental breakfast, sufficient appetizers later in day. We enjoyed that part for sure. As for the "upgraded room", all four of us agreed it was not worth it....the bathroom is small, with no counter space, the beds were not very comfortable ( supposedly Sweet Sleeper beds, but I stayed at a Sheraton last month with a sweet sleeper bed, and there were no springs digging into my back there!) Our bathrobes, which didn't arrive till our second night were hard,scratchy and looked like they were made for children! The bathroom fixtures were clean, but lots of dust on baseboards and corners. The bedding was worn and kept coming off the corners. Granted, the duvet was good quality as I expected and pillows were as well. The bed skirts were stained and again, baseboards and headboards were dusty, wallpaper was peeling and trim was all banged up.. I am not one to complain but felt that since it was an upgrade, that it would be a much nicer room. The hot tub was lukewarm, had very weak jets and the cleanliness of the water was questionable. The pool was nice, neat to swim outside and inside. The lobby etc was very nice and staff was friendly and helpful. But it was definitely below the standard we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some concerns”
Reviews.Author: Polygan
Reviews.Content: I had read about other people wondering about the quality level of the room being biased because their booking was through a 3rd party discount website. I have to admit that I am also wondering. The reservation was through a 3rd party site and when I arrived I was told that there were no king bed rooms and that I would need to take a room with two double beds. I was also placed in a tower (not the Queen St. tower) that had an elevator out of service and construction on the street (even at 2:30 am). Hmmm. The room itself was nice and kept very clean. The fitness centre and pool were a pleasant surprise. The lobby and public areas were also very nice. The staff members were attentive and very accommodating. The location was very central and a short walk from my conference, the Eaton's Centre, and many restaurants. So, it was kind of a "mixed bag". I think if I would stay at this hotel; however, I would not book on a 3rd party site (even though that should not be a factor). I would also request a room in the Queen Street tower.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug760
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is ideally located in the heart of downtown Toronto, the hotel rooms were not worth staying. I stayed in the hotel for a week and was not very happy. There were a number of things that I was not impressed about. First off, the rooms were old and smelled like cigarettes- considering that this hotel is supposedly smoke-free. My bathroom had a couple of problems as well. The toilet was not flushing correctly - there was a certain way to flush it which was very inconvenient. It did not have ventilation. The tub was always clogged. Customer service was okay - I just wished that guest services knew where certain places were. There was a time when I had asked the information about something and judging from how she was acting - not friendly and hesitant to help me since it was closing time and she had already turned the computer off - I had asked her something was and she replied that she doesn't even know where that place was. (And this is the information center?) Overall, my experience in this hotel was not what I had expected. Considering that they are part of the Starwood family, I would expected more of a Starwood experience from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “central, functional, decent pool”
Reviews.Author: CRtor
Reviews.Content: Well-situated, helpful staff, plain rooms, small bathroom, needs a refresh. pool area better than expected. convenient to downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “You'll want the Queen St tower, upper floor”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 4 times at the Sheraton Centre. Each time with Hotwire. Previously had opted to upgrade to suites by paying the hotel an additional amount. This last time, didn't check in until midnight, didn't upgrade, so got the Richmond tower, 6th floor. Yeach. It may be quieter, but give me newer with a view any day. I had no idea this old tower existed. Granted, they have the rooms furnished similarly, but we're talking lower bathroom ceiling, older heating system, smaller hallways. However, Sheraton is still a great choice. Can't beat the convenient location. Love the indoor/outdoor pool. Really enjoyed the free fitness room - open 24 hours - with TVs built into all cardio machines (LifeFitness brand). You'll need your room card to access the areas on the 3rd floor Queen Tower - including the change rooms with saunas. Free internet only if you go to the lobby "Link" area. My room had a safe and iron & board in the large closet, coffeemaker but no fridge/microwave. Bathroom has a hairdryer. Staff are very courteous. I did run into one weird thing: when I pulled up with a car to get luggage I'd stored in their holding room, the valet staff didn't offer to get it. Instead, he had me park my car and go in. In other hotels, they've brought it to me. Ah well, not such a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “March Madness”
Reviews.Author: JOCURT
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed here many times and we have always enjoyed our stay. The location is excellent because we like to walk everywhere. We booked a weekend getaway with the kids for the end of March break. The hotel offered a package deal for the "King Tut" exhibit at the AGO. The package included two tickets so we had to purchase two more tickets at the concierge desk. Upon check-in we were told we would be in the south tower (I didn't even know it existed). The south tower is difficult to get to and one of the elevators was not working. We found ourselves constantly waiting for elevators for several minutes each time. The room was a standard double with adequate cleanliness. The hall carpets were stained beyond belief. During our stay there was a national kids karate tournament going on. Both nights we were awakened at 3 a.m. by noisy "karate kids" running up and down the halls (note: not the fault of the hotel....this can happen anywhere) I just wish we had been informed when checking in about the "karate kids" and given the option to have a room far far away. Hotel food and drink prices are astronomical and the food isn't that great. Save money and grab a great meal or drink nearby. Valet parking is $45.00/night. park your self across the street in the City Hall underground. Over-all the hotel will still get my business in the future but it needs some "freshening up" and I will insist on staying in the big tower next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Roslyn138
Reviews.Content: Having decided to spend 5 days in Toronto, booked the Sheraton following research on Trip Advisor...I was impressed that the manager of the hotel took the time to comment on reviews. On arrival, no issue with checking in at reception, receptionist made us feel very welcome - asked why we were staying and what we were planning - and gave us room 3535 - saying we should enjoy the view of her city - she wasn't wrong - excellent room, amazing view of city hall and surrounding area . You can't go wrong with the location - from CN Tower, Eaton Centre to China Town, all are within walking distance , and the PATH system is linked to the hotel. We were returning later that week and asked if we could have a room on the other side - looking on to CN Tower - again nothing was too much trouble. We had a great stay at this hotel - Thank you .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but Extras are Way-Extra”
Reviews.Author: tamrenidrag
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. The staff is friendly; the room was clean and in a superb location. I guess the trade-off for using Priceline and paying $100 for a room (which is very cheap BTW) is that you have to absorb the ridiculous fees for the extras...$45.00 (Plus tips so $55) for valet parking? Thatâ€™s a first for me in downtown Toronto. I don't think I've ever paid more than $30 . I guess you could park across the street cheaper but I didnâ€™t know until I saw the valet tag while checking in. A whole page of different room telephone fees? What hotels charge for just connecting anymore? Still a charge for internet access? And only half hour at a time for wireless. Who charges for that anymore? Also with 2 kids and 2 lap-tops, they can't connect at the same time and when I asked the front desk for another or temporary internet login so both my kids could go online they looked at me like I had two heads. I did not try the Steak-house or the Deli restaurant but Traders Restaurant was just OK. My $30.00 steak was as tough as a shoe and confirmed by the chef that it was a bad piece of meat. I wouldnâ€™t have sent it back if it was a $10 steak. Also they stopped serving around 11pm on a Saturday night with plenty of people wanting to have a drink. No matter what or how you get you're room (Priceline, Expedia etc) you're going to pay for it somewhere. Other than a few drawbacks mentioned a pleasant experience. Matt..Niagara

Reviews.Title: “perfect location great place for families with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: morafamily4
Reviews.Content: We decided last minute (two days before) to book a two night Toronto stay during spring break. We made reservations through the 1-800 sheraton reservations, and requested two rooms adjoining as all the suites were sold out. We requested a king bed, and double beds in the adjoining room. We arrived at 230, check in time is 3pm, and were told our rooms would be ready in 30 minutes. The line up for check in was long, however front desk staff were effecient and the line moved quickly, thankfully as we lined up three times waiting for our room to be cleaned. Long story short after waiting over an hour we were told that two rooms with doubles was ready, or if we wished to wait the king room and adjoining doubles would be ready soon, receptionist was polite, made a call to houskeeping, and took our cell phone number to call when the room was ready. We finally got to our room after 4pm, and it was 2 rooms with DOUBLE BEDS! We called the front desk to complain, the issue was not resolved, and the receptionist politely repeated the course of events...........including when I made the reservations- which I did point out was for a king room, I was not told it was not available. The hotel was evidently full, and I realize spring break is busy, as it is every year, proper management of the volume includes ensuring sufficient cleaning staff are on duty.Many guests waited until after 4pm for check in, really a problem when we had dinner reservations and tickets for a show. This is why I give service the rating of 2. After the negative experience from check in we put it behind, and enjoyed our stay. We were in the Richmond tower, and I think the view from our 6th floor room was fantastic. The rooms were very clean, houskeeping did an excellent job, and were very friendly. We went to the bistro with plans to eat breakfast, but $27 a person for buffet breakfast was too much for us, and as others have said there are great places to go outside of the hotel. Valet parking is $45 a night so be warned! Even with the vast crowds for spring break the hotel was clean, pool area did not feel over crowded, and the fitness center was excellent. Our teens enjoyed the laptops in the lobby, the giant chess board, comfortable seating, magazines and books. We plan to stay again, although next time I will not plan dinner until after 6pm, because of the problems with checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not luxurious, but nice.”
Reviews.Author: costaricanvoyageur
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel for the discounted rate we got in downtown Toronto, but it was nothing too fancy for a four star. Rooms were clean and well appointed, but there was a bit of an odd setup to get to the pool/fitness centre, since you had to walk through a crowded lobby of business people on their way to work (in your workout clothes or bathing suit.) But the gym was one of the best ones we've seen, and it is right in the business district. Would definitely recommend for business travelers. Also, while most of the staff were very nice, there was one front desk receptionist who was rude to my husband and made him stand behind a stupid rope and line up, even though there was no one else there. Oky-doky whatever, no big deal, but not really what you expect at a 4 star hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucy_2234
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at the Sheraton Centre, and it is definitely my favourite hotel in Toronto. I've gotten very good deals booking on Hotwire, and have always enjoyed the rooms that I have been given. The hotel itself is an attraction, with many restaurants, shopping, and amenities. Plus, with the low price I pay for the room, I always feel okay indulging in some late-night room service - the service is always impeccable and the food arrives quickly and is nothing less than delicious! The hotel is so convenient, within walking distance of tons of downtown shops and theatres. The last trip I took was for an after-Xmas splurge, but I can't wait until I have another excuse to plan a trip back to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Expensive Food and Beverage”
Reviews.Author: chilleruk
Reviews.Content: We are currently in our second week here and thought it was time to write a review. Check in was efficient and we were allocated a room on the 32nd floor of the hotel, over looking Nathan Philips Square. The receptionist made some airline staff wait until she had finished checking us in before dealing with them, this was very refreshing to see, a pet hate of mine is airline staff pushing in and demanding to be dealt with immediately. Location wise the hotel has direct access to Path and on the edge of the entertainment district. The room it self was a bit small compared to the Delta Chelsea, where we had previously stayed. We had a double bed which was fairly comfortable. The room was clean and well maintained, with only the air con unit making an annoying noise. Maid service was very efficient, though I couldnt understand why one day we received water and the rest of our stay we havent. Maybe that will change before we leave on Sunday. The hotel provides free WiFi to guests in in the lobby, this is something that isnt really advertised very well, instead the in room brochure is pushing high speed net access in the room for $16.95 a day which we felt was quite steep. We only learned about the WiFi after allowing the hotel channel to complete a full loop. We havent used the hotel restaurant yet, Bistro on Two, it seems overpriced and has some serious competition both inside and outside the hotel which the hotel management have decided to ignore or not compete with. So we have eaten in Quinns/Shopseys a few times, located in the lobby of the hotel. The hotel is located on the PATH and a small fast food court is readily available for lunch and breakfast, which is a lot cheaper. In Room Dining is again expensive. It took us a while to adjust to the time difference and we found the 1.30 am to 6am dining menu to consist of a chicken wrap and salads, not a good offering for a high profile 4 star hotel, so we didnt bother, we stocked up with nibbles from the 7/11 nearby. We had money to spend but the hotel offering just wasnt up to what there guests are looking for. These are all minor quibbles, this is a great hotel for leisure and business people alike and I would highly reccommend it, I'm just very pickie after having 15 plus years management experince in hotel/leisure in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “beware of 3rd party bookings!”
Reviews.Author: bingbuff
Reviews.Content: have stayed at this hotel in the past with nothing but great enjoyment. booked 2 nights in May for a ball game and show. called the hotel for 2 reasons today. one, to confirm my room and two, from reading previous reviews have noticed that 3rd party bookings get the short end of the stick. i was told that because i used priceline that the possibility of getting a room in the 42 storey tower (the updated rooms) is basically a chance i have to take as we are low priority. asked when i would know what room i'd be getting i was told i would find out upon check-in. luckily i purchased the trip cancellation insurance. have used priceline probably 20 times and have never had this problem. the last four times i used it i received the westin harbour hotel. in fact the last time there i phoned the westin harbour to confirm my room 2 weeks prior to arriving and was told that the hotel was sold out for that weekend due to U2 concert(s) and a large conference at the hotel. the funny part of this is that my room was a king size bed with a view of lake ontario. apparently the westin harbour doesn't believe in classifying their guests as low priority guests but as guests of the westin harbour. i guess my only option is will be to phone the sheraton centre about 3 days before arrival and see if their preferred guests get their rooms and i may get lucky and have an up to date room thrown at this low priority CUSTOMER.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Poor after service.”
Reviews.Author: honeyseven
Reviews.Content: My fiance and i stayed at the sheraton centre toronto for eleven days last september. We regularly visit toronto usually twice a year ,however this is the first time we have stayed at the sheraton centre toronto we have stayed at other sheraton resorts and hotels in other citys. The check in was busy with long lines of people ,but the staff were very efficiant and got through the line quickly. Upon check in we were given excellent service from the agent who asked us if we had visited the city befour, we replied several times and he said have a good stay. When we went to use the door swipe key to our room the key did not work so we had to go back and wait again and were given anothe key card this time it worked. The room vas very clean superb beds and a great view however we were next door to the service elevator which rattled by all day and night. we requested a change of roonm as we were staying for our usual 11 nights and again given superb quick service and given another nice room which met all our expectations of sheraton. one down side was upon chechout i noticed we were being charged for parking, however we did not have a car we were assured that the error would be corrected and our debit card would not be charged . when i returned home i noticed the card had been charged and i was very annoyed as i was asured twice that this would not happen . I called the hotel to question this and recived very poor service first i was told they would call me back within two hours no one called. i called back to be told the manager was in a meetingand he would contact me im a hour three hours passed and no phone call . i phoned back and was told a refund had been done and it would be on the card after a few days . I gave it 3 days checked the account no refund i then called again and was told the refund had never been done but would be done immedatly. By this time a was furious as all the calls i had to make and the cost as im calling from the uk . This i must say left a great time at the sheraton very clouded . I know mistakes happen. I feel let down by the managment dealing with this situation as i never recieved a reply from a manager at any point and found it very difficult to get hold of one by phone .I was allways given excuses to why they did not call me back . In the end a refund was made ,but im not sure if i can trust the Sheraton centre toronto staff to handle my debit/credit card correctly, or sort out problems of over charging in a proffesional mannor.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel expensive bar though”
Reviews.Author: sexymerth
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. The room was clean and comfortable and staff were cheerful and helpful. Only down points was the price in the bar $10 for a pint of ordinary guiness when two minute walk it was $4 in a local bar and just as good, bit of a rip off. Our safe didn't work and allthough we were told it would be fixed it never was but we did get a free safety deposit box , the trouble was queing up to get a member of staff to let us in the room to access it. Every thing else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised with complimentary b-day cake!”
Reviews.Author: momof4J
Reviews.Content: While visiting the Sheraton Centre last week for my sisters 50th birthday, we were enjoying a swim at the beautiful indoor/outdoor pool. While chatting with the very friendly attendent she discovered the reason for our visit. After returning to our room, we recieved a phone call, "would it be OK if they delivered complimentary coffee and sweets to our room?" Soon after the girl from the pool and a fellow employee arrived with our coffee/hot chocolate and a delicious chocolate birthday cake, candle and all! Then they took the time to take a group picture with the cake! This is the type of service we don't expect anymore, but was sure a pleasant surprise!!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: GleasonH
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great lounge on the top floor, and if you go into the restrooms the wash basin area has windows that go from floor to ceiling, awesome view.

Reviews.Title: “Meal at Bistro on 2 - average quality/service-outrageous price”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatra99
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had breakfast at the Bistro Feb 21, before going to the AGO. We were appalled at the price for a less-than-average, basic breakfast. $65.00 for ordinary bacon and eggs for two people is not acceptable. No juice, no fruit, no toast. My friend's order was brought lukewarm and was not even correct. The server was abrupt and did not apologize for the poor quality. If you go to this hotel, do NOT eat at their own restaurants (Traders, Le Bistro) . Take three extra steps and ENJOY Shopsy's deli ( great food/service/prices) and Quinn's Steak House. Fabulous food/decent prices. The Sheraton Downtown Toronto is just a hotel - one of many. The food brings it down to a very poor choice.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience - clean, comfortable rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lolGatineau
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sheraton Centre several times over the past few years. I would like to commend the Management and staff for a wonderful experience every time. Not only is the hotel very central and convenient . The rooms are quite clean and spacious, and the staff are always very courteous and helpful. Compared to similar hotels in Europe ( and I have been several times to different places in the UK, the Netherlands, Brussels, Paris, etc), I have found the Sheraton to be one of the best. My hats off to the management and staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: lovesthesun14
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a large-scale conference at the Sheraton Center. With a group of 500 professionals, the staff were nothing short of excellent. Because of travel from outside of the city, I arrived very late into the evening. The hotel had begun to fill, and I was provided with an upgraded suite without even being aware until I entered the room. The room was kept immaculate during my stay, and the staff were very helpful. Location is excellent. I will definately be returning to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: salmalcolm
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire & got a great deal...Great hotel in good location! View from our room was awsome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, average accomodation”
Reviews.Author: octavia
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is close to so many things in downtown Toronto. My husband and I stayed here for the weekend while taking in the AGO. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the lobby is nice however as far as the rooms go...these were out of date, somewhat dirty and not generally up to Sheraton standards. We were given a room on the 'starwood preferred floor', our bedside light was not working and our bathroom sink taps broke the first time we used them. We had to wait for some time (and called down to the lobby twice) in order to get this repaired. I can't imagine what the rooms on non-starwood preferred floors must have been like. The pool was freezing, I couldn't get in past my toes. Overally the location was very central and very convienient, however the room itself was dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price, but our room certainly NOT 4-5 stars”
Reviews.Author: OttawaJoan
Reviews.Content: As previous reviews have stated, this is a very large hotel. We were given a room in the Richmond Tower, which is quite old, and, even though it's been renovated, it's still a little dumpy (although clean). The Richmond Tower of this hotel would not rate any more than a 3 star. Valet parking VERY pricey ($45/night), cheaper parking across the street for $20/night.The hotel lobby is nice, and all the staff were friendly and helpful. I'm assuming that the hotel puts Hotwire guests in their "cheapest" rooms, and full fee paying guests in their "more valuable" rooms. Location is great, and we certainly couldn't beat the $69/night we paid through Hotwire for a downtown location on the Ontario Family Day long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bandlshoe
Reviews.Content: Central location was a definite plus. Staff helpful and polite. Beautiful hotel lobby. FYI, the "underground mall" is closed on weekends. Room was clean, comfortable, nice size. Large bathroom a bonus. Decor was generic, but up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Love Toronto”
Reviews.Author: colors
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great~restaurant in hotel was great~health club was great! One very important thing is that I would HIGHLY recommend bringing a travel humidier with you if you visit in the winter. The room was VERY DRY & I basically drank 2 bottles of water every night. It was also wonderful that we were able to walk underground all the way to the Stadium (we only had to walk outside for about 2 blocks). Faboulous restaurants all within walking distance. They put on a spectacular event for New Years Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Need to wear socks!”
Reviews.Author: tourgirl
Reviews.Content: Yuck. You know that there is a problem when I refuse to take off my socks while walking around the hotel room due to the lack of confidence that I had for the sanitation of this hotel. You know it was really bad when it's prompting me to write my first review since becoming a member of Tripadvisor... I stayed at the Sheraton Center 2/3 through 2/5. Thank goodness it was a short business trip. For $167.30 plus tax a night, I got a room that had hair all over the bath when I walked in, blood on the shower curtain, and consistently bad customer service (don't believe me??? I took photos on my iPhone because I couldn't believe it either). Here were some of the issues: 1. I called downstairs to ask what the number to the Hyatt Regency was down the street. The agent said that she would have to call me back. After waiting ten minutes with no return call, I called down again and got another person. This person took forever to try to figure out the number. Can't you just Google "Hyatt Regency Toronto" and get the information? 2. How can housekeeping not see the hair (most likely pubic) in the bathroom. We're not talking hair here and there. Weâ€™re talking clumps of hair, scattered throughout the bath. I called downstairs and had housekeeping come up right away to clean it (they did). I would have changed rooms but I was too exhausted after a 6+ hour flight. 3. The vent in the bathroom had not been cleaned in a long time. The picture does not do it justice but notice it's mostly brown (it's supposed to be white) - YUCK!!! 4. When housekeeping left, I decided to hop in the shower. I closed the curtain too see blood. Are you serious??? I got right out and went to bed. 5. In the morning, I called downstairs to get the address and directions to the Hyatt Regency. I later found that they gave me the wrong address and directions (they gave me the information to the Park Hyatt and not the Hyatt Regency). 6. At the front desk, I asked for directions to Mariposa Cruises (the largest cruise company in Toronto). The agent looks at me while standing in front of a computer and says "I don't know." I stand there a little longer thinking that they would look on the internet with the computer right in front of them to find that information but no, he just continued to look at me. WHAT???? I asked this same question to the front desk agent at the Hyatt Regency (after getting lost with the directions given to me by the Sheraton) and without any hesitation, was given the name of the building that the cruise line was located and circled it on a map for me. 7. Valet: The valet ticket reads "Please allow 20 minutes for your vehicle" Kind of ridiculous since it costs $45 a day to valet in the first place. 8. Since the valet is busy getting the cars that the people in the hotel have requested, you also have to wait for a valet to take your car away when you pull up to the hotel. After a long day, I pull up in front of the hotel to find nobody there to take the car. I wait and wait and nobody comes to help. I finally had to get out of the car and find a bellman who was willing to help me out by taking the car himself. These are the only things that are coming to mind right now. The whole stay was a disaster. Toronto is a beautiful city and I cannot wait to go back. One thing is for sure, however. I will not be coming back to the Sheraton Centre when I do. P.S. When we got back home, we found that we were overcharged on our hotel invoice as well.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: wtravellersny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very large. This is usually not 100% my hotel style, but I was amazed how well maintained the hotel is. It was very clean. We stayed on the club floor and the breakfast on the higherst floor was so delicious. I would recoomend this hotel to everyone without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoonDoggie82
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of horrible hotels but this was by far the best. Room service was great, the view was fantastic (you could see both Old and New City Hall from our window), the pool was beautiful and warm. We were within walking distance to just about everything. We were their for the start of the Toronto Film Festival so their were celebrities everywhere and many staying at that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: WeInScotland
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton centre is a big hotel which of course makes it a bit anonymous. But everything is perfect, beginning from the room to the service that was quite friendly and extremely helpful. I would reccommend it especially because of the location, being situated centrally in downtown Toronto and you can reach all the major spots easily within about 20 min. walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Top Place!! Will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ange069
Reviews.Content: What a great place to relax and enjoy all the amenities this great hotel has. It's in a great location, not far from Young St, where all the action is. Staff are very friendly and room service was a treat. Make sure you enjoy the pool and spa facilities.

Reviews.Title: “I don't even know where to begin - Got robbed!”
Reviews.Author: dodgingwrenches
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton twice in the past two weeks. My first stay was January 19-20th for business. I was a little disappointed with the room. Found it to be a little dingy, and the carpets were pretty dirty in the hallways, etc. My first thoughts were that this is NOT a four star - you should see the Intercontinental in comparison - stayed there twice in the last six months and it is amazing! Anyway, I then decided to upgrade my room for the next visit this past weekend, which was also the weekend of my 30th birthday, so a celebration. I was told that for $60 a night, you get a nicer room, with nicer fixtures and amenities, free appetizers, free breakfast, and free wireless internet, and it was the only way to get a King bed. The non Club level rooms were either one or two doubles. Since it was my birthday, she offered to do the upgrade for $50 a night, so I agreed. When I arrived the second time, I was disappointed again with the upgrade. The room furnishing was exactly the same - except for being slightly bigger, having a King bed, and having a mini-fridge which the other did not. I was told it would be a NICER room. The wireless internet is only in the lobby and club lounge, not in the rooms. I thought I could live with the $50 a night if the breakfast were good, but it is a pitiful continental. You can get better muffins and croissants at the Tim Horton's downstairs. After breakfast, I went to the front desk and requested to "downgrade" again to a normal room, since the "upgrade" in my opinion was not in the least bit worth the money. $50 would get me an amazing breakfast! To their credit, they apologized and told me they would not charge me for the upgrade, but keep me in the same room (they were pretty full, so probably couldn't move me). They gave me new keys (to remove Club Loung access I guess?) and sent me on my merry way. Since they were giving me a free upgrade, I didn't take one of the front desk representatives up on her offer to send up complimentary sparkling wine for my birthday, since that would have made me feel guilty . This was the more minor issue of my stay. The major one was getting robbed while I was out. While I was out Saturday night, someone entered my room and stole my purse and my laptop. My purse was recovered by hotel staff on a different floor (fully intact, minus cash and subway tokens). The laptop, however, is gone forever. I cannot describe how violated I feel when it comes to my privacy. That laptop has my whole life on it. Letâ€™s not even mention the files Iâ€™ve lost since my last backup. The worst thing though, is how I feel the hotel treated me. They called me around 3am telling me my lost purse was found. I told them I didnâ€™t lose my purse, but left it behind in the room. They told me it was in lost and found. Thatâ€™s when we noticed there was a problem, and I noticed it was gone. They told me theyâ€™d come to take a report and bring me my purse. After hanging up the phone, I noticed my laptop was gone, too. I called the front desk, nobody picked up. My husband called again, and after a while someone picked up. They transferred him to security, where someone picked up, and then immediately hung up the phone. It took a while for them to finally come upstairs (and at 3:30am, I didnâ€™t feel like waiting). I ended up being up until 6am with security, police, etc filing reports. According to security, the door lockâ€™s log shows that it was left ajar. It is PHYSICALLY IMPOSSIBLE to leave that door open without a door stop or something. It is that heavy, and the springs are that strong. Trust me, we tried, and I have the videos to prove it (thankfully I had taken my camera with me when I went out and left my purse behind in the room, so I had it to record the video). The door will ALWAYS fall shut. Iâ€™m thinking either the lock malfunctioned, or worseâ€¦. (Security logs can probably be altered). I tried talking to security the next day, asking them to entertain the possibility that the lock didnâ€™t register. I was completely brushed off â€œThe log says thisâ€� etc. Itâ€™s electronics. Electronic locks do have quirks and donâ€™t always work. I had enough issues with the lock electronics on my previous car, locking and unlocking itself. Heck, I had difficulties unlocking the door earlier that day. And, I have two other people that were with me confirming the door was closed. Itâ€™s a habit, after all. I never, ever left my house or apartment door open. I outright challenged the guy to come upstairs with me and try to leave the door ajar. He brushed me off again. He was being very very vague, obviously trying not to say the slightest thing that could be any acknowledgement of responsibility. So there are no security cameras on the floors, there are none in the elevators, and you donâ€™t need to pass security to get to the elevators. The elevators are equipped with key card slots, but they are not required to access the rooms. The security is pitiful at best. I cannot begin to describe how horribly upset I am about this. I have my videos of numerous attempts to leave the door ajar and am deciding what to do about all of this. Was expecting a call from the manager today, but have received none so far. As far as I am concerned, the Sheraton owes me $1000.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational”
Reviews.Author: Shosydney
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms for 5 nights each over Christmas. From the moment we walked in to when we left the experience was terrific. I spend over 100 nights on the road per year and in terms of western hotels this Sheraton certianly rates as equivalent to anything else I have stayed at. The gym and pool are on par with most 5 star hotels and the location and general ambience is excellent. Will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business, ok for leisure! Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: JKsurrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days on business and really cant fault the place. Superb big lobby with internet access (terminal and wifi), good bar/restaurant and direct connection to shops and the huge Eaton Centre. Rooms were clean with great TV (best i have seen) although movies looked expensive to rent. Tried the pool which was nice but very pokey changing rooms that can only be accessed by walijg down a corridor in the winter months. Highly recommed for business and alos leisure travellers but you will be bored of the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great!”
Reviews.Author: icemonkey4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Sheraton for our honeymoon and I have to say it was fabulous. Check in was a bit crazy as it was 7pm on New Years eve, but when we got to the desk, the hotel had arranged an upgrade for us as it was our honeymoon. Our club level room was wonderful - clean, tidy, spacious and well decorated. I cant fault the staff on anything they were extremely polite and knowledgable. The free internet in the 'Link' in the lobby was also very useful. The food in the bar was lovely and they make some nice cocktails. Finally the location is fantastic and if I ever visit Toronto again I would definately stay in the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, would certainly stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Dancing_DadStrathroy
Reviews.Content: Just completed 25+ nights at the Sheraton Centre in downtown Toronto for business over a 5 month period. Overall an excellent hotel, clean bright rooms, very comfortable beds, well equiped rooms and very friendly and helpful staff. Very nice pool and exercise centre. Great location as well, located directly accross from City Hall, close to the Eaton Centre and connected to Toronto's undergroud walking system "The Path". Also if your thinking of upgrading to Club Level I would say it would be worth it. Club level was included in my negotiated rate, but the breakfast is very good despite the lack of hot items. Always lots of fresh fruit, breads and cereals, danish, several kids of juice, cheese, yogurt, coffee/tea and a great view as the club level is on the top floor. In the evenings the cold and hot snacks were very nice as well. Should I travel back on business I will book here again and would not hesitate to bring the family.

Reviews.Title: “Two Hotels under one roof!”
Reviews.Author: Angela_The_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed int his hotel a couple of times and I have to say, it a bit strange. Don;t stay int he Richmond Tower, it's a time warp. It is quite literally like walking into a retired couples den. Plaid walls, plaid bed spreads, plaid cutains, it's a nightmare in plaid! The rooms and corridors are filthy and tired. On the other hand, in the other part of the hotel, the rooms are well appointed, clean and very fresh. The rooms in this part of the hotel could not be more different. Trust me when I say, do not stay in the Richmond Tower and if you go when the hotel is holding an event, make a lot of extra time for check in and parking.

Reviews.Title: “I challenge you to find a hotel with a better location than the sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: ellenofengland
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here throguh the last week of October, 2009, and could not have asked for a better stay. Upon arrival we were greeted and checked into our room on the 9th floor of the Richmond tower. (which had the best view I have ever seen from a hotel room, might i add) Previously reading some reviews of this tower, I had my doubts when it was assigned. Believe me when I say that this tower is not as bad as some have made out. It's smaller size hence fewer rooms means elevators are not half as busy as those in the other tower, and the rooms were large enough to facilitate a family of two adults and a 15 year old teenager, that being myself. The location was by far superior to many hotels in Toronto, being just steps from amazing Yonge St. and the large but pricey Eaton Centre, facilitating every shop you could imagine. The 'buisness center' in the lobby was an exellent feature, and although staying at a busy time for the hotel I was always able to use one of the slow but facilitating computers, and although they may appear full at first glance a few patient minutes will see one become available. Overall, our stay at the Sheraton was everything we could have hoped for. Even my teenage girl self who held high expectations of her stay found this hotel exellent, and I STRONGLY recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Additional Fees”
Reviews.Author: jabacchus
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were celebrating his birthday with a night out on the town and a romantic stay at a downtown hotel. I booked the hotel through Hotwire and the result was the Sheraton Centre. After booking on Hotwire, I called the Sheraton Centre to confirm what time check in and check out were at. The person on the other end of the phone told me that check in was at 3pm and check out was 12pm the next day. Fine. She also told me that the room I had booked was a King size bed. I asked about parking and was told that there was Valet parking with in and out privilages for $45!! Yikes! Upon arrival at the hotel, we decided to park across the street in the underground thinking that it would be cheaper. It didn't exactly end up being much cheaper. We parked the car in there around 4pm and took it out the next day at 12pm and somehow racked up a bill of $32! Besides the parking issues, when we checked in we were asked if we wanted a room with a double bed or two double beds. I told the guy that when I called I was told that the room was a King size bed. He told me that it was certainly requested but the fee for that would be $20 extra. Being the good girlfriend that I am, I decided to spring for the King size bed so that we would actually enjoy our night. The bed was comfortable but the room was not all that I hoped it would be. I have stayed at other hotels downtown 3.5 star and 4 stars and I found this one to be more of a 3 star quality. The only good thing that this hotel has to offer is it's location. I hope the next time that I book on Hotwire I don't get this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel you'll want to stay when you're in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: LorenzSingapore
Reviews.Content: Was given a SPG room on 35th floor. Very nice view of downtown Toronto and CN Tower (especially at night). What I love most about the room is the bed. Extremely comfy and nice plush pillowtop mattress. Bathroom is nice. Valet parking is a bit too expensive at $45 + tips are expected. Location wise, its in the middle of everything. Union station is only a few blocks south and St Lawrence market is also walkable southeast but it can get really chilly in winter so dress warmly for outdoor walk. Beneath the hotel, PATH connects it to the Hudson Bay Company (dept store) and just about everywhere downtown. You donâ€™t have to brave the cold winter to move around downtown. The Airport express takes you right from the hotel to Toronto Pearson in less than an hr (even in traffic).

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: saralsaigh
Reviews.Content: The hotel did not meet my expectations. The front desk was very busy and only 2 people were working there. The girl checking me in put in the wrong last name although I spelled it out for her and then pointed it out on my card. Then she insisted that the room I ordered was a king when I am sure I booked 2 double beds and when she finally realized her mistake I didnt even get an apology and she quickly shooed me away from the desk. I expected more than that from the sheraton. They have two sets of elevators, ones for floors 1-24 and the others for 25 and above I think but no signs or anything were there to tell you this and many people were getting confused. Also I wanted more than once to check my email but their "business center" was always full with people so if you need a computer bring your own laptop. The room was okay, not that big, had a flat screen TV. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was big. However it was very old. The toilet seat was cracked and faucets of the tub were rusted. Room service was prompt and good. The location was excellent and close to everything I needed. I would not stay here again since it was not my first time in downtown toronto and I have stayed at other hotels which were just as good if not better around the area and for a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Sucks”
Reviews.Author: bigrobdog2010
Reviews.Content: The sheraton hotel was horrible. Right from the beginning the parking area was brutal, $45 for valet parking is ridiculous luckily city parking across the road was easy and half the price. Got first room after a hassle with what was supposed to be a prepaid room we got to our room which was nothing special and found that the door did not lock. After waiting 5+ minutes on the phone we packed up our stuff went down to lobby and waited again. The desk gave us a "free upgrade" to a Club level room which was nothing special and which we later got the bill and they tried to charge it for us. All in all the hotel was nothing special the room was small the upgrade was nothing great and the condition of the room was crappy unclean tub , peeling wallpaper and a room heater that was loud and horrible. For sure won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: MBRTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre has two towers, a 42-story main tower with presumably nice modern rooms, and a secondary 11-story Richmond tower, where "low priority" customers are placed. Beware of the latter. We booked our room through Hotwire and were given a room on the 7th floor of the Richmond tower. To our surprise, the room was absolutely tiny, with only a full sized bed, barely large enough for two adults. The room was so small, there wasn't space for our two large suitcases. When we asked if another room was available, we were told that it would be an additional $50 per night to move to a room with a larger bed (i.e. if you book through a travel site you are a second-class customer). The bathroom was tiny and dark with literally no counter space for toiletries. One of the three bathroom light bulbs was burned out, and the shower leaked badly from the side, spraying water onto the bathroom floor when operating (they did fix both of these issues after I complained). Worst of all, our room was inexplicably not cleaned after our first night, despite our two requests to do so. The Richmond tower is obviously assigned to teenagers. There were kids in the hallways talking and/or reading at most hours. Oh, two of three elevators weren't working in this tower, so 10 minute waits to get up/down were the norm. $18 for Internet access, $45 for parking. The hotel is so big, common areas are mobbed with guest at most hours. Public areas of the hotel were nice, and the location was great. We especially liked the easy access to the Bay and Eaton Centre via the underground PATH system. Overall, while the main tower may be nice, the Richmond tower is two-star at best. Our experience was so bad we would never consider going back to this hotel (or ever staying in this particular chain again). Beware if you book this hotel through a travel site.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Canuck72
Reviews.Content: I was visiting family over Christmas and booked on hotwire for the first time. While you can't choose the exact hotel, I was lucky and got the Sheraton Centre. I have stayed here before, but this time was impressed with the great price. The service was great. I had my car with me, and when I asked about parking the lady at reception told me it was $45 a night or I could use the city hall garage across the road which cost me a total of $12 for the two nights! Ok, so I have only talked about prices here...well, the Sheraton is very well-located, and my favourite thing about it is the indoor-outdoor pool. It is so strange to be swimming outside in late December. It is even better when it's snowing out. I would definitely recommend the Sheraton Centre to anyone who wants to see Toronto, and have a great place to relax in at night.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: MarkFromBuffalo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for the Buffalo Bills / Jets game. Beautiful lobby, but our room was very outdated, with filthy bathroom (bathtub-sink-toilet). I did park across the street at the City Hall ramp with easy access thru a tunnel from the hotel. I hope they upgrade all the hotel rooms but most importantly hire competent cleaning crew.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Fun56
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Toronto at the Sheraton Centre and found this hotel to be fist class all the way! It has an excellent location, walking distance to some great shopping and restaurants. Great view of the CN Tower, which is really beautiful at night. The staff was incredible on every level, we were always greeted with a smile and a friendly hello. Any questions we had or help we requested was dealt with in a courteous and proffesional manner. All in all we had a terrific stay at this hotel and when we return to Toronto we will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An alright stay.. nothing to write home about...”
Reviews.Author: Gryphon7777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto for a few days. My room was overlooking funky City Hall. The room was reasonably new, and well decorated and appointed. A soft king size bed was also included. Check-in was effortless and the hotel lobby and amenities were very impressive - maybe a little bit too big in fact. It felt like it was more orientated to the businessperson rather than being a warm, welcoming and friendly hotel. Warm wooden colours, but it felt cold. All in all, I found the stay to be quite average for a four star hotel. I probably wouldn't stay there again (would try something new), as everything is so so expensive (parking $40+ a night!, Internet $$$ etc). The fact that the hotel is connected to the underground shopping/transit network is really convenient, as is its proximity to the Eaton Centre. As far as hotel goes, it ticks all the boxes, I just felt something was missing...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: HaggisOntario
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the family in order to visit the King Tut exhibit at the AGO and do some Christmas shopping. Excellent location to shopping, underground PATH system, downtown restaurants, subway, and parking at City Hall across the street. Great to be able to swim in the indoor / outdoor pool in December ! Staff very accomodating with the kids !!

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of its 4 star rating”
Reviews.Author: bw1907
Reviews.Content: We were excited to return to this Sheraton as the experience on our previous trip (through Priceline) was outstanding â€“ definitely a 4 star rating â€“ great rooms, great service, and great facilities. On this trip, however, our experience at this hotel was completely unsatisfactory. We were placed in the Richmond Tower, on floors obviously assigned to teens. The hallways were extremely noisy, with teens running up and down the hall during the night, knocking on our doors, and the smell of cigarette smoke was distinct. In addition, because of the smoking, the fire alarm rang at 4:30 in the morning requiring us to be alert for possible evacuation. In the 2 days we were there, we got very little sleep. Even though we negotiated a fixed price through Priceline, they were not willing to provide us with a king-size bed unless we agreed to pay an additional $1.00/night for the bed and an additional $20.00/night for the room. Not withstanding, the price charged for parking was $45.00/day. In addition: 1) The bathroom door in our room would not fully close, 2) Two of the 3 kiosks designated for securing airline passes were out of order. 3) Only 2 of the 3 elevators for the tower were working. 4) The concierges on duty gave out inaccurate information on 2 occasions. 5) The food at the restaurant buffet was far below 4 star expectations. In sum, the Priceline "price" was misleading, and the 4 star rooms are not assigned to Priceline guests â€“ only those willing to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AllyandBill
Reviews.Content: Booked blind through the web as a 4 star hotel. No queen bed, robes, fridge etc. Experts at squeezing extra charges out of you from a TV that makes broadcast TV difficult to watch (but pay-per-view easy), to $45.00 valet parking, (Park instead under Toronto City Hall, across Queen Street and connected below the lobby level.) to $28.00 per hour internet, (or $10.00 to check your email in the business center....) to $2.00 local phone calls, no newspapers. Is it just me or do you end up feeling like you have to be constantly on guard? On check-out, grossly over-billed for meals not eaten and extra nights of parking. Sorted out but only after 'investigating" my alleged alibi. Good views, friendly staff but way less satisfied than I would expect. Felt like an overcrowded cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “Busy hotel with a great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: expatrex
Reviews.Content: SUMMARY: With 1,300+ rooms, this is one monster of a hotel with people (and lines) everywhere, probably attributable to its central downtown location and reasonable room rates. As a result, there was much wear and tear on this hotel, and service was sub par at best. I donâ€™t know if Iâ€™ll stay here again unless I find one hell of a deal. ROOMS: My room was on a high SPG floor which provided great views of the financial district. Thatâ€™s pretty much all it had though. The bathroom in particular was in poor form. The shower handle was loose and the water temperature was impossible to control. There was rust on some of the fixtures, and the HVAC vent was so loud that it kept me up at night. I guess on the plus side the bed was comfy and the power outlets were on the desk and not behind/underneath. SERVICE: The service was slow and impersonal, with the exception of the young club lounge hostess. There were long lines for checking in (see photos), long lines in the club lounge, and long wait times on the phone to reach an agent. It took over thirty minutes for someone to deliver coffee packets to my room. AMENITIES: There were some nice amenities, including the oversized fitness center and the heated indoor/outdoor pool. The former was dark however, and the latter was overrun by little kids. The club lounge was impressive though. Located on the top floor (43), it had panoramic views of downtown on two sides, as well as an impressive evening cocktail reception. Expect long lines during peak hours though. Free WiFi in the lobby and club lounge. LOCATION: Despite it being my first time in Toronto, I quickly realized how great the hotelâ€™s location was. If this is your first time as a tourist, you just canâ€™t go wrong with the location. Plus the hotel is one of the tallest buildings in the area so you can spot it if you get lost. CLEANLINESS: The public spaces and rooms were clean for a hotel with so much traffic, but at times there were so many people making messes that the staff just couldnâ€™t keep up. It wouldnâ€™t be uncommon to see empty cups and dirty napkins in the lobby or various parts of the club lounge. There was also visible wear and tear in the guestroom, especially in the bathroom. This hotel could use a renovation to make things a bit more fresh. VALUE: I was able to find a phenomenal deal for my stay, and I really have no room to complain since I certainly got great bang for my buck. That said I donâ€™t think I would ever pay the retail rates for this hotel. I hate to say it, but I think it would be a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Crococat
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked trough hotwire, so you never know in advance where one ends up. It was a nice surpise that we ended up in the Sheraton Centre. Location marvelous, very friendly helpfull staff, rooms ok. We have been in the Richmond Tower. The lower one with view to the city hall which was great as there have been lots of activieites on the icefield that Weekend including huge fireworks. The bad thing was that the rooms / windows are absolutely not sound proof and also the wondows have been very dirty. If you go there look you get a room in the main tower. Those rooms seem to be renovated. The ones in the Richmond Tower not yet.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four-star hotel for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: mauigal06
Reviews.Content: The good: friendly front desk staff, large hotel in good location. The bad: Rooms are dirty â€“ moved once and still ended up with bedding that had stains and a bathroom that was not clean. Everything just feels run-down and lacking care.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location is brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: moposurrey
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth stay at the Sheraton Centre, Toronto and we are always made to feel welcome. We booked the City Tour and the Niagra All Day tour at the information desk and they were both great. We had especially great service from Isabel at the information desk and she will go above and beyond to help you and nothing was any trouble for her. Beware of eggspectations, we used to eat there every year but this year the food was cold, the service was appalling and when we couldn't find the waiter to pay, the waitress said she would pass it on to him and we were silly enough to leave a tip for him as well,because he chased us outside onto the street asking us if we were leaving with out paying. Tim Hortons does a great coffee and the shopping at the Eaton Centre was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: ap_dp_00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used to live in Toronto and wanted to go for a little getaway weekend with our 2 1/2 year old. We decided to stay here because of the location. I cannot say enough about the entire staff. From the moment we checked in, to the staff we just passed in the hall. Everyone was nothing but friendly and accommodating. We were even swimming one day at the pool (fantastic by the way), and the pool manager brought our little one some hot chocolate to have when she was finished! Unbelievable! Our room was fantastic and we looked out directly onto Nathan Philips Square. We will definitely stay here again! I do just want to mention that those that say they could hear the subway beneath them would definitely have been hearing things. The subway doesn't even run under the hotel which is located on Queen. It runs a block over on Yonge. They probably heard the streetcars. and I'm sorry but if you are going to stay in a downtown core, you are going to hear something!!!! Thanks again Sheraton Centre!

Reviews.Title: “Everybody was so friendly & helpful, excellent location & we had a great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Birthday2009
Reviews.Content: Very realxing stay & will definitely use the same hotel if we have the opportunity to come back. The food was great & the the best part is the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “very good accomodation in down town”
Reviews.Author: bulagna75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the sheraton centre toronto for four nights on a buisness trip. The hotel was coveniently located, at walking distance from the convention centre. The room was spacious and comfortable. Very good breakfast. I woudl recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “fairly generic large scale hotel, but in a great location”
Reviews.Author: frootloops
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed and re-reading my previous review I was quite harsh, I think because we had payed quite a lot for it. This time though we got the room for Â£80 a night and at that price point I don't have anything to complain about. I had also emailed in advance to specifically request a room away from the lifts and drinks machines which was my major complaint last time The rooms are a decent size, the beds are comfortable, the city views are pretty good. Can't really comment on staff as had no involvement with them other than check in, where they were friendly enough. Likewise can't comment on the restaurants. All in all I would certainly stay here again next time we are in toronto.....if we can get it at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staffs”
Reviews.Author: graju
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to stay in cluding my daughter she was so happy see the nice view in that hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: travellingwilbury66
Reviews.Content: If you like huge corporate hotels, you'll like this. Can't really fault it on anything, but hotels like this one can sometimes feel a bit soulless to me. Liked the outdoor pool and jacuzzi though, and the sauna. Room was quite plush, big TV etc. Staff were very polite but impersonal. Got a good deal on hotwire so was good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “A marvelous hotel with marvelous rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jtk_Greece
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sheraton in a club level room with my wife. It was our first time to Canada, and our experience was great from both Toronto and Sheraton. I cannot express how nice this hotel is. Location is great, is conveniently connected to the underground PATH system, so you don't even have to go outside to venture over to the Eaton's Centre or the underground, the Bay, etc. The rooms and beds are very comfortable, the views are breath-taking - we stayed to a high floor. Also the Club Lounge was a very nice place, both for breakfast - except weekend - and for evening hor' d' oeuvres. We really enjoyed and we would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: RobertC7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Walking distance to the Rogers Centre, CN Tower, waterfront and more. Be sure to budget lots of money for parking, though, because that's a serious rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “A Central Delight”
Reviews.Author: cuddlypolarbear
Reviews.Content: A top notch hotel in the heart of downtown toronto. Near reaturants, eaton center, subway and more. A large and upscale yet comfortable hotel. Amazing rooms, pool and fitness center. Staff are attentive and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and great management Well done Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyTripper
Reviews.Content: My daughter was turning 24 and to celebrate her birthday, I gave her a gift of a long week end stay at the Sheraton Centre Toronto. What a good choice. The stay was made special because the general manager, Tony Dunn, added small touches to make the event special. Cookies in the room on arrival and a lovely room on the top floor. I cannot express how nice this hotel is. Location is great and in the summer, she and her friends from Winnipeg could relax by the pool after a day of sight seeing. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay...but don't bother with the club lounge breakfast on a weekend”
Reviews.Author: Syanda
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sheraton before, but this was my first time in a club level room. I booked this specifically for the included continental breakfast as I wanted to save my family of 3 the expense of paying $20/person for the buffet breakfast offered by Bistro on Two, the usual breakfast place of choice in the hotel. This turned out to be a mistake. We stayed at the hotel on a weekend so the Club Lounge was EXTREMELY packed on the Sunday morning at 8:30am when we ventured down for breakfast. I was expecting a nice leisurely breakfast with my family with a nice view and ended up a table at the end of a hallway with not even a table cloth because the place was so packed with people.
