Having a small child with me (who couldn't help much bringing food and coffee back to the table), my husband and I ended up making WAY too many trips to the main buffet table to get food and beverages (as there are no trays provided). As a previous reviewer mentioned, I was quite appalled that after about my 5th trip up to the buffet to get some orange juice I came back to our table to find a badly photo-copied form sheet asking for a tip! You've got to be kidding? I received zero service while sitting there, no one offered to refill coffee, no one took our used plates. What would the tip be for? This breakfast experience aside, the hotel itself and the rooms are marvelous. The rooms and beds are very comfortable, the views are breath-taking, even considering that I used to live in Toronto and have seen it all before, it was still amazing from the 36th floor. The pool is great too, although the location of the change rooms is a bit inconvenient. From previous reviewers, I took the advice and parked across the street at the City Hall parking lot for an amazing overnight price of $18! The last time I stayed here I paid $40 for valet parking and had to wait forever to get my car the day I checked out. It's definitely worth parking over at city hall and it's very easy to get to. You just go down the ramp right by the main Queen Street entrance to the Sheraton and then take the left ramp down (the right ramp is the Sheraton valet parking entrance)...so you're basically in the same underground. There are plenty of other hotel guests parking there, so you don't have to worry about your car sitting in a dark and secluded parking lot overnight. It will be perfectly safe. The Sheraton is also conveniently connected to the underground PATH system, so you don't even have to go outside to venture over to the Eaton's Centre. Very convenient indeed. All in all, I would definitely recommend staying at the Sheraton, but don't bother paying extra for the Club level rooms, the Bisto on Two may cost a bit more in the end (if you're paying for more than 2 people) but the experience will be much more relaxing for you and your family!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very nice room, but food was poor!!!!”
Reviews.Author: John_in_ie41
Reviews.Content: I was in the hotel for a conference staying for the week. The hotel was nice, with a spacious bedroom BUT the food was tasteless (everywhere in Canada and not just in this hotel). What really got up my goat was the approach of the staff at breakfast - I was staying at Club level which included breakfast and as it was a buffet you helped yourself to everything. Immediately on sitting down with whatever you selected, without even a good morning or similar the staff dropped a card requesting a tip from you. I am a generous tipper when I get service .................but as I Iliterally did not have anything to do with the staff nor did I get any service from them I find this practice to be a disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “First choice in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: liamuk2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during June 2009 on my first visit to Toronto. Very impressed with the hotel and Toronto itself. We stayed on the club level at the top of the hotel and had fantastic views of the CN tower and that side of the city. The views facing city hall in the opposite direction would be equally as impressive if you get the choice. The club lounge on the top floor has views in both directions to allow you to take photographs. Breakfast selection in the lounge was plentiful and the staff were very helpful. Our room was nice with a large LCD television and comfortable beds. The bathroom was slightly dated and this would be my only criticism. Free internet access is also provided in-room, the club lounge and on PCs in the lobby. We found the concierge to be helpful but as with most hotels seemed to only want to push their own tours rather than providing more general information. The hotel is linked directly to the Toronto PATH system. If, like me you didnâ€™t know what this was â€“ itâ€™s basically a network of subways where you can walk between the basements of buildings. In the lobby simply take the escalator down and youâ€™re in an underground walkway with shops (including a newsagent and food court etc.) connecting you to a range of other buildings without having to go outside into the cold. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would use it if I ever visit the city again.

Reviews.Title: “A stay you will enjoy”
Reviews.Author: hoteldotell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights with my girlfriend. I haven't been to the city in a long time and I was taking a much needed vacation. The room was clean and the staff very friendly, especially the gym manager. The hotel lobby is newly renovated and modern and the <<Sheraton Link>> free internet was fun but you had to wait a while to get a free computer. The gym itself was clean and modern. The half indoor half outdoor heated pool was just great and not too cowded. The changing rooms (although a little detached from the entrance of the fitness and pool area) were well appointed and clean and there were plenty of fresh towels at our disposal. The weather was awful during our stay but the underground access connecting the Sheraton center to Toronto's PATH and subway and all it's attractions was a HUGE plus (although some of the underground connections close early). It was nice having a window in our room that I could open a bit to let in fresh air. There are always cabs waiting at your disposal at the entrance at all times. The city itself has much improved over the years and there is no signs of stopping, I recommend the city and hotel for a great little getaway. The only negatives: Not much service at the valet, I drove up expecting the valet and bellboy to help with the car and luggage but ended up taking everything out myself, having my girlfriend wait with the luggage while I parked across the street (at a cheaper rate then Sheraton). The wait was long to check in but next time I will register with Starwood prefered guests and zip by the line like many did. Also after check in, the clerk at the desk should have told me that I was staying in the Richmond tower, it took me a while to figure out the configuration of this hotel, and that there were 2 towers, Queen and Richmond. It was a shame that the waterfall garden was closed for the season. On the second night there was a fire alarm at 4am which was very annoying, we had to leave our rooms quickly. Tips for a better stay: - Register as Starwood prefered guest -Get a map for the PATH -Save money and eat better breakfast outside the hotel -bring your laptop, there are connections everywhere in the lobby and rooms

Reviews.Title: “Fixing Noisy Vents with Tissues...A Trait of a 4 Star Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Scona
Reviews.Content: First of all, there where no problems with service (except for an over zealous breakfast server). Housekeeping was great. So was the location and fitness room. The hotel LOOKS like it is well maintained; but it definitely does not sound like it. I do not consider myself a light sleeper; yet there was not one night where I had a really good sleep. During the first night, I noticed that the bathroom vent was running particularly loud; and there was no controls for it (as most hotels have a switch next to the lights). I called down maintenance; and they fixed it by putting a piece of tissue over the vent. Of course, the tissue fell when the vent stopped briefly; and started up again at 4 AM. I had to get out of bed, close the door, and stuff the vent to filter the sound. There is also a high gap below the door which does not filter out any hallway noise. Fortunately, our fellow guests where quite quiet. I complained, but did not get any follow-up or even a "sorry". Next time I visit Toronto, I will definitely be staying somewhere else; even if the location is not as great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lsanchez522
Reviews.Content: Everything went well, the chek-in and check-out were fast and no hassle. I enjoyed the lemonade and popcorn when arrived on the first day. The only thing I dislike was the parking charges as I hadto pay $25.00 for an overnight parking.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, comfort and at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: moigor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights. Nice friendly welcome by staff on arrival. Room fantastic. What comfort, the bed and the seats. Good sized room and very reasonably priced with plenty space for clothes and luggage. View of CN Tower from window and also overlooking the outdoor swimming pool. Within easy walking distance of most of the main attractions and only few minutes walt to underground. Access from hotel straight into PATH which is good if the weather is poor or too warm. Had buffet breakfast, what a choice, good value and friendly waiter. It was difficult getting out of my bed in the morning it was so comfortable just having a coffee and watching the tv. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: jen558
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel for the weekend through priceline. It was in an excellent location - right in the center of downtown Toronto. Seemed to be a decent area - direct access to the PATH (underground mall). The only complaint I had is that we waited in a really long line to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: AlanTX78
Reviews.Content: First mistake we made with this hotel was parking the car in valet, $33/day, what a ripoff when you can park in the City Hall Parking Garage attached to the hotel for $13/day. The hotel doesn't tell you this, but after we got settled and walked around we found this out. The hotel is basically just a gigantic business hotel, which after visiting Toronto isn't really all that surprising b/c that is what Toronto is, a biz town. I wouldn't visit Toronto again for leisure, although it seemed like perfectly nice place to live. The room was a good size, but there was mildew in the bath, and not just a little either -- ceiling edges, floor edges, corners. The carpet in the room was also completely stained, I'd hate to see what the room looked like under a black light (although you could say that about most hotel rooms).

Reviews.Title: “it was an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: le85
Reviews.Content: Biggest disappointment was the fact that I didn't feel like the rooms were clean enough... unfortunatley that's huge for me.. otherwise the hotel was beautiful

Reviews.Title: “One of My Best Hotel Stays Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: NNJFamily
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the Sheraton Centre Toronto. My family and I were lucky enough to be guests recently for a business meeting. Being a Starwood member, I asked whether any upgrades might be available. This is what we received: 1. Upgrade to club level with breakfast and afternoon hors d' oeuvres daily; 2. Upgrade to "Parlour Suite," an amazingly large room, attached to our regular-sized room, with couches, conference table, breakfront, extra bathroom, and amazing view; 3. Fresh flowers in room; 4. Birthday baskets of balloons, candies, etc. for my 2 children. This was all compliments of Manager Tony Dunn and Administrative Staff Member Rudy Duarte. What an amazing experience! My kids felt like royalty! Added to this were many other great things offered by this hotel: great location (with elevator to mall below); great pool; beautiful and immaculately cared for lobby, gardens, etc. A deluxe property which earns that title in every possible way. Without question, one of our most enjoyable hotel stays ever. The staff were AMAZING and acted as if they just couldn't do enough for you. If there were 10 stars possible, the Sheraton Centre Toronto would earn that rating! If you have an opportunity to stay here, don't look any further.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Central Location”
Reviews.Author: userScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton from the 16th July to the 19th July. Booked this through hotwire for a great price and got a corner room that looked onto Queen Street West, looking out of the side window in the room you could see down Queen Street West. The room was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. The room was cleaned everyday and house keeping always seemed to be busy all day, but always had time to say good morning as you passed them in the hallway. In fact all the staff in the hotel was extremely friendly and never seemed to be too busy to talk to a guest or to give information about the surrounding area. The pool was average but it was nice that it was half indoor half outdoor, for when the weather was nice outside, also used the whirlpool which was very relaxing. There was also a gym however neither girlfriend nor I used it. The hotel is connected to the path, which is an underground network of shops which connect major building in downtown together so commuter neednâ€™t walk in the streets in the winter. The water fall feature in the centre of the hotel was very nice and you could go outside and walk beside it, good for photo ops or just to unwind at the end of the day. Would definitely stay at this hotel again if in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Angelina2008_9
Reviews.Content: In September, 2009, I visited Toronto for five days and feel most fortunate to have chosen the Sheraton Centre as my hotel of choice. On arrival, I was warmly greeted by the receptionist on duty, who efficiently provided porter and room service. My room was comfortable, clean and a shortage of hangers was quickly remedied once I requested same! The Sheraton motto â€˜You Don't Just Stay at the Sheraton - You Belongâ€™ is no false advertising as Management and Staff are proof that the Sheratonâ€™s award winning reputation is well deserved. The reasonably priced â€˜Club Lifeâ€� upgrade is well worthwhile for those wishing to be spoiled, as it includes access to the Lounge on the hotelâ€™s 43rd floor, where complimentary continental breakfast is served, with most gracious staff to assist, as well as Hors dâ€™oeuvres in the evening from 5:00-8:00 pm. Other amenities, with this upgrade, include complimentary high-speed Internet access, local calls (with some restrictions), as well as toll-free calls. These little extras make a big difference and are a reminder that superb service is remembered, long after the price is forgotten. The Sheraton Centre is a perfect location in the heart of Torontoâ€™s entertainment and business district, adjacent to shopping, including the Eaton Centre, which is connected by an underground walkway, so weather matters not. This hotel also has magnificent waterfall gardens, providing serenity for those in need of solitude, yet close to all the action as the mood dictates. The Hotelâ€™s smoke-free environment, as well as other amenities, such as swimming- pool and spa leaves guests feeling totally pampered and wanting for nothing. My personal experience proved that Management are genuinely interested in hearing of any concerns as they immediately leave no stone unturned to ensure guest satisfaction. In summary, my stay was memorable for all the right reasons and I echo the sentiments of other guests, including business and holiday travelers, who clearly were well-traveled individuals with high standards. Hotel staff, at all levels, were pleasant, courteous and aimed to please, while Management have reason to be proud of a dedicated team of caring employees who won my respect and loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and great view”
Reviews.Author: nate1879
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a conference in Toronto. The hotel was comfortably Sheraton and in a super location for walking about the city...weather permitting. The views from the room, being on a higher floor, we wonderful in the evenings. The hotel was very clean and the staff was more than helpful with suggestions and recommendations for things to do. The room was a typical Sheraton room. Not flashy, just comfortable beds, and subdued decorations. The pool was especially enjoyable with the views into the city as well. Likes: pool, location, staff Dislikes: overpriced, smallish room even on club floor Overall: Would like stay at this hotel again. The helpful staff/concierge made getting dinner reservations and theatre tickets a strong selling point to return.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Sydney027
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights from Oct 1 - 4, 2009. There were some aspects of the hotel that were quite good and others that were not up to par. The central location was convenient. We parked our car at the lot across from the hotel for $24/day (underground parking, safe) and then took public transportation or walked to wherever we wanted to go. The subway stops were within two blocks of the hotel which was very handy. We also had to go to St. Michael's hospital and it was a short ten minute walk away. The best part of the hotel was the location. We stayed in a junior king suite. The list price was $279 but we paid $159 through a special deal with our credit card company. We were expecting more space, but in fact, the suite was really just a slightly larger room than a standard hotel room. There was a balcony, that overlooked a garden, but it was too cold and wet to go out onto it. As well, the small table and two chairs on the balcony were not cleaned and the balcony itself had some leaves and branches on it that were not cleaned up during our stay. The bathroom left a lot to be desired. The tub/shower combo was just standard and was located in a tiny room right beside a toilet. It was so small we couldn't easily close the door. The sink and counter were outside this area which was good, but there was no door separating that space from the room so anyone using that area disturbed other people in the room who were trying to sleep. The decorating was OK, nothing special, and there were some gouge marks in our rug. The outside door of our room had peeling paint on it. There was a nice flat screen TV. The room could be renovated, but the good thing was that is was spotless. The bed was very comfortable. To access the room. we had to descend about 8 stairs once we got off the elevator, which was a challenge when we were transporting our luggage. The worst thing, though, is that we couldn't adjust the heat in our room. When we called for advice we were told that the heat wasn't on yet - we couldn't believe that a hotel in Toronto wouldn't have its heat on in October, when the outside temperature was 5 degrees celsius. Our room was only 67 degrees. We did get a heater brought to the room, which helped somewhat, but it is unacceptable to have to have even needed one. The pool was nice - a very large indoor/outdoor one with a separate lane set up for anyone who wanted to swim lengths. My only complaints about the pool were that it opened at 7 am - I'd prefer 6 am as that would allow people to go for a swim before starting a day's actiivity. I couldn't make it to my 8 am conference if I only got into the water at 7, so that was not as convenient. I also like a pool to be warm. The temperature of the water was 81 degrees, but for me, that was too cold, given the outdoor component of the setting. We enjoyed the location, and we are glad that we had a reduced price, but I wouldn't stay at this hotel again, given the above issues.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location for Everything”
Reviews.Author: Wyld0ne
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. We are Starwood Guest members and had a great room on one of the club floors and certainly worth paying the extra. Views were fantastic. Lives up to the good comments made by others which is why we chose it for a 4 night stay. Central to absolutely everything. Breakfast on the club floor was exceptional with a vast range of choice. One small complaint which let the 'club' down was the extortionate price of the drinks. Although the 'nibbles' were free you certainly pay for it wihin the price of the drinks. Far better value to go outside the hotel and find a nice bar/restuarant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great rates available”
Reviews.Author: Jamezon
Reviews.Content: The airport express bus will drop off from YYZ (Lester Pearson Airport) right outside the hotel which is a good start. We were offered an upgrade for $50 per night to a club room, which we turned down as we had a 3 night stay and the benefits seemed negligible. The standard room was very nice and a decent size, even if not the most modern but this is a huge, very busy hotel to be fair. Everything was clean and there was a large window (not opening) overlooking City Hall. Breakfast at the hotel was pretty expensive, we ate at one of the many surrounding Tim Horton cafes, think a bagel shop crossed with a coffee place, very affordable and nice bagels. The staff were very helpful throughout. Overall, would definitely recommend this to business/leisure travellers alike, particularly as you will likely be able to get deals around the $100 mark. (We booked through Canadian Affair at Â£72/night.)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: smackdown928
Reviews.Content: We actually ended up at the Sheraton Centre through Priceline and I am so happy that we did! The location is just perfect - you are right downtown, close enough to subway, trolleys and walking to so many different places was super easy! The lobby is quite nice, and there are a ton of shops and food court down below that you can walk through in order to even get out on other streets (A nice way to avoid cold weather!). They also have a very nice fitness center as well as an indoor/outdoor pool. When we checked in we let Natalia at the front desk know that we were up celebrating my birthday and she upgraded us to club lounge level with no charge. It was such a nice thing to do - we were able to have complimentary (delicious) breakfast each morning, hor dourves at night, and just to have access at the lounge for wireless, etc was so nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest Location”
Reviews.Author: rhonda8791
Reviews.Content: Do The Best Location; In the heart of downtown (surrounded by shopping, restaurants & theatre) Very nice lobby; with water fall. Free internet Ok The staff wasn't overly friendly The rooms are standard; no fluff; but comfortable Don't The parking is $40 per day The parking lot is a zoo; cars coming every which way The bath room needs to be updated If it wasn't for the location this would be a 3.5 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - fab location”
Reviews.Author: writergirlHouston
Reviews.Content: As others have said here on Trip Advisor, this Sheraton is a very good hotel, updated and very comfortable but not super-trendy. Service is very good. Ate at 1st-floor bar restaurant and it was ok. But the location is FABULOUS! My husband was at a conference so I was on my own. I was right down the street from Eaton Centre and across from City Hall -- a main location for Grey Line Tours. Toronto is a safe city and the Sheraton is well-located for walking to entertainment & restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: tiaras
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a friends wedding in Toronto-50 of us travelling independently from ireland. i loved the hotel-it is not boutique...it is a large busy hotel with all that goes with that. we found the staff very helpful, our room was great, we got an early check in as requested and put on a higher floor as requested. room service was great-expensive but great. I would stay here again but only through hotwire prices-i think it is very over priced on its own website. location is as downtown as you could want to be and close to everything. really enjoyed it. my one big issue is why the expensive broadband connection fees when a-its a pricey hotel and b-downtown Toronto is a hotspot-very cheeky.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not the service expected”
Reviews.Author: GipsySuarez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is greatly located, the facilities are well equipped although small when it comes down to the room size. The Club Floor, if you are a Starwoods member, is a big plus. However, the service was on the low side, not what I was expecting for a Sheraton hotel in Toronto and for more than $250/day: I had to do a check-in line 3 times, the first time just for regular check-in, the 2nd one because my room wasn't ready, and the 3rd one because my key wasn't working as expected. The room smelled as if somebody was smoking in it but the Guest Service offered to change the room or just get it better cleaned; we went for the latter. Contacting Guest Service always took a while. In general, services was not up to the level I am used to

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: plasticintruder
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights with some friends and really enjoyed my stay. The hotel is centrally located, close to shopping, restaurants, transportation, etc. Check in was quick, staff was efficient but not terribly friendly. Our room was on the preferred guest floor (35th floor) just below the club levels. The room was clean, spacious, nicely decorated, and best of all, had an excellent view of the Toronto skyline and CN Tower. The bathroom was spotless (which is always important). The worst thing about this hotel is that there are additional charges for everything (even for gold level preferred guests). Even in the lobby there is no free internet (some cafes nearby do). I would recommend this hotel based on its location and reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dublingirlabouttown
Reviews.Content: The big advantage of this hotel is the location - it is perfect! The hotel itself has seen better days, some of the rooms could do with a makeover. However, the staff are very pleasant and do their best to help. We were given an upgrade at check-in and this made the stay for us. The club level lounge was fantastic and I would definitely recommend this if the budget allows. One small issue was the turndown or lack of it. They advertise a turndown service if you request it with housekeeping. I requested it 3 times and it did not happen once. However, overall I would recommend this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: skingo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights on a business trip. It is a very large place and the decor feels like you have gone back in time to 1983, but it is not at all tatty and the rooms have all the flat screens etc you could wish for. I had a suite on the 23rd floor which was spacious and had great views over the city. The food was not up to much; I ate out in the evenings. But overall, I enjoyed the stay there and thought it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money - Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: seyenepo
Reviews.Content: Kids immediately loved the place as you are met in the lobby with hot popcorn & cold lemonade. Always something going on in the lobby. Rooms adequate. Good pool set up. Real value for money. Great view of the CN Tower from room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to all downtown attractions!”
Reviews.Author: Flipadee005
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location, location, location. Cons: Can't think of any as of now. I booked this last minute for my wife and I during 4th of July weekend and I have to say that it was a great find. We were greeted by the friendly staff upon arrival and was welcomed to popcorn and drinks. What we like the most about this hotel was the location. It was pretty much in the middle of all the major attractions such as Eaton Centre, Chinatown, CN tower, the theater district, etc. We walked everywhere every night to all the local eats and bars. As far as the hotel itself, it was more upscale and very pleasing. The lobby area was very accommodating for it had a large area to relax and was very business traveler friendly. I would say this hotel has a lot to offer for all types of travelers; business, leisure, romantic, family, etc. Overall we were very pleased with this hotel. We hope you enjoy your experience as much as we did. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice base for Toronto”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while up in Canada. We didn't want to spend a lot of money, so I put a bid of $60 US on Priceline.com and got the Sheraton. I saw a previous poster mention that parking at City Hall was significantly cheaper, so we followed suit. Well, it was somewhat true. We stayed for a 24 hour period in the lot and it was $34 Canadian, vs $40 if we parked at the Sheraton. That isn't a huge difference and for the added convenience, next time I would recommend parking at the Sheraton. The lobby was open and spacious. We were tired at check in, but they were giving away fresh lemonade, which was a nice touch. We got our room in the shorter tower, which seemed a bit older, but the room was nicely remodeled. Although it seemed like your typical urban hotel, it was clean and comfortable and in a great location. It was one block to the closest subway station and 2 blocks to the Eaton Centre mall, which had another subway station. You can even walk to the waterfront and CN Tower, which was less than a mile away. I really liked the Sheraton and for the money I paid, it was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarahms
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 25th August to 30th August and had a very nice stay. We upgraded to a club room and had a large room with a KIng Bed and a fabulous view of the CN Tower and the lake beyond - it was great to wake up to that veiw each day and was worth the extra cost just to be so high up and able to see this. The bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows. There was a spacious desk and leather arm chair with foot stool. We were given robes and plenty of towels. The club rooms have complimentary Internet access which is fine - you can upgrade to a faster speed for a cost but for every day browsing you don't need it. One thing I was impressed with was that the water from the cold tap really was chilled - I am not sure if that is the same across Toronto or it's the hotel that does it - but It was nice to be able to drink chilled water. The hair dryer is a real one - one of my pet hates are those silly wall ones - so that was pleasing for me!!! Plenty of storage in the cupboard, an ironing board and iron and an electronic safe. The Club lounge has excellent views and serves a continental breakfast - there was a big selection of items so you could quite easily not need lunch. The evening snacks were also nice. It did get busy especially on SUnday morning and they were aksing people if they would go down to the main breakfast restaurant but we got a table and stayed for the lovely views! One thing that did get on my nerves (and this may be just because I an a stingy old Brit) but every time ytou went to the club lounge even though you help yourself to everything, the waitiers who only cleared away plates etc left cards printed by the hotel for you to leave a tip. Now I never mind tipping when I have had a service but to be honest I did think it was a bit of a cheek when I had got everything for myself including teas and coffees. I did notice that hardly anyone left anything on their cards so perhaps it wasn't just me! Check In / Out was simple and fast and the popcorn and lemonade was a nice touch each day in the lobby. The Bell desk organised out transport back to the airport and it was waiting for us whe we arrived downstairs at the arranged time - so couldn't fault that. The location is really good - we walked everywhere except to the ROM when we caought the underground really easily. This is a good hotel, with comfortable facilities and a great location. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a central location”
Reviews.Author: CinephileEngland
Reviews.Content: Before my wife and I visited the Sheraton we read a lot of reviews; most people seemed happy with it while a few had complaints (bedbugs, crowded lobby etc). All I can say was that we found the hotel an excellent place to stay. Firstly it's in a central location, close to two subway stations, on a streetcar route and above the PATH which can be accessed easily by going down into the concourse area. The room was very good. It was spacious, the bathroom was well equipped and, above all, the bed was amazingly comfortable. We had a room in the Queens Tower with a view looking towards the CN Tower with the lake visible between the office blocks. We asked for a quiet room and it was away from the elevators on our floor. The only problem was that we could still hear what seemed like elevators clunking away in the building though we were not sure where they were. However, this seemed to ease off late at night and didn't disturb our sleep. Contrary to the experience of others we didn't have to wait long to check in or out and the staff (reception, tour/information and cleaning) were all friendly and helpful. For breakfast go down to the concourse and make your way to the Thomson Concourse where you will find a little place called Fit for Life on the right hand side. They do great breakfasts of omelettes and toast (or, if you choose, there's a salad and fruit bar). Run by really friendly staff this was a favourite place for us. It was spotlessly clean. Also, I had one of the best steaks in my life at the Keg which is just round the corner from the hotel. Altogether I would recommend the Sheraton for its good service and great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the drinks at the lobby bar (rip off city)”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence23
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a seemingly pleasant bar at the lobby level. However, other than beer, be extremely careful about ordering the premium alcoho/liquor. I am certain that I was served an adulterated drink. I asked for a Macallan 18 single malt scotch whiskey and I certainly did not receive a Macallan 18 single malt whiskey. However I was charged $63 for a single shot of this adulterated drink. It is a shame that a hotel of this caliber has to resort to such lowly tricks to cheat its customers. I am planning to file a complaint with the LCBO to prevent this type of fraudulent activity from affecting others.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: EUReviewer
Reviews.Content: For such a large hotel, there was a seemingly personal air about the Sheraton. The location is excellent - easily walkable from the very centre of the city, and also handy for public transport. The huge lobby is bright and fresh - although will smell of popcorn when it is served with juice of an afternoon! Staff at the reception were helpful and courteous. The room was very clean, and the beds comfortable. The view of the CN Tower and city centre was fantastic. Although quite expensive, the bar was good, and provided a pleasant ambience for a drink. There are also televisions showing a good variety of sport, which was welcome, too. It was very useful that the hotel is connected to the PATH network, with direct access to shops, including a supermarket. In all, it was a wonderful experience at the Sheraton and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Served It's Purpose”
Reviews.Author: Sheikyerbooty
Reviews.Content: Stayed from the 27th to the 30th of August. As many have said before, this hotel has an impressive lobby, check-in was a snap, waited 5 minutes max. Now I had booked this through Priceline ($54.00 a night), and have had problems from time to time, with requesting 2 double beds in hotels when booked through Priceline...not the case here. We may not have been given the most up to date room, but it served us well nonetheless. I have stayed here in the past, and have had problems sleeping with the famous...or sometimes infamous bell tower across the street, so we requested a room away from the bell, and that request was also fullfilled, we were placed in the Richmond Tower (not much of a tower if you ask me, it's 10 floors high). Had a room on the 5th floor. Room size was medium to small, very clean, though the room could use an update, especially the carpetting. Rooms have a window that opens, which is a big plus in my book. Air conditioning system was out of date, but not too loud. Beds were very comfy. LCD Tv in the room, though I cannot figure out why these hotels give you such nice tv's but they alsways have such lousy analog cable hooked up. The one disappointment was - no mini bar, which one can often use for their own stuff. Internet service in the lobby was easy and free, with lots of comfortable spots to sit, it's an extra charge for inroom connections. So all in all, it was a pleasant stay, had I paid the regular rack rate, I may have been a little disappointed with the room, but I would not have settled for an out of date room in that case, as I know much of this hotel has been recently renovated. Oh one last thing...this hotel is very centrally located to everything in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...”
Reviews.Author: pretty11
Reviews.Content: Hmm...to put it simple this hotel is amazing. Great location..close to everything. Lobby in the hotel is very luxurious. Free internet in lobby. Nice clean rooms and comfy beds..Only bad thing i noticed were the few plates left in the hallway from guests on the way to our room..You want a nice hotel? Stay here..

Reviews.Title: “Ear plugs saved the night!”
Reviews.Author: lynz001
Reviews.Content: 2 adults and 1 teenager. We first booked the 2 night stay on their web site for $99.00 per night which I felt a very good deal. The we were offered to upgrade to club room for $49.00 per night and we did as the price was still very good and now included breakfast and a few other perks so the price was $149.00 per night including breakfast. We wanted to be close to Eaton Centre and be able to walk to the St. Lawernce Market area for the Buskerfest and we also caught the streetcar to CNE just outside the door so we were happy. Parked at City Hall for $46.00 for the full 2 days and nights and walked across the street to the hotel. We checked in just before noon and had popcorn and drinks. Check in was great and we were offered a room on the 39th floor with a great view of CN tower. The check in person even showed me which room were currently available as it was early in the day and also the room with 2 beds. We choose a room 3rd from the elevator hoping we could not hear the elevator and the only available at that time that was furthered away. The room also did not have the robes or free water but we did not mention this when we asked to be changed to another room when we got back from the CNE at around 10:30pm. Until you go to bed you do not know how loud elevators are going to be. Anyway there was no way I could sleep in the this room. I went down and there were not any other 2 bed club rooms left. So I asked if we could have a King room and a cot (at no charge) and we were given a room on the 41st floor same view and was 5 or 6 rooms away from the elevator. I could still hear the elevator but not a loud as the other room so that night I got some sleep but not as good a sleep as I got the next night as I bought ear plugs and had a great sleep. The room also had robes and free water. Location and price was great for our stay. We loved the club floor and the breakfast . It was busy but the food was good and we always got a table right away. The club room had huge windows and great views. We would go and have a coffee during the day and just stare out the windows. I do think they should upgrade to queen beds but I doubt if there is room and also add a shelf in the bathroom to put items on. Otherwise I found the staff to be very friendly and accomodating and the beds including the huge cot were very comfortable and the room we had was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Too Big, too many people...”
Reviews.Author: lestofunk
Reviews.Content: Thousand of rooms... smelly carpet everywhere. Our check-in lasted 10 seconds... no indications, no suggestions, just a key card that wasn't working. Our Room was quite old, carpet was used up... but the view was great. We reserved a club floor room on 39th floor. The club room is ok even if is always very crowded.. especially at breakfast time. Service in club room is really good. This Hotel definetely needs to be renovated...

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of the city with brilliant views of City Hall.”
Reviews.Author: TeignmouthRed
Reviews.Content: Nice place despite being absolutely huge. We were in the Richmond Tower which has great views of City Hall. Nice pool and considerate staff throughout. Rooms were clean and well-maintained and considering where the hotel is, pretty reasonably priced. Breakfast was on the expensive side but given that it was our first morning in the country after a day's travel, a well-stocked buffet was just what the Doctor ordered. Parking around the hotel is plentiful, so don't fall for the $40 on site charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lousy service.”
Reviews.Author: seismo2003
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great location, which locates in the center of Toronto city. You could reach subway station in seconds. And it is close to the University avenue. You could walk to many spots in minutes, You could shop at Eaton Center, only to cross the street in front of the hotel. The hotel is connected with the underground passage, which contain lots of shops and restaurants. The passage can reach to almost every important business building and prominent spot. If you go there in winter, you could hide yourself in the passage, prevent from the frozen weather outside. And the room is really comfortable, bed is big and cozy. Everyday you will get three packs of Starbucks convenient pack, there is coffee machine in the room. The hotel is colonized by Starbucks. Even in the coffee shop in hotel, they will emphasize that "We proudly brew Starbucks." And there is one Starbucks coffee adjacent to the Hotel. The breakfast is O.K, but not impressed. The clerks in the Hotel were really unfriendly. Some clerks are really lack of enthusiasm, especially the Latino clerks.(I have to make clear that I am not a racist, but this is what I really felt.) At first day, they claim that we hadn't pay the money, but actually we had, the clerk than became Impatient and pettish. And I phoned back to Taiwan's credit card company for confirmation, and they said we had already paid the bill. But the clerk insisted. And I phoned lost of time after then. I called back the next day, asked her to check again. She found the record and said that she ignored the page non-intentionally, but she didn't say sorry. The housekeepers were also unfriendly, if you asked her question, some of the housekeeper would answer in a pettish way, it made me very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “OK for $60 but you can do much better in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: juliea344
Reviews.Content: I am amazed by all of the rave reviews this hotel is getting. I wonder if these people have never been to a nice hotel before. I have stayed here twice (both times on a Hotwire rate). This time I paid $60 during the busy CNE season. $60 is about what the hotel is worth. We were given a tiny closet of a room which was dark and dingy with a bathroom to match. The restaurant is overpriced and the food is not good. Go there if you're looking for a $9 Bud Light. In the lobby everyone is stuffing their faces with the free popcorn and it's all over the floor. It kept sticking on the bottoms of my shoes. If I paid $200-$300 a night for this place I would not be happy. Try the Hilton Garden Inn on Peter and Adelaide. MUCH better and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - worstest Sheraton experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Hotelblog24_com
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the new years eve and arrived on Dec. 27th. After a thirty minute checkout procedure (no SPG-Gold/Platinum line opened) we were told that upgrades for SPG members are not possible and all rooms have the same size. Lounge was closed during this week and reopened on Dec. 31st, - in the meantime lounge was placed to a small part of the bar and completly overfilled. After opening for the appetizers, after 10 minutes 50% of the food were on floor, additional food was not able to get - waiting for a soft drink needs about 15 minutes! Breakfast buffet was o.k. - but waiter won't accept vouchers and told us to pay now and get credit for the vouchers during checkout (heard this from different tables also)! Room was cleaned medium - bed sheets was still dirty! If you get fresh towels, you are in lucky situation. The housekeeping service appologizes for that because of the high amount of guest. On Dec. 31st you need tapes to reenter the hotel or to go to the public parts, but if you checked-in before Dec 30th, they did not give you any tapes to show that you are a hotel guest, so you have to go to front desk at 11.30pm - real great fun. The pool idea is great with indoor and outdoor experience on -20Â°Celsius, but the inside the water is so much chlorine, that it gets dangerous for the skin. We requested twice to speak to the manager, but front-desk always told us, that it is not possible and manager is not on duty this day. Checkout was the same process as checkin - long lines, express checkout not possible, front desk told us to send invoice by email - still waiting for that. The location of the hotel is really great - but the service, cleanliness and especially front-desk is horrible. If you want waste your money on New Years eve, I can recommend that - if you are looking for a great spot in Toronto - try to find a different location!

Reviews.Title: “busy but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: E&JJJ
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms through Virgin holidays but the hotel had us down for only one room. Took a while to sort that one out but eventually got the two rooms in the Richmond Tower with nice views.Beds are comfortable and bathrooms well stocked.Elevators very slow. Nice reception area , had free lemon juice and popcorn on the first afternoon but never saw it again after that.Lovely water feature to sit and look at and free internet for 1/2 hour if you wait your turn. Suggest if you want a tour to Niagara Falls, dont go through the Hotel as they use Toronto Tours Ltd. which was extremely expensive compared to deals we found later on the internet. Quite a long and not very pleasant walk to the lake area from this hotel, but the shopping centre is nearby and the Hard Rock Cafe is great for an evening meal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelfoool
Reviews.Content: Excellent Sheraton, comparable with other renovated big-city Sheratons. Very good view from higher floors - had a high floor overlooking city hall. Downside - walls seemed thin, could hear neighbors clearly. Best feature would be the location - in between many of the city attractions. Enjoyed the unique shops on West Queen Street.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: Soliberus
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Checked in on a Sunday night (7pm) and the queue was moving very slowly. Once we reached the check-in desk the lady was friendly and we were given a room. When we got to the room (35th floor) the key wouldn't work. Had to go back down to reception. Turns out the lady wrote the wrong room number on the key-holder. I wasn't impressed. Our room faced north, so we had a nice view of the city and the City Hall. The room could have been cleaner. The toilet was dodgy. The paint was peeling above the shower and the bathroom ceiling (above the bath) was moldy. This is a convention hotel, so it can get very busy (lobby & lifts). The staff were friendly and very helpful, so we cannot complaint about the service. The location is perfect. Very close to Eaton Centre. Nice neighbourhood and we felt very safe, even late at night. The streetcar passes right in front of the hotel. We enjoyed our stay, but we feel the room could have been cleaner and in a better condition. I would only recommend this hotel if you can get a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Goin down hill fast”
Reviews.Author: hoserscorner
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sheraon Center in Toronto over the last 10 years and I can say for certain that I have seen a dramatic decline in the conditions of their rooms. The service I have no complaints about. However, serious upgrading and better housekeeping need to be done to bring this place back. In my photo editorial, you will see, stained bed skits, gum left on headboard from previous guest, windows full of grime and grease on the inside, carpets not vaccumed and rusted sprinkler. These are actual photos (no lies and no touch ups....) and all in one room (1641) OH and don't bother with their internet. I paid $10 for 24 hour access and gave up after a 2 minutes video on YouTube took over 25 minutes to load!!!! Oh, and neither of the phones in our room worked and we found this out at 11:30 when we went to set our wake up call (they offered to send maintenance but its 11:30 at night and we are in PJs!!!) Cannot believe this....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic-for the first leg of our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: wifeyNorfolk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for 3 nites for the best leg of our honeymoon. We were upgraded which was a great start to our trip to Canada, staff were friendly, room was fantastic on the 33rd floor with wonderful views. Couldn't fault anything about out stay - highly recommened

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kylienz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton for 5 nights from 28th of July. We arrived quite late in the evening so the large and spacious reception area was very quiet. We were meet by a friendly receptionist who was only to happy to help with our checking in. We requested an upgrade and she gave us a range of options for us to chose from. As this hotel is the tallest in the city it seems to be broken up into two pay rates. One for floors 2-25 and another for floors 26-40. I would suggest the upgrade as for an extra 50 canadian dollars you get a great breakfast on the 43rd floor for each day of your stay. (Also included in the upgrade are canapes served from 5pm on this floor but we were never about to enjoy them.) You also get a room on one of the higher levels, we were on the 36th floor and the views were amazing. Even though it was quite close to elevator and we were staying during the Caribana Festival our room was very quiet. It was spacious with a large TV and air conditioning. Our room was cleaned daily with fresh towels and toiletries added. Also complementary were two bottles of water which were placed in our room which was a nice touch. Another feature of this hotel which we found great was the range of in-house movies on offer. For about 15.99can (cheaper than two tickets to the cinema) you could chose from around 100 movies, some of which had yet to be screened in the UK and others that were showing in the cinema at the time. We used this a couple of times in the evening to relax with and really enjoyed it. The hotel is in an excellent location, only 5 minutes away from the Eaton Centre and access can be made to the PATH from the hotel itself. We did a lot of walking during our time in Toronto and we could get to most sights easily from the hotel. Overall we loved our experience with this hotel and found the rooms comfortable and clean, and the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It's very good for the money”
Reviews.Author: JMOsaka
Reviews.Content: Great location, totally reasonable prices, lovely indoor/outdoor pool, service was friendly and helpful. What more could you ask for of a hotel at this price? Also, we got a Club room and the Club floor, the view, the fun of it, was great. The food wasn't anything to write home about, but then... it was more about the lounge. And the jacuzzi tub in our suite. That was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location - but if it's Caribana weekend don't expect peace and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: mckaykarenj
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after an extensive online consultation of reviews of hotels in Toronto. I don't normally go to such effort when choosing a hotel but because my husband and I were travelling with my parents , it was a necessity to do so. I reserved and pre-paid our rooms roughly six months prior to our arrival and got a good rate. When we checked in the spacious, airy reception was busy, but managed efficiently. I specifically asked for quiet rooms, which we got, but for the first night only. You see, much to our horror, the Caribana Festival weekend was upon us and the hotel from Friday until Monday transformed from decadent hotel for the discerning business / city traveller, into something akin to a hooker line up at a baseball game in a ghetto. Despite 4 separate calls to guest services between the hours of 1 and 5 am, no effort was made by the hotel to calm the noise and drunken antics in the corridors which punctuated 3 out of our 4-night stay. I know this for a fact because the noise was literally outside our bedroom door therefore, I would have been aware of security asking for quiet. In the end I emerged from my room, dishevelled and cross at 04:50 on Saturday morning with a plea that they keep the noise down. They did reduce the noise but not for long and only on that one occasion. This hotel has a range of services to offer: indoor-outdoor pool with sun-loungers; sauna; well equipped gym; restaurants; bars; shops, and a lovely waterfall garden. The restaurants are not cheap; in fact Toronto in general is an expensive city to visit. The free internet access in the lobby is painfully slow, so unless you really can't go without internet access, don't bother. There are 3 check-in stations in the hotel lobby which enable you to check in online and print your boarding cards free of charge. The bedrooms we reserved had 2 double beds (very narrow, advise you pay the little extra for a king), desk, TV, hairdryer, en-suite with shower-over-bath, ample sockets and lamps, large windows and air conditioning. Air conditioning is somewhat antiquated - radiator-style vents at the window behind the blackout curtains and quite noisy...but barely noticeable on Caribana weekend...if it wasn't for the prolonged periods of disturbance in the wee small hours, and the lack of assistance from the hotel staff I would rave about this hotel. I am sure if it hadn't been Caribana our experience would have been very different and more positive.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreameral
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on Thursday July 30 for one night. We were greeted by very efficient clerk that gave us two adjoining rooms. We booked this hotel through priceline and were treated like on other guest. The lobby is massive with a beautiful glassed in water fall garden. The escalator takes you down to the underground shopping complex and is very easy to get to the Eaton Centre. We walked to the Roger's centre to see Coldplay. The room was large with a grate view of the city hall and overlooking the waterfall gardens. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: masdixon
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 4 times, and each we have enjoyed a room on the club floor, the staff is excellent and the hotel maintains a true 4 star fashion. The rooms recieved new linens and the bathroom amenities are excellent. The hotel is the tallest hotel in the city and provides excellent views, especially if you are placed on a south facing room, you get an AMAZING view of the CN Tower. The hotel also has a truly amazing location on Queen Street West.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sincerelypunk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a week from the 7th - 14th June. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the room was really comfy and clean. I was very impressed with the daily maid service and the customer service at the tourist information desk. The safe was also very easy to operate and was a good necessity to have in the room. I only have two minor faults: 1. The ice machine on our floor was not working so we had to take the lift/stairs to another floor to fill up our bucket. 2. The noise level in the hallway was unbearable some nights, especially at 2.50am! However there were a lot of conferences on at the time. All in all we had a fantastic stay and would not hesitate coming back to stay again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for visiting Toronto”
Reviews.Author: HopSkipJump
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on Hotwire.com for a great price. All in all, the hotel was wonderful. The bad points: The first room they gave me was next to an ice maker and the chiming of the elevator lobby on the 7th floor. (No way to sleep through all of that). They moved me with no complaint to the Richmond Street tower (which I would recommend). The beds were doubles, not queens. Being tall, I thought it would be a problem but it didn't seem to be (height-wise). Two people sharing such a bed might be a little tight, though. They did have 'king bed' rooms at an additional cost. The cost of the starbucks in the lobby was ridiculously expensive. A blueberry muffin costs $4. If you walk past the Starbucks and exit the door at the eastern end of the lobby, there's a 'coffee place' there with muffins for $1. My key card stopped working for some reason -- a minor inconvenience. Now, the good stuff: the room was very nice: two beds, oversized chair, desk + chair, flat-screen TV. The bathroom was spacious. I'm 6'4" (just under 2 m) and the shower head was taller than me! Lots of towels; great housekeeping staff (I used only 2 of the 4 pillows that were on EACH bed) and housekeeping was thoughtful enough not to keep replacing the 2 pillows that I didn't want. This way, I had little to do but jump into bed, in the evenings. The view from my room was great: below is a wonderful courtyard with nice landscaping and a waterway that leads to a waterfall that spills into a glass-enclosed area of the lobby bordered on with rocking chairs. Looking out from the window was a dead-on view of the new city hall complex which was quite pleasant The pool is the largest indoor/outdoor pool in North America and the fitness center was very nice -- both included in your room rate. They served complimentary popcorn in the lobby as well as lemonade. There was a 'business center' area in the lobby with free computer access as well as free wifi in the lobby that could be accessed from any seat including a long narrow table with chairs on either side that seemed to attract people with their laptops. The location couldn't be beat: 1 block to the subway. In addition, there was a street car along Queen Street that goes to the Beaches neighborhood (we went to the free jazz festival there) as well as westbound on Queen which takes you to all kinds of shopping/dining/attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: BlomidonBud
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Toronto for 5 days along with my son & his wife, who also did the booking through Hot wire (great prices!). We took the cab from the airport so the parking was a non-issue for us. We were totally pleased with the rooms, except for one matter, which affected our son & his wife. Apparently this hotel allows dogs in the rooms (yes, I did check at the front desk...it's true!). Now, I had never heard of this in my 60 years of traveling, but apparently hotels must be getting desperate for business. It just so happened that my son & his wife had a yapping dog in the room beside them, which was brought to the attention of the front desk. After several nights of listening to this dog, the management finally moved them to a luxury room in another tower. We were impressed with how management tried to make a bad situation better, but the policy of dogs in a room should definitely be reevaluated! I liked the pool, for which there was no additional charge, and noticed a fine work out centre beside the pool, which seemed to be under-utilized. The noise from the jazz festival going on at the time could have been a problem for some, but it didn't go on much past 11PM. The location of this hotel is it's selling feature...you can walk to almost everything, although we took the subway once to see a show in another end of the city. The breakfast at this hotel is fairly pricey, but several blocks away is a great grill, which I better leave unnamed, which provides a wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great service,location and customer care”
Reviews.Author: Trucker872
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Center for 5 nights. The check in was very smooth,friendly and courteous. We went to room and made a quick exit to check Toronto out. But before we did, I tried the room safe. It didn't work , so I called the front desk to inform them. They said they would send security right up. Jordan was there in less than 5 minutes , assessed the problem. He called the front desk for another room. We were on the 12Th floor, double bed. He went and got the key for us, met us on the 14TH floor and had a King bed room. He also had executive privileges setup for us the entire stay. What a nice upgrade. We ate every morning on the 43RD floor and once for there cocktail hour. Another person that was extremely helpful and cute (I can say that because I'm old), was Vanessa at the tour/concierge desk. She knows Toronto and helped us with getting around. The underground,called the P.A.T.H. has access right at the hotel. It has many shops and food courts, but does close down around 6PM. The single day pass for trolley,metro,buses is only Can $9. The 3 day is $17. There isn't anywhere you can't get to with it. We went to the Zoo, but it did take about n hour each way. So many restaurants to pick from all around town. I'd like to thank Jordan and Vanessa again. Sorry I don't recall the many others that were so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: FromSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto in the beginning of July with two of our grandchildren. The hotel is very well located, so we could walk to all the main attractions. The connecting rooms were very nicely decorated and my husband and I were given a huge room with a living area that had a 46â€™ LCD TV set. The bathrooms were renovated, very clean and of a good size, especially the one in our suite. The only thing wrong with the room was that I think the carpet was in need of some shampooing and the closets were quite outdated. One day we needed a doctor for our grandson, and the concierge, Isabel, a very polite and pleasant person, was extremely helpful and got us an appointment immediately with a doctor whose office was just in the next building. This alone saved our trip. I would surely recommend the Sheraton for leisure and/or business.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location In Toronto”
Reviews.Author: JakePilot
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline and got a $85/night price! (about 60% off rack rate) This is a 4 star hotel in downtown Toronto across the street from City Hall...could not be more central! When I drove into the covered front area, the uniformed doorman exclaimed that my unique vehicle (a 2005 Chrvrolet SSR) should not be driven by anyone other than me, I knew I was at the right place. (He had me park in the VIP area adjoining the front door and I kept the keys!) The entire hotel was swell. It is an aging property, but they have maintained it well. Everyone we came in contact with was very friendly and helpful. I would tell anyone who is going to Toronto to stay at the Sheraton Centre. (but use Price line first!)

Reviews.Title: “A little bit run down!”
Reviews.Author: JohannVienna
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel with hotwire.com and got a really good rate for it, otherwise i would be disappointed. The rooms are quite run down and in my opinion don't represent the standard of Sheraton. We complained about our room and were upgraded to a club level room without being charged. The room we finally got was at the 41st floor, the view over the city was awesome, but the room itself was almost the same as our first, probably just slightly better. The lobby is impressive and really nice and the hotel is very good situated. All in all its a good hotel if you book it at a good rate but the rooms definitely need a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Well above average”
Reviews.Author: Geoff & Barbara
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and were upgraded to a Club room when we arrived, although we were informed that we would have to pay $26 each for breakfast if we used the Club Lounge (which we never did!). We had a great view over the city form our room on the 38th floor. The room was large, clean and well appointed. The only negative was the lack of surface areas in the bathroom for toilet bags. The hotel lobby, with its garden complete with waterfall was definitely a talking point. We found the link through to the underground PATH passageways to be very handy. Weâ€™d printed a map off the internet before we went and would recommend this to fellow tourists, as it would be very easy to get lost without one. Other useful attractions in the lobby are: (1) the Link CafÃ© (breakfast with a smile plus seating in a pleasant atmosphere) (2) free PC internet access for half an hour at a time (3) Traders Bar (we thought the food overpriced, so gave it a miss; however the bar area with itâ€™s comfy chairs was very enjoyable for a late afternoon cold drink after a long day of â€œtouristingâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Loppasuu
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. The room was not too big and there was some paint peeling of the bathroom wall but it was very clean and cleaning was well done every day. Location was absolutely fantastic and there were plenty of good restaurants withing walking distance. Our reservation was made through Hotwire and so it was a really cheap stay for us. Considering the price, we really felt this hotel was worth the price paid. What impressed us most was the friendliness of the staff. We had some problems with our Niagara tour and the guy at the desk really did an excellent wotk to sort out the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Service is good, hidden charges, bed ripped”
Reviews.Author: bubblebed
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't come back to this hotel. Though the guest services there is good, there are hidden charges that they don't tell you ahead of time. I was told that the fitness center and pool is free for guest use, but it was not. They charged me a lump sum of $45 a day without my knowing until I check my credit card statement. And I called guest services to ask already and they told me it was free. Parking is another whooping $40 a day. The bed is old and ripped so badly that I can see the springs. If you're visiting Toronto, my suggestion is to just stay in Mississauga some other cities close by, because downtown is very dirty and ghetto at night. I wouldn't even want to walk around there at night. I will call the hotel regarding the $45 charge tomorrow and post pictures of the bed and give everyone a head up. Oh yeah, forgot to mention, internet is not free. There are computers in the lobby that guest can use, but there is a long wait and 3 out of 7 computers were down.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service, lack of maintenance and cleanliness are not what I expect from a Sheraton"”
Reviews.Author: rhinelegend
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for this particular trip mainly for its convenient downtown location. I am also a Starwood Preferred Guest. The first impression as we walked into the lobby was the inattentiveness of the staff. No one offered to help us with our luggage or even greet us, so we had to haul up our bags on our own. When we got up to our room, I did my quick assessment and there in the bathroom as I looked up was paint peeling off the ceiling. I called guest services to request a room change and they sent someone up to give us the keys to the room we were transferring to. Again, they did not ask us if we needed any assistance in moving our bags. That's when I knew that this hotel is not "service-oriented" and lowered my expections from that point on. I will not elaborate further on the other issues and faults concerning maintenance and cleanliness as it was a daily observance during our 5-day stay. Being a resident of Las Vegas, a frequent traveler, and after having stayed at numerous hotels all over the world including Starwood and Marriott properties, I can certainly say that this particular property has very poor service standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Najwa_Madrid
Reviews.Content: Thia hotel is one of my favorites to stay at in Toronto great location , restaurants and shoping with access to the Eaton Centen and the Bay Mall . rates i dont really look into them when i stay in this hotel and im a regular there this year i have have stay over 45 nigths in this hotel. the service is great and i recomened this hotel to every one who want to visit Toronto and stay Downtown# the staff very friendly and ready to help you in all u needs

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, its restaurant, "Traders" was not.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGourmet_9
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable rooms in an ideal location. Front Desk, Housekeeping, Bellmen, and Parking staff were all friendly and accommodating. In the hotel's restaurant, "Traders", we were seated, given menus and ignored after that. After twenty plus minutes we walked out. It was not busy, as there was only one other table with people for the waiter to take care of.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for pleasure, maybe conventions”
Reviews.Author: montrealbr
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beutiful lobby, the rooms are fine and clean. However, they have more than one building for rooms. I don't know if they have different building for different costs or for hotwire purchase, anyway, they offered me a little bit old bathroom and unconfortable beds. There are a lot of activities and business offices in the same building. We had a miserable night with a many noises and smoke smell. The parking is expensive (35 dollars a day). The swimming pool is half outdoor, so we couldn't use it because of raining. Actually, this hotel maybe is good for business or conventions but if you want a good rest and pleasure, go to another place.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences ever!”
Reviews.Author: Hogan66
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, I was really nervous to stay at this hotel. However, I'm not sure why everyone else had such difficult times and so many negative things to say. This was by far the best hotel experience we ever had! I booked the hotel through Hotwire for a really good rate. RIght after booking it, I called the hotel to ask to make sure we had a room with a king sized bed because my husband and I would be celebrating our anniversary. Not only was the woman I talked to very helpful and friendly, the hotel upgraded our room for free! The moment we got to the hotel, the staff did their best to make our anniversary magical. The man at check in greeted me by telling me happy anniversary, during our stay we were given a "gift" from the hotel to help us celebrate our anniversary, and then as we were checking out another man told me again that he hoped our stay was fantastic! We had club privileges so we were able to have breakfast every morning and snacks in the afternoon. The food was good and the employees were very friendly. The tour and information desk was excellent and always willing to help us find a good place for dinner. They always gave us a lot of options and they always knew the exact location and gave us great directions to get there. They were really knowledgeable about the area and a highlight of our stay. The hotel is in a great place in the city and getting the subway is really easy. We used quite a bit of public transportation to get to the zoo and to see Jersey Boys. It was easy to use and we felt very safe the entire time. It only cost $9 for the day and you could use any type of transportation (subway, bus, streetcar). Also, we parked across the street at the center for the performing arts (I think it is called) and it was $25 a day. Better than the $40 valet at the hotel. Overall, it was a great trip & we would 100% definitely stay at the Sheraton again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for conventions, otherwise look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Grotshops
Reviews.Content: This is a huge convention hotel. The meeting facilities and common areas are perectly acceptable, and hotel services are prompt and responsive. The accomodations are generic at best, and for the price (even at a group rate) were nowhere near what I would have expected. Stained carpets, peeling contact paper and an AC unit reminiscent of a 1960s Holiday Inn were hardly what a $239 room rate would connote. Room size was average. The A/C wasn't working properly anywhere in the hotel during a very warm summer week. Another pet peeve is having to pay $15/day for wireless internet. On the plus side, the pool and fitness facility were very good, and room service was prompt, food was well prepared and the meal price was OK. The location is also excellent for many downtown attractions. But if I return for something other than a convention, I'll stay at the Marriott Courtyard for $100 less per night.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: jicmont
Reviews.Content: I have already lived through a very pricey bed bug infestation in a former apartment, and I have become somewhat of an expert in knowing what to look for. Because of this, I am particularly leery of staying in hotels anywhere. Unfortunately, the Sheraton Centre Toronto seems to have a bed bug problem on its hands. I did my normal mattress and headboard search in my room and came across numerous black dots on the mattress corners. These are in fact the droppings of blood-fed bed bugs. There was also a discarded skin shell inside the white plastic corner protector of the mattress. Bed bugs shed their skin when they grow after feeding. After having pulled the bed away from the wall, I noticed a fine line of white powder running along the carpet where it meets the wall. This is probably an extermination or containment effort of some kind, perhaps diatomaceous earth. Since I was sharing the room with a friend, we immediately requested another room. The front desk staff was quite accomodating, excusing themselves several times. The second room, on the same floor, had all of the same signs. Exasperated, but late for a dinner appointment, we left, leaving our suitcases in the bathtub of the second room, and explained to the front desk staff that we would be back to discuss the issue. Upon our return, the lady at the front desk had alerted the manager, who came out quickly to meet us. He was quite friendly, though strangely he refused to admit that the hotel had a problem, even though I am well-versed in the signs of an infestation and asked several times if he was aware of the problem. Could this be for legal reasons? I even offered to show him the proof, but he said it was not necessary. I mentioned several times that I in no way wished to embarrass the hotel or alarm other visitors, but that I was unable to sleep in a room with bed bugs due to my former experience. The manager assured us that "housekeeping" had been made aware of the problem. He moved us to a third room in another (the other?) tower. The beds seemed clear of bed bugs or their droppings and I told the manager this when he called to check up on the situation. Unfortunately, I later discovered bed bug droppings and blood stains along the edge of the wall where it joins the carpet behind my bed. My collegue noticed more of the white powder behind his bed. Being as it was quite late, we decided to make due with the room since it was already the third that we had tried. At least the signs weren't in the bed, or at least on the exterior of the mattress. If you have never bed bugs at home, it is pehaps difficult to imagine the scope of the problem and the insuing stress and loss of sleep that follows. To avoid this problem to the best of your ability, I highly recommend keeping everything off of the floor in hotel rooms and for God's sake, don't put anything on the beds! I keep all of my bags closed on the suitcase stand in the bathroom, or even in the shower when not in use. Always pull the bed out from the wall and tuck in any linen that touches the ground. Lift the mattress and look for the bed bug's characteristic droppings: tiny black dots, like those from an ink pen. The black dots are blood from past meals and will smear if on a surface such as baseboards and wooden or metal bed posts. If an infestation is really bad, you might actually find live bed bugs just scurrying around. Upon returning home, one should wash all of one's clothing and store suitcases in large, sealed plastic bags if possible. I found giant Ziploc bags in New York which do the job quite nicely. Don't forget that, depressing as it seems, bed bugs can live for up to 18 months without eating blood. They just wait patiently for their next meal. I don't blame the hotel for the problem as a bed bug infestation has nothing to do with cleanliness or quality. I still feel obliged, however, to make this problem known to potential future customers so that they can take the appropriate preventive measures. There are several other reviews of this hotel which speak of much more horrific experiences than mine (i.e. live bugs on top of the bed). The staff was helpful with my complaints, but once a hotel of this size is infected, even on a small scale at first, it seems nearly impossible to fully control the problem without spending hundreds of thousands, if not millions, of dollars. Since the average person is still unaware of bed bugs, or doesn't seem to care until they start biting at night, it is unlikely that many hotel chains can or want to take the costly but necessary steps to eradicate this problem, including educating and advising their guests about safety precautions as well as being upfront about the hotel's bed bug infestation status. Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: alias720
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel through Priceline for 3 nights. We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel- without traffic it can take about 15 minutes, but at most, give it around 30-35 mins. The flat taxi rate should be $40 CAD- but our driver didn't have a meter (which we unfortunately did not check beforehand), and he charged us $49. We arrived at the hotel around 10:30pm. We were given a room with two double beds. Per another review, we requested for an upgrade when we checked-in. For $20 extra/night, we could have gotten a king bed. For $50 extra/night, we could have gotten a club level room, which included free breakfast and internet. The hotel was semi- full that weekend due to a dance competition. Check-in was uneventful. We decided to keep our room. Please note: there is a charge for internet; however, the lobby does have free wi-fi. It's under "the link" network- where you'll be asked to enter your name and room number.
