We were given a room in the Queen Tower- and unfortunately, the room smelled like smoke, and the vents were taped up. We did have a nice view from the Queen Tower. We requested another room (note: you'll have to go through "Guest Services" to get to the front desk), and they were able to give us another room, but in the Richmond Tower. The room was a lot better, and it did not smell like smoke, but the view wasn't the same (which was okay for us). One of the frustrating things about staying in the Richmond Tower was that the elevators were definitely slower than the Queen Tower elevators. The room wasn't as modern as it could be (in both towers)- which was surprising based on the the first impressions of the lobby, etc. Hotel Restaurant: We ate a late dinner at "Trader", the restaurant/bar on-site. Note: the kitchen closes at 10pm on Friday nights, so try to be there by 945pm (not sure about the hours for the other days). My husband had the fish and chips and I had the steak chilli- both were decent- very nice service. Location: This hotel is very close to a lot of attractions- we walked to the CN Tower (around 15 min), St. Lawrence Market, Yonge St, etc. The one nice thing about the hotel is that there is a "Tour and Information Desk". They were very friendly, and very knowledgeable. Note: You can buy tickets from the info. desk and avoid lines (e.g. CN Tower). Also, they can arrange tours for Niagara Falls (Please see separate review for Niagara Falls/Toronto Tours). Also, the hotel is not too far from the subway. Subway Note: You can purchase an all day pass for $9.00 total (with various combos: 1 adult and 5 kids or 2 adults and 3 kids- something like that!!). The hotel does have luggage storage and bell services. Note, there is also express check-out and a couple of computers set up for airport check-in and printing boarding passes. The staff was very friendly. Overall, the hotel was in a good location, the staff was friendly, and the room served its' purpose. We spent most of the day going around the city, and spending time in the lobby for the free wi-fi! For the price ($60/night) we paid, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A few issues but rectified via staff”
Reviews.Author: visceral_lizzie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights via priceline. It really was a busy time during my stay. A few downfalls were not 100% clean rooms, ie towels & sheets. And I was in a connecting room which someone seemed to be having a party in and the cigarette smoke was coming through to my room. I mentioned this to front desk and they upgraded me to a club level room with free breakfast for the last 2 nights. I didn't make a fuss and they were incredibly friendly and apologetic. The location is fantastic too - right near the Eaton Centre. The wifi in the lobby is touch and go so expect to not get great service. There was free popcorn & lemonade in the lobby - possibly for fathers day? Beware, every other sunday they appear to have a summer pool party for some 20-30 year olds. As a 22 year old myself who loves a good party, I did find the pool party just ridiculous. The music was loud & the party attendees were drunk and basically took over the pool. Don't expect to have a relaxing sunday afternoon by the pool, it is really crowded and surrounded by drunk smokers. I would visit this hotel again and found the customer service excellent. The elevators were quick to serve all 41 floors too. And the rooms were pleasant and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: KimbaKiara
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Centre is located right downtown which was great for sightseeing. The lobby was quite nice, with a nice waterfall and garden. The room was decent though not spectacular. Parking was very expensive at $40 per day. It was a bit too steep for me so I drove across the street to park at Toronto City Hall (Nathan Phillips Square Green P parking) at a rate of $12/day on weekend and $20/day on weekday.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: mtg13
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at a discounted rate from an online site for less than $90 a night. Even so we were treated wonderfully here. The hotel was full and we had only 1 double bed for our family of four. Without asking they upgraded our room to a parlour added some beds (which were incredibly comfortable!) and viola - we had a suite. Very nice with a perfect view. They also gave us access to the club lounge for breakfast since we were so "easy to accommodate". The kids received coloring books and stuffed animals. The pool was perfect for children with a large shallow end and water toys provided. The location was also an easy walk to most attractions and subway connections. The hotel's garden and waterfall provide nice atmosphere and the space allows the kids to get outside even if you are trying to settle down for the evening. Gym was large with many amenities. They offer refreshments in the lobby in the afternoon. All in all a great place to stay. Know though that this is also a popular convention hotel. So if you will be sharing space with those in attendance. Also the hotel restaurant is quite expensive (as were all of the restaurants we visited downtown). We loved it here. My kids were spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Go2Girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rm. 2236 at the Sheraton Centre Toronto on July 27-28, 2009 while in town for a wedding. I got a great rate (about $80 CAD) through Hotwire. This was the second time I have stayed at this hotel; I would have no qualms about returning nor about recommending it to friends. Our room featured a King sized bed, a leather club chair, a flat screened television, a chest of drawers and a small work desk. From the window, we had a view down to the third floor outdoor pool. The marble bathroom was spacious and sparkling clean. The hotel was quiet at night. The service at the front desk was friendly and efficient - we barely waited at all to check in, even though our stay coincided with the very busy Pride weekend. My only minor criticism of the room was that there were only shears on the windows; the heavy black-out curtains didn't close. Although I can say that I was tired enough by the time I returned to my hotel that the light didn't bother me at all. Also, if you stay, there is a public parking lot on Queen St. W. adjacent to the hotel which is much less expensive than the hotel parking. (We paid $12 for a whole day, compared to $30-ish charged by the hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “Our stay cannot be faulted”
Reviews.Author: Andrew99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned for a second stay in May 2009. We found that our first experience in 2008 was repeated. We had a really great time in Toronto and this was made possible by the Sheraton Centre Hotel. The location is really good. We do go everywhere on foot [plus me in my wheelchair] and found that we could get everywhere we wanted either overground or under the city as one of the 'moles'. The reception and lobby area is huge. My wife liked the rocking chairs that view into the gareden area. We met some really interesting local people there. The reception staff were efficient and helpful, as were the concierge and bell boys. They organised our cab back to the airport for us. The room we had was spacious with one queen size bed. The bed was really comfortable. The bathroom was easy to use and had a good level entry shower. Both bedroom and bathroom were clean and tidy and the room cleaner, whom we met regularly, was a happy and charming lady who worked so well to do her job well. The room was on floor 21 and we had a view of the CN Tower and just about saw the pool down below. We ate in the breakfast restaurant each morning and my wife enjoyed very large, hot breakfasts from the buffet. I, too, had the buffet, but kept with the cold options. We also had a couple of dinners in Traders. We found it to be good food, if a little pricey. I use a wheelchair and had no problems at all in this hotel. Thank you. We would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Vinit2811
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Queens Hotel is a class hotel great location great hotel very near to the indian geread street,great breakfast in and all great hotel.also got a superb lobby,i must say huge lobby,worth a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there to see "The Boss"”
Reviews.Author: familymanNewLiskeard
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights in May to see Bruce Springsteen. Fantastic location and price was excellent as we booked through Hotwire. Stayed in low rise section with a balcony facing courtyard with pond and waterfall. it was like having your own little oasis in the middle of toronto. Hotel gym was open 24 hours a day and all the treadmills have built in TV's. the only bad thing was that all the cardio machines face right into pool area and the people swimming have all the gym goers staring right at them. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was very nice. The bathroom was very small as the toilet was right beside the door, very cramped. Hotel connection to underground pathway was fantastic and made shopping and getting around on subway super easy. I would recommend this hotel to adults and couples, if you have kids, stay at the Delta as it is much more kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “So far.... not so good”
Reviews.Author: CMB001
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Sheraton Center Toronto through Hotwire for a family wedding. My family booked three rooms, and we are the first to arrive. Upon arrival we were informed that we would need to pay a $20 upgrade for a King Size bed. I have booked many times through Hotwire, and this has never been the case at any other hotels. We agreed to the $20/night charge, and were even more annoyed when we go to our â€œupgradedâ€� room. I am not sure when the last time the room was thoroughly cleaned. There were hairs all over the bathroom floor and tub, crumbs on the floor, and a chair stained with what looked to be someoneâ€™s bodily fluids. Gross! We called guest services and they did promptly send someone up to clean the room and exchange the chair. Feels a little better now, but the memories of news shows where they take the black light into hotel rooms are on my mind. Hopefully the weekend will get better, and that my family has a better experience than we are having so far.

Reviews.Title: “Great night at the Sheraton Centre”
Reviews.Author: melissarose88
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Centre with my boyfriend for one night. My brother is an employee of Starwood so we got the StarHot rate, making it a steal for one night. I have stayed here before and always thought highly of this hotel so I suggested it and as usual it was great. The rooms are very clean and quite spacious. The bathroom was clean and big enough for a hotel bathroom, so I'm not really sure why so many people complain about them! We stayed on the 25th floor and asked for a water view, which we got. It was only a partial water view because of the way the hotel is actually laid out, but it was still nice and we had a great view of the CN Tower. The food at the hotel is very good as well. We got a 50% discount on all food with the StarHot card, so we ate at Trader's. We also ordered room service which was amazing! The cheesecake was soooooo creamy - to die for. We got big breakfasts in the morning and they were also very tasty and substantial. There was really only one flaw with the stay. When we checked in we asked when the pool was open until, because our one main reason to stay overnight in a hotel (when we live in Brampton) was to go swimming! The lady at reception said 10. As we were finishing the check-in my boyfriend noticed a letter on the desk that said the pool would be closed from June 1-June 7, which was the time we were there. I asked the lady if the pool was even open and she told me she had forgotten it was closed. We could use the pool at the Westin but it was about a 25 minute walk away. I was quite upset when I got upstairs because I had a completely flexible schedule and could have gone downtown for the night anytime. I know that hotels have to close the pools for cleaning and such and have no problem with that, but if there had been any mention of the pool closure on the booking site I would have either waited until the pool was open again or booked in at the Westin. But there had been no warning and I wasn't even told upon check in. If we hadn't noticed the letter and asked the lady again, it's likely we would have gone to the pool later only to find that it was closed. I ended up calling the front desk to ask if there was anything they could do. I asked if we could possibly move to the Westin, which they said wasn't possible. They apologized for the inconvenience and offered to give us taxi vouchers to and from the Westin so that we wouldn't have to trek all the way there and back. I thought this was a pretty good offer! We took the cab to the Westin, swam as long as we wanted and then got another cab back to the Sheraton. Aside from the minor blip with the pool, the stay was great. Rooms are clean, comfortable - the beds are GREAT - and the service was friendly. The hotel definitely made up for the fact that the pool was closed by providing us with the taxi vouchers. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I will definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: pojaya
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night through a priceline booking. Location excellent, easy walk from Union Station, close to shops and restaurants, also longish walk to Chinatown/Bloor. We do hear the bell chiming, which can get a bit annoying. Got a room facing City Hall on low-ish floor. The lobby is very busy, almost like in a train station! Check in check out was pretty quick. The room itself was OK. Location of the TV was not ideal. The bathroom is really bad though, esp the location of the WC right against the door! Can be recommended if the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “If you booked with Hotwire, beware of Rude Treatment!”
Reviews.Author: riladon
Reviews.Content: I was booked this hotel with Hotwire. When I arrived at 11 pm, they told me there was no room left and they arranged me to stay in the living room of an executive suite which doesn't have a bed. They get me an extended bed which is so small that only a small child can fit in!! Then I complain to the Manager and tell them to get me a written proof that Sheraton can't give me a proper room and I would leave the hotel and go to another hotel. Of course, they did not give me the written proof, but offer me a STANDARD room with proper beds. Hey, were they told me there was no room left???? The Manager even compliment me with free internet and phone calls. But is that what they treat their guest? or just the guest book through Hotwire?

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap room, but nickel & dimed elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Andercoch
Reviews.Content: To begin with the room and the hotel in general was very clean, comfortable and the beds were fantastic. The elevators were fast, quiet, and smooth - we were staying on the 27th floor and found the elevators to be very efficient. The location is reasonable and many portions of the city are within walking distance. I got a fantastic price for this Sheraton on Priceline and was quite excited about the stay and the value. However after arriving we found other incidental fees to be quite expensive. The only on-site parking is valet parking - however you can park at a public garage on the other side of the street - and the parking is ~$45 CAD a day. We spent more money on parking than on the hotel room. There is no free internet access, it costs ~$15 CAD per day. Furthermore the bar and grill downstairs is exceedingly expensive, even relative to Toronto standards. We ordered room service for breakfast, which was quite decent - not bad at all but was not mind-blowing either. It too seemed to be pricier than what is typical for room service. Finally my bill had a few relatively minor charges - few dollars here, few dollars there - that I still do not quite understand (I think I got charged for using the TV to watch local channels). If you are using Priceline, or any other budget minded website, be aware that the incidental charges (e.g. parking and internet access) may blow away any money you "save" by staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Convenient Location With Some Minor Problems”
Reviews.Author: FleetingDasein
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Toronto Sheraton Centre for two nights during May 2009. I booked through Hotwire for only $60USD a night, so I was pleasantly surprised when I discovered the hotel to be the Sheraton Centre. I don't want to discourage other Hotwire/Priceline customers, but the discount price haunted me during my visit. After reading other reviews, Sheraton Toronto Centre does seem to differentiate between Hotwire/Priceline and full rate customers. If you booked at a discount price, do not expect a room in the upper floors with a good view of the CN Tower. The hotel lobby is magnificent. Check-in was fast, efficient but a little bit too impersonal. I was notified that I had booked through Hotwire, and that my room was in the 5th floor of the Queen tower overlooking City Hall. As the front desk gentleman told me, the room had a "decent" view. I was a little bit disppointed but I was tired and decided to head straight to my room. I got one of the newly renovated rooms. The room was well apointed and spacious. I noticed that there was some trash from previous guests in one of the bins. There were even some prescription pills left behind under the bed. I've had worse experience in other hotels around the world, and truth be told, I was quite content with me room. I just ignored these two inconveniences but I know most people wouldn't. Another thing that bothered me about this room is the fact that the flat screen television was not directly in front of the bed. My neck was already hurting from being on a plane for so many hours, and I did not want to make it worse by watching TV in such an awkward position. The bathroom was pretty comfortable but not very appealing in regards to the position of the toilet (right next to the door). The room was above average. If you want to compare it to other Toronto hotels, it is definitely better than the Delta Chelsea but nowhere near Intercontinental on Front St. Then, there's the charges. My partner and I were mixing drinks and needed a knife in order to cut a lemon. They wanted to charge us to use a knife from the restaurant. Then there are the charges most people are familiar with---It is $14.99 for high speed internet and $2.00 for every phone call. Suggestion: I was able to get free wireless internet in my room. So check for open connections before paying the exhorbitant fees. So far everything that I have written appears to be negative, but the Hotel is quite a good value if you are paying discount price. It is conveniently located and pretty close to everything downtown. There are many stores in the lower level of the hotel, so if you want a quick snack, you are less than 5 minutes away from a McDonalds. My favorite amenity was the huge indoor/outdoor pool and the hot tub. It is great to swim surrounded by tall buildings. Quite a surreal experience if you are not used to big cities. Bottomline, do not pay full price for this hotel and if you pay discount price, know what to expect. There are better hotels out there but this is the only one in the middle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: J_onthemove
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a quick one night through Toronto last month. What a great stay! I had a nice room overlooking the park area next door, which was great. Beds were ultra-comfy, and service was great. Got a great deal through Priceline to boot, so price was right. highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CaptinEO7
Reviews.Content: After extensively researching the most suitable hotel for our needs for our first trip to Toronto for 5 nights, we were more than satisfied with our choice of the Sheraton Centre. A very pleasant 20 minute taxi-ride from the Airport at around $40 takes you to the heart of the city & the hotel entrance. Admittedly this is not a particularly enticing entrance as it's located "under" the rest of the hotel but once inside we had a hassle-free check-in & both me and my fiancee agreed that it was the most pleasant check-in we'd had for some time, courteous, helpful & most importantly, quick ! Our room was on the 32nd Floor with stunning city views toward the CN Tower. Whilst hardly lavish or particularly snazzy, the room was very spacious & perfectly clean & modern. The bed, linens, A/C, Heating, safe, bathroom & shower were all perfect but the lack of a fridge was disappointing as hotel bar prices are very steep (as expected). The lobby was great although the huge stairwell/escalator area near the outdoor garden window was very dated due to the high density of shiny chrome - very 1980's Trump Towers ! Overall though it was a nice area to relax although internet points were usually very busy. The lobby has direct access to the amazing PATh system but the shops and food-places directly under the Sheraton are extremely dated when compared to much of the other facilities in this underground metropolis. It's still very convenient however. The location of this hotel is simpy perfect. Within walking distance of almost everything a first-time visitor could ask for (with the possible exception of the Royal Ontario Museum & Yorkville Area - about 45 mins or more perhaps ?). The PATH System makes everything incredibly accessible when either cold or wet & we felt very lucky to be able to walk all the way from the Rogers Center to our room without ever having to venture outdoors. There's plenty of great eating places within 10 mins of the hotel although we did struggle to find inexpensive breakfasts but that was probably just not looking hard enough. We did eat at Traders Bar one evening and whilst the food was adequate we soon wished we'd ventured out to the Keg Bar & Grill which is one block away and you get a far nicer experience, meal & value for money. Our friends stayed at the Fairmont which we could have gotten at roughly the same price as the Sheraton but we were glad we stayed where we did. Whilst the Fairmont is admittedly very impressive & has sumptuous public areas (including a link to PATH far nicer than the Sheraton) we felt the location combined with the modern and far more spacious rooms with a view outweighed the benefits of staying at the more well-known Fairmont. All in all a wonderful trip - great city, great fun, great choice of hotel for our needs & price.

Reviews.Title: “Best room I ever had for price”
Reviews.Author: jt9953
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five days, starting on Victoria Day weekend, booked through Hotwire for fifty three dollars US. Pluses - very fast check-in, waited about 2 minutes - excellent location, very close to shopping, numerous restaurants, subway, and street cars/buses - low price - 14th floor room in Queen street tower had panoramic view of city hall area across the street - very comfortable beds - very little noise from other guests, probably due to Victoria Day holiday - Tim Horton's coffee/donut shop (a personal favorite) less than 3 minutes from room. Minor quibbles - noise from elevator mechanism and clock tower that chimed on the hour, neither of which hindered my sleep - drain in shower slow, water ankle deep by end of shower - water shut off for repair one night from 1 to 5 AM (I was asleep throughout, so no problem) - free internet only available in lobby. As I said, these are minor problems - it's the best room I've ever had for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nmlsnf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for a week in May 2009. It was very noisy all the time, even through the night. Our first 2 nights, we heard a clunking sound all through the night. We thought it was some renos going on so we switched rooms. But the clunking sound persisted and was even worse in the second room. The hotel staff switched us into a room closer to the elevators. Why they did this when they knew we were staying for a longer period of time and we complained about the noise. Then I realized the clunking sound was coming from the elevators. On top of the noise from the elevators and people coming off the elevators late in the night, there was the rings of the bell tower across the street which was very loud. The showers were horrible, no pressure in the shower in both rooms. Also, the bathtub was grimy and not very clean. The toiletries were awful. The heating was switched off while we were there even thogh it was pretty cold at the time. When we complained, the staff was very rude and told us there was nothing they could do, saying it was warm, when in fact the previous night it got down to 2C. Don't eat or drink at the hotel, it's very expensive! The list could go on and on...the only thing going for this hotel is location. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No fun but convenient, comfortable, and functional”
Reviews.Author: CharlesV
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre in Toronto is located in the center of the financial district and is connected to the Path, the underground network of shops, food courts and passages that connects most buildings in the downtown core. It's very conveniently located for downtown business. The hotel itself is quite large and boasts a big lobby with a large contingent of helpful staff to cater to the traveler's needs. Service is generally courteous and professional, and very efficient (except for parking attendants -- see below) The rooms are spacious enough with a nice work area. Beds are comfortable and the bathroom is functional. I wouldn't call the rooms plush, cosy or trendy by any stretch of the imagination. Decor is bland with your typical basic hotel chain furniture and drab colors. The gym is quite large with more than enough equipment. The adjoining swimming pool is quite nice, half inside and half outside which makes for an interesting feeling when swimming outside in a snowstorm in the winter. The hotel has 3 restaurants but I've always only visited the sports bar due to the lack of interest in the menu of the other restaurants. Bar menu is very basic and food and drinks are outrageously priced as I've come to expect in this type of large hotel chain. Good thing is, being in the downtown core, there are a lot of much better restaurants just a few steps away from the hotel. Parking in the hotel is by valet only which is convenient when arriving but it takes a long time to get the car back (I've seen up to 20 minutes) so that's a pain. But there is a municipal parking just across the street under Nathan Philips Square which is connected to the hotel through the Path. The Club Lounge on the 43rd floor of the hotel offers a very nice breakfast buffet with breathtaking views of the city. Contrary to many other hotels including the Hilton just across the street where drinks are complimentary, they charge for drinks in the evening at the standard hotel prices. To sum it up, it's a decent hotel for a business trip but don't expect to be wowed.

Reviews.Title: “Back Once Again”
Reviews.Author: mhchipmunk
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling regularly to Toronto for the past 6 years and I've tried lots of hotels there but I always return to the Sheraton Centre. The location is fantastic - you can walk to everything - lots of great boutiques and restaurants on Queen street, most major tourist attractions, theatres, and Eatons Centre is just a couple of blocks away at street level and can be accessed directly from the hotel through the PATH network - great if you don't want to venture outside in Winter. There is also direct access to the subway through the Path. The service has always been great - I am a Starwood Member and am always greeted very warmly and welcomed back - check-in is always fast. The Club rooms offer great extra goodies and last time I stayed in one I was pleasantly surprised to see that internet access was complimentary - about time! The rooms are always spotless. Some are a bit worn in spots and the hallways could use an upgrade. All the rooms I've stayed in have had great views. But the beds are freaking fantastic... the most comfy beds I have ever slept in. I get so excited when I have a Sheraton stay booked because I know I am going to sleep like a baby. The restaurants are a bit pricey - especially drinks in Traders. But the buffet breakfast in the bistro, while pricey, is incredible and fills you up for the entire day - booking through Expedia often gets you two coupons for a complimentary breakfast buffet. yum! My favourite thing after the beds is the lobby. Fantastic for people watching, sitting and reading, using the computers or just socializing. My only complaint is on my last two stays, the rooms were far too warm and even when setting the temp to as low as it would go, the temp in the room never dropped below 25. Also, there always seems to be some kind of construction going on in the hotel - however it rarely disrupts my stays and it has improved the hotel. One tip, I have an SPG preferred business account number but I never use it - the rates are always more expensive than booking without it - even when using the hotel's website. I actually use my CAA card for a cheaper rate. That irritates me.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: big0llie
Reviews.Content: Visited the Sheraton 4 to 10 May and it lived up to our expectations from checkin, housekeeping, waiting staff, information desk, all facilities, cleanliness location its got the lot. We would definitely choose the SCH when staying in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “A few more things to know”
Reviews.Author: Can_Yankee
Reviews.Content: We pricelined this hotel for a one-week stay for leisure & family events. I spent an extensive amount of time reading hotel reviews about this Sheraton. The public parking across the street was sort of inaccurate on the reviews. While cheaper than the Sheraton, be aware. With NO in-and-out privileges, it is $14 for normal business hours, then starts a whole round of charges past that, $6 post-business hours to late night, then $6 for overnight. So our parking was $26 a day plus. It is reduced on weekends. We crossed the street to the hotel, and took the PATH. While I bid a low Priceline rate, with taxes, then Canadian taxes, it was another $20 per night. What I hoped for was an upgrade to club level. Smiling up the check-in clerk with my nice clothes on didn't work. She did suggest that the Sheraton was running a special to upgrade at $40 a night. The value is excellent, so we took it, since internet access alone would run $16 a night. We've stayed here before, so it was pleasant to be back. The view of the city (which I requested) was exceptional especially at night. The bathroom was quite small for two for a week, small sink space. A room with two beds (which I requested) also provides some more room. The doors and paint were a bit worn. Lots of small debris in our hallway on the 42nd floor. Quite surprising, but I suspect this hotel is having some problems. We were a couple of doors down from the Royal Suite, which did have a party going on with guests lingering till midnight. We just turned up the TV. Used the spacious gym everyday which was great. My husband felt the pool was filthy with a pool boy just dazing into space when not busy. The hotel needs to keep the pool clean while guests are in the vicinity. It is an indoor/outdoor pool, but with staff sitting up front not doing anything, it doesn't hurt to remove debris from the pool. The best part of this hotel stay, in my personal opinion, is CLUB Level access. The breakfast is exceptional, in an exceptional surrounding, and free. Lots of pastries, fruits, boiled eggs, yoghurt, lots of healthy options, and unlimited Starbucks and better quality coffee and espresso. With a breakfast like this, lunch is not necessary. Appetizers are equally well-done, again in a beautiful surrounding with floor to ceiling windows. You do get killed on the wine though. Two glasses of wine, the most reasonable on the menu, and you'll get a glass quarter-filled, ran $28, including the multiple Canadian taxes. With a spread like this, dinner is not truly necessary. For a 1-week stay, even with Priceline on the hotel and car, it turned out to be expensive. Toronto is not a cheap city, but we had a wonderful time. I would recommend this hotel if you can get a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: kitchenchemist
Reviews.Content: Comfy bed, spectacular view north on the 38 floor (so great at night, I left the curtains open), Starbucks coffee in the room, everything I needed accessible via PATH underground (including the Oreos when I didn't feel like putting my shoes on and the wonderful Hudson's Bay Company Department Store, which has a card shop, a grocery, and a gourment deli on the concourse PATH level), Everything in the downtown core is accessible by foot. Wifi in large lobby free to guests. I made it my afternoon break "living room" experience. Always helpful information desk right in the middle of the lobby. You could spend a vacation here and never go outside! The spa, however, left something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Grand lobby w several venues”
Reviews.Author: rileigh15
Reviews.Content: I was immediately impressed by the grand, multiple-level lobby upon entering the hotel. In the lobby, there are several restaurants as well as a shopping center. My room was high (34th floor) and all of the staff was super frienly at each encounter. I was a little annoyed at the lack of parking (the only hotel choice was $40 for valet overnight or to use a city parking garage), but what can you expect in a downtown area? The view from the room offered an appealing look at the nearby skyscrapers; I couldn't really see the lake, but I loved seeing the surrounding area lit up at night. The rooms weren't the most modern I'd ever stayed in (which is a direct contrast to the beautiful lobby!), but overall they were super clean, well-maintained, and a decent size.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay!”
Reviews.Author: B0710
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel outstanding! The hotel was very clean, nicely decorating, and had a wonderful location. We picked this hotel based on its central location to many surround attractions and it paid off. The view from our room (which was just a standard king size bed room) was excellent! We found that it was definitely worth paying a bit more for such a nice hotel with a great location. We went to Toronto primarily to visit the Hockey Hall of Fame, and the hotel was a great pick for that spot because we were able to take the PATH system during the wintry weather. We used the pool and hot tub while at the hotel, which were both very nice. The pool is half inside, half outside, which is different in the winter, but fun. We also used the free computer area to check a few things on the internet, that was very convenient to have. Other than that we did not use other amenities at the hotel. A few tips....we parked in a public parking (underground). It ended up only being $27 for our whole weekend trip, which was way cheaper than the hotel...I would recommend this. We also saved some money grabbing quick breakfast or lunch meals at the food court underneath the hotel. The PATH system was also very convenient for shopping. We also exchanged money right underneath the hotel as well, which was a much better exchange rate than at the hotel desk (which we had to do our first night because it was a holiday). Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: mrsR2311
Reviews.Content: We have visited Toronto two times and each time we have stayed at the Sheraton, it really is a fantastic hotel. The Sheraton Centre is on Queen Street West in downtown Toronto and is within walking distance of all the main attractions such as the CN Tower The Eaton Centre, bars and restaurants. The hotel has an indoor/outdoor heated pool, a gym, Spa, a secure car park, valet parking, room service, vending machines and ice machines (these are situated on nearly all floors in the hotel), beautiful gardens with water features, 3 restaurants and a bar. The room and the bathroom were very clean and the best thing about this hotel is the beds! They are probably the comfiest beds I have ever slept in. The Sheraton has 3 restaurants but we never ate in any of them. There are many good places to eat in Toronto that are very reasonably priced (I think the restaurants in the Sheraton are a lot more expensive). Eating and drinking in Toronto is quite cheap, but you do have to tip between 10% and 20% (if you get good service that is). The only complaint I have about the Sheraton is their bar (Traders). We went for a drink one night and found it really expensive. We didn't leave a very big tip because we didn't receive good service and when the waiter saw what we had left he laughed and told us we had to leave more! Apart from that though we have no other complaints and would definitely return to the Sheraton. Restaurants I recommend that are near the Sheraton are: Eggspectations, Sunset Grill, Baton Rouge and Everest.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great stay. Beware of LIMO SCAM!”
Reviews.Author: Moonsoon33
Reviews.Content: Greetings from the West Coast of Canada. I extended my business trip and decide to spend the weekend in downtown Toronto. After a very successful Priceline bid of $50 (US) a night, I was happily surprised with the Sheraton. (Previously - twice - I got the Westin Harbor Castle thru Hotwire.) After a quick, cheerful and painless check-in (despite a very busy Friday afternoon), I arrived in room 1546 - a great semi-corner room (with city and CN Tower views), nicely appointed furnishings, superb bed & linens... and, unfortunately, dated carpet and a few hairs in the bathroom. The hotel lobby is fabulous - a Saturday morning clown entertained the kids, great popcorn (free) to satisfy the pre-dinner hunger and a great city vibe. I had a great work-out in the gym and wished I had more time to experience the pool and another work-out. The gym is very spacious and has modern equipment. Swift and plentiful elevators kept the hotel guests moving up and down without much delay. The hallways are quite dated and need updating. One eye sore was the tray of dishes left in the hallway (outside room 1547) that was there when I checked in on Friday afternoon and didn't get picked up until late Saturday afternoon. Upon leaving the hotel on Sunday morning, a bellman stopped me in the lobby asking where I was going. When I told him the airport, he grabbed my bag (without asking me )and said that the limo service was cheaper than a taxi. He said the cost was $55 all inclusive. I asked him twice if that included everything, specifically tips. He said (twice) that $55 was all I need to pay the driver. Upon arrival at Pearson airport, the driver advised me that the price was $55 + $3 GST (tax) and tip was not inclusive. The drive rwould not budge (and not get my luggage out of the truck) until I paid him in full - despite my arguments that the hotel bellhop had advised me $55 all inclusive. The receipt had the company name Canadian Limousine Service , and - get this - there was no GST number on the reciept. CRA audit lead pending. This tainted my experience and stay at the Sheraton. I would suggest that the bellman was part of the scam and would advise those that don't want to be scammed to just walk out the lobby and hail a taxi (as there are plenty waiting in the driveway). I've taken the limo service from the Westin Harbor Castle and both times the bellman told the driver, in front of me, what the price is and that the price was all inclusive. I hope that Sheraton managment reads this complaint and investigates this limo company that operates with the hotel. The driver was also very intrusive (trying to find out if I owned property, how much it was worth, how big my family is, etc.). Great stay, very nice room, very central and friendly staff and vibe. Just stay away from the limo company and the bellman that are connected to the limo company. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “good service, good price, good view”
Reviews.Author: traintravelLondon
Reviews.Content: I had a great priceline price but was treated like a queen (so maybe there has been some learning from the less positive experience described below). Staff polite firendly and well-trained, room service fast and good, good views and very clean (in 2844 - thank you cleaning ladies)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality! Despite room issues”
Reviews.Author: cheapnclassy
Reviews.Content: hi at the time it was my fiance and i booked for thre days through hotwire. great rate 66usd. this hotel had the best ammenties great gym pool and restaaurants right downtown with an underground path that led to the eaton center. rooms- our first room had a draining problem bathtub and sink they kindly upgraded the room which was beautiful club suite spacious clean modern furniture although the room had no heat. the service was good because despite thes issues they could not move us again, they said but they did bring a portable heater and humidifier. the beds were very comfortable and there was internet acess per charge i would return only if iam staying in the club level because the rooms are modern and u have acess to club lounge free breakfast and happy hour evening snack! the restaurant in the lobby was more like a pub with pub food, the steak house connected was expensive but impeccable food and wine, there was also a foood court downstairs and shopping center!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location”
Reviews.Author: plymouth
Reviews.Content: Yet another stay at this hotel; why come back to this establishment having sampled several other hotels in Toronto? Well, it's about location. The Westin Harbour Castle is very pleasant, views on to Lake Ontario and so forth... but it takes a good few minutes to reach the nearest subway station. OK, other hotels stayed at, in the past, are near the subway system, but the Sheraton Centre is on the PATH and is near to so many 'obvious' tourist sights (for when not working) and has the catering outlets near the concourse...

Reviews.Title: “Sherton rocks”
Reviews.Author: justlogic
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location for Business and some cultural things. right on the subway and Toronto's PATH / underground network. Great hotel

Reviews.Title: “This hotel treats Priceline travelers as second class guests.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeard
Reviews.Content: This hotel has so many great things about it--the city's most central location, numerous facilities, a 2 acre garden with waterfalls, the country's biggest indoor-outdoor heated pool, and noteworthy highrise views of skyline and Toronto's iconic City Hall--that my check-in experience was an unfortunate and jarring contrast to the Sheraton's advantages. The front desk agent, Kristian, was determined to put me in a room with two beds despite my traveling alone. When I asked for a room with one king bed, he attempted to charge me a $20 per night upcharge. I wouldn't have it--but since the hotel has 43 floors, I asked for a nice view. Again, he was determined to give me the worst room he could. No rooms on the north side of the hotel, he told me--the north side overlooks City Hall and Nathan Phillips Square--only the room he wanted to provide, and a few others, none with views and all near the elevators. Seems that since I was booked through Priceline, I was relegated to the hotel's inferior rooms. He as much told me so, and not even pleasantly. Since I wasn't winning the argument, I went to my room 740. Not wholly unpleasant, it did have two beds with nice duvets, odd vinyl Burberry print wallpaper and drapes, and a view of the pool. Unfortunately, the bathroom had not been cleaned thoroughly--I found a rusty or bloody washcloth between the shower curtain and the wall that the maid missed earlier. As well, my safe was already locked, so I couldn't use it. I tried twice to leave messages for the general manager, and didn't get calls back. Finally, on my third attempt, I reached Carmela at the front desk who moved me to the type of room I wanted to begin with, and for my troubles, provided club access. The new room, 3111, was much nicer, and had a corner view of both City Halls. Neither room was huge, but this one had a working safe, and a clean bathroom. Nice bed too. The hotel's club on the 43rd floor is one of the nicest facilities I've seen like it anywhere. At one point, it was a rooftop restaurant. . .the stunning views of the skyline and City Hall remain, with a high ceilinged, well appointed space. Club guests enjoy a buffet continental breakfast, as well as hors d'oeuvres from 5-8 each evening (though drinks, and expensive ones at that, are extra. $11 glasses of wine, etc.) The fitness facilities are well appointed, and free to guests. The machines are adjacent to the pool. There is no hotel in Toronto with a more central location than the Sheraton. The subway--clean, efficient, well located--is a block away, and a train/bus combo gets you to the airport for $2.75. As well, the Queen Street streetcar runs right in front of the hotel, to take riders west to Queen Street West, an alternative shopping area, or east to The Beaches, a New England-style village with a lakeside boardwalk and cute shopping strip. Eaton Centre is just a block away, for noteworthy shopping. And the city's financial district is just in back of the hotel. So other than a rude desk clerk who shouldn't be in guest contact roles, and the housekeeping issues, this would have been a good stay. After I returned home, someone from the hotel contacted me to apologize, and invited me to stay at the hotel in the future. Nice attempt at recovery. That said, if a hotel is going to take bookings through Priceline or any other source, it shouldn't treat the guests poorly, or any differently from any other. If this behavior is encouraged by management of the hotel, Priceline shouldn't allow a hotel to participate.

Reviews.Title: “Priced higher than it can possibly live up to!”
Reviews.Author: Marcello74
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Sheraton Centre while attending a conference. Once I found it (see note below on signage), my front desk experience was great -- they were organized, polite and friendly, allowing me an early check-in with no attitude. My Standard King Room was modern, fresh. The bed and furniture were comfortable, including a leather club chair for reading/watching TV. Great flat screen TVs in the rooms, though no HDTV channels -- just HD movie options. HVAC controls in the room are new and great. My view was of the business district and the CN Tower...very nice. My room was not quite perfectly clean. There was a half-consumed bottle of water along with the fresh bottle when I arrived -- obviously looked over by cleaning staff. The bathroom wasn't quite as clean as I'd like, and there was not a working bathroom fan. I found the hotel restaurants and room service menus to be absurdly priced. I did find the food I ordered to be good, though the trays were a bit bare (no ketchup or steak sauce, for example) and the service fantastic and friendly. At that price, though, I'd expect no less. The conference amenities (including food) were well tended. My only complaint about the hotel -- aside from the ridiculous pricing -- is that there's very little directional signage, and since it's a very big place, a person needs help. By day three I was still getting waylaid down the wrong hallways. For such a big conference hosting hotel to be short on signs is odd. Consider that it took over 10 minutes to locate the check-in desk when I walked in the first day! I found that staff were a bit scarce in the main parts of the hotel. Cleaning staff in hallways were friendly, but in the lobby, it was hard to find a friendly face beyond the registration desk.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: DKK031
Reviews.Content: Had a very good stay at this hotel recently. From check in to check out, everything worked very well. The room was a good size for us. The bathroom was adequate. The air conditioning was rather noisy though. We normally switch off the ac anyway, but this was even more reason to. Foyer is well laid out. We made use of the in house bar/restaurant on our first evening, which was a God send as we arrived at around 7pm and were tired from the trip. We made use of the breakfast facility, but after the first day we found a good breakfast place (Over Easy) which was very good and much cheaper. The staff were friendly and efficient. The Concierge was most helpful! The hotel goes down directly into the PATH system, which I can imagine is excellent during the winter! Location of the hotel is excellent. You wil find yourself within good walking distance to all areas. Although a little bit further away, Chinatown is maybe a Â½ hour's walk away- Downtown is literally around the corner. The Entertainment area is a pleasant walk away, and to the Waterfront is 20mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: veggielovr
Reviews.Content: I picked the Sheraton because of its great location and amenities. It truly is an amazing hotel with world class facilities. I have stayed at other Sheraton hotels and this one is one of the best. I loved that I was able to access the PATH (underground walking) system through the hotel, and that I was across the street from the Osgoode subway station. I had business meetings in North York and getting there was extremely easy. The Queen St. trolley also runs in front of the hotel, with closeby stops. The trolley makes it easy to get down to the fashion district easily - which helped b/c I wanted to do a bit of shopping while in Toronto. (Keep in mind that most shops do not open until about 11am or noon... just in case you need to get some shopping done before you fly out.) I also found a great cafe or two in the Fashion District (I would recommend Greenavi). The room I stayed in was nicely decorated , though I noticed that my room lacked a fridge. I also had a room facing toward Queen St. and city hall -- nice view, but next time I would request a room facing the other side. The bells in the city hall clock tower went off every hour and my first night was very restless (as I woke up every hour, on the hour). I would say that the staff were helpful, but no one went out of their way to make my stay overly enjoyable. Most are friendly, but the couple of times I asked for information at the *Information Desk* I dealt with a woman whose dour expression and personality made me question the hotel's ability to properly place their staff. All in all, the stay was good. Expect to pay through the nose for any room service or extras.

Reviews.Title: “Another Nice Stay at the Sheraton Centre”
Reviews.Author: george00
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sheraton Centre Toronto 3-4 times per year and have always been satisfied. I recently stayed there over Easter weekend when they were having a great sale. The location is great. It is close to the Eaton Centre and subway line. If the weather is bad, you can walk undergound in the PATH under the hotel which connects to other parts of downtown. Our room was clean and in good repair. The colors are mostly in the beige family which can be a bit boring I recommend parking across the street at the city hall parking garage. The only negative is that internet is $14 unless you are on the club floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for health conscious travellers looking for a great deal in the City”
Reviews.Author: COCOFromOttawa
Reviews.Content: Toronto hotels are hurting these days and this Sheraton is one of many offering bargain rates in a great downtown location. What separates it from the bunch though are the fantastic workout facilities, huge indoor/ outdoor pool, and lovely breakfast on the airy Club Level on the 43rd floor overlooking the city. Rooms are decent with great beds and bathrooms. Service is more on par with a 5 star hotel. It's friendly and conscientious -- on our stay a minor issue was followed up on immediately and comprehensively. A good choice for a business traveller or a family visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: flyingpig11
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Sheraton. Overall, the hotel was an excellent experience. We were upgraded to a club room, looking north over City Hall and northern part of the city. The room was nice, and very clean. We were given access ot teh club lounge whcih is on the 43rd floor, with spectacular views both north over the City, and south over teh downtown and CN tower and Lake Erie. We are a continental breakfast at the club lunge and had appetizers there as well. Everythign was of fine quality. It was nice to get a good coffee at a hotel, and in teh club lounge, starbuck was complementary. As was espresso and cappucino. The lobby was very nice and soothing. The pool was great for our family. All of the service people were fantastic. Only minor complaint, but just being picky. 1. I think the rooms with double beds could fit queens. (seems to be a trend elsewhere). I would absolutely stay here again. Our rate was tremendous. I never felt crowded. Our room was clean, everyone was friendly. Enjoy it. One hint, parked across the street in City Hall garage...$24 for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “FAN-tastic”
Reviews.Author: danioko
Reviews.Content: It has to be said that the Sheraton Centre, Toronto has a very unique place in my heart - I LOVE IT!! FANTASTIC. As soon as we arrived we were amazed by the size of everything! Once inside the lobby we were like children in a theme park, amazed by the open plan reception area, positively bustling with like minded travellers and business personnel. From the door staff, to the receptionists and the house keepers to the bar men, everyone was very friendly and greeted you like friends, very personable and enjoyable experience. The room was lovelly and the view over Nathan Phillips Square, from the top floor was supurb! I have never (HONESTLY) slept in such a comfortable bed in all my life. People usually say there is no bed better than your own, in EVERY case other than this, that would be right! My only moan, and that is at a push would be that the bathrooms could reflect the rest of the hotel, they seem some what dated and in a way, forgotten. Still I spent no extended time in there so it did not matter. I return to Toronto on the 18th April for 2 weeks, this time on a business trip and I have twisted the arm of the accounts department to allow myself and colleagues to stay here. I truly hope the trip will be as memorable this time around. My colleagues have never visited Canada before and this will be a special first time, I whole heartedly trust the Sheraton will be a large part of this. Thanks for a great trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “It Was Average All Around”
Reviews.Author: reviewit24u
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in March 09 for leisure. I selected the hotel based on the favorable reviews here, but found that the hotel was average and definitely not deserving of 4 or 5 stars. Iâ€™m American, so perhaps it is luxury by another countryâ€™s standard? Anyway, it has a luxury lobby and a few very expensive restaurants, but the rooms are dated; our first room was changed because of a plumbing issue due to old fixtures, and the second room had a heating issue. This hotel was packed with conventioneers during our stay and is definitely meant for conventioneers and business/weekend travelers; it is not well-suited for families with children or leisure travelers. Many amenities for travelers are missing, such as a mini-fridge, excursion pamphlets in the lobby, cheap eats, no free wireless, no free fitness center, no continental breakfast, no free local calling, etc. There is a charge for everything â€“ local calls are over $2.00 each. I found the front desk staff very curt and unfriendly and the tour desk didnâ€™t offer any advice in terms of sightseeing or maps. We also had our wake-up calls arrive 35 minutes late on 2 separate days (one on a departure day), so they are not reliable. The pillows are terrible â€“ they give you about 4-5 per bed, but they are very hard to sleep on. There are some pluses though â€“ the hotel in is the PATH â€“ with direct access to many shops and food courts. We didnâ€™t even have to leave the PATH for one entire day. For all other attractions the hotel is within a 30-40 minute walk. The water is boiling no matter what time it is and you donâ€™t have to wait a second for the temp. to hit boiling, or freezing. The maids did a fairly good job and were helpful. It was an average hotel all around but I wouldnâ€™t stay here again; Iâ€™d prefer a hotel that offered more things for leisure travelers and would suggest as some alternatives: the Fairmont Royal Oak, Strathcona, Radisson waterfront, or Super 8 in Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Theatre Package Great Value”
Reviews.Author: m0m2b0yz
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for a girls' getaway in March/09. We booked the hotel through the Mirvish Theatre Package. Great rates, includes tickets (we were right up front, tickets usually would have been $200.00), dinner and our room, including taxes, for $303.00. Absolutely no complaints about the package. The menu choice is limited with the package, but all good choices and the food was excellent. (Drinks, of course, are extra.) For booking, check out the show you want to see and check for the package rates. We were worried after booking over some newer reviews claiming uncleanliness and bugs. We had no complaints whatsoever. It was obivous our room had been recently redecorated and CLEAN!!! The staff was friendly and helpful. The lobby is beautiful with the waterfalls. The location is PERFECT. After checking out, the front desk will hold your luggage for you until you want to retrieve it at no charge. This way, we were able to walk to shopping and retrieve our luggage before going home late that evening. An excellent service. We parked in a nearby parking garage after reading suggestions on TripAdvisor. No complaints. Taxis were immediately available at the front entrace to take us to our shows and the front door staff is eager to assist with this. If you are not wanting to spend a lot on breakfast, don't eat at the hotel. Walk through the PATH system although you will find mostly things like Tim Horton's & McDonald's. All in all, a very nice hotel at an excellent rate and EXCELLENT location. Would definitely go again. Oh, and the Spa offers excellent massages!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JulienF
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 2 nights at the Sheraton Center Toronto, 2 weeks ago and I was very happy of my stay since this hotel is right on Queen Street, 2 minutes from Osgoode subway station, right in front on the City Hall, near Eaton Center. Breakfast buffet was good. Swimming pool was great since it half inside and half outisde. The rooms are ok. I recommended for the people who wants to be downtown Toronto, near of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff made it right”
Reviews.Author: Librarianone
Reviews.Content: My wife, baby daughter and I arrived for a weekend stay on March 13th - booked a nice suite to relax and enjoy ourselves - we soon found ourselves on a floor filled with convention people, Ont high school teachers to be exact - drunk, disorderly, rude and noisy - unbelievable! By 12:30 a.m. I had called hotel security three times to do something about the major party in the hall. My final call I said my next step was to call police. Next day hotel staff did the right thing - by providing us with a new upgraded room, wine and various other upgrades. They saved the reputation of the hotel as did room service and house keeping staff - However the night staff should have arranged this before I had to ask. The weekend was 50% saved by attentive hotel staff on the Saturday morning....What we learned - always ask if you're going to be sharing a hotel with convention folks - and teachers have much to learn, their behaviour was beyond belief.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: rust0r
Reviews.Content: Close to shopping malls and ice skating, great choice of places to eat

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Kateman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at the heart of downtown with a 5 minute walk to the Eaton Centre. We loved practically everything about the hotel. Parking is expensive at 40 dollars per night but you can park across the street for a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Consistancy is a good thing.”
Reviews.Author: BruceHToronto
Reviews.Content: Did another annual over-nighter here recently and the hotel remains a good deal. Kids still love swimming outside in the heated pool. Valet parking was very slick. Reception was fast. Beds very comfortable and they give you a ton of pillows. Big flat-screen TV a nice addition. Very convenient to all the shopping. [ Eatons Centre to the right and Queen St. west to the left ] All the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: dreaming_in_colour
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire and had a fantastic getway with the family! We were able to check in at 11m and the first room we received was overbearingly hot as A/C is not on in the building at this time of year and the room received direct sun all day. As my husband has asthma and the heat really bothers him, when I explained this to the desk staff, they made another room ready and happily moved us right away! Rooms were nice and clean and beds were very comfy. The pool was very nice, clean and warm. You can;t beat the location of the hotel. I do again have to note the friendliness of the staff. Everyone from front desk, to housekeeping, to management were warm, genuine and just added to a great stay! Wonderful experience and can't wait to go back! Making plans to bring my daughter and a couple of friends for a weekend stay of shopping and swimming for her birthday. Wouldn't have it anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Reliable quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: ny501
Reviews.Content: I ended up at this hotel through Priceline, which is a surprise since most of us end up at the big hotel on the lake all the time, when using Priceline. This hotel is located fantastic and is in great condition. Considering its size I found service personal and friendly. The internet corner in the lobby that I see at more and more Sheraton hotels these days is a fantastic invention that certainly adds value to your hotel stay. The room was large, comfortable but the decor and colors are horrific, especially considering the fact that this is becoming the standard decoration scheme at Sheraton. What's up with the colors and this ' country' style at an urban, business hotel, BIG mistake off the interior designers. I was also totally put off by the fact that there was no mini bar in the room. This is shockingly bad, the front desk staff member told me "you stayed in a standard room", I think she meant to say: " you stayed in a Priceline room". If this is 'standard' I suggest to downgrade this hotel to 2 stars. On a more positive note: I used the gym which offers some of the best equipment of any hotel in the area and although the architecture of the pool area comes close to 'your local high school gym' it was pleasant enough to use.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: Silverain54
Reviews.Content: 3 friends and I stayed at the Sheraton downtown by the Eaton Centre for the second time. Both times I booked off Priceline for a GREAT price!! We received a room with 2 double beds (this is what we wanted) and our room was on the 14th floor and had a view of the pool and the CN Tower. DH used the gym, hot tub, and pool and was very happy. Check in was easy and we parked for $18 for 24 hours in the City Lot (entrance across the street from the hotel) and used the PATH underneath to get to the hotel lobby. We also used the PATH to get to the Eaton Centre which was a 5-10 min walk. The room did not have a fridge, whereas other hotels in downtown Toronto offer this but the room was clean and comfy! I hope I am as lucky on priceline again to stay here for my next Toronto visit.

Reviews.Title: “The best meal of my life!”
Reviews.Author: JupieJune
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at the Sheraton Centre with another couple after placing the winning bid in the CHUM FM charity auction. We were treated to superb service, a spectacular meal and a wonderful room. Anyone looking for a unique and delicious dining experience should book the chef's table. Executive Chef Michael Picken is a charming, brilliant, cullinary genius. Not only did he create a meal worthy of poetry, but he was a warm and attentive host. Raj was a fantastic waiter as well. I am sure there are at least a few other people who were responsible for how well the stay went. A big thank you to them as well. We checked in and found a bottle of icewine along with a plate of beautifully dipped strawberries, cheese and honeycomb as well as artisan crisps waiting for us in our room. Shortly after our arrival we received a phonecall asking if everything was satisfactory and if there was anything we needed. We enjoyed a quick swim in the indoor/outdoor pool then dressed for dinner and met Chef Michael Picken and the general manager (whose name, forgive me, has escaped my memory) in the lobby. After a brief tour of the kitchens, which included a stop for hors d'oeuvres and champagne, we were shown to the chef's table for dinner. Start to finish the meal was delightful. Raj is a waiter who knows how to make his guests comfortable without being smothered. He is the perfect blend of friendly chat and quiet efficiency. To everyone at this fien establishment, Thank you. It was a stay to remember.

Reviews.Title: “TO's party central hotel”
Reviews.Author: jurajl
Reviews.Content: Pretty average Sheraton with the exception of the 43rd floor lounge - which has a stunning view. Be aware that this is known as a party hotel for locals, since it right adjacent to the nightlife district, so expect marauding teens in the pool areas and lobby, late night parties and beat up rooms. I experience a fire alarm early in the morning (apparently this is considered fun by some of the pubescent guests) and found the rooms fairly utilitarian. Unless you get a good deal (i.e. below $200 a night) I would choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Functional, and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RealTimeTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a suprisingly good hotel for its massi ve size. I was checked in with the highest level of efficiency I have had at any hotel in my life. This hotel is working hard in making its lobby a social gathering spot with its Starbucks, work desks and comtemporary setting. I would suggest visitors requiest a renoveted room, they are quite nice and very comfortable and well lit. The in-room coffee is very nice as is the big flat screen TV. My only complaints are being charged $12 for a glass of beer, plus tax and tip. There is no WIFI in the rooms so you must work at the large desk. The desk chair is not very comfortable if you spend a long time on the computer. The comouter cable is very short so you are somewhat limited in moving your computer around the desk. It is very hard to tell what diining in the hotel belongs to the hotel and which are outside tenants. "Steaks" was very disappointing and like other Toronto restaurants, they seem to be in a competition who can charge the most for a steak. My steak was no great value, flavor or taste for $34. And then evertyhing else is extra. And you cannot charge your dinner to your room account. A glass of beer in their pub, Traders, was horrifically expensive...$12, plus tas and tip. The pool area should be receiving a mini-facelift soon, which is a good thing. This hotel is big; but,it is functional and well located in midtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: dougie-w
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire, paid $51 per night and can't imagine getting a better deal. The young man who checked me in was very friendly and accommodating, so I asked for and got a room on a high floor (the 27th) with a direct view of the CN Tower and a partial view of Lake Ontario. My room had one, queen-size bed; I was told I could upgrade to a king for an additional $20 per night, but since I was traveling alone the queen was fine. I made ample use of the hotel health club and hot tub, though I wasn't brave enough to try swimming into the outdoors using the indoor/outdoor pool. I also took advantage of the free wi-fi in the lobby and enjoyed receiving the complementary copy of the local paper every morning. The hotel's location is fantastic: three blocks from one subway station, just one block from another. A short walk through the PATH tunnel system (very handy during the winter) takes you to the Eaton Centre mall and The Bay department store.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs beware on the 15th floor”
Reviews.Author: Cha0s
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 15th floor was infested with Bed Bugs. We went out for dinner and came back to find a bug crawling across the covers of one of the beds and another across the bathroom floor. We didn't know what type of bugs they were so we called the front desk. We were offered to be relocated to a different room (which ended up not being as nice as the first room), but we took it to get away from the bugs. We were not warned the bugs could be bed bugs and we were not offered any advice on how to deal with our possessions that had been left in the room while we were at dinner. It took three days before the hotel called us to notfiy us that the bugs in our room had been bed bugs. By that time we had already returned home. To top the whole situation off, the wake up call will requested was never received and we missed the free breakfast we had been offered as compensation for the bugs in the first room. If it is in my power, I will never stay at a Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Everything you need for Toronto fun.”
Reviews.Author: HarleyGump
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy the Sheraton. Can be booked cheaply through hotwire. Close to shopping, theatres, dining, nightlife. Quick check in-out. Pool is great for the kiddies.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wileyc0y0te
Reviews.Content: This is a great, classic downtown hotel that had all of the amenties you'd expect of a hotel of this caliber. Our one complaint was that we booked with Hotwire and while we know you can't specify the type of bed you want, it didn't help that the person that checked us in seemed to take delight in giving us a room with two small beds. Not only were the beds too small for two people, most college dorms have beds of better quality than what they wanted us to sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best thing”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn99
Reviews.Content: This huge hotel was full of tour parties and the lobby felt like Grand Central Station. The check-in was efficient, there is a good choice of restaurants but the size of the hotel made it all feel rather impersonal. The best thing about the hotel is its central location - everywhere was within walking distance. Judging by our room on the 19th floor the hotel is a little tired. Indeed, we had to complain about the cleanliness of the room, but the manager did upgrade us to club level. The club lounge on the top floor was comfortable with excellent views and a good choice of food. However, the wine was expensive for a very small glass!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, large comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: lomejor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night only, but had a great stay. Check-in was quick and I was up in my room within 5 minutes after arrival. If you are coming from Toronto Pearson Hotel and do not have access to a car, ride the Airport Shuttle Express (book tickets online for a 10% discount). It is cheap, clean, and will drop you off right at the hotel. Booked a "King Suite" which had a couch with a pull-out bed and a king size bed with very soft, comfortable pillows. There were 2 large flat screen tvs, 2 desks, very comfortable leather chair. The room had 2 large windows with a view of Toronto and the CN Tower. The room has a mini bar/refrigerator and some snacks. The prices of everything are very high, for example $5.00 for bottled water. Don't use any of the products. Just take the elevator down to level "C" which is the level of the Toronto PATH system. This is what makes the hotel great. There are many stores to buy snacks, meals, or beverages. There is a shopping area in the PATH 1 block from the hotel called "The Bay." I found a whole case of water, 12 pack (same exact bottles as in room) for $2.99 CAD. So take a look in the PATH before you pop open something in the room. Note: While walking the PATH I noticed that many stores and restaurants were closing around 6:00 PM, so make sure to get down there before the stores close. The hotel did have a restaurant, large pool, and huge lobby. Overall, it was a good hotel with many services available. The location is perfect and if you want to explore Toronto, no matter how cold or hot it is outside, this is the place for you. Prices are a little higher, but you have everything you need within a 1 block radius.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs beware on floor 33”
Reviews.Author: faithtravel
Reviews.Content: I was on floor 33 and the room I had was infested with Bed Bugs it was horrible . I actually saw the bugs jumping off my clothes . BEWARE , I had bites all over my stomach and Back and they moved me and got me medication but the damage was already done I could never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “alright ....have had a better stay....”
Reviews.Author: giants86
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend, with the family. Were told the hotel had a conference in house , that was why we were put in the Richmond tower. That was oaky, except the pool is on the main tower,so with having young children we had to cross many areas to get to the pool. The room was on the fifth floor, which is looking tired and run down. The room was not clean as always, and the heater made a terrible humming noise all night. Also on the same floor was a bunch of sports teams which kept us awake until 3:00 am, with their party. What made the trip okay was the breakfast buffet and the room service, which was excellent. I think this property needs to evaluate its cleaning procedures for their housekeeping department, being the Sheraton Centre. Would recommend this property for its location and food.

Reviews.Title: “City Trip Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Shahbanoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for almost a week during a city trip to Toronto and I am sure I ll be back and will stay at Sheraton Toronto Center as it is not only centrally located and provides easy acces to most of city's attractions but also is a good starting point for those who want to do some shopping at Eaton Center or Hudson Bay Plaza etc. And the Lobby of the hotel provides guests a lovely garden with a waterfall as well as coffee corners, bars and bistro's that makes you really feel being home and close to all that your heart desires. Don't want to make your own tea or coffee in the room, just go downstairs and order your coffee/tea with different flavours.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: MorayTraveljunkie
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel we stayed in during our Canadian tour. The transfer from Niagara took 2 hours instead of the one and a half anticipated due to traffic but our room was ready and the registration smooth and speedy. We were offered an upgrade for an extra $100 a night. This consisted of a room above floor 25 (we were already on floor 24 which was quite high enough for me), full breakfast (which we don't eat) and free access to the pool and gym which I didn't think we would have time for having only two days and a long itinerary, so we declined. The reception area was huge with lots of comfortable seating, computer access and tables to work at. A large enclosed patio garden on several levels with waterfalls and pools could be seen through huge glass panels in the reception area. I forgot to explore the swimming pool area which I read about when we came home. I wish I had seen it as it is supposed to be the largest indoor/outdoor pool in Toronto. Our room was spacious, clean, well furnished and above all light with a super open view over a square which meant we could see over the other buildings for miles. What a lovely change from our previous hotel where the room was dark and our window looked straight into the window of the next building. Everything was spotless so it was a surprise, on retiring, to find the previous occupant's chewing gum still parked on the bedside clock! With so much to do in 2 days we were out most of the time and didn't eat in the hotel but we did have a drink in the bar on our first night. Wow! The bill came to over $20 for a pint of beer and one small Baileys. On our last day I popped into a little shop at the hotel entrance from the PATH system to buy 3 postcards. I was in a hurry as I paid and got my receipt and it was only as I started to write the cards in the reception area while waiting for our shuttle that I realised I had paid $7 for 3 small ordinary cards! The PATH system is a series of underground shopping malls all linked and stretching for 27km (17miles). Great if the weather is wet and cold and super fun to navigate. I loved the fact that we could get back to the hotel when it rained without ever going outside on the street. Coming from a rural area where shops are few and far between this was heaven. With our stay in Toronto limited, the staff at the excursion/tour desk were brilliant and we booked a city tour, harbour tour and entrance to the CN tower on an all inclusive reduced ticket. Another tip I got from a person who gave us directions was that if you want to eat inexpensively and well, but wish to avoid the fast food outlets, head for the theatre district. We did this and were delighted with the choice and value to be had. Canadians are lovely people I was beginning to find. You have hardly got time to be lost before they are offering to help!

Reviews.Title: “Fading...”
Reviews.Author: Dr.Mom67
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 has stayed at this hotel before, and in fact, I have reviewed this hotel before, positively. It has been more than a year since we were last there, and I find that things have slipped. We had a courtyard view room which seemed old with peeling paint, and (alarmingly) a space heater. The night wasn't too cold, so we didn't need it, but I wonder what happens when it gets cold? There was a full garbage bin outside our room when we arrived and it was not emptied by checkout time. My kids have always loved the indoor/outdoor pool, an attraction in the winter because it is neat to swim with the snow all around.
