However, it does get cold and it is nice to hop in the hottub to warm up. Suddenly there is a new rule that no children under age 12 may enter the hottub no matter who is supervising. (complete with pool police to enforce the rule!) Kind of an ugly surprise when you are all cold and soggy. Buffet was still pretty good on Saturday morning. Service at Traders for cocktails in the evening was pretty slow, although they weren't busy. It isn't a bad hotel, just not as good as it was. I think the management has to raise the standards for housekeeping and maintenance. Hotel rooms in Toronto are expensive, and clients deserve more for what they are paying.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Centre - Needs Renovation!”
Reviews.Author: zanev
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Sheraton Centre after catching a hockey game. The hotel is in desparate need of renovation. We were on a club floor. Our first room was brutal. The washroom door didn't close and the washroom fan was so noisy you couldn't even hear the TV. We were switched to another room and the toilet didn't work. They provided quick service to move us and repair the toilet, but these things should not happen in the first place. The overall decor is drab, the heating/ac system is old. Nice flat screen TV's, but everything else in the room felt worn and dated. The pool/workout area was OK but again felt dated. Common areas (lobbies, etc) are nice and the location is great with underground access everywhere downton including the ACC and Eaton Centre. When parking, park in the City Hall underground lot. It is cheap and connects underground to the "path" and hotel on the 1st level, south end. Club floors get hors d'oevures and continental breakfast in the club room which were OK but not worth paying extra for. Will not recommend until they revamp the rooms or drop the price a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Casserole
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms at the Sheraton Centre for December 6th. I requested connecting and was happy to see that our request was met with 2 connecting rooms on the 12th floor of the Richmond Tower. We overlooked City Hall, Nathan Phillips Square and Queen Street. The location was very convenient to shopping at the Eaton Centre just down the street and to the Elgin theatre on Yonge St. where we saw a show. Rooms were clean and comfortable, the only minor negatives were the windows were a little grimy on the outside and a couple of the lamps did not have light bulbs. We had breakfast at the Bistro on Two and it was a very good buffet. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice views.”
Reviews.Author: Carpe-Dium
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton Centre on a great deal we found on gtahotels.com ($132 per night). Whilst the offer was available only on the twin rooms we took a chance, and on check in the lady at the desk let us change to a king room for no cost. This is a very large and busy hotel, with lots of amenities. The location is great, you can walk internally (using the underground system) to the Eaton centre, and the theatre district & subway station are both very close. Free internet stations in the lobby for guests, though is a shame that they scrimp on the printing and charge that to your room. Overall great stay, great location, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: geoprincess
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there. Our first room was FILTHY and felt like there was an overall layer of grime on everything (Room 1843). The hallways were full of crumbs and dirt and left over room service trays. The heater in the room was as loud as a vacuum cleaner. The chap at check in had an attitude as well. Managed to get switched to another room on the 28th floor -- this one was much better. Would I recommend this hotel to others? Probably not, considering how expensive their rack rates are. There are better hotels around for the same price (eg King Eddie or even the Sutton Place Hotel which we thought was pretty good, all things considered.)

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel: Good value, well located”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be located so that we were closeby to some sights that were walkable, and the Sheraton seemed ideal. It was. We were assigned a club level floor room (#4035) as we are club members (there are 46 floors). The membership also includes continental breakfast except it's temporarily being served in the 2nd floor restaurant (Bistro On 2) instead of on the 43rd floor. We also were able to get complimentary bottled water in our room. There was a coffeemaker with Starbucks coffee included also; I believe this is standard for all rooms. Our room had a view onto the Nathan Phillips square and ice skating rink as well as the old city hall building. The room itself was a good size with the typical desk and chairs. The Sheraton Sleeper Bed was very comfortable. The bathroom, however, could use some updating even though the marble sink and countertop were nice. Staff were generally helpful, professional although I suggest that the concierge staff members (apparently there were the same two people on duty during our day visit) become more familiar with the hours of operations for recommended restaurants. We were there on Boxing Day weekend and were told that Fune Japanese Restaurant a few blocks from the hotel was open. It was not. Therefore, we wasted our time walking there. Location-wise the hotel is good if one likes quirky as well as chain shop shopping as the hotel is on Queen St. W. It's also attached by the PATH system to The Bay department store which is connected to the huge Eaton Centre shopping mall. If you care to walk to Chinatown it's a long hike about 20 minutes or more depending on how slow or fast one walks. It's also possible to walk to the Queen's Quay harbourfront-about 25 minutes or so. In fact, we saw the Westin Hotel near the harbour and were very glad we chose to stay at the Sheraton. The Westin is isolated and the hotel itself very quiet. That is a good thing if one needs quiet as the Sheraton is completely the opposite. The Sheraton's lobby is huge and bustling almost like a train station in my opinion with many people walking in and out of it. During our visit there was a large group that had their get together at the hotel and their members occupied just about all the public spaces. As far as internet use goes, the Sheraton is pretty good as there is a bank of seven computers with complimentary internet available for guests in the lobby area-first come first served. If one needs to print it's possible although there is a credit card charge. Their bar/restaurant located on the lobby level is quite good although prices are a bit high. Their fish and chips and hamburger are good choices as are the drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton - great as always”
Reviews.Author: NYtraveler1234
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th stay at the Sheraton - booking through Hotwire always gets us great rates. We are a family traveling for fun so we look for convenience to the downtown Toronto shopping, ice skating and restaurants. The Sheraton is the perfect location for all of these since it is connected to the underground PATH (don't even wear a coat for the walk to the Eaton Centre), and is right across the street from the public ice skating rink at the City Hall plaza. We always request (and have always received) a king bed room with a roll away, and a view of the rink and city. This time we were on the 16th floor in a corner room - what a view and plenty of room for the extra bed. Hotel pool and fitness room are also great in winter - you swim in and outside which is fun for our daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday...top notch, high class service!”
Reviews.Author: Newsgal75
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto after a DISASTER at the Grand and wow, so glad we went there instead. It's like comparing prime rib to ground beef...what a difference in class. Booked the jacuzzi suite for a romantic birthday...and got a great rate, complimentary champagne and breakfast. Plus, the concierge told us the best place to park for cheap! The room had a cityview with two person jacuzzi... so gorgeous.. plus two flat screen tv's, beautiful bed linens, etc.... There are also great restraurants as well as shops on site, plus its in the heart of downtown toronto with city hall just across the street. Many things to do within walking distance. The only negatives: - the room service prices... completely ridiculous. -and our breakfast in the "club lounge" got screwed up.. However, one phone call and they immediately gave us complimentary buffet breakfast on the second floor...it was huge and soooo good! Instant customer service. This is a hotel that knows and strives to make customers happy. Would totally recommend and plan to go back many times.

Reviews.Title: “Just-OK”
Reviews.Author: SRKC
Reviews.Content: Very quick check-in- accomodating with room change. Room was a decent size and the bathroom was bigger than average. Clean. prior to check out I noticed a prob. with room charges-desk couldn't fix it, but said they would bring the revised bill to me prior to check-out. No one came, so I had to stand in line yet again and they attempted to fix the billing problem to no avail. They had to end up emailing the final copy to me.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Taipeiworldlywise
Reviews.Content: overall it was a good stay. great location in Toronto. decor: a bit dated food: in restaurant was WAY too expensive. staff: mostly helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay overall, Awesome Location, Room was a little small”
Reviews.Author: bosox1010
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on this hotel when I booked my flight and accomodations on expedia (half price $100 per night). The room was a little small but very clean and up to date. I also loved the 32" HD flatscreen. Unbelievable location being in the heart of the downtown area and in between the U of the subway system and streetcars nearby also. On top of that the hotel is part of the PATH system where you can get to many downtown locations using a network of underground tunnels which is great in the wintertime. Check in and check out were expedited extremely well and they also had a luggage room where I could store my luggage and go site seeing the day of departure

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: europeiscool
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is centrally located and within walking distance of a lot of major downtown attractions. The staff was courteous and friendly. The room was very nice as well. The only thing that bothered me was that they only had 4 computers for the guests to use, two of which did not work. Other than that, the Sheraton was a great place to stay and I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Eye Appeal - Rip Off For Service And Price”
Reviews.Author: maadad
Reviews.Content: Planned for a weekend getaway. Nearly 2 months. Chose the Shearaton for the "ammenities" & location. Requested King with large bath. We wanted to spoil ourselves a bit. We booked a month in advance on Sheraton's website. We prepaid on our credit card also. Selected room as to what we wanted. Upon arrival, no place to park at lobby entrance. Conjestion with vehicle to no end. After circling 20 minutes we got hotel valet. He took our keys and had us double park while we checked in. Next frustration. Lined up, OK, 4 checking in ahead of us. This took nearly 30 minutes to get checked in. Get to the check in counter show the lady our confirmation and she informs us the they have no King size rooms. Double beds only. Our comment was no we reserved a King and it was confirmed with this letter For approx 400.00 dollar we want King size. We could of booked a Super 8 if we wanted doubles. This was all prepaid and debited. Then she offers us free breakfast., NOOOOO we don't want a breakfast to counter the cheaper room. She mentions we're on the Dirty Dancing Package. NO our confirmation says we did not book this package. Yes we are going to Dirty Dancing but we booked our own tickets online, it was cheaper than they're deal. We stood our ground after wasted 10 minutes arguing. (probably why there were so many lined up at check in) , She suddenly finds a room with a King size as we booked and request. Entering the room we didn't get the oversized bathroom as we booked. So we are [-]. For what we paid for we got downgraded. Without even the free breakfast that they offered. Room is nice, clean, great eye appeal. View overlook Toronto city hall. That was good. No outlets in the room. Guess this type of room is meant for single business users. We took our work with us, and to keep in touch with family. Thinkin' that internet is included, NOOOO. Wifi not accessible unless you pay 20.00 for that or use the cable DSL for 14.00 for 24 hours only. Yee Haw, lets gouge the customer more. Certainly am amazed at the amount of business this hotel is doing. Guess location is what matters here. Certainly won't book with Sheraton again. Mostly because we booked and paid for certain room with ammenities, and had to argue to get what we request and was confirmed. Oh yeah 2 large cups of coffee is all you get in this 200 dollar a night King Size room! Sneaky, ways of gouging us. Well here for another night yet. We're off to get a brunch. Thinking head to the Marriot we see out our window. Check out that place for future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location !!”
Reviews.Author: gaudzrn
Reviews.Content: Booked this room for 2 nights through Priceline.com. and again, i was not dissapointed. This was my first time staying at the Sheraton, and my girlfriend and I truly enjoyed it. As mentionned in the title, the location is perfect for a downtown Toronto stay. Here are a few comments in case you are contemplating a stay at the Sheraton. 1. Parking: I took the advice of others who have written reviews on here, and parked directly across the street under Nathan Phillps square/Town hall. It was much cheaper, and is easily accessed from underground directly to the hotel. 2. Another great thing about the Sheraton is that it is directly linked to the underground P.A.T.H system, hence you can walk to the Eaton Centre...Air Canada Center...etc without going outside. This is nice if it is raining, but I do reccomend doing your walking outside, and enjoying the city views. 3. The lobby is huge...and busy, but check in hardly took 5 minutes, and we were off to our room. The room itself was clean and nicely sized. No complaints at all. We were in the Richmond tower, and it was fine. 4. Didn't eat in the restaurant, but there are many places to get a bite around the hotel.. There is a Mcdonald's in that PATH to the Eaton Centre if you are looking for a quick cheap coffee or bite to eat. Overall, I quite enjoyed the Sheraton. Perfect Location for a shopping weekend, (a minute walk to the Eaton Centre) or to enjoy the downtown sites. Probably a 10 minute walk down Young Street to the ACC. Hope this helps. Don't hesitate to choose the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel overlooking City Hall”
Reviews.Author: TiredCanadian
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at the Sheraton for business. The room was very spacious and comfortable. Although the hotel is busy and on a very busy street, the room was surprisingly quiet. The Sheraton is located right on the convenient underground walkway system, which means that travellers can often avoid having to wear boots/coats in the winter --- a real plus in Toronto's winter weather. The bell captains were friendly and knowledgeable. Note, it is often SIGNIFICANTLY cheaper to book on the internet than to phone or ask for a rate in person.

Reviews.Title: “terrible room”
Reviews.Author: RobMcFad
Reviews.Content: I always try and be fair with my reviews so I would like to start by pointing out that this could get four stars if you got the right room. Unfortunately I got a terrible room so I base this review on my own experiences. My room was on the 4th floor and had no natural day light so my lights had to be on day and night. I had a problem with very noisy neibours but when I asked to be moved I was lied to and told there wasn't a single free room to move to. As I said I like to balance things out so I would say location is excellent however, the front of the hotel makes the m25 look like a peaceful place to pass through. Facilities inside are very good but don't go to the bar for too many drinks or you'll be looking to remortgage your house pretty rapidly. Walls are paper thin so hope you have nice people next door, the staff however are very friendly much the same as the rest of the people in Canada. So to sum up, loved the city and the people, liked the hotel and hated the room hence the poor rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Massive Hotel but a big Dingy”
Reviews.Author: jenmito
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what to expect from this Sheraton Hotel since it is in a great location but the building is quite nondescript - sort of like a concrete slab fading into the dark skyline. The view from the room is great especially with so many floors available. The room itself was spacious with a desk and sitting area. The closet can only be described as functional and the bathroom quite dull. The bathroom is insufficiently lit and you're practically showering in the dark. It also lacked a fan with a fire sprinkler. I wonder if that combination is a good idea. Besides that, this Sheraton with copious rooms always slashes its prices on Priceline. I would definitely stay again for the location but I've been at 3-star hotels nicer than this.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and central”
Reviews.Author: LeroyWirral
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife, on holiday, for 3 nights in mid October having booked through Canadian Affair (can recommend). Room was very good, large, clean, good size bathroom, comfortable beds and a great view. The room had it's own safe which is great for visitors passports. It also had two suitcase stands which makes a change as it is very frustrating when there are two of you and one has to put the suitcase on the floor (more hotels should provide two of these). It is very much a business hotel, conferences etc, but also caters for the tourist. Although we didn't use the swimming pool facilties by other accounts we missed out. Reception was good as was the Tour Desk and Bell Captain & staff (very helpful). Didn't eat in the hotel; we had breakfast at various cafes in the subway under the hotel as we needed to get on and out siteseeing and prefer not to eat dinner in hotel restaurants as they normally have little atmosphere. Instead we ate at two local restaurants, the Keg and Little Italy, which are just around the corner from the hotel main entrance and both provided good food at a reasonable price. The hotel is in a good position for the shopping areas, restaurants and for siteseeing. It is about 20 minutes walk to the quay and a little more to the CN Tower. The hotel also has a safe manned luggage holding room so if you have a late flight out of Toronto you can leave your bags whilst siteseeing. Will stay at the Sheraton again if we visit Toronto in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: JackB9
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Sheraton downtown as the rooms are very comfortable and location is great ( close to Eaton's Center and major night life) and rates are reasonable. Staff are friendly and if you have any issues let them know right away as usually they will find try to resolve right away. Such as one time they put us by a noisy elevator , we complained and they moved us immediately. As well they gave us a nice discount for the inconvenience. The Toronto underground parking is easily accessible and the weekend rates are great like $12 per day which is a bargain compared to $25-30 at some other hotels of the same class. The pool is nice but hot tub a little on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Large and rather soulless”
Reviews.Author: Faience44
Reviews.Content: This is a huge hotel and as I learned, it's easy to get lost in the corridors and ballrooms. The rooms are tired. I switched off the fan in my room and discovered a whistling noise coming from a vent I couldn't turn off. In the end I had to jam a towel in it. On the positive side, the hotel is so large it has its own medical clinic, which I needed to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel but quite nice”
Reviews.Author: Karwie
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night for business. Huge crowds in the lobby, still many "private" corners to use the free wifi. Check in was quick, staff friendly. Room furnishings were well above average (Club Level) and the view was simply stunning. Breakfast at the Club Lounge was very nice as well. Generally a great location right downtown, well kept hotel, good quality product. I would return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: mseibert
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best hotels in the downtown toronto area. From check in to check out our stay was great, again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Clamp535
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2-3 months while traveling on business. This hotel is great! It is centrally located and close to shopping (Young, Queen), all the attrations, and it is even link to the Toronto underground tunnels (great for raining/cold winter days.). The underground tunnels will also take you to the Eaton Shopping Mall + mass transit. Skip the valet parking and park across the street (if out by 7:30AM, around $12). Parking lot is link by underground tunnel to the hotel. p.s. Tip: Stay in the Queens tower it has a great view of the City Hall. Stay away from Richmond Tower which is older and if facing south it looks right into office building. If you have to stay in Richmond Tower ask for rooms at the East/North end of the building. This will still get you a great view of Young street and City Hall. The beds here is very comfy and overall great service! If you have club lounge access, make sure to head up to the top floor for great breakfast with exceptional view of the city/lake skyline! FYI, except for lobby there is a fee for internet from the room. And from what my co-worker indicate the resturant in the hotel is over-priced and not too great. There is tons of restaurant within a block or two.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS HOTEL, WAS MORE THAN I EXPECTED”
Reviews.Author: Meinmachine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights after a crappy flight with Transat we needed a bit of a lift! The sheraton did not disappoint! At all! Everything from the pillows on the extremely comfortable bed to the excellent amenities to the Strawberry Daiquiri's was first class! The friendly helpful staff could'nt do enough for us! Checking in and out was very easy, we ate in Traders and Bistro on Two and both were excellent, great value for money! The location is perfect, form shopping in the Eaton Center to visiting the CN tower it's all so easy by foot! Toronto is not that bigger city and is easier to get the feel of it by foot and the Hop on Hop off bus tour! If your staying in one of the north facing rooms look out for the light show in the windows of City Hall! Very clever! Highly recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: Peewak
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in September and had emailed in advance ,asking for king bed,on high floor,which is exactly what we got via the friendly,unfussy,receptionist.Within 10 minutes of walking through the hotel door,we were in our large,very clean,well appointed room. We booked a Niagara trip via the hotel and arrangements were excellent - bus on time etc. My good lady wife insists I praise the Cosmopolitan cocktail sold in the hotel bar(14 dollars)-after studious sampling ,in other Toronto hostelries,she assured me that the Sheraton was no.1! Indeed,out of the three hotels we used,during this vacation,the Sheraton was tops - an excellent,good value hotel,central for most attractions which,we discovered,were all within walking distance Will certainly use Sheraton brand again - strongly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near City Hall Toronto”
Reviews.Author: JR_in_NYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my newlywed wife on our "mini-moon" for 2 nights. We booked the hotel via priceline and paid under $100 USD per night. The loading-unloading zone area in front of the hotel was very hectic. Lots of cars were pulling in as well as taxis. My wife went to check in while I stayed in the car. Valet Parking would have been $40 per day, but was told that we could park across the street under City Hall for a lot less, with no in-and-out service though. Since Toronto has a decent public transportation and being from NYC, we opted to just leave the car parked for the 2 nights we were in town. We used public transportation or walked to our destinations. Parking lot is connected to the hotel via the PATH (underground tunnel). Our room was located on the smaller tower, which did not face City Hall. The room was on the average to a little small side. Room came with a flat screen TV. The hotel was very busy due to the Toronto Film Festival being in town. The lobby was very crowded, and there were some street closures as well as the main entrance being closed off for a few hours. We were directed to use the side entrance instead, not much on an inconvenience. Hotel is located across the street from City Hall and the Old City Hall. The Eaton Center is easily accessible. We were able to walk to the CN Tower (15 minute walk), Rogers Centre (15 minute walk), Hockey Hall of Fame (5 minute walk). There is a Tim Horton's next door and a 5 minute walk west on Queen street, you come across several restaurants and bars. Would definitely stay here for the price we paid on priceline. Would not pay full price though.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hote,l excellent location”
Reviews.Author: blackrose77
Reviews.Content: This was one of the handful hotels that I liked pretty much everything as soon as I entered the room. The room was very nicely decorated and specious. The location couldn't be better, in the heart of downtown Toronto with a walking distance to most local attractions. Even the hotel bar was exceptional with a nice collection of European beers. Finally, the service was gracious and prompt. Overall - great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Is it ever quiet?”
Reviews.Author: WaltR
Reviews.Content: There always seemed to be people coming and going at this hotel and it's obviously popular with large tour groups and conferences. The airport bus stopped right outside and its location for some theatres and the Eaton Centre couldn't be better. Nice long hours for breakfast after a long flight but it was pricey. Good sized room but street noise a problem over the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very large, very busy but very nice Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: spur365
Reviews.Content: This hotel overall exceeded my expectations. Yes the hotel is very large and very busy with business clients but it works very well and staff more than friendly Check-in was smooth and request accepted for high floor with a view. Given floor 21. Room was very comfy with 2 lovely beds and chairs. Floor to celing windows made for lovely view. Bathroom was of nice size with the freebies refreshed daily. Didnt eat at the hotel restaurants as the were fairly expensive but had room service twice which came within 30 minutes. For breakfast the Sunset Grill one block away is very nice. Tram and subway stops are outside the hotel with the CN tower and union station 5 minute walks away. Would definatly stay again if i come back to Toronto

Reviews.Title: “A "Big-Box" Experience”
Reviews.Author: mykel67
Reviews.Content: I'll try to be fair here since we did get an excellent rate for this hotel through Priceline ($70 per night). I do think it is rated too high. To call this hotel 4-stars along with the likes of the King Edward, Inter-Continental, Park Hyatt, Sutton Place, Royal York etc. does those other properties a disservice. It is more like the 3.5 star Delta Chelsea if you are looking for something to compare it to. It's not the kind of place I would ever knowingly choose. It's too big, too impersonal, and seems to cater to large tour groups, big families and flight crew. Upon arrival you feel like you are in an airport or suburban shopping mall. It's dark, crowded, and utterly lacking in charm or character. Check in was a little unpleasant. When I asked for a non-smoking room the clerk responded, "You did read the fine print of your reservation, didn't you?" I told her that the other person in our party had a severe allergy to smoke (total lie), so she grudgingly "found" us a non-smoking room, albeit one with two double beds rather than the king we requested. I fully expected to have a view of a brick wall, dumpsters or ventilation shafts, but instead we had room 1945, which overlooks city hall and the downtown skyline. The room has been recently redecorated and is comfortable enough, although the upholstery on the lounge chair was already spotted and the woodwork already scratched. The decor is not as nice as that in the Toronto airport Sheraton. There is a decent outdoor pool, but it was always filled with kids so we didn't bother with it. The fitness centre is well equipped but guests are charged $10 per day to use it! I've never had to pay to use a hotel's fitness facilities before, and I've stayed in hotels that have had much nicer ones. Shocking. I suppose the hotel is in a good location if you want to spend time at the Eaton Centre or go to shows in the Theatre District. I've just booked another weekend in Toronto, and I noticed that the Sheraton is still available on Priceline for the price (or even a little less) that we paid, but to me it's worth it to spend more and stay somewhere more comfortable, quieter and more pampering.

Reviews.Title: “An ok experience in an overpriced, shabbily renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: monkey769
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay here if I had to pay full price. I've never used priceline before, which was great, but the hotel - not so much. For a newly renovated hotel, it was obvious that they did a shabby job. Old elevators, holes in my sheets, and a rather un-updated bathroom all made for just an OK stay at this sheraton. It still looked rundown and aged, which is unfortunate. And, my oh my, was everything way too expensive at the hotel. You had to pay to use the fitness center and breakfast was absolutely ridiculously priced for only half decent food. $35 for an orange juice, breakfast sandwich, and a muffin -- and that wasn't room service.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: SpartyHolt_Michigan
Reviews.Content: We stay here for our anniversary. The location is excellent. Easy walking distance to theaters and shopping. It has been almost 25 years since we last stayed here and the faciility has been well maintained and while a little bland, is reasonably up to date. We had a problem on check-in, they had no record of my hotwire reservation. They went ahead and checked us in and with a copy of my confirmation, the staff contacted hotwire and everything was taken care of. We had a great room overlooking city hall and the plaza. Just a tip, avoid the lobby bar, way over priced. There are several good options within a 5-10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “City of Heights”
Reviews.Author: InverkeithingCats
Reviews.Content: The bedroom was excellant, very clean, good size. However, the bed was too soft for my husband, when he told the receptionist all that was offered was to put something under the mattress not sure if this was done as there was no improvement. I did not appreciate when booking this hotel that there was nowhere to go for breakfast, it would have been helpful to give info about this in the hotel room so you would know were to go. The only thing that really annoyed us was some days we were given bottles of water for our coffee and some days we were not, I found this to be inconsistant.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Hotel, but Great Place...........”
Reviews.Author: martythemonkey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property on many occasions in the past and have always had a great experience. This stay was no different. The lobby is undergoing some renovations in the guest check-in area, but they seem to have things changed around adequately. Check-in was fast and I was upgraded without having to ask. I was on a higher floor and had to switch elevators at the 25th floor to make it to my floor - but this was a minor inconvenience. The rooms have all been completely renovated and the club lounge is the best I have experienced in some time - to the point that it is well worth the upgade fee. This is my hotel when in downtown Toronto!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Centre Hotel - Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: sj_startraveler
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome. We got our room with starwood points the night before so we were very surprised that we only needed 10k points per night, when the Hilton across the street wanted an insane amount of points per night. PARKING Don't park on the valet. It's $40/night and they take forever to go and get your car. The parking lot across the street is half that and it's safe, very well iluminated and clean. You can cross to the hotel via an underground tunnel from the parking lot as well. LOBBY and CHECK IN The lobby is so pretty and huge. We checked in on a friday afternoon and there were a lot of people checking in. The check in process was fast and the staff was very friendly. ROOM We got a room on the 35th floor with a nice view of the CN tower. The bed was comfortable. The room was very spacious. My only complaint is that the bathroom didn't have a lot of space to set up our things. I'm used to display everything so I don't have to live out of the bag in our vacation. RESTAURANTS We ate at the italian restaurant across the street Little Anthony's Italian Ristorante and it was soo good!! Our waiter was very nice and helpful. We spent $100 for: 2 glasses of white wine, salad, bread, one pasta dish (gnoochi with marinara sauce), one main entree (lamb chops were sooo good!!), and dessert. Not bad at all. We had breakfast at Sunset Grill - walking distance from the hotel. and it was good too. We had sushi @ Sushi Queen - walking distance too. The sushi was very good, good price too, but they took forever. Seemed like they only had 3 waitresses for the entire restaurant which was full on a saturday night. Our overall experience was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: chokobrzi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent the weekend at the Sheraton Center and we absolutely LOVED IT! From check in to check out, everything was stellar. The room was very cozy, the breakfast sooooo good. The staff extremely helpful and full of positive energy. The pool/hot tub and the gym are perfect, too! The hotel itself if BEAUTIFUL!! Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but beware of extras!”
Reviews.Author: MacVicar
Reviews.Content: We booked our reseravation last minute on hotwire and got a pretty good price. We were disappointed; however, on arriving, to find out we'd been placed in a 2-double bed smoking room (I guess hotwire makes no guarantees as to the type/quality of the room you book). It was only because I am a Starwood Hotels preferred guest that we were able to upgrade to a non-smoking room (otherwise we would have had to pay an additional $100/night). The hotel is very nice, great beds, linens, furniture, amenities, etc. Also, it is attached to shops (including the Eaton Centre), the subway, and various other points of interest via an underground route called 'PATH', which was very convenient, especially in the rain. All that said, I was very surprised by the extra charges for EVERYTHING. There was a charge if you wanted to use the fitness facilities, parking was $40/day, in-room internet was $14.95/day, and the toilet paper was one-ply (ha!). There were four public-use computers in the lobby that you could use (if you could get on) for 30 minutes before the computer shut-down automatically and booted you off. Considering a lot of the discount hotels provide you with comfortable rooms and all of these extras (including sometimes breakfast) for under $80/night, it is difficult for me to understand how the Sheraton gets away with charging for all of these things. At an average of $250/night, you'd think they'd provide these services free of charge to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable hotel. Dreadful food”
Reviews.Author: inner_city_resident
Reviews.Content: A reliable large chain hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful but seemed overwhelmed by the load--which wasn't helped by our arriving during the Toronto Caribbean event. The location is very convenient for downtown Toronto. We had our 9-year old with us and had some difficulties with beds. We'd booked two queens but ended up with a single kind-size, so they agreed to put in a roll-up bed. This took forever to arrive. Then two days later it disappeared and took several calls and to get reinstated. We're still not sure what happened. In desperation on the first night we ate at the in-house restaurant/sports bar. We didn't make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: NewBlueVim
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find something to complain about at the Sheraton Centre. We booked through Priceline and got a great price for our weekend stay in Toronto. Food and shopping are extraordinarily convenient as the hotel is directly connected to the "concourse" level or underground, citywide mall. The major transit lines are hardly a short walk away and there's a lot to see nearby on Yonge and Queen streets. I was surprised how many families were staying here over the weekend - but this place is huge and probably has to try hard to keep rooms filled over most weekends. My only problems with the hotel were the outdated ventilation system that would occasionally make the room smell of cigarette smoke and the recent bizarre and gaudy "cabin in the Canadian Rockies" renovation to a hotel that oozes "Blade Runner meets spic-and-span Toronto".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: GB40
Reviews.Content: Well, this is what to expect from a Sheraton really. Very professional, very helpful and polite staff and the hotel itself was spotless. Check-in was efficient, we were in our room within 5 minutes. And what a room; very spacious, 32nd floor with great view of the city including the pool and CN Tower. Plentiful elevators (and fast too) and the hotel is beautiful inside. Traders bar/restaurant is very reasonably priced and in fact we ate in there every evening about midnight after a busy day. My only gripe really was about some of our fellow guests for our last two nights. We unwittingly booked over the annual "Caribina" weekend which is a celebration of the Caribbean so the hotel became very full, very quickly. The guests up for this weekend were very noisy and even in the lobby, where they hung around in their dozens for hours on end, made a heck of a noise. We were a little disappointed that nobody dealt with this as it wasn't in keeping of the previous ambience of the whole place. The guests would then be noisy in the corridors until all hours until finally, at 0400 on our final night, one of them set off a fire hose, which resulted in a total evacuation. However, the staff and fire dept quickly established the cause and we had only got down to the 16th floor when we were told it was safe to return to our rooms. I feel that if the hotel had been more proactive in the beginning and stamped out the unruliness then this incident may not have occurred. However, we did not let it spoil our stay in an otherwise very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Package”
Reviews.Author: amareusqueadmare
Reviews.Content: Myself and three girlfriends stayed at this hotel for one night. We ate at TRADERS and saw WE WILL ROCK YOU downtown. The whole package was very affordable and it was a delight to go away for a night. Even the 'standard' rooms are fairly luxurious, (tempted to stow away the pillows and sheets!). The only dissappointments were that the hotel didn't have much of a night life and we were unable to get two rooms on the same floor. (Thats par for the course in summer in Toronto). I enjoyed my stay. I hope to stay there again sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel is a Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: seattlemusician
Reviews.Content: My father and I visited Toronto, Ontario, for the first time and felt that this Sheraton Hotel was a good cholce. It is in the center of everything with walking distances to most attractions. The subway is a block away and there is the underground network of shops known as the 'Path' beneath the hotel. Our room ,which we booked through Expedia ,was on the 30th floor with a commanding view of the city skyscrapers as well as the CN Tower. The room was well furnished and in good condition. Though I do feel that this Sheraton is more of a 3 + star hotel rather than a 4 star which it is advertised as. The standard room we were given was on the compact side and lacked a mini-refrigerator as well as an exhaust fan for the bathroom (the bathroom mirror would steam up after a bath). I have stayed in both 3 star and 4 star hotels and I feel that a 4 star hotel must be spacious in every way in addition to having all the features that some 3 star hotels don't have. Since we received such a good deal from Expedia I hate to quibble over these matters. I indeed would stay at this hotel again if in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location... and the POOL”
Reviews.Author: digtravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this room for a great price through Hotwire, in town for some baseball games. This hotel is in a great location to see all of Toronto. Check in was great, very friendly- they offered bottled water while waiting and were very pleasant despite being busy. We had a king room on the 26th floor overlooking City Hall. The room was recently remodeled, had a comfy bed, nice TV and a great shower. Maid service was great as they cleaned and straightened the room promptly each day. The highlight f this hotel has to be the large indoor/outdoor pool, surprising for a downtown hotel. We enjoyed the pool and spa, and cocktails by the pool as well, which were reasonably priced considering. My only complaint would be the high price for parking, a fact I didn't notice until the final day ($40/day). Overall, a great stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Wellingtonian
Reviews.Content: Got an incredible rate on hotwire and loved every minute of my five-day stay! I was allowed to check in early (greatly appreciated after travelling from New Zealand) and I was assigned a very pleasant Queensize-bedroom on the 11th floor with view of the pool and the CN Tower with its nocturnal light show. The room was spotless and well serviced with ok amenities. I appreciated the in-room safe (which the Sheraton Gateway at LAX didn't have). The furnishings were attractive and unpretentious. I slept very well. This is a huge hotel so not for those who are looking for a boutique or personalized experience. It was truly excellent value for money (and what a relief after the ghastly Sheraton Gateway at Los Angeles Airport). Warmly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in business area”
Reviews.Author: sophielaura
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 2 nights with my family, 2 adults and 4 teenage girls. Hotel was in the business district which as it was a weekend was quite. Travelling as part of a road trip around Canada-USA. Hotel was very good and clean. Rooms fine, only issue was a bit of noise on the first night with soem kids running up and down at 4am. However, hotel sorted and gave us free breakfast. Internet in lobby which you can use for 30 mins. Pool great and warm. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.... great location !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jewelzzz
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here because we got a good deal through Expedia. We received an upgrade when we checked in, the room was clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful. When we got lost in the pathway ( the underground shopping centre ) the girl at the desk was very helpful and even drew us a map. The room service was alright, was over priced but we ended up being snowed in for one night of our four night stay and room service was our only option. This hotel is located right on Queen St. W and is the perfect location for those travellers on foot, like myself and my friend. We could pretty much walk anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location & rooms”
Reviews.Author: Juxu
Reviews.Content: Great location at the heart of Toronto. Nice clean rooms with excellent bed and tv. Reception was ok, however overnight the reception had moved to another location :) Everything worked as they should in this class hotel. Only problem was nearby church, they ring the church bells at 6 am, and that's not good... Checkout queue was quite long so I used the automat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Slightly Above Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCAD522
Reviews.Content: Got there early, about 10am and the room was ready, however they only had 2 beds instead of the room with a king bed that i requested. Was told that i could "upgrade to an executive room for 75 more per day if i wanted a king." I wasnt thrilled with that answer but oh well ill live. You can hear EVERYTHING your neighbor does as the walls seem like they are made of paper. On a positive note the location is AMAZING, right by the Eaton Centre, Hockey hall of fame, Dundas Square and all major stadiums. Also the room service food is amazing for late night dinner and desert. However DO NOT GO TO THE RESTAURANT FOR BREAKFAST..COMPLETE RIP OFF. I had an omelet, my wife had 2 eggs over with toast and we each had juice. It was $61.00..more than the dinner we had there. I would most likely stay here again just for the location but dont be fooled you have many choices right in that location. The only thing i really didnt like was that this is one of those hotels that charges you for EVERYTHING they can. Internet is 15 per day unless you go to the lobby, which we did...the lobby is quite comfortable. Just make sure you get a good price on the room cause the extras can add up quick at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location. little more”
Reviews.Author: Ganor
Reviews.Content: Excellent location but shouldn't get more than 3 stars. rooms look "oldish" and bath tubs may be yellow and broken (as was in one of our 3 rooms). We travelled with 3 kids + grandmother and were initially located next to the elevator shaft. HORRIBLE!! A defective elevator kept us sleeping in 20 minutes intervals. Traveling with kids & senior this severely compromised our next day plans. we switched rooms the next day. Surprisingly, non of the hotel staff thought we deserve an apologize ! They knew the elevator was defective but didn't bother to inactivate it during the night! Rude! Also, strangely, they started remodeling the reception area during our stay. As a result getting to our rooms involved switching elevators on level 25. quite uncomfortable if you are loaded (we were). Also beware of room service. A $20 order turned into $34 after room charge + gratuity (and ...the waiter will wait patiently for his additional tip !)

Reviews.Title: “Does the little things well”
Reviews.Author: canucksfan26
Reviews.Content: Overall I would say it's a good hotel that simply doesn't miss any of those little details you really appreciate when you discover them. For example, having two suitcase stands in our room was a nice bonus. The location of the hotel absolutely cannot be beat. The lobby is beautiful and from what I saw of the pool, etc, the facilities are clean and nice. Overall the service was good. There was an issue with the first room key they gave us, so they moved us to a different room. The only downside of that is we were on the third floor and a very long ways from the elevator, but I guess someone has to get those rooms. I would recommend this hotel to any people in their 20s or early 30s because it was amazing for a young couple to have such ready access to so many tremendous attractions and to enjoy being in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Love This hotel”
Reviews.Author: virginatlantic
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel,The sweet sleeper beds,trademarked to Sheraton! are amazing,the hotel is 2 minutes to the Eaton centre,the Airport Bus stops right outside.We did hire a car ( for two days)but found parking difficult around this area as it's so central we took the car back after the two days hardly used.Subway is 5 mins walk,we had breakfast but did'nt use the bar,so can't comment on that.It's so good we are due to go back in october.If you are looking for a more personal hotel this is not the one,but it's just right for exploring the city area.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kyyhky
Reviews.Content: The Sheration Centre Toronto hotel is a decent family-friendly hotel. We stayed there on two adjacent weekends; first on a 32nd-floor room facing towards Lake Ontario and second on a 22nd-floor room facing the Toronto City Hall. The hotel itself is quite old though the rooms and the public areas have been renovated quite recently; the rooms were a bit weary but still very clean and comfortable. The single layer windows were a bit too thin to keep the traffic noise on the Queen street side away. The view on both sides of the hotel was great. The lobby area and the hotel restaurant were great and the hotel location (just two blocks from the Eaton Center) is suberb, at least for vacation purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Probably better for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: howden
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice downtown location, not far from subway stop, Eaton Center, and walkable to other areas. The parking is the first hint ($40 a day). They still charge for in room internet ($15 a day) and their free computer center in the lobby is always crowded with a horribly slow server. They allow 30 minutes for each sign in, and for both days of my stay, at least 10 minutes of that 30 minutes was spent trying to link up to the internet. The bar is equally over-priced ($12 for a beer?). Best to go to a local tavern on King St or such. If you are looking for help on attractions or shows, only whatever the tour company that operates in the lobby will give you help with what they are involved in. Overall, not bad if you get a good rate, but as title says , you may want to consider others if travelling with family.

Reviews.Title: “The best location!”
Reviews.Author: ilovethesun99
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sheraton through hotwire for $110. I felt it was a great deal for a four star right downtown Toronto. A friend and I stayed for one night and had a standard room with two beds with a large window that opened up a bit. The room was musty smelling when we first arrived so I opened the window to let the smell out. Although the beds were very clean and comfortable, the carpet was stained, paint was chipped from the tables and the bathroom was small and not the cleanest. The staff were very professional, polite and helpful. We loved the location, and were able to walk to the theatre and to many restaurants. We also did some shopping at the Eaton's Centre which is connected to the hotel. I have stayed at the Sheraton Centre several times in the past, but I think i'll try a different hotel on my next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay! Greart Location!”
Reviews.Author: TexasZuggie
Reviews.Content: Very nice room. Very pleased. We had one of the smaller rooms with the smallish bath and toilet in seemingly the wrong place as mentioned by a previous poster, but we had no problem with it. The room was very nice and appointed. Following the advice of previous posters, we found breakfast in the concourse below the hotel, used the free WIFI in the lobby, and self-parked in the garage across the street. Parking would have cost $40. a night if we used the hotel parking. We got around on the jump-on, jump-off bus, and that worked out well. Paid just $65. for this room for two nights on a PriceLine bid. At that rate, what a bargain! Location could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it great location”
Reviews.Author: MayLouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It is the location that makes it. It is in the centre of everything you need with the eaton centre only around the corner. The rooms are lovely and spacious really clean. We were up on the 28th floor great view over the city. Pool area was very nice indoor and outdoor pool would definatley recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: 206_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal on Priceline for the 6 days we were in Toronto so it definitely pays to do your research before you go. We flew in on a red eye and got to the hotel well before the 3pm check-in time, but thanks to Max at the front desk we were able to get into a room at 12:30pm and get some rest before we met up with some friends. Like everyone's been saying, the location is great, the room is nice (only the bathroom could be a bit bigger and better lit), and the internet downstairs is very convenient. You can walk to everything or buy a bus pass and take the streetcar or subway to pretty much anywhere in the city. (FYI - If it's raining both the streetcars and subways get packed. On weekends, one day pass ($9) works for 2 adults or 1 adult and kids. Definitely worth it if you've already walked for most of the trip and need a break.) Plenty of food options outside of the hotel. My recs: Indian Palace - great lunch buffet. It's one of many on Queen St towards Spadina, but it's one of the busiest. Crepe Cafe - open late and super good. If you need something quick, Tim Horton's is a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: valerie_c_vfh
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through hotwire, so we were pleasantly surprised to have a great room. It was very clean, on the 24th floor, and we had a great view of the city and CN tower. We liked that there was a nicer TV than in the usual hotel, and the bed was fantastic! We will absolutely stay there again and we recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location....”
Reviews.Author: Gateway_12
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Sheraton at the end of July. Pros - great location - lobby are was very nice (if a little dark). The leather chairs were very comfy, and the view to the graden was nice. - Room was good, had a view of the square. Bed was very comfy, and good plasma tv screen Cons - access to internet was very difficult. There always ssemed a queue to get access to the machines - had a meal at Traders, very nice but a bit pricey. I woul drecommned going out for lunch/dinner. - lobby area was very busy. The hotel is used for lots of conferences, and business use in general, including travel attendants staying there etc. Overall comments Its a very nice hotel. Nothing too extravent, and everything is done very well. Its location is great, walking ditance to most tourist sites (and shopping ares) .Would i recommend is - Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Above Average”
Reviews.Author: JFsB
Reviews.Content: As a solo business traveller (stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights to attend a large industry conference) and having read the stellar reviews here, perhaps my expectations were too high, as I didn't experience the "wow" factor described by other reviewers. While the front desk, restaurant and in-room services were all fine, none were exceptional. The common / public areas were well maintained (although usually quite crowded and busy no matter the time of day or night) although a bit dated in look and condition. The various on-site conference rooms were of good size, comfortable, well lit, and kept at a reasonable temperature (although I did see plenty of people grabbing an extra sweater, so if you tend to get a chill, don't forget to pack one). The staff always had the necessary audio / visual equipment ready. The room (2 double beds) was of adequate size, but the bathroom was smaller than comparable hotels. In addition, the cleanliness, despite daily housekeeping service, left a bit to be desired. There are 3 restaurant choices: a breakfast-only spot, a pub-like bar / restaurant that is open for lunch/dinner/happy hour, and their high-end steak house. Because of the convenience, I selected the pub during my stay. The service was attentive and friendly and quality of the food was about average, however, beware of the unrealistic prices for what you're served. Instead venture out to the city where you'll find a plethora of restaurants within walking distance. When it comes to the location, like other reviewers have already said, the Sheraton can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: UlikahluvsToronto
Reviews.Content: So, I got the hotel through Priceline and visited Toronto primarily for the Caribana Festival. As you might have read, the Hotel is centrally located and in walking distance of everything. Unlike the experience of the traveler before me, I found the hotel to be quite elegant in nature, at one point I actually counted 6 porters and 3 supervisors who were just walking around asuring that the cutomers were ok. The porters were always helpful with directors and suggestions. The hotel itself has a classy feel to it, and at the same time was quite bussy. There is a computer station in the lobby with about 6 computers....(they should have more in my perspective) The restaurant traders...is a rip off, you can eat out and save some big bucks! Or you can just have a simple breakfast downstairs as the hotel is connected to PATH the underground shopping mall. Immidiately connected is a small mc Donalds and several breakfast venders with fresh fruit and coffee. The bedroom was great, with the 42 inc LG flat screen, and THE BED! OK let me tell you about this bed...ITS DANGEROUS....you can spend your WHOLE vacation in this bed, its almost like it was MADE for your body, its EXTREMELY confortable!!!!!!!! Overall, along with the great feel of being in toronto this hotel complimented the fact that I made an excellent choice. You can chose to eat lavishly, or eat on a budget. I spend about 4 days in Toronto and only spend $65 on meals....and I ate at 2 restaurants. I STRONGLY recommend Richtree on Yonge walking distance from the Hotel, its cute and hip fresh food that will avarage $20-25 depending on what you get. If your looking for a cheap eat during lunch there is a Buffet retaurant called Mandarin on Eglinton and Yonge I think it was about $12 but the selection was very large. The only little dissapointment I may have is that the rooms were not completely sound proof and you could sometimes hear people from the outside. The staff was great at the lobby but should also book all families with children on the same floor. Oh, if you leaving toronto late, you can ask for a late check out, it would only be about an additional hour, but you can leave your luggage at the luggage holding station and contunue cruising toronto until your ready to leave. Have a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PIPTYPIBE
Reviews.Content: As always, I chose my hotel by reading all the reviews on Tripadvisor and the Sheraton shone out from the rest. Yes it's very nice but maybe my expectations were a little too high. I was slightly disappointed. We arrived by the excellent Airport Express bus. As it was my first time in Canada I expected a bigger welcome at the reception desk. I was a little deflated! The room was lovely, a little old though. Great views of the city! I was delighted to find a Starbucks coffee maker in the room. It got great use! The bed was a FAB kingsize bed and there is a cool plazma tv with lots of channels. Most disappointing was the bathroom. No shower gel, shower cap, mending kit, dressing gown or slippers and the hook behind the door was broken. On the very positive side the Tour Desk is brilliant! We went on the Bus & Island Tour and the Niagara Tour and were not disappointed. The Tour Company is extremely professional. I was very impressed. The hotels location is fabulous. Everything is a little walk away and this really made up for everything. The lobby is always very busy and there are always queues to use the internet. Nice little garden in the centre. Only discovered the PATH shops on the last morning but had been greatly impressed by the Eaton Centre so didnt mind.I welcomed the newspaper everyday on our door also. Would I return? For location most definetly yes!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: cngw
Reviews.Content: The location of the Sheraton is excellent - its less that 2 minutes away from the Eaton Shopping Centre and the Queens metro stop and connected to the PATH system. The Club Level room was quite good - (upgrade for $75 or 1000 Sheraton points per night)clean, all fixtures worked, good furniture, Sweet Sleeper bed, coffee & tea, mini-bar and complimentary Internet connection. Also included is an adequate Continental breakfast and afternoon tea on the Club Lounge (superb view of Toronto) One minor negative - the elevators are a bit loud and can be heard from the room. It takes a bit getting used to. . . All-in-all, a very good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OnTraveler_8
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, with clean, comfortable rooms and bedding and good service. The hotel is also connected to the underground mall which extends under a good section of downtown. The first time I visited here was in January 2007 and I walked underground from the train station, where I arrived in town, to the hotel lobby without once stepping outside into the winter weather. This time I was visiting on vacation with my family. They loved the roof top pool area, which was a great spot to sunbathe and read the newspaper. The only complaint I have about the place is the exorbitant cost of internet access, which is free in a lot of hotels nowadays. Hopefully they'll get with the times.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite Toronto hotel!”
Reviews.Author: micmac327
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Toronto frequently, and The Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel is our new favorite place to stay! From the elegant lobby, stunning view, and beautiful grounds, the Sheraton Centre is a gem in downtown Toronto. And you can't beat the location! It's within walking distance to anywhere you would want to go - 5 minutes from the Eaton Centre, 15 minutes from Union Station, CN Tower, Skydome, and the harbourfront. By far the best hotel we've stayed at in Toronto! I can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brencanada
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice with my family. Each time we only stayed for a night, but enjoyed ourselves. We are from Toronto but sometimes we just want to get away from it all, so we have stayed here. That may sound odd but vacationing in your own city is actually just as relaxing as vacationing in another city, except it's cheaper. We had two connecting rooms to fit us all, and it worked perfectly. A king bed in one room, two doubles or queens (I can't remember which) in the other. We had wonderful views of City Hall, and since it was winter we could go ice skating. The rink lit up at night which was beautiful. On one visit we had access to a club on the top floor, which was basically a restaurant. There was a small buffet with good food and you could order drinks. The walls were lined with glass windows and the city views were amazing from up there. The pool is great. Going in the winter time was a nice experience because half of the pool is outdoors. You can swim from the indoor half to the outdoor half. So I can now say I've swam outside in January! There was also a hot tub and sauna which was very nice. The location of the hotel is great. There are restaurants and places to shop nearby. For dinner we walked underground to a restaurant under the Fairmont Royal York, called Benihana. All in all, I definitely recommend the Sheraton for anyone traveling to Toronto. Great rooms, great service, great location. It seems very popular among people coming to Toronto for business but it works for families too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bakerboyscotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 night in first week of July. Large and busy hotel but very friendly and professional. Staff were helpful and friendly, rooms were spacious and spotless.Really cannot say a bad word about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Algood
Reviews.Content: I am originally from Toronto and living in the US now. When my husband had to go to a conference, I jumped at the chance to go. He stayed there for 2 nights while I stayed with him for one night. After all the years I spent in Toronto, it was with fresh eyes that I saw Toronto whilst staying at this hotel. We got a really nice suite overlooking CN Tower. It was breath taking at night. The bed was huge and soft. The staff was courteous and the interior of the hotel itself was beautiful. We were given club privileges so we had breakfast on the top floor where the entire room is surrounded by glass to take in the magnificent view of the town. It was beautiful. Not to mention the food - lots of variety and great service. Greatly enjoyed my stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: George_StonyBrook
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. The room was very nice and it had a great view of Toronto. I booked via a secondary supplier and when I called ahead for a king bed in a smoke-free room they were happy to accommodate the request. The hotel staff was helpful and courteous. I recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Pricey Extras”
Reviews.Author: JJH3d
Reviews.Content: First, I will admit that Iâ€™m one of those Priceline guys who got the room at a price which ought to land me in jail, therefore I have no standing to complain. With that in mind: This is an excellent full service hotel. They treat you right. Although the only room available when we arrived was on the smoking floor, they moved us the next day and, because there was a delay in the â€œfreshen upâ€� of the smoking room, they threw in 2 complimentary buffet breakfasts. Clean, large room, great bathroom, great housekeeping, great service all around. No complaints â€“ except the pricey extras. Do not spend a dime in the restaurants or hotel stores. For example, the cafÃ© prices are double the Starbucks / Tim Hortonâ€™s, which are one block away. The buffet breakfast we received for free (see above) would have cost $26 each, plus the obscene Canadian tax, plus tip. It was a great breakfast, but not THAT great. These high prices are to be expected at any downtown big city hotel, so one canâ€™t be surprised. Overall, itâ€™s a great place and next time I bid Iâ€™ll cross my fingers that the Sheraton comes up again.

Reviews.Title: “Big & impersonal, but works”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED: This convention size hotel is massive and located in the heart of Toronto, easy jump to most area attractions and directly connected to the underground network of shops and walkways. Check in was fast. This older property sees steady business, but most facilities in decent (not good) repair. Room recently renovated and bedding comfortable. Internet access for such a large property is very fast. Rooms quiet and good illumination. Bathrooms in general good state, though some peeling of paint evident. This is a solid 4* offering, not much charm, but a good choice nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tbf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent an enjoyable 3 nights at this hotel in June 08. It is in a great location minutes from the shopping area of the Eaton Centre and about 10-15 minutes walk from the CN Tower. The staff are very friendly and helpful from the doormen to the restaurant staff. At check in the receptionist noticed it was my birthday and offered us a free breakfast which was a really nice touch. We had our complimentary breakfast the first morning and paid for the same on our 2nd morning. It was expensive ($60 for 2) but worth it. On our 3rd morning we just went into the coffee shop around the corner from the hotel and ate for about $6!! There is a really nice restaurant across from the hotel called the Keg which we had lunch in on our last day before we went back to the airport. We also ate in the bar in the hotel when we came back from the Niagra tour as we were really tired and couldnt be bothered going out. In the city centre we ate in a restaurant called Bateux Rouge next to the Eaton Centre. All the restaurants are worth a visit as all our meals and the service were great. You should book the Niagra day trip at the hotel as the girls tell you all about the tour and you get collected from the Hotel. A full day trip which lasted about 11 hours cost around $180 per person but was brilliant. On our last day we checked out of the hotel about 11 am and left our luggage. When we went back to collect it we were able to shower and get ready in the leisure club which was handy. Its easy to get a taxi to and from the airport and it costs about $47 and it takes about 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Can't really fault it”
Reviews.Author: BalSingh
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through Hotwire so the price was excellent to start with. Having been to Canada before I knew the hotel location was very central. We stayed for 5 nights. The hotel itself was great. We took our 6 month old baby on vacation for the first time and the hotel were very accommodating. They provided us a crib in the room, bought us a band new ketlle so we could heta up water for the baby's feeds too. When we found that the first room they gave us didnt have a safe, the quickly moved us to a room with one. All that in itself made the stay worthwhile. In terms of the rooms, they were spacious, comfortable, had nice big LCD TVs and had great views (we were on the 29th floor). The bathroom was functional and clean. The cleaners did a good job every day too. One of the best things about this hotel is its location ... it is part of the PATH network of underground walkways which meant we could get to the Eaton Centre and Bay Dept Store for some retail therapy without even having to step outside (on the rainy days, this was a boon). Overall, I would recommend to anyone. The staff are friendly (as Canadians usually are) and the hotel provides everything you woudl need.

Reviews.Title: “The Sheraton Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: Cynth_L
Reviews.Content: My sister stayed here after getting a fiercely awesome deal on priceline. I only got to hang out for the day but I will give as much details as possible! This hotel is beautiful!! It's not much to look at from the outside but as soon as you walk in you are faced with this really pretty, enclosed waterfall that I saw many people just sitting around and reading, watching, relaxing.. whatever!. There's a bunch of computers that they offer free internet access on and tables around for people to play checkers or chess on. My sister has a 6 month old baby and they put in a crib at no extra charge AND, get this, they gave her a FREE kid's package that included a little puzzle, an alphabet book and a nightlight. She was like "I didn't order this." to which they replied that every child gets one! The pool is quite big, compared to other hotels I've stayed at that offered pools. Half of it is covered and the other half is outdoors, with lounge chairs all around for sunseekers. There is a sauna and a spa but i didn't use these so I can't comment. There are several restaurants on premises which I hear are quite expensive. I think a lot of the patrons that leave reviews get the room via priceline, like us, or hotwire so it is heavily discounted but the truth is, this hotel has one of the best locations in the city and is actually worth a couple of hundred dollars a night, so to expect really inexpensive food prices is a little unrealistic. Just because you're paying $70 for the night, doesn't mean it's a $70 hotel! However, no need to worry! The hotel is connected to the PATH (underground mall) , as many have stated, so there is tons to see and eat down there, and it's right on Queen St., which is IMO, the best street in Toronto! There is a wealth of cheap eats right around the hotel and it is located smack dab in the middle of everything. I believe the room was the standard room but it was more than enough. There were two double beds, a window facing the pool, quite a large bathroom and the tv. There is also a coffeemaker and complimentary tea and (starbucks!) coffee. The beds and pillows are SUPER comfortable!! Plenty of room to move around and for a large crib. The baby, however, did not like the crib (constantly crying in it and definitely not a crying type of baby) and slept better, much to the dismay and constant worrying of my sister, on the bed with a barricade of pillows around him to prevent any falling. There are events going on all the time here but this weekend was super busy with the gay pride parade and a mexican fiesta going on at Dundas Square AND the jazz festival at Nathan Phillips Square. We could walk to each of them no problem within 10 mins. Trust me, we would not walk far with the baby! If you like going out, clubland is really nearby as well so you pretty much never have to cab if you are looking to see downtown toronto, for any reason. The events desk was extremely helpful in helping us locate the events and the route of the parade. They were able to even route out the best possible way to meet up with the parade for us. The staff everywhere was very helpful and quick to respond. Checking in and out was a breeze even though my sister forgot the confirmation papers back in Ottawa. The parking at $40/night is a bit crazy.. Just look for green P signs, which indicate municipal parking, and it should be far less expensive, like $10/night. We even found free parking during certain hours of the weekend, you just need to be on the lookout for signs. If you're visiting, don't even take a car, there's several streetcar and TTC stops really closeby! Hope this helps and you enjoy our beautiful city! Don't stay in the hotel the whole time and enjoy the benefits of being so centrally located!

Reviews.Title: “You be the judge”
Reviews.Author: garypcsc
Reviews.Content: This is a tough one so I'll just tell it as I see it. We got a great rate on Priceline and spent 2 nights at the Sheridan Centre. We were greated promptly and allowed an early check-in without any problem . We were given a nice room on the 28th floor with a great view of the city. The room, although a little drab (color scheme, a personal preference) was clean and everything functioned properly. The bed was very comfortable and the choice of pillows was nice. We visited Travelers for a drink and a lite meal. The hostess who was not busy, totally ignored us. (I must say that when I mentioned this to the desk clerk upon check out, he was ready and willing to make amends with a free breakfast or a credit to our bill). As we are a retired couple without a corporate expense account, we found the price of a hamburger at $18.00 to be outrageous only exceeded by a beer at $9.00 to $11.50. Through our 7 day travels in Ontario province EVERY PLACE we went accepted the US Dollar at PAR. Not the Sheridan, no they wanted to give us 90 cents on the dollar. So I would say that we have two things going on at the Sheridan, a staff, who for the most part provides excellent service and and an excellent product and back office bean counters who are striving to drive customers away with their prices. Why else would they need to fill so many of their rooms through Priceline. One last comment, Valet parking in now $40.00 per day and overnight parking in the adjacent garage is $23.00. The $14.00 rate mentioned in one of the reviews is good until 12PM.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice”
Reviews.Author: traveller489
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute city break to Toronto and paid a little extra to stay in the Sheraton and it was completely worth it! The location is brilliant and the rooms are an excellent size. We were on the 29th floor facing the CN tower and the view was fantastic - particularly at night. We used the leisure facilities every day, the 23 metre pool and hot tub were great bonuses in a city break. The connection to PATH led you straight to the Eaton Centre and was very handy, particularly as the weather was showery whilst we were there. We have already recomended this hotel to family who are travelling to Toronto shortly and would certainly stay again if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: missema
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and the staff were very polite and helpful. a big thumbs up on the self check in kiosk... made everything so simple!! Room service menus were somewhat limited but of the choices they did have the food was very good. The hotel is connected to the PATH underground which has a McDonalds and a Supermarket less than 30 seconds walk from the C level on the lifts. The only bad thing i would say is not that its the hotels fault, but they had a concert going on in the square facing my window which was very noisy and didnt finish untill 11pm... it didnt bother me as i was awake, but if i wanted to sleep i would have found it bothersome. I really had a good experience with this hotel, I would definatly recomend it and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clank007
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weeks holiday at the Sheraton Centre Hotel in Toronto - what a place! I asked for and was given a room overlooking the CN Tower on the 30th Floor by the lady on reception. Then a lovely woman on the tour desk booked me onto a tour to Niagara Falls, from which I have still not retrieved my breath! My room was a standard room but had everything I needed. It was spotless. You can even choose a 2 hour slot during the day when you want it cleaned - a great touch by the hotel. You are connected to the underground Path system via an escalator in the hotel lobby, plus you have free internet access at the computers by the tour desk. I cannot fault this hotel at all. The staff all couldnt do enough for me and the location was perfect for seeing everything Toronto has to offer. I want to come back to see Niagara Falls in the winter which is said to be spectacular, and this hotel will be my base again. There is no reason to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pegster110
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to echo all the recent reviews of the Sheraton Center in saying that this hotel never lets you down. Location, room and staff are all great and there never seems to be a problem with an early check-in. I'd happily stay here everytime i'm in Toronto. A+

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Centre treated us well”
Reviews.Author: Insightful_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: We selected the Sheraton Centre as the first of 7 hotel stays during a 3 week whistle-stop tour of Canada.
