Following our flight from Heathrow we were in our room, a very comfortable "twin-double" (if that is the correct terminology) an hour after our plane touched down, this despite correcting the only (small glitch) of our stay, that of firstly being allocated a smoking room (we thought all of this smoking stuff had been outlawed, but perhaps not - worth you checking). Our room had a view of the top of the CN tower & was comfortable & well air conditioned. We found the hotel staff, particularly the concierge desk, very helpful. The breakfast buffet, at C$26, set us up nicely for our days around the city sights, and we found excellent restaurants within easy walking distance. Overall, and particularly at the "less than Â£65" price we paid per room per night, we found this a good value & conveniently sited hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my Expectations”
Reviews.Author: GLASGOWCHILL
Reviews.Content: Had booked via Hotwire, got a great deal, and to be honest was not expecting too much from this place. However I was really pleased with this place considering how little I paid. The welcome here was very friendly, I requested (and paid for) an upgrade to the club level and was checked in within a couple of minutes. Room had two queen beds, was spacious and had a nice view to the south (ie. lake, CN tower and many other sky scrapers). Bathroom was rather average, but it's not somewhere I spend too much of my time so no great issue there. Used the club lounge each day for complimentary nibbles in the evening and breakfast in the morning. Was a nice place to chill out in the evening with a cocktail before heading out. Club level also offered free internet in room and free wifi in lounge. The hotel is well located, less than 5 minutes walk from Eaton Centre and Yonge street. Was able to walk to all the nightlife, restaurants and habour area without any problems. Overall, good location, friendly staff and above average facilities. Great value for money if you get a good deal like i did.

Reviews.Title: “Garden Room Location - very nice, parking too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Jason Koulouras
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton recently for a two night stay. We booked a 'junior suite' with a patio. At this hotel, this means a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor of a wing of the property. The room was quite nice inside and large at about 400 square feet. It had a king sized bed, a large desk, roll-away sofa, LCD TV, commode and shower/bath combo separate from the rest of the bathroom and good storage space. It had a patio overlooking the interior gardens, water features and walkways. The location is off of a hallway - the hallway faces north over Queen Street and the room doors are on the south side of the hallway. From time to time in the room we could hear the streetcars passby on Queen Street and also noise from the room next door which had a connecting door. This did not bother us as we are sound sleepers but it is something to be aware of if you are not. The hotel staff are very nice, gracious and try to anticipate your needs. We found the valet parking at $40 a day to be quite overpriced and since there are a number of garages nearby you may want to consider alternative parking. The ground floor restaurant - Trader's - is nice inside and roomy but could use more choices on the menu. The patio was quite nice as the interior courtyard has a number of large trees, water features and is quite pleasant on a warm spring day - I would avoid this type of room in the winter though unless it was a warm sunny thaw kind of day.

Reviews.Title: “Great as Always”
Reviews.Author: edmb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night on June 8th. I booked this room using cash and points option from the Starwood Preferred Guest Program, so I expected to be given a tiny room. However, when we showed up at 12pm (3 hours before check-in), they had a room on the preferred guest level with a king bed ready for us. The room was spacious, quiet and had a great view of the CN Tower. There was no mini bar but each floor had a vending machine. Check out in the morning was quick and easy, they leave an invoice under your door at night and if everything is correct you just drop your keys in the express check out box in the lobby. The concierge in the lobby was very attentive and immediately helped us with our bags as we stepped out of the elevator and arranged for a flat rate taxi to the airport. This attention was even more impressive based on the fact that the lobby was bustling with activity and dozens of people. This is my hotel of choice in downtown Toronto. Close to the Eaton Centre and the Entertainment District.

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks For The Sheraton Centre,Toronto”
Reviews.Author: daydreams777
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and I have just returned from our ten day break at the Sheraton Centre,Toronto. I want to start by saying that the hotel doesn't appear to be that magnificent a place from the outside,being essentially a huge grey skyscraper,but please do not be put off by that. Inside the hotel you will be met by warm and friendly staff,a lovely lobby with a mini waterfall view and cosy little seating area. The staff are extremely efficient ,always prepared to answer questions and do anything that is asked of them to their best ability. The Sherraton has three different restaurants,one is for breakfast and lunch ,(which serves a wonderful buffet breakfast ) ,Traders for pub food ,and lastly , 'Steak ' Which serves more upmarket food allowing you to dress for a special dinner and enjoy a wonderful evening meal with it's tasty,well presented dishes,the latter being the most expensive . The exit onto Queen Street West,,has a Statue of Winston Churchill facing towards the Hotel,this looks really nice,as does the water fountain display that you can see looking out of the glass windows, near the conference room in the Sheraton at night.We stayed on the 35th floor and we got a lovely view from our room window when the water fountains were all lit up at night. The high floors offer really great views of skyscrapers at night and the main Tower a really nice view of the City Hall. Our room was reserved by Tony Pepe,who works in the customer relations department at the Sheraton. This was because I was anxious about staying in a large establishment and worried that I may not get a high room with a view, so I aE.mailed the hotel to help me out. The room was so nice ,which was a real blessing as we were celebrating our birthdays, When we got into our hotel in th evening a lovely box of chocolate cookies had been placed in our room with a little note wishing us a Happy Birthday ,which I thought was a lovely touch. Tony Pepe had sent them to us and I was really appreciative of the special care and attention by the staff ,(after being a little apprehensive about how the staff might treat customers in such a huge hotel full of people!!) The Sheraton has an area in the lobby with several P.C's for use by the guests in the hotel, you will need to look out for a spare one as they are in great demand!! However ,the people on them are only on for a short time ,so you can eventually use one. The rooms have internet access also,at a price. You can go down from in the lobby of the hotel directly into the path system that takes you underground to get round and about the city,which is great in very hot weather or wet weather. I have enclosed pictures of the hotel and views from the hotel, I would recommend the Sheraton as a great place to stay,which is central in location to the main attractions in Toronto and would love to stay again. I was really thankful to all the staff who made our stay so special I give this hotel ten out of ten . e

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: EdmTraveller101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while in Toronto at the tail end of my vacation. The hotel is located in downtown Toronto with direct access to the PATH, the metro, and numerous buses going throughout the city. The airporter shuttle bus also stops within a block of the hotel, so can be reached easily using this option if you are coming in from Toronto Pearson. I arrived later evening and was guaranteed late check in which was honored, although I had requested a 1 king bed room, they only had a room with 2 queens, which I accepted. To compensate, the check in staff provided me with vouchers for breakfast both days and offered to change my room the following morning if I so chose. The room itself ( on the 16th floor) was comfortable with a great view of the Hilton, city hall, and the downtown skyline. It was clean and well stocked with Starbucks coffee, extra to-go cups for coffee, adequate towels and toiletries. Housekeeping and other hotel staff was friendly and courteous, however the hotel appears to be often utilized for large conferences and meetings, so can often be busy. There is a lobby level business centre with free internet for hotel guests and many shops throughout the concourse and lobby levels for those who want to shop. Overall a great stay and would recommend to others in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shawbee99
Reviews.Content: I have probably spent close to a month at this property in the last year or so. The staff is always really great. I love the new â€œlinkâ€� lobby design and the rooms are perfectly fine. If your there in the winter ask for one that overlooks the ice rink across the street. There is a trolley line right out the door and you are perfectly situated to the Queen Street West neighborhood as well as the typical downtown business destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Tip Top Toronto”
Reviews.Author: JCPGJP
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Sheraton. Our requests for high floor, adjacent rooms and view of City Hall were fully met (we did hear the clock - but worth it for the view!!) Expect to pay over Â£5 for a glass of beer in Traders Bar (how much?) Lots of other bars nearby at reasonable prices. I would highly recommend The Keg if you are a fan of steak, we also had a lovely Italian at Veni Vidi Vici in Little Italy, and for something a little different try The Beer Bistro on King Street. The Sheraton is a little "businessy" but very clean, great comfy beds and fab shower, top coffee machine, we were also placed near the lifts and couldn't hear a thing. Toronto is a great city, and great to tour on foot, however we also did a Hippo Tour, CN Tower and Toronto Islands, but Niagara was unforgetable and is a great trip booked through the Hotel. The whole trip was a bargain booked through Canadian Affair and after visiting the US many times, this was our fist trip to Canada but certainly won't be our last!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel to see the sights”
Reviews.Author: windy1875
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre is in an excellent location to see all the major sights of Toronto, escpecially if you are lucky enough to have a view of the CN Tower from your room like we did! We would recommend that you tackle the dizzy heights of the CN Tower as early as you can as it can get very busy. Trust me walking around the glass floor with bus loads of screaming children is not the best way to conquer your fear of heights! We also went to see the Blue Jays Baseball, a great canadian experience for those of you who haven been, tickets can be booked on the internet at the blue jays website. Toronto has the "hop on/hop off" buses which are great but the city itself can be seen better on foot, the grid system is excellent to understand and ensures you never go off track for too long ! Toronto is also a very safe city and has an excellent downtown area filled with bars and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanandcecilia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a very good hotel in an excellent location. As it was directly above the PATH underground, it was incredibly easy to walk towards the harbour, the Eaton Centre and the CN Tower. The hotel was also in between two subway stations making desinations such as Bloor Street, Union Station and the Royal Ontario Musemn that much easier to get to. It is also situated on Queens Street West which is full of excellent shops, restaurants and boutiques. The hotel itself if definately catered towards business and large conventions but it is also a fantastic hotel for families. We had interconnecting rooms on the 4th floor in the Queens tower. We were in an adjoining annex to the main Queens Tower and the rooms were definiately bigger than the rooms in the main tower with much larger bathrooms with a separate bath/shower and toilet. I travelled with my parents, wife and infant son, and the hotel kindly met our request for inconnecting rooms with king beds, cot bed, kettle and fridge. They were all free of charge. The rooms have a small balcony which overlook the swimming pool. Admittedly it didn't have the view of the CN Tower or City Hall but we definately willing to forgo that for the larger interconnecting rooms. The rooms have a flat screen TV, safe and the hotel has a self service laundry and a good swimming pool which stays open every night until 10 pm. They also have a very good spa which we tried out. We didn't notice the chiming bells of the old City Hall clock tower but I would imagine it would be a lot more audible for the guests staying in the main Queens Tower closest to the clock. There is also free internet access and it was never busy when I used mainly because I used it either first thing in the morning or last thing at night. Didn't try the hotel restaurants considering there were so many restaurants close by to the hotel. Also I am a member of the Starwood Preferred Guest scheme but used the main check in area which was very quick and efficient with a kind gentleman porter helping us take our bags to the rooms immediately. I was slightly disappointed to find out that our 7 night stay at the Sheraton would not count towards the Starwood Preferred Guest scheme as we had booked the holiday via Expedia. Overall, it was a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiResident
Reviews.Content: The hotel is connected to PATH, the underground network of walkways in Toronto and this was one of the reasons we selected it. Useful when it's rainy which did happen while we were there. However, as far as location is concerned, the next time, I would probably look for a hotel in the Bloor Street, Spadina or Yorkville areas rather than Queen Street West. The hotel is very nice in most respects. Good rooms (ours overlooked the CN Tower); had everything you would need. Standard Sheraton tolietries, an in-room safe, in-room iron and ironing board. The in-room coffeemaker had Starbucks Coffee. Great stuff. The hotel has attached shopping, a nice pool, good breakfast, a cafe in the lobby that 'proudly' (in their words) brewed Starbucks coffee. However, it takes time to speak to the Operator or to Guest Services and requests are almost never filled correctly. Guest Services, will, however, follow up to ensure the request is eventually met. Good intentions, but lackadaisical application. Efficient bell desk, good laundry service. Exellent room service. Surprising lack of adequate dining options, though. A pleasant experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Centre - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: kansel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Centre from 4th - 9th May 2008. Rooms are above average in size and we were pleased to have our request for a room with a view granted and our room was on the 18th floor and overlooked Nathan Phillips Square. The room had 2 double beds, flat screen tv, comfy chair, desk and office chair. It was immaculately clean and nicely decorated. The beds are usual Sheraton quality - i.e. the most comfortable beds ever! We had a couple of issues with the bathroom during our stay but nothing to cause major concern. The shower had excellent pressure and there was always plenty of hot water available. The hotel itself is HUGE which if you like small boutique hotels may put you off a bit. The size of it naturally makes it a bit impersonal but for the Â£60 we paid per night it was an absolute steal.

Reviews.Title: “good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: daddylaird
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on a short 3 day break, we were in a room on the 28th floor and the first thing I must say is that there was not even the slightest whiff of cigarette smoke in our room and believe me as both strong non smokers we would have noticed, so previous post must have been unlucky, like Scotland,Wales, Ireland & England you are not allowed to smoke in public places in Toronto although unlike here it would appear that you can smoke in hotel bedrooms but again I must stress that there was no sign of this, the hotel was very clean and well run as you would expect, the staff that we came across were all very helpful although we found this was not the case with all Canadians once you were out the hotel. Also as stated in a previous post there is a bell that chimes on the hour, apparently it chimes every 15 mins but no way does this wake you up as we only heard it if we were already awake and we are not aware of even hearing it all when not on the hour so even light sleepers can rest easy on that score, the only down side for us was the cost of drinks at the bar as a pint of Canadian lager and a glass of white wine was 23 dollars (you can do the maths yourself) this was the only drink we had in the hotel although you will find bars in and around the old town area expensive as well so be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: FrmNJ
Reviews.Content: I travel to Toronto 2-3 times a year on business, and most of my meetings are in the financial district. Being a Starwood frequent guest, I am tied to either the Sheraton Center, Westin Harbor Castle and Le Meridien King Edward. After wasting many a dollar at Kind Edward (right next to the financial district but old, musty rooms in need of serious makeover) and Westin Harbor Castle (wonderful, contemporarily furnished rooms and views, but 20-30 minutes away from the ciy center), I found this hotel. The rooms are furnished like classy Westins or Ws. There is a big flat screen TV, usual Sheraton Sweet Sleeper bed, and a work desk with charging slots for electronic equipment. The breakfast buffet was great, check in and check out quick, and everything was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: TearsForSpears
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the best hotel i've everbeen to, fantastically located. the people were so welcoming and refreshments were avalible the minute we entered. Someone took our bags upstairs for us, and the entire process of checking in was so simple. Because there were three of us they gave us a special deluxe room though we certainly didnt pay the price for it! and had our own dining room and lviing room which was brilliant. The small touches you normally have to pay extra or dont find in hotels as big as this were brilliant, children and adult books in the lobby in a cosy area for families to enjoy, free chess game tables AND magazines. Also, every guest got 1 hour free internet surfing everyday which was briliant and convinient and there were so many little shops and coffee places directly from the hotel down to a huge shopping centre. The swimming pool was clean, the sauna was amazing and the spa was a dream. i have nothing bad to say about this place, and i wish i can go back! when we left, we actually said it felt like leaving home and right now i still feel like the hotel is my home! its brilliant. I would advise you try their lobby restaurant food, it is definitly the best restaurantin the world with a award winning chef, this hotle beats all the stuffy cold minimalist overpriced hotels out there e.g .hilton, the ritz. Sheraton has the extras and the feeling of being at home and not a rented room is so nice. I know they dont need any publicity but i have to say, this is just wonderful, i would tell anyone to go there hand on my heart, dont bother with those other hotels who say they haveall these things but when you go, its all extra costs. Loved my one week stay and hopefully i'll go back soon!! The one thing i'd say is bad, is the price of booking, you must be book earlier othweise one nigght is very expensive. but still, good hotel and excellent throughout. do not judge on photos its really nice in real life.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carole17
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Priceline for this hotel. great location - right in the centre, connected to the Eaton Centre and tram stop, underground station and tourist bus stops right outside. Room was large with great views of City Halls. Room was very comfortable and clean. Didn't eat here, but there is a food hall downstairs with nice places for breakfast (Try the Marketplace). Huge choice of restaurants for dinner close by. Very friendly staff and concierge was very helpful with restaurant recommendations and bookings. pleasant lobby area with free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Well located huge convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: This is a very well located hotel, right in the nice center of Toronto and steps from many wonderful Toronto attractions, restaurants, cafes and landmarks. Parking is not cheap. The hotel itself is absolutely huge: avoid if you easily get disoriented as you can easily get up the wrong elevators otherwise. The rooms are standard sheraton fair: nice beds, decent upkeep. The food at the hotel is expensive but very good with multiple choices. Gym is ok.

Reviews.Title: “One more time!”
Reviews.Author: ephemeral
Reviews.Content: I booked one week prior to our (my friends and I) stay directly through their website after learning about a promo they had. I ended up paying close to half of what they normally charge. The lobby was great and it was step away from major places in downtown. I live in Toronto but just wanted a night out with my friends. :) I knew that it was very close to the mall and would definitely have a great view of downtown. We also took advantage of their pool which was partly open to venture outside. I wish the pool was a bit warmer though but other than that no major complain. The room was designed elegantly and the bed was very comfortable. I wouldn't mind staying for another night here.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBBUN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a self contained suite (ie a bedroom and living room with sofa couch and offer of roll up bed if needed) for 2 days in March with our two under tens at $219 a night. We were very impressed with this hotel. We were struck by the quality of fixtures in our room (very comfortable bed and powerful shower) and the attention to detail, for instance, the Starbucks coffee machine in the room, the childrenâ€™s welcome pack (games, colouring and a soft toy), 2 flat screen TVs and the milk and cookies that were sent up to our room on our first night. Mostly though we were bowled over by the fantastic service, particularly the front desk and Michael F in particular. It made us feel very welcome. Our room had a wonderful view of City Hall, the ice skating rink and Toronto skyline. It was just magical at night. We all enjoyed the indoor/outdoor pool and Jacuzzi and the free access to internet enabled PCs was very useful. We ate in Traders and Steak. Food in both was good though quite overpriced. Having said that, as the hotel is located close to two separate subway routes and the PATH system, cheaper options would have been easily accessible if our children hadnâ€™t hit the food meltdown point. We also spent a few days in the Delta Chelsea. Although they have slightly better facilities for kids (especially the arts and crafts centre) the Sheraton is significantly more modern and luxurious and made the children feel special. If we were returning to Toronto for a two or three day break, with or without children, we would stay in the Sheraton without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sleep, Great Price (on Hotwire & Priceline)”
Reviews.Author: via_the_bee
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for the weekend for a course and got a great deal on the Sheraton Toronto Centre through Hotwire ($95/night). I took the overnight bus from Ottawa to Toronto. It wasn't the most comfortable journey, and I really needed to refresh myself before my course. Luckily, the Sheraton didn't disappoint. ROOM They had a room ready for me by 6:45AM (a crazy early check-in time) on the 34th floor facing the CN Tower. The room had a coffee maker that brews Starbucks coffee - complete with Starbucks cups - and an LG flat screen TV (I didn't actually use the TV). A quick snooze in the Sweet Sleeper bed and a shower (the soap and shampoo smell like oranges) perked me right up. BED Of all of the things I love about the Sheraton, their bed has to be their best asset. I slept like a baby and woke up refreshed from my nap and my overnight sleep - I would have slept in longer if I didn't have a course to go to! I could hear a bit of noise from the hall and from the street below, but it didn't bother me at all. RESTAURANT The breakfast buffet was also extensive - I had a mixed vegetable omelette made to order, a yogurt and fruit parfait, toast, cheese, and grapefruit juice - but it was expensive ($26+tax). The ketchup was cool - it came in single serving-sized glass bottles. STAFF The staff were all friendly, but occasionally they were too sure of themselves. For example, when I asked about what time the local Goodlife Fitness (a gym) opened, I got the same answer - 6:30AM - from two different employees, but the actual time is 8:00AM on weekends. GYM Since the Goodlife trip wasn't going to work with my schedule, I inquired about the hotel gym. I was initially disappointed to learn that the hotel's fitness centre costs $9 per use for the first two uses, but I noticed through the window that this isn't an average hotel gym - they have an extensive selection of heavier dumbbells and bars and a variety of weight machines and cardio equipment. The gym is open 24 hours and seems well worth the small fee. LOBBY I returned to the hotel in the evening and watched a bit of a boxing match in the hotel lobby. There is free wireless Internet and a business centre down there - it gets pretty crowded on the hotel terminals, so I recommend using your own laptop if you can. I also rocked in a chair in front of their waterfall garden (which was very relaxing). The lobby is modern, well-equipped, and a great place to socialize. POOL The indoor/outdoor pool, the whirlpool, and sauna were also well-maintained. The pool was nice and warm, and it was kind of cool to swim outside in the early morning when it was still cold out. The whirlpool jets could have been a might stronger, but it was kept at a decent temperature (not boiling hot). I met a group of guys in the whirlpool who had got their rooms through Priceline at $60/night, so it was clear that there were great deals out there. The quality of the hotel at these low discount prices is absolutely incredible. OVERALL This was an excellent hotel overall, and I recommend it to anyone, even more so if you can get the room on the cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer service”
Reviews.Author: jfcovi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Toronto for Halloween and stayed 7 days in total. I was with my wife and two kids. We had a wonderful time. This is a great hotel. I will definitely take my folks there again.

Reviews.Title: “gr8 hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmrsoubielou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sheraton for 1 week. The hotel is situated in a great location, easy walking distance to all toronto has to offer. NIAGRA fALLS IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING AND A MUST TO ALL TRAVELLERS. We went to 4 shows - Dirty Dancing, a good show, We will Rock You, Fantastic, Evil Dead is so funny and a must for anyone with a sense of humour,please dont pass this one bye. Last and most definately least The Paranormal Show at the Disel Theatre, it was so terrible it was hillarious!!! Please do not waste your money at this dreadful show. The CN tower and the glass floor is well worth a visit, as is lawrence st marrket, especially one of uno moustachios famous sandwiches, delicious!! We found Traders to be a little on the expensive side but ther are loads of places to eat close at hand, n if you like shopping the eaton centr is the olace for you.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Good Location, Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: rabid_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sheraton Centre, Toronto on business for 4 nights during February. First impressions of the hotel are good, with a welcoming hand from uniformed staff at the front door to a very quiet check-in desk with plenty of staff. The hotel reception area is large with a comfy seating area and tables with free wifi access, an internet zone, small shop, and a cafe selling Starbucks coffee - the free wifi makes this an ideal place to check mails etc even if you arenâ€™t staying in the hotel. A set of 'rocking' chairs facing out onto the artificial waterfall are popular at all times of the day and are great fun to sink into at the end of a day with a book and watching the comings and goings. My suite was located on the 6th floor as was very well sized and comfortable. A flat panel tv in both the lounge and bedroom areas were a nice touch and the furnishings were to a good standard. The lack of a fridge was the only downside - I like to keep some bottles of water, and snacks in the hotel room in case of late night munchies and the lack of fridge or mini-bar in the room meant having a carrier bag out on the side. The Bathroom was well sized with a solid bath with power shower over, plenty of towels although a little small, and the usual selection of 'smellies' (Shampoo, Shower Gel, Soap etc), face tissues, and Hairdryer. A nice addition was the 'recycle' box in the bathroom where used newspapers, paper bags etc could be left for recycling - the first time I have seen this in a hotel and something I think all hotels should offer as well as the normal policy of requesting guests to reuse sheets/towels to save on water/chemical use. The bed was comfortable with a firm mattress and a number of layers of sheets and duvets which made temperature control very easy as you could shrug layers off during the night. A radio clock alarm is provided and there is plenty of drawer space although the cupboard is in the lounge area of the suite which felt odd as you have to pad through the room to grab your trousers/shirt in the morning. The one element I really didn't like in the room was the lighting - other than the bathroom there were no wall switches in the suite to operate the lights - each light was controlled via a lamp switch toggle which meant having to turn each one on and off individually. The room had two heating controls (one in the bedroom, one in the lounge) which operated hot/cold air blowers mounted under the windows - the system functioned well and it didn't take long for the room to warm up or cool down when needed. The location of the hotel is excellent for the business district, with the CN Tower and Rogers Centre easily within walking distance. The Hotel is joined onto the PATH system as well so you really donâ€™t have to step outside if the weathers cold. Breakfast was an open buffet style affair and there was plenty of choice although some of the cooked breakfast options did appear to have been sat in their 'canteens' for some while. During my stay there were a number of conferences with the public areas getting quite busy with conference attendees so if you're looking for somewhere away from the hustle and bustle this wouldn't be ideal. In summary the Hotel was comfortable with friendly staff although a little busy in the 'public' areas. I would recommend spending some time trawling the web for the best available price as their seemed to be a large number of possible 'options' and packages which greatly affected the price of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NicolaCV
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Sheraton. We discovered on our first day at the hotel that our toilet blocked, I reported this to reception and within 20 minutes the problem had been resolved and been checked by reception. The hotel has a great view of the City Hall and the City Centre. We used the PATH system on the days when it was too cold to be outside or too wet and this is really straight forward to use - I would also recommend that you download a map and print it before you go. We took the advice of a previous traveller and went to see Dirty Dancing, the show was brilliant and if you love the film I would highly recommend that you go to see this! The hotel is a good location to stay in and is close to the Eaton Centre and also the CN Tower. We went to Niagara Falls for a couple of nights and then returned for 1 night. When checking in for the second time, we discovered the room we were allocated was less than perfect. I reported this to reception and we were immediately upgraded and given complimentary breakfast. We ate every night at the restaurant in the hotel called Traders, the menu isn't that large but we tried something different every night and we were not disappointed. The room is well equipped and has a free safety deposit box and a large TV, coffee machine. This was my first trip to Toronto and the location was spot on. Also, we used the Airport Express as a transfer service from the airport. This stops just outside the hotel and runs all day every day and is $16.95 from the airport

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Centre: Good Choice in DT Toronto”
Reviews.Author: SFGuy35
Reviews.Content: Booked a two-night stay here in March 2008 through Hotwire for $79/night US. At that rate, it turned out to be a solid choice in a good location in downtown Toronto. Check-in was pretty quick although the clerk took a long, annoying phone call right before helping me. Later noticed long lines at check-in. As soon as I got to my room and settled down for a quick nap, the phone rang: it was the front desk just making sure the room was okay. A case of "service" going a bit too far. But the room was fine: flat-screen TV, desk with internet cord and electrical plugs, good heat control, comfortable bed. Television in next room clearly audible. Internet service appeared free one day and then stopped, showing me a screen asking for $15 for 24 hours. I called guest services to make sure a certain area code was a local call, and that local calls were free; I was told "yes" to both and made my call. A few minutes later they called back to say that "just letting you know, local calls are $2." Cute. Room was in the Queen tower, north side; good location and was not bothered at all by the hourly bells. Ordered breakfast from room service and it was prompt and very good, but $34. Gym facilities better than some. Equipment a bit of a mish-mash (and the area could use a renovation) but lots of machines and weights, treadmills, yoga mats. Pool is a good size, indoor-outdoor aspect probably more fun in the summer. Lobby area is nice, with a coffee bar and free internet, although only four computers were working and most were usually in use. Free wifi in that area as well. Single espresso and tiny San Pellegrino came to $7.41. The Airport Express bus ($16.95 one way) stops outside the hotel and is a great way to get to the airport, it only makes a few other downtown hotel stops, and took around 40 minutes. The hotel's location is good, steps from the Eaton Centre mall and Yonge St. shops and subway; nightlife area on King St. a short $10 cab ride away. Not a ton of stuff in the immediate vicinity although there are shops and fast food in the underground passages below the hotel. All in all, for under $100 night it was a pleasant if unremarkable stay, good facilities with some service flaws. I walked by the Delta Chelsea, a hotel with a similar price and availability on sites like HotWire, and its location seemed less central and entrance area an unfriendly maze of car ramps. The Sheraton Centre is a better choice at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for Value”
Reviews.Author: chieffunfairy
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business and I feel I was overcharged for what I received. The toilet "ran" and I had to jiggle the handle. The TV had terrible reception and was un-watchable. I must say the bed and linens were extraordinary but it was hard to overlook the small room and other challenges. Not worth $275 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Oh say can you see...lots!”
Reviews.Author: MplsguyMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown Toronto--close to CN Tower, Queen Street shopping, and riverfront. You can take the subway (TTC) from nearby Osgood Station to many places (even gets you close to the far away airport; transfer to bus) Close by restaurants. Quality service!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and hotel but watch out for expensive drinks!”
Reviews.Author: kerrbear29
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire and got an AWESOME room for 79.00 plus tax which was a HUGE saveings. Very large bathroom and comfy king bed with a balcomy overlooking the outdoor part of the heated pool which looked cool in the snowstorm! Went to the bar/restaurant (not sure what its called) but it boosts over 25 kinds of beer. We ordered a pint of coors light and a pint of Guinness and later found out they were $9 and $12!!! The pint was the same price as my meal! Other than that, we very much enjoyed our stay. Swim in the pool and go to the outside part especially if it is snowing, loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: usernanc
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel. This is a very nice hotel with a great lobby. I enjoyed the free computers that were available in the lobby to use and get on the internet. We were in Toronto during a snowstorm and found the hotel very convenient for seeing the sites without venturing outdoors. The PATH is connected to the hotel. You can use this to get to everything (we walked to the subway, Eaton, CN Tower, Royal Alexandra Theater, etc...). Make sure to print a map off of the internet http://---.pdf so you can easily navigate. The website map will give you the names of the buildings that are referenced on the signs in the tunnels. Most other maps do not reference the building and it gets tricky without this information. We also did the shop dine tour Toronto. It is a yellow bus that you can hop on and off. They have a stop at the hotel to pick-up and drop off. If Dirty Dancing is still playing I highly recommend that you go see it. It is a $5.00 cab ride from the hotel to the theater if you don't want to use the PATH. Tickets sell out early but you can go to the box office the day of the show and they may have extra tickets. The hotel has a travel desk that will help you get tickets. They can get great seats but do charge a service fee. If you don't have any special check-in / out request use the self-service kiosk. This allows you to skip the long line at the registration desk.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler333Windsor
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel as we read the reviews on here before going and made sure to get a room overlooking Nathan Phillips Square, where the ice rink is. We got a corner room on the 5th floor (room 547), which was the farthest away you can get from the bell tower. We couldn't even here it chime. The staff were helpful and friendly. We ate at the Traders restaurant in the hotel and the food was good, moderately expensive. would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a winter break”
Reviews.Author: EvieVee
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff very friendly. Hotel centrally situated with underground access to the Bay and the Eaton Centre. During our visit the temperature was between -10 and -20 C, so when it was snowing, it was a great way to go shopping! There is a big variety of places around the hotel to eat out, though eating at the hotel is also an option. Our room was large and very clean, and the view towards the old and new City Halls over the ice rink was light up at night and made the whole area very attractive. We did occasionally hear the bell that some have complained about, but we were in the middle of a city and some noise is to be expected. The indoor-outdoor pool was a great experience, and in the winter time, not one to be missed. Again the staff there were pleasant and friendly. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel, and out of 10, I would give it 12!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TeamMP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Centre for six nights and have no complaints whatsoever. The room was a good size with an excellent view - other reviewers have commented on the loudness of the chimes from the bell tower and whilst we did hear it occassionally I would say it was a very minimal background noise that barely registered. We ate room service several nights - well priced and plenty of food delivered in 15 minutes on average! We also ate lunch at Traders and were very impressed with the food and the friendliness of the staff, and ate dinner at Steak which we found to be pricey but the food was excellent so it wasn't a major issue. All members of staff were extremely helpful, especially the tour-desk staff who helped us book an excursion to Niagara (well worth doing) as well as a city tour. We had a late evening flight and were able to leave our luggage in storage until we were ready to go to the airport at which time we were provided with a towncar immediately, which at a fixed fee of $47 was cheaper than a taxi and way more comfortable and luxurious. There was free internet available at 5 terminals in the lobby which was a nice bonus and lots of comfy seats to lounge around in whilst contemplating what to do next. The location was excellent, very central with a 5 minute walk to the Eaton Centre which could be accessed using the underground PATH system. All in all, we were very impressed with the hotel and all its facilities and staff and would definitely stay there again on our next visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: writetosfa
Reviews.Content: I got this on priceline for $70 - way worth it! It has an excellent downtown location, walking distance from Nathan Phillips Square and The Toronto Eaton Centre. The room was great - we got a higher floor facing the CN Tower - it was a beautiful view. The bed was so nice - I loved it! Internet should be free - so many places are offering that service now, they need to get with the times a bit on that one. The pool was great, but a little crowded, hard to find a beach chair and service for drinks VERY slow. Only problem (but not really the hotel's fault) was that the fire alarm went off at 4am and we had to evacuate. But, after 5 minutes we went back in, but no one really explained what had happened or offered any restitution. All in all, a great place to stay in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: spurslass
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from this hotel on my first trip to Toronto. The hotel was great, as per many reviews on this site, and just as I expected. I had a room overlooking city hall on the 37th floor (club level). It was directly opposite the old city hall with clock which strikes on the hour every hour, but this did not affect sleep as mentioned in a reivew before, as the beds were so comfy, I defy anyone not to have a great nights sleep. One tip I would give for anyone wanting to book is that the Club Lounge is now temporarily closed for refurbishment until April, I think, and breakfast & hors d'oeuvres are now served in the Bistro on 2. This had the added advantage of having breakfast upgraded to hot & cold from just continental (which was great anyway), so you can have omelettes, waffles, bacon etc as well now. The hotel is very central, about a 2 mins walk to the Eaton Centre and no more than 20 minutes walk from CN tower and Rogers Centre. If you want an alternative to the Eaton Centre, try Bloor St which is a bit more upmarket - easy to walk in about 30 or catch the TTC which goes from the corner of the block where the hotel is situated. I would also recommend booking on a Canadian website as you will be able to claim back the GST/PST on any accomodation under the Visitor Tax Refund scheme. Under this scheme, keep any receipts for purchases, especially clothes, for more than CAN$50 and as long as your receipts total CAN$200 or more, you can make a claim. Overall, Toronto is a great place, but not a spectacular as New York as most of the buildings are very grey, very 50's & 60's, although there are a few Victorian and Deco buildings about if you like to look at the architecture. A must is Niagara Falls, the sights are amazing, even in winter. The tour desk in the lobby offers a great trip, which on the face of it looks expensive CAN$164 per adult, but is well worth it as the guide can me excellent and interest information along the whole route and was very knowledgeable. It also included a buffet lunch at the Sheraton overlooking the American Falls - great views.

Reviews.Title: “One Downside”
Reviews.Author: lilkal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Sheraton, hotels location was brilliant, you could walk everywhere within 15 mins which is just as well as there was a huge snow storm and for a day it knocked out all transport. We opted for the club level and must say it is the nicest club level lounge of all the sheratons we have stayed in. The view is fantastic and a good selection of breakfast is available (we were never around for the h;deourves). The staff was polite and extremely helpful. The tour desk booked a private tour for us and we were not disappointed at all. We had a room that overlooked the ice rink and the shows for the winter festival which was really nice unfortunately there is a bell tower a stone throw from the hotel which chimes each and every hour (yes including 1:00am, through to 6:00am - still if you wanted to know the time throughout the night you did not need to look at the clock just listen to the chimes). We would not stay at this hotel again or any in the surrounding area of the bell tower as the chimes (unless of course we took eye plugs) as after 3 nights were were very exhausted. We were offered a move to the other side but the hotel is rather slim and although the noise was slightly less it would not have solved the problem and we could not be bothered to move all our clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed for visiting Toronto and surrounding areas.”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethEngland
Reviews.Content: Large hotel in the middle of Toronto, well placed for visiting all that is going on in the city. The only problem we had was with noise - the rooms we had were overlooking the Town Hall which has a clock that chimes every 15 minutes. However, the hotel staff were very accommodating and moved us when we asked. They also offered us a complimentary breakfast as compensation. Overall a good hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: FrankDrebin
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a family vacation back to North America, at which time we stayed in several Sheraton properties including the Sheraton Centre in downtown Toronto. Initially I was a little apprehensive since this is a huge property (800+ rooms) and figured it would be very outdated or cold and unfriendly. Our actual experience was refreshingly the opposite. I was traveling with my wife and two young boys (3.5 and 1.5) so we had requested adjoining rooms as a necessity. Thankfully the reservation was perfect and after a seamless check in at the Preferred Guest 'lounge' (a perk at such a busy hotel) we went up to our rooms on the 11th floor. I was quite surprised by the 'updated' decor of the rooms. The beds were all plush and cosy looking (not positive whether they were Sweet Sleeper Beds but very comfortable) which was a welcome change from some of the beds we'd experienced over the previous few weeks. Everything was in good shape, including the bathrooms and amenities. We had a great view over the ice rink at Town Hall, which the kids were fascinated by. Overall the experience was great. The staff were all very friendly and despite the chaos and the hectic feel of this big hotel, we never felt overwhelmed. The rooms are clean and comfortable and and the location is right smack in the middle of everything. I would definitely go back to this property in the future, especially if traveling with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - Too Pricey!”
Reviews.Author: michellefromontario
Reviews.Content: Service: Great! Front desk was very helpful... they overcharged for a bar service which we never did and removed it right away no question Price: Overpriced ..then again it was New Years and all hotels are overpriced! Rooms: Okay - small, washrooms are a bit outdated, great plasma screen TV though, and very helpful room service guy who brought extra blankets/towels =) Oh.. thanks to 'Andy', my girlfriends and I were satisfied wtih our eggs and bacon at 6am! ;) Overall I would visit again. I like the Sheraton on the Falls in Niagara better though! Those rooms come with a fireplace and a couch!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping the Path underground”
Reviews.Author: IrishLass38
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Toronto in the middle of Winter this hotel is located in a great spot.Walk underground on the Path for miles without a coat on to shop in many types of businesses without freezing.Sightseeing trips and discounted theatre tickets are available directly at the hotel.If you are lucky enough to get a room directly across from City Hall you can watch the ice skaters as they spin around the outdoor rink,all ages and sizes.We were there when they had the Winter Festival going and were able to watch fireworks from our room on a Saturday evening..quite a sight from the warmth of our room.Hotel is pricey for meals but within walking distance of many areas to dine.The train trip from Windsor to Toronto is a great way to experience Canada with good rates on a package at the hotel included.We will return.

Reviews.Title: “My home from home”
Reviews.Author: CiaransMum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times now, for leisure and business. Its a great location in downtown Toronto with immediate access to the underground network of shops and a great view to the CN Tower or over the City Halls. There is a fast, frequent and cheap bus that drops you right at the hotel from the airport and there are good bars, restaurants and sight seeing opportunities everywhere. The rooms are excellent and we have received an upgrade for a few of our visits here. Recently stayed here with my 2 year old son and there was plenty of room for an extra bed and all his stuff. There is good free internet access in the lobby as well as conection in the room. Will certainly be staying again. Its great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great for business travelers-take a taxi!!”
Reviews.Author: 1stephbaker
Reviews.Content: I think its a great hotel for business travel, meetings, etc. The lobby is expanse with comfortable, private places for informal meetings. The lobby bar is an upstyle pub that offers a great atmosphere for networking and meeting with colleagues. We stayed there for a conference and had a private reception suite that was really big and the food, bar, etc. was wonderful! They were very accomodating. The ONLY negative I have is the ease of access. While its located in Toronto, I wouldn't recommend walking to the convention center or the arena. Also, we rented cars and it was very difficult to get to the hotel due to the confusing one way streets!! I recommend taking a taxi or corporate car if possible if you aren't familiar with the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Did not enjoy our stay”
Reviews.Author: MKChicago
Reviews.Content: The positives: The hotel was in a very nice location with great access to the underground city. The lobby was beautiful, and the view was nice. The room was comfortable. The negatives: This hotel charges people as if it was a super-fancy hotel. Every little thing costs a tremendous amount. We were there for three days and were charged $70 for fridge in the room, $110 for parking, $15 per day for internet - not to mention the price of the room which wasn't cheap, even with a special conference rate. This would be fine if the hotel was actually a fancy hotel, but in fact the hotel was mediocre at best. The sheets and towels were not always 100% clean (it wasn't as if there were massive stains, but they weren't pristine either), the TV looked impressive as a flat screen, but the picture was worse than a big box TV and there didn't appear to be premium cable (is there premium cable in Canada?). There were little things that bugged us too - like the fact that out neighbor left their used room service food outside their door and didn't have it picked up for more than a day, or that there was a light out in the hallway, and that the elevator button didn't light up on our floor, or that the ice machine was broken on our floor for all three days. Each of these things is a little annoyance on its own, but together with each other and the nickel and dime attitude, I found the overall experience unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “won't go back”
Reviews.Author: jumpinhorsedad
Reviews.Content: The value just wasn't there. You expect to pay more for a 4 star or sheraton hotel but you also expect the service to be better. It wasn't the things that went wrong were a mile long. Noisy room beside elevator shaft, TV that didn't work and they couldn't replace, fire alarm, hotel picketed by protestors causing the place to fill up with 20 TO police officers - not so good when hosting visiting guests. my wife an i both got sick from the Club Room buffet. the food was stale - what was supposed to hard was soft and what was suppsed to he soft was hard. we booked the entire trip through expedia (and saved a lot) so we did not pay for the rooms while there. but we did have to leave a card on file and on two occasions the hotel billed us for over $1,000.00 worth of services and charges - none of which were valid and were all removed, but only after we spoke to a manager. Dining throughout the hotel was bad and expensive. What we did like - great king beds very comfortable!, great view, and great location close to shopping and the toronto PATH system which allowed us to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Richmond Tower - Horrible”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the hotel...the first was an average stay (see my July review - avoid the rooms by service elevators). The second was in August and was a decent stay for 4 nights (the room was nice, quiet and I do love the workout facilities at this hotel). The third stay was last week and was terrible. I was put into the Richmond Tower which was the first time. Here's the issues with the Richmond Tower: 1) It's lower, and right off of Richmond Street which is a terribly busy and loud street. And being lower to the ground (I think guest suites are floors 3 - 10 here with offices above that) you are close enough to hear even loud yelling on the street and definitely close enough to hear trucks, sirens and car horns. 2) The bed was an OLD double bed. It was uncomfortable and noisy. 3) The rooms are not well insulated and I could hear my neighbours alarm go off and his phone ring. I heard EVERYTHING in the hall way. 4) The gym is back over in the other towers so you get to walk through the ALWAYS busy lobby in your sweaty clothes. This was particularly pleasant for me on this trip as there was a formal cocktail reception in the hotel and everyone in their black tie attire had the pleasure of having me wander through their crowd after I'd been working out. I can't say I won't be back, but my list of rooms to avoid (the loud ones by the service elevators, and anything in the Richmond tower) is growing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: teacro
Reviews.Content: My family (including myself, my husband and 4 young children) stayed here for 5 nights the first week of December. The Sheraton Centre proved to be an excellent choice for us. We were a little worried when we arrived as it is a huge hotel that obviously has a lot of conferences and business events. We were not sure it would cater well to us and our kids. Also, the check-in queue in the mid-afternoon was very long. However to its credit, the line moved very quickly at reception and when we checked in we found the front desk staff exceedingly friendly, helpful and efficient. We had no trouble getting the room configuration we needed (connecting rooms with 1 king and 2 double), which is something that a lot of hotels seem to have trouble with. Whilst they didn't have it available on the first night they accommodated us in a large suite that was more than adequate and then moved us to the 2 connecting rooms the next day without fuss or bother. The rooms were large and very comfortable. We stayed on the club level and I highly recommend paying the extra to do this. It is not that much more expensive and for the price you get access to the club lounge, (very comfortable to hang out outside your room) and their sumptuous continental breakfast in the mornings. The breakfast included a big variety of fresh fruit, cereal and yoghurt, a variety of breads and croissants, cold meats etc. It was attractively presented and fresh and tasty and what particularly impressed us was the wonderful and welcoming service from the breakfast attendants who were all friendly, efficient and helpful. You can also access the club lounge in the evening for drinks and complimentary hors d'oervres with dips, cheeses and biscuits and little appetisers which again were tasty and plentiful. (I confess we made this our dinner a couple of nights). There is also wireless access in the club lounge which is great as the internet access in the lobby is often busy. Any requests we made of the hotel were dealt with promptly and we had particularly good assistance from the tour desk with any queries we made. The hotel pool (half indoor/half outdoor) and hot tub was fantastic even in winter. The fitness room was well-equipped. It was bitterly cold whilst we were there (we live in a very hot climate) but you could access all parts of the city from the underground network of walkways which was terrific for getting around with the kids. For family activities, the CN Tower was fantastic and the ice-skating rink across the road was huge fun for the kids. Eaton Centre was also just a short walk away. We have travelled extensively around the world with our kids and all in all this was one of the best hotel experiences we have had.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: stuey44
Reviews.Content: The 4 star rating is perfect for this hotel. it has a great location, linked to the underground city so you dont even have to go out in the cold!! the rooms were recently renovated, and included a good size bathroom with plenty of towels, a flat screen tv, internet access, excellent views and quick check in. for those previous reviews that complain of long check in times - did you not see the self check in screens in the lobby!!! the staff were friendly and the tour desk very helpful in arranging car hire and any other trip you are interested in.

Reviews.Title: “Full Scale Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times. On my most recent trip I was pleasantly surprised to find that they have remodeled the rooms. There is a moderate sized gym and large pool..however the pool was closed and there is a fee to use the equipment. There are several bars and restaurants on site and direct underground access to the Toronto underground (Path) system. I would highly recommend the hotel for both location and large choice of ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, average rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: Teamjurgie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed over the thanksgiving holiday. When we arrived the only rooms available were smoking rooms. When we complained, we were given a choice of a tiny, tiny room with one double bed, or a "loud room near the elevators." We took the double bed, but came back down to the desk when we realized how tiny the room was. We were given a suite for $60 more per night. By that time I just wanted a room. The suite ended up being huge, but was old and had some obvious water stains on the ceilings and trim molding. Otherwise, our stay was pretty enjoyable. Great location. Nice lobby and public areas. But not what I would consider a 4-star hotel. It is a huge business conference hotel that is too big to provide much in the way of service. I would not stay here again, despite the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: babycoco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton this past weekend and I was very disappointed with my stay. This was the weekend of the Grey Cup so the hotel was apparently overbooked. I was travelling with a group and we were all placed in different parts, on different floors of the hotel... it was a complete diaster. Our group booked non smoking rooms but ended up in smoking rooms since only smoking roooms were available at check in. On the positive side, the location of the hotel was ideal. It was close to the malls and several restaurants etc... The view of from my hotel room was priceless and aside from the stench of stale smoke, I was happy with the comfortable bed, clean bathroom and flat screen TV. To conclude, I would defintely recommend this hotel to anyone. However, be prepared for possible disappointments.

Reviews.Title: “On top of the world!”
Reviews.Author: Arbie
Reviews.Content: ...which is exactly how both my partner and i felt each morning and evening when using the club lounge. We paid extra for the 42nd floor club room with king size bed which allowed full access to the Club Lounge on the 43rd floor. We made full use of the excellent complementary Continental breakfast and the early evening hor d'oeuvres! The waiters were fantastic - nothing was too much trouble and we were both made to feel very welcome, and, to be honest, quite special. Having stayed at the Sheraton many years previously, the recent refit and standard of Hotel services was top notch. Our trip was for a mixture of business and pleasure - but can honestly say that due to the whole Sheraton experience, it became more pleasure than business! Another worthy note to anyone wishing to use the internet whilst away, on the club room level we were on, the internet access was free to use which was an unexpected bonus! Our view from the bedroom (see pictures) was simply breathtaking! Looking directly onto the financial and stockmarket skyscrapers and also a perfect view of the CN Tower, which could be fully viewed whilst lying on the bed! Our bedroom was immaculate with all complementary bathroom accessories being replaced each day - Even mouthwash was supplied! The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was very quiet indeed. The hotel is very well located for all aspects of Toronto, Shops Restaurants and Sightseeing. We did not have dinner at the hotel but made use of the many local restaurants that was very close by. The Keg Steakhouse became one of our favorites which we can also recommend. Would we stay again - Try keeping us away!!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: nyr30flicka
Reviews.Content: I felt the need to write this review simply because I feel some people may be misinformed or mislead by some of the reviews I have read in the past before I stayed here myself. Due to the fact I booked my holiday over a year ago I have been regularly reading reviews on this hotel and there are a couple of recurring themes I would like to offer my own experience of and hopefully put any peoples worries to rest. I cannot fault this hotel at all. The only ONLY thing I could possibly say doesn't even count really as a negative thing, and that is that the website advertises an in-room safe. We did not find this but that was fine as the reception operates a safety deposit box facility which is manned 24 hours, and I found this preferable to an in-room facility. Everything else was brilliant. Here are the main positives: 1) The location is just perfect. We were no more than 10 or 15 minutes walk from any of the major attractions. The hotel also has a stop for the airport express bus and the Grays Line Tour company (with which we booked an excursion to Niagara) right outside. Be aware though the stops are not right next to each other so you may wish to double check where you need to be with the concierge, which we did and they were very helpful. 2) We did not experience any fire alarms going off, which was a real concern of mine following previous reports. The Sweet Sleeper beds are absolute bliss, although I did find the pillows a little TOO soft for my liking but still the beds were extremeley comfortable. 3) Some reviews I have read seemed to suggest that visitors had a bad experience if they stayed in the Richmond Tower, that is was run down and noisy and unsafe. We stayed in this tower and had no issues with any of those things. It is smaller than the other tower but I still had a lovely view of downtown Toronto. Everything was to the same high standard we experienced in the rest of the hotel. 4) Check in and out was absolutely fine, we requested and received a non smoking room with no problems, plus there was little or no queueing whenever I needed to access my safety deposit box. 5) We only ate in Traders and the Lobby Cafe and did not experience any other of the dining facilities in the hotel, but found them to be reasonably priced with friendly staff. I would have appreicated slightly more variety on the Traders menu though as I am a fussy eater. All in all we had a wonderful stay, both the hotel and Toronto as a whole were a delight and we were very sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “a travel agent's review”
Reviews.Author: mickey0823
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and I booked a night at the Sheraton Centre Toronto because it was close to the Air Canada Centre. The hotel is really beautiful with spacious rooms. Check-in was quick and friendly. Our room had a great view, comfortable bed, and was very clean. You can't beat the location, we were within walking distance of the Air Canada Centre. My only complaint is the elevator noise. You could hear the elevators running all day and night. But, it wouldn't stop me from staying at the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Big and Bustling”
Reviews.Author: mjk43
Reviews.Content: Given a "two" rating to this hotel but it is close to a "one". There is nearly always a long line at the front desk â€“ indeed when we arrived at 5pm after a very long journey, the wait to check in was a good 20 minutes. Having finally reached our rooms, about 25 floors up on the south side, we started to unpack only to find ourselves tormented by a regular metallic screeching noise from outside. The front desk were not in the least surprised when we asked to switch to the north side of the hotel â€“ I got the impression quite a few guests switch. They gave us new rooms graciously enough but it took another 30 minutes for the bellman to arrive with his luggage trolley and the new keys. Our plans for an early supper followed by an early night to recover from the journey were scuppered. The next morning we found there was no water in our bathroom or our daughtersâ€™ bathroom. Front desk sent up a key to another room and all four of us had to take turns to go in our nightwear in 2 elevators about 20 floors to shower in an empty guest room. Not only was this embarrassing, but it also wasted a lot of our limited tourist time. We were repeatedly assured by the hotel that the water would be fixed by lunchtime. In the evening, coming back to change quickly before the evening meal, luckily we checked the bathroom - to find that there was still no water in either of our rooms. After quite some fussing, the hotel found us two rooms on a higher floor adjacent to each other. These rooms were fine but again our evening was ruined by the lengthy time taken to find rooms and move to them, repacking and unpacking. These final rooms turned out to be very good â€“ quiet with great views to the north looking over both new and old City Halls. To make up for the disturbance, we were given access to the Club Lounge which was very useful for the buffet breakfast and the two pcâ€™s with internet access. The hotel also gave us a small discount by way of further apology. We were, of course, most unlucky with the water and I donâ€™t suppose future guests will experience that â€¦..but there are some things of which it would be helpful to be aware before choosing to stay here: â€¢ Bedrooms are very noisy if on the south side or if next to an elevator shaft or the ice dispensers. â€¢ If you donâ€™t have access to the Club Lounge and you donâ€™t have your own laptop with you, there is a small area in the lobby with about 6 pcâ€™s available for useâ€¦by anyone, guest or not ! So the lines are huge. â€¢ The concierge desk always has a line and the staff mostly sell packaged tours. Their knowledge of attractions appears surprisingly limited â€“ for Niagara, for example, they sell a guided tour package but could offer no constructive advice on a self-drive day. â€¢ Food outlets within the hotel are expensive but there are many restaurants within easy walking distance above ground and also a wide range of sandwiches, sushi and fast food on the PATH to which the hotel has direct access. â€¢ Parking is much less expensive under the new City Hall, directly across the street with an underground passage through to the hotel. It is more convenient too as you donâ€™t need to wait for the valet. â€¢ The location is very well served by public transport â€“ it is also a short walk to the Eaton Centre, a large shopping mall. Definitely a hotel for those who like â€œbig and bustlingâ€� not â€œsmall and friendlyâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Getravel
Reviews.Content: After looking at some of the very unfavourable review for this hotel we were not looking forward to staying here at all. However all of our worries were taken away as soon as we stepped into the hotel lobby. We have stayed at a lot of hotels all over the US and Europe and this hotel ranks among the best and we are fussy. The room was very spacious and clean with fantastic views across the old city hall and we really could not have asked for more. The rooms are extremely quiet at night with no sound from anyone in adjacent rooms. The hotel is also linked to the underground network of shops and the parking garage across the street, which is less expensive than choosing the valet park option at the hotel. We had originally tried to book the Hilton for our entire stay (even though that is more expensive) and eventually had to setle for 1 night at the end of the holiday. The Hilton is also a very nice hotel however we both agreed that if we return to Tornoto we would much rather stay at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Emz_D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in October 2007 having found a great deal on Hotwire. Could not fault it in any way. Location, room, staff - all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “It's nice”
Reviews.Author: Sumisu
Reviews.Content: Called hotel to confirm reservation, and they said I had a king bed room so everything sounded good to go. Got there in the evening and Tammy, the short-tempered clerk, gave us a double next to the elevator. I asked for a king and she said they didn't have any, and that since I had booked through priceline, i got whatever they decided to give me. We did not sleep at all that night due to the elevator noise through the walls, they wooshed/rumbled every couple minutes all night long. I called in the morning to switch rooms and guess who was still working that morning- Tammy! I tried to explain the elevator noise and she cut me off and actually yelled at me! I guess she was really grumpy after working all night...but not an excuse for treating customers poorly. I finally finagled a king bed and the room was great. I just wish the customer service was better and that people who paid with priceline weren't treated second-rate. I understand the policy that I cannot guarantee what room I will get, but I was confused as to why I was told they had a king bed waiting for me, only to show up and get a double.

Reviews.Title: “Right Down Town!”
Reviews.Author: Didi_Corbeil
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in the heart of downtown Toronto. We walked to the Canon Theatre, endless restaurants, St. Lawrence Market, and of course, the Eaton Centre. The Hotel offered clean, comfortable rooms and the beds were just the right firmness. Linens exquisite. Although pool was being serviced we were able to run across the road and use the Hilton Pool. It was only okay. There is an underground tunnel to the Bay but it was much nicer just walking around this beautiful city. Tim Hortons right next door just in case you have a early morning riser who is kind enough to get your coffee!

Reviews.Title: “great place.”
Reviews.Author: nwestwood
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night trip to Toronto staying at the Sheraton Centre. We could not fault this hotel, the rooms are nice and clean with very good beds and large lcd tv's. I did email the hotel before booking to ask for some requests, when we checked in all of those request had been made. Has all the other posts have stated the location of the hotel is the best, we only used public transport once and that was just to try out the underground. Over all for seeing Toronto city you can't really go wrong with the Sheraton Centre Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janelancs
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, Club floor room. Club lounge had great breakfast, evening snacks & great 43rd floor view over Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Intro to Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: esanjays96
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting Toronto and we got a great rate for this hotel through Priceline $67 US per night. We stayed four nights. We walked down the street and we had access to many different ethnic restaurants. Our rooms were decent sized. Everything worked fine. Free internet access was a hassle, but at least we could get it for free. We brought our own laptop so we didn't have to compete with the other hotel guests for the 5 stations that were available. Each person could have up to an hour on those stations so that made for a long wait for some folks. While I was sitting in front of my own laptop, a fight broke out in French about who was next on the newly opened station. I was sooooo thankful I brought my laptop. That was about the extent of the excitement at that hotel. This is a great place if you've never been to downtown. We did many of the sites here. Next time, however, we will probably prefer to stay in Markham since that's were all the really good Chinese food is located. We love to eat so it's worth going just for the food.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fearful
Reviews.Content: We were guests of the hotel from October 11-14 and obtained an exceptional rate (under $90.00 US) from Hotwire. In the context of this price point, our stay was above average. As others have noted, this hotel is very well located. It is, however, very busy. We were there during the Toronto Marathon and, in addition to conventioneers from other events, there were many runners staying at the hotel. The lobby was always teeming with people. Nevertheless, the check-in/out area is off to the side and both checking in and out was a breeze. Front desk people were extremely efficient and courteous. Doorman and bell men were always in evidence and available. Tour desk line-ups were long: there doesnâ€™t appear to be a concierge, so this desk does double duty. Generally, we found the hotel personnel and service to be above average. We stayed in room 2940, which was exceptionally quiet. The room was spotless. Appointments are not luxurious but attractive. There is a nice size flat panel TV and the bedding is comfortable. We had a great view of the CN Tower and even saw the lake. Our only complaint was with the bathroom. It was small and there was barely a vanity, really just a small shelf. It was problematic for me in that there was no place to put out my toiletries, make-up, and hair tools etc. Towels were also thin and there were few included toiletries. A shower cap, although graciously provided, was a special request. No robes and no fridge. There was, however a coffee maker with more than i1package of regular coffee (a necessity for us.). We ate breakfast at the Bistro on the second floor. The food was fine, but we did experience a surly wait person who seemed to be over extended and hated her job. A breakfast buffet was available on the Saturday we went. The bar downstairs is very, very busy but service was surprisingly good. We ate there out of necessity a couple of times. It is extremely dated looking and in need of remodelling. The food was OK. The Sheraton Centre was all in all a very good experience and we would definitely return at the price point.

Reviews.Title: “What a suprise!”
Reviews.Author: Super7cyw
Reviews.Content: We booked on Priceline for $75 wondering what we would get! We were very surprised and happy! All the other reviews on the location (central to everything) are correct. Wonderful! Parking at city hall thanks to reading a review! I had called ahead to ask for a non-smoking room with a king bed and to mention it was our 7th anniversary. Check in was smooth and friendly, she congratulated us on our anniversary and asked us a few questions. She seemed to take a few extra minutes which she then told us she was trying to find an upgrade! We were on the 41 floor! What a VIEW!!! The Club level! Beautiful room! We were so happy. The club lounge food was amazing! with an even better view! We will happily stay here again! We heard no bells and had a corner room which seemed quite large. The pool was fantastic and there were less than 10 people on deck the whole time were were there. The indoor/outdoor pool was a great feature and the pool was quite warm. Tons of chairs to lounge on and a large hot tub. P.s. A quick walk down Queen St west is a little restaurant called EAST! Asian street Flair....the food was Fantastic and had unbeatable prices! ($35 for two apps, two entres, and I had a martini)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rachelyorks
Reviews.Content: Just Come back from spending 3 Nights at the Sheraton with my Husband and little boy aged 2 and a bit. Our Room was large with 2 doubles and on the 8th floor high enought for me!!! our view was over Nathan Phillips Square, we were 2 minutes to the Eaton Centre and a good 20 mins from CN Tower. We used public transport without a hitch travelling upto the Science Centre to see the Titanic Exibition. We also visited the Falls (but were taken there by some friends) and went on the Maid Of the Mist, not recommended for little ones my little boy cried most of the time on the lower deck!
