Toronto is the best city i have been to so far, Clean, Happy and Safe this is my 5th visit!!!(but i do have friends living 30 mins away!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but had to argue with them over our promised suite.”
Reviews.Author: hspirit
Reviews.Content: We had been promised a complimentary upgrade to a suite two weeks prior to arrival at which time I had called willing to pay extra for the upgrade, but was told it was unnecessary. They would give it to us at no extra charge because it was our anniversary weekend. I called the day before our visit to confirm this and was told that everything was still in place.When we actually arrived it was a different story. All of a sudden they "didn't have any suites available". We were SO disappointed, and spoke to the manager explaining that when I had called originally it was my intent to PAY for the suite upgrade,and that at that time suites were available. After going back and forth for about 15 minutes suddenly she looked again and "found" a suite available.Whew! Well, they did follow through in the end after much discussing,and the room was nice with a 2 person whirlpool jacuzzi next to the SO comfortable king size bed.This room also included complimentary buffet breakfasts on the 42nd floor every morning that were quite nice, as well as early eve. hors duerves AND free parking. We paid $130 per night through Priceline which for all that we got was tremendous!The hotel is in a great location.All in all it was a nice stay...it just started out a bit rough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPandJen
Reviews.Content: The building itself is fairly ugly but inside the hotel is quite impressive. The rooms are big and clean and there are a wide range of facilities, including a large business centre with free wireless internet. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central hotel, shame it was so busy!”
Reviews.Author: ticklergolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights from the 12th Sept- 16thSept, was a very nice lobby when we first arrived but also noticed it was very busy, buzzing with people and a small queue for check in. When we got to our room on the 32nd floor we realised we were given an interconnecting room with which you could hear coughing and sneezing from next door. Seeing as we didnt ask for an interconnecting room we asked to be changed but unfortunately there was no rooms available that night, so we moved the next day and they gave us $50 to spend at the hotel! We found the hotel to be very central to everything, it was right around the corner to the Eaton Centre and we walked to the CN tower and the harbourfront and Yorkville althought this was a bit of a walk, in which we knackered ourselves out! the hotel had a nice swimming pool and hot tub which we used twice and Traders restaurant and bar was quite nice and fairly reasonable. I wouldnt get brekkie in the hotel though as there are many cheap alternatives close by. The last night we did get woken at 3am by a party going on in the room above but this was quite speedily sorted out once we made a complaint. We still had a brilliant stay but if i visited again i would probably choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, some niggles”
Reviews.Author: PintOfGuinness
Reviews.Content: This was our first room for our honeymoon, was a bit disappointed we got 2 double beds in our room instead of one large kingsize bed . Anyway we seen complimentary water and beside that a basket full of goodies and sweets, was sure it was the stuff you need to pay for, but after a good hunt around I could see no price list and thought they were complimentary as well. Eat a packet of jelly beans, next day realised my mistake when price list suddenly appeared and the jelly beans had been replaced. 7 dollars for a small packet of jelly beans, convinced its a ploy so naive people like me can tuck into expensive overpriced tuck. Anyway breakfast here is good and made sure I got my moneys worth! Room was nice and quiet as we were on the 36th floor, what a view. Lifts were so fast they made your ears pop. Was annoyed cleaner only left us one towel one day but we never got it rectified so I ended up sharing it with my partner. Would recommend the Comopolitan hotel that we stayed in after this, it was slightly cheaper more luxurious, modern and had a kitchen, washing machine etc. But overall not a bad hotel especially for location.

Reviews.Title: “loved toronto”
Reviews.Author: sunderlandmoose
Reviews.Content: travelled from uk to toronto with canadian affair, booked flights and hotel though canadian affair very pleased with both. we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and had booked a double room, we were a little disappointed when we checked in that we had a twin room my husband went to reception to see if we could get a double and was told ours was a double but it wasnt it had two 3/4 beds in staff at reception were very pleasant but said the hotel was fully booked as it was toronto film festival week and that we could try later on in the week but once we got settled in our room we could'nt be bothered to pack up and move. fortunately that was our only complaint the hotel is in a great position very central for everything. had a great meal in the hotel steak restaurant. the hotel has a swimming pool which i believe is the only hotel in the city that has one it is half indoors and half outdoors and we spent a very pleasant afternoon lounging around the pool. overall a very good experience and would certainly go back to toronto and also this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: NickCDN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Center Hotel Toronto for $74 dollars from a priceline bid. We were given a king room on the 20th floor. On arrival we were greeted quickly by the front desk with no wait. We requested a crib for our infant daughter and arrived at our room no more than 10 minutes later. We parked across the street as it was much cheaper than the Valet parking at the hotel. The room was clean and the view overlooking city hall was nice. For a 4* hotel, I would have expected a nicer bathroom. Only a couple of complaints: First, the service elevator was really nosiy until about 11:30 pm. Second, the termostat in the room did not work. Attempted to turn on the heat in the room and it did not work. Luckly it didnt get THAT cold in the middle of the night. If I had paid the 'best room rate' at the Sheraton website that was $299, I would have been really upset, but since I paid $74 bucks through priceline, I was happy with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharlynne
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through name your price on Priceline so I wasn't sure what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised. Our room overlooked Toronto City Hall. The room was large enough for my husband and I. We had a king size bed which we found very comfortable. Our floor was very quiet. We found the restaurant for breakfast very expensive. Not knowing much about the area we used the valet parking. It was $35 but I'm sure if you looked around you'd find something cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend a stay here”
Reviews.Author: Chemicalguy123
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel to stay at. It is very large and we got a room on one of the higher levels. There are very nice views of downtown Toronto from this hotel. The room and washroom were spectacular. There was a very large pool that we could see from our room but we never got the change to use it. The best part about this hotel has to be its location. You're within walking distance of every major attraction in Toronto. The beds were very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sheraton Centre”
Reviews.Author: SimpleJoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton Centre Toronto on Queen St. West from 8/31/07 through 9/3/07 for the Labor Day weekend with our toddler son. The room had the City Hall view from 23rd floor. The room was quiet large and comfortable for all three of us. We had requested a microwave which was in our room upon check-in and we were also given a refrigerator which was very helpful to keep the food for our son cool and we could warm the food when we wanted. The microwave appeared not to work and requested the guest service to fix the microwave and within 10 minutes a hotel staff showed up and fixed the microwave. Our beds were done daily and it was a very good feeling to come back tired after visiting all the attractions to the hotel room that had its linens neatly done and all the stuff in the room placed where they belong. Complementary newspaper was also delivered each morning. The hotel also has a beautiful waterfall that you can enjoy sitting on a rocking chair in the lobby area or walk near the waterfall after getting out of the door from one level above the lobby area. My son really enjoyed walking near the waterfall and it was a good experience. Check-out was quick and hassle free. No surprise charges to my credit card what so ever! Overall our stay was excellent and the hotel staff was very warm and friendly and would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Toronto for tourism. We did not use the hotel valet parking but parked across the street under the City Hall Toronto Parking Authority(TPA) parking garage. Hotel valet was $33.00 per night but we parked for $36.00 for 3 nights in City Hall TPA garage and took out the car once to visit Toronto Zoo(NOTE: Unlike the hotel valet parking TPA garages do not have IN/OUT privileges so plan accordingly). So if you don't travel too far outside Toronto which may need a drive in your car you can park in the TPA garage upon check-in and you will most likely not need a car to see the major attractions in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “You had better be a deep sleeper...”
Reviews.Author: hoteluser
Reviews.Content: We visited the Sheraton Centre while attending a wedding over labour day weekend. Check-in: The stay started off well. Despite booking through priceline, we were upgraded rooms upon arrival through the automated check-in system. I had e-mailed a request for non-smoking which either by chance or intent (I was never replied to) was met. When we arrived at the room, the furnishings were nice. There was a work desk, data ports and flat screen TV. The bathroom was basic tub and shower, but clean. Our room had a nice view of queen street and Nathan Phillips square. Noise: One of the problems fellow travellers have cited ended up being a large problem for us. You can hear the noise of people in the halls and adjoining rooms really easily. The walls seem to be paper-thin at the Sheraton Centre. On our second day we were unfortunate enough to have a family with a small baby move into the room next door. For the next two days we lost plenty of sleep. The fan brought to us didn't help very much. The night before the wedding we were visiting we called the front desk and asked if they could move us to a similar room. First, we were transferred 4 times. Then, put on hold indefinitely. Upon calling back, we were told the hotel was sold out (rather hard to believe). This may sound like a minor inconvenience, but losing sleep from noise in adjoining rooms felt like a major one at the time. I would have preferred smaller, even dirtier accomodations in order to sleep well. On labour day itself, the structure of the building was again exposed. A parade was going on in the street, 34 floors below us and it sounded like it was the people directly below us. Heating: Our room would not heat up. I'm not sure if they turn the heat off during the winter, but our room was too cold for the majority of our stay. Pool: Nice, large pool. Half of it is under cover, the other exposed. It's heated, and was apparently 78o the day we were there. Unfortunately it was a busy weekend, and there were too many people to practically enjoy it. No fault of the hotel. If you think it is going to be a busy time however, you may want to schedule your pool time appropriately. Conclusion: This place has a great location downtown. It is also connected to the PATH. You'll love parts of the accomodations. If possible, try to only visit on relatively non-busy days or be prepared to bring some ear plugs and maybe a blanket.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Griffintoronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 9 nights end of August 2007. It was just as Expedia described it. Rooms were cleaned every day to a high standard. The internet was free for all guests for 1 hour a day though sometimes there was a bit of a wait to get onto a computer. The hotel is right in the middle of downtown Toronto and nothing was ever too much trouble for the staff. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a first class hotel right in the centre of Toronto

Reviews.Title: “A little like a zoo”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoDreamin
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one positive--location. It's very close to the Eaton Centre, so there are lots of food choices close by and the PATH train is only a block away. HOWEVER, this hotel gets very crowded. So you will wait for everything. There are only three elevators to accomodate what seemed like a lot of conventioneers. And one was broken during our stay. You're always waiting for an elevator, waiting for a chair, waiting for a table. The rooms are Ok; small but Ok. The restaurants are mediocre and crowded. For the money, it seems like you'd have to be able to do better. Unless you like a LOT of people -- all the time --- wearing funny badges. Then do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: idwfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Honeymoon in August and liked what I saw. We booked very easily through the hotel website. On arrival our check in was handled very efficiently and we were in the room on the eigth floor in no time. The room was well furnished looked quite modern with all the ammenities that you would need. We were staying for two weeks and it was a good length of time to get a proper view and feeling for this place. The lobby is absolutely huge with entrances to Le Bifteque and Traders (more about them later) and the entraence to the PATH system. The path system is a 16km long underground shopping paradise with 1200 shops. You can go the whole day without ever going up on the street. The first time we walked it we got lost on the way back! The lobby has different desks for everything you need; one for the tourists to get information, one for the porters and a seperate check in for the higher class rooms. There is easy access to the streets from the hotel and the hotel even has some shops of its own that might catch your eye. There is a great shop called Kumar's in the hotel which does great brand name cloths at really good prices. There is a conveinance shop and small coffee shop also. The lobby does hold a small business centre and that can get crowded with people queing to use a computer. The hotels hosts fantastic looking gym, spa and pool areas. The half indoor half outdoor pool is quite good with a poolside bar for your use and a jaqussi and alot of loungers as well. One thing though, I found the poolside drinks alot more expensive than inside the hotel. In Le Bifteque Restaurant which from all accounts is one of the top beef restaurants in Toronto, we were treated to alot from the the place. I come from Ireland and to have a filet mignon ($27) served chargrilled and sent out was something I'm not really used to. I like mine sealed and oven cooked but it was quite something to taste, it was a good bit of meat. Even though the food was very good all through our stay (especially the raviolli for $12 and homemade steak burger for just $9) we got both sides of the waiting experience. They have some very good servers and a couple not so good. Here's a tip, after around nine in the evening a gratuity is added to your bill, fair enough, before nine the reciept says "Gratuity Not Included" which says to me, tip if you want, its optional. When I get my bill off the waitress twice in the two weeks I was there that had the Grat Not Included sign circled in pen and 15% please written beside it, I don't want to tip any more. Leave the tip option to the customer please, don't look for it or you won't get it! The other restaurant is Traders, in which I found the food too plentiful and I like my food but I couldn't eat everything they put in front of you. That's not a complaint but a compliment on what they serve. Is a little more pricey I found than the other restaurant but I didn't mind. You don't mind paying for quality. Try their battered fish and chip, or the indian butter chicken and they do great soups ($7) There is another restaurant called Bistro on Two which serve breakfast and lunch only. The service was good all around there and the food was lovely. The serve fresh big breakfasts and oone thing to watch out for. They charge for every thing you have. All items are individually priced. Our first breakfast there which was 2x tea and oj two breakfasts and toast was $47 as everything on the hot breakfasts is again individually priced. One thing to watch out for in Toronto in general, especially if you aren't from the area, taxes are not included in many things and are added on at the till which for the first few times you buy something there, it can throw you off a bit. The Sheraton Centre is connected to the subway at Queens through a short walk on the PATH system and you would be pleasantly surprised at howq cheap it is $2.75 a trip and that is good. The cleaning services in the hotel for the rooms were efficient and friendly to talk to when you meet them and invisible when they are working. The room was cleaned to a high standard every day and a comp newspaper left in every day also. There is an ice machine on the floor and a vending machine also which can come in handy if is gets balmy in the time of year you go there. The check out procedures are quick and easy and the concierge is adept to helping you with bags or transport. The hotel has a holding area for luggage if you need to store them for an evening flight for example like we had. The Sheraton Centre was a great hotel and just about perfect for what I wanted. It is in the city centre and a short hop to anywhere you want to go. I would go back tomorrow if I could.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: a-fussy-traveller!
Reviews.Content: just had a six night stay at this hotel with my family. we really enjoyed our time here, the location is absolutely brilliant. the view from our room was breathtaking particularly at night. the lobby is stunning - very modern, lots of glass and chrome and escalators. also a beautiful waterfall you can sit and relax in front of. we ate regularly at traders and found the food and service to be good.

Reviews.Title: “Good family base for Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MumTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days at the start of our trip to Canada. They did not have the connecting rooms that we booked (hotel was full, and my emails in advance asking for connecting rooms had not been followed) but compensated us for the inconvenience, and moved us to connecting rooms the next day - staff helpful and polite. The pool area was quite crowded on a fine afternoon, but kids enjoyed it anyway. Rooms comfortable and quiet. A good base for exploring Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Not for guests who want to use the gym”
Reviews.Author: gordonrink
Reviews.Content: First, the positives: 1. Parking garage across the street 2. Decent, clean lobby area 3. Nice waterfall garden area an easy walk from reception 4. Some views from the main tower are spectacular Now the negatives: 1. Some rooms are in a smaller, older tower. These rooms have the same rack rate as the newer rooms but you have to walk a long way to get there, the elevator is VERY slow (I once had to wait 5 minutes, no kidding). 2. The gym costs $9 for non "Club members" - this was a personal affront, I am NOT used to having hotel gyms cost money! On top of that, the equipment was old and filthy. 3. The restaurant was decent but way overpriced ($14 for 8 chicken wings, and $8+ for 16 oz beers). Service was fine but I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you intend to eat elsewhere. Apparently there is a good gym a block or so away that is only $10 a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, someplace cool!”
Reviews.Author: Buzzkillbunny
Reviews.Content: It has been at or above 100 degrees for weeks here in the South so my husband and I thought it would be a good time to check out Toronto on a long weekend and thus, we made plans to stay at the Sheraton Centre. This is a convention hotel. While we were there the Herbalife Honorees from Latin America were all staying there. Hoardes of people flooded the lobby at all hours. Not a problem though, the place is HUGE! We caught the Airport Express directly to the hotel, although you can take the Airport Rocket and subway, I didn't feel like doing that with luggage. I recommend the Airport Express. Check in was mobbed when we got there, but they had folks at every terminal on the desk and within 10 minutes we were in our room. We were on the 10th floor with a view of City Hall. The room was nothing to write home about. It was clean and comfortable. The cable was extensive with both Canadian and American television channels. The beds were those new "Luxe Hotel Beds" soft and comfy. Except I prefer a hard matress. I slept really well though, so no complaints. The A/C left something to be desired. It didn't cool the room below 74, and since the bedcovers were heavy duvets, this was problematic. Additionally, if one closed the blackout curtains, the source of the A/C was BEHIND them, so no air circulating. We slept with the curtains open and tried to keep the window open as much as possible during the day, since if you didn't close it at night, you'd hear the clock in the church across the way chime all night long. It was also hot in the hallways and other common areas of the hotel. We decided to go down and grab a bite to eat so we had a meal at Traders. Boy! Was that underwhelming. The chicken planks and fries were fine. The fries actually were just like English Chips, I would have liked some malt vinegar for them, but our waitress made herself a bit scarse. We also tried a chicken curry, that was not all that good. I thought perhaps that since there were a few curries on the menu that someone in the kitchen knew how to make them. I was wrong. The area is downtown and rather than downtown in NY, where there are shops and restaurants and all sorts of entertainments within walking distance, this was more like downtown Pittsburgh, where at the end of the business day the sidewalks roll up. The only things around were tourist spots that were obvious rip-offs and other hotel restaurants. We took a cab to see Evil Dead, the Musical at the Diesel Theatre. That was a BLAST! Catch it before it leaves in September, if you can. We took a tour of Niagara Falls with the King Tour company. There was a bit of a hassle with pick up. We were expecting a large motor-coach to pick us up at 8:30. Finally at 9:00 a town car pulled up and took four passengers and the driver (I sat [--]) to another hotel so that we could cram into a 21 seat van/bus (think Airport tram) for the 8 hour trip. We sat in the back on the 5 across bench. This was uncomfortable. More for the poor schmoe sitting [--] there, I at least had a foot rest and could lean against my husband, he just bounced around for the whole day. We went to a winery (ice wine, who knew?) Niagara on the Lake for about 40 minute (we crammed lunch down) and then down to Niagara Falls to ride the Maid of the MIst. The tour was totally worth it because we didn't have to wait in line. Just grabbed a ticket and were escorted onto the boat. The tour was $80 Canadian dollars and the Maid of the Mist was $14. We spent 3 hours in Niagara and then went back to the hotel. The next time we go, we're going to try a hotel in a neighborhood, rather than smack downtown. I'd also like to say that your meal options weren't all that great near the hotel. There's a Ruth's Chris steak house, which was perfectly fine, but no funky, neighborhood joints. Everything was super expensive (due to a really crappy exchange rate.) There's a Ted Hortons adjacent to the hotel. That's no big deal, but it is cheap. We never did find the food court. All in all, there's nothing wrong with the Sheraton, it's exactly what you'd expect from a huge hotel. You can certainly get to any attraction quickly and easily from it. It's quiet and comfortable. The staff is great. The food, not so much. At least we stayed cool for a few days!

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOfFour08
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was really pleasant. Room was clean and comfortable but a bit small for a "high end" hotel. Also the lack of parking was a bit of an inconvenience. Only major complaint is that despite being in a city center location and being a $200+ hotel, the internet access was not complimentary, was expensive and the costs were not posted. The "free lobby" access was not available in all areas which caused some additional dismay. Many lower cost hotels provide the courtesy, Sheraton should get with the program.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Position for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: TJ862
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated for access to the downtown area of Toronto. There are two main accommodation towers, one is much larger than the other. We stayed in the lower of the towers which meant that to use the pool we had to come down to the lobby and use the elevator in the other tower to access the 3rd floor pool. Half of the pool is outdoors and the other half indoors. The hotel was occupied by 1500 Harry Potter fans during our entire stay which was fun at times. The hop on hop off city tour bus (recommended) stops just across the street from the hotel. Our tour to Niagara (recommended) also picked up directly outside the hotel. The hotel is on the PATH route of underground tunnels that snake throughout the downtown area which means you can escape either the winter cold or summer heat - it was 95 degrees during our stay. There are places to eat inside the lobby area which offer variety and price which we did use. However for something a bit cheaper there are plenty of restaurants nearby and the Eaton Centre Mall is only a 10 minute walk where there is a foodcourt with plenty of choice. There are Internet terminals in the lobby for general use although you will probably have to wait a while. There are nice gardens with a waterfall which can be seen from the lobby area. The only slightly negative thing really is that this is a very large hotel and can seem a bit impersonal at times, especially in the large lobby area which gets busy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Happy King
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The location was very good - opposite city hall and right next to the opera. Many restaurants in walking distance or a short inexpensive taxi ride away. We had gone on a convention, so unsure of the restaurants food and service, but the catering was excellent. Food variety was expansive and the service excellent. The rooms were a decent size. Try and get the side facing the harbor and CN tower. The opp. side (where we had our room) had the city view with city hall right opposite. If you're Starwood, you get the higher floors - very nice and quiet. Rooms are average Sheraton - no complaints. Pool was a nice amenity although they could have kept it cleaner. Supposedly heated but the kids preferred the hot tub. Towels provided and some food service available at the pool. Everything else was wonderful - service, etc. at the reception, bell desk, valet. Only downside was the parking fee - but it's a city!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: RABSREVIEWS
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at the Sheraton in early August. Check in was swift with no hitches desipite the amount of people in the lobby area which is always very busy. The lifts are speedy and you never have to wait too long for one to arrive. Our room , on the 26th floor , was sufficiently spacious for 2 people with an extremely comfortable double bed,multi channel tv, writing desk and good sized bathroom with hair dryer. The hotel has 2 restaurants, 'Traders' in the lobby area and 'The Bistro on Two' - second floor - both which serve adequate bar type fare. Staff, we found to be, most courteous and helpful.They have a separate desk for those wishing to book tours and appear to be pretty knowledgable on what,s on offer. The only real minus point, in our opinion was the pool itself which was not very clean with sun lotion floating on the surface.There weren,t enough sunbeds and virtually no parasols. For us, the hotel,s selling point is the location.It is within easy access to most of Toronto,s attractions either on foot or taxi, it,s up to you. All in all, a pleasant hotel which i would have no hesitation in recommending to others.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, a lot of guests”
Reviews.Author: BostonMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month, I stayed in a club room at this hotel for four nights. The location is definitely this hotel's attraction. The room was cool and comfortable. Maid service was efficient. The club lounge was nice with free internet connection but the food was so-so. The lounge food was set up to serve the masses. There were a lot of guests at this hotel during my stay. The hotel lobby felt like a busy airport terminal. The other reviewers were right on. The reception counter was difficult to locate as it was on the far side of the elevators. Most people would walk up to a desk managed by a tour company first instead of finding the receptions. The concierges were quite transparent in the crowd. The Starwood desk provided quicker and more personalized service when it's being manned. Would I stay at this hotel again? Because of its location, I guess I would if the price is right. I would also consider nearby hotels such as the Marriotts and Metropolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our visit”
Reviews.Author: Beeb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights in Toronto at the Sheraton. Overall,I am happy with the hotel.We arrived late at night so check-in was not a problem.I had asked for a room on a high level but was on the 5th floor - this was not a big deal as I had a nice view of City Hall.Room was fine - did not hear any noise from the rooms beside me.Ate breakfast out of the hotel on a few days - Sunset Grill -ok;Senator - much better;Eggspectation - loved the brioche beauty....!! Had breakfast buffet in hotel on 2 mornings and enjoyed the variety.Also ate one evening in 'Traders' Bar in the hotel and both meal and service were good.Great location and an enjoyable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: andygt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights in July with partner and 2 kids, aged 10 and 13 When first checked-in had asked for a room on higher level floor but was given a 5th floor room looking straight into an office block. Bad start. Went down to reception and asked of there were any better rooms and they said all rooms were taken but they would see what they could do the next day. Checked with reception the next day and they upgraded me (at no extra cost) to a club room on the 40th floor. Very nice and really made the difference during the stay. Traders bar/restaurant is fine for having a relatively cheap meal. Great location. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: mz15
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was OK, but not excellant. The service was extremely slow. The check in line was rather long, and time consuming. The staff was friendly though. When we arrived in our room (20th floor, non club level) we were disappointed. The room was rather small, and the walls were paper-thin. We could clearly hear what our neighbor in the room next to us was watching...... on a normal basis. We decided to upgrade, which took well over an hour for the staff to get back to me. I actually had to call them as it took way took long to get back to me. We upgraded to a club lounge room on the 36th floor for an extra $60 a night. Basically, same extact room and features (size, and paper thin walls), but access to the club lounge. was is worth it? yes/no.... The breakfast was a contential breakfast (cereal, bagels etc), and they had complimentary appetizers (fruits/veges, and bruschetta etc) from I believe 5-7. We enjoyed the appetizers the most. That is about it. The view was nice however. My main issues w/ the Sheraton was the slow service, paper thin walls, and the amount of congestion in the lobby. I felt like I was at the Eaton center. considering we paid $ 115 a night via hotwire (then the upgrade to the "lounge:" for $60), it wasnt a bad deal. We go to toronto a few times every year...but I would recommend the Cambridge Suites, or the Hyatt vs teh Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “They can do better.”
Reviews.Author: mischiefmanager
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Sheraton Centre. My college-age daughter and I were there for a convention. We had a mixed experience-overall, the convention staff was great and the hotel staff, not so much. Some basics: The hotel is in the middle of the city, across from City Hall. There's a parking lot under City Hall that is considerably cheaper than the hotel one, so that's where we parked, and it worked out well. The hotel is within walking distance of the Queen Street business district, which has lots of funky and affordable shops and restaurants. When we arrived, one bellman at the entrance took our luggage and loaded it onto a cart, then took it inside and turned it over to another bellman to take up to the room, so we had to tip 2 different people. Nice little scam they have going there. We didn't check out the pool or the exercise room at all. The pool is available at no cost but the exercise room has a fee to use it. We didn't have time for this to be an issue, but really, why big hotels do this sort of thing I'll never know. It's just cheap and petty. It will never cease to amaze me that you can get services like this free at places like Best Westerns and Days Inns but not at high-end hotels. If they want to rip off people who are going to expense their visits, fine, but give the rest of us a break. The rooms have high-speed wireless connections but again, this has a fairly high fee. However, you can connect in the lobby for an hour at a time at no cost, and you can do this as many times during the day as you'd like, just making sure to sign off at the end of the hour for a few minutes. The hotel has 3 restaurants and a coffee bar. One of the restaurants, Bistro on Two, is open for breakfast and lunch. I went in for breakfast one day. It was extremely expensive-$27 CAD for the breakfast buffet. The food was good but still, that's way too high. There's a steakhouse which we tried for dinner one night, and that was fine. The prices were reasonable for dinner and the food was pretty good. We had no problems with service either, but it was an off-peak time, about 4:30 PM. We had a terrible experience with the last of the restaurants, Traders. Five of us went in for dinner one evening at about 6:30. the restaurant was busy but not full and there was no line. It took 20 minutes and 2 requests for service to get a waiter, 20 more minutes for drink orders to be taken, 20 more minutes for drinks to be served (incorrectly, so the waiter had to go back and try again) and our orders to be taken, and half an hour for the food to begin to be served-it came out one order at a time. By the time my order arrived, I had to leave to work a volunteer shift. My daughter brought my meal to me in a takeout container (no utensils were provided) and the restaurant added a 20% tip to everyone's bill. It was a dreadful, unprofessional, infuriating experience. I will be notifying the hotel directly about this. The hotel is connected to a food court, and mall, and inexpensive options are available there for breakfast and lunch. The shops and food stands close at the end of the business day though, so there aren't in-house budget choices for dinner. The coffee bar in the hotel is like a Starbucks, with comparable selection and pricing. We had asked for a room on a high floor in the main tower. When we checked in and renewed those requests, we were told that no such room was available. The room we were assigned was next to an ice machine, so I went back to the desk and spoke to a different clerk, who was much more helpful. She got me the exact kind of room I had requested in the first place. The room was fine, not huge but certainly livable, with a lovely view of City Hall and the adjacent park. The bathroom was also fine. The room was clean but somewhat worn, which I found surprising in a hotel that isn't all that old. The beds were comfortable but the pillows were the small, very soft kind that I find pretty unworkable. I much prefer the bigger, more solid ones. For some reason, our room wasn't cleaned or made up on the 4th night, so we had to request extra towels. They came but the person who delivered them didn't take away the mound of dirty ones. Also, the safe in our room didn't work and although we called security to fix it, they never did. Overall, if I come back to Toronto (which I hope to do-we didn't get to see the city much at all), I'd look for another place to stay. We paid a special convention rate which was considerably lower than the rack rate, and that was okay, but I would definitely not pay the rack rate. The hotel was adequate but hardly luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start but worked out nicely in the end”
Reviews.Author: Fabhols
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our wedding anniversary 21/07/07-26/07/2007. We arrived to a very busy hotel, whose 1400 rooms had been fully booked. I'd emailed well ahead and asked for a room with a view of the cn tower, however although this was noted they didnt deliver this. check in took a while although the staff were friendly. we checked into our room and were horrified to find that the room hadn't been cleaned and the bed was all messed up. Really dissappointed. however, they were v apologetic and offered us a new room which was smaller. I wasnt happy with this so complained to reception. they were quite helpful and apologetic again. This time they said we could have a king room the following day, but as a gesture of goodwill, we were given club room benefits for the duration of our stay, so we happily settled for this. Once we moved rooms everything was fine and we enjoyed our stay. I must thank gregory at the front desk who recognised that our special occasion hadn't got off to a good start and he more than made up for it. IT IS A GOOD HOTEL THOUGH! Location smack on, great, standard king room good, stay in an even numbered room, the cn tower view side. Good link to PATH the shopping centre. Staff are full of care and and are attentive. TIPS: Eat outside the hotel, it's cheaper. Arrange sight seeing tours outside hotel, like hippo bus, lot cheaper, grab breakfast in PATH shopping, cheaper than bistro on 2. Hotel room are clean and to a good standard, despite rocky start will stay again. Internet access was free for 60 minutes each day in the lobby. Definately eat in The Keg its scrummy!! Hotel just need to improve on their housekeeping during peak time. Will use again though.

Reviews.Title: “Lounging in Mediocrity?”
Reviews.Author: medicboy07
Reviews.Content: What a mediocre stay. Check-in was relatively quick, and the staff were very helpful and polite. Once we got to our room - we were very disappointed at what we found. Certainly not what we'd come to expect from a Sheraton, or even what we expected from the reviews on this site. We had paid extra money for an upgrade to a "suite" room. All this seemed to mean was that we had an extra room attached to the 'bedroom' portion of the overall room with what they claimed was mahogany furniture. The furniture seemed to be mahogany stuck to pressed-particleboard. Additionally, they advertised "leather furniture" on their website which turned out to be one chair. They did have a couch in the room but it was a ghastly shade of yellow and very uncomfortable because it was also a pull-out. In the bathroom, the bathtub was dented and scratched and the sink (no joke) was less then 8" in diameter. The hotel had been listed as "recently renovated", but the room appeared to have the baseboards scratched. Upon arrival in the room, we discovered that the ventilation system in the room made some very strange high pitched wheezing noise. When we contacted the front desk, they sent a maintenance worker up. His solution seemed to be simply to put a piece of paper over the vent that was making the noise rather then fixing the problem. I guess he was too busy. We were so disappointed by our stay in Toronto that we actually left early. Internet in the hotel was at a cost (very expensive) and the city wifi internet was /significantly/ cheaper, and available city-wide (offered by the Toronto Hydro utility I think). Why would I want internet that's more expensive and only available in the hotel? On the plus side, the lobby was very nice with a waterfall. The hotel is in proximity to the PATH, subway and very centrally located. Checkout was quick and there was no extra cost for checking out early.

Reviews.Title: “Summer holiday”
Reviews.Author: SL.123
Reviews.Content: Having holidayed in Toronto previously & visited the usual tourist sites we wanted a relaxing lazy time. We wanted a hotel that was central & the Sheraton is excellent in every aspect. At check in we enquired about upgrading to a suite, $60 per night, our intention was to do this for our second week but after seeing the room we were hooked. Well worth the extra when you have two children. The check in & tour desk staff were very helpful, efficient & we were dealt with very quickly. The extra room gives a separate bedroom & lounge with sofa bed. The first night we called housekeeping to make this bed up, the porter arrived with two single beds & full size mattresses. These were fantastic & could be tilted & stored against the wall during the day. As you would expect rooms are cleaned daily & all public areas were spotless. Traders & the Steakhouse are worth trying if you can't be bothered going out. By its very name the hotel is close to everything, whether you want to walk to the ferry or take the subway. There are so many restaurants that the best advise is try any, they are all good & prices are much better than the UK or Europe. Shopping is a nightmare, you will do serious damage to your bank account, most items are cheaper than the UK which means you buy more. We used the PATH for the first time & found it a great way to move around the city without actually going outside. The gym & pool area has ample loungers, equipment & towels. We used the pool most days & never had a problem with availability, the remaining days were spent out at the Islands lazing around on the grass or braving the cold water of the lake. This is a great hotel & whether this is a first or return visit to Toronto I would recommend you give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cold_in_kitchener
Reviews.Content: We recently completed a 2-night stay at this hotel. Overall, we were very pleased with the Sheraton. Upon entering, the lobby is huge, busy, and very impressive. I now know what other reviewers meant when they had a hard time finding the front desk - we had to make a few laps before we actually found it. Check-in was fast and we were given a room on the 29th floor, with a view of the CN Tower. We could also see the pool from our room. The view was amazing, as we could see all of the downtown skyscrapers. The room was fine. Nothing spectacular, just a typical Sheraton-style hotel room. The bed was comfortable (as all Sheraton beds are). Overall, the room was clean, but there were some stains on the walls in the bathroom. Nothing too bad though. The location of this hotel is its biggest asset. We were able to walk everywhere and did not use the car even once. It's very close to Queen Street shopping, Yonge Street, and even the Rogers Centre. We had no issues with safety, and felt comfortable being out at night. We did use the pool one night and enjoyed it. They also have a hot tub and a fitness centre (at a cost of $9/day). The pool area was nice, clean, and comfortable. Certainly a nice way to end a tiring day. If you do stay at this hotel, park across the street at the City Hall. Its a safe, underground facility. We paid only $37 for the weekend, while the hotel charged about $31 per night! Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great again”
Reviews.Author: chelskiboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 28 June until 11 July and loved it. Great rooms, great service, great staff and my kids tell me a great pool. This is a large hotel that doesn't forget the families that stay here as well as the big conferences it hosts. Every member of staff we met was always pleasant and willing to help should we need it. Well done Toronto for having this gem.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayisobel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 01/07/07 and 02/07/07, loved the hotel. Room was clean and tidy linen and towels were changed each day. It is a very busy hotel and conference centre of which quite a few were taking place. Bit on the expensive side but it was a birthday treat for my daughter. Good central location for all the obvious attractions

Reviews.Title: “Super Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Dagdabear
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was not our first choice of hotel in Toronto, but we were switched to it after the original double booked us. As such it proved to be a superb surprise a truly excellent hotel with almost nothing to fault it. The positives were many, three excellent restaurants connected to the hotel, we would specifically recommend Traders as a great casual eating and bar experience. The room was good and we were lucky to get a room on one of the higher floors so were blessed with a fantastic view over downtown Toronto. For what is a huge hotel we found staff both helpful and polite. Good location for public transport, and a good range of tourist attractions. Slight negatives, the valet parking was excellent it was slightly expensive. Breakfast again was excellent but a bit hectic and a touch expensive but equally you could have eaten for the day on the buffet if you wanted. One way system in city drove us crazy but we can't attribute that to the hotel. Overall the Sheraton gave us all we wanted for the five days we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “GreatLocation”
Reviews.Author: bonus
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Sheraton Centre Toronto from Saturday 16 June 2007. We booked the room, and our flights to Canada from Scotland, with Canadian Affair in London and I think we got a reasonable deal. There was ample short term parking for check-in at the door. There was valet parking at $35/day but we didn't use this as we returned the hire car soon after arriving. Check in was speedy after we queued for just a few minutes. The clerk did try, gently, to get us to upgrade our room but we declined. He was very pleasant and informative. In fact, every one of the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful. Our room in the Queen's Tower was as you would expect in a typical busy city centre business hotel. It was on the 32nd floor with a good view north over the city square and old town hall (which chimed every hour night and day). I wondered if the view to the south was better, perhaps seeing some of the lake. A friendly chambermaid let me in to another room on the opposite side of the building for a look. No lake but plenty of high rise buildings. No problems in getting to the 32nd floor. The lifts were plentiful and speedy Our room was fine, and not particularly big. The bathroom was not too large either, but everything was clean and in good repair. I requested a electrical extension cord and it arrived within a few minutes (no socket outlets near a mirror for my wife to dry her hair, and the bathroom would be too steamy after a shower .) There were a couple of queen beds but just one easy chair. There was also a safe and coffee maker in the room. The beds were comfy. The air conditioning took a bit of fiddling to set just right (not too hot, not too cool, not too noisy) The room was single glazed which I though was unusual. Double glazing insulates the heat and cold but it also deadens the noise. In saying that, apart from the chiming Town Hall clock and occasional sirens, street noise was never more than a low level hum. The lobby was very busy most of the time (There was a large convention on in the hotel's function suite at the time and I spotted a couple of weddings over the 3 days we stayed there) There are 3 PCs in the lobby which are free to use for 20 minutes or so which were very handy for a quick email home or to transfer photographs from a full digital camera onto an empty memory stick. There were lots of nice comfy chairs, newspapers, books all over the lobby. There was a sports bar and restaurants but we didn't try them. We preferred to eat out as there are oodles of bars and restaurants all over the place from hot dog stands, burger joints to fine international dining within a short stroll or taxi ride. The hotel lobby and the concourse, a floor below, is connected to Toronto's PATH, a 16 mile, 27 kilometre network of shops, restaurants, food courts, services etc connecting many of the major buildings, hotels, stores, malls and stations in the town centre. Great for keeping out of the heat in high summer and the snow in winter [---] The only complaint I had was not about the hotel but some of their guests. A party of VERY noisy ladies rolled in at about 4 am on Sunday morning, obviously after a very good night on the town. I've no objection to that, but I do object when they run back and forth between rooms, yelling, giggling and screaming in glee, slamming doors and shouting down the corridor to each other. There was no sign of the giggling ladies on Sunday morning and no more nocturnal shenanigans for the rest of our stay. There is a bus stop right outside the door for the airport bus. Buy tickets from the tour desk to save time on the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Big, bustling and impressively efficient”
Reviews.Author: billyboy
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here in June and were happy to return for a further 2 nights in July. Check-in was fast and smooth and bags taken to our room immediately. Check-out was even faster with the bill, showing the amount charged to my credit card, being pushed under the bedroom door in the early hours of the morning of our departure. Bags were collected within 2 minutes of telephoning the bell desk. The room was large, with 2 very comfortable queen sized beds and lots of soft pillows. Guests may choose when they wish their room to be cleaned and serviced, and housekeeping standards are high. The bathroom was spacious and lots of fresh towels and toiletries were provided. The shower over the bath was efficient and there was constant hot water. Breakfast in "The Bistro on 2" was good value for money at just over 25 dollars (including taxes but excluding the expected 3 dollar tip) per person, but only for those who can eat a really substantial meal in the morning. Anyone who likes only a light breakfast would be better to eat in the food court below the hotel for under 5 dollars. Although the Airport Express is mentioned in other reviews, we used taxis for the airport/hotel/airport transfers, with a journey time of only 20 minutes as against 45 minutes or more by bus, due to the numerous hotel pickups. The Sheraton is one of the first collection points on the Airport Express route. The fare from the airport was 45 dollars, but only 40 dollars on the return journey as there are lots of taxis anxious for business. Bus tickets for 2 persons cost 36 dollars, so there is not much in it. There is no waiting for anything in this hotel. Elevators are numerous and speedy, waiter service is slick, bell staff are on-the-ball and most helpful with local information and receptionists are pleasant and efficient. In summary, a great city centre hotel in a great location and one which I will be happy to stay in on any future visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in The Heart of Toronto (20th - 23rd June)”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in the Sheraton Toronto Center. This was our 5th time in Toronto and we were only there for a short length of time. After viewing the hotels on offer and our passed experience we decided on the Sheraton for its location. In the passed we had stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle and the Fairmont Royal York, we found these to be too far out of the city center. Transfer from the airport was smooth, we took the airport express bus which was reccommended by the hotel. It dropped right off at the hotel and picked up at T1, T2 and T3, it cost aroun $19.95 each for a single ticket. Check in was quick and easy and the staff were very helpful and friendly. We had room 888 which was in the Richmond Tower, we had a view of the financial district. The beds wwere very comfortable and the rooms were cleaned daily. The hotel is very big with 4 restaurants a leisure centre and gardens. The hotel is connected to the underground tunnel system called "path", where underneath the hotel you can find a large food court. There is also free internet access to all hotel guests. The hotel is located oppisote the town square and is connected and close to the Easton Center and the Bay Department Store. Overall the Sheraton is a great hotel in a great location, do not be put off by its size because it does not loose its charm. I would definantley visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better than this!!”
Reviews.Author: MJA_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business May 2007. I also brought my husband and 2 kids. Club level room had a phenomal view of the CN tower and the waterfront. Club lounge was nice (but definitely not kid-friendly.) Staff were unbelievably accomodating. Recommend parking valet, though. We parked at the garage next to the hotel and our car was broken into on the last day. The Sheraton staff was immediately helpful. They helped us call our insurance company and even arranged for a mobile glass company to come to the hotel and fix our window. Since we had already checked out of our room they offered us free breakfast at their Bistro restaurant while we waited. The manager stayed with my husband until the repair was complete. He even gave us cookies and bottled water for our trip. We will be Sheraton customers for life!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in the heart of the city (June 16th -18th)”
Reviews.Author: Brookadingo
Reviews.Content: First off a big thank you to the hotel. I rang up before hand to ask for a room with a view as it was my wife's 30th birthday and not only did the room and view blow us away, we even got a complimentary bottle of wine. Great touch. The room on the 35TH FLOOR (!!) was superb. It was very clean and the king size bed was also very comfortable. The hotel lobby was huge and the bar in the hotel wasn't very expensive which was surprising. We did go to the Sunset cafe for breakfast (as recommended by other tripadvisors) and it was a great tip so thank you. The cafe was only a block or two away on Yonge and Richmond and was very nice and great value. Everything seemed very close by and we walked to the waterfront area and the Steam Whistle Brewery (right by the CN Tower) and i'd recommend both, if you get tthe chance. The CN Tower was absolutely superb and although the restaurant was very expensive it is worth doing if you can. (and besides we sat a couple of tables down from Will Smith and his family!!) Overall a great hotel and great city. Would love to go back and would strongly recommend this hotel and city. The one and only thing wrong is the $35 a day valet parking!! Please take this advice if you stay at this hotel. The building sits on a corner and there is Parking across the road on 3 of the sides that are between $10 - $20 less a day.

Reviews.Title: “Your typical large downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: YVRTraveller
Reviews.Content: A busy hotel located in the heart of the Toronto business district. Stayed here in July 2006 for business. Service and amenities are top notch. Expect prompt, professional service. Rooms had comfortable beds, great showers and nice furnishings. Lots of choice for restaurants and entertainment within the hotel. The Sheraton Centre is connected to the PATH Network; Toronto's underground city. Many more choices for dining, entertainment and shopping can be found literally steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel yet for me”
Reviews.Author: stillsmoking
Reviews.Content: Ok, let me start by saying I book this hotel off Hotwire-great prices but no refunds at all for any reason so make sure of the dates you want to go. I walked in after spending 1 night at the Days hotel, took the subway over at noon, had my bags in my car trunk which was still park at the Day's hotel garage-did not have to move it till 2 pm. The lobby is so big I could not find the check in desk so I asked around. Was told this man at a small desk could help me-turns out to be the gold members check in desk-which I seen the sign at the end. He was so very nice to me, did not say that I should go to the normal check in desk where everybody else goes. Took my ID and credit card and notice I book from the internet. Was hoping they would just give me a room, the hotel lobby was so nice I could not believe the price I paid. Check in went great, in fact I was given a room on the 27 th floor. In the Queens tower, Wow. No asking if I wanted a upgrade for a small charge. A first class place all the way. What more can I say, the view was great, the elevators were high speed-they zip you pass the first 24 story's. Could not even feel it stopping. My room was first class, it had a room safe which was locked. I called downstairs, as soon as I pushed the button somebody was there, I told them I could not open the safe so they said someone will be over to my room. In 5 mins a very nice dressed man show up. He was able to get it open with some fancy phone-like a blackberry. Even the safe work first class, you enter your numbers and the door just open. Not like most where you need to pull it. Was the only problem I had and it was quickly taken care of. The next day, after a great night sleep-those beds blow away the Day's Inns beds, I order room service. Got the farmer breakfast and juice. Again, just push the button on the phone and somebody was right on the other end, no waiting what so ever-same with those elevators. 15 mins later my food was in my room, hot and very good. Bill was $35 but was worth it. I paid $20 for breakfast across the street from the Day's hotel the day before, food was not as good and I had to go outside my room. Well after I return home I joined the starwood member club, you get points for each dollar spent-not if you book on Hotwire just if you book from the hotel itself. I already am a Hilton Honors member but the Sheraton are even nicer-then they also have the St Regis hotels-not in Toronto but in most big city's. I did walk in the Hilton lobby next door, was nothing like the Sheraton. Thanks hotwire, thanks to the nice man who check me in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snowwhite
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is wonderful. We actually changed rooms after our first night becauase we were next to the lift - 1914- and we found this quite noisy but we moved to 1942 the following day. The even numbered rooms face the CN Tower and pool (useful to see your family) and the odd face the City Hall. A lot of people have said to get a room facing city hall (A very impressive building) but we were pleased we had the CN Tower as the clock struck every hour on the old city hall and I imagine you would hear this. The steak restaurant, although very dark, was superb value for great steaks. The bar prices were ok for a hotel in a big city. All the staff were so helpful and so friendly. Lifts always available - we never had to wait more than a few seconds. The room was large and the beds VERY bouncy. The kids loved launching themselves on them and falling off again! There was a large wardrobe and 3 good deep drawers and a cupboard and shelves - plenty of storage. The bathroom had lots of counter space. For some reason the maid didn't take the tips we left just by the tele. We did leave a good tip when we left though. Our flight home wasn't until 11.30pm so we asked for a late checkout. We were told it was $50 until 4 and $100 until 6. I asked if they could do $50 until 6 and they said yes virtually straight away. We were also told we could use the pool for longer. As many people have already said, the pool is great and the hot tub very hot. Our kids were allowed in the hot tub/jacuzzi with us too which was nice, (they are 11 and 7) If you are reading this because you are deciding which hotel then book then just go ahead and book! If you have already booked and, like me, love looking for new reviews then be assured that you will have a great stay here and in Toroto!

Reviews.Title: “Quality accomodation in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: gje123
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on this hotel from Canadian Affair. I arrived here late on a Saturday night with my wife and kids (14 and 11). We were greeted warmly by the reception staff and given a lovely room, very high up, with a great view of the CN tower. We stayed here for 3 days. The staff were very courteous and helpful. The quality of the entire hotel was excellent. The indoor outdoor pool was great. I highly recommend basing yourself here when staying in Toronto. We also stayed at the Westin Harbour Castle, but the Shereaton was definately superior.

Reviews.Title: “Geat central location”
Reviews.Author: 092910f
Reviews.Content: Great centrally located hotel with friendly and helpful staff. We walked everywhere as everything we need was in easy access such as the CN Tower and eaton centre for shopping. Rooms are a good size with extremely comfortable beds, never slept so well on a holiday! The hotel is big and busy, partly because there is a large conference centre in it but it was underneath the hotel so it was just the lobby that seems active. Hotel is linked to various underground shops but did not really explore these as The eaton centre and other shopping areas kept us busy enough! Nigrara falls is a good day out but first impressions can be disappointing, especially when they seem to have built blackpool next to it. However once you have been on the maid in the mist you realise just how awe inspiring the falls really are. Do the helicopter trip if possible, it is very cheap and worth every penny. Niagara on the lake looks so beautiful but the trips just drive through with out stopping, which is a shame. Great hotel, great location, great value

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kemc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 17th - 20th, hotel staff were so friendly and helpful, the room was clean and very comfortable. Did the Niagra tour from the hotel and it was brilliant, the tour guide was really friendly. If you do the tour, do the afternoon one as you get a meal at the sheraton falls hotel with a great view over Niagra falls. We had no complaints with our stay and would definately stay at the Sheraton again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Experiencing Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jerseyians
Reviews.Content: Let me preface that we got this hotel room discounted through hotwire, which made our stay even better (knowing we did not spend top dollar)! Hotel Positives: location is prime! Easy access to great restaurants, shopping outside your door or literally downstairs - below the hotel. Subway less than a block away. Beautiful lobby. Friendly and helpful service. Hotel Negatives: Must pay for internet in your room or if you use hotel's computer. But if you have your own wireless laptop, you can connect in the lobby where there is a nice seating area for you to connect. Parking is expensive, but what do u expect in a busy city? Luckily, there is a municipal lot that is quite reasonable on wkends, a little pricey on weekdays - it all depends on how much you'll be using your car. We didnt use it much, public transportation is very easy. (Use day/family pass on wkends - unltd use is worthwhile if you'll be travelling all over the city). Using the gym is an additional fee per day, although the use of the pool is no extra charge. In the heart of downtown Toronto, you have easy access to diverse restaurants on Queen St. (mainly of Asian influence) - not too pricey. Bars and jazz clubs are nearby as well. If you prefer opera, it's next door. Just across the way, less than a block is Eaton Mall. You really can't go wrong if you decide to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: rdcjMD
Reviews.Content: Got a very good price from Hotwire and we had a great 6 day stay . Location, as in previous reviews, was excellent. The Eaton Center is a 5 minute walk. Restaurants are at your doorsteps and if you want to save, there are burger and hotdog stands at the Queen st entrance. Hotel service was impeccable. Lastly you save on airport transfer since there is a Western Pacific Express that takes you directly to the hotel which is a lot cheaper than taking a taxi or a limo.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, enoyed the pool.”
Reviews.Author: Rubbertops
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seraton Centre on the May long weekend. The location was great. We parked across the street (under City Hall) in the Green "P" parking for $18. We got a $69 rate from Hotwire. With fees and exchange it came to around $100 Canadian. Rack rate was $200. We stayed on the 14th (really 13th) floor with a City Hall view. We could have upgraded to club room for $60 at check in. This would have included breakfast and a better room (higher floor), however, we declined. The staff was very helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The pool was great and we made use of it both days. Nice patio with bar and lounge chairs. We did not eat in any hotel restaurant. We had a nice breakfast at the Sunset Grill on Richmond and Younge (about a block from the hotel). We ere very happy with our stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: BRIANROWLE
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a short break in Toronto, staying at the Sheraton Centre hotel. All my travel arrangements were made through Canadian Affair. As the name suggests the hotel is located in the centre of Toronto. Local attractions, restaurants and shopping are within easy reach by foot. The hotel and room were well presented; the room having tea/coffee facilities, iron/ironing board and hair dryer .In the Lobby there is a Tour desk, enabling you to get as much information as possible about the city and surrounding area. You can even book excersions through the desk. Also in the lobby the is a small coffee shop, free access to the internet. A useful service provided by the hotel is the baggage room, where on the day of departure, if you don't want to pay an extra $50 or $100 for a late check out, you can deposit your luggage for free and collect when you want. If I return to Toronto I would certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Robster1965
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to everyone travelling to Toronto. The location was excellent and you had easy access to everywhere in Toronto. Even if the weather is bad you can get around using the underground PATH system from the hotel without stepping outside. The room was spacious and was kept clean and well maintained by the house maids. When leaving the hotel we found the baggage porters extremely helpful in getting us transportation to the airport. The only downside we had was when we needed assistance from the Tour Desk, we found one male member of staff was rude and not helpful when we tried to book tours and theatre tickets. We will be recommending this hotel to anyone that is planning to stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: antontravel2004
Reviews.Content: Great location. We walked to the Princess of Wales Theatre to see Phantom of the Opera. We could see the Marriott from our window. We were directly facing the new city hall. On the east side of the lobby is a small convenience store, and right outside the door is a Tim Hortons which has excellent breakfast sandwiches. Directly across the street is the Winston Churchill Statue, where the GreyLine Trolley / Double Decker Tour bus picks you up. Rooms were big and clean. For a great meal, go to the Diplomatico restauraunt in Little Italy, located at Clinton Street and College Street. To help you remember, memorize the phrase Bill Clinton went to College and he loves rigatoni (ask an Italian to explain this joke)

Reviews.Title: “Lack of special touches disappointed”
Reviews.Author: clson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for a conference for two nights. I liked the room decor (no pastel floral prints) and the front desk staff (cheerful and helpful). I disliked: that there were no minibar or snacks in my room, no robe for going to the pool, that they charged me $9 a day to use the fitness facilities and $2.00 for each local phone call (the room rate was not that cheap), that the hot tub was a bit grungy (although the pool was nice), and the service in the breakfast restaurant was very mixed. I loved the fact that the heating/air conditioning system in the room was easy to turn off and there was a window that opened, creating comfortable ventalation, which is always a challenge in a large, high rise hotel. The location is convenient, but there are much more charming places to stay in Toronto for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for an extended stay!”
Reviews.Author: rebel1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Sheraton Centre Hotel in April 2007. For reference, we have also stayed at several other hotels in the downtown Toronto area including the Sutton Place, Delta Chelsea, the Royal Meridian King Edward, Westin Harbour Castle, and the Courtyard By Marriot (yes we go to T.O. quite often). I was really impressed with the Sheraton on many levels. First off, the room itself. The room was clean, spacious and functional. We had a King bed that was very comfortable. My wife has back issues and rarely finds hotel beds to her liking, but this bed did not bother her at all. Probably the best bed we've slept in while in Toronto save for the Westin Harbour Castle. Bathroom was clean and relatively spacious. Shower was average sized - shower curtain railed extended in a loop to provide more room in the shower. Toiletries were upper-scale (Pantene shampoo as opposed to no-name brand). There was also a spacious closet which contained a programmable safe for your use. Check-in and check-out were effortless. All staff we encountered were pleasant and professional. Parking at the hotel is all valet at a whopping $35/night. Save your money and park across the street in the City Hall underground parking for half the price. There is an underground PATH walkway direct to the hotel. If you use the amenities, you are in luck. A pretty impressive fitness centre with lots of equipment. A heated pool is also available that extends to the outside when weather permits. Hot-tubs and saunas are there too. There are a couple of restaurants and bars in the hotel. We only tried the steakhouse Le Biftheque. The prime rib was excellent...didn't care for much else food wise there. Beneath the hotel is Toronto's PATH underground walkway. This is a 10km stretch that extends from the Eaton Centre shopping plaza to Union Station. Filled with stores and restaurants, it's like a mini-mall as well as a weatherproof walkway to wherever you are going in the downtown core. Overall, an excellent hotel that combines location, convenience and comfort. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jimmy0999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. Booked thru Hotwire. Would gladly stay there again! The central location was excellent - we did not use our car during our entire stay. When I checked in, my husband, waiting in the car, was approached by a valet and told where to park our car for a lot less than the hotel parking. The hotel parking is $35 per day, the city parking garage to the hote was $19 per night. Very customer service hotel, indoor/outdoor pool was great! And, for those who forget baby swim diapers, the pool conveniently has them. A great value for $85us per night!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, awesome view!”
Reviews.Author: paulela
Reviews.Content: You'll love the location of this hotel - next to subway (1 block), 2.5 blocks away from major shopping centre (Eaton Centre), across the street from Nathan Phillips Square & City Hall, 4 blocks north of the train station (Union Station), 3 good steakhouses (including Ruth's Chris right across the street) and there's always people to make you feel like you're in the right part of town and not some run down location. The hotel has 46 floors if I recall correctly. I had access to the Club Level lounge on the 43rd floor which offers a nice continential breakfast with an incredible view of downtown Toronto. Overall, this is a 4* hotel given the quality of the room, service/staff and an excellent location. I'd return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: bridgendbaggie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week on the 40th floor, great views over the city. Excellant location for just about everything, especially Eaton centre and the Bay and if the weather is bad you are directly above the Path subway system - which is also handy for cheap breakfasts/lunches. Very friendly and helpful staff, the room size was average with very comfortable beds. The pool/gym were great, the pool sits half in/half out and is heated so we were able to swim outside in minus temperatures and snow! The steak restaurant just off the lobby was great value and superb steaks - better than the Keg and thats saying something. Pre-book any trips to Niagara via the internet before you go, we saved $50pp on hotel prices.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure how they do it...”
Reviews.Author: cdinlondon
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Sheraton Toronto Centre. Booked on Priceline for an absurdly low price, and I just can't figure out how Priceline gets the rooms this low. This is a great hotel, location, location, location. Close to everything you want to do in Downtown Toronto. You can walk underground to the Eaton Centre, and then from there take the subway virtually anywhere. The pool and fitness area is very nice, you can even swim outdoors, which was quite invigorating. The hotel itself is a typical 4 star. Great beds/bedding, clean and well equiped rooms. The toiletries were not the greatest (Pantene) but that was only a minor issue. Our room was only on the 2nd floor, but the front desk clerk (who was very friendly) said it was a junior suite (we had two rooms and he said this was all he had available on the same floor at the time as there was a music teacher convention at the hotel) Getting to the room was a little bit of a pain, you have to go up a small flight of stairs, which with a child in a stroller and a lot of bags was a little bit of a chore. These rooms have a view of the waterfall garden area, and actually have a patio door out onto the garden. (which my wife loved since she is unfortunately a smoker) The one serious negative about the hotel is the price of valet parking. I know it is a big city, but it isn't New York, yet they charge you $35 a night for valet. There are other self park options around the hotel, but we had our daughter and my mother with us (and all the subsequent baggage) so we really had to use the valet. Maybe this is how they get away with basically giving away some rooms to Priceline. We did order room service, it was lightning quick, and decent enough, of course as in most hotels radically overpriced. All in all was a good stay, Sheraton website had the rooms @ $189 CDN a night when we went, not sure I would have been as upbeat had we paid this, but given the $60 US a night we paid it would be hard for me not to be happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKRugbyprop3
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a club level room on the 36th floor for not a lot more cost than a standard one. Really, really comfy bed, spacious room, bathroom perfectly ok if a little dated in decor. The best thing about the hotel was the club lounge on the 43rd floor - but you need to be in a club level room to get in free - alternatively you can pay but its pricey. Views from up there are quite spectacular and there is free internet with 2 PCs and printers. There you are served breakfast which is a good selection of fruit, cereals, cheese and meat, and continental style breakfasts. From 5pm they serve little snacks until 8pm, other times you can pop in for coffee - until it closes at 10pm. Tour desk staff are very helpful. Overall, a really nice hotel and would definately stay again. Nice gym and ok swimming pool with a bit inside and a bit outside. We braved it in -7c and we survived!! If you like fast elevators and views - this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: sewaterman
Reviews.Content: Downtown Hilton was full and had to make a meeting so booked a club floor room at the Sheraton. Flew in from Vancouver so arrived early evening - no club floor rooms because "we had several block bookings". [at Sheraton individuals bookings are apparently much less important than block ones] Said I could have an ordinary room with "club floor priveliges" - ie they'd charge me club rate for an ordinary room + breakfast. Some gentle whining later got the room upgraded to a suite - tired, grubby and with the loudest heating/AC system I've ever met -bit like sleeping in a wind tunnel. Hilton this was definitely not ! When I insisted they moved me to a club room next day - which of course meant re-packing everything. Better but still grubby - black fingerprints on the back of the bathroom door - old towels, minimal toiletries, bath robe that had shrunk and was too small for my size 10 frame. Breakfast was basic - fresh fruit wasn't [very bruised strawberries, rock hard melon, over-ripe pineapple] lots of pastry but few healthy choices. Glasses with fingerprints, uncleared tables. And $12 for a single glass of wine in the evening. Best advice - book the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Great March Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestofToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night as a March Break getaway. Everyone had a blast. The indoor/outdoor pool was hit with the kids. The water was so warm and being able to swim outside in Toronto in winter was a highlight. Club room benefits of pre-dinner snacks and continental breakfast in morning is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Family holiday in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Sunnier-climates
