Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton hotel for 6 nights. Our hotel room was on the 18th floor and we had a great view of City Hall and an ice skating rink. We travelled with our four (nearly five) year old daughter and Isobel on the concierge desk went out of her way to talk to her. The hotel was attached to the underground path network and we could walk to the Eaton Shopping Centre direct without even going outside in the snow. This was fantastic as we didn't need to take all of our coats, hats, scarves and gloves, which were definitely required for this time of year. We enjoyed the indoor / outdoor heated swimming pool and the indoor hot tub. The hotel managed to obtain tickets to see The Raptors (Toronto basketball team), which was a sell out. The hotel room was spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. We would recommend this hotel to other families visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience at Sheraton, Toronto, Canada”
Reviews.Author: naplespalmtrees
Reviews.Content: First, when we arrived the room I had reserved was not available. We had a two beds room instead of a king size room with a rolloway bed for our child. They could not make any changes before the day after. The beds were terrible since every time we moved one finger, the whole bed moved. We felt we were jumping every time we moved ! Next day we moved to a king size bedroom and we had the extra bed we had requested one month before our stay. The king size bed was as bad as the two beds we had in the previous room. It made it very hard to sleep. Second, the rooms were very small and so the bathrooms. Third, the cleaning was really bad. You can find hairs everywhere including your bed. You don't have to look at the corners to find dirt. Fourth, it was very expensive for what you got!!!! The only good point about this hotel was the fact that we were able to go shopping indoor when it was very cold outside. Besides that, I think you can find a better hotel in Toronto, cheaper with a better location. Hope this help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall, Fire Alarms a problem.......”
Reviews.Author: CJWirral
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Sheraton Centre over New Year 2006 and for us it was a thoroughly enjoyable holiday. The staff were friendly and the warm welcome reflected what we experienced throughout our time in Toronto. We had no problems with keeping the room at a comfortable temperature, standards of housekeeping were acceptable to us and we personally did not feel that staff were just looking to get a tip when attending to you. BUT....unfortunately there is a problem with the Fire Alarm "false alarms" which you may wish to get a current update from the hotel about (?) We were woken on two occasions in the night during our stay and it really does disrupt plans you may have for a good nights sleep!!! On checking out, the desk clerk was most apologetic but did not go into too much detail as to why this is happening? Sadly this would be the only reason that may deter us from staying at this hotel in the future (any updates would be much appreciated?!) If you do choose to stay here, check out the pool it's great, swimming outside on New Years Day can't be beaten!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Priceline Beauty!”
Reviews.Author: Irishman_27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in September 2006. Wanted downtown 4 star hotel for good rate so I could visit with my brother. The Sheraton didn't disappoint. It's quite a big complex and difficult to navigate, but the room was great and the location was excellent. I'm staying here again in March 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not special”
Reviews.Author: Cambridgtravler
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel. My room had a view of new City Hall, which I very much enjoyed. The hotel is incredibly large and connected to all of downtown via the PATH, and loads of nearby shopping. My room had no tourist information in it at all, and there was little available in the lobby. I asked a staff member in the lobby for a Toronto NOW magazine and was told they were all out, but a staff member found me in the lobby bar a while later and provided with with one, which was very nice. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, very convenient for that first cup in the AM. The room was pleasant, nothing special. The elevator to my room was off in a corner, the area was filthy the whole time I was there. This has a good central location and I booked it in conjunction with a flight, so got a good deal. Hoewver I think the size put me off, it seemed cold and a bit overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location & very good standard accomodation”
Reviews.Author: SamsCalling
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of January 2007. Upon arriving, the hotel lobby looked very modern & clean, and there was no queue for the check in desk (around 5pm). We were allocated 2 rooms (as we were travelling with friends) on the same floor - not in the main Sheraton building, but in the smaller tower (can't remember what it was called) - but this wasn't a problem as it was just as easy to reach our rooms as it would have been if we were in the main building. We were on the 10th floor & had an excellent view of City Hall & the ice skating rink. The rooms were very spacious & had two double beds, a desk area & a corner chair. There was a safe in the room (complimentary) & the bathroom was clean & modern. The beds were very comfortable & the maid service thorough! No complaints about the rooms whatsoever, they were very nice. We ate in the Traders bar/restaurant which is on the ground floor, in the lobby. They serve main meals such as burgers, pasta dishes etc, which were very nice on the 2 occasions we ate there. We also ate at the Bistro on Two - we had breakfast there which I think was $22 + tax for the buffet, but there were a range of other options ranging from $12 upwards. The buffet was huge with lots of fruits, cereals, hot breakfast items, omlette bar, pastries etc. We also ate at the steak restaurant, Le Biftheque, but sadly the service was very slow & our waiter far from helpful. The portions though (my boyfriend had chicken & ribs) were huge, & my steak was very nice. The hotel is part of the PATH network so connects directly to the Eaton Centre & other places which was great. Location wise we felt we couldn't have been in a better location. The staff on the trip desk were very helpful, although there wasn't much on at the time we went - most of the theatres don't start shows again until mid-late January. We went up the CN tower & did a tour of Niagra Falls, then did some shopping. If we go back to Toronto I'd have no hestiations about staying at the Sheraton again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: kevie1985
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in October and having read reviews from this sight I was expecting something pretty good. The room was nice and clean but not as big as I expected. The hotel is in a great location its pretty close to the Eaton centre and has very easy access through the path system. The restaurant in the hotel wasnâ€™t really up to much the waiter seemed more interested in the hockey game and the food was not amazing. I was also disappointed with the internet we stayed in 2 other hotels on this trip where we got free internet in the Sheraton we had to pay for 24 hour only internet access. For a big company like Sheraton you think they could afford to give you the internet for free. I did really like this hotel we had a great view and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great view”
Reviews.Author: FCOSTIN
Reviews.Content: We got a great price throught Priceline (65$ US). Arrived at 8:30PM and asked for a refurbished city hall view room. Were told that all rooms are refurbished and were given the last city hall view room on ninth floor. Room was great, clean, large, bathroom was clean, but a bit old. View was superb. Quiet althougt we were near elevator. Overall, great stay, and we were happy to save money on the room and spend it at Senses restaurant at the Soho Metropolitan Hotel. Best dinner we had in a very long time and we have been to France last year ! Interior/exterior pool is a great extra.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: manny_83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 6 Lads for 2 nights (thursday/friday). We were given 2 rooms next to each other, which were connecting so it was ideal! Great Hotel. We encountered no problems at all and were given friendly service. Location is great on Queen Street. 2 minutes walk from the Eaton Shopping Center and around 10 -15 minutes walk to the CN tower (if you go the correct way!!). Excellent location. Would recommend this hotel highly, especially as the rates are so good. You get your value, end of.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: postmanpat
Reviews.Content: stayed at the sheraton centre 12/1/07 for a week room was fantasic with great views of city skyline and cn tower.staff very helpful and also got a free room upgrade to a suite very nice.great location would defintley go again,canada is a great place very clean and very nice people. ...salford manchester

Reviews.Title: “Great pool!”
Reviews.Author: Lovely72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre for 4 nights from 8 Dec â€“ 12 Dec. Our trip was primarily for Christmas shopping for which the hotel was perfect location wise. It had direct links to the underground city (PATH) and was about 2 minutes walk away from The Eaton Centre. It was also perfect for Christmas activities, it was directly opposite the ice skating rink and outside stage where they had Christmas concerts and shows over the weekend. The hotel itself was functional, very large, busy but kept to a good standard. The rooms were a good size with an extremely comfortable king sized bed with lovely warm duvets and covers, just what you need with the sub-zero temperatures outside! All the usual extras were included such as hairdryer, internet access, tea/coffee making facilities etc. The bathroom was the only slightly disappointing aspect, although a good size it had a somewhat â€œplastickyâ€� feel to it, however it was kept very clean, tidy and we were provided with the standard bathroom products. We had breakfast every morning at the Bistro on Two which was ideal. It was clean, comfortable and had a huge buffet selection which was fresh every morning. There was even a chef on hand to make your eggs just how you like them, perfect for my partner who loves his eggs freshly scrambled! The final thing which I can highly recommend is the pool. As a keen swimmer it was great to have a city centre hotel with a pool that was a fairly decent size. I loved the fact that it was an indoor/outdoor pool. Invigorating to be swimming in a warm pool whilst outside in -10 degree air temperature!

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad at Sherton Centre”
Reviews.Author: PDRoberts
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton centre in late December while visiting family in Toronto area. This stay was a real mix of good and pretty bad so I thought I would share our experiences. We booked two rooms online through Starwood. I am a Gold member with Starwood which means they are supposed to upgrade us, room availability permitting. Starwood sent an email shortly after the booking asking if we would like to pay for an upgrade to the Club Level. I called the hotel itself to ask if I wouln't be upgraded automatically due to status with Starwood and was told unquestionably yes we would be upgraded. On arrival we were told that no upgrade would be given and that out of the 1400+ rooms in the hotel (it's a big hotel), no suites were available for upgrade or purchase and the only two connecting rooms were on a low floor. While I was being told this the couple next to us was being asked if they wanted to pay extra to be upgraded to one of the six club floors. Real mixed messages here. Later we were told by staff that the hotel was running the entire week at 30-40% occupancy. The rooms at the Sheraton Center are finely equipped. the rooms were clean and adequately sized and furnished. the hotel dates from the 70 s I think, but it has obviously been rehabbed recently. The real issue with the room was there is no door seal at the bottom of the door and we were immediately opposite the elevator bank. It was loud even during the day and ungodly loud at night. Further complicating the noise was a broken elevator which was stuck on our floor and whose door alarm was going off every two minutes for seven hours. It finally was fixed at 1:00 am after several requests. My wife and I made three requests for switching rooms the first day, all of which were turned down flat by the front desk (Remember hey were at 30-40% occupancy). The thermostat in our room was also broken so the heater was blasting to room to over 80 degrees. If we turned it off, the hallway noise was even worse so we had to leave the connecting door open with our kids room and set their thermostat to 65 so the two systems battled all night. The next morning a maintenance person came and worked on the heater, pronounced it fixed after a minute then left. Trust me it was not fixed. They next morning after a sleepless night, the front desk did locateus two connecting rooms far away from the elevator on an upper floor. We could not switch rooms till late afternoon, but finally we were in the new rooms. That night we slept soundly and in comfort. Pool- The indoor outdoor pool was great and we and our kids used it everyday. Fun for the kids to swim oustide in 30 degree weather with steam rising off the pool, then come back inside. Lobby- This is an attractive hotel Lobby. It's big and business oriented place, but looks nice. Location- The location near City Hall (Ice Rink at Nathan Phillips Square), the Eaton Center and shopping District was ideal. Right after arrival we realized that my son had forgotten his swimming suit. He and I were able to use the underground tunnels (PATH) system to walk two blocks in shorts all in conditioned spac,e to the Bay (large Department store) and puchase a swimsuit. Easy, convenient and fun for us Californians though we did get more that a few strange looks walking in shorts in Toronto in late December. Staff- While we met a few great staff at the hotel, but there were a half dozen who were mediocre to downright rude and this really affected our experience at the hotel. They just didn't care if the guests were being taken care of or not. Overall- You might have a good time here and the location is great, but I think there are probably much better options if you want to be in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly ruined our Canadian vacation!”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveDiving
Reviews.Content: I have relied upon Tripadvisor reviews for several years now and have never been completely disappointed with the results. However, THIS hotel is completely overrated on this website. I spent a great deal of time weighing the pros and cons of staying at the centrally located Sheraton Towne Center and at other "higher" rated hotels. I decided to try the Sheraton on my travel agent's and Tripadvisor reviews' advice. We stayed there for our family Holiday mini-vacation Dec. 28 through 31st. I'll try not to go on forever -- though the negative experience we had at this hotel would warrant it. We purchased a Sheraton deal on the website -- though I contacted the hotel directly by phone to ensure I was getting the best deal. I upgraded to a Club Level room for an approximate $60 per night when I made the reservations. When we checked in there appeared to be no problem -- we were ushered to our room by a reasonably pleasant bellcap. The room was short a couple of towels as there were four of us staying in the room including our two children, 7 and 10, and they would be swimming and, thus, showering after each swim. I then noticed that the Club Level included robes for the room, which were not present. Called front desk and they took care of this with no problem. We then embarked on a tour of the hotel. First, to the 43rd "Club Lounge" (exclusive rights for Club Level patrons) for hors d'oeuvres and drinks in a luxury club lounge with "fabulous view of the city". We shortly discovered that the Lounge was "closed for the Holidays" and would not reopen until after our visit was complete. So, the free continental breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres, were no longer part of the deal. We asked where our "free" breakfast would be served and were told that it would be at the Bistro on Two -- the restaurant's staff had no idea what we were talking about. Oh, yeah, Traders, the main bar and restaurant in the hotel was ALSO CLOSED!!! "for the holidays". Well, after a great commotion with the front desk (Catherine, Manager -- was actually, to her credit, very accommodating, very understanding and I felt sorry for her that she had to deal with such a mess!) I managed to obtain some compensation for the fact that the hotel had completely lied to me about the services and facilities offered during our stay (and that I had paid EXTRA for!). Next morning at 6 a.m., the FIRE ALARM went off -- if you've read the previous reviews of this hotel (as I had) you would be somewhat prepared for this -- but, we were on the 36th floor and this wasn't something I wanted to warn my children about and risk their being terrified the whole stay. But, when those alarms went off, I was wishing I had told them, because BOTH of my kids were completely FREAKED OUT (thanks, Sheraton!!!). On our second day, the pool temperature began to drop and never stopped. It was a "refreshing" 70 degrees F., by the time we left on the third day. Dirty (I mean not even washed since eaten upon) silverware on our table at the restaurant at breakfast. Drain broke in our room -- drain stopper completely fell out into my hand. Complimentary toiletries were not replaced properly. Came back to our room after a long day of touring and the tip we left the maid was gone, but the beds were not made. Well, she/he managed to pull the comforters up over the crumbled sheets, our kids' stuffed animals and the tv remote -- left under the comforter. Pillows not fluffed -- in fact, not even moved. No water bottles left (as provided in "Club Level" Room). Called to have room "fixed" -- okay, I could make my own bed, but, this was beginning to be ridiculous and why did I pay all this money for a "luxury" hotel and get none of the expected services??? Went to dinner -- came back to the room and NOTHING had been done! WHAT??? Called the manager on duty and then they sent someone up (9 p.m.) to re-make the beds and bring clean towels -- they had only left three and we needed four, etc., etc. Okay, so have I persuaded you??? I suppose it could have been the holidays -- but, I've stayed in many, many luxury rated hotels around the world and could NOT believe my eyes or my ears the entire time I was at the Sheraton! Shame on them!! My kids were unhappy and scared every night to go to sleep because there might be another fire alarm and they were generally unhappy, because I was so unhappy! Wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone who expects to receive the quality services they pay for!!! I don't care if it is the Holidays! All the more reason to pick up the slack and put on a good show for touring travellers!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jess8244
Reviews.Content: It was New Years so there were al lot of drunks, teens, etc...At 2:00 am as I just fell asleep after a long night the fire alarm went off. My boyfriend and I had to walk down 40 flights of stairs a long side childeren and seniors. When we finally arrived downstairs (we had to wait in the lobby until 4:00 am), myself as well as a few other couples asked if we can check out be reimbursed as it was a scary experience and we did not feel safe. The Manager stated "What do you expect? it's new years". The staff was absoloutly rude and not to mention very unhelpful. My boyfriend and I ended up checking out and going home. I will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PuckControl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel along with my family on three occasions during 2006, totalling 30 plus nights and I have enjoyed each and everyone of them. The hotel has a perfect central location, first class staff and rooms that I feel exceed expectations for the price paid. A similar standard hotel in the UK would be three to fours times the cost. I would particularly recommend this hotel to anyone staying with a young family as they go out of there way to make sure all guests, no matter how young, are treated well. The hotel is linked to the downtown PATH system so getting around is easy on foot. If you have a car then leave it in the town hall/city car park across the road from the hotel as it is easy to access from the hotel and a great deal cheaper than parking at the hotel. Rooms offer excellent views of the town hall/ice rink or CN Tower, the higher the floor the better the view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous beds”
Reviews.Author: SDNW
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 5th to 10th Dec 2006 and have only positive things to say. We were fortunate to be given a great room on 19th floor with spectacular views of the ice rink and Saturday fireworks. Beds were amazing and room immaculate. All staff really friendly and helpful, especially the older guy on the "Tour Desk" who sorted out various event tickets for us. Location absolutely brilliant for shopping with access to PATH from lobby. Great when it is really cold outside. Hotel beatifully decorated for Christmas with huge tree and hundreds of poinsettia everywhere. Lovely festive atmosphere and I would go back like a shot!

Reviews.Title: “Good Room for the $$”
Reviews.Author: TrippinCowboy
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for Oct 14-17 on Priceline and were placed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto, here's our review of this property: Check-in and Lobby: The lobby is huge and very grand, the gentleman who checked us in was very polite which was a bit surprising, as my previous experience with check-in at other upscale hotels when holding a Priceline confirmation were usually met with indifference/distain, so I was very pleasantly surprised at the exceptional welcome we received here. Room: We were placed on the 6th Floor in the Richmond Tower (the older tower). The hallway looks dated and had a musky smell but the rooms look like they were recently renovated and there was no odor. The beds as in all Sheratons are lovely. Everything is clean, the decor is in good shape and we have no complaints especially for the price. Bathroom was also very clean and of adequate size. The shower had good pressure which is always important to me when travelling. One flaw is the lack of a fridge so we had to use the trash bucket to hold some ice for chilling our beers bought from the liquor store down the block. Internet was a bit pricy at $15 CAD a night but considering the room rate we paid (about $100 CAD per night) it was not a big deal afterall. Location: Smack in the middle of Downtown Toronto at Queen & Bay and super convenient, shopping is everywhere within walking distance and so is Yonge Street and the subway system. We parked our rental car in the City Hall underground parkade directly across the street (there's an underground walkway that links the parkade to the hotel) and it saved us the $35 valet parking fee per day. The parkade wasn't cheap though still costing us $15 per day on average. We walked to the Air Canada Centre for the Leafs game and it took us about 10 minutes one way. Dining: We can't comment on this as we didn't eat at the hotel, Tim Horton's right outside the door was our main hangout for the weekend. Housekeeping: Maid service was very good and the room is kept clean everyday, requests for extra towels were promptly fulfilled and again no complaints here. Like most large chain hotels sheets will only be changed if you placed the card provided on the nightstand on the bed. Check-out: Since it was a prepaid room checkout was smooth and easy, we were billed the additional charges for the internet use and a couple local calls and they were all billed correctly as expected. Like the gentleman at check-in, the young lady at front desk who checked us out was most courteous and has the sweetest smile I've ever encountered from a front desk agent in all my years of travelling. She placed our receipt in an envelope before bidding us bon voyage and we were on our way in less than 5 min at the desk. We certainly didn't feel like second class citizens like at other hotels we've booked through Priceline before. All in all a great deal considering we got a deal that's 1/3 of the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bella79
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. rooms were spacious, hotel lobby was lovel with fountains, restaurants and shops and connects to the underground. Hotel is located extremely close to the shopping complex's which was extremely handy.

Reviews.Title: “shereton wonderfull !”
Reviews.Author: BANBURYBABE
Reviews.Content: Went to falls last may, truly was trip of a lifetime! shereton was out of this world. our room had view over falls. ceiling to floor windows, and our room was sheer luxury, breakfast was over 50 diffrent choices. would recomend this hotel, very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Tgurl75116
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. The front desk people are very helpful. Plus the rooms are clean and very spacious. I wouldn't mind staying here again when we come back. The view was amazing during the day and night. This hotel is a nice getaway place. I recommend this place to everyone .

Reviews.Title: “Warm Room Indeed”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for four nights. The room was indeed as the last review states... VERY warm. I dont like to sleep in a warm room.... it was warm. You can open up the window... but it cracks open down and out.... it would take some gusty wind for it to make it into the room. The room was quite average... nice bed... the rest... boring and average. The gym is quite nice... had I been able to keep my room comfortable I would stay here again... but because it was so hot. I would not. The gym does not have updated cardio machines, but they do have free weights, weight machines, an indoor/outdoor pool, changing rooms, and lots of old cardio machines. If you are a preferred guest you will have club access... nice am spread... pm was lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Room way too hot”
Reviews.Author: shandydog
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Sheraton. They had just switched from air conditioning to cental heating and the room was unbearable. Even with the small window open I couldn't get the temp below 78 degrees. With or without the AC truned on. Two bad nights of sleep during an important business trip.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs a make-over !”
Reviews.Author: hipdestinations
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while ideally located, definitively needs a make-over! The bathrooms are very small and did during our stay not match our expectations regarding cleanliness. The carpets in the room were old and full of stains, the heating/airconditioning was not working properly so that the room temparture was either too cold or too warm. All in all; not a pleasant experience so we would definitively not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Fire Alarms”
Reviews.Author: Bretts123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sheraton 5 times over the last 3 years and every time I have been at the hotel the fire alarms ring and every time it has been a false alarm. The alarms always go off at night and disturb your sleep and for someone who is there on business it is very very very annoying. I only come back because it is convenient for work. If it was not for this then I would avoid this hotel at all costs if you need a good night sleep. I think I wil now start staying at the HIlton accross the road instead.

Reviews.Title: “A great downtown choice”
Reviews.Author: kayteeYVR
Reviews.Content: My daughter (age 16) and I stayed here Oct 26-29, 2006. I had a business meeting and she came along to investigate some universities and do some shopping. We booked the hotel on Hotwire for a fabulous rate: $84 USD (which came out to $330 Cdn with taxes for 3 nights). Although we ran into a few glitches (e.g., the first room we were assigned had people in it, the ice machine on our floor wasn't working, we only got one bar of soap for our stay when it is typical to get one for the bath and one for the sink), these didn't seem to be an indication of systemic problems and the staff members we encountered were pleasant and helpful. Our room was on the 29th floor facing city hall. It was newly-renovated, well-appointed and quiet. The beds, as previously reported, were extremely comfortable. Internet access was pricey ($14.95 per day) so we declined. Traders is a bustling lobby bar/bistro. My daughter had dinner there one evening and I had a drink. It was reasonably priced (considering its location) and her meal was well-prepared. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for a downtown Toronto stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Galleon
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 kids and I have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Sheraton and it was pretty much perfect. We had a room with 2 very comfy double beds on the 20th floor with a great view out over the city. The kids loved the swimming pool and hot tub with the result we were in the Health Club at least once every day so I can't actually tell you what the showers in the room were like! Its in a great location and we were able to walk to all the attractions. The Tower, Hippo Tour, Hockey Hall of Fame and the Basketball were all big hits for us. The hotel also has direct access to the underground PATH system and on a rainy day we managed to eat and shop pretty much all day without having to step outside at all. Hotel staff were helpful although my husband wasn't too impressed with the bar staff in Traders. The breakfast was too expensive ($75 for a buffet for the whole family) so we ate out but there are plenty breakfast places nearby - we liked Sunset Grill which is less than 5min walk from the hotle (just behind The Bay Store). Plenty of shopping in Toronto but I have to say I found it quite expensive compared to UK prices.

Reviews.Title: “A nice 2 night stay....”
Reviews.Author: David-NZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto for 2 nights in September; our booking was part of a Trafalgar coach tour group and we had not expected to get the very nice rooms we were allocated ; on the 25th floor and newly renovated with extremely comfortable beds, all amenities and very pleasant. Our initial arrival ( independently ) from the airport made us wonder where we were at, as the main entrance is like an underground bus station;noisy and smoky; but once you get inside the doors its really very impressive, huge atrium and excellent staff. If you are interested in safety, we can vouch for the efficiency of the fire alarm system which went off at 3 a .m.our second night ! Luckily a false alarm, but Fire Dept response was very swift . There are side entrances on to the main street and we found the hotel very close to shops, Eaton Centre ( where we ate one night ), The Bay etc., with a very pleasant park and City Hall across the street. If we were to visit Toronto again would certainly return to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: ChildOfTheKing
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Centre overnight Oct. 21, 2006 and we very pleased overall with the hotel. I booked the night using my Starpoints (7,000) and requested an upgrade to a 'club room' for 1,000 more points. The upgrade was well worth it for many reasons. The room came with a king size "sweet sleeper" bed (with a heavy and comfy comforter) and was designed nicely with crown moulding and stylish furniture, including a leather club chair and ottoman. The club rooms are high up in the Queen St. tower (ie. over 40 floors up) so the views are fantastic, and only the club rooms have access to the Club Lounge on the 43rd with free hors d'oeuvres from 5:00 - 8:00 each evening and a free continental breakfast in the morning. Hors d'oeuvres included big tasty chicken wings and cheesy puffed pastries as well as fresh fruit, cheese and crackers and breads with dips. The continental breakfast was very substantial and would have easily cost $13 each if we were paying for it. I would highly recommend upgrading to a club level room for these benefits if the additional cost is only $20 or so. My only knock against the room was that the bathtub was due to be replaced (rusting around the drain significantly), and the bathroom was quite small. Fortunately we were didn't need to be in the bathroom at the same time. It was adequate and clean, but definitely not spa-like. The room had a digital thermostat so you could just set the temperature to whatever you desired, and it would do the rest. Noise was not an issue at all for us - we barely heard a peep from our room the entire time. We didn't use either of the restaurants and room service seemed steep (Caesar salad was $9 and there was a $3.50 charge for delivery plus an automatic 15% gratuity), so we ordered some food in from a place offering free delivery. We also parked across the street at the city hall underground parking lot which was $18 for 24 hours. They have an underground entrance to the Sheraton which was really handy as it was raining when we were leaving. Overall I was quite pleased with our stay at the Sheraton Centre and would not hesitate to come again. If you're looking for a good quality hotel that is close to shopping and all the action downtown Toronto, it's hard to beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value/location”
Reviews.Author: ross71
Reviews.Content: Having only paid about Â£60 for the room through our flight operator (Canadian Affair) we were really impressed with the hotel when we arrived. The atrium is huge, with a smart bar and restaurant next to it and conference rooms on each of the 5 principal floors. We then got upgraded to one of the suites on the 23rd floor, which had a separate lounge and bedroom and is probably the biggest hotel room I've ever stayed in! It was nicely furnished and the sort of design/standard you'd expect from a Marriott hotel in the UK. We only stayed for one night, but I'd recommend this hotel - though was a bit disappointed with Toronto itself, as it's a bit soulless and business focused.

Reviews.Title: “good location!”
Reviews.Author: dougieoscar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Centre for 6 nights from 6 october. The hotel itself was good, the rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable!! This is a very big hotel so expect it to be impersonal - you will more than likely go unnoticed for your stay but to be honest I think thats the best way!!! The tour desk was helpful and we arranged our Niagra visit from there - $150CN each, quite expensive but it was a good trip, especially the driver and guide - Fred. The hotel is in a very good location, definatley within walking distance to everywhere - all be it some places a longer walk than others! We had breakfast every morning in The Sunset Grill on Bay Street, just one block from the hotel - it was great, very clean, endless cups of coffee, eggs every which way!! Eating out in Toronto was good - The One on Younge Street, a Thai restaurant/cafe was fab, The Burrito Boys on Adalaide Street was good for a quick lunch.... We went to see Wicked the new Broadway hit which is really good and also went to see the Toronto Raptors play Boston Celtics in the Air Canada Centre- a good way to spend a night! So all in all a good experience was had, no probs at all!

Reviews.Title: “You Belong-For a Price”
Reviews.Author: traveltrooper
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from Toronto where we stayed at the Sheraton. I would recommend this hotel with a few cautionary comments. First, the entrance the to the hotel looks like a dingy bus depot. There is no clear cut path with which to walk from the city sidewalk to the front doors. You end up dodging past and around the dozens of cars and taxis lined up outside. This is not a big deal but just weird considering they just completed a major remodel of the hotel. This Sheraton seems to be stingy with the amenities. The fitness center will cost you $9.00 unless you have paid for a higher priced room. The towels in our room's bathroom are not of high quality. There is no fridge or minibar, or wine glasses in the room. The newsaper delivery was hit and miss. Sometimes, there was a paper outside your door sometimes not. Saturday mornings there is no delivery. When I phoned the front desk they suggested I would find a Saturday Globe and Mail at the car desk in the lobby. I immediately went down to the lobby and was told they were all out of the Saturday edition of the paper. Hence I conclude that the Sheraton's motto should be revised to read, "You belong-for a price." However, the positive experiences included a very comfortable room and beds. A quiet five day stay despite being beside the ice dispenser and elevators. A nice pool and very friendly bellhops and doormen.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: skcollobsgod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto for 4 nights in October. The room was a refurbished room so was clean and tidy. The wether in Toronto was cold particuarly at night and I could not get the heating to work. I asked the front desk to fix it and they said that the hotel heating had not been turned on yet. They gave us a heater but that broke after 1 day. The breakfast was good but a little expensive. If you need to know anything about Toronto or help with touring then speak to Isabel on the tour desk at the hotel. She was simply brilliant and helped us make the best of our time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: stevefric
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The staff was friendly and helpfull. The parking is somewhat inconvienient and expensive $19-$34 dependeding on if you use a valet. The rooms are smaller than I would have expected for the price. The beds were as comfortable as any I have ever slept in. We didnt use the pool as it is an indoor outdoor pool and it was quite chilly outside. The restaraunts are good but expensive. Next time I am in Toronto I would consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LucindaA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend of mine for 3 nights. We booked it as a package through Travelocity, which ended up being a fantastic deal. The sign on the back of our door said the room was $399 Canadian dollars a night and we paid $350 for 3 nights at this hotel and an airfare - so i think we struck it lucky! We were on the 30th floor, amazing views of Toronto and the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The staff were really helpful, we wanted to watch Desperate Housewives and they left us a very detailed message about what channel it was on and what time etc etc. Its close to everything, we could walk to all the major attractions nad there are lots of lovely restaurants just across the road. If you can get a deal like we did, I would definetely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Teej79
Reviews.Content: After deciding to get married in Toronto and having family and friends coming out for the wedding we needed a hotel with a central location so we choose the Sheraton Centre Hotel. Seeing as it was our wedding we decided to book 4 days through a travel agent and then book ourselves in direct with the hotel for the remaining 2 days in an upgraded room before flying off to go on honeymoon. When arriving at the hotel late at night they had been kind enough to upgrade our room for the entire stay so we ended up on the 35th Floor with access to the Club Lounge on the 42nd Floor. The room was fantastic; we had a good size bathroom, living room and a spacious bedroom with Jacuzzi, which was extremely nice. The views from the room were unbelievable; we had a clear view of the CN Tower and the lake. The only downside to our room was the fact it was geared towards the business man, plug points were not in the right place, the bedroom had no dressing area, the shelf in the bathroom was small and the lights were not in the right place - this made it a bit harder when trying to get myself ready on my wedding day. If you get chance it is worth going to the 42nd Floor as they have floor to ceiling windows on both sides and you get a fantastic view of downtown Toronto and the breakfast is not a bad price. The two things I would be wary of are the telephone charges it works out a lot cheaper to buy a phone card and use a public phone. The second one is eating in the hotel, the Traders Bar is very nice but the food is expensive for what you get, there are plenty of great restaurants and bars in Toronto which are well worth checking out. Overall the stay was very pleasant, the hotel staff were helpful, polite and friendly and hotel was clean and very tidy and it is in a great location close to all amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: live2travel1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto hotel from Sept. 20 - 25, 2006. I booked the hotel with Hotwire for $78 USD per night! The rooms usually go for $200 -300 USD per night, so I got a really good deal! The hotel has quality rooms and amenities. The lobby is huge and has a glass encased waterfall and garden. The hotel is conveniently located near most of the downtown attractions and is also connected to the city's underground system, which is great for getting around when the weather is bad. The underground system (PATH) has many cheap restaurants and shops. To save money on breakfast, go to one of the restaurants in the food court next to the hotel. They have complete breakfasts for less than $4. I was also pleased with the hotel's courteous and speedy service. During our stay, the weather just got cold and the hotel's air/heating system was still running a/c instead of heat. I called the front desk and 10 minutes later an engineer dropped off a personal heating unit. And 5 minutes later, the front desk called back to confirm that the heater was dropped off. The only 2 things that I didn't like about the hotel were the small bathroom counters and the expensive hotel parking. The hotel's parking was around $30 a day. I recommend parking at the City Hall parking across the street for $19 a day. It is also conveniently connected to the PATH, so you can walk to the hotel from the parking lot without going outside. Those 2 things aside, the hotel is a great value and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good as expected”
Reviews.Author: Aaron&Nic
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at the Sheraton Centre on our 17 night honeymoon. We booked via Canadian Affairs for 1st 3 nights, then we returned for the last night to Toronto, via Hotwire. We got great rates, but the hotel was a high standard, even for the standard rooms. Good location downtown, close walk to most places. As they are a big hotel, not as personal or friendly, but thats expected. Massive underground shopping connects from SC, so if too hot or cold you can pass through. I highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton Centre”
Reviews.Author: Ra_C_7
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful staff, had beautiful room with a stellar view.

Reviews.Title: “Joyless stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: corduroy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Toronto for Labour Day Weekend with my partner and I have to say that they have the worst front desk staff I have anywhere seen in years--we've stayed in quite a few hotels in our travels including Sheratons and W's--my partner is on SPG. Initial reception at front desk: joyless service, no smiles, no interest in our stay. We had requested a standard King, they gave us two doubles by the noisy ice machine, so we upgraded to club for 60 bucks a night, and the front desk woman said "it is SIXTYdollars per NIGHT" as if this was some sort of huge premium (which it was for such poor pathetic service). They tried to shove us into a smaller club room; we went back to front desk asked for another; front desk person lied and said there were no rooms available---hah! We went to the platinum check in area and told that front desk lady of our situation; she told us there were lots of rooms available and found us one, but again, no smiles, no interest, very perfunctory. Pool was freezing, half indoor half outdoor, and they chose to leave the overhead door that separates the areas open, while it was raining and the temperature was 16 degrees outside--as a result too small hot tub was packed. Disinterested pool person sits at his booth and says things like "towels are over there" without looking up from his newspaper. Club Lounge OK--great view, but Toronto can be pretty ugly on a grey day. Club Lounge looks unfinished or a room that was once a nice restaurant. Breakfast is fresh fruit, cereal, breads, croissants, coffee, tea etc. "Hors d'oeuvres" are cheese, crackers, cold cuts, and hot meatballs and cheese tarts, armenian flat bread with the usual suspect spreads: hummus, baba ganoush, unknown pink (taramosalata maybe?) cream. I don't know if this sounds to you like its worth 60 a night, but on top of that waiters only smile and serve to get tips. Room is freezing; thermostat said 15 degrees, asked them to turn up temp and were promptly ignored. Did not ignore us when wanting us to fill out the gratuity card though. Room was ok; good bed, ok bath, but a little worn, Sheraton signature shower curtain arcs out beyond the bathtub to give you extra space which is a nice touch. Toiletries are crap but we expected this. On our second night, room was not cleaned even at 3 PM! We called, and even after a half an hour the cleaning person had not shown up. Calls to front desk are met with bland terse functional responses like everything else at the hotel--a recurring motif at the Sheraton Centre Toronto--bland menu in room service, bland menu at the restaurants, bland colonial nothing style decor of the rooms, and worst of all bland, indifferent, and could care less attitude service from the bland looking and acting staff. Poor showing, Sheraton and Starwood--All this makes for a bland, terribly joyless stay, doesn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Helen007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton from Aug 18th to 22nd then again from Aug 26th to 28th. The first room we had was on the 30th floor with a queen-sized bed and a terrific view of City Hall and Nathan Phillips Square. The staff knew it was my 50th birthday and sent up a chocolate cake and strawberries (nice touch). The second room we had was on the 19th floor with 2 double beds and again a fantastic view of City Hall. The staff were very friendly without being pompous and the hotel was in an excellent location (we walked everywhere apart from getting the subway to Yorkville). I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Amarone61
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and our 12 year old daughter stayed for 3 nights in a room with 2 double beds. We pre-booked through "Purely Canada" about 4 months beforehand and got a rate of about $160CAN per night. Check-in was quick and easy. The staff at the desk were cheerful and friendly and we found this true of any of the staff we came accross. The room was on the 28th floor, had a stunning view over the City Hall and was spacious enough for the 3 of us to move around in without bumping into eachother. As most people have commented the beds were very comfortable, although there was very little counter space in the bathroom and the towels were a bit small. We had expected more things like that to be above average seeing as it was a 4/5 star hotel. The pool area was very good although, like the rest of the hotel, the recent refurbishment couldn't hide the fact that it was basically a 60's built concrete building beginning to show its age. We ate at Traders on the groung floor one night and the food was very good and reasonably priced. We also had breakfast in the 1st floor restaurant one morning, which was nice but pretty expensive. The big plus about the place is its central location and the access it gives to the PATH system which links it to the main shopping and business areas. Overall it was a very big hotel which still seemed to operate things quickly and efficently and we enjoyed our stay, although some of the little things were only ok and not up to what you might expect from a 4/5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: maggie
Reviews.Content: Arrived after 8 hr flight at 7pm with kids and the room was not ready to be checked in! No huge fuss just not ready. We were sent to the club lounge for an hour and a half-a rundown bar with a good view- then the room was way too small -two doubles on the club level-so we waited another hour and paid $60 more per night for a suite. nobody wanted to sort out the problems with a polite smile. I spoke to a manager who really just wanted me to stop asking questions.We had upgraded to club level for better facilities but it was pointless.The club lounge is tired and messy. We stayed five days and regretted our decision to stay in such a faceless place. Really nothing special at all. would never bother again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Matt-&-Vicki
Reviews.Content: Had the first week of our honeymoon in Toronto and decided to stay at the Sheraton after reading the reviews and glad we did. This hotel is huge! The staff are friendly, food excelent and location out of this world. We stayed on the 18th floor looking on to the CN Tower. The room was really nice, clean, big, well decorated and yes the beds are awsome! You never have to wait for the elevator. There are 6 on each floor and are fast. Bell Boys always outside the hotel and will whistle you a taxi in a flash. If like me, you smoke or you just want to get out of the room for a bit, the gardens in the middle of the hotel are the perfect place. There are plenty of benches in front of the ponds and waterfalls and I found these a relaxing part of my stay. I did on a couple of occasions go for a smoke at the front of the hotel and every time I did, I was hastled by beggers. The Esculators in the lobby go straight into the PATH system which then leads straight in the Eaton Centre which leads straight to Yonge/Dundas. Had dinner in Traders which was lovely and room service was brilliant. Went elswhrere for breakfast, usually in the PATH system or the Eaton Centre. There's about 10 different fast food places in the PATH about 1 minute walk from the lobby including McDonnalds and Pizza Pizza. Toronto is very very big and busy. Would recommend the yellow tour buses to get your bearings. These buses stop at something like 35 locations and you just jump on and off as you please. We found it very handy and interesting at the same time as the buses have a tour guide giving you facts and stories of the area as you go. Restaurants get busy also, pre booking at most restaurants is a must. If not, you may be in for a long wait at the bar. We actually found it quite difficult to eat at night. There's a lot of "posh" restaurants and some are out of the busy parts which made my wife and I feel unsafe and uncomfortable. I would recommend the different restaurants within the hotels and the restaurants on the harbour front. Lots to do here, shopping is great and cheap (same fashions as over here but half the price), Toronto zoo and CN Tower a must! Toronto Islands are a good day out but beware of "Harry" - some bloke on a bike that will offer to give you directions or take a photo of you and the missus and then ask for 3 cigerettes or $4 for doing it. Quite harmless but gets on your nerves after a couple of times of seeing him. If you're planning a trip to Toronto and you want to be in the centre of it all, want value for money and want something a bit special, stay at the Sheraton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Centre was our favorite part of visiting Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: grram1
Reviews.Content: Was thoroughly impressed with our stay. Service was quick and friendly. Room was modern, clean and comfortable. Had a great view of the skyline and CN tower. Located in the best part of town (though we found the City to be somewhat dull and run down). Had a great pool area (1/2 indoor 1/2 outdoor with a hot tub). And we got a rock bottom price through Hotwire. I wasn't too excited abouit spending $28 bucks/night for manditory valet parking, but the service was great and this is typical of big city hotels. Would have been satisfied with our stay even at full rack rate. Would stay again if in Toronto and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Longwood Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and had a wonderful time. The location is excellent and the room was comfortable for the price. We booked a weekend package which included a coupon book for some attractions and restaurants in the area and that came in handy. The onsite valet parking is a little steep ($33 CDN per night) but they were quick at retrieving the car and the price is not untypical of parking charges in any large city hotel. The hotel atrium is attractive and the staff is very helpful. We ate breakfast both mornings at the Starbucks in the Lobby level (Lobby Cafe) and that was comfortable enough. The room was very nice with a comfortable bed and a nice view of the city (though not of the Lake). The halls are rather narrow and the soda machine on our floor never worked but overall the room was comfortable and inviting. There is a charge for high-speed internet access but it worked fine. We checked out the Royal Ontario Museum which is free on Friday evenings in the summer from 4:30 to 8:30pm. Excellent First Peoples collection and interesting exhibits (be sure to park in lot behind the Intercontinental hotel and ask museum for parking voucher to get discounted parking). The waterfront area was a pleasant Saturday jaunt and we used some of the coupons we received for discounts on food and admissions to several areas. Overall it was a very pleasant stay and this is one of the nicer hotels I've stayed in within Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Rendlesham
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a comfortable city centre hotel, with high standards of cleanliness and customer service. As I was travelling with a large family group (8 of us) including children and older relatives, we had booked four rooms. The check in clerk failed to explain to us where the rooms were and consequently some of us went up the wrong tower with children, older relatives and baggage in tow (presumably because they wanted us to use the bell boys). The room was as described on the website - i.e. big bed and average sized room for a city centre hotel - unfortunately, when I went to get in the shower I found someone else's hair on the wall and empty toiletry bottles, indicating that the room had not been properly cleaned. Since I'd been up since 4.00am travelling from Edmonton, I decided to let this pass - later as I got into bed, exhausted after a very long and trying day (exacerbated by the breaking news about the terror plot in London making my family nervous about travelling by air) I noticed that an air vent in the room was blowing noisily. I tried to ignore it and settled down to sleep by by 11.30pm I was at my wits end so I called the front desk - who informed me that room 580 in the Richmond Towre had a vent related to the service elevator (Which didnt' appear to be anywhere near this room but who knows) and therefore they could do nothing about it and they couldn't move me because they were full. (This was true - every room in TOronto was full because of a big conference). I realised I had to put up with it and asked for a move as soon as possible and since I was intending to travel to Niagara the next day on a tour I had to wait to the evening before I could actually move my hotel room. Since I was forced to stay there for the rest of the 2 nights I was pleased to find that my next room was much quieter - the air vent was now in the bathroom which could be shut off. No apology was put forward at this time and since I was pre-paid I didn't feel there was much I could do to mitigate my loss or deal with the fatique caused by the hotel. When it came to leaving the hotel, invoices were put through the doors of my partys rooms and it was clear from this that someone had been using my parents room to watch movies and these were being charged to the room - my parents almost were charged for this because the way the invoice was written gave the impression that they had been zeroed - we had used myu credit card to charge incidentals to all of the rooms so I would have been liable for this. When queried, the clerk said that someone was watching a movie in the room - even though my parents both stood there. With poor grace they remvoed the charges from the bill and zeroed it out properly. Then I went to check out. No apology about the sleepless night or diry bathroom was offered until I asked for it - eventually they agreed to refund $100 from my incidentals bill - which in my opinion was a rip off too - breakfast for three people - french toast and coffee came to nearly $50!!!!! What is irksome is that because I was prepaid as part of the holiday (I had a mixture of pre-booked and un pre-booked hotels because I was travelling from Vancouver via the Rockies to Edmonton and then flying to Toronto) I had absolutely no comeback and if anyone thinks I was going to leave it until I got back to the UK and then complain from 3,000 miles away, they can think again. We had a far better night in a Ramada at Stony PLain for $160 than in this hotel which variously styles itself as 4 diamond and 5 star. One thing I would like to say in its favour. The Bistro on the 2nd floor is massively underused (probably because it is ridiculously pricey) but having said that the food was EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: CDJD
Reviews.Content: We booked the room through priceline for a rate of $69/nt for a 2 -night stay the weekend of Aug 19. The hotel was well appointed and very centrally located. We received room #1147 which was a corner room with great views of the city. The room had been recently remodeled and the bed was very comfortable. We were disappointed that the room did not have a refrigerator/mini-bar and that the ceiling height in the bathroom was so extremely low (anyone over 6ft would have hit their head on the ceiling in the shower). The best part of the hotel was the location which was within walking distance of all the major attractions. We would stay here again but would not pay the full prices found on the hotel's website. It was terrific for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A real Sheraton hotel”
Reviews.Author: Connecting passengers
Reviews.Content: This is what I expect for the Sheraton hotels and Sheraton Centre Toronto reached for those quality standards that every hotel called Sheraton should have reached. Good location, heavenly Beds, nice pool etc. Room size is average at this level.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: W&Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Sheraton City Centre in August 2006. The Sheraton lived up to its reputation, with a large, comfortable, well-appointed room in a large high-rise hotel. Breakfast was not included. The hotel attaches to the underground PATH system of hundreds of underground shops in central Toronto, which is very convenient not only for eating and shopping, but also for walking to other downtown areas out of the heat or cold. Also, the hotel is only a block from a metro station on Toronto's very good subway system.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.. but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Tournament_Dad
Reviews.Content: Room had 2 double beds, which were very comfortable. Room was on the smaller side, well equiped and very clean. The pool was very big. We enjoyed our stay... Everything you would expect from a 4 star property... but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is tired!”
Reviews.Author: AMPF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very tired. The lobby has been renovated and is quite nice but the rest of the hotel needs renovating. We spent the first night in a suite in the renovated tower ( Richmond) which was renovated but did not look it. We were also told it had a king bed but it did not. The fold out queen sofa was actually bigger than the bed itself. We tried to change to a suite with a king bed but, after a wild goose chase looking at rooms they said had a king bed but didn't, we gave up. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No Quibbles”
Reviews.Author: SubaruDriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the end of July and cannot complain. Brought our 9 month old son with us and had a crib / cot delivered free of charge within minutes of getting there. Very quick check-in - there was a line, but new desks were opened immediately and we were made to feel welcome. Room was on 22nd floor, so had a good view! Room size was typical Sheraton and the bed was fantastic. Liked the thing you could hang from the door suggesting the time you wanted the room cleaned - to fit in with you. We were there on a break, so wanted to pop in and out when we wanted which was a nice touch. Swimming pool / jacuzzi were large. I noticed though the gym had a charge to it - although signs did say it was open 24 hours. Location of the hotel is fantastic though - downtown and central. The Eaton Centre is 2 blocks away and the financial district only a 5-10 minute walk. The atrium is large, and Traders Bar is good, albeit expensive - but then again, typical for a Sheraton - as most people in there are on expense accounts!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nic eCity Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheffgal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the SheratonCenre for 1 night only, bu twe found it to be very comfortable, the beds are super comfy, it is very close to everything in down town Toronto, and the staff are super friendly, We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Shame about the loud americans next door”
Reviews.Author: Deanjp32
Reviews.Content: The hotel in itself was great with very friendly people on the desks and very quick service. The room was very good and the room service even better. My only concern was that the room next door was a larger room which a load of Americans decided they wanted to have parties in all night. It took three attempts at security to get them to quieten down which was poor. This happened for two nights out of the seven we stayed and took the shine off what was an almost perfect experience. I would recommend this hotel however!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a bit pricey though.”
Reviews.Author: Mr. Paul Kemp
Reviews.Content: While I did get a good deal for this hotel on Hotwire, it's still a rather pricey hotel for what you get. Located right in the heart of downtown Toronto, I'd definitely recommend it for 'first-timers' who don't want to do a lot of driving, and business travelers with a lot of downtown appointments. The hotel is huge, with two towers and several restaurants attached to it's ground floor promenade. Check-in and out is a breeze, and the rooms are clean and up to Sheraton standards. My only real beef was the complete lack of parking for a hotel of it's size. I literally had to bribe the valet to take my car both nights because the lot was full and I didn't feel like driving around trying to find an all night parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: JohnDaniels
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and can't find much to complain about! Room was a high standard with a view of the CN tower (and other buidings of course). If you get a room over looking Queen street you get an even better view of government house. Bathroom was good size and the shower was amazing and refreshing after a long flight. Hotel facilities were good including a food court in the mall underneath that makes eating a bit cheaper. The bar / grill is nice although as pricey as you would expect in a hotel of this quality. Service was excellent, pool was good and gardens are pretty when you need to chill out away from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: angie101
Reviews.Content: I stayed her with my husband and daughter for one night, our room was very spacious, had great views and the beds were very comfortable. We took the shuttle bus from the airport which was great, we were dropped off right outside the hotel entrance. My only criticism was over the attitude of staff at the hotel pool who were very unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctrese21
Reviews.Content: My male companion and I stayed here during Easter weekend. When we arrived we didn't feel like parking the car across the street and opted for the valet. They were very prompt and courteous with their services. The front desk agent quickly checked us in and we were given a room on the 17th floor with a view of City Hall. Ablsoulutely beautiful at night. The room was very clean and so was the bathroom. The bar/lounge downstairs offered some good atmosphere when you didn't feel like going out of the hotel. Below the hotel is an underground area of shops and restuarants. Unfortunately they were all closed during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dime issues”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a nice hotel. It's classic Sheraton with nice (if somewhat sterile) rooms and very comfortable beds. And I got a great rate on Priceline so I shouldn't complain too much, but I did feel that the hotel nickeled and dimed me to death. This is the first time I've ever had to pay for room-to-room calls. Internet access was about $16/day, the highest I've ever paid. And parking was roughly $33/day. I wanted to go to the gym but nobody answered my phone call there and I was afraid to go because I knew it would be an extra charge but I didn't know how much. So, I'd probably stay here again but I'd be careful about every potential charge item.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location and Hotel in the City Centre!”
Reviews.Author: JulesTravel
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to the Sheraton - just happened by luck to get it via Priceline during Holiday times. Our 2nd visit was just as fantastic as our 1st! We had a terrific view of the City Hall Park and fountains. It was during Jazz Fest so the location was just perfect. It was also Canada Day - adding to the excitement around the area. The pool area is really large and fantastic for a city hotel. Also, the proximity to Eaton Centre and the subway & street car transport is the very best in Toronto. I found the service to be outstanding at check-in / check-out and the concierge desk was extremely helpful in suggesting things and giving directions. We did not dine in the hotel but were sorry we did not after peeking into the steakhouse - it looked quite cozy. We did enjoy late night drinks in the Traders. It was a really good atmosphere - but typical of any hotel lounge - quite pricey compared to other pubs in the surrounding area. Our room was a decent size, again - great view ... the bathroom was adequate size but very clean and nice amenities like shampoo, etc. The one thing you can say over and over about the Sheraton though - is oh my - those BEDS!! The Sheraton has the best, most comfy beds I've slept in ever ... and yes, it's so difficult to get up in the morning because they are the most luxurious comfortable beds in the market! I'd definately welcome another stay at the Sheraton Toronto anytime and hope to be there again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Melissaif
Reviews.Content: Amenities, Guests, Proximity to downtown, the view...everything was fantastic! I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Five Days Of Relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times before. The room was excellent. The cleaning staff do a very good job at keeping the rooms clean. I loved the colour of the room, with the wallpaper and leather chair. The view was great. Breakfast every morning was a pleasure.. bagels, freshly baked muffins, fresh fruit, cold cuts, tea and coffee etc.. The pool is large, and there's plenty of room to swim around. Traders bar was very good. I tried the halibut fish and chips ($15) for lunch. We also had drinks one evening. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: merchants24
Reviews.Content: Spent couple of nights at the Sheraton one weekend in June. Standard business fare with adequate sized rooms and the usual dark-wood interiors. The hotel is massive with one of the biggest lobbies I've experienced in a convenient location for the CBD and downtown sights. Quick walk to the Eaton Centre and about 15 mins to the harbour front. However, there is no character, the restaurant was bland and there are both better places to stay and better locations to stay in when visiting Canada's biggest city.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Neisar
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just come back from a four night stay at the Sheraton and would have to echo all of the positive reviews and comments. The rooms were a nice size, well equipped and comfortable - yes the beds were very very comfortable. We were in room 2711 which was on 27th floor a corner room overlooking city hall etc, the views were fab and the room was very quiet. I had emailed in advance to be sure of a quiet non smoking room and informed the hotel it was a surprise for my partners 40th birthday. When we arrived, very tired after a 5 hour delay and then an unexpected stop at Halifax, we were pleased to see a very good bottle of red wine waiting for us along with a platter of cheese and fruits! They went down very well believe me - a thank you to Heather who arranged all of that from guest services. I would highly recommend the Sheraton, not just for how nice it was and how helpful the staff all were but also the location is brilliant for exploring Toronto,

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Sheraton Centre”
Reviews.Author: Amandamorris
Reviews.Content: I am from England and have just returned from a week's stay in the Sheraton Centre, Toronto, Canada with my husband. This hotel is absolutely fantastic. The room was fab and the beds are really hard to get out of in the mornings as they are so comfortable. The hotel has just been refurbished and I can say that they had done a fantastic job. We stayed on the 17th floor overlooking city hall which afforded us wonderful views over the city both by day and night. The staff were very friendly at all times and Traders bar is a great place to end your evening. The hotel pool is very nice and has great faciliies - changing rooms, showers with shower gel, shampoo and conditioner provided, hair dryers and hair gel, there is even a little machine that you put your swimming things in that spins them dry.... this was great on our last day because we just lazed by the pool until it was time to go. There are loads of bars and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel (although it did takes us a few days to get familiar with the area). Definately take a trip to Richtree's market restaurant... it is fantastic value and such a novelty. You enter and are given a plastic card each, next wander round all the food stations (and there are quite a few) choose what you want, hand your card over which is used like a credit card and away you go.... the food is cooked fresh before your eyes and you can mix and match anything. The tables are scatterd around in different themes, ie little bistro type tables to sitting out in the open watching the world go by. Before you leave you hand in your "credit card" and pay for what you ate and drank... beware though the desserts and coffee are a must so leave room for them after your main meal. The hotel food is very good too (if a little expensive - breakfast especially as it cost us Â£25 for two breakfast on our first day there. The breakfast was lovely but not worth the money) but Traders bar is good value and really nice. We found a great place to eat breakfast though on Younge street "eggspectation" - fried breakfast, coffee, fruit juice, basket of toast and jams worked out about Â£12 for two. You must take a trip to Niagara (we had ours organised through the hotel who were very good) it cost us about Â£75 each and was worth every penny, that included coach with driver who gave a guided tour of every inch of the trip, lunch which was excellent, ride on the 'maid of the mist' and a stop off at Niagara on the lake which is a beautiful quaint old town. The only downside was that the day went too quick, we didnt seem to have much time in each place although we set off at 9:10am and didnt return until 7:30pm. The city of Toronto is a wonderful place and I would love to go back again and do all the things I missed out on this time and if I did I would most definately stay at the Sheraton Centre. CANT RECOMMEND IT ENOUGH.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jen1marsh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre for the first 4 nights of our honeymoon, on arrival at the hotel I admit that we did say it was our honeymoon and staight away the guy at the reception tap tap tapped on the keyboard suggesting that we got an upgrade. Sure enough we were on the 29th floor in a room with a separate seating area, a view of the CN Tower, a huge really comfy bed and a jacuzzi tub in the bedroom. Furthermore, 10 mins after arriving in our room there was a knock at the door and a waiter came in with a bottle of Asti and biscuits with cheese. Nice touch!! The room was clean and found it a great idea that you could choose that you either didn't want your room serviced the next day or that you could choose a time. A def plus when you are tired after a wedding and all that travelling!! We chose not to have our room serviced and this was adhered too. All in all our stay was fantastic, great location, the staff we were in contact with were friendly and helpful, the pool area was clean as were the changing rooms. I also liked the touch that you could recycle things by putting it in a bin under the sink in your room. The only thing that does not give this hotel an excellant rating is that they had just had a new fire alarm installed, one false alarm i can take even at 7.30am, another at 12 midnight the next night not such a problem as this time the fire brigade were called due to an "incident" but 5.30 again on the 4th day is a bit much. Not such a hassle for us as we could go back to sleep but i did feel for the people with babies who had to wake them up then put them down again. Apart from this I loved the hotel and would stay there again (even without the upgrade!) without a doubt. (Anyone booking from the UK - we booked through canadian affair, great rates!) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Centre for 2 days in June 06. The room was comfortable, was a good size and had a great view of the CN Tower. As mentioned in earlier reiews, the beds are amazingly comfortable. However, the bathroom let the room down to a certain extent as it hadn't been renovated, unlike the room itself. One of the main reasons we booked this hotel (apart from it's location) was becasue of the leisure facilities. However, the pool was freezing although supposedly heated and the saunas were in the changing rooms which meant that my husband and I couldn't sit in the sauna together. The leisure facilites could be so much better than they actually are. If you want a comfortable room with a great location then this is a good hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rooms & Bed but unfriendly checkin staff”
Reviews.Author: fauberte
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Sheraton Centre Hotel in Toronto 3 times. The location is simply perfect in front of the city hall, near the entertainment district of King/Queen, near the Eaton Centre, near many subway stations & walkable distance to skydome, CN tower. Also, the rooms are perfect, the quality of the bed & pillow's are great and they have a nice pool. The only thing unfriendly is the checkin staff. Everytime I got there, the staff is mostly rude if you aren't a CEO of Bay street which is a bit cold. Also, the breakfast buffet it totally overpriced at 20's something bucks for simple eggs. I would certainly recommend this hotel if you don't care being treated like a King to get your keys as the rest is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Corky2
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 6 night stay in the Sheraton and were really happy with it. Even though it is a busy conference hotel...we didnt mind at all and never felt it was too busy. We put together some points about our stay: 1. Emailed the hotel in advance asking for a room up high facing city hall, which we were told at reception was going to be the case, but our room was actually on the 7th floor not overlooking city hall. Despite this, we were delighted with our room which was spotless, fantastic bed, quiet and very well serviced for us 2. We liked the fact that you could choose the time your room was serviced in the morning. This was handy in particular the day we were going to my brothers wedding and wanted the room cleaned between 2 and 4. 3. We found when we rang guest services, they were very prompt to drop up what we wanted and then followed up with a call a little later to ensure we were happy. 4. We had breakfast downstairs one mornng which was nice, but cost 48 dolars. We ate out every other morning for around 28 dollars. Of note were "Eggspecations" and "Over easy" on Yonge Street. Delicious breakfasts. 5. We ate twice in Traders downstairs and were extremely happy with the servoce and the food. 6. We ate in a place called the Keg which is a steakhouse, just around the corner from the Sheraton. The steak was fabulous! 7. Our group which consisted of 7 people, booked a limousine to take us to Niagra falls. This was booked through the Four Seasons where one person wass staying. It cost over 500 dollars but split 7 ways was cheaper than doing a tour - and we felt like celebs! 8. Didnt feel that check in staff were over friendly, but everyone else was. All in all, a great trip and would highly recommend the Sheraton. I was in the rooms in the King Eddie and felt they were outdated, and the people staying in the Four Seasons were a little disappointed with their room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for all ages”
Reviews.Author: AliB01
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at this hotel and we couldn't find fault. We had gone to Canada to celebrate my parents golden wedding thus our group was made up of a number of generations and all were very happy.
