I can honestly say the beds are the best ever, location was great and we found all of the hotel's facilities to be in good working order and easily accessable. Staff were very friendly and always polite. We would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “if in toronto,stay here”
Reviews.Author: shadwell
Reviews.Content: the member from the Isle of Wight got in before us, we agree with all they said.this hotel is wonderfull!we arrived on the 13 may,and as a smoker,we had room 1617,its huge!! my husband is a non smoker and could not smell any smoke in the room or on the whole floor. Traders bar has a completey seperate smoking room that again you can not smell any thing.The barman PJ is serbian and once you understand his sense of humour a great laugh. We found a rest/bar called Mr Greenjeans in the Eaton centre.has a smoking room that you can eat in,and again no smell of smoke.dont ask for a large beer,you'll get a 1 1/2 litres!!every where else a large is a pint.great food.there is a web site . We used Greyline tours,for our trip to niagra,booked online in uk.Â£220.for both of us.we had a phone call from them at the sheraton the night beforechecking that we had arrived,and confirming our pickup,which was right out side hotel.Colin the driver,was great,with info,laughs,a quiz,the trip included,falls,maid of the mist(tip; wear old trousers/shorts you wont want again,throw them,not only will they be wet,but when they dry out they stink! then put on the dry pair you had in bag) buffet lunch,helicoptor ride,which has to be done! visit&tasting to a vine yard, and a quiet ride back when you need some sleep. Toronto is great for shopping,also very clean,and felt safe.even the tramps are polite. Check out was quick&easy. people we met on the plane had stayed at the Fairmont,and wished they had'nt. So if your going to Toronto use the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeGoose
Reviews.Content: Toronto is not blessed with great hotels in my opinion. However, if you are looking for a hotel with an excellent location, decent service, and something newly renovated, look no further. The Four Seasons is old and tired, the Royal York is really old, quirky, and the rooms are tiny. I found the Sheraton to be fresh, clean, and comfortable. The new sleeper beds are really posh. I would recommend staying in a club level room. This gives you access to a continental breakfast and evening snacks, internet, and use of the workout area. This is included in the cost of the room. I did have a problem with my safety deposit box. This was fixed by security within ten minutes. As I stated, the location is within walking distance to most of the major attractions and the Sheraton is connected to an underground pathway that can be used on bad weather days. I used the valet parking which was a nice feature since I used my car frequently to get in and out of Toronto to see friends and family during my stay. Overall, I was extremely happy with my stay and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really Sheraton, Really Centre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on the first weekend of May. Ok, it may not be a boutique hotel, or not even a hotel - rather a small town in it's own right (50 floor and 1500 rooms... go figure) but it really is a central base for downtown, connected well connected to the shopping/business district via the PATH underground city and the metro. It has excellent standards and for it's size really well-behaved personell. The rooms are well-equiped and most of them have great views of the city's skyline. Would stay there again and definitelly recommend it to anyone willing to pay the price.

Reviews.Title: “A charmless Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: ronfaddison
Reviews.Content: If you like a charmless enormous hotel packed with conference delegates and brash business people with a foyer that is constantly noisy and overflowing with an adjacent raucous bar then this is the hotel for you! But if you are just an ordinary tourist looking for good accommodation then there must be alternatives. To be fair it was very good value for money (Â£63.00 per night for four nights) and I agree with other correspondents that the location is very good. There are plenty of varied restaurants nearby and a superb British style pub (The Duke of Richmond) 2 minutes away opposite the old City Hall which served a good variety of beer and good pub meals. It is far better than the hotel bar where service was cursory, prices were expensive, seats were at a premium and the noise level was considerable. Our room was reasonably sized, clean, well appointed and well serviced although there was no mini bar. We had to phone down to get our luggage which I think had been just left in the foyer with no-one taking responsibility for it. The ice machine on our floor (28th) was not working nor was the adjacent soft drinks machine during the whole of our 4 day stay. This was sloppy. The staff were OK without being outstanding. They actually matched the hotel which I would rate the same way. There was not a lot of charm or sophistication in anything I saw. When we left we paid $47 dollars for a "limousine" (their description) to the airport - as advertised on a notice in the foyer about how to get to the airport. We took this to mean that this was a hotel vehicle as we had to pre-book it. When we left, however, we were put into an ordinary taxi at the fixed rate of $47. I found this very strange and I would suggest that the wording of the notice in the foyer needs to be amended to make it clear exactly what you are getting for your money. Our stay was reasonably pleasant but it certainly did not prompt us to look towards booking again with the Sheraton chain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Cinemaven
Reviews.Content: Work takes me to many different Toronto hotels, but the Sheraton Centre is always my first choice if possible. The location, staff, bed, pool, and views combine to make this a pleasure each time I stay. My most recent stay was a typical one. I arrived at 3 p.m. knowing that check-in is at 4 but was given a room (usually possible on a weekend stay) right away. I took a dip in the pool and enjoyed swimming under the curtain to the rainy outdoors. The pool is especially fun for families in winter because children really love the novelty of being able to swim outside when the snow is falling. I then took the PATH to the Bay for its excellent cafeteria style bakery and lunch counters. I brought the food back to my room and enjoyed the view of Toronto city hall from 32 stories up. I then walked to the theatre (Canon - formerly Pantages) to see Cirque Ã‰loize presents NOMADE which was wonderful. The sweet sleeper bed is a treat and I always leave thinking I need one for my home. The room was clean and the one small problem I encountered (the remote was missing) was resolved within 5 minutes. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone staying in downtown Toronto. Tips - Ask for a high floor with a view of City Hall in a renovated room - if asked if you'll accept a room by the service elevator.. say NO - ask for walking directions from the tour desk as most theatres and major shops are an easy walking distance and a very pleasant walk. - park in the municipal lot for large savings - in winter, you can use the PATH system to get to most major shopping and many restaurants without ever stepping outside. It also connects you to the subway - The food at the Sheraton is wonderful but typical restaurant fare... steps from the hotel are amazing restaurants that cover every ethnic palate and every price range.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel , Great Location”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl123
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one week. Excellent location, two minute walk to subway. Streetcar runs outside the door, always taxis waiting outside the door. PATH system connects hotel to subway, shops etc. You can easily walk to all the main attractions from this location. Got nice sized corner room, air conditioning in the room wasnt great. Spotlessly clean. Had breakfast each morning on the bistro on 2 , about $20 for the full buffet breakfast. Ate a nice meal in the traders restaurant just off the lobby but mid week this seems to turn into a buffet and didnt look great. Le biftheque restaurant which is accessible from the hotel does a nice burger. Negative points: Hotel seems to do a lot of conferences so it is always very busy. Internet access within the hotels business centre is very expensive I think I was quoted $10 for twenty mins. Gym is very small plus guests have to pay an additional charge to use it , the pool is free. Plus points: Concierge staff were extremely helpful and I asked them a number of different questions over the course of the week all of which they could answer. Location is brilliant. Connection to PATH system and shops on lower level of hotel. Pool was nice size.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: sunloverontario28
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in March 2006. Upon arrival we were very pleased with the quick service and especially the room. We booked a regular room with a king size bed. We had a great view of the city through our wall to wall window. The room was very spacious, with plenty of room to move around. It included a massive full size mirror, a desk, leather seat and of course a fair size TV. The bed was comfortable and the bathrooms are very clean. There is a classy bar downstairs, where both friends and/or couples could enjoy a few drinks. The location is fantastic, as you are right downtown near all the boutiques and the Eaton Centre. China town is about 15 mins walking distance and there are tons of stores around. Parking is not a problem, as the hotel has parking underground and there is also city parking across the street which is a little cheaper than parking at the hotel. Absolutely nothing went wrong during our stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who expects an above average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadian007
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with friendly staff. Great accomodations for business travelers. Spacious rooms with comfortable beds. Friendly service. Good choices of restaurant within the hotel. Great pool and great gym.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ScratchyBadger
Reviews.Content: Having read earlier reviews we were looking forward to staying here. A good start to the holiday is that the Toronto Express bus from the international airport actually stops/picks up outside the hotel entrance. However, don't do what I did and lose the return bus ticket! The hotel rooms are very clean and well proportioned. The hotel itself is part of the underground PATH system that links miles and miles of shops in Toronto without having to brave the weather conditions on the streets outside. The pool was welcoming and the hot tub relaxing. The only negative point was that the noisy renovation work got you up earlier in the morning. But it wasn't a problem really as we were out most of the day and work had stopped come the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: BigHorse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 4th March for a couple of nights. The facilities, staff attitudes and location are excellent. Ask for a high floor facing City Hall and you will be rewarded with a beautiful view of skaters (which I did). There were 2 Queen-sized beds in my room and there is wired broadband internet for CDN16 per 24 hrs. Under the Sheraton, there is the PATH walkways which leads to the nearby streets like Dundas, Yonge and Queen to name a few. I bought my groceries and food from the stores in the PATH. You don't need to wear winter clothes in the PATH unless you want to get out of the PATH onto the streets. The PATH also reaches the CN Tower, Eaton Centre, Bus Terminal and the Union Station. You can get the PATH map from the Sheraton tour desk and chances of you getting (guaranteed) lost in the PATH is pretty high without the map. The TT subway (Osgoode) is just under 5 minutes away from the Sheraton. For a day of shopping, You can use the subway to travel out of the city to Downsview, take a 107 TT bus to Rutherford Station and finally via a 85 YRT bus to Vaughan Mills outlet mall where you can shop shop shop! I am not sure but it seems that early March seems home to a lot of final sales signage everywhere! Or for a two day 1 night trip, you can just go to the bus station and get a ticket to the Niagara Falls (CDN40+Rtn). The Sheraton stored my luggage at no charge whilst I visited the Niagara Falls. Oh and before I forget, you would want to enquire about the PST and GST refunds before you book a hotel (hint.. hint..) and make any accomodation or goods purchases! Finally, the people in Toronto are really friendly and it feels safe too (despite 2005 statistics on shooting!).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Get A Renovated Room”
Reviews.Author: VegasCanuck
Reviews.Content: I love a freshly renovated hotel room so I felt compelled to write this mini review. I actually stayed at the superb Hilton a block away but I had a very good view of the extensive room renovations at the nearby Sheraton Toronto (see attached photos). You will notice that as of February 19, many floors are getting a complete redo. I love the renovated Toronto Hilton (see my review posted Dec 19, 2005), but I know there are those that love the Sheraton chain. The Sheraton Toronto would be a good choice for a stay in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- Outstanding Service and Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: FairmindedTraveler
Reviews.Content: As a longtime Toronto traveler, I booked this as a spur-of-the-moment, one-day deal via Priceline. A friend and I were in Detroit over Super Bowl weekend, had a snafu regarding a weekend hotel (subpar quality to say the least!), and he'd never been to Toronto (normally a 4-hour drive from Detroit metro area). As it turned out, the trip was more like 5+ hours, with a snow and sleet storm coming and going....plus torrential downpours the night we were there (if you've been to T.O., then ya know it's not exactly a 1-day-see-all kinda city and especially not in nasty weather, lol). That background said, the hotel was absolutely impeccable for making it up to us...and totally obliterating the travel difficulties we experienced. At check-in, I respectfully asked for any kind of a room with a view, explaining about my friend's 1st-time to T.O. -- and also that I understood that the room may be limited because it was prepaid/PLined. We were accommodated with a high floor facing City Hall where a free fireworks show was to happen later that night (was rained out, lol). The facilities were very nice as well, and the hotel's connected underground to shopping (Bay Dept store, Eaton Centre, subways during business hours). Overall, just an outstanding stay, very nice room (the fluffier heavenly bed kinda quality that the better Starwood hotels are known for)...hotel park lot wqas full but the City Hall underground lot across the street was available ($10+/day cheaper and connected to the hotel as well!). Even though this hotel is slightly older (I remember a family stay in the late 70s when I was in my teens), the rooms, facilities and service definitely make it a 4-star...and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again (in fact, I'd hope to stay there again!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: buncey47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 26th December to 3rd January. Checked in 3.30pm - no line . Asked for a quiet room and was given a corner room on the 33rd floor. Biggest bed I have ever seen and as it was a corner room it was larger than some. Bathroom was pretty statndard for grade of hotel - no problems. Views over the city including the CN Tower when it wasn't misty ! All staff were very friendly - we had room service one day and were treated like royalty! Had buffet breakfast in the bar 3 time during our stay. With tax and tip worked out at $25(can) each - not cheap but excellent. One of the big plus of the hotel is that it is on the PATH system - you can walk all the way to the train station or CN Tower without ever having to go outside - brilliant if the weathers bad. With in 5 mins of leaving our room we could be in the Eaton Centre - a large undeground mall with excellent shops. We gym look at the pool and gym - looked great just never got round to using them. I would definalty recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: BBSwim
Reviews.Content: Whenever I go to Toronto on business I stay at the Sheration downtown. The location is excellent, gym is very good, and rooms are comfortable. Check out is super easy as well. My only complaint is that it is sometimes noisy late at night. Great staff, good overall place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at the downtown Sheraton for part of our honeymoon. We are members of the SPG program, but upon arrival checked in at the regular front desk instead of the "Elite Check In" for members. We were assigned a spa suite on the 26th floor; I asked if anything higher was available or if we could be upgraded and the clerk immediately said no. It wouldn't be a stretch to think he just wanted us out of line so he could check in the next guest. We were satisfied with the suite. We ordered room service once and the order, delivery, and quality was what we expected. I called the service desk for restaurant recommendations and the clerk was able to provide some suggestions - we were happy with the quality of the restaurants. At 10:00 one night I called the desk and asked for a list of Chinese restaurants that would deliver to the hotel. The clerk gave one name and number, but said that the concierge desk was closed and that was all the information she had. I looked at the menus in the yellow pages and found something good. We at breakfast in the Club Lounge twice and had hor de'voueres once - the fruit was excellent. The food was tasty and the view was good. We didn't use the swimming pool. We didn't use the PATH much because the weather was good. Although acceptably attractive, the lobby's ambience, despite completed renovations, was nothing spectacular. Elevator's were quick. Housekeeping did a fine job. We enjoyed the Sheraton and wouldn't have any qualms about returning, but next time in Toronto will probably explore what other hotels have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Dump and dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed there on new years eve terrible found hair in my food hair left on the bed there where dead insects all over never stay there. Also i found a dead rat and they didnt care

Reviews.Title: “Better than the competition”
Reviews.Author: here369
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after spending some time in the Marriott on Bloor Street. Frankly, the Sheraton is way better - none of the service issues that we experienced at the Marriott, although the valet parking guy was a little rude. Bottom line: a well run and comfortable hotel in perhaps the most ideal spot for new years celebrations. Also appealing to the business traveller, the hotel has a fantastic steakhouse and is well connected into Toronto's bizarre and amazing underground shopping network.

Reviews.Title: “great overall package”
Reviews.Author: diamondpro
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days over the festive period...check in was smooth and we were given rooms on the 21st floor which we requested...views from the room were excellent overlooking Nathan Phillips Square and the ice rink. Rooms were big and spacious and the bed was huge but extremely comfortable. Location is ideal for almost all the main attractions..we walked to them all and were not disappointed.Traders grill serves great food and has good staff with prices comparative with a meal in the uk. Tour desk was a great source of help and we booked some trips through them and were given discount as we had purchased a few at the one time. Will come back,hopefully in the summer and will certainly be back at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four of us shared two connecting rooms one of which was a large suite overlooking Nathan Philips Square. Check in was great, staff were helpful free upgrade to the suite room because the other room was not ready. Good internal access to underground shops and the PATH. Adequate facilities in the hotel including restaurants, bars. Nice presented restaurant however very limited menu and limited soft drinks. Only stayed four nights and got awoken two nights by the fire alarm. Really good view from our window for New Years Eve celebrations.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great pool!”
Reviews.Author: bronwyn_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre the night of December 26. We booked that day on the net. No line at check-in and we were pleased with a room on the 21st floor overlooking city hall. The trees were lit for the holidays. The room was very clean but only 64 degrees on our arrival so we turned up the heat and left to shop. The temperature was great when we returned about 2 hours later. We really enjoyed the indoor/outdoor pool, but were disappointed that the whihrlpool was closed until 9am this morning for cleaning. (Not good for early risers.) We were quite surprised last night at the number of downtown restaurants closed.We thought that more would have been open on boxing day, considering all the hotels in the area. However, I'm sure the restaurant staff were enjoying a well-deserved holiday! Because it was a holiday we got a bargain on parking at City Hall, only $12. for a 24 hour period. We have stayed at this hotel many times and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: weddingplanner26
Reviews.Content: We purchased our one night stay from the hotwire website, and I can say that I was a bit nervous doing so, especially after reading some of the problems that other guests have had. About 3 days before our intended arrival We e-mailed the hotel and made special requests like 2 double beds, non smoking, not near the elevator etc. We arrived in Toronto at around 11:30 a.m and thought we would leave our luggage and go shop. Much to our surprise our room was ready and it was in the Queen tower, facing Nathan Philip square, which was wonderful! It was nice watching the skaters on the outside rink. The room had been recently renovated and we had no complaints, other than the music from outside was a bit loud, but it was turned off by 10p.m. We had dinner at The Keg, which is like 2 minutes away, and the meal and the atmosphere was nice. The best part of all is the pool facilities. It is so great being able to swim outside in -10 degree weather. The mist that comes off the pool is so refreshing, and the hot tub relieves all aching muscles, and it is so rejuvenating. The next morning we ate a huge breakfast at the Sunset grill, which I highly recommend. It is on the corner of Yonge and Richmond. Overall we had a great time, and I cannot wait to return. Also we parked in the City Hall lot across the street, and found this to be very accessible and it saved us some money too. Go and relax and have a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but clean - the bed is one of the most comfy ever. We stayed on a higher level floor - view was great and we got free breakfst. The map was ripped out of our hotel magazine and there was a half drunk bottle of water when we arrived. The internet access didnt work at all well. The staff were friendly and helpful and gave us credit for all of these things. A perfectly nice place to stay on business if you dont mind horrible food in Toronto at outrageous prices.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke & fire alarms”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, Nov. 19 - 23. This was the third time I've stayed at the Sheraton this year (twice using Priceline, once for a convention). We occupied two rooms, both of which were supposed to be on non-smoking floors. In both cases, the room next to ours contained an illicit smoker, who either did not understand that they were in a non-smoking room, or didn't care. We moved because of this once, but it didn't seem to help. Having a smoker next door is like having one in your room, as the ventilation must be inter-connected. Worse than the second hand smoke were the two building wide fire alarms at 5:15am on Nov. 22 and 6:00 am on Nov. 23. The alarms worked well in waking everybody up, but they turned out to be false alarms. I would not stay here in future.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: mugglie
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a week's stay at the Sheraton and cannot fault the hotel, i can't get hung up on not having shower gel i take my own! the room was on 9th floor, well decorated,clean and the beds are so comfortable. The staff all around the hotel are really friendly and helpful, the cleaner on our floor was a real sweetie, chatting to you. The bar and restuarant are relaxed and a good place to have a final nightcap after being out. The hotel's location is excellent all the main sights are within easy walking distance and access to the PATH system is great. Would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: Bezi
Reviews.Content: Funny how you are about to write a review and you look at the last one written and they have highlighted similar complaints! Bath and Shower gel, how much can it cost! Not to have any is just cheap. Admittedly you would have to be a midget to enjoy the bath as it is so small. Other than that the hotel is functional, it's the sort of place that they hold conferences but not the smart ones! Good location and nothing terrible about the place so would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: GaryH_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 13th Nov for 6 nights and were very pleased. We were on floor 7 in the newly renovated block. The hotel itself is huge inside, and is located central to everything, even the underground PATH system runs under the hotel. The staff were very friendly and could not do enough, especially the room service guy. The tour desk staff were excellent too giving all sorts of help and advise about where to go and visit and how to get there. The room itself was a good size with a view over city hall. The beds were huge and comfy, with a large screen tv, tea and coffee making facilities, power shower, bath (very shallow) etc. It was very clean and well maintained - infact the only thing preventing me giving this hotel 5 out of 5 was the rather noisy fan in the bathroom, but upon closing the door at night, you couldnt hear it. The swimming pool was nice and warm, half inside, half outside, and it was weird swimming outside in the warm water with snow falling around you. There is also a hot tub jacuzzi and saunas available for free to hotel guests. There was a $9 charge to use the gym however. The drinks bar and Traders restaurant was a bit expensive, and the steak restaurant on the bottom floor was a bit poor, but walk through the PATH system and you are in the Eaton Centre within 5 minutes. Best places to eat nearby were Baton Rouge and The Pickle Barrel. Lots of conferences going on in the hotel, and the hotel was always a hive of activity. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others and I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: vilewis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel in November 2005 for 6 nights. When we first arrived we were allocated a room on the 9th floor which was ok but it had no light and on inspection of the bathroom the bath was badly marked and it put me right off. We complained about the room and were allocated a room which they said had been refurbished, but the bath was just as bad,I like a bath when I am on holiday but no way would I have one in my room. So I opted for the shower but there was no shower caps or shower gel provided. I thought all 4* hotels provided these commodities - not the Sheraton Centre, I had to ask for shower gel every day we stayed. I think people expect these nowadays especially when they are supplied at the Sheraton hotels and even express hotels in the UK, I certainly wouldnt thing of bringing shower gel and bath caps all the way from England. The hotel should take advice from across the border in America most hotels provide these essentials, including slippers and bathrobes. If I go back to Toronto I wont stay at the Sheraton again not just because of shower gel etc., because its too informal. My advice to anyone travelling to the Sheraton Centre in Toronto is be prepared to take your toiletries with you!

Reviews.Title: “The Renovations are mostly done!”
Reviews.Author: drummerhill
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sheraton Centre about 10 to 12 nights per year. I was at the hotel for a convention this past week. The renovation to the Lobby and enterance are finally done. The rooms are acceptable for a four star hotel. Always book Club level! The Sheraton is perfectly located in Toronto to all dowtown destinations. Close to the subway, financial district, Eaton Centre, and its on the PATH (underground walkway). Always use the valet parking... your car may be at risk at City Hall parking for vandalism. A good choice generally!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: Nom_de_screen
Reviews.Content: The small cockroach I killed on my second night of a 4 night stay here is the only thing stopping me giving 4 stars to this hotel. The staff were very helpful, and were even able to meet my request for good second hand book shops in Toronto with an annotated map to same! The rooms aren't bad, the beds are very comfortable, the check-in check-out system they have is highly efficient and the hotel is in an excellent central location. I didn't eat there, although Traders bar had a good atmosphere for a hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Judia
Reviews.Content: Having received an incredible rate on this hotel through Priceline, I suppose I wasn't expecting much. How wrong I was! Not only was the hotel absolutely lovely and perfectly located but the employees--from registration through housekeeping--were the most pleasant and accommodating I have ever encountered while traveling. While waiting to check out (didn't use automatic checkout since I had time to kill), I was next in line but, like magic, someone popped up beside me and said she could take me at her counter. Room service was equally as magical, delivered in a flash and piping hot. The rooms were decorated lovely and those beds are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: tracy35
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Centre at both ends of our holiday in Canada for 2 nights eachs stay. The hotel is centrally located and has direct access to the Eaton Centre - 6 miles of mainly underground malls. We had different rooms for our 2 stays, both lovely - very clean, spacious and well-equiped, with lovely comfy beds. The overall standard of the hotel is very good - lots of helpful, friendly staff - great 'posh' lobby, efficient lifts and lovely rooms. If there is a down side - its the price of food and drinks. Be prepared for a sizable bill at the end of your stay if you can't or chose not to eat out. (Mind you - fairly pricey everywhere in Toronto that we went). We chose to have breakfast in the hotel on one morning - the others we went into the adjoining mall for far better value for money. However - can't complain - the rooms cost us less than Â£50 per room per night (through canadian affair)for a family of four and represented amazing value for money. Would definitely chose to stay again if visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: GatorDocs
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful. You can go to the lobby floor and walk underground to the subway. We stayed at the Club Level. Upon check-in, we were told that Club Level members had free internet access. I said, "In the rooms?" And the employee said Yes. A friend of mine said she had been told the same thing. So we get our bill, and we have internet charges for the three nights we were at the hotel. On one day, we were charged twice for the internet. (One charge is good for 24 hours). I call the front desk, and they transfer me to a manager. I tell the manager that if we had been told we were going to be charged, we would have used the free internet in the Club Lounge. I told her that we were also charged twice in one night for the internet. She said, "I'll take two charges off, but I'm not taking all the internet fees off." I said to her that since we were given incorrect information, I wanted all the charges taken off. She said "Fine", then slammed the phone down. Although we had that unpleasant experience, we did have a club level employee that was very helpful to us.

Reviews.Title: “The bed of our dreams”
Reviews.Author: Jo1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week during August.Me my dh and our 3 children.We were given adjoining linked rooms which were HUGE!!! We were right at the front of the hotel and had a great view.We all agreed that the beds were the best we'd ever slept in. Great hotel-good food and service in its retaurants and bar. Its the second time we've stayed there and would go back time and again.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch !!”
Reviews.Author: loseapoint
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel in a great location within easy walking distance of all the downtown attractions. It is also on the PATH system so you can avoid getting wet/cold whilst shopping. Rooms are good size and contain the highlighted 'sweet sleeper' beds (although they were a bit too soft for me !). All of the furnishings and fixtures were in pristine condition and everything worked perfectly. I was particularly impressed with all the staff members we encountered as they were all courteous and helpful. Parking was $28/day which is perhaps not unreasonable for a city centre location. There are a number of eating establishments on site - ranging from basic pub style to posh steakhouse but we chose to eat at the 360 restaurant at the CN Tower - which was a fabulous experience and, considering where it is, we thought the prices offered excellent value (there are 2 fixed price options @ $40 something CAD and $60 something CAD which includes entry to the Tower). All-in-all, we thought the Sheraton was a great place to stay and we would be happy to recommend it to anyone staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: keminole
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel. Great location, connected to Eaton Center for shopping and eating. Right next to subway. Lobby is fantastic, ate dinner at Traders and it was better than expected. Room had great view of skyline, and all staff was great. Wasn't disapppointed with a single thing, and usually I'm picky. Paid $80 from pricline....but hotel is worth twice that.

Reviews.Title: “just ok, good location”
Reviews.Author: jenshh
Reviews.Content: We chosed the Sheraton mainly because of the location which is quite good actually (but some downtown hotels are also in the neighbourhood).All the main sights are easily reached within a short stroll, and there are some nice cafes/restaurants near the hotel on Queen Street West and on Yonge Street. For parking we took the city hall garage which has a direct connection to the hotel (about 17 Can$/day). The foyer of the Sheraton is really large and its easy to see that it has just been renovated. To be honest i would have liked it more if they would have invest some of the money+skills into our room. We picked one in the Richmond tower - as recommended in some of the reviews - but especially the bathroom looked a little bit dated and wasnÂ´t properly cleaned. The people at the desk seemed to take my reclamation quite seriously. They apologized and i got a breakfast voucher for two as a compensation. So lets just say: the Sheraton is ok but if u get a good bargain in other hotels in the area check them out first!

Reviews.Title: “Three Star Hotel with Four Star Location”
Reviews.Author: TheWongClan
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here to celebrate our anniversary. You cannot beat the location of the Sheraton for dining, entertainment, shopping, etc in Toronto. They are in process of renovations (Lobby was finished when we were there) but do not believe we were given a renovated room. The bathroom was dark and very old (not what you expect at a supposed 4 star hotel). The bed was the only great feature of the room. Overall we greatly enjoyed our stay due to the location and especially the great price we got on Priceline!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Audreybella
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful. The Sheraton has a gorgeous lobby and it is huge. The lobby has free wireless internet which is always a plus. The room was actually bigger than I had expected and the bed is super comfortable. Actually I believe the Sheratons have the best beds in the hotel business so far that I have encountered. The hotel is well situated near the Eaton Center and Yonge St. Staff was helpful and courteous. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: dngrockstar
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is one of my favorite hotels to stay at in Toronto because of its location. You are within walking distance of shopping areas such as the Eaton center, and Queen West. There are also great restaurants around the area. It is also connected to the worlds largest underground mall, PATH. If you are into the nightlife, you are well within walking distance to the club districts, and entertainment districts. Trying to get into the entrance was quite difficult because of the long wait and heavy traffic, but if you do plan to check into the hotel I suggest parking across the street in the underground parking lot then walking to the hotel. Parking at that parking lot under Nathan's Philip Square, will save you a great deal on parking! The staff was exceptionally friendly and very courteous. My room had a view of City Hall which was beautiful. The rooms were your average looking hotel rooms. One thing I must mention were the beds! The matress was incredibly comfortable and relaxing! Overall, if it's your first time in Toronto, I recommend staying at the Sheraton for its great location and conveniece to everything worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: cho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 6 nights in Sept. Got a special rate from Priceline for only Â£39 a night, so can't really complain. Was a bit worried when reading all the reviews about dodgy rooms, so wrote a email to the hotel requesting a non smoking room with queen size bed with baby crib on a high floor. (had heard the horror stories about the 4th Floor) Maybe it was a quiet time of year, but check in was a breeze and we got a room to our requirements on the 35th floor with a view of the city hall. The room itself was nice and clean, but IMO nothing special, if i had paid full rate i would have expected more. All the staff were very helpful and the bell boys weren't forced upon you. We requested a few items from Housekeeping and they were promptly delivered and unlike NYC they didn't expect a tip, just said "have a good evening" and walked aaway. They even called the room to make sure we had recieved our items. Nearly forgot about the best part - the beds. They are so big and comfortable, best nights sleep i had in ages, anyone know if i can buy on of these beds ??? Finally location is a hugh selling point for this hotel, right in the heart of the city. So overall i would highly recommend this hotel. (especially if you can get it for a bargain price !!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steveℜen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre on October 1st. We travelled with another couple and both ended up with rooms on the 30th floor. I must say, this is the nicest hotel in downtown Toronto that we have stayed at. The rooms are recently renovated, and Sheraton Sleeper Beds are "awesome" The hotel is within walking distance to everything. We walked to the Royal Alex to see Les Miserable in about 15 minutes. My only complaint would be the abundance of homeless people on Toronto's Streets. The pool and sports centre are nice. Though I was a little shocked that Sheraton charged an extra $9 to use the fitness centre. If I am paying $169.00 Canadian a night, I think this should be included. There is a Keg Steakhouse located about 3 minutes from the Hotel. Unfortunately we did not find it until our second visit. Another great restraunt is Al Frisco's which is only a 10minute walk to the west. I can not say anything negative about this property. The rooms were great, check-in and check-out were pleasant and it is within walking distance to everthing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gatototo
Reviews.Content: Not a cozy hotel. It's a convention center so it's huuuge and crowded. One thing after another was running out of service. I prepayed a non smoker, king bed room but when I arrived they were oversold and sent me to a smoking room. I complained and was sent to a suite but it didn't have a bed. They brought a single roll on bed. I complained and was moved to a cabana room. It was disgusting, cold, old, noisy and stinking of cigar. I complained and finally the next morning I was sent to the correct room. They didn't want to refund the money for 1 night even though they were the ones that messed up. The final room was ok and spacious but not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sheraton Toronto Centre and Toronto”
Reviews.Author: DublinIrishTraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked for 4 night Sept 2005 with Hotwire for approx $70 per night. The best deal I have ever got. The hotel is excellent, the check-in easy and friendly. My room on 26th floor was great, with views of the CNN Tower etc. The other room was on the 16th floor with views of the park etc. The Gray-line tours, booked at the square by the Hard Rock, are the best value for money. We bought downtown and uptown tours and the Niagara Falls Friday evening tour. All tours were great. One tip buy your CNN tower from the Gray line tour rep, it saves the long queue when you get to the CNN tower. Anyway the hotel is great, the food is very good but expensive. The hotel has good access to the Eaton centre and the underground walkways. I would definitely stay here again especially if I could get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room on a high floor!!!”
Reviews.Author: Philygirl4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Center Hotel in Toronto for 4 nights earlier this month. The first room they gave us was on the 4th floor in a completely deserted part of the hotel -- far away from the pool. There is a church across the street from this hotel that has a clock that gongs every hour on the hour. The is another clock tower in the distance that gongs every fifteen minutes. We ended switching rooms to the main tower and asked for a high floor (we were on floor 32). I am happy to report we did not hear the bells on floor 32 and we had much easier access to the pool. Parking at the hotel is $33/day but if you park across the street in the city lot it is $18/day. BE WARNED if you park in the city lot make sure you park as close to the ticket booth as you can. OUr car was broken into because we were parked on a lower floor with no one watching it. So much for saving money! PS-- The pool looks nothing like the sheraton's website although it was pretty nice. It is an indoor/outdoor pool and there is a separate jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Plumbuff
Reviews.Content: I recently took my boyfriend to Toronto as a birthday treat and had booked us into the Sheraton Centre through Canadian Affair. As I arranged our flights through Canadian Affair also, the cost of the Sheraton was approx. half that quoted alone on e.g. Expedia, Travelocity. As such, I was happy with the price I paid for the 6 nights. Even happier with the fantastic view in the south facing room we had on the 30th floor! We could see Lake Ontario, the CN tower and the major financial buildings from our window, so we didn't need to request a change! The room itself was fantastic, with a huge king size bed that was extremely comfortable. There was also a desk and small armchair in the room and it wasn't cramped at all so v spacious. The bathroom was also a good size and although it wasn't renovated, it was spotless! My boyfriend was also delighted with the hotel and although we both loved the place, the majority of our time was spent out of it! A small word of warning, the restaurants and bar in the hotel are expensive. This is to be expected in hotel bars but just to let you know! There is a fab place just 2 secs from the hotel called sunset grill which does tasty, cheap breakfasts/lunch all day long! It's located on the corner of richmond st/yonge st. The hotel is in an excellent centre location, we walked all over the city centre and the major attractions were not too far away. For example, the CN tower/Skydome are only 10 mins walk away from the hotel. I particularly liked walking down to the harbour front and taking the ferry over to centre island, it was a gorgeous day and we just wandered round the park! I would like to mention that the company Toronto Tours are also located in the lobby of the hotel. They are fantastic to recommend restaurants etc, but the organised tours are pricey. The tours are of a v good standard and take any hassle of organising out of it as they tend to pick you up at the hotel and drop you off, but as I mentioned, they are v expensive! For example, we paid 150 canadian dollars each for the evening trip to niagara falls, and although we had a fantastic day, we felt as though it was massively overpriced as we had v little spare time and the dinner was standard buffet fare. (still tasty!) Another recommendation is that when you visit the CN tower, it's only a few dollars more to go for lunch in the 360 restaurant than the general admission fee for all of the tower. The food was lovely and we felt we would not have looked out over the city for as long or appreciated the view as much had we just gone to the observation deck. Our meal lasted just over an hour, during which time the restaurant revolved one full rotation. We loved Toronto and hope to go back soon! We will prob stay at the Sheraton again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first ever visit to Toronto and we had a wonderful time. The city was great - lots to do, friendly people and a fun atmosphere. The hotel was a big part of our stay. We received a great deal via Priceline and when we got there, the front desk staff was courteous and helpful. We asked for and received an upgrade to the Club Level which allowed us complimentary continental breakfast and hors d'oeuvres in the evening. We also received a corner room which gave us a little extra space. The hotel itself was in a great location - near to a subway and streetcar line - plus within walking distance of a lot of attractions - CN Tower, Chinatown, clubs, restaurants, etc. We are definitely going back and staying at the Sheraton. It was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Good as long as not next to elevator shaft!!”
Reviews.Author: KR2008
Reviews.Content: Firstly I would definitely recommend this hotel. Great location, good facilities, good service. When we checked in we were told we were on 27th floor with views of the CN Tower which was great. However, when we got to the room, although we did indeed have a fantastic view, it was right next to the elevator shaft. Every time an elevator went past, the noise was like an aeroplane flying past! We decided we wouldn't be able to sleep with the noise, so the hotel moved us straight away, but unfortunately we didn't get to keep the great view! King size bed was VERY comfy - had one of my best nights sleep all holiday. Hotel lobby was undergoing some refurbishment while I was there (aug 05) so that should be improved once completed. Tip: go to breakfast at Cora's on Blue Jays Way. My friends who live in Toronto took me there and it is highly recommended - they make an artwork out of your food!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, ridiculous pricing.”
Reviews.Author: valerie135
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. One of the best locations in the city. Very close to the theater district, restaurants, bars and union station. But the best part was the underground tunnel to the Eaton Centre. I would stay here again just for that feature. Our main purpose was to go to the Canadian Expo which puts all other fairs to shame. It was awesome. The room at the Sheraton was good, but I did not like the pricing on a few things. I stay at many 4 and 5 star resorts so I know how expensive things can be. But I believe if you are paying decent money to stay at their facility, the least they can do is not charge you for the fitness center. The fitness center is very nice, but they charge you $9 a day. The parking is $33 a day and room service is too expensive. If this was a 5 star resort in Vegas I would expect this. But for a 3.5 star place charging a minimum of $179 per night, those things should be included and you shouldn't have to pay $16 a person for a continental breakfast. Overall, the Sheraton is above average. I would stay again for the location and the Eaton Centre access.

Reviews.Title: “Great city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights with family. Excellent hotel in very good location close to attractions, shops, restaurants etc. Our rooms were newly refurbished, spacious, clean, comfortable. The hotel lobby is enormous - it was in the later stages of refurbishment when we were there, but it caused no problems - with waterfall features. Excellent range of shops and a food court downstairs, and superb large swimming pool and gym. The check-in was very fast, and the concierges were always available and very helpful. We booked valet parking for one night and that was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good Solid Sheraton With Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent rate of just over $60 per night on priceline - and were given a nice corner room with a view of City Hall. The room itself had been recently refurbished - and the new decor, especially the huge Burberry looking headboard, was nice. Extremely surprised by the lack of both mini-bar and in-room safe, which I would have expected in a business hotel of this size and rating. The use of safetly deposit boxes behind reception was free. The bathroom was slightly more worn than the room - tub peeling slightly - but was clean. Traders Bar was a nice informal place for a cheapish meal and beer whilst watching sport on the large screens. The nachos were absolutely huge and certainly didn't leave enough room for the burger which followed! The real winner of this hotel is its location - the harbour centre is within comfortable walking distance as is the train station/bus station (handy if you are planning a day trip to Niagara). The mall access downstairs gives you a wealth of options for breakfast and enables easy access to the Eaton Centre etc. Overall a good solid choice for downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Four star experience for $61/night on Priceline!”
Reviews.Author: emindc
Reviews.Content: Our family spent a long weekend in Toronto and snagged a room at this hotel for $61/night on Priceline. Unlike another reviewer, for us this did not translate into an undesirable room, in fact, quite the contrary occurred -- we received a complimentary upgrade to a room with the preferred view on a high floor, without even asking (and they honored our request for two beds and non-smoking). It probably hinges on availability. We found the room very comfortable and the beds posh. The staff were very professional and helpful. We ordered room service one evening and were surprised at how delicious everything was. The hotel itself is beautiful, and very convenient to everything. If you are driving, I would recommend the self-park across the street. The hotel staff told us this was the most cost-effective option. The only negative I would note is that high speed internet access in the rooms is not free. Otherwise, it was a wonderful hotel in a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Lydia007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for a week. They have the most comfy beds that I am now a fan of Sheratons and would stay with them whenever possible. At check-in, priceline.com was mentioned but I wasn't treated any less -- I got a room on the 26th floor facing city hall. The room was of average size with a nice work desk etc, descent and classy decor. The bathroom and closet are quite generously sized. The best parts of this hotel are: location, bed and pleasant service. It's centrally located next to city hall, the therater district, and only steps away from TTC (the subway and surface bus/streetcar) with which you can go almost everywhere. One quick tip: There are two subway stations near by, the Queen street station is just a few more steps further but its accessible from the concourse level at the hotel via PATH followed by Bay department store during the day and evening time. e.g., I didn't have lots of luggage, and was able to wheel my suitcase from the concourse level all the way thru to the Queen street subway, then transfered to the airport bus 192 at Kipline Station -- it costed CAD 2.50, and the commute wasn't long either.

Reviews.Title: “The Remarkable Sheration”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Sheraton Hotel a month ago we stayed 2 nights and 3 days, me and my best friend went for the Caribana Festival and we enjoyed it, our service in the hotel was great, the rooms were beautiful and very neat and clean, this isn't my first time at the Sheraton I always say here when I come because the hotel is so convient it's right in the heart of the city we love the fact if you don't want to leave the hotel you don't have too, because everything is located underground. I had one complaint we said on the 16th floor which had a beautiful view but it was alot of youngsters on that floor in and out the rooms till the wee hours of the morning so it kind of kept us up, but overall I rate the Sheraton #1 and will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: silgirl
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the Sheraton Centre for one night on August 19th, 2005. Got an excellent price through Priceline.com. Service was excellent and hotel is close to a lot of major attrations like the Eaton Center, Queen St. and Nathan Phillips Square. The rooms were nice and big. I stayed on the 26th floor. I am not sure if that was a renovated room or not but it looked really good! The only bad point I can say is that the bathroom was not superbly clean. There were eyelashes all over the area were the cups and shampoo was. I didn't bother complaining as was only there one night but overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Slinky69
Reviews.Content: I first stayed here in Sept '04, and when returning this year it is the only hotel I wanted to stay at. The location is perfect. Its right in the middle of downdown, and you can walk to pretty much anywhere you would want to go, as its a great city to wander around. The street car stops a minute walk away. The area is nice too, opposite City hall - its worth asking for a high floor room as you get great views over Nathan Phillips, city hall and the skyline at night! The rooms are immaculate and pretty good size too, the closet is very roomy, and the beds are amazingly comfy. Decor is simple and classy, and also get tea/coffee maker and iron & board in room. The only slight downside is I dont find the staff very freindly but to be honest thats not an important factor to me. All in all a fab hotel and wouldnt consider staying anywhere else in T.O

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Sheraton Centre Hotel in downtown Toronto for five nights. The room was very clean and comfortable, especially the beds. We stayed on the eighth floor and had a wonderful view of city hall. The hotel has a very nice swimming pool. Our room had high speed internet connection for an extra charge. When looking for a hotel in Toronto this was an important factor for me. I only found one hotel in the downtown area that said it had a free high speed wireless connection but some of the reviews said that it did not work. Our room had an ethernet connection that was very easy to set up. The location of the hotel was great. We were right in between two subway stops and directly connected to Toronto's underground system of shops and restaurants. This was convenient on a rainy day. We could get to the subway and head up to the Royal Ontario Museum without getting out in the rain much. I only had two problems with the hotel. First, was the main entrance. It was like walking through a small parking lot to reach it. The main entrance is undergoing some renovations so maybe this will be remedied when that is finished. You have to walk through several rows of parked taxis and the circle drive which is not very safe for small children. There is a side entrance off the sidewalk that we discovered later. The second problem was not the hotel's fault but a condition of the great location. One night during out stay there was some sort of music festival going on in front of the city hall which was across the street. I don't know how long into the night this lasted but I fell asleep to the sounds of Pakistani pop music. Overall we had a great stay and the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Helpful, and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TTabs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our two teenagers just returned from a two night stay at the Sheraton Centre which I had booked through Hotwire back in February. The price was what attracted us to the hotel (so low I don't want to say) but the staff and the location is what will keep us coming back here. We went to see Cirque Du Soleil which I would recommend to anyone no matter what city they are performing in. Just get your tickets in advance. Even my two teenagers, who were not at all interested, wish that the show would have continued on for another couple of hours. Great family fun! As far as the hotel goes, upon check-in, the front desk staff confirmed that I had requested a non-smoking room with two double beds which was no problem. I also asked him if we could have a view of the government buildings which was also no problem. We were Up Graded to a 24th floor, beautifully decorated room with a view as requested. This whole process took about 5 minutes. Now even the elevators in the hotel were quick and readily available when we needed them. I don't believe we waited more than a minute either going up or coming down. After the first night, the cleaning lady left us extra towels and extra bottles of water for our thirsty teenagers after seeing we had four people in the room. In reading other postings about parking at the hotel, we decided to park in the city parking garage directly across the street. All we needed to do was take the hotel elevator to the PATH floor and the garage was just around the corner. This could not have been easier. Since we didn't plan on using the car, we left it there and upon leaving three days later, paid $35 CAD. That's a bargain in the city and we didn't even have to go outside in the rain. The city subway (just a block away) was so convenient as well as just walking the PATH to Eaton Centre and beyond. We took the subway and then transferred to the Bus 509 which took us right to Ontario Place and to Cirque Du Soleil, all within 30 minutes. So we had plenty of time to shop in the tents before the show began. We also walked to China town, (15 minutes), and were there for the opening of their annual festival. My daughter just loved the divercity of this city and the ability to walk everywhere. We all share her sentiments. We also went down to the Harbor and took a boat ride into one of the island coves. At the booth in front of the boat, they wanted only cash and also quoted us a price of $11 CAD per person. Since we wanted to use our credit card, they sent us to the Tour Booth where you could book all different tours. After talking with the clerk there we still ended up on the same boat but the pricing was cheaper. Only $7 for the teenagers since their age limit went up to 15. So we saved $8 just in walking across the sidewalk (15'). We ate at some great places but the one that stands out was the Cafe Crepe at 246 Queen St. W. (2-3 blocks from the hotel). You can watch them make the crepes and then add several different ingredients into the crepe depending on the orders. We had the ham/cheese and the dark chocolate which we ordered to go. They wrap it up like a waffle cone and off you go. The best fast food place. You can also sit inside but we were in too much of a hurry to see the city. Upon checking out on Sunday, all that was needed was to hand over the key cards. Very quick and off we were to IKEA. Great store and I can't wait until we have one in Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire/Priceline Booking = Smoking Room”
Reviews.Author: siouxzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Center in Toronto August 6, 2005 while in town to see Cirque du Soleil. I got a great price on Hotwire ($85 a night). We asked for a non-smoking room with 2 beds (there were 4 of us traveling) but were told at check in that by booking through Hotwire we couldn't have a preference & they were sold out of those rooms anyway, the only room available was a smoking room with 1 king bed. This seems to be a common response after reading other reviews from travels who booked a room using Hotwire or Priceline, I've used these sites several times & have never had any problems until this stay. The room was a decent size, had a nice sitting area & a clean/comfortable bed; our room also had a patio door that opened up into the Waterfall Garden which was nice. The negatives were the stale cigarette smell, stained carpet & the 2 males who were traveling with us said the toilet seat was broken & wouldn't stay up on its own. We called the front desk/"customer service promise line" to see if we could be moved to a non-smoking room because the smell was not pleasant & were put on hold for 5+ minutes, called back, were put on hold another 5 minutes & finally gave up! (this also seems to be a common experience according to other traveler's reviews that I've read since my stay) 45 minutes later they coincidently called our room to see if the cot we request had been delivered (which it hadn't) & when we requested a room change we were told they didn't have anything available but they could have housekeeping come up & "spray our room". Eventually the cot arrived & was set up for us, my travel companion who slept on the cot said it was actually comfortable; 3 of us ended up sleeping in the king sized bed which fortunately wasn't too bad. The hotel is very large & busy, its in an ok location, the closest subway stop & shopping/food is about a 1.5 - 2 block walk which doesn't sound bad but if you've been walking around all day & just want to get back to your room to relax, it can seem like a lot. There was a great "roach coach" across the street (lovely name I know but that's what they're called) where for $3 USD you can get a good late night snack/dinner of fries with either a burger or hotdog made while you wait (veggie options are available too which was excellent for us). The next morning we had breakfast at Bistro on Two (inside the hotel) we all had the $20 buffet which included juice & coffee, it was pricey but good & the service was outstanding! Out waitress "J." provided us with the best service we've had in years & anticipated our needs before we even had time to think of them. All in all our stay was ok for one night but I don't think I'll stay there next time I'm in Toronto, I'd recommend the Days Inn on Carlton St., its in a great location & reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - cheap rate through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: juliannac
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice enough, comfortable beds and good service but it is like a zoo. The hotel is ENORMOUS and just packed with people. You feel like cattle. I booked my room with priceline and got a great deal. I offered $120 per night and the hotel was asking $225. We got the 120 rate. When I checked in I asked for a king sized bed which is always in nicer rooms. So good luck and book through priceline for a real deal.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific renovation”
Reviews.Author: A3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the hotel and I must say the renovated lobby looks fantastic! Overall we had a great stay. Prime location in walking distance of most tourist destinations. The stay did start with some confusion: booked through Priceline, I contacted them in advance to request a renovate room. They very kindly told me I would have one. We arrived early, 12:20, and the desk attendant said we had a nice room worth the wait of housekeeping rather than switching. We agreed. Later another attendant (I learned afterwards he was a 'trainee') reassigned us to a non-renovated room. I can only assume that he saw we were Priceline booked and thought he was doing the correct â€˜corporateâ€™ move. Later I went to the front desk and told a very helpful desk attendant what had happened. She straightened everything out and gave us a lovely corner room. We really liked the room. Other than the one attendant, the staff were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Big Changes at Sheraton Centre!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 day business stay in Toronto - and what a surprise to find the Sheraton Centre has finished its renovations in the lobby and driveway. I stay in Toronto about once a month and love this hotel because of the convenient location (subway access or easy walk to meetings) and the great perks from their membership program (SPG). On my last visit, the hotel was under major consturction in their lobby - but not this week! When I walked in I was pleasantly surprised to see all new furniture and a very impressive lobby bar (which I had forgotten was even there!). This place looks like a really high end hotel now and I'm glad I came back after the construction. As always, I had a great room - LOVE the beds - hard to get out of them to actually work! The staff are efficient and courteous - it is a busy convention hotel after all and this week was no exception. Be sure to check out the Sheraton Centre - I bet you will be as surprised as I was!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: calico696
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great city! Stayed 3 nights on the club level floor. View was fantastic! We could see the CN Tower and the Sky Dome from our window. Room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. All staff were attentive and friendly. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: RegisToronto
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from room 2137 at the Sheraton. Here is what I think: Rooms Very nice. I was given what they call a "preferred room" due my SPG gold status. I was surprised that they recognised my elite status given that I had made my reservation using an opaque channel, which usually voids any elite privileges. The room is nicely appointed with a good size bathroom. It is furnished with Starwood's signature Heavenly Bed (which I attest to be indeed heavenly!), working desk with swivel char, small couch, alarm clock and 27 inch TV. Service Very good. Upon arriving at the hotel, bell boy immediately helped me with my heavy luggage. Check-in desk agent also very pleasant - absolutely no "priceline treatment". Also used the very helpful concierge services, no problems there as well. Value This is hard to say. At the heavily discounted rate I paid, I would say the value is tremendous. At the regular rate, I am not so sure. Cleanness No problems there as well. Activities / Gym / Pool Did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay. I stayed at the Sheraton on business for one week with no problems at all. The hotel is going through a major renovation of the lobby, but it is going to be excellent when finished. From what I understand the all rooms are now completely renovated, my looked very new. The bed as always was excellent. I have a hard time determining what is better, the bed at the Sheraton or the Westin. The location is excellent, a small walk from all downtown major attractions. I walked to the Skydome in about 10-15 min, which is next to the CN tower, very easy to walk to the Eaton Center; itâ€™s only about 2 blocks away. Jazz Fest was the current attraction in the city, which was held across the street, very nice. I ordered room service once, it was very fast and food was excellent. Over all I have nothing bad to say and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline Customer - Fine after a bumpy start”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Sheraton Toronto Centre through Priceline[-]. I am not one of those people who is of the school of "well I only paid $70 through Priceline, so if i get a mediocre room I am fine with it." No way. The reason why I used Priceline is because the selling point is that you can get a 4 star room for $70. If that is the assertion, then that is what you should get. So I was disappointed to put in a bid with Priceline for a 4 star hotel in Toronto and find out I was staying at the Sheraton. My parents had stayed here once before and were given a horrible room and had a terrible stay. They said their room was old and shabby with a strong reek of cigarettes, and there were spit-marks all over their windows, which the hotel explained away by blaming it on a partying tour group from Spain, but refused to change the room. I found their experience was not uncommon after reading quite a few negative reviews on Tripadvisor about "cabana rooms" lax security and suspect cleanliness. I called Sheraton Reservations to put in my request for a renovated room. They claimed it was out of their jurisdiction. I insisted. I called more than once. Still no luck. Next, I tried the "Service Promise Help Desk" at the hotel itself. They should be called the Service Promise Help-less Desk. After cutting me off about 4 times in a row, they finally looked up my confirmation number and said room requests were only on a first-come-first-served basis. What I gather from this is once they mark you as a Priceline customer you are treated as a poor step-child. Priceline should do something about this since so many of their customers have experienced this treatment. My last step was to contact the general manager and tell her what happened. Her staff responded very quickly and efficiently and took care of my request. I was VERY HAPPY with my room in the end. It was large and beautifully renovated with a king-sized bed. The hotel is in an excellent location close to Queen Street West which is where we like to have dinner and drinks when in Toronto. The food court on the lower level was a convenient place to get breakfast in the morning without going outside. However, I would not classify the hotel as 4 star. (Maybe 3.5 stars.) Although the pool is free, it is full of kids at all hours, and guests have to pay $20/day for use of the gym. Shower caps are not provided with the room ammenities. The hotel is very popular with large families and groups. The atmosphere is noisy and active. Overall, I would stay here again if I could get a similar standard of room for the price I paid, but mostly because of the location, not because I was wowed by the hotel, although I did appreciate the trouble the manager's office took to accomodate us. We also stayed at the Intercontinental Toronto Centre on this trip, and had a reverse experience there. Although we weren't crazy about the location and found it a little dull at night (in the Financial District), we loved the hotel itself, and found that to be a true 4-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: happyherts
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 6 nights at Sheraton Centre and found the hotel to be excellent and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay downtown in Toronto. The rooms have all now been renovated, they are large, nicely decorated with great comfortable beds. It is in a great location with most places within walking distance. When I read some of the other negative reveiws on this site I often wonder if I stayed at the same hotel. The only negative thing I can find to say about the hotel is that the main lobby is under renovation but that is due to finish by the end of June. We never planned to spend any time in the lobby other than 5 minutes checking in so I cant see this being a problem to most people..

Reviews.Title: “Reservations are the pits”
Reviews.Author: vkvk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 night stay at the sheraton, we had reserved five rooms for various nights all with the same last name, so before we set off I telephoned the hotel direct to confirm reservations and was told everything was okay. On arrival everything went to plan and the rooms are amazing, the beds are worth the visit and as others have said the hotel is under construction but doesnt spoil any plans unless you like to sit in the lobby reading. day two when my in laws checked in things seemed to be okay until the following morning when they was informed they should leave as there stay was for one night only but in actual fact they had booked and paid for 8 nights, it took over 1 hour to sort this out and then we thought that should have been the end of it, but the following day when my mother in law went to check in again they was told there was no room for them and again it took over a hour to sort it out even though I had all the letters and confirmations in front of me, the duty manager was very rude and took no resposiblity, I had to take more time out to see the Hotel manager to sort everything out and then had no further trouble, other people also had trouble with reservations, I can only assume with all the banging and drilling going on they are making lots of mistakes. one last point is the pool area is nothing special, bar closed and they could do with either new sunbeds or cleaning the ones they have. I would recommed the Hilton which is directly across the road and also have great beds

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: THD
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Centre was more than a superb value for what I paid on Priceline. Heart of downtown w/access to subway & underground "canals" from the hotel lobby (some reviewers have said this is dangerous--only if you're paranoid--I think it's great). It is a very large, traditional, ordinary hotel. The main lobby was under renovation, but this didn't cause any annoyance. The "tower" my room was in definitely showed wear in the hallways, etc. and I couldn't get ice from the ice machine, but I'm sure they would have brought ice right away if I had asked and seen to it that the machine was fixed ASAP, they had a very good staff. The room was recently overhauled. But the bath--oddly enough, part of it (the sink area) was renovated and had very nice, new granite and fixtures, but the tub was old & peeling...very strange. The room was not all that big, but it was big enough; it was very clean and it had newer, nice funiture in good condition and extremely comfy beds, etc. I still would not be as impressed if I had paid a regular rack rate, but with my Priceline rate I was *THRILLED* to pieces!

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel - A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shazadi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto Hotel in downtown Toronto on Saturday June 4, 2005. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Elegant yet personable. Hotel has a main tower, two smaller towers, and some courtyard rooms with balconies. We booked a Club Room (upper 6 floors of the main tower (floors 36-42)) and would do this again. The Club Rooms give access to the Club Lounge on floor 43 (top floor) which is very nice -- excellent views with full windows all around. The Club Rooms include complementary hors d'oeuvres 5-8pm (which we enjoyed with a drink) and a great continental breakfast 6:30-11am (10am during week) in the Club Lounge. All the staff we dealt with were very pleasant. Room was good size. King size "sweet sleeper bed" -- was too firm for our preference. Room was well maintained -- appeared recently renovated -- as did the corridors. Renovations continue in the large lobby (expected to be completed July 2005), but still very nice. Pool has part of it indoors part outdoors. Garden courtyard areas. Easy walking access to everything in downtown Toronto. (We saw Evita at the Princess of Wales Theatre -- an easy walk.) Parking at hotel is valet only ($33/day including in-out privileges). We opted for self-park in the Toronto City Hall underground lot across the street (seemed very safe - one of the largest underground lots in the world ($17 for 24h)). Hotel is connected to "The Path" - a whole complex of underground shopping connecting a large number of the major buildings in Toronto. (Handy especially if the weather is not so good.) You can use the Path to reach the Bay, Eaton's Centre, Union Station (Via/GO Trains), etc. A lot of movie and commercial filming going on in the area -- very interesting to see all the equipment and staff and set up -- but they did not "discover" my "actress" wife this trip -- maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best location in Toronto..The staff is superb...Visit Trader's bar and enjoy the best bartender in the City..His name is Rudy and he has been plying his trade here for 24 years..This last trip we were unhappy with the room that had been assigned us..Just a comment rergarding this to the desk clerk (Russell) and the problem was solved..We were upgraded on the spot..The room was very clean, the bed was way above average..We love to visit Toronto and will always stay at Sheraton Centre.. Russell is the most customer friendly desk clerk that I have ever met in over 30 years of globe trotting..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, going to be even better”
Reviews.Author: JetSetJay
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Center is in an excellent location in downtown Toronto, across from City Hall and just down the street from the Eaton Center shopping mall.
