The hotel is also connected to the PATH system which is a vast underground series of pedestrian tunnels (really just a huge shopping mall) connecting all of the major skyscrapers and other major buildings in the city. The street car and subway are very close. The hotel is undergoing a major renovation and the lobby is going to be beautiful. A friend stayed in a newly renovated room which looked and smelled great. I got a room on the Club Level which had not been renovated but was a junior suite. The room was huge and was blessed with a huge wall of windows; great views of the CN Tower and city skyline. Even though it was not renovated the room was very clean and comfortable. The room had all of the comforts, conveniences and amenities that you would expect from Shertaon. Service is excellent at Sheraton. There are lots of people in the lobby guiding you to the appropriate counters for check-in etc. Very friendly and helpful and professional. I would definitely stay here again. Word of caution however: parking in downtown Toronto can be very difficult and hotel offer only very expensive valet parking. You can park across the street though in the vast underground garage at city hall. It's public parking but will cost you about $16 per day. The pool area is remarkable for an urban hotel. The pool is indoor/outdoor and very large. Even though the weather was very cool that week there were still numbers of people using the heated pool. Next time I stay at the Sheraton I will upgrade my review to "5 star" (Excellent) because all of the renovations will be done by then.

Reviews.Title: “Should be nice when it's Finished!”
Reviews.Author: beagleboy99
Reviews.Content: This is a very large hotel, and is under some pretty extensive renovations. The location of the hotel itself is fantastic, right in the middle of the heart of Toronto. I always slept great in the Sheraton sweet sleeper bed, that is worth the price alone. The service is lacking however, getting help in the restaurants or with the employees of the hotel seems to be a chore. This is very typical of many Torontian's however, and should be expected in any hotel within the Toronto area. Overall, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “An O.K. stay.”
Reviews.Author: wwe_j_b_l
Reviews.Content: We went here for 1 night April 22-23. When we made are reservation we ask if we could have a fridge. We check-in and ask the lady if the fridge was there. She sid Yes. When we got to our room NO fridge. Phone down and the lady said we'll have one right up. 30 minutes still no fridge.We phone the service promise desk and they informed us they had no fridges but they said we'll look for one. After we ate our dinner the fridge was in our room. We recived $25.00 our room. Our next problem was the heat it was far too hot. A guy came us and put it on to cold but it was still hot. THe last problem we had was te stopper in the bath tub was broken 30 minutes for the guy to come up and 5 minutes to fix it. We are getting 50% off are next stay there for the problems. Would I stay here again Yes just because of the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and GREAT hotwire discount w/great room!”
Reviews.Author: cdntravel_lovr
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel three times in the past three years, and each time we booked through Hotwire and got about 50% off the regular room rates. We've had absolutely no problems - we always get nice, clean rooms, good service and the hotel is conveniently located close to the Eaton centre and the theatre district downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: selfant
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 Star, top-quality hotel. It does have some minor reconstruction going on in the lobby area, in the center. Providing that the lobby is HUGE (about the size of a small shopping centre), it does not affect the stay at the hotel at all. The rooms are top-notch. The beds are pretty good, and so are the pillows, and everything else in the room. We were in the cheapest room available there too. We did not use the health facilities but we heard that they are superb. I would stay here again if I get the same good price that I got recently.

Reviews.Title: “Despite some major renovations underway - we had a great stay at Sheraton Centre”
Reviews.Author: chefdude
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Tuesday April 12th to Friday April 15th. The hotel was hosting a large convention so our request for a recently renovated room in the Richmond tower wasnâ€™t available. No big deal however, the room we received was quite nice and comfortable. The hotel is currently under some major renovations so the main entrance, lobby and reception areas are under a lot of scaffolding, etc. Again this didnâ€™t cause us much concern, the elevators were quick and access to and from the street was easy. If youâ€™re going to Toronto to shop, eat, see a show, etc I doubt youâ€™ll find a more convenient location (Eaton Centre is across the street, Yonge street a block away, The Bay Co. main store Â¼ block away, theatre district 10 minute walk) My only complaint is that the â€œconciergeâ€� / tour desk attendant wasnâ€™t able to answer any of our questions (ex. whereâ€™s a good late night dining spot for post theatre eats?, can you recommend a good Japanese restaurant?) some pretty basic questions that anyone familiar with the city, let alone a concierge, should have been able to answer. Just the same, we had a great visit to one of the worldâ€™s great cities and will definitely be back to Toronto and the Sheraton Centre again soon.

Reviews.Title: “needs some work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Toronto over Easter weekend and found the hotel to be less than average. The service was very poor at the front desk and in the hotel restaurants. They were undergoing renovations on the lobby level and it was very loud and distracting when in that area. The valet service was slow until we complained, then it improved every time they saw us coming. The rooms were fine and the beds were great. There was a pretty bad smell on our floor from something we couldn't quite figure out! Some kids pulled the fire alarm at 4:40am on Saturday night and we had to evacuate the building for a good 45-60 minutes, which wasn't too fun. Pool and hottub area was nice and clean. Eaton Centre stores and many restaurants were closed on Good Friday and Easter Sunday (for future reference). I really think I'd rather stay the the Marriott or Renaissance next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - hotwire favorite”
Reviews.Author: EscapeMichigan
Reviews.Content: Visited Toronto with several friends, we used hotwire and ended up at the Sheraton Centre TO. The hotel looks like it's at the tail end of a major construction, but other than a "causual" entrance and some temp. walls in the lobby it did not effect our experience at all. The images of the completed project look great. The hotel is in a great location, directly south of City hall, Nathan Phillips Square, and is connected to the concourse so you can get to the mall, and many other places with out having to go outside. (helpful if there is a snowstorm in April) The staff at the front desk was very friendly, they were able to get us all into doubles on the same floor. We were put up on one of the renovated floors, it was very nice, they have done a very good job. The rooms are very stylish, with pleanty of space and very comfy beds. Parking is expensive, as everywhere in TO, and you may aswell valet park, you might save a buck or 2 self parking but it's not worth the bother. We will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and scored a great room thru Priceline”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week in Toronto and my trip was thoroughly enjoyable due to the superior accommodations I received at the Sheraton Centre on Queen Street. The hotel is in an ideal location for business travelers, tourists and above all SHOPPING. The Sheraton sits between the massive Eaton Centre Mall and the legendary boutiques on Queen Street. I booked my room thru Priceline at a rate of $75.00 US per night; however, after reading some of the hotel reviews on trip advisor I was worried that my room would be sub-standard. My worries were quickly relieved when I arrived in the hotel and was given a room on the 27th floor in the Queen Tower. The room was immaculate with an oversized King Bed, beautiful decor, brightly lit, nice furniture and extremely clean washrooms. I had an impressive view of the CN TOWER, Hilton, CIBC Building, various office buildings and the Sheraton swimming pool. The service was top-notch and I was not treated any differently due to booking the room thru Priceline.com. I highly recommend the Sheraton on Queen Street because my time there was simply amazing. The location, accommodations, staff and convenience were worth three times what I paid. For the record, Toronto is one of the most beautiful cities in North America/the world. The people are extremely friendly and the restaurants, nightlife and shopping are top notch!!! I look forward to staying at the Sheraton Centre Hotel when I return to "T.O."

Reviews.Title: “good deal..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my wife and i visited toronto over the weekend from rochester, ny. we had a twin bed regular room at the sheraton centre booked through priceline for $90 (US) (including the priceline fee) a night. i saw some bad reviews about the rooms booked through priceline, so i called ahead and upgraded to a 40th floor king bed CN tower view club level room for $60 (canadian) extra per night. it was worth it. the concierge told me this room normally goes for $200 and up - so clearly i made a profit booking through priceline. (whew!). we had complimentary access to the club lounge on the 43rd floor with free breakfast and snacks in the evening. great view from this level. parking - the best deal is the municipal parking on queen street just past the hotel itself. $5 for from 7am to 6pm everyday, $6 overnight and $5 for 24h on sunday. do not get sucked into parking on the private lots in downtown - too costly! we walked to the CN tower from the hotel quite comfortably even in the late winter weather of february. also walked to the mamma mia show at the royal alexandra theater and to lunch at the Dhaba (nice Indian food) on King street. Great shopping at the Eaton center - also walking distance from the hotel. use american credit cards freely. if you want to use cash - be prepared to have canadian currency ready. the favorable exchange rate and great shopping has my wife saying we'll be back in spring!

Reviews.Title: “Beware hotwire rooms”
Reviews.Author: tayloralexasmom
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room for a week at this hotel and were very excited about the awesome deal we got on hotwire. Unfortunately, the room they gave us was disgusting. There were spots on the rugs, furniture and god only knows what the stains on our comforter were!! The bedframe was broken and our air conditioner broke during the 2nd night. I complained and was told the hotel was sold out. After the 2nd night, I wrote a letter to the manager and left it at the front desk. We received no response! I took pics with our digital camera of the stains and sent them to sheraton headquarters to advise them of the condition of the rooms. For a minute I felt like a 60 minutes reporter doing a piece on dirty hotel rooms!! ! The evening of our 3rd night, we packed up & drove 10 hours back to CT. Upon check-out, the desk attendant was very nice and tried to assist us and get us to stay; however, enough was enough. The Sheraton staff was more than gracious afterwards and we are going to try to stay there again this summer. I will warn not to get discounted rooms...they were gross!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware Priceline Rooms”
Reviews.Author: blondetotty
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on the Sheraton for 4 nights through Priceline and was pretty pleased. This however changed when I was allocated my room. After winding my way down a dark cold corrider on the 4th floor past empty open small conference rooms littered with the remains of ?lunch/drinks I finally rounded the corner and came to a dead end with approx Â½ doz rooms tacked on, one of which was mine. The corrider was dark and freezing and the room wasn't much better. On first inspection the bed was nice but that was where it ended. One of the main lamps had wires sticking out of a bulb hanging out and when I looked out the glass door I discovered that the dead lock to the outside balcony was broken and the door only had a small clasp lock stopping anyone trying to enter from outside. (Although on the 4th floor - the balcony was accessible from the 3rd floor pool deck - the room balcony overlooked this). The room also had an interconnecting door to another room. As a single female traveller this is a no no as far as any other hotel is concerned but the Sheraton didn't seem to take this security into account. I complained to the front desk that evening and was told that maintenance would deal with it while I was out. When I arrived back late this was still not dealt with but after travelling so long I decided to stay put and complain again in the morning. After a pretty rough night (even the sweet sleeper bed couldn't put me out) keeping one eye half open I turned up at reception at 8am prepared for a battle. I was called over by the Sheraton Preferred Guest Agent and after describing the problems I asked if I could use some SPG points to upgrade to a room where I felt safe. She said this wasn't necessary and pointed out the Sheraton promise. She then gave me a room key to a room in the Queens tower on the 31st floor and apologised for the problems. This room was a complete contrast. The room was bright and well decorated, tidy and clean. The view opened up over City Hall and Nathan Phillips square where I watched two nights of fantastic fireworks as a start to the Winter Festival. After a pretty dodgy upsetting start, the rest of my stay was fantastic. Room service was unbelievably fast and piping hot. Traders Bar a great place for pre dinner drinks and Le Bifteque steak house served amazing prime rib! The other staff I encountered during my staff were friendly and helpful. The Sheraton Centre is a great place to stay (if you're not in a 'priceline room' - see previous reviews with the same problems), the underground PATH access was worth the price alone just for access to the Eaton Centre in temperatures during my stay of -20. They are undergoing construction of the new lobby area until May 05 but the works don't seem to get in the way too much. Would definately consider staying again but probably not booking through Priceline...it doesn't seem worth the risk of getting an unsecure room.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and nice new rooms”
Reviews.Author: rockyraccoon44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with multiple guests and rooms in October 2004. At that time the rooms in the Richmond Tower had recently been renovated and were very nice and plush. We also had other family members staying in the Queen's Tower who said the rooms were not as new but managed to get a great view of the CN tower and lake facing south. All in all it was a great stay and staff are very helpful and really want to ensure that your stay is everything you would expect. Also very nice having the underground link and being close to the Eaton Centre and downtown in general. The newer Keg restaurant down the street is very chic for a Keg with good food if you're looking for a restaurant close by. The only thing that was costly was the parking (valet pkg only at hotel is $28/day I believe) however there is cheaper parking across the road. We managed to book this hotel multiple times in the past also for around $75 US through Hotwire site which is a great deal for this hotel, especially if you request a newly renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Centre twice since 2002, and both times were just really really nice. The first time I went in the winter of 2002 as a package deal with The Lion King play and I wasn't able to see and do a lot, due to it just being a weekend type trip. Even then, I knew the hotel was special and nice. So much so, me and my girlfriend went back to Toronto, this past August 2004 to see the city and Cirque du Soleil for the time it was in town. One was able to see the hotel more in depth, and to just marvel at how close it was to everything in the dowtown area of Toronto. I have no major complaints about this hotel or the staff whatsoever! The front lobby when pulling up in your car can be very very busy, so be patient and the parking lot attendants will get to you asap. The lobby was big and spacious and the staff get you checked in right away and off to your room really quickly from what I noticed. Most folks just sit and chit chat in the lobby, it's so wide open to guess and people who are just walking through to other parts of the hotel or city. They have a nice bar/restaurant on the first floor that offers a lot to a guess, depending on what your looking for. All the main nice restaurants in the downtown locale if staying here is in walking distance, or a quick cab ride! Ruth and Chris Steakhouse, The Keg, Fisherman's Wharf of San Francisco, just to name a few are right there for your eating pleasure's! The room was AWESOME! A very nice view of city hall to the north, and in 2002 when I stayed here had a wonderful view from the south looking right at the CN Tower. Everyday I woke up I took incredible pictures of the city and city hall. So to me all the views are good, no matter which direction your facing while staying here. They had a nice fitness area, big for most hotels, nice big jacuzzi, that can seat quite a few folks in there, and not a bad swimming pool for those that like to swim. I know in the winter time the pool was heated in 2002, I didn't get in it in August of 2004, but the pool was nice with plenty of towels for all guess to dry off on. Lots of shops within the hotel for one to do some shopping on the property. Only thing I didn't like about my room was the very small sinks inside the room, one would think they would've been a tad bit bigger, but aside from that, the room was nice. Soft bed, lots of space for two individuals. I love how the Sheraton Centre connects to the Eaton Centre shopping mall, that right there is the highlight of staying at this facility. I was told by a friend that this isn't the best mall in Toronto, it's the tourist mall, but to me it's really nice. The way you can take the underground walking path to the Bay shopping store, then take a few lefts and rights and your inside the 3 level mall is nice I must say, very! I think that really help sells the hotel even more to me, just to have that option without leaving the hotel and still be able to sight-see with just walking a mile or less. One thing I didn't like, being that Nathan Phillip Square is right across the street. Me and my girlfriend went there the first night in town to just relax and the place smelled something awful of urine by all the homeless folks living there, not the best place to relax at the end of the day, due to the smell!! I do recommend this hotel to the fullest! I think one by themselves, or with friend, or family can really enjoy this town and hotel no matter time of season it is. If you want to be close to everything, this is your place, you can't go wrong with the Sheraton Centre of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in September 2004 and had a fantastic holiday. Hotel was fab! The room was so much better then i had expected with comfy beds. We had a view of the CN tower which was romantic and beautiful. The hotel was clean and all staff were more than happy to help with a massive smile. I had a factastic break and would return at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year”
Reviews.Author: jow2006
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a New Year break at the Sheraton Centre. What a fantastic location. Our room (in the Richmond Tower)overlooked Nathan Phillips Square where they held the New Year celebrations and the view was fantastic. The room had been recently refurbished and was lovely. The sweet sleepers were so comfortable and so many pillows!! The reception staff were all very friendly and check in/out was quick and smooth. Excellent location, linked to the Eaton Centre via the PATH system and so no need to go outside if the weather is bad. The steak restaurant at lobby level was also very good. We would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Toronto Sheraton Centre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Centre Toronto in September 2004. Overall it was an excellent experience. The staff was amazing and paid very close attention to detail. People really do make the difference and at this hotel it is very noticeable that their staff is well trained and dedicated to making your stay pleasant. The Sweet Sleeper Beds are so comfortable; we were reluctant to get out of bed in the morning! But when you are staying at the best location in Toronto...you can't stay in bed all day! The hotel is connected via underground to many of the cities main attractions...which was great since we had some rainy days! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Kinda shabby in the Cabana”
Reviews.Author: Dondoh
Reviews.Content: First off, we booked through priceline for a very reasonable price, so our experience may be different than someone paying full price. (Shouldn't be but that is a different matter altogether...) Upon check-in, the Sheraton check-in clerk told us how lucky we were to be assigned a "mini-suite" that they called a "cabana"room. Warning bells should have sounded as we entered the cabana area and passed an outraged customer complaining of "missing glass" in his room. I never found out what the missing glass was but I can say that our room was NOT 4* quality. More like a 2* Holiday Inn with some years on it. Peeling paint in the bathroom, dirty carpets and generally getting close to shabby. The cabana is in neither the richmond nor the queens tower, it is a few rooms tacked onto an area where the smaller meeting rooms are located. But all this would have been fine considering the paltry sum payed for the room, if it had not been for the noise. Now, I am a VERY heavy sleeper and I couldn't care less about a little noise from next door. But, this room was the loudest I have EVER been in. If our neighbors talked in a normal tone, their voices were somehow amplified and sounded like they chatting in the same room as we were. Almost uncanny! Well the second night at the Sheraton we had no neighbors and it was fine, but the room was still a little shabby. The location is great. The bed was the exception to the rule in the room as it was VERY comfortable. We also stayed at the Westin during our trip and it was far superior in every way but location. And the Westin is a nice location, just not quite as convenient. My advice to any future priceliner, or anyone else for that matter, would be to avoid the "Cabana" sales pitch at check-in, refuse the "upgrade" to cabana and take your chances on something else. If you had no one around you in the cabana it should be OK, but if anyone is next door - watch out! Our neighbors were relatively quiet but we would have much rather not felt like we were sharing a room with them. I expected more...

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton is the best”
Reviews.Author: jo_b78
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on more then one occasion. My boyfriend and I usually book it for occasions such as our anniversary, new years etc. The Sheraton Center has excellent service and very comfortable rooms. The beds are to die for. It is in a good location down the street from the eaton center. I would recomend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Toronto area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked in and was given a room right opposite City Hall. What a view! The large room was newly decorated and in perfect order. Lovely plush fabrics and decor and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Had both breakfast in the hotel and dinner in the Le Biftheque steakhouse - both very good. Great location with both the Eaton Centre and The Bay both just a few yards away. There is also access to the PATH (underground shopping) System from within the hotel. Good sized pool and hot tub. Coin operated laundry facilities also available. Would highly recommend the day trip to Niagara Falls which also includes a large buffet lunch at the penthouse restaurant in the Sheraton on the Falls hotel. This trip also includes a ride on the Maid of the Mist, visit to the whirlpool rapids and a drop off at the heliport for an optional flight over the falls (stunning). Finally, there is a stop off at Niagara-on-the-lake which is very pretty and not to be missed. Our tour guide was a total gem, she helped make our day very pleasurable. I would also recommend Mamma Mia at the theatre and a visit to the CN Tower - go all the way to the Skypod! Lots and lots to see in Toronto. Lots of great places to eat. This was my second trip and I am returning again next summer and will definately be staying at the Sheraton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the bed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived 3am in the morning, tired and exhausted after spending 7 hrs on the plane. We were told that there's something wrong with the electricity the day before and the lifts were out of service. The staff was polite and helpful and we waited 30 mins before a lift could take us to 8/F in the Richmond Tower. New carpet, furnishings... but not completely done. The celling was not even replaced. We called and waited for another 30 mins (because of the limited service provided by the lift) before another room was arranged. I still wonder how they could make the mistake to give a semi-dorated room to guests. My husband who likes soft bed has enjoyed the bed very much. On the other hand, I had developed backache after 4 nights sharing the same bed with him. We loved the spacious room especially the delightful bathroom. Good view overlooking the City Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton under renovation”
Reviews.Author: Powerstraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the Toronto Sheraton Centre. We were given a room in the Richmond Tower on the 10th floor which was just opened following a complete renovation. All new carpet, furnishings etc. The only thing not new in our room was the tub. Otherwise it was very nice. The problem we had was a late night 1:30 a.m. fire alarm which was very disturbing, but not an actual fire. Also the next morning there were no lights (pitch black) in the corridor. There was no offer to compensate for the inconvenience although we did not ask for any. The location is very convenient - park in city garage across the way for less $.

Reviews.Title: “$49/night U.S. on Hotwire ... What a Deal ... What a place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Centre last summer (2003), in fact, our last night was inclusive of the GREAT NORTHEAST BLACKOUT. The hotel was wonderful during the blackout, offering chilled water and bags of ice at no cost and did checks on everyone at infrequent intervals. I am writing this review now only because I just recently discovered tripadvisor. I booked my room using Hotwire and spent $49 US a night Sun - Fri. All I can say is my wife and I thought this place was absolutely one of the best rooms we have ever had. Down comforters, pillow-top mattress, extra throw pillows, two sitting chairs. We were given a corner room on the 27th floor overlooking the CN Tower ... whew, what a view, and whew ... what a walk up the stairs during the blackout !!. If you go, check and see if you can get a corner room. You get an extra sliver of glass on the side of the building, just enough to create a slight "panoramic" view. This hotel is centrally located, Eaton Centre half a block, Theatre District about 5/6 blocks , Chinatowne 5/6 blocks, Waterfront /Skydome/ Air Canada Centre all 6/7 blocks, as is the Hockey Hall of Fame. Bus and Trolley run right in front of hotel. The one bus that I mention will take you right to the ferry dock for the Toronto Islands Beaches (work on not having any tan lines ;-). Same bus taken from just across the street from the ferry unloading exit will get you back ... how easy is that? What is there not to like about this place ?? Sure if you overpaid for the room, maybe you would find fault. I honestly would pay up to $150/night US and still not complain about this place. Oh , which reminds me ... I do have a slight unhappiness (not really a complaint) ... the pool does seem a bit small for such a large hotel, but it was never overburdened while we were there. But then again we liked the half in / half out of the building pool design and there is a pool bar AND jacuzzi !! Didn't try the restaurants in the hotel. (we like authentic Chinese, Pizza, etc. from the neighborhoods) Believe me, I'm not bragging here, I can easily afford this hotel at published prices ... Hotwire is why I can, but won't ... Thanks Hotwire !! AND GO LEAFS GO !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: EscapingScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights on vacation in May 2004. We found the location to be excellent for access to the subway, trams and for sightseeing. The hotel is business orientated and therefore attracted a number of conferences during our stay, which could be off putting for some visitors. Our room was on the 33rd floor and whilst perfectly acceptable could benefit from an update as the dÃ©cor and , air conditioning were "tired" and perhaps did not reflect the 4 star rating of the public areas. Staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Okay/Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Traveled here with a family of four on July 29/30 for two nights. Booked this room through Hotwire, which billed it as a four star hotel. When first checking in, was told only availability was smoking. The wife went back to the front desk about 20 minutes later and was able to badger them to switch us to a non-smoking room. I've been in nicer four star hotels, but the Hotwire rate of $61 per night American, tax included, was tough to beat. Nice hotel bar and pool. Good location. Great for the price but not worth the rack rates.
